name: Meghan Brabston
text: I moved into Ashford Place a month ago and I couldn’t be happier to live in such a safe, quiet, and pretty community. The office staff members, Patrick and Carol, are very helpful and strive to go above and beyond for all of their residents. After I moved in, I had a work order that was answered very quickly. Hands down, this the nicest apartment complex off Grelot Road, and it’s very convenient to many stores. I feel safe walking and driving at any hour to the CVS, Winn Dixie, and Circle K gas station 2 minutes or less away. Plus I love that Cottage Hill Park is less than 0.5 miles to walk to. Highly recommend!

name: Dana Turrentine
text: i would rate this place negative stars if i could. i don't even live here yet and its already a bad experience. i applied and got accepted for an apartment and was told to contact management for further details and to sign a lease and that was about 3 weeks ago and i have called every day and emailed and has not once gotten a call or email back! i was given a move in date of 7/10 but i cant get ahold of anyone to confirm if i actually have an apartment or not and get any info. management is very very unprofessional and  seems like they couldn't careless about anybody who actually wants to live here! i definitely would not recommend this place.

name: Christopher Burnette
text: We were just Stirling through it was nice

name: Shianne Mitchem
text: Is under new management and they are trying to fix the fencing and sidewalks.

name: Alexia Pettway
text: I do not live at this apartments, but me and my boyfriend have been looking. I sent a request the night before and Hannah Lott responded the next morning via email. Answered all my questions very quickly and was very informative and I could tell through just the emails she had a great personality! Thank you for your help Hannah!

name: Mila Dixon
text: Ashford Place is AWESOME. My husband and I love it. Perfect for starting out. Reasonable rent, very safe, nice neighbors, quiet, and extremely friendly staff. We have had a few maintenance request since living here just as any place you live, and everyone one of them has been responded to same day. We love it and would recommend it to anyone.

name: Tyler Lowery
text: Living here for almost seven months now and I could not be happier. If i have any questions or maintenance request they are quick to answer or fix. Would highly recommend.

name: Katie Clearman
text: Lived here for 2 years, and we loved it. Our rent rates were good for a 2 bedroom, but they are doing renovations now and the rates have went up. Staff is very nice and helpful. Any repairs were fixed in a timely manner. I really liked living here! The only thing I did not like about it was that it is not gated and there weren’t cameras on property.

resp.text: Hi, Katie! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are glad that you loved the 2 years you spent at our community. We wish you the very best and hope you will return for a visit. Thanks again! - The Team at Ashford Place

name: Madison Maree
text:
*update: STILL cannot get ahold of Stone River Property Management and when I attempted to go speak with Heather in person at the office (in March) she told me she couldn’t help me since it was sent to collections (3 days after we moved they charged it to collections and didn’t give us any of the information they sent) after that she slammed the door in my face.*

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE; Heather, the manager, doesn’t care about anything other than getting her paycheck.

If I could give negative stars I would. Heather, the property manger, acted very unprofessionally and was unwilling to offer assistance after we had chosen to do an early lease buy-out. Both her and former leasing agent refused multiple times to provide me with my rental charges and payment history. I am unable to get anyone from corporate to answer my call(s) or return my call(s).. highly disappointed to be having to go through this headache just to have record of my payment history. *update: STILL cannot get ahold of Stone River Property Management and when I attempted to go speak with Heather in person at the office (in March) she told me she couldn’t help me since it was sent to collections (3 days after we moved they charged it to collections and didn’t give us any of the information they sent) after that she slammed the door in my face.

name: Alex Calder
text: This is the most efficiently run apartment complex I have ever encountered. For one, the management is AWESOME. Our leasing agent, Macy (who actually works at their sister complex Huntleigh Woods), was upbeat and so helpful. She sold us on a unit, and was nothing short of hospitable for the entire experience. After we signed we met the manager, Margaret. Margaret knows how to run this complex! She is super sweet, and made sure everything was up and working before we moved into the apartment. We've a few MINOR issues and the maintenance man has been here in less than five minutes to fix the issue! He is awesome, and he is by the far the hardest working maintenance man ever! I love living here, and I'm so glad we came here. Margaret, Macy, and the maintenance man... Thank you!

name: jwaldo12
text: Best apartments to rent in Mobile. Location is great. No riff-raff. Fairly priced and the staff is amazing. If they had garages I would have never moved.

name: Evan Jackson
text: Great place to live! Wonderful staff in the leasing office and great location. The apartments are good quality and recently renovated.

resp.text: Thank you, Evan! It brings us joy knowing you feel our community is a great place to live. If there is anything we can do for you moving forward, please just let us know! - The Team at Ashford Place

name: LaTonya Vee
text: I am a current resident and I love it here,you don't hear any noise at night,only a few kids playing in the day. Heather is amazing to comunicate with, i only wish some of our residents would pick up more behind their pets.  Love living here.

name: Ken Dameron
text: Absolutely super! Been living here 16 years and can't find a fault!

resp.text: Ken, we greatly appreciate you for being a valued resident of our community for the past 16 years! We are thrilled to see that we have been able to provide you with such a great community for so long. As always, please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do for you going forward. - The Team at Ashford Place

name: William Pierce
text: Went in for a tour yesterday. Staff was extremely nice and helpful, inside the apartments were nice, every room had W/D connections and can't wait to see how all the renovation turns out. Cant wait to move in!

name: Alicia
text:
I put up a review earlier stating that my apartment has termites but I guess it’s been removed.

I’m leaving another review stating that it’s been three weeks and we’ve still got termites inside. You may be wondering why not tell the front office? They know. They sent out a piece of paper saying just turn your lights off and they’ll be dead in the morning. You just gotta vacuum them up. That’s it! Apparently it’s “termite season” and they won’t be doing anything about them. I’ve never heard of the season since I’ve never seen termites until this apartment.

Even if that’s true, can’t there still be something done about them crawling through holes in the corners of the walls? I sent in a ticket but about how they’re getting inside and it was just answered with “termite season” and filed it completed. Why not at least patch the holes? Or come check it out ay least? I had to put tape in some places so they couldn’t crawl in.

Sorry, but living with BUGS all over the ceiling and walls is not something I’m okay with. The first day I noticed them, I must’ve vacuumed 40-50 of the suckers up off the walls and ceilings since I didn’t know how I could get rid of so many any other way.

I would not recommend this place. I’m embarrassed to have people over in case they see the termites start crawling out of the holes in the walls.

name: Brianna Rhodes
text: I love our apartment here at Ashford. Front office is very sweet, apartments are clean, and great environment. I would highly recommended

name: Lexus Hair Studio
text: Very professional love them ❤️

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5-star rating and the special shout out of our team! - The Team at Ashford Place

name: ashbartypartytennis
text:
The area is ok....but what makes this place an amazing place to live is the manager, Leigh.
She really takes a lot of pride in her job, and really goes the extra mile for her residents.
I just moved into a home, but if not, I could've lived there forever.  You'll never find a better manager.  NO, I'm not an employee of this place.  This is an honest review.

name: lededria baker
text: I have lived at this complex for over 5 years. I use to love living here. I have had multiple maintenance issues that have not been fixed properly or never completed. The constant market increase and having issues not fixed is very frustrating. I hate to move but I have a child that deserves more.

name: Heather (Heaths)
text: My son's apt is nice but his wife's car has already been broken into

name: Stephen Lewis
text: Terribly ran property. I live here currently and I wouldn’t reccomend it to anyone at all. I was baited to move here by being told I was gonna get a certain apartment and it was being renovated and all kinds of stuff, a nice view was a deal breaker for me therefore I was taken to the apartment with the best view and told that would be my apartment. What a coincidence right? But that’s not all. I filled out an application for that one, SIGNED A LEASE, for that one, everything and the “assistant manager” Tara waited until the day I was supposed to move in, actually on the way to show me the apartment for the first time on the move in day, that I wasn’t getting that apartment but she had another one for me. How lovely. So here I am with old terrible carpet that should’ve been replaced, old paint, I have had to call maintance about 10 times. I have had to have them replace EVERY APPLIANCE all the way down to the thermostat, the maintance never shows up when they say they are going to, they go days without contacting you, nobody is ever in the office, heather the manager is rude, and the place is a disaster. I am extremely unhappy and it is highly overpriced. The property is dirty, never maintained, and all out nasty. I have complained multiple times with no necessary actions taken to fix the issue, I even went as far as noticing when the people moved out of the apartment that I SIGNED A LEASE ON, and they told me no problem we can move you in there, FOR A 400$ MOVING FEE. Do what??? Please save yourself some trouble and DO NOT move here. There is a VERY GOOD REASON they are running move in specials and have immediate openings!!!

name: latresha stinson
text: I use to love living here, but now I am really having second thoughts since the last management change. Without going into too much details I will try to explain. I had two events that happened  which required repair work back in October 2015 and I believe January of this year, 2016. It is now April 2016 and neither issue had been resolved. I was dragged along for months by management  stating too me it was because  of vendor issues. I now have another  issue and don't  feel like reporting it. I have never been through anything like this in all my years of apartment living. I am embarrassed  to have guest    over. Whenever  I call the office staff is friendly enough, but I think I have been more than patient.

name: Tyree Curry
text: It is bad because they keep uping the rent

name: Hammad Jamil
text: I would say place is good to live  i was a former resident when i moved i deposite 500$ i start living and very first week water start leaking from the first floor and whole walls of the room messed up but i live there almost a 8 months nobody came to fix that and i lived like that when i moved they kept all my money and said we need to clean that apartment this is not good 500$ not gonna hurt but these people specially manager she dont like other color then white never talk gently with me always sound like racist poor managment ...

name: Crystal mcdaneld
text: Great people, great place to live

name: M27
text: Don't rent here... landlord parks is clueless..she just says thing that sounds good but inaccurate and the prices for a 400 sq ft ...I would not recommend..and the way the AC is built bugs are going to get in through the AC unit..and don't get my started on the washer and dryer combo..might as well just use the laundry room..go down the street to sherwood where you get what you pay for at least...the Vue has the exterior of a 70s apt and the critters outside knows...

resp.text: Resident satisfaction is our number one goal, and we appreciate your feedback. We are always looking for ways to improve and would be glad to speak with you about how to make your experience worthy of five-stars. Please feel free to contact us if you would like to speak with our team.

name: Hanna Whitaker
text: I paid a pet fee when I moved in and they decide to tell me I didn’t when my lease is 3 months from being up. They said it got “lost” with new management. I don’t think so. This place is trash.

resp.text: Hanna, we’re disheartened knowing you have an unfavorable opinion of our apartments. We understand our manager has reached out to correct the error regarding your pet fees. Please accept our deepest apologies for this issue and any frustration it may have caused. We hope to improve your experience and opinion of our community and invite you to reach out if there is anything else you'd like to discuss.

name: Demetrius West
text:
I’ve have lived at VUE at Rocketcity Apartments for 5 years. And I’m Home for Life.  Professional Management, quality maintenance and all new appliances, and washer & dryer.  I love it here. We’re family.

I visited the new pool , today. Amazing, clean and set up with awesome chairs , lounge chairs. And I’m a big guy , and I was very comfortable.  The pool is amazing.

I’m home. !

Demetrius West
A14

resp.text: Demetrius, thank you for this wonderful five-star review of VUE at Rocket City Apartments! We couldn't be happier knowing you're enjoying life at our community. We love our residents and want each day to reflect the five-star lifestyle we value. We are thrilled you're enjoying the new appliances, new pool, and the exceptional service we strive to provide. We're glad you've chosen to call us home and hope you continue to choose us for years to come. If there's anything you need, please don't hesitate to reach out to the team.

name: Matt Scarola
text: Excited about the new pool. Property looks nice and clean. Some of the best rates in town for a modern apartment

resp.text: Thank you for this wonderful five-star review, Matt! We're delighted you're enjoying life at VUE at Rocket City Apartments and are excited about the many enhancements we've made and those still in progress! The team works diligently to keep our community tidy, and we're glad you've found our pricing reflects an excellent value. As always, we love being of service and invite you to reach out if there is anything we can do for you.

name: david cole
text: Got home last night and it felt like 1000 degrees in my apartment. I called the management just hoping that they would be able to help same day, but not holding on to any miracles due to the time. She was on the phone immediately after my call, and within 30 minutes I had a new A/C unit in. Thank you so much for your quick response! I really do appreciate it!!

resp.text: David, thank you for taking the time to leave this five-star review for our community! We're thrilled you received the swift service you deserve. Our goal is always your satisfaction, and we understand meeting maintenance needs in a timely fashion makes a difference. Please feel free to reach out if there is anything else you need. We are always happy to be of service!

name: John Grady Welden
text: By far the best deal in Huntsville. It's close to everything, has brand new units and amenities, and it's still one of the lowest prices in town.

resp.text: John, thank you for this wonderful five-star review! We're glad you're pleased with our central Huntsville location, new upgrades, and the excellent value offered at VUE at Rocket City Apartments! We love our residents and pride ourselves on providing an exceptional apartment living experience. If there is anything we can do to be of service, please don't hesitate to contact the team.

name: T'tiana Owens
text:
I lived here from 2014-2019 as my first apartment on my own.
Management switched each year I stayed there. I had multi issues over the years some got handle & some I had my father come fix but it was common issues nothing major till the last two months of my stay. But the new management Briana handle the issue right away. She is so far one of the best lease management Tara Garden could have. She reply within 48hrs.
Thanks I enjoyed my couple years.

resp.text: T'tiana, thank you for taking the time to leave this thoughtful four-star review for Tara Garden Apartments! We are glad our current team provided you with the swift service you deserved. Our goal is always the satisfaction of our residents, and we're glad you enjoyed your time with us. Please don't hesitate to reach out if there is anything we can do for you in the future.

name: Irrelevant info
text: I live here currently and they are by far, the best at everything. Our air conditioner went out and it needed a different unit and they replaced it THE SAME DAY😊😁. It is bug free, crime free, quiet and clean. The office staff are very polite and helpful. I couldn't ask for more and 5 stars isn't enough for them.

resp.text: Suzy, thank you for this kind five-star rating! We love hearing from our residents and your feedback is truly important to us. We're glad to know you've received the prompt service you deserve concerning your air conditioner. We're also happy to know our staff have been professional and helpful, and life at our community has been such a pleasant experience for you. If there is any way we may be of further assistance to you, please don't hesitate to visit us in the office or give us a call at (256) 830-4878.

name: A R
text: The management here is the most responsive and efficient management I've come across so far. They address situations directly and do their best to resolve them in a way that helps everyone. That is a quality that many places don't have, so it feels great to live somewhere that does!

resp.text: Anton, thank you for this glowing five-star review of Tara Garden Apartments! We're thrilled you've enjoyed your lifestyle as a part of our community. Our goal is to make every experience worthy of five-stars, and you've shown us we are meeting that expectation. Our staff will be delighted to know you've found them so helpful and efficient. Please feel free to drop by the office or call (256) 830-4878 if we may be of assistance to you.

name: Luke Daanomah
text:
I currently live in Tara Garden, and must confess, it has been quite the opposite of what I heard about the place from a few people prior to me living here. So far I love the responsiveness of the new manager of the place, Miss Lisa. In fact, I heard a lot of negative things about the former manager of the place but Miss Lisa has definitely made my stay at Tara Garden worthwhile. She is so kind, caring, and very courteous. I love the convenience of the location of the apartment--5 mins drive to NASA and in such a close proximity to shopping centers etc.  I also enjoy the serenity of the environment here.
I have really enjoyed my stay here so far and will definitely recommend it to anybody looking for a peaceful place to live in Huntsville that is so conveniently located to everything else in the great Rocket city.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving this five-star review for Tara Garden Apartments, Luke! We are thrilled your experience reflected our goal of providing an exceptional place to live with world-class service. We understand your post isn't recent, but please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do for you. We are always happy to be of service.

name: Nick Plater
text: I moved in at the begining of January around the time they came under new management every time i walk in the office i feel at home.  Lisa the new Manager is awesome. She is very Professional but at the same time you can talk to as a friend. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an affordable bit stylish place to live.

resp.text: At Tara Garden Apartments, our entire staff is dedicated to providing our residents with the highest-quality lifestyles available in apartment living, and we're glad that's what you've found at our community! We truly appreciate your kind words and this great five-star review. Though you posted a while ago, don't hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do for you. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Kelly D.
text: Absolutely HATE it here . Bug INFESTED. TERRIBLE STAFF. Pest Control is JOKE here. SO many roaches & other bugs. Terrible maintenance as well. The office staff does not care about the people who live here nor about the complaints. I've been here since for 5 months now and I''m looking for a place to live. Also VERY small counter space, no space for anything. In conclusion do NOT come here. ( :

resp.text: We know it's been a while since you posted, and apologize for not responding sooner. We value your feedback and would like to learn how we can improve your experience. Since your post, we have made many positive changes to our community, and we think you'd be pleased. If there is anything you'd like to discuss, we would be happy to listen. Please feel free to reach out anytime.

name: Jonathan Sullivan
text:
A great place to live for young professionals, students and temporary residents. Minutes from UAH and Calhoun, and both are accessible by walking. It's also very easy to get downtown. The ramp to 565 is literally right down the street.

I could not ask more from the management - My fridge had a funky smell to it and they replaced it the same day I put in a complaint. The only real downside was a lack of natural lighting, but that may have just been because I was in a corner unit.

Overall, I would highly recommend Tara Gardens to anyone in need of affordable housing. I would definitely live there again.

resp.text: Jonathan, thank you for taking the time to leave us this wonderful five-star rating! We're delighted to know you enjoyed your time at Tara Garden, our convenient location, and received the excellent quality of service we strive to provide to all our residents. We loved having you as a resident, and we would be thrilled to welcome you home to Tara Garden again in the future. If we may be of any service to you, please don't hesitate to give us a call at (256) 830-4878 or drop by and visit us in the office at your convenience.

name: Tom Hand
text: The washer dryer takes 4 hours to do one load, and fills your tub with lint and residue from the backflow.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Tom. We’re sorry to learn you are dissatisfied with the lifestyle you’ve found at our community. While our European washer and dryer combo takes longer to complete a cycle, this is because it performs both functions of washing and drying in one appliance. The drainage was set up to accommodate the plumbing system in place when our community was built. We apologize for any inconvenience. Each move-in packet includes a washer/dryer tip sheet to help residents maximize the efficiency of their machine. We would be happy to answer any questions you have or speak with you about improving your experience. Please contact the office at your convenience to discuss these matters further.

name: cole eddy
text: Terrible place to live. I have needed a new door for the past 3 months. I told them 3 months ago and they told me they was going to get somebody to look at it and they never did. 2 months ago I said something else and they told me the same thing. So 2-3 weeks ago I told them AGAIN I needed a new door and they told me i was on the priority list to get one and that I would have a new door by the end of that week. The end of the week came, and guess what? You guessedit, no new door. I seen the door installers working on another apartment door and I asked him about it and he showed me the list of priority and 2 priority and my apartment number was no where on that list. I messaged Tara garden apartments about it and they told me "I assure you you are on the list and I don't know what list he showed you". The list he showed me was a print out of the email that Tara Garden sent to him. I wouldn't rent here. Bugs and they will give the run around on EVERY LITTLE THING

resp.text: Cole, we feel your frustration, and we’re sorry your time with us has been less than satisfactory. Our goal is for every resident to experience a five-star lifestyle, which is why we are dedicated to improving our community. We are currently replacing every door on our property, including yours. We have two priority lists in circulation which is why you might not have seen your apartment number listed. We understand your feelings concerning this process, and we apologize if we have miscommunicated the timelines involved in the purchasing and installation of the doors. Additionally, if you are experiencing an issue with insects, we offer pest control by request each Tuesday and will gladly service your apartment. We would be happy to speak with you further or answer any questions you may have. Please visit the office or call (256) 830-4878 if we may be of assistance.

name: brittany ortiz
text: From the outside I wasn't sure what I was getting into but I LOVE the close proximity to Bridge Street. The apartments are a good value. Convenient and nice management.

resp.text: Even though it's been a while, we wanted to thank you for taking the time to leave this great five-star review for Tara Garden Apartments! We truly appreciate you and are thrilled you've had such a positive experience at our community. If there is anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to call or visit the office. We are always happy to be of service!

name: YesweCam1
text: The ladies at the office are very nice and welcoming. Bugs are bad here. I was without power for 2 days because Tara Gardens failed to report/update, notify my information to Huntsville Utilities of my move in date. Also the last owner of my apt did not pay the last utilities bill and i recieved a notification on my door about it. I thought i was being scammed but wasn't. I had food in the fridge that i did not trust to eat afterwards and had to buy new food. This should have never happend to begin with because i gave them a heads up. They promised me that i would not lose power. Im an adult in this world addressing my problems but what can i do? Tara Gardens claim Hsv utilities made errors. And Hsv utilities told me "Tara gardens made the mistake not us". Tara Gardens did say thst they were sorry. Also Google Maps location is incorrect on this page. Its Old Madison Pike not Madison Pike. I have mail that never reached me because it caused confusion. This is a decent place to live its a little hoodish. I miss living at Hampton Falls.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We’re glad you’ve found our staff friendly and welcoming, but apologize for the power issues you experienced upon move-in. While we notified our carrier about the need for power in your home, there was a miscommunication from our vendor to the utility provider. We are glad the issue was resolved swiftly. Pest control is offered to residents upon request, and we will gladly add your home to our weekly service schedule. We are sorry you’ve experienced an issue with mail delivery. Google is currently forcing our address to be displayed as “Madison Pike” instead of “Old Madison Pike.” We have contacted them to have the error corrected. We suggest you contact the Wynn Drive Post Office for any issues regarding mail delivery. Our goal is for every resident to experience a five-star lifestyle at our community, and we would like to speak with you about improving your experience. Please call or drop by the office at your convenience if there is anything you would like to discuss.

name: Simone Wallace
text:
We currently live here and we hate it. The people in the leasing office have no idea what they are doing, they have no idea how to do paperwork. I went to speak with someone about a buyout fee a few days ago and brought my lease with me, and when she pulled out the lease in the office it was a completely different lease than what I had. And the girl who did our lease is no longer working here.

Our apartment is old, and nasty, when we were told we would be getting all new appliances and carpet. When we moved in our bathroom sink was rotting, and our stove was from the 80's with all the numbers and settings rubbed off.

There are so many other things I could go on and on about, but seriously, We hate this apartment complex. I just feel like they hire people who aren't qualified, and have no idea what they are doing.

resp.text: We know it's been a while since your post, and apologize for not responding in a more timely manner. We value your feedback and would like to learn how we can improve your opinion. Please feel free to call or visit the office if there is anything you would like to discuss.

name: Andrea Ball
text: It didn't work out but Tara was absolutely great. She was patient, kind and worked with me to try to get approval. She rocks!!

resp.text: Andrea, thank you for taking the time to leave us such a fantastic review! We are sorry to hear it didn't work out, but glad to hear Tara was so helpful to you.

name: Richard Cathey
text: The hospitality here is very outgoing very good it's just a blessing to have a good place to live thank you Lord can I get a amen.

resp.text: Richard, thank you for such a wonderful review of Tara Garden! Hospitality towards our residents and visitors is something we take very seriously, and we're glad that our community is where you call home.

name: Trey hughes
text: I love it that simple.I moved in just a few weeks after it came in under new management and it's great.Studio Apt is affordable and  stable.Management is friendly.You have the feeling of coming home when you talk with them.Lisa is a great manager to talk with while still being a manager she's cool to talk with as friends.

resp.text: Reviews like yours make our day, Trey! We truly appreciate this great rating for our community! At Tara Garden Apartments our goal is always your 100% satisfaction. We know you posted some time ago, but don't hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do for you!

name: Karen Monter
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE ! If I could give 0 stars I would !!! This place is one of the WORST places out there ! Pest control is a literal joke ! I was literally seeing spiders the size of my hand. There were roaches everywhere! I made sure NEVER to leave food out and I cleaned on the regular. The amount of roaches that are there is absolutely disgusting. I told her twice I needed an exterminator. For months she gave me the run around. I got bit and everything and she still gave me the run around. I kept seeing people throw perfectly good mattresses with bed bug zip up sheets. (I know what they look like bc my parents got bed bugs while traveling 7 years ago) That was a red flag! No too long after I found a full size bed bug!!!! At first she tried telling me it wasn’t a bed bug ( Even though I kept the bed bug for her to see) . Then she told me the mattresses were from people moving out. Who throws a perfectly good mattress out? Finally, (after keeping the spiders and bed bugs for her to see) the exterminator came and basically said I brought the bed bug in even though I had not traveled or stayed at anyone’s house or been to anyone’s house.( I was new to Huntsville) So he told me I had gotten it from a restaurant, when the bed bugs  are only active from like 2am-5am. He told me not to treat the apartment with bed bug stuff from Home Depot bc it would make it wors and told me I would have to pay out of pocket to pay for a “professional” bed bug treatment. Btw the Home Depot stuff worked. The day we moved out , someone dumped a couch and it was INFESTED with bedbugs. You could literally see them crawling around on it. So please tell me you don’t have a bed bug infestation.  My boyfriend told her months before we were going to move out when the lease was up. She tried to charge us two more months rent because we “didn’t give her a notice  “ then she said she didn’t remember that us telling her . We refused but we still had to pay just one more month of rent. Also, she does not reply to emails or calls ! Like NEVER ! I had to blow up her inbox a few times to even get a reply and even then she wouldn’t. One time my boyfriend called her right before I walked into the office and she literally let it ring. 2 seconds later I walked in and told her my boyfriend had just tried calling so we could all talk. She said the phone never rang, but I had heard the phone ring just before I walked in. So clearly their costumers are high on their priority list.

resp.text: Karen, thank you for taking the time to leave this review. We’re sorry your Tara Garden experience has not lived up to your expectations. We offer pest control every Tuesday upon request. When you experience a need for service, the best course of action is to submit a work order to ensure your need has been properly entered into our service queue. Reports of bed bugs, while rare, are something we take extremely seriously. While bed bugs are primarily active at night and acquired through travel, they can come from various sources such as restaurants, theaters, or other public spaces. Sealing and removing mattresses from the home is the proper course of action to take if an instance of bed bugs has occurred. However, many people keep their mattresses in protective coverings for sanitary purposes unrelated to pests. Our procedure for the treatment of bed bugs is very thorough and involves detailed steps to ensure any presence of these insects is eliminated. The couch you mentioned was removed from our property the same day it was placed curbside. Inspection of your apartment revealed no presence of bedbugs beyond the specimen you found, and further treatment, though offered for your peace of mind, was not required. Our leasing agreement states notice must be given in writing 60 days prior to move-out. We apologize for any miscommunication concerning this issue. In a show of good faith, we adjusted your lease to month to month, which only requires a 30 day notice. Our residents are our highest priority, and our staff are trained to answer all emails and calls or return them promptly. We apologize if you feel your communications were not treated with the importance they deserve. We would be happy to discuss these matters further if you would visit the office or call (256) 830 4878 at your convenience.

name: jeff johnson
text: my son lived here, thid place is horrible,toilet has stayed operaible for weeks ,he has to go down the street to the store to use the bathroom because the management wont fix it, his apt was broken into,some one kicked the door in  and the security cameras were next to his apt and mgt woulndt let him view the footage to see who it was,then his door wasnt repaired for 4 days so he had to sleep with a chair propped against his door to keep from getting robbed. a week later he was robbed at gunpoint by someone who lived in this apt complex.DO NOT RENT HERE FOR YOUR OWN SAFTEY.

resp.text: Jeff, we're sorry your son's experience wasn't enjoyable. Since your post, we've come under new management and have made many upgrades to our community. We appreciate your feedback and would be happy to speak with you about our changes. Please feel free to reach out if there is anything you'd like to discuss. We would be happy to improve your opinion.

name: Daniel Sperry
text: I have no doubt that staying at Tara gardens was the most detrimental thing to happen to my life . I can't believe how unprofessional and disgraceful these people have acted towards myself . I wouldn't let my dog stay there for free . Enough said , thanks for nothing you sorry excuse for a living environment .

resp.text: Hi Daniel, we’re sorry to hear your time at Tara Garden didn’t meet your expectations. We’ve reviewed your records, and we wanted to let you know that since you left our community, we’ve undergone a change in management. We believe every resident should be treated with respect and professionalism by our staff, and anything less than that is unacceptable. We would like to invite you back to Tara Garden to meet the current manager and see the positive changes we’ve made in the community. You are always welcome to drop by the office or give us a call at any time at (256) 830-4878.

name: Sapphire Mcfarlane
text: Awesome and helpful staff ,with an ideal location!!

resp.text: Sapphire, thank you for this wonderful five-star review! We're thrilled you've found our staff helpful and our location convenient. Our goal is always your satisfaction, and reviews like yours make our day! We are always happy to be of service to our residents, and invite you to drop by the office or call (256) 830-4878 if we may be of any assistance.

name: C.J. Love
text: BED BUG CITY, DON'T MOVE HERE!

resp.text: Though time has passed since your post, your review is important to us. Since you reviewed our community, we have made many positive changes and would like to improve your opinion. Please call or visit the office at your convenience so we may learn how to better serve you.

name: Front Desk
text: HAS BUGS

resp.text: While we appreciate your review, we’re sorry if you’ve experienced issues with pests. We recently changed our pest control provider in an effort to better serve our residents. We offer pest control by request every Friday, and will gladly add your home to our list for immediate service if you will visit the office or call (256) 830-4878. We strive to provide a five-star experience for our residents, and we are always happy to be of service!

name: Kenyon Gradert
text:
Edit: seems like Hayley boosts its google reviews by rating itself. (See pic.) Appears that one of their own property managers left a five-star review.  And four of their five-star reviews come from people with the last name Hayley, same as the owner. (Maybe it's a coincidence!) It's almost funny.

Read through these reviews and you'll notice a trend that explains Hayley's poor ratings everywhere: they start with poor quality and end with scamming you out of your deposit. My pregnant wife and I spent 3+ hours on our hands and knees scrubbing our rental house top to bottom before we moved out. It was far cleaner than when we moved in. We discovered $100+ was kept from our deposit because we "didn't have it professionally cleaned" -- which is not even a requirement of the lease. I provided photographic evidence that we cleaned up messes that Hayley had never addressed when we moved in, proving that we left the place cleaner than Hayley did. (See photos below for before and after.) Their lawyer said our photos were selective and that we were "belittling" their efforts -- says the person who penalized a pregnant woman for cleaning 3+ hours. Nor did Hayley specify what we failed to clean, much less photographic evidence to prove it. All this to say that Hayley appears to automatically deduct $100+ from deposits for cleaning yet doesn't use that fee to clean the place to their own supposed standards.

This was just the last of many frustrations. Ants and roaches were present when we moved in. Here too we picked up for Hayley's slack and hired exterminators. Hayley's lease requires tenants to maintain the yard but when we moved in, we discovered the yard filled with bamboo and 1+ foot of pine straw (no wonder there were bugs). We asked Hayley to fix it; they sent a maintenance crew that cut the bamboo and left everything else. I spent all week raking it up.

Finally, the property was quite literally rotting on the outside. (Again, no wonder there were bugs.) The owner clearly was attempting to put as little maintenance into the property as possible. I think Hayley is coasting on the Auburn housing market, but it won't take much for a competitor to pick up their slack.

name: Marc Newbern
text: Let’s start in the beginning.  A week after I moved in I had to go pick up the garage door openers because they didn’t give them to me when I moved in, the also didn’t have two keys and had to go get one made.  The office told me that they thought my wife and I had funny relationship.  One, my wife is black and I am white so I am not sure what was even meant by that and two,  it’s none of their concern what kind of relationship we have.  Secondly they cheat you out of your deposit, doesn’t matter if that was the way it was when you moved in.  I have pictures to prove and the move in sheet.  They took $600 for touch up paint. I would be curious to know if they actually painted because they sure didn’t paint any walls when we moved in.  Keep moving, don’t rent from them, it isn’t worth the hassle.

name: Heidi Smith
text: Nice places to stay, but you have to put up with unprofessional office staff.  I am furious and would not reccomend them to anyone.  Takes forever to fix anything, they have their deposits all mixed up and allow folks to move in even if they havent signed lease for that time period.  they make me sick

name: Ann-Braxton Mann Smith
text: Follow the rules and dont destroy the home you live in and you may get different results when ya move out. I had absolutely no issues while living with them. Always nice when i called the office and never had any problems! Highly Recommend them if you know how to follow rules! :)

name: Elias Moritan
text: Do not respond to calls and applications in timely fashion. Hard to work with. Would not recommend.

name: Meredith Kemp
text:
We purchased a condo two years ago for our sons to live in while at college. The current tenets had four months left on their lease so we had Haley stay on as property manager since we were not living in the area. About two months later we received an email notifying us that an upstairs toilet had leaked but it had been handled and everything was dry. Since they had eyes on the situation we trusted them when the email said they had handled it and everything was dried. We had insurance, if they had informed us how bad the leak and water damage was we would have contacted them to come in. Instead two years later we have reports from an environmental mold specialist ongoing us that the upstairs and room beneath where water leaked is covered in black mold. Testing shows that it clearly originated from the bathroom leak not dealt with two years ago and the specialist also told us this does not happen when fans and dehumidifiers are brought in to properly dry everything out.
We owned a home in Virginia that had been handled by a property manager for 7 years before we could sell and they were always clear about communicating and honest with handling any issues. Haley was paid to do a job and clearly did not. My guess is because they knew we would not be extending our contract at the end of those four months when our sons moved in. We now have $20,000 worth of mold damage and our son with asthma health to worry about because of their poor management of our property.

name: Brent Butts
text: Rented from Hayley management for over 4 years. Not all of it was bad, but I wouldn’t recommend them. When we first tried to rent from them they told us to come sign because they were holding a spot for us. Only for us to come in and they told us it was given to someone else. They wouldn’t do anything about it until I had my dad come up there and speak to the manager and show them the text. Just over all unprofessional. Then upon move out they racked all these charges on us. Some were warranted and completely understandable. Others were not. A professional company would call you and explain the situation. They basically told us through email that our case was closed and to pay. They would not provide any proof of the work done or proof that fault was on us for certain damages. Not the worst place in auburn but you can find better for sure.

name: Edward Branchhill
text:
I've tried contacting Haley Management on multiple occasions to try and set up tours of available units. I always got the same response that they were "shorthanded" that day and to leave my information so that they could call me back to set up a showing. I've never been contacted back even after leaving my information on four separate occasions. The first time that I contacted them was over 3 months ago. Your experience may differ, but if the way they handle tours is any indication about how responsive they are to their current tenants then I would avoid them if at all possible.

Also, it appears that at least some of the 5 star reviews are left by representatives of Haley Management. For example, the most recent review by "Ann-Braxton Mann Smith" appears to be from a person that works for Haley Management (just do a quick search of her name). On its face, it appears to be a conflict of interest.

name: Matt King
text: I’ve been renting from Hayley for 3 years now and have had no problems. The staff is friendly, helpful, and they are super flexible on rent payments which is great if you are a student. The two leasing agents, Kelli and Ann Braxton and are always happy to help and answer any questions I have. They actually care about their owners and tenants. If you are a student and need a place to rent in the Auburn/Opelika area, I highly recommend renting from Hayley Management. Fantastic establishment.

name: Evlyne G
text: Friendly informative. Easy to work with cross country. Was given other options when the first choice wasn't available

name: Arthur Bosswell
text: Super trash!  They have employees and family boost their ratings.

name: Maxi Roberts
text:
I lived with Hayley for 5 years and literally didn’t have a SINGLE problem. I see a lot of reviews concerning security deposits. They give you a check list to
Go by when you move out. I followed the check list just like my lease said to and I got my entire security deposit back. I know this is a college town so maybe all of these mad people are just college kids who don’t understand how the move out process worked...? Not sure but I’m just here to say that they were all great and very professional to me.

I’d be curious to see the conditions of the homes that these “bad” reviews were left in. I can only imagine what some people lived like!

name: Adrian Buice
text:
Absolutely terrible to work with.  Would not recommend to anyone looking for a rental property.  We moved into a house that was poorly painted; single coated, holes in the walls were terribly patched up and not painted.
Upon receiving our deposit statement, they charged us $450 for them to repaint.

Edit: After sending in photos of what the paint job looked like BEFORE we moved in, they asked us to provide MORE documentation because apparently their team has NO documentation whatsoever on the unit.  A complete asinine request.  They also stated the grass wasn't cut and charged us $200 to cut the grass.  We provided photos of the yard the day we moved out which shows the lawn was in good shape.  A month went by before new tenants moved in.  I'm pretty sure they did have to cut the grass again between that time but we shouldn't be responsible for those cuts.  Disgusting company.

name: Mallory Mitchell
text: I love Hayley Management! They have been super accommodating to me and my family since renting with them in 2018. Ann-Braxton has been soooo helpful in getting my needs met and I’m so thankful to rent with them!!!

name: Jessie Mann
text: Where do I begin... we subleased an apartment and after being promised the place would be cleaned and carpets professionally cleaned we moved in. Well months went on and I stayed on the phone with their managers about the damages that were there. Moveout time comes after discussing it many many times with them they send me a bill for 7k dollars wanting me to pay for damages the previous tenant caused. They are so very unprofessional.... I SEVERELY wouldnt recommend renting from them!

name: Georgie the sweetest
text: First time ever writing a review in my life..Lived here for a year. WORST place to live. All good reviews are fake..Worst part is when you move out. They will check everything on their move out check list dirty and will charge you $450 for painting, $200 for carpet cleaning, $150 for “unprofessional cleaning” when the apartment was not painted and cleaned at all when I first moved in.. Absolutely worst worst place to live

name: David Aguiñaga
text: Unprofessional place, called them every day to check for any updates on my application and at the end they ended up leasing the property without notice they told me to look for other options on their web site and they will call me back... which they didn't. I didn't even rent here and I do not even recomend it because of their service.

name: DaJon McIntosh
text: They have a lot of nice housing options, but bad communication between their different offices. I submitted my application before my roommate and he got a response of rejection before me. And this was after we had already made an appointment to see the house, and on the way to see it. They should really suggest doing the application first before setting up an showing. It cost us $70 for application fees and $15 in gas and a waste of a day.

name: callie morris
text: Hayley Management has been so quick to respond to any questions that my roommates and I had during this pandemic about our future living arrangements. They have also been very polite and worked so hard to make sure that we got the answers we needed.

name: Kenneth Beard
text: Worst rental company to ever do business with. They will rent your property out from under you giving you little to no time to find somewhere else after you have discussed trying to renew your current lease. They never call you back when they say they will. The tenants right to a peaceful enjoyment will constantly be broken with them trying to find the next renter. They care less about the properties structure or maintaining it so they can make you pay for it. Everything is half way complete with anything they do. I would give them ZERO stars if possible. Also, if you do try to do business with them read the fine print cause they will try and pull a fast one on everyone of their tenants. It's not a personal basis with them only a number and dollar sign. Beware for you have been warned.

name: Brittney Johnson
text: They full of it. They want you to have a high credit score when alot of dont have that! We have good.

name: Jeffrey Webb
text:
Smooth move in and worked with us if someone was a couple days behind on rent. I would give them 5 stars but....
They gave us a check list of stuff to do to get back out deposit. The place was sparkling when we left but we were still charged for everything on the checklist. I would have been better off not cleaning at all. Hope they enjoy the bonus month of rent money.

name: Kim Spencer
text: Discriminatory with mixed couples

name: Ted Cook
text:
I don't normally write reviews, but I feel like I need to warn people about this company.

I lived at a Hayley property for two years and actually enjoyed the property itself. The size and location weren't bad for the price, and the one time pet fee made having a dog in college actually plausible. Unfortunately, that was pretty much all Hayley got right.

The yard was always a mess, with massive patches of dead grass and poor irrigation that caused the yard and our sidewalk to flood whenever it rained. There was also an issue where the owner of our property had requested that Hayley not sign anyone to a lease after our first lease ended so that he could sell the property, but Hayley signed us to a second lease anyway. This lead to confusion between us and the owner over whether we would be able to even live there the next year at a point in the year were most properties in town were already taken.

However, the worst offense was their predatory security deposit handling. During our second lease, our new owners would visit often and always thanked us for taking such good care of the property. On moving out, we followed Hayley's checkout list in full and left the place better than we found it. Despite all this, instead of getting our security deposit back, we received a bill stating we owed $1600 in damages BEYOND what our security deposit covered.

We were surprised to hear this based on how we kept the property, so we requested proof of the damages we were being charged for from Hayley. We were told that we would have to schedule an appointment for that, but any subsequent attempts to schedule an appointment were ignored.

Funnily enough, a friend in the same neighborhood who also rented from Hayley received a very similar bill upon moving out and has had the same experience in being ignored.

It seems as though Hayley's strategy is to scare young tenants out of their security deposits by asking for a ridiculous amount of money and then silently slinking off with an extra month's rent. To make things worse, this money isn't being used to clean or renovate the properties either, if the state of our property when we moved in is any indication.

So in summary, just avoid this company. Don't be fooled by the reviews here (if you look closely, almost all of the good reviews are years old with no comments and the recent reviews are much more scathing). You may not have problems right away, but they're bound to arise at some point.

name: James Hayley
text: I highly recommend these people. I rented from them for 2 years. They gave me a check list of their expectations once I left. It was super helpful and I got a my deposit back. They responded to my work orders in reasonable time. The rental was very spacious and comfortable.

name: Side Track
text: Been living any their space for over a year and it’s been very easy. People are nice and respond quickly. They fix things as fast as possible. No complaints. Gonna keep renting from Hayley.

name: Smith Smithson
text: This company has to be one of the worst managed rental agencies around. They do not care about tenants at all. It can take weeks at a time to get a reply and answer for any questions you may have. If your question regards anything dealing with money, you will unfortunately never receive an answer. However if you're looking for a job though, I would highly recommend trying to become a manager for Haley Management. This is because every time you ask to speak to a manager the receptionists say that they are on "vacation". Sometimes they can be on "vacation" for weeks at a time. So if you're looking for a job that pays you to do nothing at all and gives you more paid vacation time than any business around, being a manager at Haley Management could be the right job for you. I would suggest only working for them though because living in a property owned by them is not half as rewarding.

name: Nicky Bravo
text: Unprofessional and drug their feet and lied to me. Would not recommend at all! If you have any other choice try to find arrangements with a different company

name: Janna M
text: This company is one of the greatest! We have rented from them and now rent our condo through them. They are always helpful and get things done fast when needed! I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a rental company!! All of the office staff is wonderful and very helpful!

name: Thanh Huynh
text: Their service is Good and I love working with Brandon, but some of the staff is so rule and I feel like I was discriminated. I cannot remember her name but she is white. She was so rude and racist. I can feel that by The way she talk to me because I am an Asian and don’t speak English well. She used to gave me some tours to the house but when I was not pleased with the house and then she had a bad attitude to us. Whenever I call to talk to Brandon, she never let me talk to him, and try to ask me why I call, and then answer impolitely. I feel bad. She is Really mean to me. Please respect your customer, I pay the rent on time, I didn’t take any one money. Please learn how to answer the phone if you are as customer service agent. Because of you, I give your company zero star.

name: Stephanie Greene
text: I called and asked to see a property, they were very polite and very prompt in sending me the access code. However, I was very disappointed to have found out that the house in question Had another interested party. In fact, I didn’t find out that somebody else put an application in on it until I called back about it, which wasn’t even 24 hours later. I am slightly disappointed of course. It was beautiful home and would have been perfect for my husband and I. However, I’m more frustrated that they wasted my time and as a former real estate professional I would have expected them to at least let me know that somebody else was interested in the home, had put an application in on the home, so that I would not have wasted my time. I think I’ll look for a more customer focused office for my future needs.

name: Trish Cooper
text: Very knowledgeable

name: Kathy McBride
text: The management is very rude. They don't respect their tenants at all. We don't mind to pay maintenance fee if it was our fault to clog the tub drain by fallen hair ( I tried my best to collect these hair while taking shower and threw them to trash can), but you don't have to send a complaining email and attached a picture on what you unclogged and warn us not to do that anymore! Sorry but I won't call for maintenance anymore!

name: May Chen
text:
I like the work of Hayley Management Company very much. They are very professional, responsive, efficient and considerate. They not only consider the demands of the property owners and handle management affairs efficiently and effectively, in the process of collecting lease and providing management service for the property, they are also very considerate for the tenants with the greatest goodwill. It is not easy to handle the balance of effectively solving problems and considering all relevant parties with a humanitarian spirit, but they can do it very well and balance them very well.

All the staff working there I have contacted, no matter over the phone or actually going to the office,  are very polite, professional and responsive to your inquiries and requests. So far, this is the best management agency I  have seen. I definitely highly recommend this property management company to my friends.

name: Brice Hilyer
text: I rented from Hayley Management last spring and their service was exceptional. The rooms were impeccable. Customer service is the best around! I would recommend Hayley Management for everyone!

name: Donna Burnett
text: Brianna is a great representative for your company.  She assisted me in finding a great place to live on short notice when I moved to Auburn!  I have every reason to recommend Haley Management Company to help others with their housing needs when moving to Auburn or the surrounding area!  Thank you, again!

name: Hannah Anderson
text: Rented from this company for 6 months. They were always prompt when I called for maintenance. They even repaired the fence for the backyard before move in, so my dog would be safe. They added a pay rent online feature that makes renting from them much easier.

name: Chris Jefferson
text: I always thought organized gambling was illegal in the state of Alabama, that is until I signed a lease with Hayley Management. You see, Tom Hayley and his band of thieves run Haley Management like that of a casino. When you sign a lease with them you are gambling with what service you will be provided. If an appliance ranging from a refrigerator to an air conditioning unit quits working, you have a chance at them fixing it in either 1 try or 10 tries. Sometimes these issues can raise your power bill up tremendously high. If you call their offices to try and figure out an issue with money of any value, your chances of receiving any kind of help are around 10%, the house has 90% in this particular game they offer. But rest assure every December and January their employees try to reel you back into the Hayley Management casino just like a pit boss does in Vegas or Biloxi. So unless you’re a degenerate gambler I’d steer far away from Hayley Management.

name: Maddy Carroll
text: Very helpful staff, I have enjoyed working with this company, especially through this stressful situation of COVID-19!

name: Andrew Orman
text: Not very good on customer service. Absolutely robbed us of our security deposit, deducting for ridiculous reasons. Our unit wasn’t nice to begin with, and we had to get it cleaned after we moved in, even tho they claimed it was done before hand. Overall terrible. Would choose Northcutt any day of the week.

name: Mona Johnson
text: R&R rentals is by far the best company I've ever rented from. My duplex was clean and in great condition when I moved (and when I moved out). My roommates and I never had any maintenance problems, but Kurt (the owner) was always just a phone call away if we had any problems/questions at all. I would definitely recommend renting from this company, it was a good experience.

name: Stephen Hughes
text: Highly recommend!  Impeccable work ethic.  Rented many properties over the years and have never been so satisfied with the staff.  Very personable and easy to work with.

name: Brett Nelson
text: The owners here are very friendly and very helpful.  The way the run things here flows smoothly and without a hassle. Highly recommended!

name: Ben Burkart
text: R and R (Hayley Management) took over management of the house we were renting right before our lease ran out. The company that was managing our unit did not provide Hayley management the total initial deposit amount that we put down. They also did not provide them with our initial unit inspection sheet. Because of this when we got our deposit refund it was much lower than it should have been. After explaining the situation to Kurt, and providing him copies of all our initial paperwork,  he was very willing to refund us the deposit amount that we deserved. Excellent customer service and they put their customers, both renters and owners, first.

name: DopeAMean (DJ Dope)
text: Unable to make contact, used someone else.

name: Farm House
text: Hayley management company is a great group of people to work with. They care about their customers and work to make their customers satisfied in everything they do. They really care about their work and the customers they serve.

name: ribbon ribbon
text: Do not be fooled by the close-to-perfect reviews of this rental company. The majority of the reviews come from random accounts who ONLY review Hayley Management AND Tiger Iron Gym... hmmm, the owner of both of these companies is Kurt Hayley, who only wants to boost the reviews of his places. I personally leased with them BECAUSE of these reviews, and while the quality of the duplex was sub-par, they don't have upkeep of their rental properties. People have dogs and don't even pick up after them... Not the worst rental company in Auburn for sure but I think it's really shady that the good majority of these reviews are from the owner hidden behind a computer. *disclaimer: This isn't my main e-mail account as I do not want to be harassed by places where I provide my HONEST review.

name: Andrea DeWitt
text: I was very disappointed a number of times working with Haley Management. I had accepted a job in Auburn and was looking to move relatively quickly. It was very difficult to get a reply to the emails I would send about available properties and viewing appointments. I still to this day have yet to receive an email from Charity about a property that I was later called for. I was told it was no longer available by phone call on my part but then called by Brandon the next week after I had accepted a property with a different agency. I understand that emails can pile up and get lost but after three months of working with them I would not recommend them if you are in any type of time strain.

name: Tfoles4Life
text: We have had a fantastic experience with R & R rentals. We had bad experiences with several other companies in looking for a house initially, but Kurt with R & R was very personable and easy to work with. We found a great place to live owned by R & R, and we've had great service ever since! When we first moved in there were several issues with the house, but within a couple short weeks R&R got them fixed. When we had a problem with some of the maintenance workers, Kurt went above and beyond to figure everything out for us. It is rare to be truly taken care of and looked out for as renting college students, but R&R has done a fantastic job!

name: Katelyn Johnson
text: Not much managing going on here. More interested in collecting a paycheck than ensuring and managing quality properties.

name: Glenn Lamb
text: Hayley Management is great! They really work hard on finding the right spot for you. Plus the lady up front is smoking hot!!! Makes you look forward to coming in every month to pay your rent!

name: Angela Tran
text: Stay away!! They give you a dirty unit to start with and when you live in the unit for two years you clean and fix everything that they didn’t. And once you move out they want to charge you for every little thing just to keep your security deposit! Money hungry. They don’t care for anyone. They have a bunch of college kids working for them and no one even seems to care. Just stay away from this place!

name: Sierra McNeel
text:
First of all, if I could leave Hayley Management 0 stars, I would. I lived under Hayley Management for 2 years. I enjoyed the property for the most part, but the office is very unorganized. Maintenance was also disrespectful to our belongings when they would come maintain the grass on the property. Grass was not cut as often as it should have been, multiple times it was knee high. They’d consistently leave the gate open and throw our yard furniture near the house. The bushes in front of the house were probably trimmed twice the entire time that I lived there. If you cannot maintain all of your properties, maybe you should charge less for rent and not offer this service.

Multiple times they called me saying I had not paid my rent when I had and even had a receipt to prove so. I was a very loyal resident who always paid my rent on time. The lease ended on the 20th of July and they would not offer us a pro-rate for the month. Although we had to pay the entire month’s rent, we were required to keep water and power on 7 business days after moving out, and if we turned it off, then we were charged a $95 reconnecting fee. Aside from all of that, Their move out checklist is insane. They are trying to have the tenants clean the entire property so that they do not have to pay a cleaning service to do it. Tomorrow is 60 days since we moved out and our lease stated that after move out if applicable we would receive our security deposit and could request a list of damages.

Back to being unorganized, no one in the office is able to provide me that list or amount that I am receiving back. I asked to speak to a manager and I spoke to Kurt who told me that this was a ridiculous question to ask. What's ridiculous is speaking to you clients like this. Is it really a ridiculous question to inquire about my money? Anyone who is leasing here or planning to lease here, be wary, because they make everything seem really nice in the beginning but really screw you over in the end.

name: Crispy Cloak
text:
I have rented from 3 other companies in the Auburn area. This is hands down the best realty company I have been with.

We had a flood here on Christmas Eve. When the realty manager Kurt comes out here himself on Christmas Eve with boots and shovels to dig trenches and rip out carpet and help us take care of the problem, you know you're in good hands.

I don't think I need to say anymore, but I will.

They are super easy to rent from, maintenance will come same day if you report a problem. Rent is a fair price and the office is always friendly. Coming from Alice Henderson realty before, this is paradise.

name: Ellis Kennedy
text: I got my full security deposit back. Great people and management. Definitely will rent from them again.

name: Valerie Tisdale
text: it's been 72 days since I've moved out and haven't gotten any information on my deposit refund. I didn't get any sort of checklist upon moving out. It seems like it's managed by undergrad students. Look at Northcutt reality instead.

name: Harry Fisher
text: Loved renting from Hayley management. Great people and always were quick to come fix something if it broke. Highly recommend renting from them.

name: Austin Phillips
text: My back door knob jammed after hours and I called and they were here within minutes. Changed the knob like a NASCAR Pit crew. Much appreciated.

name: Katy McCollister
text: I needed a place fast and Hayley Management helped me get a place to rent that day. They showed me the unit, ran there background check, and we signed a lease. It made finding a place to stay a breeze.

name: Melissa Monroe
text: Most of the good reviews are from friends of the Hayley family, family members themselves, and employees. They're the ones that treat the tenants poorly. Maintenance never fixed my leak, mold was present in unit and after requesting it to be taken care of and speaking with the ladies in the office along with Kurt they just said sorry. When I first moved in the floors were filthy, walls were missing paint,  window pane and blinds were already torn, light bulbs were not working, air filters were dirty, toilets constantly ran etc. Did I mention the unit and other units are invested with spiders. Even after telling them I had a baby present in the home nothing changed. I was never late on rent and kept my unit clean. When I moved out they were frustrated because i told them I was not resigning my lease due to their lack of care for their tenants.

name: LaDonna Moore
text: Hayley Managment is awful, my son’s lease has not even officially started and I can tell you I would NEVER recommend this company regardless if you are leasing or a property owner. My son signed a lease to move into an apartment where two other young men were renewing their lease for the upcoming year.  Not a sub-lease a NEW LEASE. The guy that moved out left the bedroom and bathroom disgustingly dirty, blinds broken, holes in bathroom wall.  Spoke with HM face to face with pictures in hand and they refused to do anything about it. Told me it was my problem and office manager said  “ if I were you I would not have signed a lease for an apartment I did not view first” . My son did view the apartment back in February when he signed it is now July.  I am sure HM will keep this boys deposit but they are refusing to use any of those funds to fix the damage and mess he left behind.

name: Anthony Greenlee
text: Really loved my apartment in Opelika. It was really spacious and in a great part of town. I am gonna miss that place.

name: Joshua Hollingsworth
text: HMC is fully focused on  providing the customer with top- notch customer service. This alone puts them way ahead of the competition. HMC also, keeps their tenants happy by quickly correcting maintenance issues and offering reasonable rates. Easy 5 stars.

text: Hayley Management Co. has by far the best service in the Auburn/Opelika area. Kurt runs an outstanding management team who's focus is clearly on the tenant experience. They are more than willing to work with you and place an emphasis on availability and ease of communication. After 5 years of renting through several other large management companies in Auburn,  I can say with full conviction that HMC succeeds where so many other companies fail: with a customer service focus, reasonable rates/requests, timely maintenance, and up-to-date/well-kept units.

You pay up your rent then they’ll decide they don’t wanna renew lease. Lol oh well.

name: Joseph Vinson
text: Hello all, I'm a recent customer of Haley Management Company (HMC) after the homeowner I currently rent from began to use their services. I first want to state HMC was very point blank and aggressive and I find them to be unreasonably rude, making use threats and unnecessary means of manipulation to obtain rent EVEN THOUGH I WAS READY AND WILLING TO MAKE A PAMENT. After a recent Identity theft and a severe life threatening illness that left me homebound for several months I was very hesitant to send large amount of money to a company that I had never heard of. All this happened over text message too at that, though they Implied that I(who have had a great rental history prior to my current very difficult landlord) "Had just been ignoring them and they had been trying to make contact". All their problems were my fault. They show absolutely no desire and put forward effort to make my rent payment easy to make, just threats. even after the check I wrote them was RETURNED TO ME DUE TO SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY. Excuse my language but i didn't even know where the goddam office was. This is an inexpensive company that at the moment appears to care nothing at all about about the well being of their tenants. This is just a personal note, but I can give the impression of that of a low income person in trouble (when in reality that was not the case) and I get the impression that this company has been using the fear and threat of security as a means manipulate their "less desirable" clientele regularly for some time now. they seem very practiced. My advice, don't do business with people who use fear as a business model. I will be living my very well enjoyed home to work with a company that values my business and perhaps more importantly, value me as a human worthy of respect. Spend your time, happiness, and money with better people. You (or your tenants) will thank you.

name: Mengyuan Qiu
text:
Hayley Management Company is by far the best management and real estate company in the Auburn/Opelika area.

Realty Service: Kurt Hayley is one of  the most knowledgeable and experienced realtors  in the area.  He is honest and to the point and will tell you exactly what the condition of the property is and how much you should pay for it.  His comps are current and accurate. You can't go wrong to pick Kurt and his team if you are a potential home owner.  Unlike other realtors in the area, Kurt is also a real estate investor.  For all the potential real estate investors out there, Kurt is the agent you want.  He is a great lead and he finds properties that are not on the MLS.  He has a team of contractors that can quickly and accurately estimate repair costs so you can generate your cost estimates.  Most importantly, if he cannot find a property that fits your criterion, he will tell you so instead of trying to sell you one that wouldn't be in your interest.

Management Company: Hayley Management Company will always answer your phone call and address the concerns you have on your properties.  The team always collect rent on time and send the check on time.  Kurt will always look for the best price for repairs to save you the owner money while keeping the customer satisfied.  I have heard nothing but good things from my renters.

name: Cait Chri
text: Love the Clubhouse. There are even showers in the men and women's locker rooms near the gym. Gym is better than the planet fitness!! Pool is fun! This place is perfect for students to live with friends.

resp.text: We love our new gym, too! Thank you so much!

name: tammy stanfield
text:
Read this before signing a lease. My daughter lived at this apartment complex for two years. When we got the house assignment before my daughter moved in they had completely changed the type house that my daughter had agreed to rent. Then they said directed me to the place in the least small print where it says they can switch you to any unit they please. There was nothing we could do about it. While we were in the unit the hot water heater was replaced going to a gas hot water heater and because the gas was in my name they charged the hot water heater to my account. It was charged to my gas account and debited out of my checking account, $1800 without my permission. I had to wait three months to be reimbursed and I also had to wait on a coupon from the gas company to be reimbursed. We could not wait to get out of there.

——I did receive a phone call a few days after posting my review from the corporate office about my negative review. I want to clarify that Spire didn’t charge my account without the On-site management people at Creekside letting the gas company into the home. I nor my daughter was there to let them in and the only people that authorized the charge and transaction was Creekside and Creekside refused to call Spire and correct the problem by billing them or the owner of the condo. Also, the small print indicating they could and did switch the unit that we wanted is a fact and an issue that future tenants need to understand. It makes you realize that they could and did show a nice unit in the style, location, and price and switch you to whatever they want.  They placed our daughter in a unit that was at the entrance to the community, high traffic, high noise, and her Eno was stolen off the tiny porch the first week.

resp.text: Hi Mrs. Stanfield! Thank you for taking our call this afternoon to discuss Spire charging your account for the water heater. We are glad they were able to sort everything out, but apologize for the lengthiness of the process.

name: Emma Truitt
text: I love living in creekside!! with all the beautiful amenities, trees, and sidewalks perfect for walking, it’s been the best place to live as a college student!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Emma! We have enjoyed having you as a resident.

resp.text: We love that you enjoy our community! Let us know if we can ever do anything for you!
