text: Don’t waste your time. Office is EXTREMELY unprofessional. More worried about squeezing all your money from you instead of accommodating residents. Do yourself a favor and tour almost any other complex in Auburn.

resp.text: Thank you for stopping by the office today and going over Creekside's Rules and Regulations. Should you need anything else, please do not hesitate to ask!

name: Paige Maxwell
text: Very poor quality for what you pay. My carpet tack strip was showing in multiple places when I moved in and was never fixed. There were also cracks in our front door that you could see outside through. The wifi went out almost every day. I turned my keys in when I moved out but they claim they don't have record of that and charged me $100. :) Tons of miscommunication and conflicting answers from different people in the office when trying to get information on things like re-signing, gas/utilities, etc. Pick somewhere else to live

resp.text: Hi Paige! It looks like we were able to work out your key issue. Please let us know if we can help with anything else.

text: Creekside is an outstanding neighborhood for college studies to live in. I have experienced nothing but safety and companionship while living in creekside. As an almost graduating senior in May of 2021, I will miss living in creekside. All the employees that work at creekside are efficient, kind, and helpful. I recommend creekside to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you Sheldon! We're so happy you've had a great experience here! We will miss you when you graduate and wish you the best of luck! As always, War Eagle!!

text: This is my second year living at Creekside and I love it. The distance is far enough from campus, that you feel like you are away from school and come home to a nice area. The staff is great! I recommend checking it out!!

name: Bolton Brothers
text: I have lived in Creekside for all of my years at Auburn which would be 4. It has been an amazing experience. Beautiful landscaping, friendly neighbors, and a lot of good memories. The management has also taken great care of us. Lost my car keys and they delivered them to my house. Overall great quality.

resp.text: Thanks guys! We love your moving company! We are so happy you had such a great college experience here at Creekside!

name: Becca Hopkins
text: BEST most incredible staff out there. I have had the most amazing time living here. It blows my mind that people write about how the staff is unprofessional and rude. I promise those reviews are people who broke the rules in the neighborhood and were held accountable for their actions. I want to say just how beautiful the houses all are. There is a huge grass area for your pups to play! But most importantly, no matter what issues arose, regarding the neighborhood, my house, other residents, you name it, Kristen went so far ABOVE and beyond to be the most genuinely caring person. She is the sweetest manager you will ever meet. She didn't have to do 99% of what she did for me while I lived there and I can never say thank you enough for the staff of Creekside. Truly a luxury living environment. I spent a couple years living here and never regret it for a minute!! If you are looking for a place to live Fall or Spring you have to look at Creekside or you'll miss out BIG time! Also shout out to Charlie in the front office for helping Kristen pack my WHOLE house and move it to my new unit for me while I was abroad. How many managers and their employees in the office will do that for? that is just a testament to how much the staff cares about everyone (pups included).

resp.text: Becca! This is such a sweet post! We really appreciate all the love you have for Creekside and the staff! We loved having you as our resident for the past several years!

name: Kristin Burton
text: I have lived in Creekside for 3 years in as a student. This property has the absolute worst management I have ever seen. Clearly they don't train their staff to know anything. Any time my roommate and I had maintenance issues in our apartment, we had to call several times before someone would come out and fix the problem. Our AC in our unit breaks all the time. During graduation weekend it wasn't working and we were going to have several people in our unit celebrating with us. On Saturday, we called and were told maintenance doesn't work on Saturday's and then were told we could call someone not affiliated with Creekside. When we asked for a recommendation the girl said, I don't know I'm from Florida. Clearly, they don't care at all. The gate is never working and part of the money we pay to live here includes it being a "secure" neighborhood. They don't take care of the property. Don't live here even though it seems nice, I wish I had lived in Aspen Heights.

resp.text: Kristin we would like to find out more about your situation please call our office and thank you for the feedback.

name: Em1827
text:
Unprofessional staff and management.

When I first moved in there was a tanning bed as a part of the amenities which was appealing at the time, it was later removed because it “was too much to maintain” or in other words the management or employees did not want to maintain it and a study room was put in its place. There is already a large study room downstairs. The monthly HOA fees have stayed the same.

On multiple occasions I have to call days later after I have already put in a maintenance order to see when maintenance will be coming, lack of communication to residents.

resp.text: We would love to hear more about your experience.

name: Genney Adair
text: Don’t even bother going for a tour. We were so excited because we had been recommended and saw positive reviews. Went for a tour and the apartment was DISGUSTING. All bedrooms were locked and tenants wouldn’t let us in. There was paint all over light fixture and dirt all over the floors. Absolutely ridiculous. Even if you tour a clean one you don’t know that you’ll end up with that one

resp.text: Genney, thank you for the review, we apologize for the experience you had with us. We do not have a model home on site so we must rely on our residents to show our homes. We would love for you to give us another chance, call us today.

text: I lived at different apartments prior to Creekside and none have been as awesome! I love the amenities, and especially the pool. The office people are great! They are so hopeful and nice! They always make me feel welcome and do more than I ask.

resp.text: Creekside's pool is AMAZING! Voted #1 best pool in Auburn! We are so glad you love our staff! Thanks for the kind review!

text: If you have plans to live in creekside the first step you should take is deciding whether the amenities and homes (which are honestly very nice) are worth the unprofessionalism and hassle that you will deal with from the office staff. My roommates and I went 7 weeks without a washer or dryer after ours broke. We have had other issues that either went unresolved, or were handled poorly. There are some great things about creekside, but don't expect to be treated respectfully if you ever have to interact with anyone that works in the office.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback we would love to hear more about this issue. Please give us a call 334-321-2356

The homes they offer are pretty amazing with good and huge rooms..
the wifi services and management is awesome..
the best thing you would like about in here is the neighbourhood and the swimming pool.. had an amazing experience.

text: the apartments themselves and the landscape is very nice, staff doesn't ever seem to know what they are doing, never answer the phone, maintenance never does anything either

resp.text: Hey Sara thank you for the review, we would love to hear more about how our maintenance team can improve. Please give us a call or email us with your feedback!

name: Lizz Campbell
text: Literal children could run a better office. the people that work in the office are rude and incompetent. They lose checks every month and don't plan anything (they just walk in our house for tours on a regular basis). Also the gate never gets locked and even when it does everyone knows the password (even the taxi/uber/lyft drivers) or people run over it. they run out of parking all the time and tow residents like clockwork. They have zero regard for anyone other than themselves in the office.

resp.text:
Hi Lizz, thank you for the review. We are so sorry to hear this, management would love to speak with you about our staff and gate system . Please give us a call and we would be happy to speak with you.
Sincerely,
Creekside Management

name: Miah Henderson
text: One of the Worst places in auburn. We had trouble with appliances not being repaired for two months and once they were they left scratches on the walls from moving the dryer down the stairs, tracked mud all through out the house, and left the Front door unlocked. They also closed the gates at night at the beginning of the year without giving all of the residents access cards. Would not recommend to anyone.

resp.text: Miah we hate to hear this experience, the washer and dryer did get replaced for you all. Also when your roommates informed the office of the mud and scratches left on the wall the manger went over to the home to review the damage and offered to vacuum your stairs and took photos of what happened from the appliance company.

resp.text: Thanks Joel! We love Catherine too! Thanks for the 5 stars!

name: J Pizzle
text: Don't listen to all these fools complaining about petty issues they've had while living in Creekside. As far as a college living experience goes, I challenge you to find a better place. Good community of higher grade college students, units are roomy and nice, neighborhood is very scenic compared to anywhere else I've been, and amenities are nice even if they could be better kept at times. Staff is lenient on things that don't really matter and take care of things that are priority (exactly what I was looking for.) Overall I've really enjoyed my four years of Creekside and would be hard pressed to find another place for a similar price per quality.

text: Creekside is filled with nothing but immature college students (this review is COMING from a pre-med college student and I'm not revealing my name because I regretfully still live here). People are loud, and they throw their trash everywhere, when there is even a trash bin OUTSIDE your door!! The only thing good about this place is Kristen at the front desk. She is great and makes sure you are accommodated for. HOWEVER, in their lease, they claim this place is a "gated community." One time out of 50 the gate is closed, but some immature "resident" or "guest" will run INTO the gate, causing it to fall off. No joke.  This place could get in big trouble for not following through with their leasing terms. This place is way too expensive unless you are living with 10 roommates, but the rent is probably still around 300-400 if that. If you are a serious college student, this place is NOT for you.

name: Steve Klein
text:
I lived here for three years and figured I'd let people know my thoughts. Some of it is good, some of it is bad, some of it could go either way depending on what you want out of a place to live, and some of it is just unavoidable as it is targeted to college students.

Some aspects of the property are really nice. The clubhouse is pretty nice (though the weight room is a joke; I don't know why any Auburn student would use it instead of the top notch campus facility). The common areas are generally well-maintained. I say generally because while the landscaping is kept up, the gates are not. I've been trying to get my name added to the call box for three years and it still hasn't happened, yet I know residents that moved out years ago still in the list.  The gates are frequently broken and they keep nobody out. If someone wants to get in, they will get in. They will simply wait for someone to open the gate and go in after them. If you are going to be a "gated community" then be a gated community. In my opinion, Creekside should just get rid of the gates because they really don't accomplish anything except annoy the residents.

Creekside does not tow. This could be good or bad depending on your point of view. I never had an issue with parking. On busy football weekends, perhaps I'd be 10-12 spots away from my front door but that was about the extent of it. However, other parts of the complex may not have quite as abundant parking so that could be an issue. I'm really not sure. It was nice to not have to deal with visitor passes, etc. but it would be very frustrating if there wasn't enough parking near your home.

Creekside does not enforce many of its own rules. The one that really annoys me is the pool. It is supposed to be limited to residents and residents are allowed two guests I believe. What it ends up being is tons of people who might know one person in Creekside... or in some cases just show up without knowing anyone. I pay good money to live in a place like this and don't feel like my money should be going to clean up after non-residents who break chairs, leave beer cans and bottles strewn about, etc. Some would say I'm a party pooper... but I like to think of it as being irritated by trespassing. People (many times non-residents) bring beer bottles and dogs to the pool routinely... both are supposed to be fineable offenses... but I've never seen one handed out.

Maintenance is a mixed bag, but mainly poor. To get a broken door repaired, it took about a dozen phone calls over a two month period. Simply absurd. I also reported a broken toilet two different times. Once, it was repaired promptly. The other time... I was told they'd be out there "in the next couple of days" and nobody ever came. After about a week, I fixed the toilet myself. Also, I should point out that *OWNERS* are occasionally treated as second-class citizens by the on-site management. Essentially, the homeowner's dues should get me the same rights as the renter's... but when I file a maintenance issue that is supposed to be covered by the HOA dues, they handle all renters first... I guess to make sure they get people to resign because they know the homeowner is unlikely to sell because of a small issue like this. Or, in the vast majority of cases, it isn't the actual homeowner who lives in the house; It is often the parent of one of the residents who probably never even hears about the issue.

The last issue I have is with the TV/Internet Service. It has been nothing short of awful the entire time I've lived here. In 2015, I don't think people can really appreciate just how bad I have had it and what a negative it is. The internet is slow, often less than 1 megabit/second so forget about streaming Netflix during peak hours; You'll be lucky if you can just get a YouTube video to play in 240p, nevermind HD.

All in all, it is a decent place to live. You could definitely do a lot worse. I think I'd rather pay for a location closer to campus rather than the resort style amenities, but that is personal preference.

resp.text: Thank you for the valuable information

name: Angie Chatham Denton
text: Real nice, gated community.!

name: Kelly Tsaltas
text:
Creekside of Auburn claims to have the best pool and amenities in Auburn and to be “student living redefined.” Their definition of student living, however, did not live up to its advertisement.

Firstly, what they boast as the best pool in Auburn is ever crawling with non-residents and is usually dirty. Oftentimes people who come to the pool don’t even know anyone in the complex (I have no idea how they get in). Adding to their being unwelcome is the fact that they, along with actual residents, throw empty beer cans and cigarettes into the pool, making it disgusting and completely unable to be used.

Creekside also advertises itself as a gated community. Unlike other gated complexes, however, Creekside uses a barcode scan system, which is usually broken. Thus the gates are open 24 hours a day, including weekends. If the gates are closed and the scanner is broken, there is no code to open the gates, which led to three broken gates because of cars driving through them in the year that I lived there. Why they chose a system with no backup way to get in is beyond me.

Creekside is a magnet for irresponsible students who love to party loudly. I did not understand how there could be such a high concentration of people with such habits, but then I discovered that much of Creekside’s advertising involves half of drink specials for residents and other alcoholic incitements. There were obnoxiously loud parties that could be heard two rows of houses over and up the street nearly every weekend and even on weekdays. These parties were rampant with underage drinking and lasted until four a.m. or later. The courtesy officer never picks up his phone, so the police usually come. This is an inconvenience and an annoyance for the officers, especially since Creekside hired someone who is supposedly responsible for taking care of such noise disturbances.

The Internet is abysmal, and it is nearly impossible to get someone to come out and fix it. Our Internet didn’t work for three months, and the management refused to give us a refund on the portion of our rent that went toward cable and Internet.  They also refused to let us get our own router.

Management threatens to fine its residents constantly, but never follows up; therefore, what looks like a beautiful complex from outside the gates is full of porches that are littered with beer cans, cigarettes, trash, and beer pong tables. Any complaints about the state of the porches will go unnoticed.

All in all, Creekside is a place for rich kids whose parents don’t care if they drink excessively underage and blow off classes in the morning due to a midweek party. Were I a parent, no matter how much money I had, I would avoid investing in a unit in Creekside like the plague.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback on our college student community.

Other than that the Units are in decent condition though i believe we are all overpaying by about 50-75 dollars per month and the front gate is NEVER fixed. name: Rsimmons Sangria
text:
We were torn between renting a house and an apartment, but we eventually settled on Park 35. Wow, was that a mistake, especially this year. To call this place contractor grade cheap is a huge understatement. From the carpet in the bedroom with the nail strip you can feel to paper thin walls, everything is meant to give the illusion of quality and expense. It's just that - an illusion. I mostly think of my neighbors as roommates, because you can hear every single thing through what passes for walls.

The amenities seemed nice during the tour, but there's no way we're using any of those right now. A dog was something we considered, but after listening to the one down the hall from us that barks all evening, I don't know if we ever will now. There's so much dog hair in the hallway, it's like having tumbleweeds. The new floors are a big improvement over the gross carpet that lined the hallways, but they're already stained. The neighbors here are so inconsiderate.

Overall, it's fine if you want an overpriced, generic box that costs as much as a renovated three bedroom house in the city. The one thing we did right was go for a pool view. The lights around the pool area are extremely bright, but they turn off eventually. The golf course view was tempting, but the noise from Clairmont Avenue would be so annoying I think. We've considered breaking our lease early even with the exorbitant cost (2 months rent). Maybe management would be flexible, but I really doubt it.

I will say having a grocery store next door is very convenient and parking is never an issue. Maybe it'd be fine living here if you get lucky with the neighbors and can score a decent deal on the rent. We will be leaving at the end of our lease or maybe even earlier.

resp.text:
Hi Rsimmons Sangria,

I have not been able to find your name in our system but would love the opportunity to discuss any issues you are having. While I can't do much on the construction of the building, I can certainly look further into any tack strip issue you have as well as reach out to your neighbors regarding noise if needed. We are here to help and happy to do so. If you would like to discuss any of your review further, please let me know.

name: LaMonica Roland
text:
Upon  returning to Birmingham, my husband and I stopped at this beautiful location and decided to make it home almost immediately after touring and meeting Ms. Teria. The location is prime, most of the staff were wonderful and the scenery was just top notch. We made this home for roughly a year but just could not continue to justify such the expensive price tag that came with the seemingly small space - we bought a house and are much happier due to the issues that began to spiral once we began moving out.

For months we tried to get someone to our apartment to come and spray for pests that were coming from the apartments of people who loved to leave their trash by their front doors on none trash days - we even witnessed people putting their take out containers on the floors in the hallways, making the entire hallway smell like dead animals - it was bad. The floors of the apartments are made out of a very cheap material so its very easy to scratch and scuff, especially if you have dogs like we did. The walls were so thin you could literally hear the conversations of the tenant in the next apartment. There were times we had neighbors that would play their music at 3 in the morning and since the walls were so thin, we sadly heard it all and had to endure it. The trash valet service was a joke - never met such picky trash people in my life. The service, luckily, was switched just a few days before we moved out - praying that the current tenants are getting better service for the money they pay every month.

Upon moving out, we were not given an exit survey like most apartments do to check off on any damages within the apartment. Luckily we took pictures of every inch of the apartment before leaving. We were sent a bill of almost $1500 in damages to the apartment (floors, fridge, anything not tied down) - all were just wear and tear on the walls from pictures and the carpet which was not damaged at all. We were told we needed to pay to replace everything which was outrageous. There was no way possible two young professional adults ruined an apartment in the ways they claimed. We tried to heavily communicate with management but responses were far and few between. It took us weeks to even reach someone so they could reply to our inquiries about the damages. It took so long to reach someone that the bill was sent to collections after we explicitly tried to handle the misunderstanding with no help from management. We were luckily able to get this ordeal handled promptly and efficiently with the collections company which were far more easier to deal with than Park 35.

If you love living in a high dollar box I would definitely recommend Park 35. Just be prepared to stay there forever if you want to be treated as a valued tenant - the dynamic of the staff completely changes once you inform them that you will not be renewing.

Pros:
Location - you are near night life and numerous eateries
Grounds of the complex were 'usually' kept clean
Ms. Teria, before she left
Dog park and grooming station

Cons:
Pests
Paper thin walls
Pet owners never picking up behind pets
Cheaply made apartments
Talladega Speedway Parking Deck
Inconsiderate neighbors

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review.  We would love to hear more about your experience, so that we can use your feedback to deliver an even better experience next time.  Please contact the leasing office with any further comments or suggestions you wish to share.  Again, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.

name: Haileigh Crowley
text: My first apartment in Alabama after moving here from California, The View Apartments will always hold a special place in my heart. This review is coming from a stay at home mom with no vehicle, so I truly lived here nearly 24/7. The property is kept clean and inviting. While it is nearly impossible to leave the property without a vehicle—as it is located at the top of a very steep hill—I absolutely loved my daily walk up and down the parking lot. The apartments are surrounded by trees—hence the fitting name, “The View Apartments”; you can truly enjoy a beautiful view—and Dixie and Jennifer, along with their maintenance team (all with whom are also very pleasant to interact), are always outside planting new flowers, trees, and ferns. They are extremely responsive to concerns, so my family and I always felt well taken care of. Lastly, at The View, you are surrounded by wonderful neighbors around whom you always feel safe. If it hadn’t been for my husband’s work transfer to another city, we would still be living here. Thank you, The View Apartments!

text: Best apartment complex I could ever wish for! The apartments are neat, modern, well taken care of, and highly functional. The complex sits on a ridge in a wooded area, so despite being in this city you can look out your window and see nothing but trees. I enjoy seeing wildlife when I walk outside: squirrels, deer and the occasional pack of armadillos. The landowners are extremely helpful, friendly, and very accommodating. There has never been an instance where they were not available or willing to help in any way. If you are moving to Alabaster, or anywhere in the surrounding area for that matter, this is the place to be!!

name: The View Apartments, Alabaster, AL 35007
text:
.ALABASTER'S BEST APARTMENTS!

As one who moves frequently for work, I've rented at a number of apartment complexes, and I've found The View Apartments to be the best rental deal I've ever experienced. Its location, atop the ridge behind Shelby Baptist Hospital, places it close to shopping, healthcare, and entertainment, but away from traffic and most noise. And to discover why it's named as it is, just wait for the winter view from atop the ridge. It's lovely!

By far, though, its most sellable feature is the quality of management. It is managed by its owners, and not by an employee of a distant corporation, as I've often found in other places. This means that detailed attention is given to the condition of the buildings and grounds on a constant basis, repairs and unexpected emergencies are handled with speed and competence, and the owners are on site almost daily.  The Owner’s long experience with building construction and landscaping shows in the good repair of the buildings and the beauty of the grounds, contributing immensely to the livability and quality of life of the tenants. And the high integrity and professionalism with which she conducts business is deeply appreciated by those of us who've had less than stellar experiences with some other rentals.

In summary, not only will one get living space kept in good repair and in well-tended, lovely surroundings at The View, but one will get extremely ethical, competent and responsive management. As one who's rented several times before, believe me when I say that that's worth more than gold.

resp.text: Thank you for this great five-star review of The View Apartments! We're glad you've enjoyed such a pleasant experience at our community. resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community. The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development. We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is one of the tasks that we are hired to do.  It is the Buyers responsibility to obtain a copy of the covenants for a neighborhood and to understand them before purchasing.  The Realtor typically provides these to the Buyer.  Once we are made aware of the purchase and the new owners contact information, we send a welcome packet in the mail that includes the covenants.  We also provide an Owner Portal that has all of the Association documents for owner to access.  Spaces is not "pocketing money from everyone".  Spaces is paid a set Management Fee by the Association to handle all of the management and administrative tasks for the Association to operate.  This includes paying all Association bills, working with and overseeing vendors, answering Owner, Realtor, lender, and closing attorney questions, creating financials statements, reconciling the bank accounts, administering quarterly and annual meetings, etc.  The annual budget is set by the Board of Directors and is then presented to all Owners to vote to ratify at the Annual Members Meeting.  Spaces then operates the Association within that budget for the year.  Spaces provides regular financial statements to the Board, and approved financial statements are available to all Owners.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants and a managed community, but most people do. For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

resp.text: We have a great team of managers at our corporate office and on-site at our communities that have been team members for many years and provide excellent service.  The goal of everyone at Spaces is to provide a great customer experience, and beautiful communities for all of our residents to enjoy.  We constantly work to improve and have the right people in the right positions to deliver on this goal.

resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community.  The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development.  We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is what we are hired to do.  We cannot speak to how the Association was operated previously, but a primary reason we are hired is to provide covenant enforcement for Associations.  If someone is considering purchasing a home in an Association we manage, they can expect an Association that operates within the budget set by the Board of Directors and ratified by the Members.  They can also expect the restrictive covenants to be enforced in a fair and compassionate way.  We always send a friendly letter for each first time violation to make the owner aware of the covenant violation and provide a timeframe to correct the violation.  This friendly letter results in 95 percent of the violations being corrected.  In the cases where the violation is not corrected, we do have a set policy that is equally enforced to bring the property into compliance.  The majority of violation letters we send are a result of a neighbor reporting the violation to us for enforcement.  By having a set system, it allows neighbors to be neighbors without having to get into demanding compliance with restrictive covenants.  We facilitate that process for the Board and neighbors.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants, but most people do.  For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

If you do not have a copy of the HOA budget I will be glad to provide you one as well.

name: Michella Carter
text: I have never written a bad complaint about anyone in my life.But this was a lesson.Please be aware that these condos are individually owned by different people and managed by spaces management.If something goes wrong ,you report to a third party that has to get in touch with the owner before the issue is handled.Which determines how fast your situation is handled and the proper up keep of the apartment determines your owner financial stability.They will do everything in their power to not give you your deposit back.I have never in life had a deposit deferred for any reason.Its not enough money to sue but it’s my hard working money.Just be careful.

resp.text: Hi Michella, Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. Spaces Management is a third party manager for the individually owned units at Midtown. Our goal is to provide the upmost customer service and respond in a timely manner to all requests. All units are inspected and photographed prior to move in to document the condition of the unit before occupancy. A second inspection is conducted during the residents tenancy to document the condition of the unit in preparation for the upcoming move out. The final and third inspection/walk through takes place to document the condition of the unit once the resident has vacated the unit. The security deposit is refunded less any damages, financial or physical property damages, to the forwarding address on file within 60-days of the lease end date. If you would like to speak about this further, please feel free to contact me at 205-342-3220. Best, Midtown Village Condominium Manager

name: Krystina Adams
text: If I could give them a 0 I would. They manage our neighborhood HOA and we literally pay almost $200 A YEAR for nothing. We FINALLY get a playground and it is a joke. No benches to sit on no trees around it. No pool. The front entrance road has been crappy and half finished for at least a year now probably longer. All they do is ride around and nit pick to fine you  then send you pictures of the minute things they consider not attractive. Hello... the unfinished road is unattractive. I cannot wait to move out of this neighborhood and get away from these”Nazi’s”.

resp.text: Krystina, Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns.  The Board is diligent in keeping dues as low as possible while maintaining the common areas and adding improvements to the neighborhood as funds allow. Most recently the improvements included additional lighting and security cameras. The Board has also addressed the condition of the roads with the City and they have promised they will be repaired very soon.  This has been an ongoing issue with the original developer and the City of Northport and the Board has been communicating with them continuously regarding the conditions.    Spaces works with the Board to make sure that the neighborhood is the best that it can be.  Should you ever receive communication from us that you are unsure about, please do not hesitate to reach out to us so that we can help address the situation.

name: Melissa Spencer
text: Unethical company. We lived at Traditions Condominiums from February 2016 to February 2017. We were told in December 2016 that we have to sign a lease for fall 2017-2018. If we did not sign it by the end of December, they would start showing the apartment in January. Not sure what we wanted to do, we signed the lease. The apartment was small, no light, smelled horrible from old carpet as well as being a family with 2 teenagers, we were cramped and decided to look for a house to rent until we were ready to build. We found someone to take over the current lease as well as the next years lease. They were not subleasing, rather they were signing a new lease. Spaces Management charged us a fee for breaking the lease as well as a fee for each month. We tried finding this in the contract that we signed and did not find anything. When we called them about it, they told us that we had to submit it all in writing in email format. Even though we had an attorney, they threatened us to pay the fees or they would reassign the tenants that we found to a different apartment and not rent our apartment out. We would be financially responsible each month until our contract ended on their term. Just be careful who you rent with.

name: Arrow Xia
text:
One star for the never answered phone call and email. Whenever I was in town or moved out and tried to call them, they never pick up the phone!!! I moved out of town in July then received a bill in September, with a service that I never used. I tried to call several times, never get answered. I also emailed, no answer as well. They are doing a fair job at maintenance.
Another thing that happened when I moved out was all the UHauls were gone during that week, so I asked the main office if I could have a grace period for one day. The premise for me to ask this was my roommate is still leasing the apartment, and she has not found the new roommate yet. I assumed, if she agrees, then I should be good. I went to talk to the main office, the front desk told me to talk to the office at the Midtown apartment. I went there, the lady rejected my proposal and said they will have vendors checking my room right on the day I moved out and through my stuff out even if I have my roommate's permission to place them in the living room. So, I ran crazy for that week looking for moving trucks and finally moved out on time (actually two days in advance). I returned the keys and everything to the main office and told my story. Another lady, seems like the manager or some management-level person told me a totally different answer. She said if my roommate is keeping renting the apartment and agree to let me put my stuff in there, I could have the grace period!!! This is nuts! I was so upset for that day but decided to not give a bad review on Google review. This time, I really cannot. It is not about money, it is their attitude.

Updated

Around an hour than I left the one star review, they responded and someone finally answered the call. The answer I got for the charge is because of the wreath we had on the door🙄️so I told them that is not trash, that is what we used to place outside as decoration. Since my roommate is still living in there, it should not count as something I left not as trash. The new manager of the office said she had no other answer for my question other than I have to pay the “reasonable” charge. Oh, the most incredible thing for this management company is they will change the detail of the lease without notifying. Since I am moving out of the town and my roommate will stay, she renewed the lease. When we started to lease the apartment, we get told that we are only leasing our own room (we were paired up by the management company), which means we do not have to lease the whole apartment if we cannot find a roommate. After two years of leasing, our contract have never changed. However, they changed it this year without any notification, and my roommate did not look through carefully so she rent the whole apartment. This is the reason why I thought I should be ok to leave my stuff in the apartment with my roommate’s permission. Based on my roommate’s feedback, their maintainance worked as well as the office does. It took them over a month to get the sink fixed.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not have a good move-out experience.  You can call our office at 205-750-2260 and we will be glad to assist you with any questions you have in regard to your security deposit statement.  The answer you received to move out by the end of your lease term was correct.  The unit has to be inspected and room made ready for the next resident.  It is not up to your past roommate to allow you to store your items in the common area that the new resident will also be using.  We understand that the move-out time is very hectic as a large number of residents move out at the same time each year.  We cannot allow residents to keep their items in a unit past the term of their lease as we have to have it ready for the new resident.

name: Scout Gage
text: Super helpful! The guy that help me put up my tv was super nice and extremely helpful! And he actually saved me over $100 by recommending something other than what I already had in terms of how to put up my tv. His suggestion worked even better than my original plan and saved me a lot of money. Highly recommend! Great service, super helpful, very nice.

name: Wayne Parker
text: Great management company. Everyone was very helpful and always professional. I was helped at every step of the process. I highly recommend.

name: Malaysia Ford
text: I am a future resident of The Nine at Tuscaloosa owned by Spaces Management. Spaces has done a great job with the leasing staff at this property, they are super friendly and extrememly professional/knowledgeable. I am so excited to be apart of this community.

name: Brenan Hester
text: Have been in a Neighborhood since 2014 and done everything according to the original HOA. Spaces takes over it in 2019 and now I have violations that have never been before! Also there are different HOA for different sections of this 1 neighborhood! Absolutely a joke as my 2 violations are a new , Christmas gift, Basketball goal and my garbage can beside my garage!! Seriously nearly every home in America has this and they are saying it’s devaluing a neighborhood! Would give them a 0 if possible and just to note their not BB accredited!

resp.text: Mr. Hester, As we have discussed, Spaces does not make the rules or create the covenants, we are hired to assist the Board or Developer in managing the neighborhood which includes collecting the dues, paying the bills and enforcing the covenants as they are recorded in the Probate office.    Although we are not BBB accredited we do have an A+ rating.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

name: Danielle Festino
text: Day 2 of no air conditioning. Put in a maintenance order yesterday. Then called 3 times today. Tomorrow will be day 3 of no sleep because of 80+ degree apartment.

resp.text: We are very sorry for We are checking into this with our vendor.  It was assigned to them shortly after you made the request.  A lot of vendors are backed up because of all of the apartment turns throughout town.  We are following up with the vendor this morning.  Again we apologize for the delay.

name: R Entsmingr
text:
Andy and Spaces Management take no responsibility for Two Maids and NOT the highest rated and reviewed Trainwreck.  The maids are awful and Andy's latest errand girl does nothing to help resolve my complaint.

Don't go near this company.  They falsely advertise and send you lazy maids that smoke more then clean. Andy Turner and Spaces Management, I'm calling you out.

If anybody has had a bad experience with two sad maids like I have post your complaints on spaces management.  Also call spaces management and don't hang up until you get hold of Andy.  ;)

resp.text: We apologize if you did not have a positive experience with Two Maids and a Mop, but it is a separate company from Spaces Management.  Spaces Management strives to provide excellent customer service.  We reached out to the Manager of Two Maids and a Mop, and they do not have a record of R Entsmingr as a customer.  The manager reinforced that they have a "pay for performance plan" and if a customer is not satisfied, they return to address any areas that are unsatisfactory to the customer at no additional charge.  After looking into this issue further, both Spaces and Two Maids are working with Google to address what appears to be fake accounts created under the names of R Entsminger and Laura Smith as neither person has ever been customers of Spaces or Two Maids.  If either R or Laura would like to meet with the owner of Spaces to discuss their issue, he is glad to meet with them.  To schedule a meeting simply email reception@spacesmanagement.com with a few dates and times and a meeting will be set to resolve any issues.

name: Nicholas Ellis
text: The properties are nice and well maintained, but management is rude and mostly unresponsive. The company uses predatory business practices to relentlessly gouge university students. These practices are unethical, and I cannot recommend anyone to do business here. Another thing to note: as I have scrolled through the reviews for Spaces Management here, I have noticed a few 5 star reviews from people that I know to be Spaces employees. So, they are artificially inflating their rating.

name: Get Hauled
text: The best property management company in the business. Highly recommended. A+

name: Carolyn Roberson
text:
I can't rate a zero but I would if I could. River point apartments are horrible. Bugs are everywhere and I don't mean a few, it is CRAWLING. We've begged for pest control to no avail.

When my son first moved in a downstairs unit the bathroom had worms coming up from the shower drain. And he went ALL winter with NO heat. They kept saying the heater was fine. So he moved upstairs and the new tenant downstairs left because of that every reason.

Upstairs the AC never worked. It was always hot and water leaked continually out of that unit. He kept a gallon pickle jar under it to catch the water and emptied it daily. Maintenance "fixed it" (haha) but it never worked.

The bathroom sink NEVER drained correctly and even backed up with fecal material. He constantly poured drain cleaner down it. And management NEVER did anything about it.

Roaches were crawling everywhere, in the fridge, from the ceiling where some wall was tearing away. Gnawing through food wrappers. It was disgusting. Colonies were behind the fire extinguisher. He left a month early because he was staying sick.

The owner showed the unit to a potential buyer and my son told him about the bugs and it embarrassed him in front of the potential buyer.

Now they are billing him for a BRAND NEW AC and NEW BATHROOM SINK. and want him to pay for the damage maintenance did changing out a ceiling fan.  $3000.00!!!!

Stay VERY FAR AWAY from Spaces Management and River Point Apts!!!

name: Meredith Simmons
text: Spaces management is great to work with! They care about each individual tenant, and want you to have the best experience while living in their properties!

name: Kristen Osborne
text: The people are fantastic and will go above and beyond to help you any way they can!

name: Eric Levitt
text: Let me tell you about my experience with these guys. My daughter is renting and overpaying for her unit at the UofA off campus. Her AC has had problems before but none like this. Keep in mind this is a brand new renovated apartment that we rented. When the AC unit again had a problem we were told, sorry it cant be fixed as the unit is out of warranty and we need Matt to okay the repair. Well at 830 at night there is nobody to sign off on the service with the temperature in the apt now at 82 boiling degrees. We had to move her and her dog into a hotel to beat the heat while nobody answers the after hours phone.

name: Carlie Chapman
text: Great company to work with! They made the transition to my new apartment so easy!

name: The RC1
text: I currently live at river pointe apartments, one of the properties spaces management manages. Let me tell you about my experience.  There was a leak in the wall of my bathroom last year right after i moved in.  I was displaced from my apartment for a little over a week while they completely ripped apart my entire bathroom to fix the leak and redo the bathroom.  I let them get started right away and found myself somewhere else to stay.  Well after they finished fixing the leak and redoing the bathroom they just left without cleaning up my apartment.  There was dust EVERYWHERE covering everything in my apartment with a layer of it.  I cleaned all of the furniture myself but the dust was embedded in the carpet and it took almost 2 MONTHS of me calling to finally get them to send carpet cleaners out to clean the carpets.  I'm a little concerned about the health effects of breathing that in for so long.  But the whole ordeal was awful and the worst part is they didn't even offer to take anything off of my rent for me being displaced for over a week and having to live in that dust for 2 months.  I would caution anyone moving into these apartments or any apartments that spaces management manages.

name: Land For Sale
text: Tried to buy a condo that was being managed by Spaces. We offered to let the tenants out of the lease as part of the sale but Spaces refused to terminate the contract. They keep 10% of the monthly rental fee which I offered to give them and they refused. They are pain in the butt just out of spite.

name: Jameson Hughston
text: Excellent company.  The staff is very professional, easy to work with, helpful, and accommodating.

name: Morris SMITH
text: They are all about the money! I receive fines every month without warning. Oh and don't have a Tenant in your home, you will be targeted.

resp.text: Mr. Smith, thank you for leaving a review for Spaces.  Unfortunately, tenants can be difficult to get to follow the rules.  We will continue to work with you to make ensure that they properly keep up your property and protect your investment.

name: Kelly South
text: Great management company!  I highly recommend.

name: David Kimani
text: Management is EXTREMELY rude. They will tell you something over the phone and once you bring it up at a later date, they act as if nothing was said. The management will also hang up in your face. Very unprofessional.

resp.text: We want all of our customers to have a great experience, and we tried to assist you with options to resolve your problem of moving out in accordance with the lease agreement at the end of your lease term.  In this case, our team advised that all items in the unit had to be removed at the end of the lease term.  We offered to have the items removed and stored, but you refused. You stated you would have someone remove the items.  We began the clean up of the unit after your lease expired, and the items that remained in the unit were considered abandoned.  No one hung up on you, but rather it was you who hung up when this was being discussed.

name: Jasmine Hughes
text: The Association Management is racist, trash, and discriminates. They also are uneducated with basic property laws. Avoid anything dealing with them.

resp.text: This review has been reported to Google as inappropriate.

name: Heather Mitchell
text: Helpful staff!  A great company to work with!

name: Jason Gray
text: Great management company with some great properties to lease.

name: Brian Randolph
text: Beware this management company. My son signed a lease only to find a week later he had lost his scholarship and would not be returning. We continued to pay the rent thinking they were trying to help sublease only to find they were turning people away. When confronted, they agreed to sublease to someone WE FOUND. Now to avoid returning our security deposit they have created damage that did not exist when we left but they are trying to get us to pay additional money. The initial conditions were terrible to start with. Think twice before renting any apartment they manage.

name: Spencer Wise
text: Great management and people.  Above and beyond service

name: Akia Austin
text: This whole company is awful. Lived in Capstone Quarters for 3 years and it gets worse every year. The management is unprofessional and the maintenance is unreliable.

name: Garret Leopard
text: Very Helpful staff, and beautiful and well kept properties!

name: Sven S
text: Not providing any service to the neighborhood. Instead they’re making up new rules just so and then have their agents solicit for any possibility to charge the residents!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving a rating for Spaces.   I understand that your landlord has provided you with a copy of the covenants that are recorded in the Tuscaloosa Probate office.  Spaces does not create these, they are developed at the time the neighborhood is planned.   If at any time, you feel that you are receiving a notice for something that is not set out in the covenants, please contact us so that we can discuss it further.  Our goal is to have zero violations noted for our neighborhoods.  We understand that there are always extenuating circumstances and will be glad to help resolve those if we are aware.

name: TJ Ward
text: They hardly ever answer the phones, and they never call you back when you leave a message. This place has some shady business practices. Avoid this entire company while looking for a place to live in Tuscaloosa. They charged me $895 when I moved out for having a pet, but I never had a pet when I lived in Tuscaloosa. After confronting them about it, they changed it to a charge for not moving out in time. They were unable to tell me what day they had me moving out in their records. Their Facebook reviews show other people having the same issues as me. Please save yourself some trouble by not renting from them.

name: Christopher Long
text: Extremely unprofessional and dishonest. Do not rent from this company.

name: Katlyn Caldwell
text: Great company!

name: Grayson Garrett
text: Fabulous

name: Nyabinghi Djehutti
text: Nice ballroom for wedding receptions. A convenience store on the premises is well stocked with incidentals one may need. Twenty floors provides for some breathtaking views of the city, classy upwardly mobile residents, nearby entertainment venues, seems like a quite a nice place to live.

resp.text: Nyabinghi, thank you for this thoughtful five-star review of Thomas Jefferson Tower! We are delighted you're enjoying our dynamic neighborhood, stunning city views, and on-site amenities. The team intends to create a pleasant and welcoming lifestyle for every resident, and we're glad you feel we're meeting that goal. If there's anything we can do to assist you, please don't hesitate to contact us. We love being of service!

name: Making Memories
text:
The staff is kind, but very inexperienced. Among the many disappointments and headaches of a recent family wedding, the STAFF CUT THE WEDDING CAKE AND SERVED IT TO GUESTS BEFORE THE BRIDE AND GROOM HAD THEIR CAKE CUTTING CEREMONY! It's a moment that they can never get back and is heartbreaking. Even if you aren't paying attention to the wedding, It's obvious if a cake has not been cut yet.
The venue also had water all over the floor from leaking windows, no maintenance personnel on staff and was unorganized. Security is non existent.
The staff, especially bartenders, at Roots and Revelry are incredible. The best part of the venue by far!!
The space is pretty and they have the potential to be a wonderful venue but need a lot of hand holding. Make sure you have your own wedding planner or day of coordinator to keep the event staff on track, and be prepared for wedding day disasters for either the bride or coordinator to handle.

resp.text: While we appreciate your feedback, we wanted to note our staff does not participate in or offer services for events taking place in the on-site ballroom. These functions are handled by an independent business not connected with our apartments. While the venue for your celebration is located on our premises, we do not offer cake cutting or food service, provide event security, wedding planners or coordinators. Though our leasing team was not involved in your event, we are truly sorry you did not have the five-star experience you deserved. We are sure the team you worked with would appreciate knowing your concerns, and we urge you to reach out to them so they may use your review to improve their services. If there is anything we can do for you regarding apartment rentals, please feel free to contact us anytime.

name: Wes Kilgore
text: Amazing property!  T.J. tower is historic, well-renovated, well-managed!  Paris and Andrew are wonderful, attentive, and fair.  If you love history, and upscale downtown living, it’s your place!

resp.text: Wes, thank you for taking the time to compliment our historic apartments and dedicated management team! We truly appreciate your kind recommendation and these five stars for Thomas Jefferson Tower! We truly love the unique nature of our building, central downtown location, and wonderful community! If there's anything we can do to assist you, please feel free to let us know. Call or contact us anytime!

name: Victor Griffin
text: I've lived here for two years, and it's been a wonderful home for me. The office staff and maintenance team are extraordinarily accommodating. The manager is constantly looking for new ways to bring people together through events or new accommodations. It's the first place I've lived where I've felt that management genuinely cared about the wellbeing of its' residents. Great location and access to the city.

resp.text: Victor, thank you for this complimentary five-star review of Thomas Jefferson Tower! We're thrilled your two years with us have been enjoyable and glad you're receiving the outstanding customer service you deserve from our team! We love providing comfortable homes, entertaining events, and a true sense of community at TJ Tower, and we're delighted that's what you've experienced! Please feel free to reach out if there is anything you need. We are always happy to assist!

name: james borton
text: I am a current resident of Thomas Jefferson Tower Apartments and recently completed a new lease for this coming up year. This was an easy decision to make after checking out a few other properties close by and realizing what a great situation I was already in. My time here has been nothing short of amazing and I would personally like to spend a few minutes here to explain why. Although many properties offer similar pricing and/or amenities, in the end they lacked the professionalism and caring nature of our staff here at TJ Tower. My experiences with everyone from the property manager (Paris), leasing consultants (Andrew and John), and all the way down to the maintenance technician (Justin) have left me completely satisfied and enthused to be a continuing resident here. In a day and time when customer service is a quality in which most organizations fall short, the staff here at TJ Tower has made every possible effort to ensure my comfort, safety and overall general well-being. I simply cannot give them enough praise in the space provided, but can honestly say with complete certainty that this is by far the most complete and caring staff ive encountered in 20+ years of leasing here in the Birmingham area. I would highly recommend this property to anyone considering a change in residency, and am lookimg foward to yet another fantastic year in the building which Im so happy to call my home.

resp.text: james, thank you for this complimentary five-star review of Thomas Jefferson Tower! We understand providing professional, meaningful service is the key to an exceptional residential experience, and we're thrilled you've found our team responsive to your needs! We love creating an enjoyable environment at our community and will work diligently to ensure you continue to enjoy the highest caliber lifestyle available in apartment living. Please feel free to reach out if there is anything you need. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Angela Adams
text: We were completely let down by the tour of the apartment home. It was so dirty. I mean really dirty! I was in Property Management for 20 years and I would have said I had nothing to show if I didn’t have a cleaned apartment ready to show. You never show an apartment like that! Also the leasing agent told us we had to put our masks on but then we got on the elevator and two vendors were allowed to get on the small elevator with us without masks. He said the large elevator was being using for someone to move. The apartment looked nothing like the pictures. I’m glad we looked because originally I had said my daughter could lease that apartment without it being seen and I thought we’d be happy with it! I’m so glad she didn’t!

resp.text: Angela, we’re disheartened to know you and your daughter did not enjoy an excellent experience at our community. Our team reviewed your tour and learned the apartment you were shown was not on our ready list. We profoundly regret this error and would like to invite you to tour one of our meticulously prepared homes. Each home is diligently cleaned and serviced before a resident moves-in, and we want you to experience our best efforts. Please accept our apologies for any miscommunication regarding mask use, as we are committed to following the city’s current ordinance. We have reached out to your daughter regarding this event and would like to speak with you as well. Your experience matters, and we invite you to contact us so we may work to improve your opinion.

name: Christina A
text: I haven’t moved in here but I went to view their apartments to see about moving in here and guys..... these apartments look NOTHING like the pictures did. The apartment we viewed was a HUUUUUGE let down. The counters and stove in the kitchen were dirty from the previous tenants still, the windows looked sketchy, the rooms were very tiny and it just looked so dirty. The bathroom wasn’t like the pictures. I was very disappointed. The pictures online made me feel like this place was going to be THE PLACE I wanted to move into. I left here wanting to cry because of how awful it was compared to the photos. I wanted this to work so bad because of the beauty of it as well as being close to UAB. I’m so sad this isn’t what I thought it was based off of what I saw online. DEFINITELY need to look at this place in person before making a decision.

resp.text: Christina, we’re truly sorry to hear your tour did not provide you with a positive first impression. After reviewing our records, we’ve discovered you were toured through a home that was not on our schedule to show. The apartment you saw had not been cleaned and prepared following the move-out of the previous resident. Before a new resident moves in, we carefully clean and prepare each of our homes to ensure they meet our exacting standards. We would appreciate the opportunity to change your impression of our apartments and would be glad to show you one of our more spacious floor plans. Our manager has reached out regarding your experience, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Cassandra Harlequin
text: Beautiful building!  We love when clients select their ballroom area for their wedding. There are tons of beautiful and scenic locations around the building for pictures pre and post wedding!

resp.text: Cassandra, thank you for this wonderful five-star review! We're delighted you've enjoyed your experiences at Thomas Jefferson Tower! We love hosting weddings in our ballroom and are always thrilled to see the creative ways our spaces are photographed and utilized. We hope to have you back at TJ Tower soon for another wonderful event! As always, if there is anything we can do to be of assistance to you, don't hesitate to reach out to the team.

name: Hunter Bush
text: The views are worth living here by itself. Staff has always been friendly and able to handle anything I've thrown at them. Location is impossibly good as I like to be close to the "action" but this place IS the action. There's constantly things to do here, as well as all the surrounding concert venues, restaurants and boutiques. No more sitting on 280 filled with anxiety about making an appointment on time or inventing new cusswords on 459 when I have to merge across 4 lanes of traffic. Its all here.

resp.text: Hunter, thank you for leaving this wonderful five-star review for Thomas Jefferson Tower! We're delighted you've enjoyed our convenient Downtown Birmingham location and resident and community events. We know how stressful the local commutes can be, and we're thrilled we've helped bring the best of Birmingham closer to you. Please don't hesitate to drop by the office or call (205)882-9555 if there is anything we can do for you. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Keyeriah Miles
text:
At this point, my frustration comes from the lack of concern of what happened to me RIGHT in front of the building. I was called the “N” word by a random person and mentioned it to the leasing consultant.  I wasn’t ask any questions regarding who that person could be. No description. No concern to even figure out if that person was a resident or not to make sure it doesn’t happen to anyone else. I didnt expect much but I definitely expected some sort of concern. And I didn’t hear from the manager until a WEEK after I mentioned it. It took me having to email her for her to reach out to me.

With the many problems from having the dishwasher, lighting, and garbage disposal fixed, the garbage inside and outside, it’s the noisiest place to live, my fridge doesn’t even dispense clean water (it’s very cloudy and grey),  I didn’t even realized I was paying for valet parking just to have my car parked in the open where it can still be broken into.

The property manager has been horrible with communication. This place doesn’t care at all about their tenants. I’m never one to write a bad review but this is just unacceptable. I will be ending my lease after only being there for less than a month.

My experience hasn’t been good from the start. Things probably could’ve been resolved when I first made awareness of all this but unfortunately, now I have no desire to be there. I can almost say I hate it there. Beautiful building but my experience has been the absolute worse

resp.text:
Keyeriah, we are deeply sorry you experienced such a troubling event near our community. The vile language used towards you is completely unacceptable and not something we permit or tolerate. We understand your frustration, and we apologize if you feel we did not give the situation proper attention. Our manager was unavailable during the week in question as she was home caring for a sick child. We, and our valet, did investigate the incident and did not find a resident matching the description of the person who harassed you. We always advise our residents to contact our office and the police if they feel threatened in any way.

We are sorry you’ve experienced issues with your home and are not satisfied with our parking. We are happy to address any appliance issues, and hope the filter change our team provided has resolved the issue with your cloudy water. Our manager will reach out to ensure it has been handled correctly. We understand the bustle associated with city living may not be tolerable for some, and we apologize if you have found the sounds of downtown living distressing. Our parking lot will soon be gated to enhance the peace of mind our residents experience.

We truly care about our residents and want to improve your experience. Our entire team is dedicated to your satisfaction and we ask you to call (205) 582-9555 or visit the office at your earliest convenience.

name: Dale Anderson
text:
Living in a historic building is a long time dream come true for me. I love living at the Thomas Jefferson Tower. I moved in 2 months ago; I have had some minor issues which required scheduling maintenance to visit my apartment but the guys have been great. Our property manager, Paris Topazi, has been attentive to my questions/concerns and always replies. Sometimes the repair issues have taken a little patience on my behalf because a part is unavailable and needs ordering. A building of this size and complexity must require a lot of details and upkeep, so I've no complaints. My love for the history and architecture of the building, as well as personally witnessing the rebirth of Birmingham, influenced me to make the decision to move here and be a part of the revitilization in the downtown area. I don't have to worry about traffic (I can reach the parking deck where I work in 5 minutes) and I save car fuel. I am close to Railroad Park, Pizitz Food Hall, and amazing restaurants such as Brick and Tin, Trattoria Zaza, El Barrio, The Essential, Paramount, Revelator Coffee and many more places that I intend on discovering for the fun and pleasure of it. I don't even have to walk outside of the building to visit one of the classiest restaurants in the city: Roots and Revelry. The food is amazing and the crew is attentive to your every need and want.

Down the street is the Harvest Market for delicious food and groceries, and in the Thomas Jefferson, we have our own convenience store, the Vineyard Market, which stocks many items you might need in a pinch.

From my window I can look out and see reminders of history everywhere: the Civil Rights Museum, 16th Street Baptist Church, Carver Theater, the 4th Avenue Business District and the Colored Masonic Temple where Duke Ellington and Count Basie performed, and Martin Luther King met with officials. From my bedroom window I can see the Lyric Theater, as well as the Alabama Theater. There are churches within walking distance of my apartment. There is so much potential here for beauty, art, music and architecture. I walk around to study the old structures that line the streets and I dream of a future where they will all be lovingly restored with businesses and residences.

As a child of the 60's, it is very important to me that Birmingham is revitalized to become a positive example of unity and brotherhood, where all walks of life can coexist. Birmingham's past is stained by racism that has left scars, but why can't it become a place that is not strictly gentrified but a place where people of all walks of life can afford to live? I don't think that is a dream that is out of reach. But it takes patience. The City is working with many different groups to bring change to Downtown.

I'm  aware that my lengthy review has evolved beyond simply stating my opinions about living at Thomas Jefferson Tower; it has become a dissertation of life in the city while singing its praises.That is because TJ Tower is such a part of the history of Birmingham. It is interlinked to the other historic places around its perimeter and part of Birmingham's historic skyline. To live here is to appreciate the history and richness of the past, as well as its lessons.

I sometimes imagine the halls of this grand structure echoing with the noises of hotel life long ago. Celebrities and dignitaries visited here, as well as average, every day people like you and me. Can you imagine the many stories that this building must hold within its walls, beginning in the grand lobby and all the way up to the 20th floor? For decades this place stood empty, solid yet forlorn, waiting for people with vision to see beauty beneath its stained exterior. I admire that kind of ambition. Now it is open again and will be made even better for future generations. Birmingham is being renewed, too, and I hope I live long enough to see its stained past outshone by healing and renewal. These are things that bring optimism to the heart.

resp.text: Dale, we are in awe of your exceptional five-star review for Thomas Jefferson Tower! We love your enthusiasm for our community and for the renewed spirit of Birmingham! Our historic building is full of wonderful stories, and we're thrilled to be writing a new chapter as a center of revitalization in Downtown. We appreciate your kind words towards our manager, maintenance, and your detailed picture of the vibrant community that surrounds TJ Tower. We are looking forward to enjoying a new vision of Birmingham with you and having you call our apartments for home for many years to come! Please feel free to reach out if there is anything we can do to assist you. We love being of service!

name: Jonathan Murphy
text:
Since moving to the Thomas Jefferson Tower in May 2018, I have dealt with intermittent bug infestations, hallways and common areas that often smell like garbage due to a mismanaged trash chute, fire hazards caused by trash-blocked stairwells, leaks from my ceiling causing damage to my countertops, and coercively obtained alterations to my lease agreement (threatening to take away parking if I did not agree to the amended agreement). While I was out of town for Thanksgiving, my vehicle, along with six others (according to the police), was broken into in the Thomas Jefferson Tower parking lot, for which I pay $150/month to park (an amount that exceeds any other parking fee I have seen in Birmingham, particularly for an unpaved and unfenced lot). The break in was reported to the Thomas Jefferson Tower valet and to the police on Friday, November 23 by a fellow tenant. I was not informed by anyone at the Thomas Jefferson Tower that my window had been smashed open, so my belongings were left vulnerable until I flew home and discovered it myself on Sunday, November 25. The same was true for at least two of the other vehicles that were broken into. My vehicle sat in their parking lot for two-days while it was rained on, damaging the upholstery and electronics, and inviting anyone who wished to come take my belongings to do so. The damage to my upholstery and window electronics was caused directly by the fact that I was not informed of the break in. The same thing happened to other tenants last week over Christmas. I have been told by staff that the management has not introduced any new security or surveillance measures. I would not recommend the Thomas Jefferson Tower to anyone.

UPDATE: Since making this post, no security or safety measures have been taken by property management and at least 2 other break ins have occurred to around 17 other vehicles. They only warned other tenants of the danger after the most recent vehicles were broken into. It really is sad that such a beautiful historic property is so poorly managed by SPM Property Management.

resp.text: Jonathan, we’re sorry your time at our community hasn’t been the five-star experience we enjoy providing. We take the concerns of our residents seriously and strive to address any reported issues swiftly. We have spoken to the parties responsible for leaving trash in the stairwells and will continue to reinforce the importance of adhering to fire codes. We are under the impression we handled the leak you reported to your satisfaction. We will be glad to revise our work if you feel this issue still needs attention. We offer pest control by request and service the common areas of our community regularly. If you notice pests in any area, please report it to the office so we may quickly remedy the situation. Our trash chute becomes clogged when it is improperly used. We have reminded our residents certain items cannot pass through the chute without causing an impaction. We are diligent to remove any refuse blocking the chute as soon as we are aware of the issue. We are sorry you experienced an incident with your vehicle. As this event took place over a holiday, our offices were closed or had limited staffed hours until the following Monday. We apologize if you feel this issue was not handled with the care it deserves. Our goal is always the well-being and peace of mind of our residents. A police report was made, and we will work to improve our communication in the future. The ownership of our parking lot changed, and we issued a lease addendum explaining the conditions specified by the new owners. It is our legal obligation to present new terms to our residents via an addendum, and we are sorry if you perceived this as a threat. We continue to improve our parking and are looking forward to providing a paved and gated lot in the near future. We are disappointed you would not recommend our community and invite you to visit or call (205) 582-9555 if there is anything we can to do improve your experience.

I now pay for the water bill and electricity of 3 people and a dog as opposed to just two people. The gym has not been 24/7. There is NOT a hot tub despite them advertising one. The study area has not been 24/7. The pool was rarely clean. Often I would order packages and they would say they couldn’t be delivered because the people working weren’t there so I wouldn’t receive packages and still haven’t received them. All around an awful living experience and I would not recommend it. Live somewhere like 191, midtown, or creek side instead.

resp.text: Gianni, thank you for taking a moment to express your frustrations with The Beacon and it's corresponding amenities/staff. We want to make sure to answer to some elements of your review, while also inviting you to correspond with our GM Philip (phrinehart@thebeaconauburn.com) about the concerns regarding your unit/roommates. The hot tub was taken out as a decision by ownership, and an upgrade to the area was done with stamped concrete and a pool table with green area. The amenities were closed for a while along with the office due to COVID exposure, but emails and communication went out about that. They are all currently open at this time. During the shut-down, the delivery companies were asked to deliver packages to the tenants' doors. We were not able to collect them at the time of the shut down. Packages are logged now, and the system does work correctly. Again, our efforts here are to help continue a conversation that can better facilitate the changes you wish to see to your living space. Thank you for your time, Gianni.

name: Ashley Miles
text: I have lived at The Beacon for two years and I can say that I really enjoyed my first year of living here. The staff was always nice to me and the maintenance team always fixed any problem that I had in a timely manner. However, something changed during my second year here. The gym was often dirty and provided no disinfectant spray or paper towels. I notified the office and they cleaned the gym and provided supplies, but within a couple of weeks the gym was dirty again and out of supplies. As a result, I started going to another gym. On another occasion, I was having recurring noise problems from a neighbor. I contacted the office four times about this issue and they did not do anything about it until I was able to email them a video of how loud the noise was. Lastly, in the middle of my lease, the business started using a new payment system that charges the residents almost $20 as a “service fee” to simply pay their bill. The worst part about this was that The Beacon did not tell the residents about this new policy. It was up to the residents to figure it out. This second year at the Beacon has left me feeling like the business takes advantage of college students. They brush off the residents and do not take their comfort seriously.

resp.text: We appreciate your dialogue here, Ashley; thank you for chiming in on how your experience of The Beacon has taken a turn. It is never our intention to take advantage of our residents here, and we want to do our best to support the community our residents thrive in. We've intro'ed new cleanliness measures across the property to ensure we don't assist the spread of COVID, as well as maintaining the quality of life. The noise situation concerns use and we'd like to talk more about that; give us a call and ask for April at 3344599855; just mention your review. We also utilize a service for online payment that provides a secure payment portal for all residents. We can show you how to avoid the service fees in-office if you'd like. Thank you, Ashley; we look forward to chatting more.

The Beacon
