text:
Among a very smooth move in, the apartment complex has been wonderful thus far. I have been impressed and happy with my time here.
The staff has been fabulous, and I have enjoyed how kind everyone is, and how quiet the neighborhood is.

resp.text: We're so glad you had a smooth move-in experience, J Marie! We're constantly working to make sure that first impression reigns true for the rest of your time with us. We appreciate the insightful review!

name: Monifah Lucas
text: I love my apartment! Not only is the staff and maintenance workers very nice, but I never have to be afraid to ask stupid questions. It comes as a plus that I have my own bathroom too. This place is still amazing!

resp.text: You're the best, Monifah! Thank you so much for the awesome rating.

name: Jasmine Conaway
text: The apartments are nice and clean but the staff here is slow when it comes to handling anything. Maintenance takes a while and then you usually have to keep calling them because they never fix things correctly. The package room is a good idea but the staff is ridiculously slow with putting your packages in the room so you're waiting extra long to get a package that you know has already been delivered. I've had multiple problems with the electronic keys and I keep having to go to the leasing office and the issue is still not resolved.

resp.text:
Thanks for the clarity in your review, Jasmine. We'd love to fully resolve the situation with your key with either a re-program or a new one altogether; if you can stop by the office and ask for
Angel, she's been made aware of your review. We're in the process of working with the delivery companies to start logging them upon delivery, which for the time being has had to be done by staff which extends the process; for this, I'm very sorry. We're hoping the solution comes sooner than later and we can get mail to residents quicker than it currently takes. We care deeply about giving every resident the experience they desire and pay for, so thank you for giving us the road map on how to make your time at The Beacon better.

name: Kristen Tolbert
text: Awesome! I love it...

resp.text: You know, we love it too... ;) Thanks so much, Kristen!

name: Kait Shields
text: I don't understand any of these bad reviews- I have had nothing but great experiences here at the Beacon! My roommates and I have only had to put in two maintenance requests ever and both were our own faults, but they were still dealt with and resolved pretty much right away. I love the staff, everyones super nice and personable and do an awesome job with resident events (pretty much weekly events with free food or fun artsy activities- super cute)!  I would definitely recommend for anyone to live here and have nothing but good things to say!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for the five star review Kait! We take pride in providing a positive experience for our residents.

Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Joe Reich
text: The place is satisfactory at best. For starters the room came with half the furniture we were told it came with. Upon multiple requests to the front desk and maintenance nothing has been done. Second, the 7 or so maintenance requests where they enter whether you're there or not, have not fixed any of the nonworking lights or helped the issue stated above. Needless to say, i'm happy to be leaving this summer.

resp.text:
Hello Joe,
We are very disappointed and surprised to receive this review. Per our system, it appears that you have not placed a work order. Our General Manager will be reaching out to you right away to resolve this situation.
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Taylor Boutwell
text: Absolutely love The Beacon! The staff is extremely friendly and always on top of things. I lived here for three years and couldn’t have imagined a better experience. 10 out 10, would recommend to a friend!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Taylor for the five stars! So glad you loved living here.
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Grayson Dabbs
text: I have lived here for the past year and I have nothing but good things to say! The office staff and maintenance crew are beyond helpful and will always greet you with a smile. I am extremely satisfied with how they handled all my questions, concerns, and living adjustments the past year (and I had TONS). They work very hard to keep the community a safe, clean, and friendly place. I would recommend for almost any college student who is looking for a good cost of rent to 'what you get out of it' ratio. PLUS It is also very close to the nursing/forestry side of campus so if you have class in that direction then it makes it very convenient to hop on a bike and ride to class

resp.text:
Thank you for the five stars, Grayson! We are so glad that you have had such a positive experience! We appreciate the great feedback!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Arthur Bruce Jr
text: The location is great and the tiger transit route is very fast!The pool is a really cool place to hangout during the summer. There are also lots of resident events that allow for plenty of chances to meet other people living here There are students from Auburn, Tuskegee and Southern Union that live here! ! I was very impressed with the newly renovated 3 bed 3 bath model and am and looking forward to all of the great changes! The only downfall is the card keys, but I here that they are being replaced as the renovations continue! I would definitely recommend this apartment complex to anyone looking for housing at Auburn, Tuskegee, or Southern Union.

name: The Scrub Life
text: Absolutely love this place! The staff is amazing and always wanting to meet your needs and I am excited to see the new renovations of the property. This place is already great and I cannot imagine to see what the apartments will look like after these tweaks are made!

name: Jennifer Herrera
text: Friendly staff and maintenance.

resp.text: Appreciate this more than you know, Jennifer. Thanks for your great review.

name: Thanh Truong
text: Living room, and kitchen were trashed. U have many other options with that price!

resp.text: Thanh, we're very sorry to hear about this issue you've had upon move-in. We're sure there is a better explanation for what's happened and would love the time to discuss it in more depth than a Google review could merit. If you have some time this week, please stop in the leasing office and chat with our general manager Philip. Thanks, Thanh!

name: savannah vick
text: I’ve lived here for less than a year. Since I’ve started living they’ve had 3 different general managers. Their assistant manager left so they went without one from November until April. This property is completely unorganized. Once one general manager leaves they don’t leave hardly any notes for the new general managaer to work off of. I had a terrible roommate for most of this time. She was breaking the lease and I brought it to their attention and they didn’t want to handle it. The last general manager Angel was awesome. She handled everything exactly how it should be. The new general manager April is amazing also. She handles everything in a timely manner and makes you feel like she cares and actually listens to you. Some of the community assistants are fantastic but others aren’t. Luke is amazing and will treat you with kindness and respect no matter what. He’s always super nice and very willing to do whatever he can do to help you. There is a community assistant who is very rude and isn’t very helpful. This person was nice at first when I got my tour but when this person was handling the issues I would have they would tell me that they would get back to me on a certain day and wouldn’t. I would have to reach back out to this person to get them to fix whatever issue was present. This person also refused to let my stepmother talk to a manager. This person left my stepmother on multiple holds to talk to the manager when this person should’ve let my stepmother (who’s name is on the lease) talk to the manager herself like she asked to. This person also doesn’t really make an effort to listen to you or show that they care in any capacity. Very cold individual and very emotionless. I wouldn’t live at this property ever again unless they cleared out all office staff except for a few individuals like Luke, April, and a couple of other community assistants who’ve actually been helpful and kind. The maintenance staff is impeccable. The 2 men I’ve worked with in the past have been wonderful and awesome. One of the men had to come to my apartment at around 10PM for an emergency and I never felt uncomfortable or wary of him being in my apartment  late because he is super kind, respectful, and will get the job done and do it well! The older man who is on the maintenance crew is also super kind and helpful... he’s never come into my apartment to do any maintenance while I was home but he did when I wasn’t there and he did an amazing job and got my new washer/dryer in super quickly, locked my door back, and didn’t leave a mess!! If you plan on living at this community with someone you know well and won’t have issues with and don’t need to go to the office for anything you will be good but if not I do not reccomend living here. I’m moving in August and I’m disappointed because I like and appreciate so many members of the staff there but a couple of rude employees will ruin your experience especially if you have issues with anything big. But I do have a feeling that April is here to stay and she is a wonderful general manager so you might could get her help instead of a couple of the rude community assistants. Rooms are small. Bathrooms are gross. The lining between the bottom of my bathtub and floor was coming off when I moved in. There was dead bugs in my room when I moved in. There are paint brush strokes on the granite and on the white baseboards and also on the floors. The desk was stained with some white stuff. The grout in the shower was dirty. The kitchen was disgusting. Living room is a nice size. The kitchen is tiny. Not enough space for anymore than 2 people to live happily in one of these apartments. I lived in a 3 bedroom and we were constantly all over each other. There simply isn’t enough space in the kitchen for 3 people and all their food. The pantry is also too small. Hardly any storage space. The bottom of the cabinet under the sink is rotting because of a water leak and has been that way since I moved in. It smells absolutely disgusting. I wouldn’t recommend living here unless you had no other choice.

resp.text: Thank you for speaking with me over the phone, Savannah. It was great to have a chance to sit down and really dial in on what about The Beacon was making you unhappy. I would like to extend the offer for a follow-up discussion should you feel the need to talk through any other aspects you feel we didn't get a chance to touch on. Just give me a call at your convenience; thank you! -Amy Verner, GM

name: Megan Hodges
text: I really love it here at Eagles Reserve. The office staff and maintenance staff are so friendly and always get to my service requests really quickly. Plus I feel super safe here and that was a real concern for me and my parents when I moved to Auburn. Definitely plan on staying here until I graduate college!!

name: demon stallion
text: Pretty good place to live. wish the grill had gas more often but other than that there is really not much wrong with this place at all. the staff is friendly and the manager is understanding.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review!

name: Morgan Robinson
text: I enjoy living here. The room is nice and a decent size. living room and kitchen area are nice. there could be more parking. and the wifi has been out for a few days.

resp.text:
Thank you for the 4-star rating, Morgan! We are so glad to learn that your experience has been positive! We encourage you to please visit the office, or call us, so we can address your concerns and get it taken care of as soon as possible. We would love to earn the remaining fifth star!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Joseph McGlawn
text:
The college students working on the Beacon's staff are SO sweet. The general manager acts pretty annoyed with you when you have issues with your apartment and I've had plenty.

This is a review from 2019 - and I was told Amber is no longer there!

resp.text: Joseph, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us some comment online! As Amber is no longer with the company, we'd love to take some one-on-one time with you to address your concerns directly, and see where to go from here. Just stop in and mention your review whenever you get the chance. Thank you!

name: MIN SEOK SONG
text: I was never able to enter back door of the clubhouse in the night to workout or get my package. I went to ask more than seven times to address the issue, and the staff always told me they would fix it but it never worked. My rent payment was occasionally not processed after I paid and so I had to go back to the office again with my receipt, which was time consuming and frustratinh. Good but slow maintenance. There were cockroaches when I lived first floor. Internet is ok but sometimes stopped working in the bad weather. Overall clean/decent place but keep those things in mind in your worst case.

resp.text: Thank you for the honest and thorough review, Min Seok. We will be utilizing this feedback, primarily the lack of initiative to fix the doors and the maintenance speeds, in our next team meeting to better understand why this occurred. We genuinely appreciate the balanced feedback you've provided here.

name: Brandon Lee Ray
text:
This is in response to Nick Turner's review. I am so sorry that you had a less than ideal experience at The Beacon! I would like to clarify a couple of the comments that you made in your review. I am not saying that the event you described didn't happen, but I can assure you that I was not the employee that was involved in the situation you described. I have never called the police on any one, I have never identified someone for the police, and I have never filed a formal complaint against a person. Normally I would not respond to a review, but since you have explicitly mentioned my name on such a public forum, claiming that I was the cause of such a horrid event, I wanted a chance to rectify my name. Again, I am not claiming that this event did not occur, but I want to make it clear that I was never apart of it.

Thank you,

Brandon Ray

name: Eddie Crosbie
text: Although the rooms may be a bit dingy, and the internet can be slow, the staff and attempts of the management to make the Reserve an enjoyable place to live are well meant. They're always friendly and polite while management is accepting and flexible. They're online pay system did give me quite a bit of trouble, but they accepted all of their mistakes and made it very easy for me to fix them. Honestly, the worst thing about it is probably the lack of organization within their system, but this is understandable seeing as though they're reworking everything. Probably a bit pricey for what you're getting but you could definitely do worse.

name: Conner Badger
text: The fact that you have to get a visitor pass that expires every three days and they have to park in visitor is so much more work than it needs to be. It’s annoying to have to go to the office every three days and especially when they close.

name: Cor Fre
text: The worker who came to fix the appliances left halfway through my dryer and never came back. My dryer still doesn't work until now. It makes a lot of noise

resp.text: Hey there, 卢立奇. Thank you for getting in touch regarding the internet! This is an Auburn University Master Lease building. We'l shoot an email over to our service provider to see if they can offer any assistance on the matter. In the meantime, feel free to stop by and place a work order if you're still experiencing issues.

name: Jerry Yu
text: The first day I move in, the toilet seat, lightbulb, air conditioner and the main door lock weren’t working; then I found bugs, dead roaches and food in the kitchen’s cupboard. The toilet flusher broke after a week. And the key for getting into the mailroom, computer lab and the gym never work. When the fk are those going to be fixed?

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jerry. Unfortunately, Auburn Global was understaffed until a few weeks before turn. Therefore, a large period of time pasted without us knowing there was any maintenance issues in any of the units. Shortly after AUG hired someone we received over 150 work orders from them. This was shortly before turn, and during this time we also lost our maintenance supervisor. This is not an excuse for not taking care of their problems, however, if we don’t know about the problems we cant fix them. Since everyone is fully staffed we have put procedures in place to prevent this from happening in the future.

name: Tiffani Bryant
text: This is a review coming from someone who lived here 2012-2013 and 2015 through the end of my lease which will be 7/2017 and also worked here. HONESTLY, I would not live here unless it is a last resort. The prices they are asking people to pay, considering the size and age of the apartments here, is absolutely ludicrous. Maintenance is decent, but sometimes the delays result from things the management can't help (i.e. waiting for parts from an outside source, requiring contractors, etc.). Management isn't the best and will absolutely do their best to screw you. (I.E. I renewed for an unfurnished apartment - the new management told me they were going to put furniture of their own in the apartment. I e-mailed and told them that I had signed for an unfurnished apartment so I would not allow any of their furniture into the apartment (because of pets). Amber, the GM, e-mailed and said that nowhere in my lease specified that I had an unfurnished apartment. She said this because she wasn't aware that I had a copy of the lease which clearly displayed an X beside an unfurnished lease.) I sincerely recommend ANYWHERE else to live because the cost and headache of the management just isn't worth it. My water bill for one month was $80, another was $60 and they are still working on reimbursing me. (The water bill is split between the four people, so there is no way we racked up a $320 water bill).  They have a record of losing payments, and charging late fees because management was too lazy to process the payments on time. I implore you not to live here. Their computer lab printer HARDLY ever works, and they've decided to start making residents supply their own paper. The community events are nice, but also a staple of every other apartment complex in Auburn.

name: amanda hanley
text: I have lived here for 2 years now, I am bery happy with how the grounds are kept. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and always has fun activities and parties for the residents!

resp.text:
Thank you Amanda for the five stars! Glad you like our community.
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Lukas B
text:
I lived here for 4 months and it wasn't that bad at all. I stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment. I liked the size of the bedrooms with an own bathroom and a big closet. Also, the pool area and the gym were nice. The staff was always very friendly and helpful.
Since I was an exchange student, I only needed the room for 4 months, from Aug 13 until Dec 09. What I didn't like was that I had to rent the apartment for 5 months (including the whole August and the whole December). Also, I had to pay $100 each month for a "short term lease", but I kind of understand that because they probably can't rent the apartment during the year again.
The only thing I had a lot of problems was the electric bill: I only charged my tablet and my phone, while my roommates were always on the playstation and the computer, were listening to music through a big stereo and their TVs were always on. The Beacon doesn't charge the power directly, in every room somebody has to sign up at Alabama Power. Of course, my roommates wanted to split the bill even (which already brought a lot of discussions)... And one roommate just left in the middle of the semester without saying anything and, of course, without paying the electric bill. In the end, Alabama Power cutted off our power and I had no choice but to pay a lot of the others' power..... It would be nothing but fair if The Beacon could charge everybody directly based on their own usage.

resp.text: Hi Lukas, We greatly appreciate your feedback and glad you enjoyed your time at our community, despite the noted concerns. I will be in contact with you directly via e-mail to discuss options in which I can assist you with the electricity. Speak to you soon! Sincerely, Amber, General Manager at The Beacon

name: Elliott J Diggs
text: I love living here so much that I renewed my after living here for just 3 months!

resp.text: Seriously, the best kind of feedback we can get. Thank you so much Elliott! We look forward to serving you for years to come.

name: Tide Holobaugh
text: Wish I could give it a zero. Honestly these people don't care about anything. My friends AC went out for 2 months and the answer the manager gave him was "why don't you leave the windows open at night". My hot water heater busted and flooded my living room for close to two weeks and after waiting 8 days they came and fixed the heater but told us the clean up was not their responsibility.

name: Sarah Spear
text: I've lived here for 4 years and have enjoyed my experience for the most part. Rent is never the same price year to year which can be very frustrating if you live in the same apartment. I don't see why I had to pay $50 more one lease year for the exact same place. The management is very helpful and maintenance is very good at getting to your request within a few days. The pool is nice but could use to be cleaned more. The exercise room is nice but needs more treadmills because one of them is either broken or always in use. The tanning bed is awesome and they are even nice enough to provide goggles if you need them. The only negative thing about this apartment is the card keys you use instead of regular door keys. You might think it's great at first, but trust me, you'll grow to hate them by the end. You can't just close your door to walk your dog without your card. If you forget your card, you have to get a lock out key and if the office is closed, you have to call the after hours number and it can take a while for someone to get back to you about a lockout. I wish I could have a normal lock on my door with a normal key. It's nice to have a tiger transit and we are the second stop which is great because it can fill up in the mornings and you don't want to have to be standing on your way to campus. Just keep in mind, you get what you pay for. It's on the cheaper end as far as price goes, but the appliances are dated and it could use a good sprucing.

name: Ashley Wilkins
text:
The best word that I can use to describe, not only this place, but also the new management is sleazy. Do your self a favor and if you are considering living here, don't. I lived here for two years, and I am beyond happy that I moved. Even with the new management and the few remodels they have accomplished it is not worth the price, and overall unhappiness that you will experience by living here. The only positive thing I can say about it is that the sketchiness of the neighborhood was entertaining. Free entertainment on Friday nights include fights in the parking lot, residents passed out drunk next to their cars while police interrogate anyone walking to their car, police patrolling with guns out for their safety. If you are a parent considering letting you child live here, please keep looking. I learned a lot, but mostly I learned that I should have listened to the reviews I read online, and that just because it is easy to renew, that doesn't mean you should.

Also, can I just note that all the profiles who have left positive reviews about the reserve have only left one review, and do not have any information on their profile. Looks to me like someone is creating profiles just to have some positive feedback. This is a good example of how they operate their business.

resp.text: Hi Ashley, I'm sorry to read about this experience you have had at The Beacon. I am working with the property to get more detail on the issues you faced while living at the community. We take your feedback very seriously and want to ensure that all open issues are resolved. If you have any additional information, please contact me directly at manager@thebeaconauburn.com. Thank you.

name: Kelsey Turner
text: It is much different since the new management took over. My experience has been great, and all of the maintenance people are very friendly.

name: Kaylee Thigpen
text: 0 Stars. TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT. They literally tried to lock me out of my apartment. Management randomly decided to change all the locks on the bedroom doors and they expected you to come get your new key on their terms. They left one note in the door saying it would be done the next week but didn't tell you what day your apartment was going to be changed and expected you to pick up your key that day during business hours. I work out of town a lot and didn't come home sometimes for a couple days at a time and got home very late sometimes so I didn't even see the notice until the day before this was done. There was no email or phone call (even though they made sure to call/email me at least 4 times a week asking if I wanted to renew my freaking lease.) So I call the office, from out of town, the day the lock is changed and told them that I wouldn't be home before the office closed and tried to see if I could get my key given to my roommate (who works in the office and I've lived with for 6 years, so I trust) or maybe get it put in the mailbox. They wouldn't let me do anything and I left several messages for the manager who refused to call me back. Finally after calling over and over again I get the manager, Amber, on the phone and she tells me that I can call the on call number when I get home that night and pay the $50 fee to get let into my room. So you mean to tell me that I pay $555 to rent this room and because you decided you want to randomly change the locks for no reason I now have to pay $50 more for you to let me in? I don't think so. After arguing with Amber about not paying the fee she finally agreed to let me sign a piece of paper stating that I consented to let her leave my bedroom door unlocked and she would personally do the change so she would make sure to leave it unlocked and I would just have to pick up the new key the next day. I wrote it up and emailed it to her immediately after getting off the phone with her and she confirmed that it was received. Fast forward to later that night, I get home and the damn door is LOCKED.  I also tried to call the parent company to speak with someone higher up about this issue while not being able to get in touch with Amber all day and the receptionist there told me "she didn't know what I wanted her to do about it, she was getting off in 15 minutes" then after telling her that she needed to do SOMETHING about it TODAY, she said she would have someone call me and I never heard from anyone from there again, so don't even bother trying to go higher up. This is one of many problems we faced, I would strongly advise to live literally anywhere but here.

name: Jennifer Lucas
text:
You get what you pay for is exactly right!
Good things:
Super cheap rent, the only bill you'll have is power which will be split with your roommates(internet, cable, water all included), pool, computer room, and fitness center, and parking is nice (you can always park in front of your building), w/d in unit, the maintenance guys are super nice and will help you with whatever issue you have. Pet friendly

Bad things:
The apartments are VERY small, good luck fitting a bed larger than a full in the rooms. Whoever manages this property doesn't care too much about making sure the units are kept up. You can tell each year when they repaint the walls they just paint over the plug plates instead of removing them. As a result you can't use every plug because it'll be too caked in paint for the plug to fit. There is also painting drippings around the border of the room, from them not putting anything down to cover the carpet before painting. This wouldn't be an issue, but the carpets are a brown/black fabric so the white spots stand out like a chocolate sprinkle on vanilla ice cream.The appliances are old. The kitchen is literally stuffed in a corner, and the counter space is awful. If you have a microwave on the counter good luck fitting much else. Pest control, if they even come, must use water when they spray because you will have bugs!!! They'll come from everywhere, the windows, the shower, the sink, wherever! So if you don't like bugs I'd suggest finding another place to live. They recently painted the buildings and claim to have renovated the apartments, this isn't true. All they did was put in new mattresses and living room furniture. The walls are paper thin....so thin I can hear my roommate snoring in the next room. And if you have someone above, forget everyday being peaceful and quiet. They could be walking from the kitchen to their bedroom and it'll sound like a herd of cattle are moving around above you. Not only are the units noisy for lack of insulation, this place is like the party spot. So if you like to spend your nights studying at home, you might as well hang it up here. Someone will always be partying, riding around with loud music, yelling, whatever. But at the same time this can be expected from a lot of living places in a college town.

I lived here very briefly and moved on to somewhere nicer and quieter. I would never live there again, you couldn't pay me to live there again. In all I'd look around for somewhere else to live, and come here only as a last resort.
Hope this helps!

name: Haley Nixon
text: I've lived here going on 3 years now, and the only great thing about it is the price (which is relatively good but still goes up every year) and the convenience. There's a Tiger Transit stop, and it only takes about 15 minutes to get to class, so it doesn't get much better than that. Other than that, the apartment you'll be living in is nothing like the model they show you. It's pretty much luck of the draw: I got one of the nicer apartments where mostly everything worked, but my boyfriend's apartment had the linoleum coming up in the bathroom and mushrooms growing out of his bathroom wall because of the mold. Management does not care about fixing any damages; in one apartment, the crown molding had been scratched off because of a past resident's dog, but all they did was paint over it. The space you're getting is nice, but be prepared for something to break, and I've had instances where my roommate and I both put in over 5 maintenance requests for just one issue before they came to fix it, and we've even had to call the office. Walls are paper thin, and you can hear your neighbor's conversations through the walls; you can even hear the person above you using the bathroom. The place uses key cards, like a hotel, instead of actual keys, which seems cool at first but eventually, it's a nightmare. You'll lose them, or they'll break, in which case you're charged money for a new one. God forbid the front office is closed because the person who is on call to come and help you usually takes a long time and seems more bothered than anything that you called. As a resident, I've had my car towed before (even though there was a parking permit in my car), and I had to pay $100 to get it back, but the office didn't seem to care. People who don't even live at the complex come here to throw parties or use the pool, and once again, the office doesn't check or care. I've seen bunches of young children in the pool during the summer who I know are not college students living here. Parties are constantly being thrown after hours, but the person on call seems more annoyed that they're being bothered to do their job, so the police usually end up getting called. Amenities are pretty cool, and there are always fun events being had for residents, but the printer in the computer lab, never, EVER works, and even if it does, there are residents who use the computers in the front office to watch movies, listen to loud music, or play games for days on end, and nothing is ever done about it. In short, pros are convenience, price and events for residents, and cons are just about everything else. Your money would be better spent elsewhere.

name: Brett Todd
text: Overall, it's been a terrible experience ever since the new management arrived. The maintenance staff is unprofessional, messy, and terrible at doing their job correctly the first, second, etc. number of times. My roommates and I had to move apartments during finals week, and during that same week, we were consistently woken up early to the sound of hammers and yelling of the construction workers. I had to live without working air-conditioning for at least 2 months, after repeated requests for the problem to be fixed. The management appears to have little or no experience doing there jobs and show little talent in general. For the increased and pricey number they want to charge for such few benefits, I would highly recommend that anyone look elsewhere for a quality apartment experience.

name: Amber Sprayberry
text: Absolutely love living at the beacon the staff and housing are amazing

resp.text: Absolutely love having you with us, Amber! Thank you for stopping your busy schedule to give us some digital love.

name: Ian Trobaugh
text:
Edit to this review: The Beacon responded below as well on other social media platforms saying that they would reach out to me about this issue but months later I have still heard nothing. The time I went into the office to ask about this the person at the desk was extremely dismissive and seemed annoyed that I was asking. I have, however, been asked multiple times a week for the past month if I wanted to renew my lease. That answer remains an absolute no until this issue is actually addressed.

Good location and apartments. However, the internet is so terrible that I could never recommend that anyone lives here. I regularly have issues where I can't even check my emails. After contacting the management staff I was directed to the ISP and their customer service blamed my computer despite it working fine everywhere else I've lived. Management said that they "upgraded" the service over the summer, but that hasn't improved the quality of the internet at all and has only made the service even worse.

resp.text:
Ian,
We are disappointed to learn that you are still having issues with your internet. We are working diligently to ensure that our residents' expectations are met. We are looking into this, and we will be reaching out to you shortly. We appreciate your feedback!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Jay Dayton
text: This place sucks. Before living here I overlooked the reviews as its just people complaining about the little things and honestly if there was something wrong here or there it wouldn't be a big deal but there is a lot that goes into this place being terrible. Out kitchen seems to have been made from the cheapest plywood available and then spray painted. The living room is small and there are marks where paint dripped off the walls all over the floors. The doors aren't fitted into place properly and seriously alter the temperature of the apartment. The thermostat doesnt work. In one semester our water heater broke twice. The carpets are decent but again they are poorly stapled down and i can pretty much pull it up if i wanted to. We had a serious bug problem for a little while that was resolved by spraying a ton of raid everywhere. The hot water heater, besides breaking, is also tiny and many times if my room mate just showered i would have cold water. The bar and countertops are terrible. Outside the sprinklers run every night regardless of if it had been raining the entire day which isn't really that bad it was just really annoying because when i would walk my dog i would be avoiding puddles constantly, not to mention a waste of money for the complex. Don't even look here you will regret living here.

name: Ty Shontice
text: Needs new management ASAP!  Even with a parking permit they still towe your car! Worst apartments ever they get over on you and just want your money! Please do not move here

name: Madeleine Griffin
text: No complaint other than the management. They need to be more professional.

name: Shayan Budhwani
text: Great place to live There's always something going on at The Beacon

resp.text:
Glad to see you enjoy getting involved where you live, Shayan! Thanks for leaving us a great review.

Best,
The Beacon Mgmt.

name: Ly Truong
text: Rude, nasty and unhelpful staff.

name: Kellie Jones
text: They only got that star because you can't give them none. There is always some issue or another with this place and if you have class or work until 5 PM like most normal people do good luck getting any help. Staff after 5 PM is completely useless for anything other than an awful attitude and incompetency. They refuse to contact management since they say they can lose their jobs over it. As soon as my lease is up I will be going somewhere else because this place is awful. Management even went so far as to come into my apartment without calling me because I had roommates moving in and left trash in my bed! GO ANYWHERE BUT HERE!

name: Laurin Coley
text: This is the worst apartment complex in Auburn!!! I would have given zero stars but it wouldn't let me! I can't begin to tell you all the things that have gone wrong. From mud coming up from the bottom of the toilet - to the maintenance man dropping a desk on my daughters car and causing $2000.00 worth of damage. They did end up paying for it but it was a huge hassle! If you plan on signing a lease here be prepared to loose your mind every month that you have to deal with the management!!!!!!! Sign a lease anywhere in Auburn but here!!!!!!

name: Jackson Lawrence
text: If you can avoid living here, do so. It's terrible. Maintenance is awful and the staff isn't very helpful either. My roommates and I moved into a unit with a broken washer and when maintenance came to replace it they gave us another broken washer. All in all it took about 2 1/2 months to get one that actually worked. Bottom line, don't live here.

name: Feifan Cheng
text: The air conditioner unit outside the windows is extremely noisy. I can’t fall asleep even at 3:00 am. I’m really disappointed when I reflect this problem, they don’t solve this. Write at angry night

resp.text:
Feifan,
We regret that you have had a negative experience. Pease come by our office, or contact us by phone, so we can come to a positive resolution. We appreciate your feedback.
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Helen Colburn
text: Maintenance is terrible. Apartment stays hot in summer and freezing in the winter. They let anybody live there including drug dealers. Charged me for paint upon move out and then remodeled the entire apartment. Customer service is just as bad. Look for some where else to live.

name: e S
text: The newly refurbished rooms are a big upgrade from the old ones. However the place is still built cheap so expect things to break and if you don't get it fixed they will charge you despite it being their poor build. The rental fee is highly overpriced for what you get. You're going to have get your own internet through Charter because their wifi is wildly inconsistent and when it works it's incredibly slow. If you get a roommate who refuses to pay his/her cut of the electricity bill theirs nothing you can do to make him/her pay it and the staff won't do anything but call them. If you use the AC unit expect your bill to be outrageous because this place has zero insulation so the machine will have to run non-stop to keep it at temperature. We had a $315 bill during the winter. As I mentioned they are refurbishing the place so your going to be hearing construction crews beating and working on things when your trying to sleep in the morning. If you don't care about the price it's a fine place to live but their are a lot nicer and cheaper places to live in Auburn. Find a Real Estate agent and let them find you a place. If you do choose to live here KEEP YOUR RECEIPTS from paying rent. They will try to accuse you of not paying rent. I know multiple people here who received letters instructing them to pay a bunch of late fees or be evicted when they had already paid rent. Their printers are always out of ink or paper, the pool area is a wreck, the hot tub is always broke, and the gym is a joke. Avoid this place if possible or prepare for a year of hell. BTW any good reviews on hear were most likely placed by the staff. If you really want truth just go around and talk to some of the residents. They will tell you everything you need to know about this awful place.***UPDATE*** Charter is no longer available here so you will have terrible internet. Yet another reason not live here.

name: Peter Pan
text: This apartment complex is deplorable. Honestly, when you walk into the office and go to sign a lease, you're signing yourself up for a year of awful conditions. The heating/cooling system is wildly inconsistent; somehow my room always ends up baking like an oven no matter how cold the AC is. The WiFi is a joke. I could accomplish more internet surfing with a 3G hotspot from any old phone. The maintenance staff is downright lazy and careless. The power kept going out and the hot water heaters always break. If you have a dog, don't get too excited over their so-called "dog park". It's just a really large crate. Eagles Reserve is just a terrible place to live, and not only do I not recommend it, but I strongly urge you to seek a better location. Your money should not go towards unbearable living conditions.

name: China Clay
text:
To whom it may concern,

This process started 4/21/17 when i called to inquire about the apartments/rooms at the Beacon. In every conversation I had I let them know that I had a 1 Yr. old that would be living with me. The whole process was horrible because you would ask the employees questions and they never had the answer and during the weekend the manager was not there at least when I called. During this awful process I still kept going with the process. Fast forward to Monday I have spoken with that office over 10xs. I receive a call from Taylor saying everything was good to go and I can move in Tuesday 4/25/17 and I would just have to bring payment of 102.00. I was excited despite the issues with the process. I packed my car that night and was handing off my key today Tuesday 4/25/17 to my old place. Amber the General manager sends me an application for my son and I fill it out. I then arrive at the beacon with the money order ready to bring my stuff upstairs since I was already told I could move in. Amber then tells me since my Son is 13 months which still means he is a 1 yr. old I can not move in after yesterday I was told everything was approved and I could move in. Now I have my car packed with no where to go so Now I am homeless with a one year old. I have to spend money at a hotel so my son can have somewhere to sleep after the beacon told me I can move in and then takes it back. I wish someone would say sorry or not because sorry doesn't change my situation. You people are horrible and the worse and obviously everyone needs to be retrained including someone whop holds the title of General Manager.

resp.text:
We are truly sorry for any miscommunication that lead to this unfortunate string of events. We have established policies in place to ensure that all current and prospective residents are treated equally. Once we became aware that your son was over 12 months old, we informed you that we would need to follow our policy regarding your accommodations and therefore would be unable to complete the signing of the type of lease you requested.

That said, our mission is to create successful communities, with safety and well-being as our primary concerns. Though you are not a member of The Beacon resident community, as a member of our greater community we reached out to make sure that you and your son have a safe and comfortable place to stay for the next two nights. We have contacted you to place you in a hotel for those days at our expense. We are also working to help you find a new home that will both fit you and your son’s needs and falls within your price range. We look forward to working with you to help you find a place you can call home.

name: Ashley lucas
text: Do Not Use This Apartment Complex!!! Maintenance is horrible, facility badly maintained. Reported problems for the 2 years I lived there with no response...then they charged me to "clean" what I had reported to them. Tried to discuss the situation with them and got no response, they just send you to a collection agency. DON'T LIVE HERE!

name: Miranda Reese
text:
I've been moved to different apartments 3 different times and have not been able to stay in the same place for over a year. My newest place floods every time it rains and each time the management has been very pissy with me. The money I saved on rent has not been worth the massive amounts of property damage I have experienced. This place isn't even 0 stars, This place is negative 5 stars.

edit: after claiming they fixed the flooding problem, my roommates and I left for winter break, only to come back to half an inch of standing water and mold covering the walls and floors. They just painted over the walls and vacuumed the carpets, and did not clean my bathroom or closets, because they blew the fuse in my bathroom and did not come down to fix it no matter how many times I nagged them.

I litterally can not describe how angry I am with this complex, please for the love of god, learn from my mistakes.

name: Deja Atkins-Chambers
text: Place is Great been an Awesome 2 years!!

resp.text:
Thank you Deja for the five stars!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Nick Turner
text:
This coming from a parent of two previous residents. At first glance the facility is well maintained and there was some upgrading going on the last time I was there, thats a positive. The negative I experienced was with  an individual who should have been representing the facility but instead discredited it. As a good father should I was loading my daughters furniture on my trailer to get her moved out of her apartment on 28 Jul 2016. While fastening the cargo down I saw a golf cart pull up behind me and a short round heavy set young man rolled off the cart and started running his mouth about something as he headed into the buildings breezeway. He stopped short of the building and started saying somethingto the effect of "I bet your having a better day today then you did the other nite" and" I'll make sure you dont ever get the chance to," l continued with securing the load. I then asked my daughter what was that guy talking about and why was he taunting her. She said he lived above her and it was something that happened 2 or 3 nights earlier, I then asked is he a resident or does he work there, she said both. I told her if it wasnt for her moving out I would file a complaint with the office. It was as if he was trying to start a confrontation but let it be known he was in charge. He came out of the 2nd floor apartment headed towards the golf cart, mumbled something else, but before he could leave another young man standing on a scaffold at the building next to hers. He went back to the cart and left, a minute or so later my daughter and her friend left in her car and was behind them in my truck w/trailer. As I headed out of the complex an Auburn police vehicle was heading in. I stopped and waved the officer to pass in front of me, he waved back and continued. I got on College headed towards I-85 and was pulled over, questioned about making threats against an employee at the complex, told I was identified as the one that made the threats, my truck was identified as the vehicle that was involved, forced to stand outside of my vehicle while another officer went and got Mr Brandon Ray, the accuser, so he could identify me. Well long and longer story shortened, Mr Ray in his haste to re-inflate a situation from 2-3 nites earlier decided to call the police and put a new flame on a already extinguished iincident,  ironically against a wrong person. Not to mention that whatever had happened earlier was taken care of by the authorities nites earlier, the proper authorities !!! The whole thing was sorted out, the police explained the misunderstandings I said I understood however it was totally unnecessary, we shook hands and went our seperate ways. However, in my 90 minutes of unnecessary detainment and somewhat mild harassment I decided that Mr Ray should learn from the error in his ways. It was the "right thing to do" to use local law enforcement to handle non conforming residents or guests of residents a few nites earlier for whatever reason. When you represent a multi million dollar apartment complex always be a part of the solution and not the problem. It is the "right thing to do" to exercise the authorities to uphold and maintain rules and regulations of the property you work for and represent. It is "not the right thing to do" to taunt or badger residents or guests for any reason. It is "not the right thing to do" when you attempt to recreate a bad incident so you can change or control the outcome !!! I sincerely hope the owners of this complex takes a hard look at the many many negative things written in the reviews about the management team of the The Beacon. I hope they get proactive and make some necessary changes. I would not recommend spending money here until so. I would also recommend that if Mr Ray is going to continue working for them, he take some courses on professionalism, stay off that golf cart and do some walking. This will allow him to become better at dealing with the people who pay his wages.
This was my experience and my opinion.
Thanks, Contributing parent of the class 2017 & 2019

name: caleb covert
text: Every year we have problem after problem starting from AC not working during the beginning of fall, work orders taking forever, and then with moving during the end of the semester. It honestly should of been done during the summer and not when school is at its busiest.

name: Stuart Moon
text: Impossible for me to decide where to begin the list of everything wrong with the management here. Completely inconsiderate from day one.

name: Madison Brown
text: Please do NOT live at Eagles Reserve.  My roommates and I are miserable living here.  Maintenance requests rarely even get filed, nonetheless actually resolved.  The property manager is not helpful and has lied to us on several occasions seemingly just to make us leave her alone when we complain.  Even the executive manager has been rude and said he does not care about their reputation.  When we first moved in, the apartment was DISGUSTING.  It had obviously not been cleaned at all, and we had to clean it ourselves before we could even begin moving furniture in, but the staff didn't seem to care.  We went the first two weeks without being able to cook or wash clothes because our appliances did not work, and it took that long for our requests to be filled.  We have had bug infestations, water damage, we've been forced to move apartments due to construction, and we were told we will be forced to move AGAIN by the end of the year, but they cannot tell us when because they are so unorganized.  While we are waiting to move again, they have begun construction on the building WE LIVE IN.  It is extremely loud, begins every morning at 8:00am, and lasts until around 6:00pm.  But, of course, the property manager does not care.  Nothing gets resolved no matter how many times we express our unhappiness. Everything about Eagles Reserve is awful. Just... don't sign a lease here.

name: something something
text: New management has been awful. Internet and television never work well. Gone at the end of the month

name: Suellen Toung
text: Horrible management.  They make up the rules and change them at will.  If you try to pay rent in cash, which is legal tender in the US they will not take it.  If you  try to pay online with a debit/credit card they charge a $16 fee each time.  If you get it there on the due date, they charge a large late fee.  Basically, they want you to bring a check to them.  They are requiring each tenant in each apartment to have $100,000 of renters insurance with their name as the insured!!! So our 4 bedroom apartment will be insured for $400,000?!?!? For what?  When we moved in the painters had spray painted the apartment and not completely covered the floors so there was a haze of spray paint on the floor.  It looks like they tried to use paint thinner to clean the floor which stripped the finish.  There is an outline where they had things on the floor when they painted. . . like the table.  Worst management ever.

name: Blake Diggs
text: Management is terrible, Internet is spotty, and apartments themselves are renovated badly. Don't live here go to somewhere else

resp.text: Hi Blake, We’re sorry to hear about your disappointment with our community. We were not aware of any issues you had during your time here so we would appreciate the opportunity to hear about the unfortunate situations you’ve had with management to resolve them. We take current and former resident feedback very seriously and strive to make everyone feel accommodated. Please contact me directly at adukes@thebeaconauburn.com. Hope to hear from you soon!

name: Emily Self
text: I LOVE THE BEACON

resp.text:
THE BEACON LOVES YOU! Thanks so much for leaving us an awesome rating, Emily! We're lucky to have you.

Best,
The Beacon Mgmt.

name: Ariel Holland
text: This was literally the worst experience I've had with renting an apartment. Anything and everything you could think of has went wrong with our apartment and it has still yet to be fixed since the beginning of the year when we reported things broke. Our washer and dryer has been broke for about a month now and we submitted a maintenance work form forever ago and guess what it has not been fixed yet either.I do not recommend this place to anyone. I don't want you to have the experience like we did.

name: Jasmyn B
text: This Place Is TERRRRIBBBLE. VERY unorganized. There is always a problem. there is mold in one of roommates bathroom. if you do decide to stay here, let them show you your apartment that you will be living in, BEFORE you sign for anything or PAY the rent!!!!!!

name: Jantzen Lee
text: literally the worst apartment complex available. we had to move between a total of three apartment buildings over a year, refused to replace a broken washer/drier.

name: Austin Osborn
text: Decent choice for an apartment in Auburn.

resp.text: We appreciate the 4 stars, Austin! Let us know if you have any feedback on how we can make the community even better.

name: Shengkai Xu
text: Very good place

resp.text:
Thank you for the five stars Shengkai!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Jessica Foy
text: cool place

resp.text: Hi, Jessica! Thanks for the 4-star review! We'd love to earn that last remaining star, so please let us know if we can be of assistance in any way.

name: foreign gamer
text: the staff is cool

resp.text:
Thank you so much for the five stars, William! We are so glad to learn that you have had a positive experience, and we'll be sure to pass on your kind words about our staff!
Best,
The Beacon Management

name: Alexander Noal
text: the place

resp.text: The review. :)

name: Rock SunY
text: so bad

resp.text: Hello, we're sorry to see you have had a negative experience at our community. We would love to hear your feedback.  Please email leasing@thebeaconauburn.com so we can discuss further.

name: Zifan Chen
text: Awful

name: Su K
text:
(Translated by Google) If you're coming through Global, you can go for a little bit more money; if you can't face the sudden cockroaches that emerged suddenly and can't withstand the spiders that come out of the way, try to repair your troubled machines Some of the staff are nice and can be repaired quickly, but they don't fix it right away. And on the map it looks like a school, but it's far from the school and far from marts like Wal-Mart. Please don't come. Beacon ,, live and know somewhere else, but real beacons are not a place to live.

(Original)
별 하나도 아까울정도입니다ㅎ어번글로벌 통해서 혹시 오실꺼면 돈 조금 더 내더라도 좋은 곳을 가세요;;언제 어디서 갑자기 생겨난 바퀴벌레를 마주하고 시도때도 없이 나오는 거미들을 견딜 수 없으면 당장 피하세요,,고장난 기계들 수리는 몇몇 직원분들은 착하셔서 빨리 수리되는 경우가 있지만 웬만하면 바로 고쳐주지를 않아요ㅎ 그리고 지도상으로는 학교랑 가까운듯처럼 보이지만 학교와 멀고 월마트같은 마트들과도 꽤 거리가 멉니다 보안도 별로 좋지않구요 그냥 피하세요 진짜 오지마세요 비컨,,,다른데 살아보고 알게되었지만 진짜 비컨은 살만한 곳이 못됩니다,,,

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Unfortunately, AUG was short on staff a few weeks before its turn. Therefore, it took a long time without knowing that all devices had maintenance problems. Soon after AUG hired someone, we received 150 work orders from them. This was on the verge of a transition and lost maintenance supervisors during this period. But it's not an excuse for not having solved the problem, but it can't be solved if it can't. Since all employees are fully employees, we have established procedures to prevent this from happening in the future.

(Original)
불행하게도, AUG은 차례가되기 몇 주 전까지 직원이 부족했습니다. 따라서 모든 장치에 유지 보수 문제가 있음을 알지 못한 채 오랜 시간이 걸렸습니다. AUG가 누군가를 고용 한 직후 우리는 그들로부터 150 개의 작업 지시를 받았습니다. 이것은 전환 직전이었으며이 기간 동안 유지 관리 감독자를 잃었습니다. 그러나 문제를 해결하지 못한 것에 대한 변명은 아니지만 문제를 해결할 수없는 경우에는 해결할 수 없습니다. 모든 직원이 완전히 직원이기 때문에 앞으로는 이러한 일이 발생하지 않도록 절차를 마련했습니다.

name: Anna Gates
text: We have only lived here for a month but we are very impressed with everything. Sherri ( plus everyone in the office ) has been so wonderful to work with when it comes to some minor hiccups we've had. We really appreciate the help she's given us and how she's handled the situation. Coming from previous apartment that didn't do these things, it's refreshing to have a property manager that cares!

resp.text: Thank you for writing this review, Anna! We appreciate the kind words and are delighted to hear of your positive experience with us. - Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Zachery Simmons
text: We have just moved into the Peppertree apartment complex this week. So far we have had a wonderful experience. The office staff went above and beyond to make sure everything is just how we wanted it. I must give a big thanks to Sherri the manager and Ashley. They have been incredible. So if you are looking for a lovely community, come over to Peppertree.

resp.text:
Welcome and thank you for your five-star rating, Zachery! We genuinely appreciate hearing when team members have been helpful and responsive. We'll remain dedicated to your satisfaction for as long as you're a member of our community. We sincerely appreciate you choosing to make your home in our community and if you need help getting settled in, please let us know. We are always here to help!
-Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Stella Laguerre
text: The hospitality and customer care that I have experienced from Sherri  has been phenomenal! She responds quickly and truly works hard to meet the need of every resident and soon to be resident. I felt welcomed, never rushed and my concerns were always taken into consideration. Thank you Pepper true for your A++ service!

resp.text: We  would like to thank you for your review and for recognizing Sherri  as a valuable member of the team.  Our staff work hard to make sure residents are always treated with respect and care. We're glad to hear that you felt welcomed and that your concerns were taken into consideration. Thank you for choosing to make your home at Pepper Tree!

name: iz quezon
text: The staff is so nice and they accommodated my needs perfectly. I appreciate the staff and all they do here so much! If you live here, you will not regret it. The community is also really kind as well.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to submit this high rating of Peppertree, Iz! — Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Marice Tatum
text: The girls I’m the office are always so helpful. I went in today and they handled it so fast. They have the best costumer service ever! You girls are so appreciated, thanks for you lady’s do, thanks for staying late because you don’t have too ms.sherry thanks for picking up that dog poop by my home as well!

resp.text: Thank you for writing this review, Marice! We appreciate the kind words and are delighted to hear of your positive experience with us. - Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Walt Russell
text: This is such an amazing community. Ashley and Sherri were the most helpful and thorough in helping me find my new home. I recommend this place and their staff to everyone I talk to! I was treated with the best hospitality and kindness at this establishment. Love my Peppertree!

resp.text: We are happy to hear that you have loved your experience, Walt. Thank you for leaving this review! - Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Jordan Pugh
text: I have called this place home for the past few years and have loved living here. I will stay here as long as they would let me! The office and maintenance crews are beyond helpful and quick to fix things!! Love my home!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We strive to offer the best for our residents and community and take pride in providing a great place to live, so your positive comments mean a great deal to us. Please let us know if we can do anything for you in the future. Thanks again! – Sherri Young, Community Director

name: Victoria Selix
text: I absolutely loved my time at the Peppertree apartments. The grounds were always well kept, staff is kind and helpful and my apartment was so spacious and nice! I recommend it!

resp.text: We are happy to hear that you loved your experience. Thank you for leaving this review! - Sherri Young, Community Directo

name: Nikki Parks
text: I have been living here for over a year now & I love it!!! The front office is very efficient & when we have a problem they are quickly to solve it. Plenty of space in the apartments plus there is a pantry. It is very very quiet in the apartment complex. I will be living here forever!!! It is awesome!!!

resp.text: Nikki, thanks for your five-star rating of Peppertree! We are happy to hear that you have loved your experience.  — Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Brooke Davis
text: I can’t say enough good things about Ms Kari and her staff at Peppertree. They are so kind and helpful no matter what the situation is. Ms. Kari goes above and beyond for all of her tenants and the maintenance guys are quick to fix any problems that may arise. I would definitely recommend Peppertree for anyone looking for a good place to call hone in Montgomery!

resp.text:
Thank yo for your high star rating, Brooke! It's great to hear that you are enjoying your stay in our community! We're happy that you've had a positive experience with our staff—that's what we expect of them, along with everyone who works in our community We hope you'll be happy here for years to come and we thank you for your residency!
-Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Len Mit
text: I love living at Peppertree Apartments! The community is nice and not too loud most of the time. I feel that living here was a great choice, and the convenience of being close to nearby food and shopping places is a great bonus! -Lenora M.

resp.text: We appreciate your five-star rating, Lenora! We aim to provide the best quality customer service and living experience for our residents. Thank you for writing this review! - Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Victoria Krupa
text: I’ve lived here a little over 2 years and have absolutely loved it!! The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating and maintenance issues are addressed promptly. I love the location near so many bars and restaurants and the pool amenity is an extra plus in the Alabama summer!

resp.text: Victoria, thank you for taking a moment to provide this glowing review of Peppertree. Our residents' comfort and satisfaction are very important to us. — Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Sonya Floyd
text: Customer service is efficient and proficient. GREAT customer service. Property manager and agent work with tenants. Communication has been effective and constant. I will most definitely recommend others!

resp.text:
Thank you for your five-star rating, Sonya! We aim to provide the best quality customer service and living experience for our residents and we're proud that it shows!  We are honored to have earned your high recommendation!
-Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Pradeep K V
text: Its  been our 4th year staying here and we enjoy it. Spacious apartment with decent amenities. Great staff. Service tickets are handled and addressed quickly. Convenience to nearby food and shopping areas is also great.

resp.text: Thank you for writing this review, Pradeep! We appreciate the kind words and are delighted to hear of your positive experience with us. - Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Alex Wagner
text: We are going on two years at Peppertree Apts and still absolutely love it here! We have become super close to all of our neighbors in our building as well as some in the building next to us! The staff is so kind and helpful, and will drop anything to assist you. Everything is extremely well kept, which I really appreciate, and they are always having a fun event at the clubhouse! By far my favorite apartment to have lived in!

resp.text:
Thank you for your five-star rating! We are thrilled that you love living in our community. Our entire team is dedicated to your satisfaction and well-being, we're happy and proud that it shows!
-Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Katie Worthy
text: I moved here in May of 2019 and for the price it’s a very nice place to live. My air conditioner went out last summer and they were so quick to fix it. They have the best staff! ❤️

resp.text: Thanks for your five-star rating and positive review of Peppertree, Katie! It's great that you're enjoying your living experience at our community. — Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Robin Dickens
text: After making the decision to relocate to Montgomery Alabama,  I was informed about Pepper Tree Apt. On my first visit I was totally assumed with the warm Welcome and Hospitality that I  I recieved from,  Miss  Sherry Young " totally made me feel at home and secure.  I didn't look anywhere else.  The  location and accommodations are truly a Blessing for me.  I got just what I wanted and needed.  Ms. Young not only walked  me through the process,  she made sure that I had an apt. On the 1st floor,  because of my Arthritis.  I am  so glad that I chose Pepper Tree  !

resp.text: Robin, thank you for this great review! We are pleased to hear that everything has been up to your expectations and we thank you for making your home in our community! Thank you. - Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Eli
text:
I have lived here for 2 years. The apartments themselves are nice, and I love the location. The office staff has always been friendly. The maintenance team has always responded promptly to maintenance issues and fixed what was needed. There has never been a pest issue in my apartment while living here. I left one star off because of the gate issues. They often do not work and are broken. The entrance by Peppertree Steaks and Wine is often driven through and the wooden panel is off to the side leaving the entrance open. Before we moved in there was a third entrance that we were told would have a gate soon, but has been chained off and was never given a gate.

DISCLAIMER
-I gave this review because Peppertree offered a chance to win a $150 gift card for leaving a review.

resp.text: Thank you, Eli, for your review of Peppertree.  It's great to know that you've enjoyed your living experience overall. Of course, we're sorry to see that the issue with the gate has caused you to deduct one star, and we would love an opportunity to address it with you. Kindly contact us at (334) 273-0877 or email me at cdpeppertree@liverangewater.com to  discuss your review in greater detail in an effort to regain your confidence. Thank you. — Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: BIGG JENK
text: Peppertree iApts. is a great place to live. The management staff lead by Ms. Kari are a super great team.  The maintenance team are quick to respond to any problems you may have. The complex itself is kept to a high maintenance. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great place to live .

resp.text: Thank you for your high rating, Bigg Jenk!  We always appreciate hearing when our team is doing a great job and we  are honored to have earned your high recommendation! - Kari Sweeney, Community Director

I could not have made a better decision moving into PEPPERTREE Apartments!!!!

name: Leesy Mcnealy
text:
I have lived in peppertree for a year now. The atmosphere here is wonderful. Quiet complex and the staff is absolutely wonderful. I feel safe living in peppertree ! Maintenance also responds to orders very promptly! 5/5!

-Myleesia

resp.text: Thanks for your five-star rating of Peppertree! We love receiving such positive feedback from happy residents. — Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Chyna Patterson
text: My name is Tankiya Hall. I am a resident of Peppertree Apartments and has been for over a year now. Since the inception of becoming residents with Peppertree; Sherri and Deanna has been the absolute best with customer service, hasty job order response, and professionalism. My daughter and I have packages come at least twice a week and we have always been appeased with getting timely notifications that our packages have arrived. Sherri is a ray of sunshine 🌞 for the front office! She is always kind. Recently, I met Kari, the new property manager, and she treated me as though we had met before. Kari seem to be a kind person as well. They always say, “if you need anything, let us know.” I can candidly say that they are on point, every single time!!! On a regular basis as I am sitting on my balcony, I observe how the courtesy officer is always riding around with the blue lights. There are times when I have seen the courtesy officer, literally walk around with his flashlight. Peppertree has been a great place to live!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Tankiya. We are pleased to hear you are enjoying your time with us! - Kari Sweeney, Community Director

name: Kayla Campora
text: I wish I didn't have to move! I have lived here since Aug 2017 and have had no problems. The front office staff is amazing and the maintenance guys are quick to fix whatever problem you have! They are very attentive to your needs and always welcoming. The front office, DeAnna is such a sweet heart. Anna was amazing too (recently moved to another apartment complex). If I didn't have to move for a job, I definitely would have renewed my lease again. Never had problems with any insects. The prices here are unbeatable for the size and bedrooms. They keep the grounds clean and litter free. It's a really quiet area, never experience any problems with noise or crimes. I highly recommend living here if you are looking for a place to call home!

resp.text: We wish you didn't have to either! Thank you so much for sharing this wonderful 5-star review with us. We're so pleased to read you've received such great service from our team and have thoroughly enjoyed your time with us. We will pass your kind words along to the team. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything! - Deanna Moreland, Community Director

text: Been staying here for a year now. Requested renovations since the rent will go up if we are to renew and the amount is already expensive , too expensive for outdated appliances . Many tenants have requested renovations and it’s like no one listens or even cares. Office staff is really sweet but could be more helpful. Maintenance is great and quick!

We would be more than happy to answer any questions you may have, so please stop by the office, give us a call at 334-273-0877 or send me an email at cdpeppertree@matrixresidential.com.
