text: Great reception from one Eric,keep it up

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review.

name: Julie Sousa
text: Lived here before, while they had specials going on and considering moving back,  depending on prices.

resp.text: Julia, we're so happy to hear that you're considering moving back to our lovely community. If you have any questions regarding our apartment homes then don't hesitate to give us a call. We hope to hear from you soon!

name: Kai Animations
text: Its okay for the price. My mom moved out there 2 months ago, her bathroom wallpaper is falling off. The kitchen and bathroom sink has been stopping up. Maintenance has been out to fix them each time but still she just moved in.

name: Min Lameya Kimbrough Huffman
text: I Love It, is Home!

name: Viva La Lucy
text: Friendly staff, very clean.

resp.text: Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!

name: Henry Johnson
text: Very Nice and Quiet

resp.text: Henry, we so appreciate this five-star rating of The Park at Sunderland! Your feedback lets us know that we've accomplished our goals of offering a top-notch living community; if you have anything else to add, stop by the office or give us a call.

name: Amazon Beauty85
text: OVER PRICED!!

resp.text: We are sorry to learn that your time in our community has not resulted in a five-star experience. Our team can assure you that our rates remain a fair and accurate reflection of the current local market. Please give us a call so that we may help improve your residency. Thank you.

name: Shanna Burrell
text: The inside of my apartment was beyond what I imagined I am always bragging about how wonderful and professional Sherise and Jenn are. My move in was very swift and I love how Sherise communicated with me throughout everything!!!

name: D. Roller
text: I’ve been staying here for almost a year and I cannot complain! It’s quiet, Kristen in the office is so kind in every interaction I’ve had with her, and maintenance will get jobs done in a timely fashion. I’m grateful to be a tenant here!

name: Ketta Suttles
text: I’ve been staying here for a year now and I must say the staff from management to maintenance has been amazing. Very helpful and fast with any issues u may have. Understanding and cooperative without taking away from their job duties gives me more reasons to renew my lease and stay a bit longer.. I normally don’t do reviews but I felt this was necessary because I’ve ran across some horrible apartment managers and their maintenance team was just as bad but this team makes up for all that.. No bugs or anything crawling through the walls after a couple months and pest control always on time..

name: Heather Brandon
text: Lived here for two years before a work related move. The property manager and the maintenance man are both very nice. Chris the maintenance man is fantastic for getting things fixed in a timely manner. Convenient location to lots of shopping is a plus.

name: Katelynn K
text: Me and my partner have lived here for almost a year, i love it here! Quiet and nice community our landlord is amazing, and she always greets us kindly and helps with any issue asap! Matinence is quick and well done, also the guy who does it all is super kind, we plan to stay here for awhile.

name: Vonche Elston
text: Me and my fiance been here for 7 months and we love it quiet area kristy and chris are so nice and helpful from day one if i needed anything they are always there for me so if you're looking for great people to help you and a quiet area and nice neighbors come and see kristy

name: Elder Sytrena Sanders
text: Wonderful place to stay.. Kristen,the property manager is Awesome...close to restaurants and stores...I absolutely enjoyed it.

name: Ur mOm
text: Run! This complex has no quiet hours. My coworker lives here currently and comes to work every day with severe lack of sleep issues due to the noise in her apartment. Granted the people who live upstairs are not maliciously creating noise, but any apartment complex should know that you don't put a family of 6 or more above a single person. I can confidently say that her living conditions are unbearable because I have heard it first hand. It is difficult to carry on a conversation in her apartment because of either the bed squeaking throughout the night or the children running from room to room late into the night and early mornings. If you need to sleep during the night or early mornings and your upstairs neighbors feel differently you are at their mercy for the duration of your lease. Beware!

name: Andrew In
text:
Please disregard Alabama Crappie Adventures's review, that person does not even live here. I have been living in this location for about 4 months now, but I would like to say that for the cost, this place is worth every penny.

I live in a 2 bed 1 bath location, and the management is very helpful if you have any issues. Just go and talk to them.

Also Spectrum has 200 Mbps going through here so the internet speed is also amazing.

If there is a issue, they always get it fixed. Also did I tell you that this exit on the 65 is where the back up usually starts when going home at 5? so that you can avoid that also if possible!

Also they have the best inset control as well, only saw one roach so far but it was dead. I believe he got through when I left the door open, but just to let you know it died so all is well that ends well.

name: Kathryn Justice
text: Since we have moved in, we have had multiple leaks. Just last week our sink leaked and flooded our master bathroom and now this week our hot water heater has leaked into the spare bedroom closet. These aren’t the only two leaks. We had one prior to moving in and one, two weeks after. We have only lived here six weeks. We put in a call to the office manager and she never returned our call. You’re paying for the amenities and that’s it. The gates don’t work half the time either. These are definitely WAY overpriced for what you get. I have lived in apartments before and never experienced so many leaks. I wouldn’t recommend living here. The only reason I’m giving a two star is for the nice pool, playground, and friendly community.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear of the inconvenience you have endured, Mrs. Justice. I will be meeting with the maintenance team first thig today and will contact you with a plan of action to complete any repairs needed as soon as possible ~Property Manager

name: Lindsey Prescott
text: We loved our stay at The Charleston Apartments. They are beautiful and up to date. The grounds are always clean and the maintenance team are awesome. Thank you Sarah for all your help! Would definitely recommend this complex to anyone!

resp.text: Greetings Lindsey, Thanks for choosing us and leaving such a great review! We are happy to read that our team has been able to provide exceptional service for you. Please let us know what we can do for you in the future.

name: Morgan Owens
text: Sarah is the only person that is even helpful and maintenance has always been great. The only two positive things about this complex. The first 3 months were great but after that their attitudes QUICKLY change. Apartments are loud and the stairwells are not kept up. In the instance that you can’t give a 60 day notice... they don’t care if you’re in the icu with a breathing tube! They don’t wanna hear you out as they simply do not care about your well being.  They’re gonna add $200 on top of the rent you’re already paying. $1200 for a 1 bedroom during a pandemic. Highly unprofessional and management is awful. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Sarah, we hate to hear that you had a negative experience and would like to discuss this further.  The property manager, Haley, will be reaching out to shortly as we hope to turn things around.  It is always our goal to provide the best possible customer service and we appreciate you reaching out.

name: Kurien Cary
text: These are hands down the nicest apartments in town. And on top of that the staff are really pleasant and do a great job at making sure all of your needs are taken care of. When I move back I'll definitely be renting from them again.

resp.text: Kurien, what a wonderful review!  We appreciate all of your kind comments as we strive to give our residents the best possible experience.  Thank you for recommendation and we hope to see you again.

name: Kristen Wilkinson
text:
The apartments and grounds are so beautiful. It almost feels like living on vacation. The pool and clubhouse are so nice. It's great to live in such a pretty apartment and have an equally pretty pool to escape to outdoors. I recommend these apartments to everyone!
Also, the management is the best! They take the needs of the tenants seriously and go out of their way to help in any type of situation.

resp.text: Thank you so  much for this great review, Kristen! We are thrilled you are so pleased with your home at Charleston!

name: Misbah Syed
text: Great place to stay! Office staff is super helpful and service requests are taken care quickly without delays. Amenities are maintained nice and clean. Additionally, management  communicate quickly on any ongoing activities and events. I would highly recommend this apartment complex if you are looking for a peaceful and secure place to stay.

resp.text:
Misbah, thank you for such kind words! We are delighted you enjoyed your time at Charleston! We hate to see you and your family go but wish you the best in your future endeavors! Thank you for calling Charleston Home!!
Charleston Management

name: Cynthia Holland
text: First apartment I have ever lived in. I sold my house and have bought another and am actually sad to move from Charleston. Ask for Sarah

resp.text: Cynthia, We appreciate the time you took to give us 5-stars! We are so happy that you are enjoyed your home here at Charleston Apartment Homes and we value your recommendation. Let us know if we can ever be of any other assistance.

name: malik mohammed
text: Nice place to live... excellent aminities... helpful staff...

resp.text: Malik! We love having you as a part of our Community. Thank you for the great review, we hope to serve all of your housing needs for a very long time!

name: Shan'te Johnson
text: Been here for only 3mo and so far I love it here! Any issue I’ve had has been resolved in a timely fashion. The community is clean and is very attractive!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Shan'te for taking the time to give such a kind review, We will continue to work hard to maintain your happiness here at Charleston!

name: A E
text: I have lived in at least 4 rental apartments in 3 different states of the USA and I honestly say that Charleston Apartment Homes is the best so far. 5 stars

resp.text: We are so glad to hear  you say that! Thank you for choosing Charleston as your home!

name: Sandra Myers
text: I love living here! Everything is so beautiful. The grounds are well maintained. Upon entering your apartment at night the stairs are well lite, making it a safe place for you and your family! Sara is the best! She is so kind and helpful, She guided us through the whole paperwork process.  If you decide to check the Charleston out ask for Sara!!

resp.text: Sandra, thank you for taking the time to leave us this incredible five star review.  We agree that it is a beautiful property and are so happy to see that you are loving your home here.   Please let us know if we can be of any assistance.   We appreciate you choosing Charleston Apartments as your home.

name: RedComet
text: Lived here for a year and a half, staff was always really friendly and helpful. Community activities/engagement was top notch, not what you’d expect in a city as small as Mobile.  Maintenance was always quick and gave you a heads up. Pool is really large and always clean. If you’re looking for a nice apartment and this is your best option for West Mobile.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a five star review.  As a staff, we work hard each day to ensure that we are meeting the expectation of our residents.  If we can ever be of service, please do not hesitate to call the office.

name: Isi Moreira
text: Horrible management. Don't move in here; there are other apartment complexes that have better management than them.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Isi. We appreciate all feedback we receive from our residents and continuously use it to improve our customer service. We would love the opportunity to discuss your experience, please give us a call at 251.281.2701.

name: Chris Wood
text:
I’ve lived at Charleston for over 4 years. These are amongst the best apartments you will find in Mobile.

The location is great with easy access to the interstate and West Mobile. Being on Sollie, traffic isn’t bad and there’s never trouble getting out like some other apartments I’ve been to.

The staff has always been friendly and went above and beyond from the front office to the maintenance. I greatly appreciate that on the rare occasion that we have a need to call maintenance, that they are quick, but take the time to make sure it’s done right.

Even the other residents I have met have all been friendly. Everything is always clean and well maintained and overall it’s been a fantastic place to live over the past few years. I would recommend to anyone looking for a great place to live.

resp.text: Chris, thank you for all of the great feedback and taking the time to leave this incredible five star review.  Our team works really hard to provide the best for our residents and we look forward to sharing this review with them.  We appreciate you choosing Charleston Apartment Homes.

name: Ray
text: Mixed review here. First off the office staff is Nice, they are always polite and willing to help. We fell in love with the layout of the apartment, Unfortunately it’s hard to fully enjoy it. I get apartment life is not going to be completely quite, but the level of noise that comes from the master bedroom next door is ungodly. The walls literally shake. They have a surround sound set up and have it on full blast all day and night. I’m never able to go to sleep or take a mid-day nap until they decide to. It’s literally made me miserable, it’s like living next to a nightclub. I’ve called multiple times but nothing has helped. I appreciate a good sound system, I have one in my living room but I’ll always be respectful of those around me. If I hear a knock I’m turning it down, period. Guess it’s just me. I was planning to stay a few years but unfortunately I plan to move as soon as the lease is up. If that problem was solved I would love to stay because the neighborhood is beautiful.

resp.text: Ray, we appreciate your feedback and hate to see you are having a negative experience.  We need 3rd party validation of the excessive noise when it is occurring.  Please contact the front office and/or courtesy officer when the noise is occurring so that we can take further actions to address your concerns.  We are looking further into this now and hope to make your experience with us a much better one.

name: Heather Wilson
text: I love coming home to my beautiful apartment!  It feels upscale, but is still warm and homey.  There are also tons of pros to living at Charleston, including the biggest pool I’ve ever seen.  I’ve been pleased with the office staff and haven’t had any issues.  I plan to renew my lease!

resp.text: Hi Heather.  We are so happy to see that you are loving your home here as well as the amenities.  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave this five star review.  We appreciate you continuing to choose Charleston Apartments as your home.

name: JOHN DANDALE
text: I love it here.  The staff is amazing and always very prompt in responding to different matters. The staff is constantly having events to get the community involved.  Glad I chose to live here.  It is also a quiet community and also have courtesy officers on site and it just make me feel a little safer.

resp.text: Hi John.  Thank you for the lovely feedback and five star review.  We agree that we have a great team here and appreciate your kind words.  Please let us know if we can ever be of any assistance here at Charleston Apartment Homes.

name: Victoria Peavy
text: The Charleston is a great place for your family!! The amenities are amazing and always so clean! The office and maintenance staff are so helpful and quick to return your call!!

resp.text: Victoria, thank you for the five star review here at Charleston Apartment Homes and kind comments.  We are happy to see you are enjoying the amazing amenities here and appreciate you!

name: Jaime Lee Ezell
text: We absolutely love this apartment complex. It’s beautiful, clean, and has amazing amenities. If you get a chance, ask for Sarah to help you! Sarah is the best! She has been super helpful to us the entire time we’ve lived here, she’s an amazing worker!

resp.text: Jaime, thank you for the incredible five star review.  Our team works hard to provide the best customer service and keep the community looking it's best.  We are happy to see you are loving your apartment home here at The Charleston!

name: Lauren Luna
text: I haven't moved here yet. My review is based on my experience with them so far. I am moving here from out of state, i am currently down here for a few days looking for an apartment. From the moment I walked in Paige greeted me with a friendly smile and welcoming vibe. She was very patient with me and answered all the millions of questions I had. The community is beautiful and they offer 3 different options for your apartments (floor and cabinet colors), I have never seen that offered before. I love that it is gated and only accessible for residents. I look forward to this being my future home.

resp.text: Lauren, thank you so much for taking the time to  leave us this wonderful five star review and kind comments.  We appreciate you coming by Charleston Apartment Homes and look forward to you becoming a part of our community.  Please feel free to contact us if we can be of any additional assistance.  Thanks again.

name: Byrd’s Nest
text: I signed a 13 month lease at Charleston. For Mobile, they are nice, updated, and spacious. When we first moved in, we were extremely satisfied with the place: great customer service, nice grounds, and quick response to maintenance requests. However, after three or so months, an up stairs neighbor moved in with two kids. We could hear EVERYTHING. For the price, you would think that the walls wouldn’t be so paper thin. I could hear conversations, the garbage disposal (not to mention it would even rattle the ceiling), I would hear when they vacuumed, their kids would sound like a marching band all hours of the day/night. I’ve lived in apartments before, but I have never experienced anything like that. Even cheaper apartments never sounded like that. I had a new born and only wondered if my neighbors could here him cry at night. Towards the end of our lease (month 12-13), we started to feel stuffy in the master bedroom and ended up discovering black mold around the windows (in both the master and guest bedrooms). I wish I would have gotten a picture, but between the move and living with my parents for most of the last month, I forgot. Lastly, upon moving out, we were told that we did not owe anything after a walk through inspection. the girl who assisted us, I think her name is Sarah not sure, only requested that we check the tubs (which are super cheap and hard to clean) and the oven. After we checked those and cleaned those, we signed a paper stating we did not owe anything. A week later we received an email stating we owed $468.26 in carpet damages. The girl who did our walk through tried saving herself and told the manger that she told us about the carpet; however, she only mentioned the oven and tubs. I believe I could have gotten the carpet clean (only 4-5 little spots). Just very disappointed with the entire experience to say we spent OVER $12,000 in rent to be charged almost $500 for carpet in ONE bedroom.

resp.text: Byrd, we hate to see that you had a negative experience and would like the opportunity to address your concerns.  Please contact us at  (251) 281-2701.

name: Vivianna Wu
text: This is the best apartment complex in Mobile! All the staff are extremely nice and helpful! Sarah and Rebecca are amazing! Not to mention the neighbors are all very friendly!

resp.text: Vivi, thank you for the amazing five star review.  We appreciate your feedback and agree that Charleston is the best apartment complex in Mobile!

name: Adam Gautier
text: The staff are friendly and readily available. Maintenance staff are always prompt and do whatever is required every time. Newly renovated rooms are spacious and modern. Fiber internet is great!

resp.text: Adam, we work hard to provide our residents with the superior customer service and are pleased to see we have succeeded with you and are happy that you are loving the renovations. Please let us know if we can ever be of any assistance.  Thank you for choosing Charleston Apartment Homes.

name: Caitlin Brinkman
text: I am only giving two stars for the indoor maintenance team, which has improved greatly lately. Otherwise, I would give a one star. One word to rate this place is trashy. Trashy people and trashy grounds. My husband and I have lived here for about nine months now, and the standards for the kind of people management has allowed here has gone down. Not sure of change of management or not, but we have been sorely disappointed with the people that have been allowed to moved in, not to mention loud as well (we have to constantly listen to loud music until 11:00-12:00 in the night and have filed complaints on separate occasions to no avail). Random pieces of trash that have been purposefully left by residents are just outside the surrounding areas of my apartment. The stairs and walkways/hallways are also in desperate need of cleaning (have not been cleaned in months) and are so disgusting that I am embarrassed to have guests over. To say the least, the only thing going for this place is the excellent and prompt maintenance that came a day after I called to fix some things. Do yourself a favor and live elsewhere, unless you are alright with trash in all meanings of the word. We are not renewing our lease and do not feel safe here anymore.

resp.text: Caitlin, we hate to see that we have not been able to meet your expectations and would like the opportunity to address any concerns you have.  We always go by our Rental Selection Guidelines that are posted on website to screen potential tenants.  We hope that all of your issues have been addressed but if not, please call us at (251) 281-2701.

name: Mike Tyson
text: It was a wonderful place to live until the management changed the standards to accept new resident's application. They lowered the standards so they can get more people in. The diversity of this community has changed significantly since then. It is not worth it paying this much of money no more. You can pay way less in other communities with same level and class of residents. A lot of old residents moved out because of this issue, and that's why I'm moving out in couple of weeks myself.

resp.text: Mike, we appreciate your feedback and would love to get more details.  Our application approval standards have not lowered and the income requirements were recently increased.  It is our goal to always deliver the best possible customer service and we would like the opportunity to address your concerns.  Please contact us at (844) 343-5285.  Thank you.

text: I have lived here since Charleston opened its doors for residents . For the most part it has been a delightful experience.  The girls in the office have always tried to keep me happy and when they couldnt it wasnt them but the big whigs who own the  property.  But the fact that Im still here proves that these office girls are tops  . Love the maintenance guys always on the move and working to do needed repairs.

name: Angela Putman
text: Mixed review, unfortunately. Quite nice property (especially for Mobile). Renovated units are in terrific shape. I never experienced any issues with noise or unsavory characters. My neighbors mostly kept to themselves but were friendly. The maintenance team went above and beyond for me time & time again (including two water leaks and misc minor problems). However, the office staff was consistently unprepared, disorganized, error-prone and very unwilling to admit or apologize for mistakes. Service and attitudes were so poor that this is my first ever Google review -- it was that bad. I had a great experience with Hayley, the GM, but she's also ultimately responsible for her office staff's issues. Just keep expectations low on the admin aspects involved and you'll enjoy the property.

text:
BED BUG INFESTED! Don't move here!
My mother returned 3 months after surgery to come home to bedbugs. She contacted the management about it and only to be treated poorly while barely able to walk. They said they would treat it but bugs are still alive. She hasn't been able to return to her apartment in over a month and living at a hotel. She wants out of the lease and they agreed but only to give her 5 days to move out. Her furniture and apartment still have bedbugs and she is unable to return to even get her things. It's absolutely ridiculous they are treating one of their tenants this way! Looks like nice apartments but poorly managed and way over priced!

resp.text: Rebecca, we appreciate your feedback and would like to address your concerns.  It is our goal to provide the best customer service and hate to hear that we have not met your expectations.  Please have your mom, the lease holder, contact us asap so we can clear up any unresolved issues.

text: I've really enjoyed my time while living here these last several years. The staff is always so helpful and corrects any maintenance issues I might have in a fast manner. No complaints at all and I would highly recommend this apartment complex!

name: Richard Blake Douglas
text:
The apartments where nice on the outside, and OK on the inside. Most certainly over priced for what they were. Walls and ceilings are paper thin, which resulted in multiple noise issues. I complained a few times, but nothing ever happened. Parking was also an issue. I had to rent a garage just so I had parking. Management is aware of the issue and they added a few spots toward the back, but those also filled up quickly.
Overall, these are way over priced for what they are. The property and pool area are nice, but there are other complexes that can easily compete with what Charleston has to offer at a much reasonable price.

resp.text: Richard, we appreciate your feedback and would love the opportunity to address your concerns.  Please contact the front office at your earliest convenience.  Thank you.

Previously lived in Cypress Cove and was consistently 10x happier with my home and would recommend them ANY day over this place. Needless to say - will not be renewing lease.

resp.text: Chase, we hate to see that you are having a negative experience here and would love the opportunity to address your concerns.   Please contact us at your convenience. text: Very disappointed in this apartment complex. First few years were great living there. However,  the last couple months prior to move out was terrible and even now 4 months after moving I'm still having problems with them. I paid all my final cost when I received that they have did final walk and my bill was posted. I paid it. So months later there was a "glitch" in there system with took money out account without my permission and I noticed today that they have sent the same amount that was "glitched" in their system to collection. Still no one has contacted me nor have tried to corrected the issue. I will be contacting the better business bureau and my representative because this is not right for a tenant that was faithful to a complex for years with no complaints or issues. HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED.

resp.text: Nicole, we appreciate your feedback and are looking into this further.  It is our goal to provide the best possible customer service and we apologize for any inconveniences.  Please give us a call at (844) 343-5285 as we hope to resolve any concerns.

name: Scot Maciver
text:
***If You're Not Crazy Now, You Will be When you Leave!!!!***

Used to be good. Now they have remodeled with plank flooring (mimics wood) and these apartments were not
designed for that. If you move here you better get an apartment on the top floor. Even before with carpet I could somewhat hear my neighbors upstairs and next to me due to the walls being paper thin, but now it's 100 times worse. Now it sounds like a zoo above me. Even the new neighbor above me stopped me and asked if the noise was bad. I guess he heard me banging on the walls because it was driving me crazy. They woke me up at 2:30 am the other morning and I'm sure they heard me banging the walls and cursing at the top of my lungs. They do have a new baby that constantly runs all day and night. The sad thing is I read reviews of others complaining to Management about this and when I asked about it on two separate occasions, two different members of Management lied to me and said they haven't received complaints when I know for a fact they have. With these new floors, it's not just noise that's bad, it's miserable because you can feel the vibration as they walk around. It's nerve racking and when I complained one response I got was "well it's no different than when it was carpet". Trust me, it's different. Typical BS... staff taking it personally and don't want to take a complaint seriously.

The next issue I have which, seems very minuscule with the noise issues, is that about 8 or 9 months ago they had the fire alarm company doing some maintenance work. Several of the apartments required them to actually come in and cut hole in the ceiling in the living area. They said that Management had a list of apartments that required this and they would be coming back around to fix it. So, not only was there a hole the size of of an iPad, the contractor was a klutz and dropped his drill, hammer, and other tools a few times, and caused the pipe to leak from the ceiling onto the carpet, which I handled my self. When he dropped the tools he scuffed the walls, and put a few noticeable dings in the sheet rock. He stated that it would be all fixed. Well a couple of weeks go by and I asked staff about it and they acted like they had no idea but they would come out and fix everything. That never happened. A month or so goes by and I ask again. Finally got someone from Maintenance to come by and at least patch the whole in the ceiling so i wouldn't have to look at pipes and worry about a rat or some other creature falling out of the whole while I'm watching TV. Well after he patched in the ceiling, that's the last I heard from them regarding this issue. The hole never got smoothed out and never got the ceiling textured. I went to look at a model home with the head manager and I asked about my ceiling stuff and she said she would have someone come out. I asked if I needed to put in a maintenance request so they wouldn't forget but she told me that was not necessary. That never got fixed and I just got tired of asking about it.

I've got nothing negative to say about the maintenance crew. On the few occasions I needed something they've always been prompt and resolved all maintenance related issues.

So basically, I'm paying a thousand bucks a month for a two bedroom apartment and I've got to look at a hole in my ceiling and dings in my walls. But nothing tops the noise issue. It is terrible. I'm miserable every day and it's driving me nuts.

resp.text: Scot, we hate to see that you are having such a negative experience and are looking into this further.   A member of our management will be in touch as we would like to address your concerns.

name: Kim Brown
text: Be sure to check the heating and ac unit before you sign. There was no central heat when I moved in. Maintenance was requested, two days later there was a written note it had been fixed….it was not. Upon inspection of the heating unit, the wires had been rigged unprofessionally. Fire hazard. I had no other choice but to move as it was February. Also before signing the lease, watch for the hidden costs they put in an don’t include in the initial rent you think your going to pay.

Our team strives to answer residents' requests as promptly as possible, and we want to be able to do the same for you. I'd like to invite you to stop by our office and bring up this issue with our staff so we may work to resolve this issue as soon as we can. Looking forward to connecting and improving your stay!

name: Nigel Blake
text: I am surprised that anyone would speak harshly about the leasing office and Ms.Valrie. Summer Trace has opened their arms to accept individual from all ethnic groups . Although I believe that persons who have added bad reviews all have  a right to express themselves, however, are they being completely fair and unbiased about it?. Some of these  persons who have added these negative reviews  aren't happy that the complex is home to a diverse group of people. I believe there should be diversity and love  within a community such as Summer Trace Apartments. Everyone should be able to respect each other and not cause any discomfort whether by playing loud music, doing laundry at odd hours at nights etc. We can all cohabitate and be happy if we set boundaries within out own space. I have not seen any instance of outburst of mass indiscipline among the black  or jamaicans within the community. I will not say there might not have been a one off case but that I do not know of. I  know that everywhere has it's good and bad but I'm sure summer Trace does not consist of more bad than good. I know Ms Valerie is doing her best  to make this place a better one.

resp.text: Thank you for reviewing, Nigel. We seek to provide our residents with the very best in apartment living at Summer Trace Apartments, so we appreciate your compliments to the exceptional customer care you've received from Valerie and the team. We look forward to providing you with helpful service during your residency. Please reach out if we can assist you in the future.

name: Glorious Living
text: I just want to say how thankful I am to see how much hard work is going on, our pool has NEVER EVER looked this good, the grounds look amazing and the dumpster areas have never been kept up this well. The maintenance man is doing a wonderful job. I'm excited to see we have a someone who actually wants to make this a better place for us residents. Hats off to you Maintenance!

resp.text: Thank you for the incredibly kind words for our grounds and our maintenance team! We work hard to make sure our community looks amazing and our residents are proud of where they live. Please feel free to reach out if you need anything or have any further feedback. Have a great day!

name: Gulf Dreams
text:
Summer Trace still can’t seem to keep a management company, there’s been three in the past year - with the latest suddenly sprung upon us today (06/25/19).
A few years back this place was an absolutely wonderful place to live... Until they began accepting HUD welfare recipients and allowing every type of filthy, loud ghetto trash, the kind of people who refuse to follow rules, scum who blasts music all hours of the day and night, throw trash in the parking lot and talk like everybody on the property wants to hear them, all while living in a place they can’t afford - so the taxpayers get to pay the majority of their rent while they destroy what was a beautiful apartment community. (Management won’t even attempt to make them obey the rules, probably in fear of being labeled “racist” if they dare expect them to follow rules.)
Naturally when this happened, all of the decent quiet inhabits became disgusted with the unruly welfare trash and moved out. Of course the management doesn’t care - They still get their money whether it be from quality residents who work hard or from the government that subsidizes the lazy welfare scum who’ve moved in and destroyed the place.
If you’re one of the piles of lazy filth swimming in America’s dumpster of welfare slime and unwilling to live where you can afford, check out Summer Trace where you can pay cents on the dollar while destroying the property and us taxpayers will cover the rest. If you’re an honest, clean and hardworking citizen looking for a nice apartment on the Island, DON’T FALL FOR THE LIES that Summer Trace management has become so well known for, they will say anything convenient at that moment without a thought as to whether it’s true or a lie.
And if you should decide you’d like to live in this ever-expanding ghetto, feel free: But remember to never take the property managers word for ANYTHING, ever. Get it in writing because if you don’t, it didn't happen. I guess that’s just how deceptive liars operate.

name: Paridise Beach
text: Seems like the new maintenance man is really  trying to turn this place around. I was able talk to him for a few minutes, he's very personable and seems to have alot of experience under his belt. Great to actually see someone working to clean this place up!

resp.text: Thank you so much for this fantastic review and for leaving a shout-out for one of the team members who make this community so special. There's nothing we love more than receiving this kind of feedback. We hope we can improve the community and we hope you won't hesitate to give us little progress reports along the way.

name: Lorri Ansley
text:
I lived at Summer Trace Apartments for 3 years. For the first two years it was great.The property manager Jeanna was wonderful and attentive and the maintenance man, Isaac was quick and responsive to any problems that you had. Then, the apartments were bought out by a company called Allegiant. After the buyout, Jeanna and Isaac, left.

Summer Trace / Allegiant,  couldn't keep a property manager nor a maintenance man, from there on. The maintenance man that was there, threw work requests into a drawer, literally, chapter 13.While I resided there, I may have called maintenance, 4 times in 3 years. The following are incidents and reasons on my decision to move out ASAP:

1) My a/c broke down. It took a month to get repaired, despite my numerous office visits, phone calls and emails.
2) I received a letter from the Gulf Shores Utilities stating that my water usage was unusually high based on my 2 years of living there. I took the letter, my high utility bills to the office, requesting they find out what was going on. I also called and emailed about this issue. My request sat dormant for 5 months, until my neighbor below me contacted the office about water running into his apartment and black mold. Then, Summer Trace, started trying to fix the issue. They never offered to move my neighbor into another vacant apartment, forced him to live in apartment several weeks with water and black mold. They told me that they were going to tear up my floor. I asked how could I live like that, being where they were going to tear up my floor, was my only entry on the 2nd floor. There was no response. It was fixed though, without my flooring being torn up.
3) During my last year, there were apartments with 14 - 15 people living in them. This is against the law and a fire hazard
4) Some tenants would take trash to dumpster and throw trash on ground at dumpster. Needless to say, there was trash all over the premises
5) Lastly, during the time, with my water issue, I received a letter from Summer Trace / Allegiant, saying that my rent was going up again, 3rd year in a row rent increase, with ALL the issues. That was it !!!
I hope this will assist anyone else looking to spend their hard earned money on rent, for a place like this. Summer Trace, rather Allegiant,  has no respect for their tenants well being or their quality of life.

resp.text: Lorri, please accept our apologies that your living experience at our community was less than optimal. We never like to hear that a resident departed our community with unpleasant feelings about our community and our team, as our goal is to serve our residents with professional service and transparent explanations of our fees and policies. Our team is committed to treating all residents equitably and fairly. We apologize that you feel this wasn't the case, and we would be more than happy to review your account with you. Please reach out to us at 251-968-1700 or summertrace@allegiantmgt.com. Thank you.

name: Anna Moreno Siino
text: Property Management is Horrible and has been since the first company I delt with in 2013!! That's right 6 years!! Many have come and gone! But this one is by far the worst!! No response to 3 request for maintenance MOLD!! Is a serious issue you need to address or a LAWSUIT is waiting! Your system for request on line is worthless if you don't respond.I just checked your online system and now there isn't even a record of it!! And what's your screening process for new applicants?? Do you even know what's going on in your building?? Time to pay attention!!

resp.text: Anna, we are sorry to hear that you have had some difficulty getting a hold of our maintenance team. Normally our team is quite prompt and we apologize that this has not been reflected in your experience. As a long time resident, your satisfaction is very important to us and we would encourage you to stop by the office at your soonest convenience so that we may discuss your feedback in further detail and nail down a more concrete time to address your maintenance issues.

name: benjamin powell
text: I lived here for almost 10 months and decided to leave due to the air conditioner problems and the neighbors. My thermostat stayed between 76-78 degrees the whole summer and was the most uncomfortable sleep I've ever had. The apartment refused to fix it and even my neighbors had to put two window units in their apartment just to keep cool. This place is a joke and smells of cigarettes even in a nonsmoking apartment. There was never enough parking spaces and the pool always looked nasty.

name: douglas e. hazard
text:
Constant late night parties in building 4 continue to be a problem. Concerns seem to not be an issue. Hard to get any quality sleep. Would stay away from this area.

I have contacted them. The gatherings persist with no regard to their neighbors. I have no options at this point.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We do ask our residents to be mindful of their neighbors. Please contact the community manager directly if this continues to be a problem for you.

name: Bryan Hamlin
text:
Can almost never contact anybody at the office by phone as there’s hardly ever an answer, just voicemail. The office door often says OPEN midday, yet the door is locked and the lights are out. Quite often the office clerk / property manager leaves for lunch break at noon and puts a “will return at 1pm” but she doesn’t return for sometimes until well after 2pm. Numerous and repeated complaints about trashy neighbors blaring music, partying and yelling half the night go unaddressed, but they’re sure to leave a threatening note at their door first thing if their rent is late.

Don’t move here unless you want to pay premium prices to live in a complex that resembles Section 8 Welfare Housing due to Balfour Beatty property management allowing Summer Trace to quickly decend into a ghetto.

UPDATE:
As seen below, the community pool now reflects the Summer Trace standards.

name: Diamond Skies
text: new mgt started last month and has sent out one memo so far. it said the online payment system would be available on april 1. today is april 2 and the system still says it has been disabled by the property mgt company. this place has a rep of lying and not following through, the new mgt is not off to a good start. same sh** different day

name: Waverly Bohannon
text: I have been inquiring about an apartment for a week now and have yet to get anyone on the phone and when I stop by the office is always closed...

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Waverly. Please accept our sincere apologies that this was your first impression of our community here at Summer Trace Apartments. We strive to provide a high level of customer care, and we're sorry if that's not what you received. We invite you to contact us directly at 251-968-1700 or summertrace@allegiantmgt.com to discuss this further. We hope to hear from you soon!

name: B W
text: Great customer service!  I stopped I. To have a problem with my grandma's apt fixed.  They were amazing!

name: Jim Aicone
text: Going on 3 plus years and rent has been raised 5 times already. Management has changed multiple times as well regardless of who's in charge things don't get done in a timely manner. Will not replace old and broken appliances, they just try to fix over and over. Will not replace carpet or other upkeep issues, said when we move out those items will be replaced for new tenants. Roof has a leak and bedroom has a waterstain stretching the entire lenght of the ceiling. Soda machines by the pool just take money over and over again. Poop bags for dogs run out and goes almost 2 weeks before they are restocked, even after numerous requests to be filled. Average turnaround for any issue or request is a minimum of 4 days before it is noticed it seems. Then another few to get done. The last rent hike I called to see about available units. It was cheaper to move out into another unit by almost $200, and gain another bedroom, and new appliances and basic upgrades. Silly I know but that's why I'm not happy with the overall complex. I do appreciate having a roof over my head.

name: Melissa Copeland
text: Nice apartments. Good location. Clean landscaping.

name: Lacey Herring
text: There's trash everywhere and the complex will refuse to fix your air conditioner. I sat in a 78 degrees apartment all summer. This place is trash and I would never recommend a place that doesn't care about thier tenants! Beware all the neighbors smoke and it smells up into your apartment.

name: Judith Hitchman
text: Lived here since 12.2011 and am very pleased with everything except parking gets scarce at times.  <amagement is good, responsive.  Location is great!

name: Larry Summerville
text: Stayed at this property for roughly 8months and enjoyed my time there. Haley, the property manager, is great to work with and very responsive. She truly went above and beyond  from move in to move out. The property is well kept and a quiet neighborhood.

resp.text: We will miss you Larry, good luck in Georgia. Please let us know if we can serve you in the future!

name: Alan Cook
text: My wife and I moved to Alabama just about three weeks ago into Palladian at Fairhope.  Our experience has been excellent.  The grounds and the buildings are attractive and well maintained.  The property manager, Haley, is very friendly and her door is always open to help any resident with any issue.  Eddie, the maintenance man, is respectful and willing to fix any thing that might come up that needs a looking at in your apartment.  Anyone looking for a quality apartment should look here!

resp.text: Thank you Alan and Patty for your review!  We are happy to have you here with us :)

name: Alison Parish
text: The Palladian was a great place to live while starting a new job in Daphne!  It was spacious, clean, with plenty of green space for my puppy!  I loved the tall ceilings and the little patio!  It was very private and I enjoyed my morning coffee outside many mornings! The neighbors were top notch...friendly, but never intrusive!   The management was extremely helpful and efficient! Following the hurricane in the fall of 2020,  management had “boots on the ground” knocking on every door checking on the residents!  It was a wonderful place to live!

resp.text: Alison, we will miss you so much.  You were such a joy to have here, good luck in Mobile!  Please let us know if we can help you in the future.

name: Soror Thalassa
text:
The Palladian at Fairhope is all you could want in an apartment. It is a little neighborhood that is pet friendly and family friendly. It is quiet here most of the time, and the grounds and greenery are well cared for.
The apartment I stayed in was roomy and had all modern amenities. Anytime I needed anything, Haley and Arthur took care of it promptly.
If you’re looking for a safe, clean space to stay a while in beautiful Fairhope, you just can’t do much better than the Palladian.

resp.text: Thank you so much for these kind words.  We will certainly miss you and Lucy! Good luck with your new home :)

name: Christine Bookin
text: My experience has been exceptional! My husband and I are relocating from South Carolina and Haley has been such a blessing. No matter how many times I called she was always helpful and patient, she is extremely organized, and most importantly she relieved the high amount of stress that comes naturally from moving! Could be happier! 5 Stars!!!

resp.text: Thanks Christine!  We are so happy to have you here with us :)

name: Grant Kessler
text:
Lived here short term while house hunting. They have short term leases and that’s hard to find here.

The manager Haley is truly amazing. We did have a couple of maintenance issues upon move-in and they were in transition between maintenance personnel. Haley stayed on it and the issues were resolved.

The property is well maintained and location is awesome.

We have met several people who have been here for years. They have 2 & 3 bedroom units and the 2 BR units have single car garages.

Comfortable, clean, quiet and convenient.

They are Covid conscious and the office is closed except for appointments but Haley is available by phone. There is a nice pool, workout room and grill available by booking a time through the properties app on your phone. So, those public areas are reserved and occupancy restricted.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this sparkling review!  We truly care about our residents and love that we could accommodate you until you find your forever home :)

name: Pete Scarbrough
text: Love living here. Management and staff are great.

resp.text: Thank you Pete and Becky!  We love having you here!

name: Natalie Engelman
text: We moved from Georgia and had a hard time finding a rental that fit our needs in the quick timeline we had. Haley worked so hard to make our move happen quickly and easily. It’s been a great community for our family and our kids have loved it here. Haley is very responsive and always addresses any issues promptly.

resp.text: Thank you Natalie for this sweet comment, we work hard to assist all of our residents and appreciate residents like you guys at The Palladian at Fairhope!

name: Frank Stewart
text: I chose the Palladian at Fairhope - from out of state - based upon two friends' high recommendations.  I, of course, spoke with Haley in the management office to initiate the rental.  She couldn't have been more helpful with advising and assisting with all setups; including utilities, insurance, etc.  I moved in only a few weeks ago and must say that the choice is better than I could have hoped.  So far, I have nothing but good things to say about the Palladian at Fairhope and their staff... and expect that to continue.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Frank, we are so excited to have you here with us!

name: Molly Mitchell
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! This has been my home away from home while working, my oasis, the place where I felt like a queen in my beautiful, immaculate castle!!!!! Miss Haley has been the best, most super helpful in every way!!!! They have special events, trivia contests with prizes, a beautiful pool, fitness center, safe quiet community, and everyone is so super friendly!!!! Any little maintenance issue that needed to be fixed was super easy to put in a maintenance requests for and quickly fixed!!! I am going to miss this place and the people immensely when I go back home to North Alabama, but I am so thankful I had the opportunity to experience this beautiful apartment home in this wonderful city of Fairhope!!!!!❤

resp.text: Awe Molly, we will miss you big!  Come back and visit anytime your work sends you this way!

name: Shane Bright
text: I moved from Birmingham to Fairhope for a job and came upon these apartments.  All I can say is that Haley worked HARD for me to get this place and I can not thank her enough.  I was given nine days to relocate my entire family and she made the transition smooth as possible.  I love it here!!!!!

resp.text: Shane we are so glad to have you guys here!  I'm glad you are getting settled :)

name: Sharon Arther
text: We have been here for three months and we love our new area. It is safe, quiet, clean, very well kept, friendly neighbors and the staff is quite accommodating. All needs are met quickly. It is so nice to have an apartment ‘home’ with our own garage and all the amenities one could wish for. It is perfect for us.

resp.text: Thank you!  We love having you here! :)

name: Heather Harwell
text: We enjoyed our time at Palladian.  The manager Haley was an effective communicator and always quick to respond if we had any issues.  Highly recommended for short term or long term rental!

resp.text: Thank you Heather!  We loved having you here at The Palladian at Fairhope and hope you will enjoy your new house :)

name: Allen Rentz
text: Very nice and quiet place to live or transition to the area.  Grounds are kept up very nicely and regularly.  Friendly people and staff.  Haley has done a great job since arriving at the Palladian Fairhope.  If we were to need housing again temporarily, we will look at this place again for sure.

resp.text: Thank you Allen, good luck to you guys!  We would love to have you again the future if the need arises :)

name: Beck Jones
text: I lived here for almost 4 years and loved it. Great staff. Quiet, friendly neighborhood. Couldn’t recommend it more

resp.text: Thank you!  You guys will be missed! :)

name: Brandon Allen
text: WARNING. This place is a trap. There is no way to leave without getting sued or placed into collections after you leave. Even if they are at fault. They have a professional legal team, that has invested interest in the place, to ensure you do not walk out without paying a ridiculous amount of money. They rented my family a unit that had know air conditioning issues, and when asked to fix it, repeatedly they did not. My home maininted a temperature over 82 degrees all summer before we had enough and left. The tenant who lived there before we did stop by one day to warn us in person, and to no avail she was absolutely correct. Hayley, the apartment representative on property will smile in your face, and screw you over at the same time. Profession thief. Renter beware.

resp.text: Brandon, I hate that you felt you had to make this post.  We always, always try to do everything possible within reason to help our residents.  Your situation was different than what you are exposing it here.  Our hands are tied professionally once we are pushed too far.

name: Joan Marker
text: I love living at the Palladian in Fairhope now.  The current property manager is excellent and works hard at meeting the needs of the residents.  This is a small, quiet community with very nice residents.

resp.text: Just letting you know you will be missed and how happy we are that you had a great experience!  Please remember that if you refer residents to The Palladian at Fairhope in the future we will pay you $400 each time someone moves in :)

name: kennith collins
text: Wonderful place gorgeous beautiful friendly nice apartment complex

name: Ryan S
text: Have only visited family here, but the property is nicer than most other rental facilities.

name: Eric Leisenring
text: Very beautiful homes. Quiet neighborhood and friendly, professional staff.

name: Andrew Ousley
text: Extremely quiet, Safe, friendly, and well kept facilities

name: Stuart Griffiths
text: Beautiful patio homes in awesome area

name: Roy Kinney
text: The Palladian Patio Homes have the nicest rental properties of anywhere that I have ever lived. My family rented a two bed/two bath home with a garage. The rooms are quite large with a very large living dining kitchen area. Maintenance is performed continuously on the property to help maintain a very high standard. A gentleman by the name of Pete conscientiously keeps the swimming pool in top notch order for all who swim. You could not ask for a better maintenance man than Ed. After saying all of that, I want to say Hayley, the Manager, is the very best of the best. She listens, communicates, is very responsive and shows genuine concern for all who live at The Fairhope Palladian. If you are looking for a permanent or temporary residence, The Palladian at Fairhope is the place for you!

name: Kim
text: They are actually really decent Townhomes and the maintenance person on Deck 24/7 but it is right outside of the hood so there is some Hood people in there and you'd have to be on some type of government assistance I think disability even living there but other than that they were really nice Apartments actually the bedrooms are upstairs your living room kitchen and bathroom is downstairs I don't think there is even a bathroom upstairs though that's the only bad thing that's why I gave it 4 stars

name: Kimberly Wilson
text: They are very nice is really quiet the landlord is really strict about speeding through there so you have to go like 5 miles an hour but it's real quiet it's nice peaceful rent there is based on income but you have to get either some kind of disability or government check or government assistance of some kind to live there they do a background check I don't know how intense it is but I know they do one but the apartments there are really nice they come through like every other week or maybe it's once a month and do a spection in there but they make sure you're there when they do it

name: Kimberly Wilson
text: It is actually a really nice set of Townhomes it is right by a convenience store and a laundromat the landlord there is kind of strict but pretty much if you mind your own business and stay out of trouble and don't do nothing out of the ordinary and I guess you would be okay it's not no hood apartment complex or nothing like that

name: Casey Breeding
text: Whew ... Only if you know someone who lives there

name: Susan Saxon
text: It has been months since I turned in my application, and when I call Brian, he keeps telling me he has a couple in front of. I know for a fact that a friend of mine was leaving there and Brian told me he would probably put me in her apartment. Also he said I would be there before Christmas. Now it's almost January and unhappy

name: Maxie 43 Rob
text: Site manager is very unprofessional my apartment caved-in with water they did not want to help me I had to call the city of mobile when I call Urban Development I was harassed I was talked about it was ongoing disputes between her and other neighbors about mess I have never lived in such disarray the apartment leaks is full of mold and no one fix anything if you're not about what they have going on then they pick on you if I was homeless on the street I wouldn't go there to live the way they treat they tenants when they make a complaint is unbelievable I have a lawsuit pending right now I advise anybody that lived in that apartment complex to take legal actions because there is a class action lawsuit we have 10 people already

name: Patrice Hardy
text: For your 1st move

name: james slawter
text: Nice place.

name: A Kingskid
text: Tucked away

name: Kerry Devose
text: So I asked what's the requirements before I fill out an application and they said its up to the agent. I asked was it a certain credit score I have to have and the lady told me no. So now 4 days later I called to check on my application and they told me that I'm $93k behind on child support which is not true. I don't owe child support then they go on to say you got to have a 650 credit score. I said well I asked what the requirements are before I did the application. Well the phone said click. Not just that, they wouldn't give me my check studs back. Application fee scam

name: Abby Cook
text: After renting one of Tom West's properties for 2 years, I can say I've had a great experience overall. They made it very easy to go look at any of their properties initially and were quick to get everything situated with a lease, especially since I was out of state at the time. I found a wonderful little home that was a little older, but anything that came up was handled promptly with good communication. Alyson and Tabitha both have always been nothing but helpful and friendly throughout my 2 years. Really appreciate them and would rent from them again in the future!

name: amy Elliott
text: I wanted to look at a commercial property for rent. I went to get the keys from their Office to let myself in and there was an obstruction in the key hole. They said they would call me as soon as it was fixed. They never called. I was suppose to be top of the list to see it so I was told. Just not good business.

name: Kim Nunley
text: Mr West is a very professional and sincere person.

name: Ashley McGee
text: Allyson Powell was so helpful with selling our house and purchasing another one. She was very easy to deal with and handled all the details! I would definitely recommend her to my friends and family.

name: FL Coast
text:
Loved working with TWC!   They have a wonderful, friendly office and staff.  Alyson Powell is beyond helpful and always goes above and beyond for her customers.  She is very knowledgeable about the Dothan area and puts her customers interests first.
If you are looking for a realtor you can trust, look no farther than Mrs. Powell.

name: Kayley McCall
text: If I could give zero stars I would. The townhouse was disgusting upon moving in and the list of things I asked to be fixed was ignored. If anything broke it took weeks to get it fixed. The dumpster stayed piled with trash and there were used feminine products laying out where I was expected to walk to throw my trash away. They came into my house on multiple occasions without any notice. The women in the office have terrible attitudes and are absolutely no help. If you're thinking about using Tom West, DON'T!

name: Jermaine Dawsey
text: It's a pretty good company to rent from

name: Sheaba Griffin
text: It seems to me that he only rents to the middle class and upper class white folks! Not only are his staff rude, but unprofessional! And it seems that they don't rent to people that work and make a honest living, your credit shouldn't be the only qualifying factor in renting from this company! But it is, not to mention being African American.

name: Scarlett Vinson
text: My husband and I have been renting with Tom West since March of 2016. From the beginning, the women that work there were very short and snooty with us, especially a young girl that worked at the front at the desk with short brown hair. Her nose was so far in the air, I don't even know if she knew what earth looked like. I got the vibe of "I'm better than you". No one is better than anyone no matter how much money you make, or what you wear, or what you do for a living. We haven't really had that many issues except a few. First of all, we own a dog. A well trained amazing dog. When we saw the house at first, the carpet was terrible. There was a huge black stain on the carpet in the living room and it was coming up at the seams in some places. You could tell the carpet was cheap and old and quite frankly plain nasty. They (owners/tom west) refused to replace the carpet because we had a dog. Also, the kitchen tile was terrible and in some places of the house, you could tell needed to be replaced. Second, We called Tom West a couple months back about a bed bug infestation. When we moved in, we had noticed little bugs a few places, but in the lease agreement, it stated we were to take care of pest control, not realizing they were bed bugs. We did not have bed bugs at our apartment and had verification from the previous landlord. We never called until about a year later when we couldn't get rid of them and they refused to pay to get them removed after we had tried just about everything. Its laughable now because we are moving out and they are still going to have to pay to remove them. Also, in the moving out procedures, you have to pay to get the carpet cleaned. They want me to have that cheap, stained carpet to get professionally clean knowing they are probably going to remove it anyways. We brought our newborn into this home thinking this could be our home for a bit, and now we are moving out 7 months later because it's just what's best. Over all, I would say the company is ok, but pick them last if you have to. When I rent again, they will be last on my list of companies to go through just mainly because of customer service and not taking care of their customers the way it should be and maybe it has a lot to do with the owners of the property as well in which case they need to be realistic as well.

name: Donna Harbert
text: I've never been so upset at one company in my entire life. I rented a home that was left in wonderful condition! 1 small repair and 1 blind was all that I had trouble taking care of before I left. I asked the front clerk the day I was turning my keys in if I could purchase a new pair of blinds and drop them off or even borrow the key to replace them myself because I wanted to do the right thing... she so RUDELY told me she would have to charge me another day. As a customer coming to you and WANTING to do the right thing, I was beyond upset to know this was so rudely handled. My security deposit that was mailed to me is literally NOT EVEN a quarter of what I paid up front because of the "repairs & blinds installment" I was charged for. I will never ever again deal with this scam company who rips people off and so rudely present themselves to their customers. I also will never recommend them. If you pay a security deposit with them and leave them with a decent home as when you moved in, don't expect your deposit back. They will find "repairs" to get you with. Completely & utterly disgusted with this company. Worst in Dothan.

name: Cornelius Clark
text: Tom West is probably one of, if not,  the biggest company in the Dothan area when it comes to renting or buying homes in the area. For starters the customer service in the main office is by far the WORST I have ever dealt with. Everyone is short and snobby especially the females that work at the front desk. I was renting one of their properties for close to 5 years. I travel a lot with my job and that was the only reason I stayed there so long. When I moved in I immediately had issues with things that were suppose to be done but wasn't. Had issues with things breaking and not working properly. It took forever to get some one out to take care of the issues. Then I move out and I have to get the carpets cleaned and provide a receipt only to be told that the carpets weren't good enough and they would have to have the company they use to come out and clean it again and charge it to me. They will not do a walkthrough inspection with the tenant before moving out. Then as I expected, my $575 security deposit is taken for painting the townhouse, so called repairs and cleaning. I paid to have the place cleaned as well but they have no plans on returning your security deposit. They make up whatever they can with no explanation. Just a horrible company to work with and I would NEVER recommend to anyone..Avoid at all cost. I notice all the 1 star reviews with the one 5 star review...that had to be a mistake!!! If I could give 0 stars I would!!!!!

name: Brooke Kelley
text: Horrible customer service. They do not take care of their properties or rental customers. We were told upon moving in to do a walk through and make a list of things that were wrong. We did, and we took pictures and gave them a list of about 15 issues we noticed. We rented a property from them for a year and in that year they fixed one thing off our list. Upon moving out we followed all procedures listed in our rental agreement. Most of the things on our list upon moving in we were charged for when moving out!!!! On top of that they made things up along the way in order to keep our initial deposit of $1150.00. They said that the property had leaks, mold and that we didn’t turn in the keys and garage door opener all of which was untrue. We did not receive ANY of our deposit back plus they tried to tell us we owed an additional $500 +! When we called to tell them to take it out of the deposit they kept they informed us that it was over and beyond that. Then they changed their story to say that when we didn’t turn in our keys(which we did) that we forfeited our security deposit?! When we asked what the additional money was for we also got a different story every time we called....first it was for removal of items(we left hangers 🙄) then it was for carpet cleaning....call me crazy but last time I checked neither of these cost 1600 dollars! They then sent us invoices that they had that they said we were being charged for cleaning fees???! Entire house was cleaned and left in better shape than when we moved in. Funny thing being, the three invoices they sent for the work done which was all minor cleaning around the house didn’t even total 500.....do not rent from these lying thieves that cannot keep their stories straight!!!!

name: Mary Wever
text: Tom West has always been quick to respond to issues that come up. They are professional and courteous .

name: Lauren Hutto
text: Thank you, Alyson Powell, for making my leasing experience TWC so wonderful!!

name: Jerry Benton
text: Very helpful and friendly

name: Dani Rad
text: I use Tom West Co for property management and they have been wonderful!

name: James Mcdurmont
text: Was just lookinh for a house. Dont look for cheap houses on here.

name: Rebecka McNelley
text: I am the Co- Signer for my mother and i usually call in if she needs anything and they are always quick with getting someone out to look at and fix the problem. I have a feeling the only ones who have left a review for this company are the ones that didn't get their wants handed over on a silver platter. With that being said, noone is perfect. No reason to be so ugly. These people have to work to provide for their families just as you. some of these things said are very questionable anyways. 5 STARS from this Tenant!

name: Obsolete Hawk
text: Literally just scamming people out of money. And I guess you have to have a credit score of 800 to get a house through them.

name: Jonathan Kight
text: After numerous refusals of having someone meet at the property to discuss the buildimg. Sat through over a week of negotiating a price and lease for a building to move my business (that's been in business for over 3yrs) only to sit in their office and be refused on a credit app that they insisted I pay $40 for. They are crooks. Pretty much slumlords scratching at a buck.

name: Lynn Miller
text: Dump

name: Christina Roach
text: My Husband and I have been displaced by Hurricane Michael; and, have been seeking for a home in the Dothan area. We found two homes that met our budget and what we’ve been looking for from their listings. A Ms. Powell, with Tom West Company of Dothan, told us it would be a $40 application fee for each of us (there are 3 of us) to seek Rental.  She took our money and called us that afternoon to say we were denied because of credit. Didn’t considered we were displaced; or, anything else for that matter. I’ve been working for Lowe’s for over 20 years; and, my Husband has been self-employed for the past 8 years. My Mom is retired. They didn’t take anything else in consideration, only the fact our credit wasn’t appealing to them. Can’t believe you’ll judge someone based on their financial credit. We’re not buying a house; we’re renting a house. Shoot one of the Houses appeared to have been vacant for quite some time. I can see that, especially the way Tom West Company manages properties, especially when it comes to renting to people. Even though we’ve been taking advantage of despite our unfortunate situation, we will prevail; because, God will open a door for us. He always does.

name: Morgan Griffin
text: Do not rent from these people. I had nothing but trouble from the very beginning.

name: Christine Hawkins
text: How do you advertise a big fensed in backyard but don't allow pets?!?!?!

name: Jon Ingram
text: Ordinary problems do occur at apartment  complexes. Bugs/roaches, mold, water leaks etc. HOWEVER!! This property’s management is either overwhelmed, doesn’t care or both! It’s under new management. They talk, talk, talk, reassure and promise to address maintenance and pest control problems. BUT! NO ACTION!!! Empty promises while putting letters on our doors informing us of an upcoming rent hike! Wow! Avoid this place until they invest the time money and effort to repair, and update/remodel this aging complex.

name: Caleb Carmichael
text: DONT STAY HERE, MAINTENANCE AND LEASING OFFICE IS TRASH AND UNPROFESSIONAL, CEILING BOUT TO FALL THROUGH , MAINTENANCE NO WHERE TO BE FOUND , LOOKS LIKE PEE IS ABOUT TO BURST OUT THE CEILING, HAVE HAD SO MANY PROBLEMS FROM LEAD IN THE WATER, BUGS, MOLD , DISHWASHER FALLING OUT THE WALL TO THIS NOW. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS DUMP. THEN THE CEILING GOT WORSE IN A MATTER OF LESS THAN 24 HOURS, THE DRIP GOT WORSE BUT IG THIS ISNT AN EMERGENCY ALSO CONSIDERING  WE HAVE TINY BABIES BUT ok. DEFINITELY WILL GIVE THIS PLACE A -1000 stars.

name: Durell Asberry
text: Great place to live will work with you awesome management

name: David Johnson
text: Rat and roach infested the rats are very large and are living inside the walls you can hear them running around in the ceiling literally a project in hoover there’s mold  everywhere the maintenance men don’t do nothing nor does the front office they are very rude and tell you anything just to get you out of the office you have wait months on end without appliances in unsafe conditions before they repair them save yourself don’t move here they are literally charging almost a thousand dollars for a 300$ apartment anyone knowing how to get in touch with the owner of the complex please let me know

resp.text: I’m so sorry you are having trouble in your apt. Please come to this office this morning so I can get this taken care of for you.

name: Dame Nicolé
text: Dianna from corporate is PHENOMENAL! She made sure everything I needed was taken care of before leaving back to Virginia.  Migel the maintenance manager is a REAL ASSET to this company and community. He's knowledgeable and friendly.  Again I'm happy with living here thanks to those 2 individuals.

name: Carley McQueen
text: I want to give a huge thank you to Jorge! He has help me so much the last month. And I’ve probably drove him crazy calling and asking a million questions. But Im so excited about moving in Monday June 14th. And having a great view of the pool. So ready to go swimming. And sitting out by the pool and grilling out. And living in a great location and being 10 mins from my grandparents.

name: Candra Fuller
text: Prime location! Enjoyed my time living at this community. The office team was amazing to work with. Would recommend.

name: Amber smiley
text: Tatiyanna has been really helpful with everything far as making sure I get into a good apartment! She's made me feel comfortable with asking all of the questions that I've had. Shes been really patient with me and understanding, and has been extremely helpful with the moving process!❤

name: Angela Studdard
text: Have only been here about 8 months,  met the new manager , she's seems very nice and have great plans for the property. Ebony and Taytiana have been a pleasure to talk and work with as well.

name: LeShundia’s Way TV
text:
I’ve been with The Park at Deerfield going on 2 years and I wanted to gives props to the maintenance team things have been getting done fast and efficiently. I feel we all get on here to speak negatively all the time, but not post about the good‼️
Keep up the great work guys ‼️

name: Robyn Davis
text: love the staff the property manger MS Corbitt was the nicest and was very helpful and inviting and made my move so wonderful . property is very clean and friendly maintenance  staff

name: Kimberly Botters
text:
DO NOT RENT HERE.

My husband and I and our two dogs have lived here for two years from 2018 to 2020. We have seen the complex change management hands several times, and yet nothing ever changes. The area around the front office is clean and well manicured, but that is where the polished front ends. There is constantly trash everywhere, on the sidewalks and in the parking lot. Valet trash is nice, except for when they leave it in front of the building to stink in the Alabama heat. Dog poop stations fill up and are left completely full for weeks without being emptied, so people let their dogs poop wherever since there is nowhere to put it. Maintenance requests go ignored and unanswered for days, sometimes weeks. Even now, I am waiting for our air conditioning unit to be fixed. I’ve submitted a request and called several times, with no result. Office staff are usually polite, but not helpful and sometimes just downright rude. We have to monitor our bank account to make sure that rent is automatically taken out like it’s supposed to be, because there have been two separate incidents where their system messed up and didn’t take the money out and they tried to then take out additional money for the “penalty” of being late, even thought it’s THEIR system that didn’t work properly. Most of the neighbors are lovely people, however there are a few ‘bad eggs’ with revolving doors of mischief that keep the Hoover police busy in this complex. If you have kids I would definitely not recommend bringing them here- it is not safe. I honestly cannot stress it enough, DO NOT RENT HERE.

name: Tanesha King
text: Awful ! Been living here a year almost never used my dishwasher nasty water smells like a  sewage in the bottom of the dishwasher Staff ! Been telling me Miquel coming haven’t saw him I been cleaning up maintenance mess Propery manger I miss the old one Tatayanni haven’t had an issue with her at all very helpful I love her , Hopefully Hills at Hoover get better but for now I advised nobody to move in

resp.text: I’m so sorry for your problems. I would like a chance to correct your problem tomorrow if I know your apt number.

name: Miranda Long
text: Great apartment. All utilities included except power. Nice management

resp.text: Thank you. We appreciate your feedback 😊

name: LaMetria Coachman
text: Very nice property staff and very clean environment I HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!!!

name: Derrion Smitherman
text: For every problem you have they ask you to be put I. A work order, but then they never show up, I have MOLD and WATER DAMAGE no one has been out to help me

resp.text: I’m very sorry to hear this. I will have someone there today who will fix your problem.

name: Sharon McCraw
text: Your staff was very helpful today.  got all my concerns attended  to.

name: Jonathan Gordon
text:
PLEASE READ:
