Believe every review you read about this place. Honestly this has been one of the worst apartments I have ever had the inconvenience of leasing. It’s really a sick joke. It all began when I first moved in. The apartment was NOTHING like the apartment I toured. Besides the apartment not being cleaned (the smell of smoke and plenty of dead bugs everywhere), there were so many inconveniences such as faulty lighting, doors that still do not function correctly (closet and room doors were not made to close or lock for some reason) and horrible appliances.

But by far, what really made the apartment horrible is the infestation of ROACHES and CONSTANT WATER SHUTOFFS.

Since day one, roaches have been a huge problem throughout the apartment. Every night there would be multiple roaches throughout the apartment, even after constant cleaning and spraying my own pest control. It was so disgusting to the point where I never cooked in the kitchen after the first month (that still didn’t stop the roaches though). One night, a Valet trash employee even told me that this complex had a terrible roach problem.

As far as the water, you can expect to go without water in the entire apartment for at least 3-5 days every month. I can guarantee it. This may not sound like a lot, but for this to be your “home”, being without water for random, unplanned periods of time is completely UNACCEPTABLE!

Please save yourself the trouble and look for a better option. If I could leave a 0 star review I would. Honestly, I could go on more about the apartment complex in general, but I will leave it at that. Don’t do this to yourself.

name: Belgee Chandler
text: I’ve tried to be understanding, but at this point I’m livid! First, they stopped valet trash (a service that was included in the rent) and replaced it with pressure washing! That was something that we as tenants had no say so in. Now, yet again, we’re randomly without water and without notice! I work from home, so imagine not knowing the water is going to be off and finding out when you go to use the bathroom that you can’t flush or wash your hands! This new management is a JOKE! Will be looking to move ASAP! I may even pay to break my lease. This is beyond ridiculous.

name: Joshua Buhler
text: Roaches, roaches, roaches. Moved in early March and bugs have been a HUGE issue from the start. I just found FOUR in the bathroom. Most i’ve found at a single time and it’s what pushed me to post this review because i usually don’t post bad reviews. I find them mostly by the back door because it was not sealed properly. Worst place i found one was crawling above my bed. When i went to get it it fell IN my bed. It’s the stuff from nightmares. Gave it two stars because the layout and space is good for the price, but it is not worth the paranoia the bugs cause.

name: Fred Noland
text: Very clean apartments and spacious.

name: Edith Castleberry
text: Great place with friendly staff.

name: Mateo Roshi
text: This place shows you a great apartment and a nice pool. When you move in, you find lots of things broken and leaks and painted over dirt and taped over holes in the wallls. . The breezeways are filthy. Utility doors are hanging off the hinges. The laundry facilities are always filthy, half the machines dont work. Management is friendly but dont get anything done. Cant wait to move.

name: Sheniqua Hall
text: DO NOT MOVE HERE!!!!!! PLEASE. I have been here for 3 months and have been having problems from this place since day one from roaches to A/C not working 4 times out of the month to  my refrigerator not working for 3 days and they still have not came out to fix it along with other issues that I have complained about. I have even went to the office to speak with David the property manager ( after I sent him a long email days before that he still till this day has not responded to) He is a joke. I should have listened when I read everyone else's reviews. Trust me it's not worth the money. This place is not worth any stars but it wouldn't let me post with out putting one.

name: Drea Denise
text:
I moved out August 29TH, and I thought my horrible experience would have been over with. But it’s not, MAKE SURE BEFORE YOU MOVE IN THAT YOU ASK ALL THE QUESTIONS ABOUT THAT UTILITY PACKET IN THE BEGINNING because it sounds are nice but they defer you 2 months and then come back and charge you those two months in the end. YOU WILL THINK YOU ARE GETTING A GREAT DEAL UNTIL YOU GET TIL THE END ITS DECEIVING. THAT UTILITY DEFERMENT SHOULD BE AN OPTION AND NOT A SURPRISE WHEN ASKED WHAT I NEED TO PAY TO MOVE OUT, because If you are prorated at the end, your rent shouldn’t be 400 dollars more then your other months living there. That’s how they get you. The day I moved out was a Saturday and to my surprise the rent off was closed and I was not notified. THEY DID NOT INFORM US THAT NEW MANAGEMENT HAD TAKEN OVER AND THAT THEY WOULD NOT BE OPEN ON SATURDAYS ANYMORE When I call that Monday, I’m informed that oh they told the other woman that was moving out on the same day as me, but I was failed to be notified. So I wasted 2 hours of that day just sitting at the office because maybe I thought the person was just on the property showing a model or at lunch. Nope. I was told I could use my deposit to pay my final balance for the utility BS, and that they were changing system and would be called from Carlton Equities, NOPE I HAVENT GOTTEN A CALL YET. I had to search for their number online only to be answered by someone that just says hello, like it’s their personal cell phone. My name was not asked or anything. They just told me oh well look into it and sorry for the unprofessionalism. MY LAST 2 MONTHS WERE THE ABSOLUTE WORST, there were places in the apartment that they were fixing the road because of their water pipe busting all the time, and the road stayed messed up for I SWEAR 2 months, just cones in the street. LASTLY, I hope no one is every talking a shower and washing their hair because they will turn off the water and not give you a bit of notice at all. THEY DIDNT LIKE COMING TO GET YOUR TRASH SOMEDAYS. For 981 dollars, THE THINGS WE DEALT WITH WAS JUST HORRIBLE. Not to mention When I got into the apartment an dining room light bulb had broke and I could never replace it because the screw in was stuck, the carpet was god awful, so I had to spend 2 of my final days deep conditioning and cleaning to floors. When I spoke with other apartment they always said I’m so sorry that Arlington was your first experience in living on your own. THEY CHANGED MANAGEMENT LIKE 3-4 TIMES. Y’all can see my earlier review under Andrea Johnson about them losing your money orders.

I HAD TO WAIT TIL I WAS GONE TO FINALLY WRITE THIS REVIEW.

name: Melissa Hampton
text:
I highly recommend NO ONE move here. They have changed management staff more times than I can count since we have moved in 3 years ago. Maintenance has only gotten worse since the last change in management. We use to be able to have maintenance come out here same day that we called about an issue. However recently none of our issues are getting resolved and no one is coming out. The roaches are a huge problem for one, it doesn't matter how often we have pest control come out or how often we spray around, the roaches don't stop. They pretty much live in the walls and no one seems to be doing anything about that.
The last couple of weeks our dishwasher has been overflowing and not draining. We've had someone come out to "fix" it twice by just draining the water manually, and we've been calling almost every day for the last 1 1/2 weeks to get someone back out here because it got worse after whatever he did. It's now flooding all over our floor anytime we turn it on. And everytime we call and they pick it up, which they don't always do, they say "We'll get someone out there today" and literally no one ever comes and it's the same repeat process every single day. Our hot water has been out for a few days now as well, and not a single person has come by to fix it. You would think hot water would be considered an urgent issue, but I guess they don't care and only want your rent money. Which by the way they slowly increase with each lease thinking no one is going to notice. It's gone up $120 total within the last few years. Our front door issue is another we have tried to get fixed. You can see and feel the outside light and weather from the inside. Summer time gets hot and the air conditioner stays on almost all day, raising our electricity bill. And winters stay freezing cold and the heat stays on all day. They need to replace the whole door but instead they always put a band aid on everything they touch. We've had someone come out at least 5 different times to fix our lock on the door because the door wouldn't even close shut all the way. If they really care about their residents they would do what is necessary to get a problem fixed, not just keep doing the same cheap thing over and over and over.
Really we didn't have many issues when we first moved in. It's been getting worse and worse each year and i'm finally fed up with it. They don't always answer the phone and they haven't responded to any emails. PLEASE DO NOT MOVE HERE. It is not worth your money.

name: Adam Castleberry
text: Love the new team!

name: Lyteria Robinson
text: If I can post a half of star I would, we are staying in a high price section 8. My building is infested with rats, pest control man came and did nothing about it saying that the rats live in the walls, that is disgusting and I am tired of dealing with this, I am uncomfortable in my own place!

name: Heather Page
text: The day we moved in we had alot of issues. The apartment wasn't even ready and we told them that and that we could give them extra time to get stuff done but rushed us to move in. We had alot of issues and most if not all issues hasn't been fixed. They like putting Band-Aids on stuff saying it's fixed then 2 weeks later same issue. Our AC blew a breaker and I contacted a ac company and told them and they said it was an issue with the unit not breaker. The maintenance guys said it was a fixed issue 2 weeks later same issue ac not working correctly. 2 weeks later another ac issue and all times our apt is hott cause ac isn't running correctly and they want to keep putting Band-Aids on it. Well our power bill is now double what it was before the ac issues started and can prove it with power company and times that ac was giving problems but the apts don't care and don't want to admit there's something wrong and won't pay for what there equipment has failed in. Would recommend finding another place to live as this place doesn't care about you just that your paying your rent. And I'm not calling y'all cause I already have multiple times and nothing gets resolved cause y'all don't care period so don't act like you do. I will be highly recommending for people not to move here and I will stand by my statement until my work orders are all complete and in satisfactory condition where I don't have to spend my first 3 months living here calling y'all to constantly fix things.

name: Tonatha EVANS
text: We have lived here for 4 years and love it. It's in a great location, it's a peaceful community, the office and maintenance staff are friendly and helpful, and neighbors are respectful. We just signed another 12 month lease! Proud to be resident at The Park at Deerfield.. T.Evans

name: Michele Wilson
text: Nice Place when I visit my sister

name: Yostin Hernandez
text: I loved the house of Bessemer But This Is More Better Than That Bessemer House! (😘) Yay!

name: Geoffrey Eggleton
text: I lived here for almost a year. The ladies in the front were very friendly and they were awesome. It wasn’t until they got a new property manager that things went downhill. He wouldn’t address any issues. Maintenance was awful, they didn’t do anything but collect a paycheck, I did all of the work myself as they never came and fixed anything. Horrible bug problem, I informed them, and they sent someone once who told me what to tel them about entry points; still not fixed! I fixed all this myself. I even had to continue spraying on a weekly basis to keep the bugs away. I also reported a few A/C units that had exposed capacitors, and nothing was done about this. Kids always played out there, and if they were to touch one, they would’ve been killed. They ignored all my emails, and I have it all documented, everything from video evidence, pictures with time date stamps, etc. I moved into the apartment completely dirty and a mess, and I left it in much better shape than their, “clean up crew”. To the ladies at the front, you guys are awesome, Lauren Howell should be the property manager, as she is one of the ones who actually cared and worked with people. She would be the saving grace of this place.

name: Jay Montcomedy
text: Haven't been able to use my bathroom sink for two weeks and I call the office for them to say they will get it done when they can. Should be laws in place for stuff like this to not happen cause I'm still obligated to pay my rent on time without avoiding any penalties

name: Katr Beav
text: It will be a year next month since I've starting living here. I love this place. The community and area are great! So far I haven't had any issues or complaints. The manager and staff are always courteous, friendly and helpful. The grounds are always kept up and maintained. I've only had to call maintenance once and the response was quick! Yes, I would recommend. Katrina B.

name: Kendra A
text: I love living here I have not had one issues while staying here it is mostly quiet and peaceful. My apartment has not had any issues since being here and when I did have some issues it was handled on time and quickly! These are the cheapest apartment here is Hoover especially with the bundle deal for cable and internet as well as trash.

name: Andrea Johnson
text:
the frustration…. I have been living here since august 30, every month since I have moved here, I have gotten a late fee when I make sure to pay with money orders. I pay on the first every month. They will lose your money order, put a payment confirmation in your mailbox, just to call you and tell you it was late or missing. KEEP ALL YOUR MONEY ORDER RECEIPT. Every time I talk to someone in that rent office, I get a different answer. Like please consult Your other staff before calling, SO YOU CAN BE UPDATED ON THE SITUATION. I was told hey, since you have never been late, we will waive your late fee, IT WAS NEVER LATE TO BEGINNING WITH. exactly down to the T of what happened, regions money order and payment systems had a glitch between oct 30- nov 7. any payment made were made to look like they were not made, while account still shows funds were sent and still on bank statement. regions district manager had to type up and stamp, exactly that. So you are waiving a late fee for? It was never late to begin with, which should be understandable. THE BANK HAVING A GLITCH WHICH IS PROVEN IS NOT MY FAULT, AND WAS NOT TOLD TO ME. I GET A PHONE CALL FROM THE RENT OFFICE AT 4:41 ON FRIDAY TO LET ME KNOW OF THIS, LIKE WHAT CAN I DO AT 4:41 TO FIX IT. The month before that,  my boyfriend had to pay the rent with a money order for me because I am not able to leave work and get it, he forgot to get the bottom half the money order for the receipt, he went back to get it wasn't able to get it and I even called the office 3 times the day after and the day after that. Just to be told, I had to wait and that if they got it, I'd have a receipt in my mailbox. I did, a few days later, the notorious call, that they didn't receive my rent. HOW!?!?!?! WHEN YOU PUT THE RECEIPT IN MY MAILBOX. HE HAD TO GO THROUGH THIS WHOLE INCIDENT WHERE HE HAD TO RUN HIS CARD TO BE CREDITED THE LATE FEE BACK. PLEASE KEEP UP WITH PEOPLE'S RENT. I THOUGHT ABOUT RENEWING MY LEASE WHEN IT IS UP NEXT YEAR BUT AT THE RATE WE ARE GOING, EVERY MONTH WE ARE HAVING THE SAME ISSUE WITH THESE MONEY ORDERS AND THIS RENT SITUATION.

NOT TO MENTION, MY CAR HAS BEEN BROKEN INTO AND MY GUN WAS STOLEN OUT OF IT. THERE IS ALWAYS LOUD TEENAGERS OUTSIDE AT EVERY HOUR OF THE NIGHT.

name: Spectral Wolfpack Paranormal
text: About ready to start paying my rent at this dump in dead roaches. New management is a joke. PS they’re now offering gift cards for anyone who leaves a 5 star review on google. Don’t move here. This place sucks.

name: Shaquita Smith
text: It's okay but not worth the money. Maintenance sucks. I had an issue with a basically broken pipe under my kitchen sink. I literally stood an watched the man just snap the pipe back together and get up like he had done the best job in the world in ten seconds. I could have done that my self. So i refuse to even put in work orders. You'll be better off fixing your own issues because my sink is still leaking.

name: Brittany Majors Irvin
text: The pool is unexpectedly closed on unusual days and times. They send out emails letting you know of pool hours but yet they are never open at those times. You pay rent to have access to the pool and it is constantly closed. An explanation of the closure would be welcomed since you are paying for something you cannot use. I have been down to the pool on MULTIPLE occasions and it has been either locked or chained closed. I was going at like noon on these days. I went one time and a staff member questioned whether or not the pool was open and if it wasn’t she was going to open it at NOON!!! This is ridiculous.

name: Brianca Mccrary
text: Loren really was a good tourist, I came in to the apartments looking for a 1 bedroom 1 bath apartment and she showed me a perfect apartment for me and answered all the questions i needed answered. I really love the apartment atmosphere and they have really good move in specials. If i could give Loren and The Park at Deerfield  10 stars i would!!!

name: Tiffany LaShun
text: The absolute worst apartments to live in the Hoover area!!!!! I took the bug reviews lightly until I moved in and witnessed different. My apartment was completely rushed before I moved in. I moved the end of March. I signed a 12 month lease that I am currently trying to get out of because I have complained so many times since the day that I have moved in. There is an infestation of bugs/spiders/roaches etc OH AND DONT FORGET THE MOLD!!! I had a leak that completely flooded my bathroom and closet and half of my bedroom. They have yet to fix the ceiling from the upstairs leak. The storage room looks like a construction site. I hate it here!!!! Thank God I took pictures so I am looking forward to breaking my lease soon!!!

name: M West
text: My family of 5 has enjoyed our 3rd year and counting stay here, so far. Living in any apartment complex is what you make it and there were issues that needed to be addressed. We worked with management on problems which are handled efficiently within reason. I especially enjoy the ability to make payments and maintenance requests thru their online service. The front office is attentive and personable. No place is paradise unless you work together to make it the best possible situation. And that is living at The Park at Deerfield. Teamwork makes the dream work.

name: Hollie Gray
text: I stayed here until my husband and I bought a house. Awful apartments. The management staff is nice in your face, but nothing ever gets done. There is a roach infestation. Pest control sprays and sprays to no avail. They need to rip out the inside walls of the buildings because there has to be a nest somewhere. Ugh! Utility package is a joke. Water bill based off every tenant in building. Do yourself a favor and pass on these. Or sign a 7 month lease and jet after saving for a house. We sure did!

name: Dana Cade
text: The maintenance guy Jose Garcia did an awesome job repairing my sink. He was fast and got the job done!

name: Ashley Furr
text: Still got roaches. Literally everywhere. They live in the walls and the only thing they do to "treat" them is spray.... how about taking care  of the problem?. Honestly the only reason I'm here still is because I have kids (but looking to buy a house)... I'd rather sleep under a bridge, there are probably less roaches there.

name: Roderick Hill
text: We have had issues after issues since moving in this place. Maintenance is horrible and the stray cats are a constant issue. For what we pay in rent the service is subpar and that’s being nice.

name: Josh Lamberth
text: I'm the type of person who let slide a lot of stuff, but this place really bite my nerves. Don't expect privacy here. I caught management over and over coming into the apartment without me being told they were coming, cause me to have a $100 power bill and I was gone for the whole month. You share water bill with everyone. $30 monthly trash bill that supposed to have trash pickup at the your door but most of the time it doesn't happen. You are forced to get cable and internet. They don't do repairs and if they do it takes forever. Cockroaches. You pay a monthly pest fee but they never came in once to spray. Lease office hours are never true. Workout center is dangerous the last time I used it. Only good thing that happen is I left that place.

name: Whitney Causey
text: Pool ALWAYS closed. Roaches everywhere. Even though you have to pay for pest control, it DOES NOT WORK! We had to buy our own pest control! Mildew everywhere! My husband has asthma and mold is not good for him. The rent is too high for these issues! They make you pay for cable and internet that is always spotty! You HAVE TO PAY FOR VALET TRASH, when you can take it yourself! Even though they pay you for referrals, I never will. When our lease is up, we're out!!!!

name: Mr. Wilson
text: Air vents and ducts should be cleaned out. Water pipes spit out nasty water; nasty enough to leave the white painted bathtub, with brown stains from dripping water, the electrical is probably from the 70’s, my hot water heater may get you through a quick shower, but I always have to check to make sure the breaker hasn’t popped. Hard wood floors? More like cheap stick down. The brand new fridge had the ice maker cut out of it??? Trash has gotten better, but it’s only the end of May, and I’m already seeing roaches everywhere. And for some reason, some of the residents like to play their music at full blast while driving through at all hours of the day, some even like to park and just let it beat. Been here 8 or 9 months now, getting out of my lease early and can’t wait to leave. Their utilities package through “ConService”, sounds good, but it sucks and they screw you there! The name says it all.

name: ALEXANDER REFUGIO
text: i live here and the paint in the bathrooms is awful and in the kitchen by the sink by the light it is soo gross i saw a spider their .

name: Rachel Figure 8
text: I LOVE DEER FIELD APARTMENTS BECAUSE WHEN YOU CALL THEM FOR ANY EMERGENCY THE SHOW UP ON TIME MY KIDS HAS TO ATTEND ROCKY RIDGE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.THE LADIES WHO WORK IN THE OFFICE ARE VERY SWEET THANKS AGAIN

name: Xiomara Simental
text: Enjoying my stay. I was a little paranoid about living in the lower part of the complex but I haven’t had an issue. Great accommodation and friendly staff.

name: Tyler Pascascio
text: Have only been here for my 11 month and had a infestation of roaches that was supposed to be taken care of by pest control. Not only has that problem not been taken care of they have now multiplied. The problems do not stop there, I also had issues using their app which did not inform me that after sending me a confirmation that the money was not pulled out of my account and got threatened with a eviction notice and did not even understand what had took place for me to even get that notice! But last not least had my apartment get filled with smoke in the air, smoke sectors went off because there is a problem with heating system and now all my clothes and the house smell like smoke... worst place I have ever lived EVER! So now I’m trying to get out of my lease and I’m still encountering issues! PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM LIVING HERE!!!

name: Jennifer Allison
text:
Long waits on work orders, requires pestering
Poor pest control plan
Unnecessary utility package (all I use is Netflix and Hulu)
Poor quality craftsmanship and appearance
Poor organization of garbage and recycling
Poor landscaping standards

Polite office staff and great pool facility
Safe to go walking at night with my dog
__________________________________________________

I've lived here for almost a complete year. It has come to be my conclusion that the original builders took many shortcuts in the building process and that apartment complex standards are to "get by".  I do enjoy living in my apartment, but I am finding myself doing repairs or upkeep myself. And in some ways, it can be nice due to the location and price of rent.

I am beginning to find more and more roaches and holes that allow them to come in. Pest control is a one time spray after you call. I have told them twice in the past month, and have not seen any confirmation that pest control has been to my apartment. I have sent work orders in asking them to fix the holes in cabinetry and panels, but have not seen any results or return communication discussing my situation.

I recently deep cleaned my pantry and found corners that had roach feces, then had more that had been painted over (prior to me moving in). I've had a nest in my microwave, coffee maker, and a game console.

My husband and I are trying to start a family, but I don't think I would raise a child in this complex due to some questionable loitering that takes place.

Very minimal landscaping in front of apartment buildings. The entrances and office/clubhouse look nice with flowers and pine straw. Apartments look forgotten and a little dilapidated. Trash litters the ground near bushes and often stays there for a very long time.

name: Dee Means
text: I have only been here if a couple of weeks and the trash is running over and has been since the 26th of February. The rent office is blaming Aws and they say it’s them. But you want patios and balconies clean and presentable but you have trash coming out the trash compactor running over!! That’s a eye soar as well!! I wish I would have read the reviews before hand. I think I have made a bad decision don’t get me wrong I love the apt. And the space it gives but getting things done around here is a serious problem!! And the roaches is Also a problem and I don’t want the response from the owner to send me some sorry txt and the problems doesn’t get fix. This is why people report to fox 6 on your side.

name: Khadijah Clark
text: Worst place to live....roach infested also. Big holes under bathroom sink and tubs peel cause they paint over them. Rent is 1,000 for 2br 1 bth too pricey.

name: Cynthia Nicholson
text: If you a maintenance issue, or other general question, you can forget talking to anyone in the leasing office when you call.  When you call the leasing office, you are directed to a 24 hour call center.  At first this might seem great, however, they are unable to answer any questions about the property or your "account" and can only forward messages to the maintenance crew or property manager.  It takes 3-5 business days for anyone to return your call (if you even get one) which can be problematic in the event of a more pressing issue.  Going to the office doesn't help as the staff is rude and unless you are signing a lease, don't want to give you the time of day.  Calling the corporate office does no good either, they don't return calls or handle issues you have with the property.

name: JORDIN FENNELL
text: We have been dealing with this same problem since we arrived, Roaches and yall can never fix it.

name: Shelby Jordan
text: I've lived here for a year. The roaches have just gotten worse and worse no matter what we try to do. The sink isnt even connected to the pipes and hasn't been since before we moved in. When we moved in, the place was nasty and we had to clean it upon moving in. The ceilings have obvious water damage and leak if it rains too hard. The matience guy broke one of my mirrors. The drain in the bathroom sink doesnt drain. They include internet in the rent, but it hardly works. Overall, just don't move here. Its not worth the money.

name: Tye Shairo
text: So far so good! No complaints really

name: Jasmine
text: Do not be fooled by these photos. This place is s high priced ghetto! The place is full of roaches and mold. Roaches are even outside in the grass! I was a resident for a year. I was suppose to get a 2br 1ba and the day I was suppose to sign the lease they told me something had happened to that apartment and I was going to have to take a 2br 2ba and I HAD to pay the increase in rent. At this point I'm basically homeless and had no choice but to sign the lease. When I go to view the apartment it's still dirty, ROACHES EVERYWHERE. I requested weekly pest control but they never did it. Bath tub was painted over instead of replaced so the paint peeled whenever you showered. The previous renters had a dog and the carpets smelled like dog pee. I asked them to clean the carpet, but they only  sprayed it, and it did not get rid of the odor. There was mold in the ceiling and I'm guessing that mold is also in the roof because there was a moldy odor in the apartment that I could not get rid of no matter how much I cleaned. The neighbors below me smoked weed, and when I reported this they acted like they didn't even care. This place is disgusting and unkempt. Do not stay here!

name: joseph macharia
text: Had a couple of stuffs that needed repair, stuck doors,clogged sink and bathroom,AC problem etc...in my apt.Right after I reported Jose Garcia maintanance guy showed up did a very good job and within a short time everything was fixed and was back to normal.Thank you.

name: Morris Lane
text: How can you run a  apartment complex with no washer and dryer for your tenets to use. If I stay in a apartment where there is no washer or dryer connection and I want to go wash my clothes they don't work. They put in all this time to make sure the landscaping is up to part lol but you can't fix the washers. Then they lock you into this conserving bill that they clearly told me before I moved in that I had the "option" of enrolling in this package that was going to only be $150.00 a month lol, "lie" because every month it's different.

name: Kia Lavender
text: All I can say is this apartment complex is horrible. Stay far away from it, do not rent here management is a joke. They don't answer phone calls, they don't return phone calls you have to go by there to get a response. Nasty neighbors who throw trash every where but in the garbage. Mold that they paint over and it's still visible. Apartment has unpleasant smells like mildew. Neighbors are loud and when you complain nothing gets done. The walk way is disgusting where the valet trash is being dragged instead of picked up daily .I would not recommend to my worst enemy you will have problem after problem and nothing will ever get resolved. They need to fire everybody in the office and get a real management company!!

name: Ashley Furr
text: Love my apartment, love the staff. Just wish they were there when they say theyd be there. Or have buisness hours posted. And be there when they tell you a time to meet them back. 4 seperate parties waited outside the office this morning. A staff member told one party to be there at 10am. Alsmost 1030 rolls around and everybody leaves.

name: caitlyn hampton
text: This is my first apartment me and my boyfriend hate it here we have only been here for a week we got our apartment changed a day before move in we had to change the address on everything we were not able to see the apartment until we moved in. The place was filthy when we moved in and it’s filled with roaches!!!!! I just woke up to a roach crawling on me in my bed I can’t believe this is where I have to stay for a year. There is a big hole in the wall in the bathroom that has not been fixed. Pest control came once and it did nothing.

name: American Patriot
text: I've lived here much longer than I should have or planned on. This place sux. It's quickly becoming the ghetto of Hoover. Trash all over the complex left by idiot tenants who have no pride in where they live. Loud music at all hours of the night and day by idiots who have no respect for their neighbor's. There have been issues with my apt since I moved in and when I've tried to have them fixed it has literally taken weeks, sometimes months, to be repaired. They've gone up on my lease. The conservice (a joke of a utilities package) and valet trash suck. The pool always has some issue where it's closed. For your own sake please don't ever even consider living here.

name: David Massengale
text: Very reasonable rent, cable included! Management always addressed concerns, and were very helpful, especially Tammy!!

name: Annie Hawkins
text: The Park @ Deerfield is one of the worst apartment complex ever!!! I moved in on May 2017, But in June the unit above me had a CrAzY leak for 3 days, maintenance did absolutely nothing. That leak damaged my cabinets and flooded the floors which caused the walls to swell, mildew, and rotten. I reported this issue almost every other day, I sent pictures of the damage to Mrs. Tammy Lane which is the property manager and nothing was still done. It took literally 8mths for them to repair and paint my cabinets after calling corporate over & over, getting on their nerves. My lease is about to end in 3mths and I had to go 8mth without utilizing 3 large kitchen cabinets because they didnt care to do their job. I had to find other ways to store my dishes and etc. The old saying is "You pay for what you get" so please explain why I pay $950 every month on time, and couldnt even get that issue taken care of in a timely manner. On top of that their is always trash all over the ground, my children have to constantly clean up our breezeway because the tenents have no pride in the area where they reside. And they allow their animal to poop everywhere, even on the sidewalks. Kids can't even play at the playground w/o stepping in dog s**t. I honestly feel that these apartments are entirely too expensive to have poor upkeep and they never compensate you for any inconvenience on their behalf... Really!!! RUN RUN RUN!!! Save yourself the mental anguish and frustration...

name: Linda Laffitte
text: Management at these apartments cannot be humans.  You pay to rent an apartment here and the apartment on top of yours bathroom floods and raw sewage come through your ceiling the light, bathtub, walls and floor is full of feces. They sent someone a day later to use a water hose  to wash out the tub. What about the smell and unhealthy that is? The renter that apartment flooded left.. I talked to management guess what she said "I have been renting apartment for 25 yrs and stuff like this happens when you rent an apartment on the first floor". Thank you God for phone with cameras  and recorders.  Management needs much Prayer and I did tell God all about it.

name: Mohammed Obaid
text: I've been living here for about a year and a half. It's a 2bd1bth, I pay $765 for rent and the utilities package that they said was "optional" is around $240. They are now increasing my rent while leasing the same apartment for $690, how is that fair?

name: Change is Good
text:
1st - I have nasty nasty neighbors who think they live in the projects where leaving your trash everywhere is acceptable.  There is no street lighting at night so you can't even see to back in a parking space. Water pressure sucks in master bath and bugs (who don't pay rent so why should they be able to live with me for free) coming in and out of holes left by the inadequate maintenance staff.
Sorry trash valet pick up causes more problems than they know, bambi running through the parking lots (which I kinda like) and please please CUT DOWN THAT DANG BUSH AT THE FRONT ENTRANCE!!! If I get hit by oncoming traffic trust you will be apart of my lawsuit for allowing an intentional hazardous overgrown bush blocking drivers vision of street/traffic.

Btw, there are stairs that we can't see. Maintenence request submitted over the phone recoding last night when i realized that the resident portal no longer allows for request to be submitted online.

text: I’ve lived in a different apartment almost every year I’ve lived in Birmingham, it it wasn’t until living with Dwell that I found a management company that actually cares about tenants and property. name: Faith higdon
text:
12/2020 update:  still love it here. Moved in 8/2020 and haven’t had a single problem besides tiny maintenance needs (expected with old buildings) and they are SO FAST to fix anything. Not sure I would rent from anyone else really. Rent from these people!!

8/2020 : This has been my first rental experience ever - and I’m SO happy we decided to go with Dwell. I have friends who use them as well and I have heard nothing but good news. Such a relief after touring multiple other properties in the area with no luck. They are super quick to try to resolve maintenance issues, they’ve even reached out to me to make sure things were resolved before I even had the chance to contact someone. We moved in 3 weeks ago and are so in love with the place. The entire process was pretty simple, our neighbors are great, the neighborhood is wonderful and really haven’t had any trouble with parking. And they’re pet friendly! I love coming home from work and seeing everyone’s cute puppies and cats lounging in the windows 🥰🥰

name: Chrissy Benney
text: We lived in Haven a little over 2 years; it was a great price and location. Joseph was extremely helpful, accommodating, and kind. Maintenance requests were always handled promptly and professionally. We enjoyed our time there and would recommend their apartments to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you so much Chrissy! We really enjoyed having you as part of our family of tenants. If you ever need anything, we're happy to help any way we can.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: The 1st visit: vacancies posted inside windows - now each visit afterwards with no information. I wish I could get a 2br apartment to rent from one of their buildings.

resp.text: Thank you so much for visiting our properties. We only tried physical flyers for a bit, so we do appreciate your feedback. Anything else you may have thoughts of, please let us know. We always want to know how to improve.

name: Benjamin Kidd
text: Dwell Properties is a rare gem in apartment leasing. The staff are quick to respond. The property and amenities are top notch and affordable. A+

name: Brandon
text:
I've lived at one of their apartments for 2.5 years, Joseph is great and always super accomodative and understanding. He actively took steps to get out of a contract with a terrible ISP during the first year of my stay,  very open to you making your apartment your own with aesthetic changes, and he is always very easy to get in touch with.

The apartments are great. They are older so expect higher utility bills and some noise, but they are kept in good shape and I've never had any problems that weren't immediately addressed. In these 2.5 years, I've also seen the fewest pests/bugs inside than anywhere else I've ever lived.

name: Greg Smith
text: Have been renting for almost a year now. Joseph and all the staff have been great and easy to deal with. Quick to solve repair or maintenance issues. What more can you ask for.

name: Mike Burrow
text: Wonderful people to deal with.  They make you feel like family.

resp.text: I really appreciate that Mike! The feeling is certainly mutual!

name: Angie Taylor
text: Owners are very nice!

name: Chris Davis
text: This is one of the nicer lofts that I have seen and have been living in, in Birmingham. It is updated with huge ceilings and granite counter tops. But it is also one of the worst experiences I’ve had with a home and a landlord. The music from the bar is UNBELIEVABLY loud!! It stars around 10pm and doesn’t stop until almost 3 AM! When shopping for apartments, they would never let us visit in the evening time to see the apartment, and never mentioned that there was any noise! Would not suggest working with this company!! Also let’s in a lot of naturally light.

resp.text: Chris, while we’re glad you like the upgraded features our lofts offer, we’re sorry your experience hasn’t reflected our goal of 100% satisfaction. While many of our residents enjoy the close proximity to Birmingham’s nightlife, we understand ambient noise can be frustrating. We strive to ensure all potential residents understand there is a nightclub on our first floor and advertise its location on our website. We apologize if there was any miscommunication. We only offer tours inside our lofts during regular business hours but are always happy to answer any questions regarding our homes. We would like to improve your experience and invite you to email us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net at your earliest convenience.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: I can get any information about this dwelling. The website is poorly documented. The telephone contact is a recorded machine. A visit to the place is a locked door.

resp.text: Rosalind, we’re sorry to learn you have an unfavorable opinion of our community. We strive to provide swift communication to anyone interested in our loft apartments and apologize if you feel your needs are not being met. The contact us page of the website includes a convenient form where anyone can submit questions or request a tour. You’ll also find the hours of operation and office address, located at our sister community, Thomas Jefferson Tower. Voicemails are promptly returned, but the team is unable to reach out personally as you did not leave a message. Keeping our door locked is a feature provided for the peace-of-mind of our residents, but we happily schedule tours for anyone interested in one of our available apartments. We would be delighted to provide a tour if you reach out via the contact us form or through voicemail. You may also reach us by emailing goodallfixplaylease@spm.net or by visiting us on Facebook or Instagram.

name: bill JT
text: Loud, hallways often smell like cigarette and cigar as people walk Inside with smokes lit up. Their response to Chris was bs. They NEVER said there was a nightclub and even said they NEVER had complaints about noise. There are residents who have been complaining for 3-4 years about it....

resp.text: Bill, while we appreciate your review, we’re disappointed your opinion is unfavorable. We are sorry if residents have had issues in the years prior to our current management, but they were not brought to our attention. We are always happy to address any report of unpleasant smells or noises for our residents. The two recent complaints of a smoky smell were addressed by our manager and found to be the result of a misdirected duct from another business in our building. This has since been resolved. We advertise the piano bar on the first floor on our website and have not attempted to be dishonest with any potential resident regarding their presence. As we do not have you listed as a current resident, we are unable to reach out to you personally. If you would like to discuss these issues further, please email us at GoodallFixplaylease@spm.net.

name: MAC DUNLAP
text: love the building. still yet hsvent seen in.the lofts yet

resp.text: Mac, thank you for taking the time to leave us your thoughts on our community. We are delighted you appreciate the historic charm of our building. If you would like to see inside our lofts, please contact us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net or call at your convenience. We would love to show you the five-star lifestyle we provide at Fix Play Lofts!

name: Chris Johnston
text: Nice, friendly leasing staff.

resp.text: Chris, thank you for taking the time to leave this five-star review for Fix Play Lofts! We're glad you've found our staff to your liking. We understand the importance of service with a smile and will pass along your kind compliments. Please feel free to reach out if there is anything you need!

name: Mat Boutin-Delisle
text: Worst apartment experience I've had. They will lie to you about everything and the bar underneath is so loud it's shaking the walls and floor.

resp.text: Mat, we’re sorry your lifestyle at our apartments hasn’t been enjoyable. Our goal is always your satisfaction, and we understand the importance of straightforward communication and a peaceful living environment. Our manager will be reaching out to you to better understand the issues you’ve encountered, and learn how we can improve your experience. If you would like to contact us, please email us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net.

name: Scott Spearman
text:
I was offered a job and found out I was moving to Birmingham in November of last year. The problem was, I knew nothing of the "Magic City" or its neighborhoods. But on the same day I received the offer for the new job, I realized I needed to find a place, and fast. So I downloaded an apartment app and started searching. I had decided on one criteria. I wanted to walk to work.  That should be easy, I thought, there are a tone of loft apartments downtown. The problem is that the large majority of them were black boxes. To this day. I don't know how one would go about taking a look at and discovering availability on these lofts. Without being overly conspiratorial, I will say that to this day I have doubts about the ethics, motives and business practices of so many of these downtown apartments. I still don't know how to crack those black boxes. There was one huge exception. There was a company that managed a couple of downtown lofts that were located less than a five minute walk from my workplace. When I called them and left a message, they called me back in less than 5 minutes. So that same day, I arranged to meet with their guy, Andrew, who would show me some two-bedroom lofts available at both Goodall-Brown and Fix Play. I immediately fell in love with the 3rd floor loft that would become my home for the next year. I loved the rooftop lounge and the apartment's Modern Amenities with exposed brick, 14 ft ceilings with exposed pipes and ducts and beautiful original hardwood floors, as well as my favorite feature, "the stairs to nowhere", which became my meditation space, is all I needed to remind me I was not living in an apartment "complex". I was home.

I would be remiss if I didn't mention the fact that as someone with a less-than-perfect credit score, Goodall-Brown lofts management company, SPM, was great to work with to get my contract through and approved, as they provide options that most companies do not. They also offered me free rent for the remainder of the month, which I totally took advantage of.  In a few weeks I was moved

Although I am not a dog owner, I have really enjoyed getting to know my neighbors and their furry friends. They both, the neighbors and their pets, were amicable and friendly as we constantly ran into each other in the elevator.

I also think the  Goodall Brown Lofts are in the absolutely best location to make the most of downtown living in Birmingham. Within 1 block you can walk to El Barrio, Bamboo, Atomic Lounge and Collins bar. Heck, the Wine Loft is in the SAME BUILDING. Within 4 blocks you can add more than a dozen other fantastic bars and restaurants, like Queens Park, Paramount, East West, The Florentine, John's City Diner, The Essential, Pilcrow, Cayo Coco. I have drank or dines at every one of these places and have yet to be disappointed.

In regards to the management company, I'll never forget that time a few months that I accidentally dropped my keys down the door crack  of the elevator shaft. (Don't ask, but I could hear them banging all the way down to the first floor) Sheepishly I put in a maintenance request on the website and then followed up with a  phone call the next day. Only a day later, Paris, the delightful general manager for SPM, who is a busy lady responsible for a handful of properties, knocked on my door, my keys in hand. She had had to call the elevator company to retrieve them.  I asked her how much I owed her for that service. She waved my question away. "It's fine", she said. Needless to say, they are a responsive company when it comes to service calls

I decided in October that I wanted a bigger place and preferably a house. So I found the perfect place and have moved out of Goodall-Brown  as of early December. I know that it was the right decision for me, but that doesn't change the fact that I miss my beautiful loft and the fun of downtown living.

resp.text: Scott, thank you for this truly thoughtful five-star review of Goodall-Brown Lofts! We know you had many choices when looking for your first home in The Magic City, and we couldn't be happier knowing you enjoyed your time with us. Our team would like to offer their sincere thanks for your kind words regarding their service. It is always our pleasure to provide prompt and meaningful assistance to our wonderful residents. We are often told our ideal location is a favorite feature and are delighted you found it convenient for work and play. Though we were sorry to see you go, we wish you the best with your new house! If you are ever looking to return to loft living, we would love to welcome you home. Please feel free to reach out anytime.

name: Pat Dean
text: John Bruce was a extreme help getting me setup and moved in. Easy professional and quick! Spm is your best choice and john is your man

resp.text: Pat, thank you for leaving this five-star review for Goodall-Brown Lofts, our dedicated team member, and management! We are delighted you received the excellent service you deserved during your move-in. Our commitment is to provide you with an exceptional loft living experience every day, and we are always happy to be of assistance should you need anything. Please feel free to reach out to us anytime!

As with any older homes/buildings, you have your challenges, but these lofts are super unique and the location cannot be beat -- steps away from EVERYTHING on 1st and 2nd Avenues, nightlife and restaurants. Plus, you get a huge amount of space for the price you pay. The property management team is super helpful and attentive, which is wonderful.

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you for this wonderful five-star review of Goodall-Brown Lofts! We're thrilled you're enjoying your historic loft apartment and the great access to The Magic City our location provides! text: I was not trying to give a negative review of Lofts never seen - the telephone number, website and finding more information was the problem. The amenities and location will sell to the customers who look for places to live in a space described by the owners.

We would like to speak with you further about this incident, and ask you to contact us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net so we may address this situation to your satisfaction.

name: Matt Elmore
text: Best management company in town, hands down. Tim and his staff have been great to work with, and I would rent with them again in a heartbeat. Thank you!

name: Michelle Abel
text: Its hard to get someone out to fix a problem. I put in a request a week before christmas because our ceiling was collapsing. Didn't hear back, so I called only to be told itd be after Christmas before anyone came to check it out. Or it took 2 weeks for anyone to come out when our door fell off the hinges. Or they send someone out to "fix" the a/c, but has to come back because no cold air is coming out but then admits he actually broke it the first time. The property manager is very dismissive about these problems as well and repeatedly ignores emails and requests for assistance.

name: clancy donovan
text: My wife rented a place from them at The Mount. Took them 18 months to fix a leak and mold above her roommates bed. They came a few time to “fix” it, but never actually amounted to anything. I had to come and stand over their shoulder while they painted it with Killz, and trust they actually fixed the roof leak.  The representative said they were sorry and would give them a free month of rent.... which never happened.

name: Tiffany W
text: Great rental company. David is the best!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Tiffany! We'll show David your review. It will make his day! :)

name: Alex Wright
text: Great Company to deal with.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Alex! We appreciate your business!

name: Montrell Miller
text: Nice staff

resp.text: Thanks for leaving us a review, Montrell! We are thankful for your business!

name: Boram Choi
text: Eddie found me the perfect first home to buy and made sure everything was going well throughout the whole home buying process, from inspections to appraisals and getting potential repairs on the house from the seller. I never thought buying a house was going to be as easy as it was! Very pleased with the service I got.

resp.text: Congratulations on purchasing your new home! We're so happy you're satisfied with your home buying experience. We'll let Eddie know he's doing a great job!

name: Rose Gold
text: I currently rent one of the properties Revitalize manages. So far I have found pest such as roaches, lizards, and mice. Also I’m enduring winter without a heating system or a stove to try to make it through. The issue that makes the matter tough is the lack of air seals through out the home. I was moved in to the home with these condition. The answer and reaction has been consistent however, the receptionist isn’t as engaging or knowledgeable as you may hope. Each time I was told the person of interest was unavailable and won’t be available for some time. After that, the receptionist redirects my call to a voicemail system that currently hasn’t been returned.

name: Cytavia Gamble
text: The maintenance department is really good David and Ray did a really good job putting in my brand stove they were very professional and got it done in a timely manner!!!! Thank you guys so much ❤️❤️❤️❤️

name: FPV FANATIC
text: Best place to buy/rent a house. They went above and beyond to help us.

name: Tina Hill
text: Car break ins, mold inside, brown water, old appliances, and now maintenance people blaming me for another thing. I have pics. I finally received a reply back about some areas that are slipping hazards . The manager said maintenance said the walkways were slippery bc im spraying disinfectant on them and to refrain in future. I have NEVER sprayed walkways. Neighbors even agreed its bc of the paint they use on them. I've also been blamed for electric going out. Maintenance guy said it was me using my griddle. It was the outside breaker. Im so sick of them caring about the aesthetics only and not safety and functionality. A child almost hit his head twice while slipping few days ago and I've slipped numerous times. Our neighbor has too.

resp.text: Hello Tina, Thank you for your review. I am so sorry to hear that you have not had an enjoyable experience. I appreciate having you take the time to reach out to me directly by e-mail and brought your concerns to the attention of the Regional Manager as well as the Property Manager. During the winter months our Maintenance Team do their best to make sure that the sidewalks are clean and safe for our community, however we take your concerns very seriously. If there is anything additional I can do for you at this time, please feel free to reach out to me at: tstrong@ampresidential.com

name: its me
text: I’ve lived many places but this is by far the best. Absolutely no bugs or rodents at all! Maintenance is fast effective and friendly and the neighborhood is fantastic. Yes the price is a little high considering the outdated appliances but they all work and if anything were to happen the staff here — everyone from the office to maintenance are extremely available, responsive, efficient and always very friendly. My daughter and I are on the 2nd level and have never ever had any issues with noise complaints or issues with neighbors. In fact it’s really quiet at night!! I’ve never had to call or request maintenance or pest control because they are regularly scheduled and  they let residents know when to expect a knock at the door— I seriously have never encountered a staff member or neighbor that I’ve had a negative experience with! Love it here !!!!

resp.text: Hello, Thank you for you taking the time to leave us a review! We are thrilled to hear that you are loving your home and that our entire team has been able to make you feel so welcomed! Providing the best living experience to our community is one of our top priorities, and we are so happy that you love where you live! We sincerely appreciate having you take the time to share you experience with us and hope that you and your daughter can continue to call us home for many more years to come! If there is anything additional we can do to make your stay with us even better, please do not hesitate to let our Leasing Team know!

name: Blake Matson
text: The office employees and maintenance employees go above and beyond for their tennant's. The maintenance guys come out right away to handle any and all concerns as soon as you file a work order.They are most friendly and knowledgeable as well. The office staff recently made accomodations beyond what would be expected for my family. The complex is safe and friendly. The units are nice and homey and well maintained. Thank you to the staff at Woodbrook for making a family friendly home for my family and I.

resp.text: Blake, Thank you for the 5 Stars! Hearing that our team has been able to exceed your expectations brings such a smile to our face! Providing the best customer service is extremely important to us, and we are so glad that you have chosen to call our community home. Our staff truly enjoys being able to be of as much assistance as possible, and we are looking forward to a wonderful rest of the year. If there is anything additional we can do to make your stay with us even better, please do not hesitate to let us know!

name: Tim Fowler
text: Rodent infested.   Rats running freely in the kitchen and laundry area,  and nothing meaningful is done about it.  No replies from management to my concerns.   Look elsewhere.

resp.text:
Hello Tim, Thank you for your review. I am so sorry to hear that you have not had an enjoyable experience and would like to gather some additional information on your current situation. At the earliest of your convenience, please feel free to reach out to me directly at: tstrong@ampresidential.com
I would be more than willing to shed some additional light on your current situation and work towards finding a resolution.

name: Ld Carter
text: Everything was so far so good when we moved here in May. First, I was having a friend over to visit that had just pulled up a couple minutes before me, only for a neighbor to come out of his apartment to see what they were doing there. I’ve had this same neighbor tap on my car window for no apparently reason, let alone stand behind my car as if he was looking for something in my car. Little did he know I was standing in the window watching his every move. Also, if you work a early morning shift (5am), you’re not suppose to make any noise whatsoever while getting ready for work, or you will receive a noise complaint. God forbid that you have any toddlers. Everyone knows that if you have a toddler, (ones with disabilities), they are going to make noise, they’re going to throw fits. And this leads me to believe that this apartment complex isn’t kid friendly. With COVID-19 going on a child should be able to enjoy themselves in the comfort of their own home. There’s people running up and down the steps, slamming car doors, their apartment doors, and talking loud all night long. Somethings you have to deal with when living in an apartment, especially when you move on the bottom floor. I didn’t move into these apartments to be harassed, nor to walk on egg shells. Every month you’re dealing with your water being brown. I’ve yet to seen any pest control, and to have my a/c filter changes. Don’t think I will be renewing my lease in the upcoming year; matter of fact I know I will not be renewing it.

resp.text:
Hello Ld Carter, Thank you for your review. I sincerely apologize that you have not had a positive experience. Please feel free to contact our Leasing Office directly in regards to the concerns you have mentioned so that we may further address. The comfort and enjoyment of our residents is extremely important to us and we most definitely want you to be able to love where you live. If I can be of any additional assistance at this time, you are more than welcome to contact me at: tstrong@ampresidential.com
I would be happy to gain some additional insight on your situation and will look forward to hopefully hearing from you soon.

name: R Matthews aka RJ
text:
I have lived here for around 2 years and the maintenance staff stands out because they always take care of everything. Also it is a quiet property. I had a water heater break once on a Sunday and it was phenomenal how fast they reacted.   The rents are reasonable. But I do not know what they currently are. Location is good as near 65 and very near many stores and restaurants.

But there are some issues here number one the pool is never open when the office is not here,
so they are never open on Sundays and the hours are very limited so that's a negative if you have kids. Also they no longer accept packages which is an issue because the property is confusing, so realize you may not get your I would rate 3.5 stars. 5 star though for maintenance and quiet.

resp.text: Hi R Matthews, Thank you for your review! We are so happy to hear that you have been part of our community for over 2 years and that our team has been able to exceed your expectations. We love hearing that you have been able to enjoy your home and well as the location to the local shops/restaurants nearby. We sincerely appreciate your recommendation and are looking forward to a wonderful rest of the year. Please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything additional we can do to make your stay with us even better!

name: Ron Harless
text: I have lived at Woodbrook Apt for only a few months, but I can tell you it has been terrific. The apartment is updated and has plenty of room.  The management and maintenance staff have all have been very professional and courteous. I appreciate the fact that there is a police officer who stays on the property. The property is well maintained, they are pet friendly  and even have a dog park.

resp.text: Hello Ron, Thank you for your review. We love hearing that your experience has been nothing shore of fantastic and that you are enjoying your new home! Our entire team truly loves being able to make sure each and every one of our residents feels welcomed and that also includes our furry friends too! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback! We hope that you continue to call us home for many years to come in the near future.

name: clark jackson
text: I really like my apartment.  I don't have any complaints except for the people across the hall who always leave a mess.  I am thankful for Toni and Kristina who always address it and get them to take care of it.

resp.text:
Clark,

Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

name: Shonda Harris
text: I absolutely love where I live, management is always extremely nice and maintenance is on top of their game.

resp.text: Hi Shonda, Thank you for the 5 Stars! We love hearing that you LOVE where you live and that our team has been able to make you feel at home. If there is anything additional we can do to make your experience even more enjoyable, please do not hesitate to let our office staff know.

name: Ariah Aaliyah
text: I just moved in a few days ago and I already feel at home. The management is very nice and professional and I enjoy the peace & quiet from the neighbors. Nice place to live for hard working people! Will definitely recommend to anyone.

resp.text:
Ariah Aaliyah,

Thank you for your review! We are so happy you are enjoying your new home!

Woodbrook

name: Glenn Koehler
text: Helpful staff, always there when you need them for maintenance. Grounds are kept clean and they take pride in their facilities all the time. They are by the book, to the letter and enforce every document. Would I recommend them to a friend? Yes, would I recommend my friend to stay here for more than 2 maybe 3 years? No, at the moment because the rent increases every contract renewal in the post 4 years I've been here mine has increased by $240 a month. Other than the increase monthly rent this place is awesome! Pool, volleyball court, cookout area, workout room, neighbors are typically nice and willing to chat and get to know you. Terrific starting point if you're joining the Gardendale Community.

resp.text:
Glenn,
Thank you for the positive comments - we are so happy you enjoy living at Woodbrook.  We also understand the pain of rent increases.  As property taxes, insurance, and the cost of property maintenance increases, we are forced to pass along a portion of the cost to our residents.  It's not the part of the job we like, but we do hope you see us as good stewards of your money as we invest in the community.
Thank you for your 5 star review,
The Woodbrook Management Team

name: Zackary Downing
text:
I was going to wait awhile to write a review on my experience here but had some change of plans. I have lived here for about half a year now so I'm pretty familiar with it's ups and downs.

Pros:
Management is friendly and informative
Maintenance is responsive
Decent pricing
Well lit at night.

Cons:
Horrible roads. (These apartments were built in the 70s and these roads have clearly not been revamped since then. All the time I see people navigating around the large holes and dips in the roads, me included)
The units have very poor sound insulation. I can hear my downstairs neighbors and outside way more than I should.
I see bugs in my apartment every day. Even after repeated pest control visits.
Poor complex security. NO CAMERAS ACROSS COMPLEX. This is 2019 and this apartment complex has NO CAMERAS covering any of the buildings or parking lots. The only cameras are inside the admin building..
There should have cameras on any apartment complex, let alone a 12 building complex... There was a recently a break-in outbreak where 18 cars(according police) had their door windows smashed and broken into at night. And what are the police gonna do? What can they do? NO CAMERAS...

If you want to have any security to make you feel safe in your living space, I hope you feel comfortable with some locks and windows that can be broken because that'll be all you can get here without providing your own security.

Edit: I've also been in contact with management since this review and non of the mentioned issues have been resolved. The property manager never even responded to my emails.

resp.text:
Zackary,

We have read your review and would like the opportunity to speak with you regarding these concerns. I am sorry that you feel the service you have experienced up to this point has not met your expectation.  Please contact the office at 205.631.4900, email us at wbk@ampresidential.com, or stop by the office when you have a few minutes to talk.  You may also reach out to the Regional Property Manager, Kimberly Pough by email at kpough@ampresidential.com. Thank you for your time and we look forward to speaking with you soon.

name: Christopher Blackmon
text: Great complex and community. Prompt maintenance service akways! Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice place to live.

Hello,

Thank you for your review. If there is anything our team can do to assist you, please contact us directly or stop by our office in person. We would love the opportunity to learn more about your concerns.

Thank you, we look forward to hearing back from you soon.

name: Christopher Shirley
text:
I have lived here for a year and continue to live here. Everyone has been awesome here. This is one of the best places I have ever stayed. The girls at the front and Toni the office manager do everything they can to help you. From packages to problems, they take care of you. And the maintenance people are always on point. Larry and Lee are always willing to help with anything and everything and go out of their way to take care of people.

Woodbrook is a great place to stay and I would recommend this place for anyone staying in Gardendale. Take it from me, ( A very picky person on certain things )

name: T T
text: Just want to say that new property manager is very rude, no customer service skills at all. Sticking news letters in your door about some renters liability insurance required by complex saying you can go through your own insurance company or use their provider for 10$ a month but then when you ask her in office, she replies very rudely(in front of another tenant) and says we don't provide it and then says she's had reports of people paying 12-14$ a month. Manager before her(Marci) was very helpful , but this one needs to get a grip on customer service skills . Plus when other manager was here....she was always in office 8-5. New one is here random times. I'm so over this place!! Maintenance Guy on other hand has always been here when needed . We will be searching to leave!!!! Now new people move in months ago and I believe that they are running a garage in the parking lot. They always have 3-4 cars or trucks that they are working on. They take up all the parking spaces and some of the cars don’t even have tags on them so they sit there for a long time . Now that is frustrating . Especially when we all sign a lease in agreement not do do those things and abide by the rules . It’s so irritating that they do that and they know it irritates you cause they see you having to park farther away from your apartment and where they park these vehicles it’s not even in front of their building. Rules are rules. Now addressing the management, she has gotten 100% better since she’s gotten used to residents. Maintenance guy is very good and quick so cudos for the team now!!!

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you were less than impressed with the quality of service you received upon your visit to the office. We want our residents to be as informed as possible and do our best to be transparent when communicating community policy. We apologize that this has not been reflected in your experience. We would like the opportunity to rectify this situation and would encourage you to visit the office so we can clear up any questions you may have in regards to renters liability insurance.

name: Cole Zirbel
text: Cannot stress this enough. Do. Not. Live. Here. From maintenance not responding to our fire alarms going off for 10 hours straight for no reason to maintenance coming into our locked rooms while we were asleep. Sinks and showers with mold to boot. Hot tub was green all year. Elevators broken on a consistent basis and bang around when they do work. Not worth it when you can stay almost somewhere else cheaper and better. Can’t wait to get out of here along with everyone else that has lived here.

resp.text: Cole - thanks for your insight into living at West & Wright and providing your feedback about certain amenities/appliances. It is our apology to you that these aspects determined an unfortunate lifestyle for you and others. We recently acquired a new manager at this property who is hoping to utilize information just like this to accurately assess how to improve the quality of life onsite. If you'd care to provide more color to your concerns/issues, we'd be happy to hear them in-office or over the phone, or by emailing the GM Jamie at jmancine@westandwright.com. However works best for you. We hope to speak with you soon, Cole.
