text: not professional

name: miesha folmar
text: She’s very respectable and listens to you when you have a problem, she also gets the job done I love her she’s the best !!!!!!!

name: Koda Tales
text: There is a roach problem for people living on the first floor. They do spray but it doesn't seem like enough. The apartment complex requires a deposit of $200 which is understandable. But then when moving out even if you leave the place spotless and cleaned. Vacuumed, mopped, carpets washed, everything wiped up. They take $120 out of your deposit for "painting and carpet". My deposit is not for regular upkeep. My deposit is ONLY for damage that is done to the apartment or furniture. I have spoken to my lawyer and have pictures of before moving in and after moving out. Several other people I know have had this similar problem and we are going to take this to court.

name: Trish Meeks
text: The manager & staff were very friendly & helpful...went to work for them contracting cleaning job & was not paid according to agreement, this was due to management

name: BeautyByShanyquia !
text: Honestly I hate staying here now, I have bad roommates. I have to call the police on them because they touch my things. Bugs are bad here , and the neighbors can’t follow directions when it comes to having dogs. I done had to put up with nothing but drama the entire time of me staying here. Management is good but just living here overall has been a nightmare in hell.

name: Doug Hoffman
text: The building has roach infestations (not just problems, they come out of the wall, and I've heard of multiple cases of the exact same problem ) they don't give you a clean the apartment, a very rough dirt parking lot for guests, and god forbid one of your appliances is broken ( microwave was broken and they were told from the beginning and are going to replace it after our lease is over). Oh.and watch out for the flimsy furniture. Our 15lb dog propped himself up on the coffee table and it collapsed. Stay away.

name: A. “Stitch Boss” Morris
text: God luck trying to get management to the door or on the phone.

name: James Cole
text: Great place

name: Noble Morse
text: Great service

name: Justin Conklan
text: I've lived here for over a year now and I would say that it's been a great place to live there have been some times were things didn't get fixed right away but other than that the staff have been really kind and are doing there best to help in any way they can.

name: Alissa Alhajri
text: SCAM first they showed us the model apartment and told us that our apartment is going to look the exact same, but we didn't get to see it because she claimed they're working on it at the time. On the moving in day we first got to see it and it did not look like the one she showed us. They didn't change the carpet it had stains all over it. The refrigerator was old and broke down within a month, the shower was broken there was water going every where and the bathroom celling was leaking. We had to go to my moms to just take showers. After 2 or 3 months the AC broke down in the middle of the night and it was 85 degrees inside so we called the emergency maintenance and he came after he was upset on the phone like it was my fault and charged the AC and left, that didn't last but 2 days and broke again. The whole living experience was horrible. The office ladies were rude and liars.

name: Geraldine Glover
text: The apartments are modern, clean.  Staff friendly, helpful.  Service is good.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this 5-star review! We truly appreciate your positive feedback and helping to share the word about Regency Gates.

name: NIQ
text: Scam . The ladies at the office lied to me and deceived me . I moved down here for college . I was looking at a couple different places and ran across regency gates apartments. Because of the rent prices and the fact that I’m in college and low on cash I explained to the ladies in the office that I would pursue other options first . I was told to hold the apartment for 72 hours I had to set up an account and attach a card , they didn’t tell me that it would charge me a 60$ application fee for a application I never completed . It’s been 2 months now and the office will not refund my money .

name: Jelisa Williams
text: I have lived here for about 6 months and I would recommend. I’ve had a few maintenance issues however they were always handled in a timely manner. It’s true the gates do not work however I’ve never had or heard of a problem with crime here. You get what you pay for and in comparison to other apartments in this location the rent is reasonable.

name: Ebony Foxx
text: If 1 Star wasn’t a requirement to rate I wouldn’t give them any! Our A/C is broken for like the 5th time since we’ve been living here, which has only been a year. Not to mention ALL of the other things that break down constantly, like the broken water main in front of our window that’s constantly running and attracting frogs and insects.  The office staff does nothing, maintenance sucks (for lack of a better term), and I would not recommend living here at all.

resp.text: M. Hughes, please reach out to the leasing office for information on your A/C and water maintenance concerns. Our team is working hard to make your home a cool and pleasant environment for you and your family. They do a great job and we believe that you will be pleased with the results. Office - 251-344-5755

name: Erica Scott
text: We absouletly love our new apartment home. The staff is amazing and has gone above and beyond to help me and my family.  The manager Stephanie and her entire staff  are extremley professional and nice. The apartments are very spacious and the neighborhood is very peaceful..

resp.text: We are thrilled to hear this report! Thank you, Erica. Compliments about our people are treasured. We seek to provide a great "home" experience and your wonderful encouragement helps us achieve this goal for our entire community. Thank you so much for making your home with us!

name: Phillip Glaze
text: I personally just signed my lease with this complex at a very reasonable price. The office staff was very helpful and kind. I would definitely recommend this complex!!!! Or at least come see what they have to offer!

name: Eric Coleman
text: It's a joke here. They don't care about their customers/ residents.  Rent may be reasonable but it's not worth your frustrations.  Go elsewhere.

name: Alexander Johnson
text: This place is a joke. I lived here for 1.5 years and was so happy to find a HOUSE to rent mid lease.  Gate never worked,  compactor was always full, the two little ponds in front always looked gross, the pool area was never clean covered with leaves, the laundry mat had some seriously old machines and the maintenance guys had this obnoxiously loud 90's toyota pickup that they would rev up and haul ass around the complex. Do not let the reasonable rent fool you.

resp.text: M. Johnson, Thank you for your feedback. We value our community and work hard to keep it clean. We are fortunate to have residents who take pride in our community’s appearance by helping us keep the grounds clean! It really does make a positive difference in everyone’s living experience. Please contact us at 251-344-5755 or RegencyGates@bandm.org so that we can address your specific concern.

name: Jimothy K
text:
LOOK AT THEIR REVIEWS. THESE PEOPLE ARE AWFUL.

Worst apartment complex in Mobile, AL. Trying to get ahold of the management is next to impossible. They will ruin your credit over a mistake they made and won't be willing to do anything. You can see the other reviews and make your own decision. They do the bare minimum for an apartment complex.

name: mo coleman
text: I would like a contact number for someone higher then the office staff,  and manager. I am a current long term tenant, and I am very disappointed..

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to reach out. If we failed to meet your expectations, we sincerely apologize. If you would like to share details of your experience with management, please fill out a comment form at www.bandm.org. Your comments will be directed to the the appropriate person for review and response. Thank you for choosing to make your home with us!

name: latoria west
text: Why do y'all Apartments cost so much it's ridiculous if your going pay 900 a month are 1,000 a month u mite as well get a house . I don't see how people live there it's a wast of money . U going spend that much to rent   u can be smart and do rent to own!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your comments M. West. I'm not sure why your thoughts would warrant a 1-star review of this property. There are many benefits to renting. If you speak with 10 happy residents, you are likely to find 10 different reasons why they are happily paying monthly rental rates. If you are interested in knowing more, please visit our website... http://www.regencygates.com/ . Please note that availability is limited. Select a possible move-in date to determine if we have any units of that type available to you. In the process, I hope that we can earn more stars.

name: Ashleigh Ely
text: Burn this place to the ground

name: Althalier Johnson
text: Terrible office staff, extremely rude and act like any small request is impossible.

name: Justin Hill
text: They need to spend some of the money I pay in rent to fix the damn entrance gate and the huge puddle that develops in the road when it rains.

resp.text: M. Alajmi, Thank you for taking the time to leave us an excellent rating. We would like to know more about your experience at Regency Gates. Your feedback is instrumental in improving the property and services for you and future residents. Please let us know what you like about us and the property. Call 251-344-5755 or email RegencyGates@bandm.org. If you would like to share details your experience with management, please fill out a comment form at www.bandm.org. We look forward to hearing from you!

name: Mary McKeegan
text: Our time at High River has been great. Emily and the maintenance guys do a fantastic job - they are responsive, professional, and friendly. We have been so spoiled by the spacious living room, bedrooms, and master closet, as well as a new in-unit washer and dryer set. The size of the kitchen is wonderful, and while some appliances may be ready for an update, everything has worked seamlessly for us. We also love the pool and are so impressed by how well it is kept up. Additionally, this pet-friendly home has been a great place to welcome our first four-legged family member. We wish we could take this apartment with us when we move out of Tuscaloosa!

name: Emily Toncrey
text: Great complex and very friendly staff! Emily is very kind and patient, and works quickly to remedy any issues my partner and I have with the apartment. The amenities are clean and well kept. Overall it is the best apartment in Tuscaloosa/Northport area that I have rented.

name: colby
text: These apartment homes are absolutely fabulous!! My partner and I had been looking all over town for that just right apartment for us to start our lives together in. As soon as the property manager gave us a tour of these apartments, both me and my partner were in love! The price is great for us, the floor plans were nicely laid out, as if it kind of “flowed” naturally. We loved the fire place!! We were both sold on it! The property manager did his job SO WELL and accommodated to our needs, as if he knew exactly what we were searching for!! Thank you so much for the help of me and my partner getting settled into a home together we’re we can start our lives!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving your feedback for High River. We are so happy you are experiencing an A+ living experience with us, from the tour to the move in. We love hearing from our residents so that we can ensure we are providing the best possible living experience for everyone. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Chase Moultrie
text: DO NOT LET THE NEW APARTMENTS FOOL YOU. Have been living here since August of 2020. Month after month, week after week there has been problems arising. Ever since moving in we have not been able to have a stabilized place to call home. Maintenance has constantly been in our apartment almost every week since September. We have had countless rats pop up in building 400. Managers have said every excuse not to fix the situation. Dryer doesn’t even work. You have to dry your close 5 times in order for them to be fully dry. Mold is now starting to grow in our apartment. HIGHLY recommend that you do NOT move here.

resp.text: Thank you for your review of our community, Chase. I am sad to see you feel this way about your home. I understand that management has been in contact with to resolve your issues. If you have more specific concerns over how we can improve our community you can always contact us at the office and let us know. It is my hope that we are able to make this right and move forward with a mended relationship. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Samaria Johnson
text: I moved into an apartment a month ago. It was a cross-country move and I rented sight unseen. Emily, the complex manager, was a total rockstar, as were the other Bell staff that helped while she was OOO. Not only was the leasing process smooth sailing, with the process as clear-cut as possible, but actual move-in was a breeze, too. Even in a pandemic, I had no problem picking up my new keys. The apartment was professionally cleaned before I arrived. The appliances are new and work well. Maintenance arrived the morning after placing a late-night work order and repaired a kitchen sink to work even better than before, and even cleaned the area up a bit. (Thanks again, Drew!) The complex is quiet and safe, tucked away on the Northport border but very close to everything in the center of both that and Tuscaloosa. Rent is very reasonable and easy to pay. I'm definitely going to stay put until it's time to buy a house!

resp.text: Hello. I have moved across states before and I understand how unnerving it can be. I am so glad that you are happy with your new apartment. I look forward to your stay with us at High River. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Tony Stewart
text: I am considering moving to the area and have been checking out different places to potentially live. Adam was awesome in answering any and all questions! Not only was he helpful in answering questions as pertaining to the property, he gave me some helpful tips in navigating the city- places to eat, drink, and shop! Definitely suggesting this place to friends who may be moving soon thanks to him!

resp.text: Tony, thank you for your awesome review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your tour with me. We hope you call High River home soon. -Adam Campbell, Assistant Community Manager

name: wendy stepp
text: I absolutely love this property! It is beautiful, and the staff is great! Couldn't have asked for a better experience! Thanks to Adam and his team, I had a wonderful day. I highly recommend this complex to anyone searching for their new home!

resp.text: Hi Wendy. I'm so pleased you enjoyed your tour with Adam. We look forward to welcoming you to your new home at High River! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Elise Kaminski
text:
Emily and Adam both are very responsive and helpful. They’ve worked so hard to make sure my experience with High River is positive. Rent is very reasonable for the area and the complex is well tended. Pet friendly and quiet neighborhood. I’m looking forward to the remainder of my time here.

Update: Put in a maintenance request late last night and got home from work today to find the initial maintenance and more had already been completed by Drew. Very impressed.

resp.text: Hello! It sounds like you are having an A+ living experience at High River and I am so glad to hear that. Thank you for the kind words about our office team. We too are looking forward to your time here at High River. If we can do anything for you, please don't hesitate to reach out. -Emily, Community Manager

name: jimmy paul
text: Adam is a great asset to your team at High River! Very personable and polite. Very easy to talk to and informative about the property! High River is a great place! Roll Tide!

resp.text: Hey Jimmy, We're lucky to have Adam as one of our team members. We're even more lucky to have you share your experience with us. I hope that High River is where you choose to call home soon! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Jalen Gee
text: I am sad to say that I will be leaving high river to downsize to a one bedroom apartment . During my time here I have had nothing but great experiences . My first leasing managers were Morgan and Victoria and let me say they have by far been the best management staff I have ever dealt with. Over the past couple of months Emily took over and she as well has been extraordinary! If you love pets they are very pet friendly (I don’t own a pet) and it is a quiet neighborhood. There are no gates but there is no need because there is always an officer or security on site . I highly recommend for young professionals or adults who like to be close to downtown in a quiet neighborhood with good views of the lake from a trail nearby .

resp.text: Jalen, I am equally sad that you will be leaving us and I wish that we had a 1 bed room so that you could continue to be here at High River! Thank you for the kind comments about my team and I and the positive review of the community. If you need us in the future, you know where to find us! Best of luck to the future. -Emily

name: Cole Vick
text: The staff here is amazing! It is affordable and a nice clean place to live. They work very hard to accommodate all your needs as well.

resp.text: Thanks for your kind review, Cole! We are so glad you chose High River to be your new home and that you love living with us. We truly work to make your experience with us an enjoyable one! We really appreciate you and we hope it shows in all that we do. - Emily, Community Manager

name: Angie Ingram
text: Emily and her team with Bell Partners do an amazing job. They go above and beyond to make sure the needs of their residents are met and High River is a beautiful community.

resp.text: Hi Angie. Thank you for your kind review. We are delighted to hear that you value the efforts we have put toward creating an environment where everyone at High River can thrive including both residents and vendors. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Chris Russo
text: Very nice! Pools always a plus on a sunny day. Nothing is better than great customer service and a impeccable experience living somewhere like this.

resp.text: Hey Chris! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this amazing review. We appreciate you for choosing High River. -Adam Campbell, Assistant Community Manager

name: travis diggs
text: Emily and staff at High River have been great to work with.  Coming from a contractor's perspective she is always very attentive and making sure the needs of her tenants are taken care of in a timely fashion.

resp.text: Thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team! We’re very happy to hear you're having such a great experience working with our community! Thank you again for taking the time to leave us this review about your experience. - Emily, Community Manager

name: mjg1312
text:
Great place to live! Move in was smooth and the staff is fantastic - I'm looking forward to the time I will spend here.

Edit - Shout out to Drew D. for doing an awesome job with my service request!

resp.text: Hey! I like to hear that your move in was a smooth success. I hope that you enjoy your time at High River. If you need anything, please let us know! - Emily, Community Manager

name: Zach and Courtney Carlson
text: This apartment complex is so beautiful! The application process was easy, the staff was so kind! We are so happy here!

resp.text: Zach and Courtney, this review made our day! We are ecstatic that you chose High River to be your new home. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Chase Richerson
text: I recently took a tour of High River Apartments and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. They answered all of my questions and the  Crepe Myrtle’s give the property’s landscaping that extra touch. Beautiful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming by to tour our community! I'm pleased to hear about your nice experience. We hope that you chose High River to be your new home! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Carl D HendersonJr
text: The staff there is really friendly!!! I just recently went and view the apartment and they are beautiful!! I look forward to becoming a resident there soon!!

resp.text: Hey Carl, Thanks so much for the kind review. Maintenance works hard to keep the community grounds and apartment homes looking great. We're so glad that you visited and we can't wait to welcome you home to High River! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Donnie Bennett
text: This apartment complex was amazing to stay at in the short time I live in Tuscaloosa. Amazing staff and apartment conditions. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for am apartment.

resp.text: Hey Donnie! Thanks for the positive review. I'm glad that you enjoyed your time at High River. If you're ever back in Tuscaloosa, make sure to come by for a visit! -Emily, Community Manager

name: kim weaver
text: High River is the place to call home !! The property is well maintained the staff is amazing always willing to go the extra mile to make sure the tenants have a safe and secure place to call home .

resp.text: Hey Kim. We take pride in our community and want our residents to be proud to call High River home. It's nice to see our hard work is being noticed. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We're lucky to have you with us. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Ra'Shard taggart
text: What is there to say about the duo Emily and Adam they have been nothing sort of amazing from the first phone call all the way down to the lease singing they were very warm friendly welcoming and just all around awesome. I'm so happy that i chose Hghriver . Thanks  again Adam and Emily you guys rock.

resp.text: Ra'Shard, Thank you for sharing your experience with others. I am happy to hear Adam took great care of you when you came to tour! We are even happier to have you join our community! If you ever need any assistance, please know we are here to help. Thank you! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Robin Graham
text: Love living here! Very spacious for the cost, maintenance is very responsive and Emily is awesome! Thanks for printing all my documents!

resp.text: Hey Robin. The team and I work hard to make sure everyone has a great experience. I am so happy that you are loving High River. Thanks for choosing High River! - Emily, Community Manager

name: josh lavergne
text: I recently went in to get a tour of the property and everyone I spoke with in the leasing office was super friendly and accommodating. Looked at a couple different floor plans and really loved them all and the property was also very well maintained from what I could tell!

resp.text: Hi there! We are so excited that you came by for a tour and I'm glad that you enjoyed the community. We hope to help you make High River home very soon! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Hong Le
text: We love it here, it nice, clean and quiet, good place for kids and also they provided washer and dryer so you don't have to bring your own and Emily she's so nice and very helpful.

resp.text: Hey Mrs. Le. I'm so happy to hear that you are enjoying your time at High River! We're so lucky you chose us and I hope that you continue to have a positive experience. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Samantha Mitchell
text: I absolutely love the dog park!! Emily & Adam were so helpful throughout the move in process, and Drew fixed my maintenance request so fast!  😊😊

resp.text: Hey Samantha! I'm so glad to hear you and your fur baby are enjoying the community. We're glad you are here. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Reed Davis
text: Extremely nice staff, and a very well maintained community! Has been a great choice for us!

resp.text: Hello Reed. I am so happy to hear that you are happy with your home. We are so glad to have you here! If you need anything, please let us know. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Terri McLaughlin
text:
I was denied on my application on June 25. I called on June30 to check on my application fee that I was told would be refunded to me.  They then said since I checked the box for a one time charge on application that it wasn’t refunded to my account because a deposit is the same thing as a charge. Ludicrous !!!
I was told they will process me a check that will be sent out in the mail but it won’t be processed and mailed out until next week.  I have never heard of such.  Most people wouldn’t catch them on this. Be very careful and read all fine print.

resp.text: Hi Terri, thank you so much for your review. We understand that you have been waiting for your check to be refunded and we are so sorry that this has taken some time. With the holiday coming up, please be aware that you should receive it the following week. We are so sorry for this inconvenience. Best, Bell Customer Service

name: Olivia Adamson
text: Absolutely LOVE High River Apartments! They’re very clean, professional and friendly. Not sure who the new guy in the office is, but I think his name is Adam and his customer service is UNMATCHED!

resp.text: Hey there! Thank you for the kind words. Adam is definitely one of a kind and we're so glad to have him on our team! We're even more glad to have you at High River! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Keith Sherer
text: We have had the privilege to work with the staff on numerous projects.

resp.text: Hey Keith. It's been a pleasure working with you at High River. Thank you for always doing a great job on our community. -Emily, Community Manager

name: L Grm
text: So far so good!  Morgan is very detailed, patient and professional.  The approval process was mostly easy- I recommend speaking with her if you are interested in renting.    Hopefully after reading the other reviews we wont be out of luck on move in day.   I really don't think there will be any snags whatsoever.

resp.text: Hello! Thank you so much for your review! We are so glad to hear that you are enjoying your home. If there is anything that we can do for you, please don't hesitate to contact us in the office. Thank you! -Victoria, Community Manager

name: Farrah Painter
text: I love working with Emily!  She's a rock star!

resp.text: Thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team! We’re very happy to hear you're having such a great experience with our community! Thank you again for taking the time to leave us this review about your experience. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Stacy Bensley
text: Very nice staff to work with. Very prompt with responses!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your experience with us today. It's been a pleasure working with you as well. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Brandon Thorn
text: Move in date hasn't arrived(but less than two weeks!), but I have been super impressed with the responsiveness and professionalism of Emily and the rest of the team.  Apartment/home shopping can be stressful---and I decided to leave my tiny dwellings last minute because I just felt cramped and stuffy.  I would frequently wake up in the middle of the night with some random (and im certain absurd) question, and every time would receive a response.  This was outside normal business hours, yall.    In all honesty, this transition might be the smoothest move Ive ever experienced in 40 ish years. Looking forward to move in date soon!

resp.text: Hey! Thanks for sharing your experience. I have been in your shoes while apartment shopping myself and it can be daunting! We try our best to make the process of applying, moving in and living here a hassle-free process. I look forward to your move in in a couple of weeks. -Emily

name: Thatcringingdude
text: lived here a year ago and there were people downstairs that always played loud music.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving your feedback for High River.  I am sad to hear your experience was less than enjoyable. We enjoy hearing from our residents so that we can ensure we are providing the best possible living experience for everyone.  We'll keep this in mind moving forward. -Emily, Community Manager

name: William Stewart
text: I love living here the staff and neighbors are so nice...... very very very pet friendly!!!!! HIGH RIVER ROCKS!!!!!

resp.text: Hey William! Thanks for the kind words. We love our 4-legged friends just as much. YOU rock, too! Thanks for choosing High River. -Emily, Community Manager

name: la Grm
text: After Morgan left - emails are unanswered.  These are simple emails - such as “ why was there a 4 dollar admin fee added to rent for December?”     Isaiah tries but is new.  After a few months we are pleased with the one/ two maintenance  requests.  Very nice and helpful.   This is an updated review.  Just not pleased with the office not responding to basic inquiries.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. I am truly disappointed to hear about your experience. I am glad that maintenance has been successful with completing your service request. It is my hope that I can help change your perception of the office staff during your stay here. Please don't hesitate to contact me directly at the office with any future concerns. -Emily S., Community Manager

name: Nicole T. Springer
text:
I moved from the East Coast down to Tuscaloosa two months ago, and I did not have the opportunity to see the apartment before moving in. This was also before COVID-19 and social distancing guidelines. I spoke with Emily (Manager) quite a bit and Elijah (Assistant Manager) as well when Emily was not in the office. Emily was so patient, kind, and made the process really stress-free. Being so nervous to rent a home sight-unseen was worrisome, but she helped me feel at ease. She even did a video of my apartment so I could see it prior, but the document was too large so she wasn't able to send it. From this example, Emily goes above and beyond and really wants to make sure all prospective renters feel comfortable. I changed my apartment several times due to move-in dates and we decided to go with a 2B /1.5 BA townhouse.

When I walked into our townhouse for the first time, I was absolutely blown away. It's worth it for the extra price. The rooms are spacious, and there's enough privacy in each room so you don't feel everything is completely open which is wonderful. I love our laundry room, the toilet downstairs, and the ridiculous amounts of closet space. The master bedroom has a large walk-in closet, and then there's another room connecting to the closet that I guess is for storage but is also very roomy (not for living quarters). The only downside to the apartment is that we had to buy lamps for each room excluding the kitchen, dining room, bathrooms, and hallway. If you have dogs, this is the perfect place. Having a puppy and a 3 year old pup, the dog park inside the apartment complex is the cherry on top. The dogs get to run around, the people we've met so far have been nice, and I haven't experienced or seen any issues with multiple dogs in the park. If you want to jog (especially in this time with social distancing), the hill and sidewalks can make it a nice alternative. I only had three nights where I could hear the neighbor's music, but that was it (not too distracting or annoying). I spoke with other apartment communities in the area that may look newer and a bit more upscale, but the way Emily and Elijah treated me here at High River made this place even more worth it. I would rather spend my money at a place where I am treated with respect and with kindness, than a place that looks a bit prettier but the staff are not as friendly or as welcome. If you are affiliated with UA, let them know as they have a great partnership which helped nicely with the application fee reduction.

If you have any issues with maintenance in the home, they will come by ASAP. I put in a request today at 11 AM or so, and they were at my house by 11:30 AM. I will say price wise too, you cannot opt to have the "Trash Butler" service. For someone who has difficulty with mobility at times, putting my trash outside my door in the receptacle and someone emptying and taking it to the trash for me is a nice privilege. I have also had no difficulty with packages being dropped off at my door (i.e. Amazon). This place is great. We're excited to check out the amenities once it's safe to do so. The area is ideal and is incredibly convenient. I highly recommend.

resp.text:
Thank you for leaving your feedback for High River. We are so happy you are experiencing an A+ living experience with us. We love hearing from our residents so that we can ensure we are providing the best possible living experience for everyone. We will keep your comments in mind as we continue to make improvements to our community. Please don't hesitate to reach out if there is anything else we can help you with! -Emily S. Community Manager

– High River Team

name: Clay Welch
text: Great location, great staff and beautiful updated property!

resp.text: Hey Clay, thanks for the kind words. We're glad that you find the community beautiful! -Emily, Community Manager

name: Morgan
text:
I really enjoy this complex. It's a nice place to live, and the amenities are a great touch. We have a beautiful pool, a dog park, and a small gym. The package lockers are also a great addition.

If your neighbors aren't courteous, there can be a noise issue, but the office is willing to listen and help resolve the issue.

I would also like non-carpeted flooring throughout which would be easier to clean and maintain. Some of the apartments have this based on pictures, so choose me next lol.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are pleased to hear you had a positive experience at High River. We look forward to continuing to provide you with Hassle Free Living :) -Lauren, Bell Customer Service

name: Sydney Adams
text: I honestly have loved living at High River. I have lived here for about a year and a half now and have had nothing but positive experiences. From the office staff to the maintenance staff, they are both friendly and accommodating. Also being a younger girl, it is reassuring to live in a safe community that has a courtesy officer on site. I plan to live at HR for the remainder of my time in Tuscaloosa!

resp.text: Hi Sydney! Thank you for your review! We are pleased to hear you had a positive experience at High River Apartment Homes. We look forward to continuing to provide you with Hassle Free Living :) -Lauren, Bell Customer Service

name: Jacob Henry
text: Really nice quality place!

resp.text: Hi Jacob! Love reading about your 5 star experience. We hope you continue to receive quality care at High River. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Jeff Spears
text: The kindest staff ever!

resp.text: Aww, thanks Jeff! Kindness is a 2-way street. Thank you for being so kind as to share your experience with us. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Vee Cooper
text: I am moving to Tuscaloosa with a new job. Prior to visiting the property, I had been conversing with the office staff. When I arrived, they were both pleasant and friendly. Took the time to show me around the complex and explained any questions I had. The grounds are well kept, and even though some units haven’t been upgraded to the fullest, the spaciousness is awesome and the pricing even more pleasing. They have taken my moving anxieties away, and I’m so looking forward to making HR my new home. ~~~~~~~Vee

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review, Vee! We are so happy to hear that you decided to make High River your new home and that our team was able to make your transition a smooth one. We strive to provide all of our residents with Hassle Free Living so please feel free to stop by our office if there is anything else we can do to make your stay with us even better! -Lauren, Bell Customer Service

name: Marvinia “Tara” Roberts
text:
Apartments are very nice and for the price in an Alabama college town. You can hardly beat it. I here many years ago and now I just visit friends. I miss living here. Wow! The upgrades that have been down since I have left.
Pet friendly and a gated area for pets to play. Love it!

name: Chase Martin
text: High River apartments has been a great apartment complex! Very nice office staff, and the manager cares about her renters. If anything needed to be repaired or fixed up maintenance would take care of it the next day. Plan on renewing

name: Tiffany Sledge
text:
I only lived here for 1 semester before I transferred schools.

The office staff was very friendly and accomadating. They always helped me out with anything I needed.

Lots of green space for my dog. Also, there's a running trail right next to the complex!

Super friendly neighbors. The community events also help you meet people.

Only complaints: the speed bumps are obnoxiously huge and there are so many of them! They love to do lawn work (leaf blowing/ mowing/ etc) at approx 8:00 on Saturday mornings, so if you live on a green space, it's hard to sleep in. But that's just me being lazy. :)

If I were to move back to Tuscaloosa, I wouldn't hesitate to move back in here!

name: Luke Keller
text:
Incompetently managed.
The office will tell you there multiple units available, show you a unit, accept your application and application fee, not process  your application for 7 days despite several attempts by you to contact them, and then tell you there was never a unit available for you to lease at your requested start date when you show up in person to check in on them.

name: Anthony VanSlambrouck
text: The staff is probably the best thing about this place. They're so kind and helpful that when we moved, I was a little sad. The apartments are very nice, especially the renovated ones.

name: Mark Guy
text: Highly recommend

resp.text: Thanks for recommending us Mark! The best compliment we can receive is always a referral. -Emily, Community Manager

name: Vernell Brothers
text: Talk about false advertising! What High River advertises and what you get is the absolute opposite. I moved from Bakersfield, California to Tuscaloosa to be with my daughter who is a freshman at the University of Alabama. I accepted an apartment based partly on those online pictures. Once I moved in, I realized how substandard these apartments really are. I was dumb enough to do everything sight unseen and trust what I was told; man was that a mistake. I retired as the Kern County Fire Marshal in California who can be contacted for my credentials. The on site management at the High River apartments are horrible and clearly does not understand the meaning of customer service. Since I am a single parent due to the passing of my wife, I decided to move to Alabama until my daughter graduates. I've dealt with people on so many levels including having to approve the SpaceShipOneOne project (the first civilian manned space flight). So, the bottom line is...I would not recommend these apartments to anyone. I live in Apartment 714 and you can feel free to visit and compare my apartment to what they advertise. The only pleasant experience I've had is that of my contact with the President of Arlington Properties, hte company who owns the apartments.

name: James Patillo
text: Rent isn't too high, but the power bill definitely makes up for it. In a three bedroom apt or townhouse you can expect to pay over $300 per month if you don't want to bake in the summer.

name: Dana Ehret
text: High River rented me an apartment they didn't even have! They told me that people were leaving the next month, and then called to tell me they changed their minds and were staying! Then they told me that another one would open in two months! I had already moved out of my previous place and was basically living in my car. They wouldn't place me in another apartment owned by Arlington properties, offer to pay for an extended stay, or help with the cost of storing my belongings! I ended up saying forget it and finding another apartment. They wouldn't even give me back my application fee for their mistake!!

name: waseem khan
text: Worst place ever.

resp.text: Hi Waseem, thank you for your feedback. We're very sorry to hear this. Please feel free to contact the office and let them know how they can improve your experience at High River! - Lindsay, Bell Customer Service

name: Lauren F
text: Fantastic staff!  Priscilla Nguyen is amazing!  Seriously, she is so great y’all!!!  Went above and beyond to help us with our move in and made everything so easy and stress free!  The apartment is great, everything was ready to go for us in an extremely short timeframe.  From the friendly security at the gate to the leasing office staff, we felt immediately at home and welcomed with enthusiasm.  We knew we had made the right choice making Vie at University Downs our new home!

name: Tarraina Turner
text:
I’ve lived here for almost 3 years so since before the transition to new management. Took almost a year to renovate but everything is beautiful. However, the transition to a new wifi had left me unable to work from home or do schoolwork because of the terrible connectivity. I can barely even watch tv on my Xbox since they switched the network. I have called white sky and nothing helps. They installed the wifi in a terrible place so I can’t even connect a router to extend the signal. White sky person came and recommended that I run a cord from the kitchen to the other side of my apartment. Never had these issues when we had Xfinity and it was much nicer. The apartment is overpriced for students not to even have good wifi and there aren’t any Ethernet ports to hardwire internet. It is not a hardware issue. My TVs and Xbox are brand new and I had NO issues with xfinity for the 2 years we used them. As you can see in my pictures sometimes the connection drops just minutes between.

UPDATE: The owner of my condo is now trying to move us out. The office has sent people up here AGAIN to work on the WiFi and they said the issue was not the WiFi but my usage. However, when I had all devices off as they suggested, other than the one I am using, and I’m still unable to work on school or remotely effectively. I try to meet with people in the office, and they treat me with disregard. I have lowered my rating due to the lack of understanding when it comes to the WiFi.

resp.text:
Tarriana,

I am sorry to hear about your issues with our WIFI connectivity.  I have asked our Accounts Manager Tyler Low to look into the situation further and he will be contacting White Sky.  Unfortunately, the switch to White Sky was authorized by the Condo's home owners association and we did not have any control on the switch but we are looking into how we can fix the problem.

Thank you,

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: mclain Beaulieu
text:
I have lived at Vie for around 7 months and I have had nothing but great experiences here. The staff is very friendly and attentive. If you have any issues a quick call to the office will solve it. The complex itself looks great and is very clean. The apartments are spacious and comfortable which make you feel like a king. Amenities are top tier, I myself use the gym a lot and its always kept in perfect condition. If you are a student or local resident Vie should be on the top of your list of places to consider.

- Conrad Beaulieu

resp.text:
Conrad,

Thank you for sharing your comments about living with Vie at University Downs.  We strive to provide an amazing experience for all of our guests and we are very proud of our community.  If you ever need anything be sure to stop by and see me in the office.

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: Penelope Featherington
text: I cannot say enough good things about University Downs! Every single amenity is top notch! The staff in outstanding! There is one guy in particular that stood out the most, Kyle Orabone! HE IS FANSTATIC!!! He made me feel right at home. I would even go as far as saying he is the reason I made University Downs my HOME!!! Don't miss out on this awesome place, or Kyle!

name: Patricia Moore
text: Had a very nice visit. The staff was amazing. They were also very helpful at any questions I had. Management was awesome.

name: Colton Kuykendall
text: I'm loving my experience as a resident of the Downs. Great friendly staff, Nice community, beautiful pools and Clubhouse.

name: Emma Milianta
text: I love living at vie on the apartment side! My boyfriend lives on the condo side and that’s how I found out about vie! I love the amenities and maintenance has been super quick every time I needed them!

name: Sebastian 9
text: Lived here for a year water pressure was terrible, you couldn’t have two water appliances running at the same time or else they wouldn’t work. You have to walk your trash the other end of the apartment complex. Frequently had bugs and the upstairs neighbors stomped all year. And all of this was way overpriced. Just overall not worth what they charge.

name: Brooke Owen
text: Me and my roommate have perviously never lived in apartment before. We had many worries of living on our own for the first time but within the first week of living here, it has been nothing less than perfect. We have never felt unsafe while living here, we don't have any kitchen appliances break down on us and most importantly, if is worth every dime to live here. We have friends in other apartments who feel like they are paying way to much to constantly having their dishwasher break down, or feeling like it is too dangerous to come home after 11pm. My roommate and I both highly recommend living at UDowns. Between the pool when its hot out and the weekly giveaways (such as pizza, movie nights, wings, trivia nights, etc.) this was the perfect place to spend our last year as students in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text:
Brooke,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We look are so happy you enjoy living here as your first apartment complex. We hope you choose to stay for a very long time. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to continue to make your experience great!

Thanks,
Vie Management

name: Sarah Amjad
text: The pool is awesome and they have lots of fun perks for the residents

name: Christopher (Topher) Fryzel
text: Great place with amazing amenities!  Friendly staff, too.

name: Rob B
text: I’ve lived here for over 3+ years and I’ve been pretty happy with it until recently. The new owners have made the “genius” decision to take away our cable/wifi we had with Xfinity and replace it with something called “whitesky”. Due to this, hundreds of channels are now gone and I no longer have access to several channels I rely on for sports. But hey, at least now I have three different versions of MTV and the cowboy channel... Glad to see they appreciate their residents. (Extreme Sarcasm)

resp.text:
Rob, Thank you for your review and we do apologize for your frustration. The HOA and the Board agreed to transition the cable and internet to WhiteSky because of the service that was being provided with the previous provider. The HOA has provided the channel line up, which includes many sports stations including ESPN, ESPN2, Fox Sports, SEC, ACC, Golf, and others. If you continue to have issues with the new transition that increased the internet speed significantly and adjusted the channel line up please let us know and we will notify WhiteSky to see what we can do. We look forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Vie Management

name: Lori Linn
text: My son has lived in a condo managed by Vie at University Downs for 3 years. It has been a great experience. The condo and amenities, including the 2 dog park areas and pools have been bonuses. Anytime a maintenance request has been put in, any problems have been immediately taken care of. The grounds are constantly well maintained and the office staff is friendly and courteous. We have another son leaving home soon and are confident that he will want to rent a place there, too.

resp.text:
Lori,

Thank you so much for your positive words and feedback. We work hard each day to create a great experience for all of our residents and parents! We sure are happy to have your son and you apart of the Vie at University Downs community. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make you experience even better.

Thanks,
Vie Managment

name: Deanna Rembold
text: I’ve been a resident here for over a year and a half and absolutely love it! New management goes above and beyond to make sure you’re happy. All the amenities have been fully renovated which is a huge bonus. I would recommend anyone to live here, whether you’re a student or have a family. Plus, they are pet friendly and my dogs love going on their walks around the complex and in the doggie section!

resp.text:
Deanna,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better! The new amenities are open and we are so excited to see everyone enjoying them!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: Shelby Gibson
text: I have lived here for 2 years & recently went through a rough patch with the apartment BUT the management communicated and helped me through if tremendously. This is a great place to live! The updates to the apartments are GREAT! They are attentive to your needs and want to make sure everything is a great experience for you!

resp.text:
Hello Shelby,
We're honored to be a part of your 5-Star experience, and are glad things have been communicated and will continue to be communicated to ensure a positive and happy living experience. we appreciate your kind words and will be sure to share with team. We look forward to having you as a part of our family for years to come.
Thank You.

name: Adrianne Turner
text: University Downs is a nice place to visit and the staff is really nice and helpful.

name: Clay Hodge
text: They do not send emails or text about maintenance work. I have woke up multiple times with workers in my unit without any notice, and with my lights on, door unlocked, and no one in the unit. Leaving my property available for the taking, and my trust in this place is completely gone. They cannot send a simple email or text for maintenance work but will happily run your electric bill up for no reason.

resp.text:
Clay,

Thank you for your feedback and apologize for any mis-communication. When all residents move out at the end of July our management and maintenance team are required to go to all apartments to make any repairs necessary. We apologize if this was not clearly communicated and hope that you will see increase communication moving forward. If you have any additional concerns we would like to work with you to make your experience better. As stated above, thank you again for your feedback as this only helps us make Vie at University Downs better.

Thanks,
Vie Management

name: Jenna Hall
text: THE BEST PLACE EVER TO LIVE IN TTOWN!!!!! The employees are AMAZING! I will NEVER live anywhere else in Tuscaloosa. Everything is newly updated and super clean. maintenance comes immediately and fixes everything in a timely manner. I love living at Vie!

resp.text:
Jenna,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: P H
text: One of the best places to be in Tuscaloosa. I've lived here for 2 years and the new management company is doing great things with this property. The coming renovations look awesome, and the new team is super nice and approachable. My only complaint is that the train can catch you on the way to class if you're driving, but their shuttle has gotten me to class on time without fail every single time. Really suggest that anyone who's interested in this property get in soon, I know they'll be raising the rates as soon as these renovations are done.

resp.text:
I'm always happy to hear some feedback from one of our long time residents! We can't wait for the new renovations to be done as well.

Best,
Management

name: Sydney Adams
text: I’m a senior at UA and I have loved living here at Vie at University Downs. The management is so helpful and friendly and the amenities are great. There is a brand new gym and renovated pool. I feel safe living here with the 24/7 security and gated entry. I definitely recommend living here!

name: carson brady
text: Great people even better service. Perfect for the family and pool(s) for the youngins. Awesome multi media room. State of the art gym, and stellar outdoor lounge area!

resp.text:
Carson,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: Cathy Chancellor
text: On Saturday, Jan 25, 2020, I visited this property with my daughter for housing her sophomore year at U of AL.   I am writing this review to compliment the two gentlemen who assisted us (Freddie & Parker).  I have never had a more friendly pleasant experience apartment shopping than I did with Freddie & Parker.   They were personable, friendly, helpful, patient, and understanding.   My daughter signed a lease today at this property beginning this Summer and I just hope Freddie & Parker are still there with their friendly smiling faces!  More importantly, I hope the management at this property realizes what an asset these two gentlemen are to potential tenants looking for a place to live.

resp.text: Thank you for the your feedback and compliments to our staff. We are pleased to hear how great your visit went and that we will be adding you and your daughter to our family. As a team, we take pride in making sure you feel welcomed and enjoy your visit. Freddie and Parker work really hard to make all those that come into contact with leave with a smile and a lasting memory. Can't wait to see you all during your move in.

name: zz tan
text: This work order is sufficient and fast, they fixed problem very soon! It will be perfect if they have more dumpster, they only have one near the entry.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your review and feedback. We are glad to see that you are having a good experience as we strive to ensure that all of our residents and guests enjoy calling Vie at University Downs their home. We will look into options for additional dumpsters outside of the trash compactor in the middle of the community. If you have any additional feedback we would love to hear from you and look forward to speaking with you further.

Best,
Vie Management

name: aretha moore
text: Love the property and the staff was great

name: Carl Lahey
text: Mr. King was very kind and professional through out the entire leasing process. He was always quick to help and often went out of his way to make our experience the best possible. We highly recommend vie as a place to live. Our daughter has only good things to say about it so I’m glad that we have her living there.

resp.text:
Carl,

Thanks so much for the compliments of our staff. They work hard to make everyone's experience the best possible.

Kindly,
Management

name: Savannah Cornell
text: Francisco and derrick the upper staff have accommodated every slice of the way! And I recommend to live here!! Please ask for Francisco when moving in and you’ll be happy!

resp.text:
Savannah,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: Tyquan Cannon
text: Great staff. Spoke with Fred and he was very professional and friendly. And willing to explain anything I had questions about. The community appears to be quiet but friendly. I am looking forward to the upcoming year here as a new tenant!

resp.text:
Tyquan,

I'm very happy to hear that you had such a positive experience. Welcome to the community!

Due to covid-19, we have to be quick, ready and on the move as the demands of healthcare request….Cons: Management took no responsibility! Every concern was put off as someone else’s issue. name: Madison Ehmann
text: Vie at University Downs is the worst management company I have ever worked for. After delaying their management takeover by almost 4 months, they made promises they were no where near capable of keeping. The staff I worked with was great until Vie and their employees came to Tuscaloosa and acted like everything would be better for everyone. The renovations that should’ve been finished weeks ago are just being completed. Or, in the case of the gym, these renovations haven’t even started, which will prove to be a great disadvantage to the new residents moving in in 2 weeks. Not only has this been a major problem, but the raise is rates is absolutely ridiculous. Changing a few appliances and putting wooden floors in the bedrooms is not worth an extra $150, especially when many residents provide their own furniture. Lastly, Molly Daniels, the regional manager at Vie, had been anything but helpful in this process. She was the main person to promise all of these renovations and upgraded amenities, yet left our staff as soon as she could to return to her other company. Vie Management is a complete joke. If you can live anywhere besides University Downs, please do!!

Madison,

We are so sorry that you feel so negatively about your experience. We also were not excited about the closing of the property being delayed, however we have great renovations that are taking place and all of the apartments will be completed in advance of move in, which is what we communicated and promised. We have many residents already enjoying the great new environment and experience. Please feel free to reach out to our Employee Relations Manager, Jessica Drucker, to discuss your employment further.

Vie Management

text: University downs changed management in December 2018 and boy is it noticeable. The assistant manager told someone on the phone to "f**k off" after they got an earful. Totally unprofessional. Newsflash folks: if your bank isn't in town it's really really hard to find a way to pay rent, which is why the direct pay option was heavily used. Lots of maintenance problems too: the air filter in the apartment I stayed at probably hadn't been changed since the place was built because it was completely clogged. First floor apartments have bugs too. The kitchen counters are warped and starting to break, the carpets are nasty, and the cracked window in the bedroom still hasn't gotten fixed either. There's also this huge pothole in the pavement that has been there since they started using a university bus after their broke down. The list goes on and on... The rent might be relatively cheap but you definitely understand why after living here for awhile. Save yourself a headache and rent somewhere else.

name: Tarnese Price
text: Before we moved in we had to pay rent on the 1st but couldn’t move in until the 15th because they had to “clean” the apartment. We waited just to move into a dirty apartment. Nothing was prepared for us. The mailbox key was the wrong key and the mailbox was broken so we couldn’t get our mail, and of course we were waiting on something important to be delivered. We didn’t have a gate opener so we had to use a code that worked half the time. When I finally received a gate opener it didn’t work because they didn’t activate it. The gate is trash and stopped working. Then our laundry room was flooding b\c of the air conditioning. We had to call them 3 times before they actually fixed it, just for it to happen again months later. We paid rent EVERY month ON TIME but they would put all the rent either on my account or my room mate’s account so we would get eviction notices. This has happened at least 6 out of the 9 months we have lived here. Then they decide they want to take up the carpet and replace it with something else while we’re still living here!! They kept changing the date so the day ends up being on a week where I have worked three 16-hour days plus I have back issues and need an operation so I’m having to try and move all my stuff out of my room and closet so they can do something they could’ve done after we leave this place!! Which just made my pain worst. For a month or two they had no groundskeeper so there was dog feces all over the property!! Everywhere you stepped you were likely to step in it. The tub is made of horrible material and is terribly hard to clean. The faucet in the bathroom has been leaking since I moved in. The walls are thin and you can hear the people upstairs. The dryer is trash and you have to dry your cloths twice just to get them dry. There’s no button for the garbage disposal. This place is trash for the cost!! They only care about the money not the residents!! If you like to throw away money then this is the perfect place for you!!

resp.text: Dear Tarnese, Thank you for letting us know about this. Your feedback helps us get better. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business and team. Although we can’t fix the past, we are committed to improving the way we serve every customer we have. Please accept my sincerest apologies on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. Do not hesitate to contact Garrett Galloway at manager@vieatudowns.com if you wish to discuss further.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give us a review. We appreciate all the feedback that you have given and will continue to make sure our residents are happy with the property and management.- Thanks Managment

name: Chayton Mowrey
text:
There are so many choices for apartment living in Tuscaloosa and from what I’ve experienced, no place will be perfect in every single way. My overall experience here was above average and I did enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, but it was a roller coaster. The staff is AWESOME. Nothing else to say there, they are all really good people and willing to help. I moved in fast and it was very easy, especially from a gentleman named Rulondo who helped me numerous times during my residency. Also, I want to emphasize how impressed I was with the security in the complex. There are numerous guards roaming and keeping watch, I felt very safe here.

In the units, the floor layouts are nice and the rooms are pretty spacious, the living/dining room especially.

I did however, have a few things I’d like to share. The first negative experience I had was after I was all moved in, I realized my apartment’s living room and dining room was unfurnished. I was informed that when the new ownership took over earlier in 2018, they furnished every unit with furniture. The one I lived in however, had a resident who had been in there prior to the change in management and had personal furniture already in his room. They told him that In order to get the living room stuff: couch, chair, television, tv stand, dining room table, chairs (basically everything one would need in a living space), that he must also accept the bedroom furniture. This meant he had to move all of his stuff out of there. Since he already had everything he needed, he declined.
Ironically, the other two bedroom units were furnished but the living room was still left empty. I tried numerous times to get furniture in this apartment but it felt like the staff really didn’t care about doing this and just didn’t want to deal with it. I was told numerous times that because we had already “opted out” of receiving furniture months ago, there was “nothing they could do.” Also, I know for a fact there was a plethora of extra furniture available. I let it go because I only signed a short term lease but to me this was unacceptable and simply just laziness on the management’s part.

In October, the whole complex underwent a network change to a company called Single digits. In summation, we were without internet connection for about two weeks and even after everything was “fixed” I still experienced issues. I discussed this with the staff and I can vouch for them that they did everything they could to get it up and running as fast as possible. However, I don’t know if they made the correct decision going with this company.

Something minor, but I felt necessary to be addressed is there are a lot of bugs. I am aware this was a problem a long time ago and the staff has previously addressed this, but I still had numerous experiences. Ant infestations: One in my bedroom from the trashcan and one in the kitchen pantry. This was fixed easily by a few and traps but still gross and took a while to clean up the dead ants. I am not sure if the property had been treated for bugs but mine definitely wasn’t, not to mention that there were roaches in the kitchen, often.

After seeing what other apartment complex’s are like. Yes, I had a few complaints, but I want to make sure the management can see these because feedback is a great way to improve. Vie at University Downs does have a lot to offer and it was a nice place to live. With a few fixes and changes, this place has the potential to be a top notch choice for living in Tuscaloosa, but changes definitely need to be made. They are upgrading the clubhouse and I assume it will be very nice.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your useful insights. We are thrilled to hear that you are happy to live here, but I also wante to let you know that we are constantly striving to improve these aspects.
Best regards,
Management
