name: Jessika Monique
text:
This is my fist time out on my own ....
They bribe you to make a good review about them on Google  But I don't play the radio.
I hate it here.
Misty is no longer over the apt. Complex .
I've Been a resident of twinkingham since June of 2016.

My mother has been asking for new lights on my building since MAY OF 2016 . That has STILL not Been handled.

A Young man was shot AND MURDERED at the bottom of my stairs, than not even two days later there is a shoot out leaving apartments & cars with bullet holes through them.

We hear gun shots often.
I live by myself- I'm scared to even walk in the house at night so I BARELY COME HOME.

That's not the end.

I've Ben paying $520 for rent.
March 2017 I got an notice saying I owed $570 . Apparently they charge " $35 for TRASH PICK UP " & $15 for the free cabal that you SO CALLED GET .

When does your rent go up in the middle of a contract? She said it's because misty put the information in wrong .   L I E .

WHEN DO THEY EVER COME GET THE TRASH? I've only seen it O N C E . NEVERRRRRRR

I called The front desk about it, the new landlord stated " she don't know, SHE DONT HAVE CONTROL OVER THAT. & it's not " $35 ".

So I hang up the phone to go INTO the office with the print out they gave me of my charges & to turn in my 60 day notice & she didn't want to talk to me she it was like I was totally disregarded . Because I'm a kid . That reallyyyyyy effected my outlook on this place as a whole.

You can Get used to wasps in your house crawling through seeps of cracks & door ways . Get used to seeing WATER ROACHES throughout your house . Espically in the summer & fall .

For $600 you can live in a gated , nicer & more professional neighborhood .

name: Daisy J
text: Sherry, Resident Manager, is super nice, and can multitask and get the job done. Every small issue that I’ve had she has completely resolved them as promised. Thank you Sherry!!!! And a very thanks to Orlando for getting my AC working. The apartment is great and my view is breath taking.

name: Shivakumar
text: Beautiful place. The apartment homes are newly renovated and very clean. The leasing office staff are very supportive always. The rental price also reasonable and they offer move in specials fee times.

name: Kecia McAlpine
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE!!! I have been here for 4 years and trying to get out. It took four years for them to get me a new HVAC. They once tried to repair it by placing a cinderblock on top of it to keep it from rattling. I currently have water running down the wall of my apartment and put in a work request on May 26th and they have yet to fix it. With this weekends rain, my apartment walls are completely ruined and I have 6 buckets sitting in my living room full of water and NO ONE has come out to fix the leak. It looks nice on the outside. However, DO NOT BE FOOLED.

name: Makayla Broussard
text: Worst apartment complex I have ever lived in! Not only was there construction outside my apartment for over 4 months. The took up all the parking spots with work vehicles and plants. Every time I tried to call the office with an issue they would not answer. I would have to call from other numbers or my work to get someone on the phone. I never made a late payment then I moved out due to how awful it was to live there, I received a bill in the mail dated 2/18. Called and they said to mail a check. Then I received a bill in the mail from a debt collector dated 2/22!! They did not give me the opportunity to pay the bill and impacted my credit negatively! Absolutely worst people to deal with. I would never recommend living here to anyone!

name: Michael Frost
text:
Do not move here

I put in a maintenance request Monday morning about a hair sized crack in our bathtub(5/11/2020). I do not expect at all for a bathtub to be replaced in a day but the crack turned into a hole 3 days later. In this 3 day span we did not hear from anyone from the complex. Someone finally reached out to me today(5/14/2020) telling me the new tub will be installed tomorrow. The lack of communication is extremely frustrating and if we had known a new tub was ordered already we would have an easier time making plans to shower elsewhere.  To top it all off the phone number on the corporate page for the Atlanta office doesn't work at all. To give some context to my frustration, 2 months ago in March we needed our toilet fixed. The maintenance guy dropped the toilet tank and shattered it into about 4 pieces and left the unit without saying anything. We didn't have a toilet for 3 days.  This is one of the worst places I have ever lived and would consider a refrigerator box before ever living here again. I know that times are weird, but it is the responsibility of the staff here to make sure we are comfortable in our living space with basic needs met such as a functioning shower.

Do not move here

name: Crystal Terry
text: I’ve lived here for two years & I’ve truly enjoyed it. My dogs & I love the no leash dog park!

name: Aaron Oeser
text: Apartment has roaches and construction is constantly going on during working hours. Makes working from home very difficult. Multiple trees fell during a storm last week and one of them ended up on my car. I was charged a fee for not providing proof of insurance which was provided to the office twice. However, since Summerchase at Riverchase was purchased by a new company they lost those records and charged me fees for not providing proof of insurance. Everything inside of the apartment is very cheap and breaks easily. The majority of these positive reviews are from when the previous owners ran this place. The new management is not personable and they are only after your money. They are not on your side and will not do anything to make things right. I put in my notice to leave at the end of my lease today. Looking forward to seeing how they’ll screw me out of more money while I try and leave at the end of my lease.

name: Jake Davis
text: Scammers. We never missed a payment and upon move out not only was our deposit held, but before our final bill arrived we were contacted by a collections agency. No regard for other people. Constant construction and rent prices on the rise. Charged for pest services and they never came. Run for the hills!

name: Tiffany W
text: The top floor wood views were awesome! Friendly maintenance employees and convenient valet trash. Sad that the trees prevented me from directv but I got over it quickly because my baby and I would just lok thru the windows and appreciate that so much more

resp.text: Thanks, Tiffany! We're happy to hear you and your baby enjoyed your experience at Summerchase at Riverchase. We greatly appreciate your kind feedback and hope you both are doing great!

name: Booth 529
text: One of the worst places to stay. The staff is the worst!

name: b j
text:
RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN!
currently staying in the Hoover, Alabama property called Summerchase at Riverchase. Ive had an HVAC and Electrical ongoing issue upon staying hear 3 years. Now while summer is here, me and my children are sitting in the home with thermostat is showing 84 degrees. Ive had to sit them in my car to cool them. Why should I also pay rent for a management that cant manage. Ive had to buy food out to be able to feed my family because its so warm inside the home. Ive reached out to Tribridge Residential, LLC. and have not heard anything. The managment at Summerchase has not been helpful at all. The HVAC Tech is not able to do the job. He stated he needs help to install a new unit because hes the only one staffed hes not able to do it alone. The portable AC will not work in my unit due to electrical outages that have not been fixed. Not considerate of the fact my children and I are suffering from this heat. PLEASE AVOID any of their properties as they will not have staff to accommodate you in living comfortably. If management has a resolution please respond with a phone number or email to call.

name: Will Skaggs
text: Only thing positive about this place is the maintenance staff, they are awesome. Other than that, the office staff never answered phone and is extremely unhelpful. We have been moved out now for 4 months and still have not received out deposit back. Every time we call them they make an excuse and tell us they will call back and don’t. Extremely unprofessional and will be filing a complaint with corporate office.

name: Christopher S. Lanter
text: I am a current resident of these apartments and I just wanted to say that I've enjoyed my time here very much.  The staff is polite, friendly, and very helpful and the maintenance is very fast and thorough as well.  They always have landscaping crews out keeping the grounds well maintained as well.

resp.text: Christopher, we can’t thank you enough for sharing your recommendation of Summerchase at Riverchase! We strive to create a five-star experience for our residents and we couldn’t be happier to see this reflected in your experience here. Thank you, and please don’t hesitate to call should you ever need anything!

name: Rebekah Barnett
text: There are many aspects of this place that are positive like the beautiful woodsy views and the location and the amenities like free coffee and snacks in the clubhouse, games, gym, etc. But there are other areas that could use improvement: tardy replies to maintenance requests, inexperienced maintenance staff, sticky/dilapidated countertops in the kitchen, smoking on the patios, and poop in the green spaces leave a bad taste in residents' mouths, not to mention the loss of management not long after we had arrived. This is a big community, perhaps 2 managers is necessary to keep it running well. I share all of this in hopes someone sees it and can implement some changes. All in all, this is not a bad place to live, but it could be so much better with the right person in charge and I don't feel I can recommend it to friends just yet.

resp.text: Thank you, Rebekah, for sharing your concerns with our team. Customer service is something we take pride in, so we sincerely apologize if our level of service has not met your expectations. We work hard to keep our grounds in tip-top shape, though we also rely on our residents to clean up after themselves and their pets as well as alert our team of any problem areas that might require extra attention. Additionally, we encourage you to submit a maintenance request for any items in your home that require attention. In order to further address your concerns, please stop by our office or give us a call at your earliest convenience. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: ishmael bowles
text: So I currently stay here and everything has been fine beautiful woods and apartment is pretty nice but I recently got a bill that includes 2 months worth of charges... so I call the office to get things straightened out and a guy answers the phone...I tell him my bill is  1500 and I needed it corrected long story short I have called at a minimum 28 times between the 1st and 4th of November and I always get the guy there who tells me sorry sir Iam 2 busy I will call u back nothing ever gets corrected and nobody answers the phone...as Iam currently pay month to month I will be moving because this is ridiculous

name: Nina Weathersbee
text: Jamel has been AMAZING the entire process he was super personable and made sure outback leasing process went smooth. David and his crew went out of their way to make sure our new place was to the beat for move in day!

resp.text: Our team is dedicated to providing our future and current residents with an exceptional experience, so we’re happy to hear that your time here has been great so far! If you ever need our assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us.

name: Jamie Clayton
text: Great pla e to live,great pet area,and garage pick up.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Jamie, for taking the time to leave us this wonderful review of Summerchase at Riverchase! Our outstanding amenities and lovely homes are just a couple reasons why our community is so great! If you ever have any additional feedback or questions, please don't hesitate to swing by our office.

name: Tina Hunter
text: Very nice well kept apt complex. Love that dogs are allowed

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your five-star review of Summerchase at Riverchase, Tina! We're so pleased to see that our well-maintained grounds and pet-friendly atmosphere have made your stay here so positive, as resident satisfaction is our ultimate goal. Thanks again!

name: Joshua Gunnin
text:
I lived at Summerchase from July 2011 until April 2014, 1200 Building.  Summerchase was a great community and I enjoyed my time there.  I never had a maintenance issue that wasn't addressed in a timely manner and my neighbors where friendly and courteous.

Katie and Leslie in the leasing office are knowledgeable and quick to respond and the maintenance team where always polite and efficient.

name: Kimberly Frost Barry
text: Summer at Summerchase at Riverchase was so helpful, they didn't have anything for the time frame my friend needs her apartment but she was still very kind and really wanted to help us however she could. She provided a very pleasant experience.

resp.text: Thank you for the five-star review, Kimberly! We're glad that you had a pleasant experience with our office staff and that you and your friend left our community with smiles on your faces. We wish your friend the best of luck in her housing search!

name: 4K REVIEWS LIVE
text: They were amazing did everything they could 2 help me .... .....and I think staff was great

resp.text: Thank you for this five-star review! We're happy that you were so impressed by our staff-- we'll pass your compliments along to the entire team. Have a good day, and thanks again!

name: Austin Sandow
text:
I’ve lived here almost 2 months.  I’ve had 1 minor maintenance  issue which was addressed quickly.

I also worked nights and have never heard the leaf blowers or the mowers while sleeping. The only time I was ever woken up was when they were hammering in the new flooring in the apartment above me but I slept through them ripping the old stuff out. I sleep with a floor fan so that could of drown them out but the ac unit is outside the window and you have to really listen to hear it.

The walls and floors are pretty sturdy I rarely hear the neighbors even when someone was living above me.

People are friendly always saying hi or waving in passing. I haven’t had any problems with staff and have found them to be nice. The grounds are pretty good it’s a nice quiet setting most of the time you’re hearing birds chirping.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Austin! We're happy that you've been enjoying your time here so far and that you've been impressed with the quietness of your home and the peacefulness of our community. We hope that you continue to enjoy living with us for many years to come!

name: Alisha Shepard
text:
Pros:Quiet, clean, nice location, maintenance
Cons: Overly priced, excessive admin fees, unnecessary emails, customer service
Update: I spoke to soon. This place is not really quiet. My next door neighbors fight inside and outside of their apartment. Other neighbors pull in the parking lot blasting loud music at all hours of the day and night! I also noted that the reply to the initial review mentioned late payments. I will not nor have I ever made a late payment. Your insinuation further explains my reason for listing customer service as a negative. I will not renew my lease here.

resp.text: Alisha, while we appreciate any and all feedback, we're disappointed to see your time with us has not resulted in a higher rating. It's nice to know our convenient location, timely maintenance, and well-maintained grounds are serving you well. Please know, our rates are set based on current market trends in the area. You'll find it is not uncommon in the multifamily housing industry for some additional charges - such as utilities, CAM fees, potential late payment fees, etc. - to slightly increase the overall monthly cost of renting a home. If you have questions about your current costs, please give the office a call. We look forward to hearing from you and hope to go above-and-beyond in our service to earn those final two stars from you!

name: Kayla Hoover
text: Very nice Apartments! They have a pool, a fitness center, and dog area.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Kayla! We're glad to hear you're enjoying all the great amenities at Summerchase at Riverchase. If you need anything else, please don't hesitate to let us know!

name: William Crisler
text: Great location, great property. Worth checking out.

name: Shannon Burton
text: I do Renavations there making a fresh start

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star rating! It's wonderful to see that you approve of some of the changes we're making. We're always striving to give residents a five-star experience here at Summerchase at Riverchase! Thanks again for leaving us your thoughts!

name: Stephani Ray
text: Leaf blowers every week sounds like giant angry hornets, completely unnecessary but this is how they justify calling the place "luxury". I work at night and sleep during the day so this was infuriating.

resp.text: We’re sorry to have disrupted your slumber, Stephani! Our landscapers work hard to maintain our beautiful grounds and sometimes that means getting a little loud with their tools in the daytime. We want to make sure your home needs are being met as well, however. Please give us a call or stop by the office if you’d like to discuss your concerns.

name: Theresa Rose
text: Love the apartments, sorry my sis in law had such a bad mold problem she had to move out less than 6 months after she moved in

name: ronnie shearer
text: Quiet, tucked away

name: Ben Weaver
text: Out of date weight room

name: Tj Lake
text: Neighborhood is no good

name: Corey Alfano (CorCore)
text: nice place

name: Marshell Lee
text: Did not like the staff.

name: nick scarantino
text: Overly priced.

name: Dhanalakshmi H
text: Its good

name: Dan Grantham
text: Call Gardner heating & air for your AC repairs

name: NEFTALI DIAZ
text:
(Translated by Google) The structures are old, but the area looks very clean

(Original)
Las estructuras son viejas, pero el área se ve bien limpia

name: Lance Darden
text: if i could give zero stars i would. The "office staff" is completely unresponsive and are only looking to put money in there own pocket. they do not care about anyone that lives in this complex and refuse to fix issues. my ice maker\refrigerator leak into my floor every day i am soon to be paying my FORTH months rent and i complained about these issues upon move in. the maintenance tech they sent to "fix" it just turned off the water and said they will order another one. HE DIDN'T EVEN HAVE HIS OWN TOOLS HE HE HAD TO ASK ME FOR MINE.

resp.text: Hi, Lance. We're so sorry you feel this way about our team. We always aim to give an amazing resident experience here and we're disappointed we missed the mark for you. Please give us a call directly so we can address these matters properly. Thank you and we hope to speak with you soon. -The Team at The Park at Hoover

name: Jan Adams
text: One of the most important things to me is communications.  I recently reached out to the Park at Hoover and spoke with Dantavius regarding some concerns I had.  This was by far the most pleasant, informed and intellectual call I have had in a long time.  His tone and voice were impeccably kind, understanding and caring.  He made me feel as if I was the most important person to him.  My questions and concerns were readily answered and I just had to let him know how wonderful he was and how much I appreciated him.  Often times we only here the bad things about our employees so I wanted to share with his company that he  is a very valuable asset.

resp.text: Jan, we cannot thank you enough for taking the time to leave us a review and for shedding such a positive light on our team and their ability to assist you. It has truly been our pleasure, and please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do for you further. - The Team at The Park at Hoover

name: Lisa Bearden
text: Beautiful Community. Close to everything in Hoover. Four swimming pools, large fitness center, sports court, play ground, pet park, large homes, great rental rates, helpful and caring staff. I love living here. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Wow, Lisa! We truly appreciate your compliments and 5-star feedback. Thank you for highlighting the best parts of our community! - Park at Hoover Team

name: Marlyn williams
text: This place is ghetto 😩.. The water is ALWAYS off... The pest control is a joke... I've had complaints since I moved in. The air in my bedroom barely blows.. My neighbors are really loud... My boyfriend's car has been damaged twice since we lived here.. There's been mold, the tub in the master is extremely scratchy... The only thing that I did like about the apartment was the size.. The apartment is good if you're on a budget.. I wouldn't stay here long term

resp.text: Hi, Marlyn. Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry to read that you were not fully satisfied with your living experience during your time here. We never want our residents to feel as if their concerns are not important to us and apologize that you may feel this way. We hope to speak with you directly to address your concerns as soon as possible. - The Team at The Park at Hoover

name: Angela Fox
text: It's not that bad of a place to live. I moved in on very short notice last July and Clarke was awesome. My neighbors are noisy and play loud music. My only MAIN complaint would be that when the payment website was updated there was not a notice sent out that they were experiencing issues and would rather you pay by money order or cashiers check. Can't get anyone on the phone to find out who it should be made payable to.

resp.text: Hi, Angela! Our team is dedicated to serving residents to the best of our ability, and we are here to help. Give us a call at (205) 985-7463 when you have time. Thank you. - Park at Hoover Management

name: PHENICIA DANIELS
text:
I  stayed in the remodeled apartment. I thought we got it at a good price but the total came out to be a little over 1100 a month. Definitely overpriced!! I did have a few problems with bugs but I had someone come out every month to spray and that helped. My neighbors were quiet and I barely saw them.
The walls are extremely THIN !! Also This complex can be very filthy as times, I often saw heavy loads of trash in the middle of road very other day.
The parking and be terrible at times.
I didn’t have a problem with management in fact they were really great to my me and my girlfriend. S/o to Ms Thomtha, She was awesome.

Overall the complex is decent, definitely not perfect! Just pray that you’re place in a good spot ! Good luck!

Oh and Maintenance!! The order request takes forever but they eventually come. Good thing we didn’t have major issues.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention, Phenicia. It's wonderful that our team member, Ms. Thomtha, demonstrated exemplary customer service during your time with us. However, from your review we see that you have quite a few concerns pertaining to our community's overall conditions, among other issues; we're sorry for that. We hope that you'll contact us directly at hoover@arlingtonproperties.net or 205-985-7463 so that we may have an opportunity to address the specifics of your situation and regain your confidence. Thank you.

name: Edwena
text: The Park at Hoover has been my home for 3-4years, of course the staff has been good and there have been maintenance problems, but none that's wasn't fixed. Since the pandemic I've had the challenge of making payments towards my rent. And still is catching up. The new staff that's her has been really good towards me and I give all glory to the Lord, the could have did the unthinkable by putting my belongings outside the unit. They didn't do that. You have to have compassion, be considered of your families and understanding, listen to them. I know it takes a lot dealing with different attitudes. So I give The Park at Hoover for having the compassion for their families

resp.text: Edwina, we cannot thank you enough for this amazing review and feedback. It means a lot that we have helped you in this difficult time. We know a lot of our residents are going through so much right now and the least we can do is show a little compassion. We hope you have a great day and we'll get through this together! - The Team at The Park at Hoover

name: Just Write
text:
BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE

I've lived in the apartment for two years and I moved a week ago. The place has many roaches, they are everywhere, including inside smoke alarms. My lease ended 3/14/2021, so here comes the drama. I'm thinking that since I would be at the apartment only half a month, I would only pay my prorated rent for that month. I was wrong. I received a notice saying that I have to pay an extra $327.00 which was for the utility company that they had last used in early 2020. I was told that everyone who lived at the apartment complex prior to March 2020 had to pay this fee for January and February 2020. I paid my rent and utilities every month, btw the utility fee is $149.00. I had a three-bedroom. I just paid them over $1200.00, and since I didn't have enough money to pay them on time I had to pay a $101.00 late fee. So I had to pay them an amount of a full month's rent all while trying to get another apartment. No other apartment would approve me because I had a balance with this apartment. It's been an entire mess. I was never told about this utility fee until recently. They just threw it on me like "hey here's you're prorated rent amount plus this $327.00 that you owe from 2020 that we didn't tell you about." If you move here prepare to get scammed out of your money, and when you move out add another $300.00+ to your prorated rent. They now have new management staff since I moved, so I hope they will be better and not try to scam residents.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information! We pride ourselves on transparent and quality communication, so we appreciate you taking the time to mention our new management. We wish you the best! - The Team at Park at Hoover

name: Natasha Jones
text: My rent payment for the month of February was stolen by someone who work in the office, then the assistant manager is still trying to charge me a late fee, however I will see that on my credit report. I HATE I renewed this lease it’s just March I have along ways to go. They have no cameras because this is private property, so they don’t have to have cameras they take the word of their employees, then you will not be able to get in touch with none of the upper management team. When I tell you I have a roller coaster feeling each time I come near this place. If you are looking for a place to live please keep going for the amount you paying and then to have to pay it twice in one month, I can only warn you PLEASE KEEP GOING. I have said nothing about the maintenance team OMG... PLEASE KEEP LOOKING... DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE AS ME......

resp.text: Hi, Natasha. We are very disheartened to see that you feel this way, as these comments do not properly depict our team and the respect they have for our residents. We can assure you that our team is sure to provide the most transparent service and information. We welcome you to reach out to us if you have any discrepancies you wish to discuss. - The Team at The Park at Hoover

name: Jasmine Baldwin
text: The Park at Hoover is a great place to live. The pricing is affordable, and it’s located close to many businesses and services in the Hoover area.  Most common needs such as groceries and shopping are essentially a 5-minute drive—a huge convenience. The complex management is also very accommodating and kind. They openly communicate via text to update residents on special events such as “Food Truck Wednesdays” where delicious food trucks across the city come specifically for residents. I recommend you stay here.

resp.text: We love hosting you, Jasmine! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, and for your recommendation. We're especially happy that the team has been courteous and helpful. You deserve an amazing living situation, and we're glad that you've found it at Park at Hoover.

name: Beverly Alawi
text: I will give the apt complex a five star rating! I had to move within a very quick notice and STEPHANIE was my leasing agent she was absolutely amazing! She worked with me and got me an apartment within such short notice and even helped me with the paper work to get my power and water turned on! My apt number is 4212! Thanks again Stephanie

resp.text: Thank you so much, Beverly! We’re committed to providing our residents with the best experience possible, so we're delighted to hear that Stephanie has been such an asset during your move to the property. We appreciate your five-star rating and review, and sincerely hope you enjoy your home at Park at Hoover.

name: Tracey Richards
text: One of the worst place ever to live!!! The roaches in the apartment is horrible and maintenance is the worst, they take forever to fix things and these guys act like they’re not interested in doing their jobs. When they do come out it seems like you’re bothering them just to fix whatever needs to get fix in the apartment. I’ve been living here five years and I feel like enough is enough with this apartment complex

resp.text: Hi, Tracey. While we are thankful for your feedback, we would like to learn more about why your experience was not an exceptional one. Reach out to us at (205) 985-7463 to let us know how we can improve your experience going forward. - The Team at Park at Hoover

name: Nina Williams
text: My stay at the park at Hoover was very nice..didn't have any problems except when it came to parking not enough spaces in the 3100 building!! but I loved my renovated/refreshed apartment any issues I had maintenance came right away! Office staff very friendly and polite...office is amazing...

resp.text: Thanks for taking a moment to leave a review, Nina. Happy residents make our day. We're pleased to hear that you are enjoying your refreshed living space, and that the staff has been courteous. We truly hope that you love your home at Park at Hoover. Please let us know if you need anything during your stay.

name: Melanie Parris
text: I personally have had a great experience here. Although there have been a few maintenance and billing issues in the years I have lived here, they are always quick to fix it. I have not experienced any bug or mold issues. My apartment is very clean and presentable. No apartment is perfect but out of all the apartments I have lived in, Park at Hoover has been the best.

resp.text: We truly appreciate it, Melanie! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We're especially happy that the team has been responsive to your requests. You deserve an amazing living situation, and we're glad that you've found it at Park at Hoover.

name: Tammie Jensen
text: I have lived here over a year. The couple of  maintenance issues I have had,  have been taken care of swiftly and the maintenance techs are always courteous and respectful. A good place to live.

resp.text: Hello Tammie, and thank you for your excellent review! We’re thrilled to hear that the team provided such great service, and was able to address your maintenance requests so quickly. At Park at Hoover, we strive to go above and beyond our resident’s expectations with each interaction. Please let us know if you need anything in the future.

name: Robert Nutting
text: Currently living here, ive had a busted water heater for days now. Havent had any notification of when itll be fixed, in fact was told it was fixed one day just for that to be a lie. So now my walls and floor are getting flooded with water and ive had no heat or hot water, its ridiculous.

resp.text: We apologize, Robert. Please be assured that our on-site team is committed to resolving this issue as soon as possible. We hope that you'll contact us directly at hoover@arlingtonproperties.net or 205-985-7463 if you would like to get an update on the timing of the repair.

name: Andy Roberts
text: I have lived here for a year now. My work is moving me out of state. If it was not for that i would  be staying here. Everyone at the apartment have been so nice and kind. There is no loud music like at other places you stay at. I have had a few maintenance issues and they came right out and fixed it. The staff at the front office is always willing  to help to make sure you are taken care of. So nice and kind.

name: Chef TréJ
text: I appreciate the customer service my family has gotten from the staff. From responding to my messages, to the maintenance men coming to fix things, to the assistant manager taking the time to listen to my concerns.  It's nice to have people who care.

resp.text: We really do care! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Park at Hoover. We’re committed to providing our residents with the best experience possible, so we’re happy to hear that you've received excellent customer service. We appreciate your five-star rating and review, and sincerely hope you enjoy your home with us.

name: Antwaun Williams
text: I enjoyed living on this property, I did not have one problem. I’m also extremely grateful for the professionalism of the staff, especially Tonatha she was awesome. Thank again!

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent review, Antwaun. We’re thrilled to hear that Tonatha has provided such great service. We strive to go above and beyond our resident’s expectations with each interaction. Many thanks for your kind words and feedback. -- The Park at Hoover Team

name: Bernadette Martinez
text: I have lived at this community for two years and I have issue after issue. I have seen a revolving door of employees come in and out of this office. It seems that no one stays which speaks volumes about the company managing this property.  I have even spoke to the new manager on several occasions and I have tried for well over a month for my requests to get addressed. Its been poor effort in my eyes, he did power wash the breeze way, but the workers had to come through my apt to get the water. The company's employees did not even have proper work attire when arriving which made me question who they were (sketchy) the breezeways looked  a little better but there is carpet in half of the breezeway which still smells. I had requested that a tile in fireplace be repaired from several people in my office not sure it was from the old or the new management because again so many people have been in and out of the office. But needless to say I spoke to the manager to get this fixed and two weeks later I called to ask about when it will be addressed and he sent me to speak to maintenance manager and she assured my tile would be repaired.  I allowed to enter even if I was not home but a month later still not fixed.  On top of it all I had to bother them about my renewal they had assured if I signed another 12 month lease it would get done. But because these issue I let the manager know these items are still not done, how can I expect to be taken care of for another 12 months.  My lease ended in April and here we are in June my items still not addressed i will not renew my lease until they repair my items and he promised not to charge a Month to Month fee until my items are addressed. But  this month my bill was rather high and I asked them to email a copy of my ledger and they said I had to request it in an email and I can send it to whoever. Now does that make sense to anyone? They just brushed me off to rush me off the phone but I will email the manager this request and I will be sure to update how long this took. PLEASE look somewhere else to live until this management can get a handle on this property, not sure if they can!

name: Logan Brehm
text: Great team customer service! Quite place to live for a good price and location!

resp.text: Thank you for your five-star rating and for sharing your experience at Park at Hoover, Logan. It's so nice to hear that you have been treated to exceptional customer service, and that you're happy with your space. We appreciate your feedback, and hope that you have a wonderful residency.

name: Zae Zee
text: These people that work at the office no customer service skills the thick manager she ok this skinny black lady need to work back of the house you pay your rent and they make you feel like you’re asking a favor from them

resp.text:
Hello. We’re sorry to hear that you're displeased with our service. We truly value our residents, and want to take whatever action possible to address and rectify your concerns. Please contact the office at jbrown@arlingtonproperties.net or 205-588-6440
so that we have an opportunity to discuss this further. Thank you.

name: Blakeley Nelson
text: I have lived here for a year now and I absolutely love it. It's nice apartments and I havent had but a few issues here and there. However, matience has came out and fixed every issues so far within no time of me putting the order in. I just renewed my lease for another year. Can't wait to spend another year in what I call home! 😁

name: Adrianna Bortz
text: I'm giving them 2 stars only because we pay so much to live here and have had so many issues. If you have children i wouldnt recommend this place only because of the safety issues i have had. The CS is really poor other then a lady named LeAnne, she is amazing at her job and has helped so much get all my issues with my apartment taken care of. She is the person to go to if any issues occur in your apartment because she will get the job done. She responds back to update you with whatever information she has and just to call to let you know she is still working on getting everything taken care of even if it is taken longer then expected, She's wonderful and i had a really good CS from her.

name: Jamison Boyd
text: Since mid to Late June my unit has been having A/C issues... I know right, during the summer in Alabama with A/C issues. Not a great experience I can promise you that. The unit doesn't blow out cold air nor does it drop below 75 degrees either. The unit constantly runs  throughout the day which had doubled my electric bill. I have put in several tickets and the service teams comes out and do what they do, it works for at most 2 days then back out. I have been having random people come in and out of my place during a PANDEMIC for the same issue. So I head to the front office and talk with Tonatha E the Assistant Manager who was quick to rush me out of her office while I was trying to explain the situation and the inconvenience this has been because I work from home and its out outside and inside. So I send the email Monday 7-20-2020 and she again confirms that she will get back to me in 72 hours. I didn't count Monday as one of the three days so, Thursday still haven't heard anything. So today 7-24-2020 I decided to send another email stating I haven't heard from you and its been past the allotted time that was advised. wait a couple hours and still no reply. So I drive up, meet a nice lady out front and I explain to her my situation and that I need to talk with Tonatha E the Assistant Manager. The nice lady walks into her office and then returns to tell me that she said she was busy and that I need to go see someone else in another building. First, you could walk out your office Tonatha E Assistant Manager to apologize or show some type of EMPATHY  around my situation. Second, if I needed to talk to someone else why didn't you email me or call me, even just direct me then to go seek help elsewhere. If there is a corporate number or person who can call I would appreciate it greatly. But still no air and my unit continues to run all day every day. Tonatha E Assistant Manager, if you promise someone something please follow through because you are representing the company you work for. Hope to hear from someone soon because my contact information is on file and hope we can get a resolution and come to an agreement   on how this has inconvenience me in my own home.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about this situation, Jamison, and the response that you got from our team. A member of the staff will be in touch with you to rectify the situation.

name: Jenah Rogers
text: The buildings are infested with roaches. The property management team is rude and does not care about any issues residents have. Work orders take weeks before maintenance comes out. This place is WAY over priced for what it is. It is run down and needs more than a small remodel. I believe the biggest complaint I have is the property management team being rude, careless and they don't seem to have a complete concept of what their job is and how to carry out responsibilities properly.

name: Aurelia Vel
text:
This placed used to be so terrible you couldn't even complain to the front office about anything, because it didn't do any good. Management recently changed and already there's a significant difference in how I feel about needing to approach anyone in the office.

Jasmine is a complete ANGEL who is easy to talk to and if I'm mad she's able to listen without interruption and assess what she can do to help. If you're looking for someone to handle your problems she's the one to ask for. She is perhaps the only reason my Roommate and I renewed our lease.

Tori & Dantavius are also amazing individuals, and after a visit I feel a weight lifted off of my shoulders. It's hard to bring complaints to people's attention, but they were very open minded and asked questions. Previous management never bothered to assess a situation and just took it at face value.

I'm grateful that they came along just in time.

resp.text: Aurelia, thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this excellent review. We strive to provide top-notch service and truly cherish our residents. We appreciate you for spreading the word, and if there's ever anything we can do to make you more comfortable, please don't hesitate to let us know. Have a wonderful day! - The Park at Hoover Team

name: Teresa Alejandra Leon
text: If you want to be taken care of, have a clean apartment, have a mail key that works, not have rodents and insect crawling through your home, rodent poop on the kitchen counter and floor. DO NOT LIVE HERE! I’ve cleaned this place so many times but still find rodent droppings in a couple days. They have not sent someone and we’ve been waiting for weeks. For the price you pay, it’s ridiculous.

name: Gabby Threatt
text: Hello. I've been at this property for almost 3 years. They are under new management now. I must say making changes within the office and maintenance crew has really turned this place around. Tonathan, Terrell, LeAnn, Danielle (just to name a few) and the maintenance crew have been nothing short of amazing. If I have a maintenance problem, maintenance comes out in a timely manner and resolves the issue. You have to be sure to make all maintenance requests through the residental portal. Please keep in mind that this is a large property & they are working to accommodate everyone as quickly as possible. I do not have maintenance issue often but when I do, they never hesitate to resolve them. I absolutely love my apartment. Hats off to the new crew!! Thank you for turning this place around FOR THE BETTER!!

name: Amber Shearer
text: Well, Im going to change this once I actually move in I hope but as of now they’re very unorganized. I am suppose to move into a 2 bed 2 bath fully renovated. My original move in date was 06/01/2020 well they office called me on 04/17/2020 asking me could I move in by may 1st because they could not hold my property that long.  I agreed to it. Well on 04/24/2020 they called me again saying that the earliest I could POSSIBLY move in was June 12th because my unit will not be ready until then and that’s still up in the air. I don’t understand how it went from they can’t hold my apartment until them pushing my date back even later as a maybe! I personally feel like they should’ve checked on that first because i rushed to pack and order my furniture and now everything is in a storage. This is just a big inconvenience seriously. I really would like to talk to the leasing manager.

name: Herman Mattingly
text: They will not let you into their offices without a mask. Which is the right thing to do. But they do not require their management or their executives to wear masks.

name: Sull Sosoto
text: These are really nice apartments, and the office management are really great and understanding people. The maintenance crew is always quick to respond and the community living here are good people, this is a great part of Hoover to live in.  Also everything you need is conveniently close, from gas stations to supermarkets or food.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Joshua! We're so happy to hear that you have found more than a few things to love about The Park at Hoover community. We hope we can continue to exceed your expectations and will always be a quick phone call away if you ever need our assistance.

name: Jack Leone
text: In Nov. a leak from the apt above caused the ceiling bathroom to pour down into my apt. bathroom. After calling the leasing office day after day after day, the issue was never resolved. Any issue I have reported only attempts to be repair around rent time. When I first received the key for my apt. I was given the wrong key. I then went back to the leasing office only for the girl working there to tell me "what do you want me to do about it?" I would not recommend this place. Spend a little more money for better b/c this is not worth it. The roach are so huge they make sounds when they hit up against something. Even though I’m charged $5 a month for pest control, I had to request pest control to come out. Trust me. It’s not all it’s cracked up to be

resp.text: Jack, thank you for expressing your concerns. We would like to review your concerns and come to a swift resolution, however, we are unable to identify which apartment home you are residing in based on your screen name. I would love to speak with you and improve your time here at The Park at Hoover. We have a dedicated Resident Services Center to assist you when concerns arise. You can reach them at 205-721-8935. You are welcome to call the leasing office with any concerns as well at 205-985-7463 or via email at Hoover@ArlingtonProperties.net. We look forward to speaking with you shortly and improving your stay at The Park at Hoover.

name: Aalliayah Barnes
text:
I really enjoyed my experience with this property. Lauren, one of the leasing agents, was very professional and efficient with her work! She was also extremely helpful in every way imaginable. One of the biggest issues I’ve had when renting is with the leasing agents at a property, and I’m happy to say that I did not have to deal with any of that!

I definitely recommend this property and if you’re looking for a great experience, Lauren is the lady to see!

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star rating, Aalliayah. We're happy to hear that we were able to provide you with the quality service you deserve and restore your faith in leasing agents! We look forward to keeping up the good work and can't wait for your next visit to the office.

name: Harold Jackson
text: Moved here last April and was rushed to move in sooner than originally agreed to despite paying half of April’s rent and all of May’s rent and was told I had to move in sooner due to previous residents moving out quicker than expected (i now see why) I went from last April until late July without air conditioner despite  submitting multiple maintenance requests they would just come and change my air filter or add refrigerant to the unit to try to help despite it not working i had to file a better business bureau complaint to finally get a new air conditioning unit and asked for a concession on my rent due to the inconvenience of living so long without air conditioner i was only given $50 off and the air still don’t work right even with the new unit the thermostat never reaches what i set it to In the day time causing it to blow constantly all day unless i turned it off which has caused me to have excessive power bills, that’s only one problem the staff is the rudest apartment complex staff I have ever had to deal with I lately now have been having issues with my bathtub it has now in the past month in the middle of the night started turning on full blast even when it is off and I keep having to call someone to come fix that issue and that issue alone has caused water to come out of my walls in my bathroom when showering as well as water in my laundry room, my hot water doesn’t work when this issue occurs due to when the bathtub has broken it uses up all my hot water which forces me to have to boil water on the stove to take baths when going through this, this past Sunday on 04/26/2020 i called emergency maintenance 3 times and left voicemails about my bathtub constantly running and not having hot water which caused me to have to stay home all Sunday because they don’t have a key on the weekends i never received a return call and no one ever came which caused me to cancel my plans on that day I called the rent office on 04/27/2020 and asked to speak with the manager and was denied to speak with her and was transferred to the lady that processes the rent payments and told her my issues and i feel like i should have a concession due to the constant issues i keep having my water, leaks, not having hot water due to leaks, and poor maintenance service such as not coming or responding when calling the emergency line and her response was “What makes you feel like you deserve something off your rent because of that” and transferred me to maintenance in the middle of me talking , i have stayed in multiple apartment complex’s and I have never had to deal with staff this rude and dismissive they do not care about us they only care about taking our money I do not recommend this place to anyone please take your money somewhere else THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOU!

name: Brooke Nicely
text: I been looking for an apartment for my family.  Lauren in the front office is an angel. Her customer service skills are incredible. So sweet and professional. Super helpful. I totally love her. One of the reasons why I want to move here.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the five-star rating and for leaving a little shout-out for a member of The Park at Hoover Team! We're so happy to hear that after touring our community, you're absolutely smitten. Hopefully, you'll be joining the community in due time and we'll have the opportunity to serve you once again!

name: Cristin Buentello
text: Maintenance is horrible. The AC has been out for almost two weeks. There have been three requests put in and still no response, but they can come out and work on an empty unit. 🤔

resp.text: Hello Cristin, We’re sorry to hear that we’ve fallen short of meeting your expectations. Please contact us at jbrown@arlingtonproperties.net or 205-588-6440 so that we can get more information on your concerns and rectify any issues immediately. Thank you.

name: Stephanie Alokan
text: I love my apartment here, but it's one thing that keeps me here above all, and that's CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Lauren at the front office is awesome. It shows when someone cares about their job. She's handled every issue I've had with such professionalism. There are a level of taking care of the tennent and she does that and beyond. Thank you for that Lauren. It's not often you find this kind of kind work ethic. I'll recommend everyone I know. I wish it had more stars to rate the great experience I've had. Thanks again Lauren. You've earned my respect. It's a better office having you in it.  These are great apartments. The floor plans are spacious. The property stays clean. Like it's a total package!!!!

resp.text: Stephanie, thank you so much for this stellar review and for leaving the shout-out for Lauren. We truly care about our residents and nothing brings a smile to our faces like knowing we've succeeded in brightening your day. We hope to keep up the good work and will always be a quick phone call away when you're in need of assistance.

name: Jade Wagoner
text: This is my first ever apartment alone and The Park at Hoover office staff are so great at keeping in contact with me whenever  I have a question! The location is convenient for just about everything. I don't have any problems with my neighbors or community. The maintenance are consecutive with their duties. I can't think of anywhere else to be my first home on my own!

resp.text: Jade, we are so happy to hear that we have treated you to an amazing first apartment experience and you have found so many things to love about the Park at Hoover community. We really do our best to make residents feel welcome and at home and are happy to hear we've enjoyed a resounding success. We hope you know you are welcome to pop by the office anytime you need a little help or want to say hi.

name: Achia Arrington
text: I had an overall amazing experience with the Park at Hoover and the management there! Dantavius really took the time out to walk me step by step to make sure my moving in process was as easy and enjoyable as possible!

resp.text: Thank you for this fantastic review and for leaving a shout-out for a star member of The Park at Hoover Team, Achia! We are so happy to hear we were able to make your move-in a breeze and you have been enjoying your stay in the community thus far. We hope to keep up the good work and hope you won't hesitate to give us a call if you ever need a helping hand.

name: Marian McKinnon
text: Arthur is the best maintenance man I believe they have. He always smiles when talking to you about a situation in your home and he's very respectful, he's totally about his business and getting the job done. If I could give him more than 5 stars I seriously would.

resp.text: Marian, thank you so much for taking the time to leave this amazing shout-out for one of The Park at Hoover's star team members. We're so happy to hear that we've been able to knock your socks off with quality customer service. If you ever find yourself in need of a little more assistance with a smile, we are always a quick phone call away.

name: Van Vanvactor
text: A terrible place to live at, my step son has lived there for 5 months with no internet Omg! The managing staff are very rude and unprofessional. And he can't even get out of his lease,  all they care about is your money.  I wish I could give them 0 stars....

name: Taylor Marlowe
text: The Park at Hoover has some of the most commutes staff I’ve ever experienced in the industry. Specifically, Anna Price. Regardless of what she may be doing when someone walks through the door, she will pause what she is doing, stands up and greets you wholeheartedly. She is steadfast and a pleasure to be around.

resp.text: Taylor, thank you so much for taking a little time out of your day to highlight one of The Park at Hoovers star team members. Our staff works around the clock to make residents feel at home and it truly brings a smile to our faces knowing we've succeeded in this goal. We're sure you're no stranger to the office but please feel free to stop by anytime to say hi!

name: Shay King
text: I love the apartments as well as the area. The leasing consultant Lauren is an amazing person. She makes living there a great experience especially since I’m from out of town.

resp.text: Thank you so much for leaving us a five-star rating, Shay! We're so happy to hear that you've enjoyed some amazing service from The Park at Hoover Team. We hope we can continue to exceed your expectations for some time to come and will be available in the office anytime you're in need of assistance.

name: FolaShade Thompkins
text: Its a very decent apartment complex for the most part. I love the diversity of cultures! It's also pretty quiet, especially considering the number of families with small children that live there. The staff in the leasing office is always really nice, both in person and over the phone. Lauren A. was very patience with me when it came to me getting my apartment. She was consistent and very sweet thought the whole process. You have to stay on top of maintenance when it comes to getting them out to your apartment to make repairs. Parking for my building has been a nightmare unfortunately. Overall, it work for a first-time renter.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this thorough and thoughtful review of the community. We're happy to hear that overall you have been enjoying your first apartment. While it sounds like things have been going relatively smoothly, we always look for ways to improve and appreciate your time in creating this review. Please do not hesitate to call or reach out to us with any further feedback or ways we can improve your stay.

name: Austin Carroll
text: I’ve lived at The Park at Hoover since October of 2016 and its been a pretty awesome experience.  So there’s only been minimal maintenance issues for my entire stint and they have been handled promptly and professionally.  The Staff is wonderful, accommodating and very helpful.  I can definitely see myself here for several more years.  Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, Austin. We are happy to hear that we'll be able to enjoy a few more years of your presence in The Park at Hoover community. If you ever find yourself in need of anymore prompt service, we are always just a quick phone call away.

name: MarQuita Powell
text: This is a good apartment complex to stay in. Their maintenance is good at fixing things and they will come to your apartment in a timely fashion. Make sure that you put in a work order if you want them to come on time and not have to wait too long. There is only like three negative comments I can say. The first one is the parking. I feel as though everyone should have their assigned parking spot. Its really hard to find a parking spot at night when I get home from work. I'm pretty sure some if these people are visitors. I have to end up parking somewhere far from my building in order to get a spot. The second thing is as soon as I moved in, there were roaches popping out of no where lol. Its not really that bad. I can tell that they will bomb your apartment before you move in. And the last thing is that I think they should fix up my apartment complex. Some of these apartments are really nice but as you move farther back, They don't look as good as the ones in the front. But other than those three things, this would be a good place to stay. And they also have events to where you can get money off of your rent.That's great

resp.text: We're happy to hear you've experienced our awesome maintenance team in action! They work hard to provide residents with the top-notch service you deserve. We also want to thank you for the feedback about the parking, pests, and buildings. We’re always looking for ways to improve and hope you’ll stop by to let us know if you have any additional suggestions about how we can do better in the future. Thank you!

name: Jovonne Baker
text: I stay in a studio apartment and I love it! I have been shown nothing but respect and it always feels more like coming home then simply coming to an apartment complex. The staff is amazing and they have amazing fun community activities for all of the  residence!! I would recommend living at The Park at Hoover to anyone who is new to the city like I was and looking for a place that understood exactly what you need! Thank you The Park at Hoover

resp.text: Thank you, Jovonne! We're happy to hear that we've managed to make you feel right at home here in The Park at Hoover community. We truly appreciate your recommendation and hope you know you are always welcome in the office if you are ever in need of our assistance.

name: Kyle Todd
text: I have been her for about 6 months. The office staff was/is great. From my move in; to helping resolve a maintenance issue that I had in my apartment. Both the maintenance staff and the office staff were very responsive to my issue, especially Taylor, she is awesome and played a major role in getting the issue resolved. Thank you again Taylor . The Park at Hoover is very affordable, great location and great people both working and living here!

resp.text: Thank you for this positive review of The Park At Hoover, Kyle! We're always delighted to hear when residents are having great experiences in our community, especially when it comes to our rockstar staff and maintenance teams, our affordability, and our amazing location. If you have any additional comments, questions, or concerns feel free to give us a call or visit us in the office!

name: Jayla M
text: If I could rate zero stars I would. This place is TERRIBLE & I wouldn't recommend it to ANYONE! Do yourself a favor & find somewhere that is professional because that is something the staff here lacks! The apartment we stayed in had several problems; maintenance would never come. Moving out has truly been a hassle from having to sign an agreement for an additional two months, to actually having problems w| moving somewhere else because the staff does not answer the phone & the appropriate people are never in the office. Even though the homes are beautiful it doesn't compensate for the troubles we have had here.

resp.text: Jayla, we're sorry to hear that over the course of your stay you had some difficulties receiving service from our team. Normally we are quite prompt when responding to work orders and we apologize that this was not reflected in your experience. Additionally, we would like to apologize if we in any way added to the stress of your move-out as this was certainly not our intention. While it is unfortunate that you will not be leaving the community with the fondest of memories, we sincerely hope you are doing well and wish you all the best in the future.

name: Brandon Sego
text: I've been living here for two years now. It seems adequate for the pricing. People in my building are nice. People are either quite or the walls have nice padding, cause I've yet to hear my neighbors. I use to live at a much more expensive place at the Summit, and for the price this place is much better. I stay warm in the winter, and cool in the summer. I love it.

resp.text: Brandon, thank you for the positive review of The Park At Hoover! We are delighted to learn that you're having a great experience in our community, especially regarding our beautiful homes and friendly residents. If you have any additional comments, questions, or concerns feel free to give us a call!

name: Luke Field
text: This apartment complex is amazing!!!! I am beyond satisfied with the place I live! The staff and maintenance guys are really organized and quick on their feet! This is unlike any apartment I’ve ever lived!! I am so happy with my choice! I would recommend this place to my closest friends!!

resp.text: We're thrilled to hear that you're enjoying living here at The Park at Hoover! Our staff and maintenance teams strive to provide the highest quality of service to our residents, so we're happy to hear that you've experienced that. Thank you for being such a wonderful resident. Please let us know if there's anything we can help you with in the future. Thanks!

name: Jamal Williams
text: My A/C unit has been going in and out since I moved in to this place in January my thermostat is set to 70 65 and it’s reading 83, I’ve done 4 work requests is one month alone for the same issue and the emergency line that says if you have no heat or no air to call and nobody responds back. It feels more comfortable to sleep in my car I don’t know why I’m paying this much money for a apartment with a broken A/C this is day. I’m thinking about a lawyer to get me out of this agreement because these conditions are unsuitable and I’m not the only one who feels the same

resp.text: Jamal, we apologize that your stay has been less than stellar. Our team works very hard to provide our residents with comfortable homes and know that we will continue working hard to make sure that is the case with you. Please do not hesitate to visit our office if you are having trouble reaching us via phone. We hope to see you soon and improve your situation.

name: Elisha Collins
text: Roach infestation. They were never taken care of even after numerous calls for pest control or request for an exterminator.  Maintenance was very slow to respond to any request.

name: DeAngela Colvin
text: Love my apartment super private...quiet and the school is awesome

resp.text: Thank you so much for this fantastic review, DeAngela. We're so happy to hear that you have been loving The Park at Hoover community as well as the surrounding neighborhood. We hope we can continue exceeding your expectations and will always we available in the office if you need a helping hand.

name: Chuck Riley
text: Look don’t let them fool you by putting lipstick on a pig! All they care about is getting you leased, getting you under contract, after that, for get it. I’ve been here for over 3 years, 6 different management companies.. nothing changes. They make the clubhouse look nice and the model room look nice. End of list. They don’t want to be bothered. There little to NO communication between the leasing office and the maintenance department. And then they want to be petty about the “valet trash” pick up which honestly is more of a pain than it’s worth what they charge per month. If you’re desperate and need a place to live ASAP... I get it... other wise... just like the movie, GET OUT!!!!

resp.text: Chuck, we are saddened to see you have not enjoyed a five-star experience. That being said, we value your feedback and would love the opportunity to improve your time here. We have several capital improvement projects in place including a brand new fitness center and exterior painting project for the apartments. We are also actively working on our Hug a Building Community Clean up inactive as well. We love receiving input from our residents and are very open to suggestions and if you have any concerns you would like to discuss in detail, please do not hesitate to visit the office or call us up for a chat.

name: Dan Dan Alexandria
text:
This is a great place. It is centrally located close to Birmingham. Yet, it is far enough away from the big city to feel at peace.  In particular, I love the fact also that it is close to great shopping, restaurants and recreational activities.

Jason is awesome. He always returns my calls. He is caring, kind, professional and thoughtful. He comes in early and he leaves late. When I was first applying for an apartment, he took over an hour to speak with me and my sister.  He is the hardest working leasing agent I have ever met. I just cannot ever forget how grateful I am to have chosen this community. Even other tenants rave about Jason and the complex.

Dan

name: Syenovia Bynam
text: If I could rate zero stars I would. I am a current resident and cannot wait until my lease ends. For starters there was mold and mildew in the bathrooms upon move in. The air conditioning also didn’t work for 3 days. My family had to endure 80 degree temps until maintenance was able to service the unit. Pest control is also a MAJOR issue. If you are considering renting please do yourself a favor and DONT. Do NOT let the leasing office area fool you.

resp.text: Syenovia, we are sorry to hear that you are currently dissatisfied with your home. First and foremost, we take issues related to pest very seriously and if you are still experiencing this problem, we would encourage you to contact the office imediently. Additionally, we apologize that you and your family were forced to endure a few days absent air conditioning. Normally our team is quite prompt when responding to work orders; however, it is not entirely uncommon that emergency maintenance issues take precedent lengthening our queue. While you currently do not intend to renew your lease, we want you to enjoy the rest of your stay and if there is anything we can do to improve your experience, please do not hesitate to let us know.

name: abc 1235
text:
-Roaches
-Nasty neighbors
-Ppl don't clean up after their dogs
-Bad kids roam the parking lots & fight
-Rude office worker- Stephanie that blatantly lies
- maintenance is fast
-pest control is fast

name: Lydia Weber
text: So far this is the best place to live in Hoover if you are looking for an Apartment.. Great Staff and Very Safe!!    Kid and Pet friendly.. Close to anything you want and need in Hoover. I would recommend this property to anyone that is need of a  GREAT place to live.

resp.text: Hi Lydia, thank you for taking the time to leave us this wonderful review! It makes us happy to hear that you're loving The Park At Hoover, especially our great staff, convenient location, and safe community! If there is any way we can be of assistance and keep up this level of service in the future, please do not hesitate to reach out and let us know!

name: Taylor Marlowe
text: Anna Price was so helpful to me when I was at the Park at Hoover! She was so knowledgeable about all the things I asked and more! She is a gem and irreplaceable to the industry!

resp.text: Taylor, thank you so much for taking the time to leave this heartfelt shout-out for a member of our team. The Park at Hoover is certainly staffed by some exemplary individuals and we are pleased to hear they have provided you with memorable service. Again, thank you for the review. We hope you are doing well.

name: cieara228
text: The apartments are decent and affordable. I have been a year but will never refer this place to anyone else and will be breaking my lease soon. Maintenance is horrible. It will take them between 2-4 months to get anything fixed. Also your water will be cut off between 3-5 times a month, without noticed. Sucks because they are decent and affordable apartments, but the service is not worth it.

name: Chandrakanth Bala
text: This is a worst apartment. We had a problem with dishwasher from the day we moved in. We reported the issue multiple times. And if we check the maintenance request the next day we opened, the status will be shown as fixed. But they don’t really fix the issue, they just solve it temporarily and close the tickets. For some issues they won’t even solve it temporarily. Won’t recommend this apartment.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you have been experiencing continued issues with your dishwasher. This is an essential appliance and we can certainly understand your frustration. We, of course, don't want to shove this issue under the rug and would encourage you to visit the office at your soonest convenience so that we can begin discussing potential solutions.

name: Eric Sheeley
text: AC gone out and filed a work order last night. no one has come to fix it despite calling the office 3 times and being told that they’d send someone out. We Pay too much money for our unit to stop working every other month and to have maintenance being as non responsive as they are. I honestly don’t understand how the 24hr emergency maintenance service works. Considering the fact that you can barely get anyone during business hours.  I can’t WAIT to move out. This is ridiculous and so disappointing.

name: Slimster_09
text: Great place to live if you're moving for the first time!! The application process was a breeze! Got us moved in ASAP, after other places couldn't!! Any issues we've had, maintenance took care of it! Haven't had anything urgent, but at least you can depend on them taken care of things. Everyone seems nice and friendly, and a very peaceful environment thus far!

resp.text: Thank you for your fantastic feedback, Alex & Kendillia! We're so happy that you've decided to call The Park At Hoover your home. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to continue providing you with excellent five-star service as you continue to get settled in. Thank you!

name: anna price
text: The office staff at The Park at Hoover are very professional and helpful. The maintenance is on the rise and you can definitely see the improvement around the community. Definitely would recommend this as your next home!

resp.text: Anna, thank you for the wonderful five-star review of The Park At Hoover! We are thrilled to hear that you're having a great experience in our community, especially regarding our helpful staff and rockstar maintenance team. If you have any comments, questions, or concerns, please don't hesitate to give us a call or visit us in the office!

name: lydia weber
text: This is for the Customer Service at the Office at The Park At Hoover.. Thank you Erica Kelley for all your help on helping making a smooth transfer to my new apartment. Laura-Lauren on the other hand is VERY RUDE!!!  LEARN from Erica how to treat customers... The office there needs to help her learn customer service. When a customer is talking NEVER TALK over them especially how much WE all pay to live there!!! I have been in customer service for many years and you should always try and help the customer as best as you can. NEVER EVER be RUDE to them.... If she does not know how to deal (us) with customers maybe she needs to look for another job!!

resp.text: Lydia, thank you for reaching out to share your feedback. We are delighted that you have had a positive experience with Erica and the majority of our team. We always welcome feedback from residents and are always looking for coaching opportunities for our team members. We thank you for your time and input and look forward to improving your experience so that each encounter is as pleasant as your experience with Erica. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us with any further concerns or positive feedback.

name: Hunter Booth
text: This place is terrible. Like most people I read the horrible reviews and still went to look at the place. They make the leasing office and pool nice. When you get to your apartment it goes down hill from there. Maintenance is horrible, staff is horrible, especially David. David will tell you what you want to hear but when it comes to getting things done he is worthless. There has been a continuous cockroach problem in my building. I keep my apartment very clean and we have sprayed ourselves to try and eliminate the problem. Still no help from the front office. Neighbors leave trash everywhere and don’t pick up anything. I’m the past month my vehicle and my neighbors vehicle has been broken in to. They try and act like it is a nice area when you are trying to lease but if you confront them afterwards they blow you off. Hoover PD is always arresting people around the place. If you are a decent citizen stay away. I could literally write a novel on how horrible my experience has been here. Read the reviews. They don’t lie. They also claim to have a dog park but it hasn’t been open since before I moved in in February.

resp.text: Hunter, we're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay in this community. We try our best to be communicative and responsive when corresponding with residents and apologize that this has not been reflected in your experience. We have an active pest control service and schedule services as soon as possible when reported. Additionally, the pest control service is on a preventative maintenance schedule. We do have active Courtesy Officers on property; unfortunately, we are not able to guarantee zero crime as this can happen anywhere at any time. We do like to take a preventative course of action; thus we have our reliable Courtesy Officers available to you. If you notice strange activity in or around the community, please do not hesitate to contact our Courtesy Officers or the local authorities. We wish nothing more than peaceable enjoyment for all of our residents. We thank you for your time at The Park at Hoover and wish you all the best.

name: Stephen Sheffield
text: I enjoyed my stay here. Whenever I had a problem the staff were very hasty with the responses. Every time I visited the office Lauren always made sure I was taken care of. Customer service is something that I value and I’m glad they value it here as well.

resp.text: We do value customer service, Stephan, and we're happy we were able to provide you with the best we could muster. Knowing you will look back fondly on your time in The Park at Hoover community truly brings a smile to our faces. We hope you are doing well.

name: Callie Renee
text:
I PROMISE THIS REVIEW IS WORTH YOUR TIME. DO NOT LIVE HERE
The Park at Hoover, as of this week, is going on a MONTH (on the 18th) of doing noting about the ABUNDANCE of mold growing in our bathroom and master closet due to THEIR toilet/plumbing failing and flooding our apartment. Not only was it water but it was urine and feces ridden sewage backed up. When I confronted office staff for the millionth time after they had been running me in circles for weeks, they said "there was no moisture" as if the moisture wasn't already dried and molded by week 3. Then when I told them about my chronic asthma and how I cannot live in an environment like that (I had already tried and began having sharp pains in my lungs and shortness of breath), they did not care at all and acted as if the apartment was livable. Maintenance manager even said he would put out a dehumidifier (if you know anything about mold you know this is useless) and he didn't even bother doing that. The Park at Hoover is CHEAP and didn't want to dish out the money to have the carpet, carpet padding and probably wood removed from the floor by an outside contractor. THEN when I contacted my attorney for help with getting out of my lease, all of the sudden they thought it would be a good time to bring up how they found paraphernalia in my apartment, then when I called the next day to see if the mold had been fixed office staff put me on hold to "check the status" only to return with the area manager who EVICTED US (over the phone)!!!! I literally cannot make this stuff up. Obviously the paraphernalia was seen a month ago (when the flood first happened) and they JUST NOW bring it up, nearly a month later, because they knew I was in the right. We literally had to wear full face masks with filters to move our things out. Knowing this apartment complex I know for a fact the majority of apartments maintenance works in have some type of "violation" of the lease inside. I wouldn't be surprised if they bandaid repair this damage and put another family in there. This place is as crooked and backwards as they come. I am leaving this review under a different name so, The Park at Hoover, don't bother replying with some generic response because you are only hurting your residents.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback for The Park at Hoover. An emergency service request was addressed in December for the apartment home above yours. That evening the concern was resolved. As your continued maintenance concern was brought to our attention, we scheduled a time for the Service Manager to walk your apartment as we take moisture concerns very seriously. A thorough review of the apartment home was completed where no signs of microbial growth were seen. During this review, paraphernalia was found in the home.
