Due to the escalated nature of this situation the Area Manager stepped into the correspondence and he relayed that a notice will be sent to the apartment home and there would be a 7-day period in which this violation could be cured. We strive to provide excellent customer service and want to ensure our residents are comfortable in their homes. Once again we appreciate your feedback.

name: J B (Jayromethagod)
text: Maintenance never comes.. roaches,rent way to high!!! If you’re reading this don’t move here... please!!!!!

resp.text: Jerone, we are sorry to hear that you would not currently recommend the community to others. First off, we take issues related to pests very seriously and if you are still experiencing this problem, we would encourage you to stop by the office at your soonest convenience. Additionally, if you are having trouble getting a response from our maintenance team, we would love the opportunity to help you fill out a work order and nail down a concrete timeline to have your issue addressed.

name: Xander Wilmoth
text: I have lived here for years now,  its a nice place to live.  The staff is nice and helpful. The studio apartment is the best value for the area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, Xander. We can't tell you how happy we are to know you've been enjoying your Park at Hoover home! If you can ever think of any way we can improve your experience, do not hesitate to call on us.

name: Maria Gomez
text: This place is horrible. Very unsafe neighborhood. People break into your car at 7 pm with no fear. Maintenance is horrible, even when you report things that are urgent, don’t keep your hopes up for them to come quickly. My neighbor got mugged, my car got broken into. They delete all 1 star ratings on their main page. Their advertisement is a facade.  Agents are rude, management hide behind the agents and relay messages when you want to talk to them, not even having the courtesy to speak directly to you when the issue was a safety issue. Unless you like to gamble with your life and belongings DO NOT MOVE HERE. and Laura is the worst and rudest agent. It one thing to have issues with your apartment, but when it comes to the safety of your life and health it’s a whole other level of issue. Which the staff can care less about as long as they get that signature to hold you captive for a year.

resp.text: Thank you for providing feedback. We take each review seriously whether it is positive or presents areas where we can improve. We are committed to providing our residents with a welcoming experience here at The Park at Hoover. In particular, our management team works diligently to address resident concerns and we would love for the opportunity to work with you to improve your experience. Please contact the office at your convenience and we can set a mutually convenient time to discuss. We would love to sit down with you to address your concerns . Thank you for taking the time to leave us with your feedback. We look forward to speaking with you shortly.

name: Reanna Britting
text: Place is disgusting. Moved Into an apartment infested with bugs. More specifically cockroaches. Management and maintenance don’t seem to care either because no one from a pest control center comes out unless it’s Friday. So I mean if you’re into sleeping with cockroaches running around by your bed, or cooking with cockroaches in your cabinets or even watching tv with cockroaches I mean this would be the place for you. But if your a human being with any sort of cleanliness standards I wouldn’t recommend this place to my worst enemy. When you try to call management “Dave” who is supposed to be in charge can’t be bothered to talk to you. He’s in “meetings”. He’s probably just scared to face the fact his apartments are disgusting and he might actually have to do something to fix it. You call maintenance and first are told someone will be out tomorrow to fix the bug situation by a nice genuine employee, well the next day call back and “Whitney” answers and goes back to preaching the pest control only comes out on Friday. THEY DO NOT CARE IF YOU ARE LIVING WITH COCKROACHES. I’m not sure what type of people think this is okay but apparently people like Dave and Whitney do. Again don’t move here the place is trash just like the management running it. Absolutely worthless.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. It is our goal to work diligently to provide the best service possible to our residents and to resolve all concerns, including pest issues, in a timely and thorough manner here at our apartment community. As such, we apologize that you feel you have experienced otherwise during your stay. Please feel free to give us a call or visit our office if you would like to further discuss your concerns with management and maintenance. We'd love for your input so we can identify areas of improvement moving forward.

name: Rebecca Hayes
text: I wish I could give this place 0 out of 5 stars. I've lived here for a year and dread any time that I have to contact the maintenance staff. They DO NOT answer the phone. They DO NOT call you back. They DO NOT fix anything! I have only ever been able to get one person to fix anything - the maintenance supervisor. The only problem with that is he has maybe a hundred apartments to maintain. I have had nothing but bad experiences from the rest of the staff both at the maintenance office and the leasing office. I have nothing positive to say about these people. They simply DO NOT CARE about any of their residents' well being.

name: Dylan Huie
text: My girlfriend and I love our apartment, and the office staff is very friendly. We have had no issues and are looking forward to staying here for a while.

resp.text: Dylan, we are happy to hear that things have been going swimmingly thus far and you have been loving your home. We hope we can continue to exceed your expectations for some time to come and will be available in the office if you ever need us.

name: Seneithia Parker
text: The apartments aren’t my favorite but I had an awesome experience with Lauren as she showed me around the property. Great young lady.

resp.text: Well, while our homes might not be for everyone, we're happy to hear that our customer service is universally loved. Regardless, it was a treat showing you around and we hope you'll keep us in mind when you're shopping for a new place to rest your head.

name: Peggy Rogrrs
text: Th is place is a DUMP. Nothing ever gets fixed. My neighbor has waited 4 days for her air conditioning to be fixed. They say they have 4 pools. Lies. Big pool is green can't see bottom, 1 is halfway decent, the small one never opened and 1 not filled with water. Laundry rooms are FILTHY and half don't work, and all are 2.59 a pop.Did I mention water in the walls and the fruit flies that you can't get rid of due to water problems. The staff will lie straight to your face. 3 maintenance men for 2000 apartments? Oh but the low prices. But what a price you pay. Shootings and police called out all time. RUN THE OTHER WAY FROM TH IS PLACE AS FAST AS YOU CAN.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on our quality apartment homes, convenient features and amenities and helpful maintenance and on-site team. As such, we are taking your concerns seriously, as they do not align with our goals and aspirations here at our community. With regard to your concern about the pools, two of the pools were drained during renovation earlier in the year, but all four are now filled and online.  Thank you for your patience as we resurfaced and improved these amenities. Give us a call or visit our office if you would like to further share your feedback. We would love for the opportunity to improve your experience here at The Park at Hoover.

name: Kendall Ouellette
text: The park at Hoover is a great community. I have lived here a year and love seeing the improvements in the community!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the five-star rating, Kendall! We're so happy to hear that you've enjoyed an amazing year in The Park at Hoover community and we still manage to find ways to exceed your expectations. Feel free to stop by the office anytime if you ever find yourself in need of a helping hand or just want to say hi!

name: Uriel Camargo
text: Terrible ! Horrible ! Me and my family have been living here for the past year And we have absolutely nothing positive to say about this place. They want to charge for absolutely everything here. If it isn't one thing it's another with them stupid people! They are wanting to charge for a little piece in the carpet $900 for nothing. When we first received this apt. This apt needed about $900 worth of fixing. It's retarded! They are nothing but stupid here.. I believe they need money for themselves so they take it out of anything they can take money from. Ridiculous if you ask me ! We wanted to transfer and they wanted us to pay 1300 just for deposit , b******. Nothing further.. Do not recommend at all unless u want to lose money on something worthless.

name: DAWN MANASSA
text: I've been living here for over a year today and must say it is a nice place to live. Quiet. Maintenance is good. The staff is always doing something for the community. I enjoy living here.

resp.text: Wow, thanks so much, Dawn! You've made our day with this stellar review. Here at The Park At Hoover, we always aim to provide our residents with beautiful, quiet homes and superior customer service, so we're ecstatic to see our hard work has not gone unnoticed! If you ever need anything, please don't hesitate to let us know!

name: Tasheka Shields
text: I was looking for a place to move because my lease at my house is ending soon but after reading the reviews. I definitely will not be renting at this apartment complex,  the last thing I need right now is to live somewhere that's dirty and infested with bugs. It seems this place needs to hire better employees and whoever owns it needs to babysit whoever is currently working there now and to actually care about the tenants and the property!!! People read reviews for any type of business and if most of the reviews are negative people won't think twice about looking elsewhere even if they have to pay more or live a bit further.  People want to live in a clean stress free environment and the reviews show this place is everything but that!! Get it together!!

name: Peyton Gans Booth
text: PLEASE DO NOT MOVE INTO THESE APARTMENTS. I have been here since Feb 2018 and have had a terrible experience ever since. The office staff does NOT care about you or your safety. Not even a month ago my toilet exploded when I was out of town and I returned to a MOLDED, WET BATHROOM/MASTER CLOSET. I cannot even breathe in my own room because it flared up my chronic asthma. I have since then requested PRIORITY EMERGENCY MAINTENANCE and there is STILL mold growing in my apartment from Dec. 18th (today is Jan. 1st) I cannot even live in my own apartment which I pay WAY too much to live in anyway. If I didn’t have another place to stay, what would I do? The negiligence of this apartment complex is RIDICULOUS. Nothing good can come from living here. Any 5 star reviews you see here are GUARANTEED fake. Please do yourself a favor and stay away from the Park at Hoover or Arlington Properties all together.

resp.text: Payton, thank you for expressing your concerns. Upon a brief review it appears this concern was reported to us on December 28th and resolved the same day. We are dismayed to learn that you are still experiencing issues. We will have our Service Manager reach out to you to review these concerns ASAP and ensure a resolution is reached. Please do not hesitate to reach out to the office team. We have a dedicated Resident Services Center to assist you when concerns arise. You can reach them at 205-721-8935. You are welcome to call the leasing office with any concerns as well at 205-985-7463 or via email at Hoover@ArlingtonProperties.net. We look forward to speaking with you shortly and improving your stay at The Park at Hoover.

name: Sarah Vanderford
text: My apartment has flooded 3 times within the month and a half I have lived there. I got out of the hospital yesterday to find 60% of my apartment had been reached by 1 foot of water (the water heater has been causing problems, I've reported it about 20 different times). The complex doesn't even own a shop vac and said they could do nothing about the standing water until Monday. They think it is acceptable to extract the water 3 days after and not move me or replace the molded materials. There's a long list of reasons this apartment is unfit to live in. I don't have a car or anywhere else to go or stay. This place is a complete scam. Not to mention the bug infestation, previously rotted cabinets from the renters before, wallpaper on the floor (which maintenance ripped in places while fixing kitchen appliances) and there's random paint splatter everywhere. Also my water has been out for 24 hours. The list goes on but my physical health is in danger with stress right now. I'm posting here because this apartment complex is endangering my health, my roommates health, and I cannot even safely have my daughter in my home. These people shouldn't be fired, they should be arrested.

resp.text: Hi Sarah. We appreciate you for sharing your experience. We have reviewed your concerns and are actively working to ensure it is fully resolved and does not reoccur. We are committed to bettering your stay here at The Park at Hoover. If there are any pending maintenance requests we would be happy to discuss with you at a convenient time. Thank you for your review. We look forward to speaking with you soon.

name: Moon Caster
text: I have been living her for 3 weeks it's now September 2016. SO MANY things are wrong about this apartment. We had gnats who were apparently living in the ice maker so when the refrigerator was turned on they froze and became part of the ice cubes, in addition the there was also dirt in the ice cubes also. There are numerous bugs everywhere. Ants that came in through the master bedroom window, more gnats in every room, long legged spiders in every corner of every room, small roaches (indicating an infestation), house centipedes, and a few other insects I can't identify. The stove didn't work when we moved in, the dishwasher is broken, and there are no weather guards under the front door or the patio door. It's been 3 weeks and even with regular visits from pest control we are still see in bugs everywhere. The only thing that had been fixed is the stove. DO NOT LIVE HERE IT'S SO TERRIBLE!!!!! We have complained to multiple people in the office  for days and nothing has been done. This is terrible and we are now looking to break our lease.

resp.text: We value your residency and want to ensure your needs are handled in a timely and efficient manner.  Please stop by the office at your convenience to meet me and discuss these issues.  We will get everything handled in a timely manner. I look forward to speaking with you. Sheri Davis

name: Dailene González
text: I have enjoyed my tim at The Park at Hoover. It is a great deal. I would recommend these apartments. Laura is very helpful.

resp.text: Dailene, thank you so much for taking the time to pen this lovely review and for awarding The Park at Hoover community with a five-star rating. We feel honored to have your recommendation and hope we can continue to give you the amazing housing experience you deserve! Just keep in mind, you are welcome to visit the office anytime.

name: Shebbie73 Hosler
text: I was initially assigned one apt. After having all utilities turned on the apt number was changed bc the first apt was not ready. Moved in Nov 22,2017. I had no hot water for 17 days, neither toilet would work, heater would not turn off, closet door wouldn’t close, shower curtain leaned, ice maker wouldn’t work, neither would the outlets. After having to threaten to demur them they finally got my hot water working but still having no toilet was told it’s not an emergency. They finally came to fix the toilets & outlets but maintenance did something & now NONE of my over head lights work. There was some water damage in the living room unfixed. They cut an extra access panel to the heater & left it with raw sheet rock. The office personnel are neither sympathetic nor helpful. They constantly send me to maintenance voicemail who NEVER RESPOND! I do not ever recommend this place to anyone!!

resp.text: We are deeply saddened to see that this was your experience, as we truly strive to provide our residents with a move-in ready home and a seamless transition. It is our main goal to provide our residents with great homes, and we want to ensure that each one of your concerns are improved upon. Please stop by our office at your earliest convenience so we can discuss each one of your concerns and provide you with the home you deserve.

name: Kia Strickland
text: Moved into the apartment in July. Everything started out great. Except I started having maintenance problems and the maintenance does not come To fix urgent problems as hasty as they should. My sink has been stopped up for a week and my dishwasher is hoarding filthy water that is smelling my apartment. I been having to come home to an apartment that smells and I am afraid that maggots will form due to the dirty dishes that are not able to be washed. Leah the manager of the property acted as if she did not care about my issue and just brushed it off to maintenance. I asked to speak to a higher authority. David Skinner is the guy that is higher authority and did not even come out to speak to me. Danielle seemed to be the only one that wanted to truly find help. Johnnie Lee had a horrible attitude and did not make eye contact once. She was the one that I dealt with in signing my lease. She was a good person up until this point. I am very regretful that I chose to live here. I will not renew my lease. Run while you still have time! Wish I took heed to the reviews.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We care deeply about providing great service alongside ensuring our homes remain in great condition. As such, we are taking your concerns seriously and would greatly appreciate the chance to follow up with you regarding the maintenance and management issues you feel you are experiencing here at The Park at Hoover. Please give us a call or visit our office. Our entire team is committed to working with you to improve your experience and we apologize that you have had less than a positive experience here at our community.

name: Hassan
text: They show you a very good apartment model to make you feel happy but they refuse to show you your actual apartment until you pay the application fees which made me feel very uncomfortable. Something is wrong!

resp.text: Hassan, we can assure you that your suspicions are unfounded. While this practice may seem confusing to you, it is, in fact, standard operating procedure for many apartment communities. You are always welcome to see your reserved apartment prior to taking possession of your new home.  If you do choose to follow through with the application process and are approved, we are sure all your fears will be alleviated. Please do not hesitate to reach out to the office with any questions or concerns you may have.

name: Alicia Musich
text:
****COCKROACH INFESTATION *****AC DOES NOT WORK
We would like to know how to get ahold of the owner of the property? Bcuz we’ve lived here for about 3 weeks now and have called the office been to see the people at the office, have called the emergency maintenance line several times, they have even been to our apt about 7 times and have done NOTHING about fixing our AC unit. Just recently returned to my apt after a long week of work and have walked in to my thermostat showing 90 degrees in my apt and no cool air blowing. Have called maintenance 2 times now just today and no response! I Want to leave no stars at all with this low maintained and so called apartments. But unfortunately I have to leave 1 if I want to post this. I hope the right person sees this. And for once provides some actual help. We keep getting the excuse that we are on the top floor. And I have lived in multiple top floors and I’ve never had my apartment be 90°. This is absolutely ridiculous and unbelievable. Not to mention I get attitude like I am a complete inconvenience, every time I go talk to someone at the office.  legal action will be taken if you guys do not fix our AC unit. If it was not for my company who chooses our housing and where we work I would’ve never picked this zero star place to live! Also to let you know I’ve already told my company about the conditions and hope to take further action Monday. So please if you have a higher up number that I can call that would be great. There is absolutely no way our AC unit is working at 90°
Anyone who is thinking about moving here, know I’ve only been here 3 weeks and highly recommend reading and looking at reviews before you move here. They ARE NOT LYING!!!! ALSO JUST OPEND UP MY FRIDGE AND ABOUT 3-4 COCKROACHES JUST CRAWLED OUT OF IT! Sooo DISGUSTING !

resp.text: Alicia, we're sorry to see that you have not enjoyed a five-star experience. The satisfaction of our residents is our highest priority and if there is anything we could do to turn things around and improve your experience, we would like to know. Please, if you have any feedback to share, feel free to stop by the office for a chat.

name: Omar Lopez
text: Honestly it's a decent place to live until things start breaking down, which I've been able to deal with. Now I have a leak that every time it rains its like a waterfall. Thinking about adding a glass  window with a backlight to make it seems artistic

resp.text: Hi Omar! Was this issue ever resolved? We’re following up on past complaints and would love for you to reach out to our office. We are committed to improving the experience here at our community.

name: Hazel Ford
text: This is by far the worst place to live! I'm not one to complain and leave bad reviews but people should know not to waist their money here! They shut the water down once a week and never inform anyone! I wake up to get ready for work but guess what??? I have no water! Maintenance request go unanswered for months (3to4). On top of that the company that just "bought them out" took the prices up on this crap! I wouldn't dare pay what they are asking to live here when you can live somewhere else a lot nicer probably for less! The phone system suck ass! You can never speak to anyone directly. The leasing office staff always have a stank attitude! It's to the point where I'm breaking my lease and getting the hell up out of here! People please don't not waist your time or money here! It's not worth it!

name: Harry Feliciano
text: Never answer phones, Not Military friendly, Can't provide any info ever, Worse maintenance ever. Do your best to live somewhere else. Pay the extra for better service than this Hell hole.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to send us your feedback. We try to fulfill all requests, such as maintenance requests, in a timely and efficient manner, and we’re sorry this was not your experience. We do try to accommodate to the best of our ability and in addition, we have a standing special for all active military and first responders. We would appreciate an opportunity to resolve your concerns and better your perception of our community. Please stop by the office at your convenience so that we can reach a resolution. Thank you.

name: audio davis
text: I was very excited at first because this is my very first apartment and I was excited to be on my own. Amanda was my leasing agent. Throughout the process she wasn't very attentive to my questions but apologized for it on move in day citing they were short staffed. Nevertheless, I moved in a week ago and we noted the existence of roaches and spiders. Amanda said she would get pest control but I have yet to hear anything back from her since I moved in. A week later, my apartment is crawling with roaches. I have taken pictures and video. I have made maintenance requests and have been ignored.I have had to physically go to resident relations a week after putting in my pest control request and he said he would get someone out on Friday. By Friday at 5pm, no one had shown up. I went down there again and he said it will be Monday. I told him I cannot wait that long. They sent a maintenance man out with some spray but it only intensified the roach sightings.  At this point , the apartment is uninhabitable. To me it seems like they want to just get you leased and leave you alone. I am not very pleased after only being there a week.

resp.text: Oh, my. We are sorry to hear that things are off to a rocky start. We try our best to be attentive and respond to work orders in a timely manner and apologize that you've somehow managed to slip through the cracks. We take issues related to pest very seriously and can certainly understand how this could make you uncomfortable in your home. We have an active pest control service and are committed to ensuring your concerns are resolved. We will be reaching out shortly, in the meantime please feel free to stop by the office at your soonest convenience so we may begin working toward a solution.

name: THE TOMAHAWK view
text:
The maintenance sux I've lived in this complex almost 10 years off and on , I've had a shower head lieak , we had to over flows from above and the never came back to even paint it, the pool situation is redicoulous they have months in advance to get it inspected etc , they never open on time, so my wife and I are leaving THE CRAPER AT HOOVER.

I have called about our tub faucet it leaks breezeway is nasty , it needs pressure washing, and now our  ac has run up our power bill 40$ , we come home to a nasty bree,way ugh really

Now one more leak from the oil pop es into our bathroom, the maintenance man tightened it but the ceiling is in bad shape so oh well ,  they really didn't fix the problem it will happen again .

resp.text: Tom, we are sorry to hear that after so many years, your opinion of the community has soured. Our maintenance team takes pride in their work and works to ensure a prompt response time and professional service. We are disappointed to hear that you have not experienced this. Pool inspections are scheduled with the Health Department as early as possible each year. This year we have been in contact with them since February. Unfortunately, sometimes we are at the mercy of a timeline we are unable to control. However, we do operate as quickly as we can and within our control to ensure amenities are available and the community is enjoyable for our residents. If you are still experiencing any maintenance issues or know of anything we could do to improve your experience, please do not hesitate to stop by the office for a chat or reach out to our Service Coordinator at205-721-8935.

name: Mr Venusaur
text:
***EDIT: After they saw this review,the staff came out to "fix" my ac. But, sure enough, the thing just comes on and blows CONSTANTLY but does not cool my unit. It worked well for about 45 minutes after they fixed it but it is back to blowing blowing blowing blowing but ITS 85 PLUS DEGREES EVERY SINGLE DAY.

If i could give them even less than one star, i would.***

AVOID THIS PLACE. ITS HOT GARBAGE.

This place is unclean. The staff is lazy. The matienance team is seemingly nonexistant. After a year of waiting and consistently paying my rent for the last 4 years they have yet to come fix my air conditioning.  The water system is trash and good luck getting a unit with good appliances.  And on top of that they have the audacity to try and charge us a fine for the garbage can being out even though me and my wife work when they pick it up. They say its to help keep bugs away but i assure you i keep it spotless. Hell, i even vacuum outside my door.

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE. DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT MOVE IN HERE

resp.text: Cody, we are disappointed to hear that you have not been satisfied with the community as of late. That being said, we truly appreciate resident feedback and feel that it can be a valuable tool for targeting areas in which we can improve. We will be in contact shortly to review your pending maintenance concern. We would love the opportunity to address some of the concerns you have brought to our attention and if you would be so kind as to visit the office, we are sure we could develop some solutions and improve your time here.

name: Kameelah Robinson
text: These are the worst apartments I’ve ever stayed in. The outlets in the bedrooms are out. The toilet and the sink in the master bedroom don’t be work. And there’s no hot water because something is wrong with the water heater. Maintenance refuses to come out and fix anything and we’ve been trying to get them out here for two months. DO NOT MOVE IN THESE APARTMENTS!!!!!!

resp.text: Kameelah, we a sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulty getting your maintenance issues addressed. We do our best to be prompt when responding to work-orders and apologize if this has not been reflected in your experience. Despite our less than timely past performance, we would like nothing more than a second chance to attend to your problems. Please stop by the office at your soonest convenience so we may begin developing solutions and restore your home to proper working order.

name: J G
text: Save yourself a lot of time and money and rent somewhere else! There are a lot of apartments in this area and this is by far the worst one I’ve ever dealt with! Maintenance is practically non-existent. Water would randomly be shut off and there were incidents where the apartment flooded and no one came out to help. Bugs were so bad and my air was constantly broken but still, no one did anything. I think I would’ve had a better experience in a homeless shelter than at The Park at Hoover.

resp.text: J.G, we are saddened to see you have not enjoyed a five-star experience. That being said, we truly value your feedback and would love the opportunity to improve your time here. We have several capital improvement projects in place including a renovated fitness center and exterior painting project for the apartments. We are also actively working on our Hug a Building Community Clean up inactive as well. We do have an active pest control program in place and would be happy to review the concern you are having. We are unable to identify which apartment you are in, however, we would love to speak with you. Please give the office a call at your earliest convenience. We love receiving input from our residents and are very open to suggestions and if you have any concerns you would like to discuss in detail, please do not hesitate to visit the office or call us up for a chat.

name: Aisha Belal
text:
RUN!! DO NOT LIVE HERE!
Get away while you still can. Do not be fooled by their new fancy office and nice staff. Management does not care about you, your apartment or your safety. There was a shooting here on Sunday, in front of our building where my children play. The getaway car wrecked into our vehicle and ruined it!
When I spoke with David, the property manager his excuse was that they can't guarantee our safety. This whole incident happened bc the complex is too big, careless and negligent that they don't know who is living in their apartments.

resp.text: This was a tragic isolated event which unfortunately occurred at our community. Our Team once notified responded in a prompt manner and worked closely with Hoover Police Department. Though we are not able to guarantee safety as incidents can occur anywhere at any time, we always want to make sure our residents are informed. This is why we promptly sent a message to the residents including tips for safety precautions and reminded them of our Courtesy Officer 24/7 phone line available for them. Our Courtesy Officers are a part of the Hoover Police Department and patrol our community actively. We can certainly understand your concern. We are saddened your experience was not a five-star experience.

name: Ruth Speake
text: Great service getting into my apartment from start to finish.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the five-star rating, Ruth! We are so happy to hear that your stay in The Park at Hoover community is off to a good start. We know move-ins can sometimes be stressful and are glad we made things a breeze. We hope you know you are welcome to stop by the office anytime you are in need of a helping hand.

name: Adam Tittle
text: I'm having trouble deciding if the staff is incompetent or retarded.  I've been living here for one month now.  I went a week without hot water before I finally harassed them enough to fix my water heater.  Both hot and cold air was broken when I moved in, and only the heat has been fixed (remember I have been here for an entire month.). Both toilets run constantly, making for high water bills.  The only good thing the staff is good at is making up excuses as to why your without hot water, running air condition, etc.  I also have not been given a mailbox key, and they constantly tell me that its maintenances job to provide mailbox keys, and they haven't gotten it yet.  Staff or maintenance doesn't return calls.  Everything about this place (other than cheap rent) sucks and I hope the next apartment fire here takes out the entire complex in order to save future residents from the headache and neglect that EVERYONE here complains about.  I sincerely wish I had read reviews on this place before I moved in, and for those of you reading this RUN away.   If you read any of these reviews (because no one has left a good review) and still move in, than you're probably as stupid as the people running this place and you might actually like it here.  As for everyone else, save yourself a headache and find another complex.

name: Audrey Cohen
text: I have to agree with everyone else's reviews. Nothing is done. They constantly want to raise rent. 4 owners in a year. That says a lot. Can't wait to leave. Prior to all the rain informed them of gutter having free grow out of it causing rain to come into apartment destroying furniture. Not soon enough though.

name: Malcolm Payne
text: After reading all the negative reviews I wanted to wait to see for myself how things are here at the Park at Hoover.  Started out okay.  Then the water meter sprung a leak on this past Friday.  Put in maintenance call.  No one called.  Went to main office.  Another request was submitted.  Still no call.  Someone finally came to access the leak.  The technician said he would be back.  About two hours later he shows back up, not tools or anything.  Says that he was waiting on another guy and they would be back to fix the leak.  Needless to say the leak is still there and today is Tuesday.  I call the office first thing this morning, I was routed to maintenance.  Never got a call from them.  I am beginning to doubt my decision to move here.

resp.text: Hi Malcolm. We understand first impressions mean a lot when moving into your new home. We try to fulfill all maintenance requests in a timely and efficient manner. We’re sorry this was not your experience. We want to ensure we improve your impression of The Park at Hoover. We will reach out to you shortly to confer on your maintenance concerns and will work to resolve this for you ASAP. We are thrilled you chose The Park at Hoover as your new home and truly value you as a resident. We thank you for your input and look forward to improving your stay at The Park at Hoover.

name: Taneisha jarrett Garth
text: Worst place ever lots of insects roaches to kill wish could upload video and pictures . Went to the main office and ask why this happen Ann the manager told me they only spray outside of the building and when ask why am I paying pest control if inside the apartment is not spray , her remarks was we keep going on in circle so obviously she doesn’t care about anyone health and how can you live with roaches my god ,I don’t recommend anyone to live here will be uploading all videos and pictures.on my page.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you have been struggling with pest issues. That being said, we feel that there has been some sort of miscommunication. We would, of course, be willing to schedule treatments to the inside of your home. We do complete interior pest control on a routine schedule, however, we also complete treatments outside of this schedule as requested. Our Service Coordinator will be in touch as soon as possible to schedule a visit.

name: Norin Brightblade
text:
From day one the leasing office staff has been very professional and prompt. James has helped me with everything I have asked him about. Any issues I have brought to his attention were promptly taken care of with his direct supervision. My studio is beyond perfect for my lifestyle; in both price and size.

This complex is in a transition from worse to better, and you can tell it. You can also tell that the staff is well on there way to get these things under control. I personally look forward to watching it get better during my stay here!

name: Taylor Shirey
text:
I have lived in apartments my entire adult life, and NEVER have I had such a horrible experience as I have had with this complex. I have been in the complex since August, and I have already outlive at least three management companies.

When I moved in, the apartment was in horrible condition. We found nails and screws in the carpet, the kitchen counters were sticky and covered with food stains, the walls were scratched to pieces and had hand prints, cobwebs in every corner, vents covered in dust, cracks and chips in the drywall, electrical outlets with not power and the god-awful, malfunctioning smoke detector that goes off every 12 hours.... It is now July, THESE ISSUES ARE STILL NOT FIX! Neither Maintenance, the leasing office or the cleaning crew took responsibility. All of my maintenance requests went unanswered.

Not to mention that for a MONTH I had a leak in my ceiling, causing plaster to fall constantly. It was ONLY after I complain to the Regional Manager of the management company did someone finally come to resolve the issue ...my other problems have never been address.

I can't pay my bill online because it has my monthly rent listed at a different price than what was on my signed lease. Do not even get me started about the utilities bill that only began to appear midway through my stay. I signed my lease with a flat rate that included certain utilities ...now I'm being charge roughly $150 a month for things that were originally included in my lease. It is totally absurd.

The leasing office is closed when I leave for work and when I return home for the evening, making it impossible for me to handle things face-to-face. Don't try to call, I have never once had any message I've left be returned.

The icing on this cake - Since the leasing office is closed when I'm off work, I leave my rent check under the door. In May, I left my check with a stapled letter attached giving my 60 Days Notice. They got my rent check, of course, but my letter was misplaced. I was told it was likely thrown away by a temporary employee ...and now I'm being punished for their mistake. I am being forced to pay two more months of rent outside of my lease (which ends in early August) that totals over $1,100 because an employee threw away my notice.

Please do yourself a favor --- DO NOT LIVE HERE! It has been the absolute worse experience of my life. I've never been so upset, frustrated and enraged by an apartment complex. I think a box under the freeway would be a better choice than this dump.

resp.text: We are sorry that you haven’t had a good experience with our community. Customer service is extremely important to us and we would appreciate the opportunity to discuss where we could have done better and address your concerns. Please feel free to contact us at your earliest convenience so that we can clear up any misunderstandings.

name: Caressa R Franklin
text: The WORST place I have ever lived! I wound NOT recommend this place EVER! I had every problem imaginable from bugs, no a/c, maintenance not calling back, things in the apartment were broken from the START! Now they want to stick me with an outrageous collections bill without a phone call or letter telling me I owed anything. It would have been nice for this DUMP to notify be before sending it to collections and ruining my credit!  I really wouldn't even give this place one star! Trust me there are better places in the area to stay!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our team works hard to ensure that our community remains a welcoming and inviting place to live. We apologize you feel you have had less than a positive experience here at our community. Please reach out to us if you have any outstanding billing questions. We hope to take your feedback into account as we work to better our efforts here at our apartment homes.

name: Hunter Dennis
text:
The whole place is disgusting. Mutiple issues with the apartment at move-in, including but not limited to the AC not working and dishwasher leaking. Maintennce is literally unresponsive. Tried calling the emergency maintenance line because a mirror shattered in the apartment. No answer... Infested with roaches.

Do not live here.

resp.text: Hunter, we are sorry to hear that your stay in the community is off to a rocky start. We try to do our best to be prompt when responding to work-orders and apologize that this has not been reflected in your experience. That being said, we are quite confident that if given the opportunity we could solve many of the issues you have brought forward in this review. We take issues related to pests and maintenance very seriously and want nothing more than for our residents to be comfortable in their homes. We have an active pest control service and would be happy to facilitate this for you. When attempting to review your requests we did not notice your display name associated with a current apartment home. Please reach out to us as soon as possible so we are able to assist you promptly. We look forward to improving your time at The Park at Hoover.

name: Macee Boggs
text: Toured this complex several times and loved it! This will be my future apartment complex!

resp.text: We are thrilled that you will soon be calling The Park at Hoover home, Macee! We are looking forward to having you as a resident of our community and please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your moving process go as smoothly as possible.

name: Christi Newman
text: Because of the staff's complete incompetency and total apathy, my husband and I are pretty much homeless.  We went to look at the model apartment and decided to move there based on the fact that we could move out after we bought a home.  The staff seemed caring and helpful.  After we agreed and signed a reservation agreement, the staff never answered the phone, never called us back and when they did talk to us, they would say one thing, and then either do the opposite or tell us the opposite the next time we asked.  A week before we were to move, we found out that they were changing our apartments due to a water leak.  The day before we were to move, we went up there to look at the apartment, but it wasn't ready and they wouldn't let us in.  After we sat there forever, they let us in and we found no lights at all in the apt.  The next day, we packed up to move and called and the apartment wasn't ready as of 1 p.m. that day, move in day, and they wouldn't let the utility people in, even though they assured us they would.  We were then told that the policy is you can't get the keys until after 5 p.m. the day you pay your first rent.  Who moves at 5 p.m. at night, especially when the office closes at 7?!  We went up there to finally tell them we weren't moving.  When we got there, the staff, one who wrote a glowing Google review of the apt by the way, yelled at us, called us liars and asked us to leave.  I've never been treated with such disrespect in my life.  This is how you treat a customer, a client?  In the end, we're happy we didn't move in there.  Through work, I've met people who live there and say it's an awful place, things are always broken and it's not a safe place to live.  So, I plead with you, please don't even consider this place!  We decided it's better for us to be homeless than actually live there.

name: Dewan Fuller
text: We Got The Best Up Front Service and Our Apartment Was More than Ready By Our Move-in Date Thanks To our Leasing consultant Ms.Amsley , who Also Gave a Great Description of what we were Looking for and Was Able to Exceed Expectations on our living area..We Hope To Enjoy our New Home Along the Year 😊

name: Terrell Pettus
text: The neighborhood is good, however the maintenance is TERRIBLE and the EMERGENCY MAINTENANCE IS TERRIBLE. My water has been off since yesterday morning around 2 a.m and it is still currently off. There are tons of people with no water and there was no warning! This happened more times than I can count with this place. My lease will be broken VERY soon. If you don't mind your water being cut off unannounced or poor maintenance this is the place for you!

name: JACKSON PIERCE
text: It epic but it also told me that im not cool and that hurt my feeling so I left and went to the park at fortnite epic.

resp.text: We are sorry to see that you have not enjoyed a five-star experience. That being said, we would love to know what we could have done to improve your stay. Please, if you have any constructive criticism to share, give us a call or stop by the office at your soonest convenience.

name: Brandon Terrell
text:
This complex has given us problems from the beginning. I regret coming here. The walkways are always filled with trash. The staff are slow to act and the turn over is ridiculous. In the 100 building we have had two elderly tenants pass away while living alone. Their rooms are as they were while the tenants were alive. One passed about 5 months ago. The complex put up a fan in the window to remove the smell and no one has walked in since. The other still has the lights on and large black flies can be seen clinging to the windows. The lady passed about a month ago and her body was just sitting in there...This is disgusting. I have had a gun pulled on me while living here. The website to pay rent never works. The maintenance do not wear uniforms and one of the maintenance men used our bathroom, did not flush,  and smoked a cigarette while working on our pipes.

This place is horrible. HORRIBLE.

resp.text: Hi Brandon – The Park at Hoover and the grounds team here strive daily to maintain the grounds and buildings to keep them clean and beautiful for our residents and their guests. Our maintenance team members are required to wear uniforms that identify them as employees of The Park at Hoover; Khaki pants and black shirts with Park at Hoover name patches sewn onto shirts for clarity. If at any time you see a team member out of uniform, please report that to the office so that it can be addressed immediately. If at any time you feel our team has acted unprofessionally in your home while addressing your maintenance concerns, please contact us immediately. The apartment with the fan in the window is actually the new resident who moved in earlier this year. We are aware of the other person’s passing, and as soon as we were notified about the deceased, we began processing a plan to take care of the apartment. The Park at Hoover values you as a resident and we hope you continue to call this your home. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Lauren King
text: Thought they had gotten better with the change in management but as soon as I placed in an application, it was denied within 24 hours. Why? They said the credit check (Which they did not tell me they were doing) came back with insufficient credit. I was only told of income verification and a back ground check. I  was also denied a refund on all of my fee's which also frustrates me. I have less than a month until I have to be out of my current apartment. I wish they had been up front with me on exactly what they required instead of stealing my money and then giving me a half of an excuse. I was also warned upon entering the property that the maintenance is very hit and miss. I would suggest not living here.

resp.text: Lauren, we are sorry to hear that you may have been inconvenienced by the results of the application process; however, we would like to state that submitting an application does not guarantee that you will be granted housing. Unfortunately, we do have a set of standards by which we evaluate applications and you did not qualify. Processing applications does have a cost and application fees are nonrefundable. We are sincerely sorry if this put a wrinkle in your plans and we wish you all the best in the future.

name: Boris Aleksandrovich
text: Do not come rent or even look at these apartments, they will lie to you, show you a decent looking apartment then give you a awful one infested with roaches and overwhelming with the smell of marijuana. Then when you pay rent, they will try there hardest to steal your money and if you accidently forget to put your apartment number on one of your payment stubs then they call it a late payment and will not look for the stub cause they have to many to look for your one if you don't have the number for that stub... They don't just look at the name on that stub and decipher that it goes to the same name of the person in the apartment with that name. So in final state, don't come here, find a trust worthy apartment that won't lie or steal your money.

resp.text: Hi Boris, thank you for the valuable feedback. We were disappointed to hear you have not had the 5-star experience we continuously strive for.  We have an active pest control service provided for our residents and would be happy to review and schedule a service appointment for you. Please give us a call to touch base with us about the rent and maintenance concerns so we can continue working to ensure it gets resolved. We look forward to improving your experience at The Park at Hoover. We look forward to speaking with you shortly.

name: angel pearson
text: Worst apartment complex. Don't bother renting here. They don't even bother to keep up general building maintenance and exterior cleaning( the buildings and walkways are hideously grimy and they make no effort to pressure wash or clean buildings). On top of this ill treatment is the fact that you may think you're getting a good deal with rent, but you're going to pay hundreds more in gas and power, even though the hot water only stays hot for about ten minutes. They've fired most of the maintenance, and are only concerned with getting people into these old apartments so that they can build more and run those down. Basically, this place is a project housing by another name.

name: Shaheen Virani
text: I moved in may 1st week! They fooled is showing pool and many things! I signed tge paper where i showed the work order that was needed to complete but it is sept and still the same! I call them and email tge everyday no answer! U go to office and sit hours they do not respond! Trash doesnt get picked up and  after begging them to be regular they finally started doing it! And we suffered all skin allergy because of flies around the trash! Not at all a good choice to stay here! Please do not sign up any lease! I want to leave apartment and they still want me to pay extra on what they need to compensate! We had a break in.. in our cars so apartments are not even safe!

resp.text: Hello, Shaheen. We're sorry that you've had trouble getting in contact with our team. We always aim to complete service requests as quickly as possible and we would love to learn more about the current issues you are experiencing. We will work towards improving our methods of communication moving forward and we hope to begin working towards improving your perception of home. At your convenience, please get in touch with a member of our team so we can get started on providing you with a five-star worthy experience. Thank you.

name: Matt Allbritton
text: I've been living here about a month and dig the place so far.  The location's fantastic-- just a couple blocks away from the Galleria-- and the apartments are roomy and quiet with a huge variety of different layouts.  The only real adjustment's been coming from a little 10-building complex to this one, which is about ten times the size; maintenance requests can sometimes take some following up to make sure they don't get lost in the shuffle.  It's kind of understandable, though, given the amount of work that has to go into maintaining this many units.  In any case, everyone's super polite, and they've been dedicated to resolving our issues once everything's set in motion, so patience pays off.  Definitely glad we moved here.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback.  We apologize for any delay in getting these items taken care of for you.  Please know we are working on addressing the issues you’re experiencing and welcome the opportunity to meet with you to make sure that we are doing everything we can so that you can be completely satisfied with your new apartment home.  I look forward to speaking with you.

Thank you

name: C R
text:
Apparently air is a luxury that is not included in the rent. I have been calling maintenance about my having no air which is listed by the apartment as a maintenance emergency. I have not gotten as much as a smoke signal let alone a call back a text or anything. No wonder everyone who moves here decides to move out.

Left a review a week ago. Still no air. Also have asked for a bathroom sink to be changed out for 1 year due to a flood. It now has mold and I will be contacting the health department and the news. I requested the maintenance supervisor to come out on several occasions to view the problems in the apartment I have yet to see his face. Spoke to the maintenance coordinator today a blonde whose office is located in the maintenance building and she had the nerve to have an attitude as if her air has been out since May. Do not move here this kind of unnecessary stress takes years off your life.

resp.text: Hi Cheryl. We would love to follow up with you regarding the issues raised in your July review of our community. Reach out to our office if you feel so inclined so our current on-site staff can learn more about what transpired. We're confident we can do a better job moving forward.

name: Holly Lewandowski
text: I have lived here for 10 months and have not went at least a week without getting the water cut off due to issues. It's ridiculous. I recommend this apartment complex to NOBODY!!!!! It is the worst. You call anyone "working" they have zero answers to any questions you may have. For the location and what I pay, OVERPRICED. This place flat out sucks.

resp.text: Hi Holly. We would love for the opportunity to follow up with you on the water and maintenance issues detailed in your June review. Please give us a call or visit our office. Our current staff is committed to bettering the experience at The Park at Hoover.

name: Justin truitt
text: It’s a wonderful place to live, quiet, and comfortable and easy to get the restaurant and the Galleria Mall...

resp.text: Thank you so much, Justin, for your kind words and this lovely review! We're happy to hear that you've found so many things to love about the Park at Hoover community. We hope we can continue giving you an amazing housing experience for some time to come.

name: Rayvon Murray
text: I have lived here for over a year, I love it here its very well kept up, they have some many event throughout the year for your family, year tenant appreciation , Easter egg hunt, birthday card via email an treat. Laura is my fav she rocks she alway very helpful and forever smiling.

resp.text: Aw, Rayvon, we're thrilled to hear that you're enjoying your experience here at The Park at Hoover! Our team strives to provide the highest quality of service to our residents from all of our fun events to keeping our community looking impeccable, so we're so happy to hear that you've noticed! Thank you for being such a wonderful resident. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to continue providing you with this excellent service. Thanks!

name: Linh Kien
text: Don't live here! However, if you have to, or if you're currently staying here make documents proof when you make in and out. All my paperworks was electronic documents and I didn't get a check off list for moving in inspection. Which should've been informs by the leasing staff but not! When I did the walk through I automatically notice a big carpet stain but the staff told me they don't replace the entire unit's carpet because of "a small stain". The carpet wasn't new either. I assumed that they had already note the damage when the previous tenant moved out. (Stupid of me) The day I moved out. I asked the office staffs (multiple times) is there anything I need to do prior to my moving out date. I was told just return my keys and and prorated rent. Two weeks later I received a statement for carpet damage. I tried to contact the manger multiple times but no response. Next thing I know I received  a letter from rent collector. The manger kept annoying my calls then the entire leasing office won't pickup my calls. I got screw over big time for not documenting my move in.

name: I'm Flawless Ministries
text: I have been here a year and the property management changes every 3 months... my garbage disposal has fallen and they have yet to fix it. It was leaking before that and they didn't fix that either... the water bill is crazy high. I love the area and the community but the property management is HORRIBLE

resp.text: Our team is working diligently to improve the experience here at The Park at Hoover. Feel free to follow up with our office if there are outstanding maintenance concerns you would like for us to address. We appreciate your feedback and are learning from your experiences to better our community.

name: Josh Smith
text:
I can't speak poorly enough to my experience at Magnolia Glen. It took me more than a month dealing with the office staff to even lease an apartment, because they will not return your calls, and most of the time won't even answer the phone. The inside of my apartment was clean because the person who had moved out that day had cleaned it (thank the Lord), but everywhere outside is a mess. Spiderwebs everywhere, flickering lights, shrubs growing through the fence of my porch. And they won't answer the phone for me to schedule maintenance! 2 weeks into my stay my car was broken into, which is no surprise. The parking lot is very dimly lit, and there is no security provided by the complex.

MY FIRST NIGHT IN MY APARTMENT I WOKE UP TO A SCORPION IN MY BED. DO YOU NEED ANOTHER REASON TO GO SOMEWHERE ELSE?

Water for my 1 bedroom is $60+ per month, and you have a different window to pay rent every month. Looking to trap you in some $100 fees!

Stay anywhere else, even if it means renting a hotel room for 6 months.

name: Ahmad Alnaimi
text:
I wouldn't give them the one star even,
They're so unprofessional they don't know how to manage anything they might respond to your email or to your complaint after six months unless if it was emergency they could response within 3 months, also so many problems shooting and rude staff, also the rent not including the water which you not going to be equally charged for.
Bad idea if you're looking for an Apparments dont even think about it .

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Ahmad. Our team makes a point to resolve resident issues in a prompt and timely manner. As such, please do not hesitate to voice your concerns to our office in person or over the phone to resolve any outstanding issues. We're here to ensure that our community remains a great place to live. We look forward to speaking with you in the future.

name: Katelyn Connell
text:
Whatever you do, DO NOT MOVE HERE. I moved here initially on a seven month lease, and had heard the horror stories, but thought the low rent prices would make it worth my while. DEAD WRONG. The first apartment was a nice size, but the walls were gross and the carpet was terribly stained and wreaked of smoke and cat urine. "No big deal", I thought, "you get what you pay for." After moving in, I realized that the dryer vents were clogged with lent, which is a fire hazard. I told maintenance and no one ever came out to clear the dryer vent. Since it was just a seven month lease, I didn't worry too much, hoping that it wouldn't catch fire in that short time.

When the lease was up, I decided to move to a cheaper apartment in the complex that wouldn't potentially catch fire when I tried to do my laundry. At this time, the complex was being overtaken by the THIRD management company of my short time there and prices were again changing. The leasing manager showed me an apartment and gave me a good moving price and told me he would change the carpets and put in new appliances just for me. All new everything for a good deal? Ok sure. Two months went by, and the last day of my lease was coming up and the leasing manager still had not shown me the actual apartment I was scheduled to move in to.

Fast forward to 7:00 PM the NIGHT AFTER I should be moving in and a leasing consultant is showing me the apartment while a contractor is still measuring and laying down carpet. With nowhere else to go, I was forced to sign the lease without the apartment being finished.

I could list all the problems that the apartment still has that I have put in numerous requests for maintenance to repair, but I'd be typing all night. The apartment is essentially unlivable. The leasing manager knows the issues this place has, and when I walked into the office after trying to contact him for several days to see if he would handle it, HE SAW ME, LEFT HIS OFFICE, TOLD ME SOMEONE ELSE WOULD HELP ME, AND LEFT THE BUILDING. Please do yourself a favor and pay the extra $40 a month to GO ANYWHERE ELSE.

name: Kathryn Ladnier
text: Our apartment is infested with roaches, we had to beg maintenance to come fix our one and only toilet and they never did. It constantly smells of weed and no one answers the phone when you call the office. Poor customer service. Do not live here.

resp.text: Hi Kathryn, we apologize for any inconvenience you’ve experienced regarding pests in your home. We have an active pest control service and would be happy to address your concerns. We will have someone reach out to you today to inquire about the details. We are committed to improving your experience at The Park at Hoover and value you as a resident. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Seth Eden
text: They have more cockroaches and bed bugs than drywall and carpet! I've been moving all of my cloths, bedding, food and kitchen food-prep items out of my unit every day, then back in for the evening so that each day I can spray with bug bombs and try to kill some of these bugs! Even with all that work I still see bed bugs and cockroaches daily! Their populations recover from the bug bomb in less than 12 hours! The back of my neck looks like hamburger from all the bug bites! I just got a new fresh bite on my finger that is swelling up, and that was after I started using the bug bombs daily! I have to cover my body in Icy-Hot every night because it's the only thing the bed bugs don't like the smell of, and even that isn't full proof! This apartment complex is so over priced considering the condition its in. The office NEVER answers the phone! I called them over 50 times one day just to see what it would take to get them to pick up  the phone, eventually they started picking it up and hanging up immediately without saying anything! Maintenance staff can be hit and miss. The drains clog up all the time, and the landscaping doesn't exist! Basically just mounds of dirt every place! All the trees have roots sticking up out of the ground and the sidewalks are covered in trash! The way they trim their trees is like they want the trees to die and grow in ugly ways! It's disgusting! Call it a tree torture chamber! I have called the Alabama Department of Public Health and informed them of the cockroach and bed bug infestation! We will see what they do about it! I feel like I'm living in a carapace and it smells like one too! I have to leave the fan running with the door open all evening to just get some fresh air into this place so I can breath at night, even with that I still need to put Icy-Hot under my nose to mask the smell! It might be cleaner living in a White Castle dumpster! Probably smell better too!

name: Concerned Resident
text:
If you are a fan of taking a chance of burning to a crisp in an apartment fire, this place is for you. On November 25, 2015, the building next to mine caught on fire. I considered moving then, but I thought, “Nah, what are the chances of this happening again?” Silly me.

On January 27th, 2018, the building I was living in caught on fire, jeopardizing the structure of the building, destroying several units, and causing smoke damage to multiple other units. All of the residents were displaced. Below is my best recollection of the events as I remember them from that day and after.

After the fire, they herded all of the displaced residents down into the main office where they did have some food for us. But, while all of us fire victims sat there stunned, it appeared the leasing staff was still renting apartments out to new residents. I think the appropriate thing to do would have been to cease all leasing operations for that day and attend to the residents that just lost their homes. But, I guess they thought it was cool since they bought us some pizza, chocolate, and chicken strips to chow down on while we all tried to start piecing our lives back together. How generous and courteous of them!

They also brought in a third party restoration company that lined us up and made us sign paperwork because they said they were in charge of securing the building, and they needed our signatures. They were vague about what else they did. A few days later, I found out what they really do is clean and restore items damaged by smoke and fire. I was given an example of how much it was to restore a single couch. The answer: $3000. How do you pay for this? They’ll do it all by billing your insurance company directly to get the payout from your renters policy. Vultures. I didn't accept their services. And, if their initial responsibility was to secure the building, they did a really crappy job of it, because thieves broke into the damaged apartments a couple weeks later. Is this the type of company that The Park at Hoover aligns themselves with? Looks like it!

The Park at Hoover was very insistent on quickly finding a new apartment in their complex for me. They said it was because they cared. They said I had to make a decision fast because everyone in our building had already signed leases, and they were running out of units. But, all of the fire victims had shared our phone numbers with each other. None we talked to had signed a lease or were planning on living there. It seems the only things they really “cared” about was not losing a tenant, even if it meant lying to us to achieve that. How compassionate of them to “care” so much!

Once I decided to move from this place, The Park at Hoover called me multiple times saying they wanted their keys to the unit back. A unit that can’t be lived in because the building caught on fire. A unit where the lock was broken because thieves had kicked the door in. Absurdity!

Along with the danger of possibly being toasted like a marshmallow for a s’more, here are some other things you can look expect if you dare to live here:
- Heat? Nah. Who needs that? Apparently not me since my heater was broken for two years before they fixed it.

- Indoor floods? You got it! When the temperature outside was below freezing, the pipes to the sprinkler system would burst, and the outdoor corridor would flood along with the apartment. Buy some galoshes. You’ll need them.

- Mold? You betcha! And, if you tell them about it, their solution is to paint over it. I guess their policy is “out of sight, out of mind.”

- Constant, random disruptions in water services? Yep! Expect that at least once or twice a month. Hope you didn’t have a shower planned.

- Mountains of garbage? In the words of the Kool-Aid man: OH, YEAH! The garbage dumpster is constantly overflowing (sometimes into the street), and will sit like that for days, and on occasion, weeks. Oh, and the dumpster caught on fire once too. I know because I was the one that called for help.

In conclusion, don’t live here. K, bye.

resp.text:
Dear Concerned Resident,

It is heart-breaking when a disaster occurs and displaces families from their homes. This particular situation was unforeseeable and was not due to any building deficiencies are not instances that are taken lightly by our team. Our relief efforts were fully geared toward taking care of the displaced residents as well and as quickly as possible. Being displaced from your home is stressful and finding a new home for these residents was a top priority to ensure they were in a home that best suited their needs and as quickly as possible.To assist in our relief efforts we enlisted assistance from two nonprofit disaster relief organizations to ensure that everyone had their needs met.

Some of the concerns listed in this review do not seem to be recent occurrences, but we apologize for anything that may have occurred under a prior management company or during our transition. Our aim is to improve the community, elevate our residents’ experience and continually seek to improve customer service. We hate that your experience ended on a poor note and can assure you we have made great strides in improvements including a community clean up initiative as well as a renovated fitness center.

-The Park at Hoover Team

name: Nick Waddell
text: Worst apartment complex ever. Water was shut off twice a month on average. Sometimes it would be shutoff multiple days in a row without warning. Took the maintenance 6 months to fix a leaking ceiling which ended up ruining our carpet. Not only that but the maintenance never came and fixed our toilet. Even worse the walls in this complex are paper thin and the management has leaf blowers lawn mowers etc going at 7am when majority of people are sleeping. To top off this terrible experience. The management had a new layer of tar put in the complex parking lot... all this did was get tar all over our shoes and socks which lead to tar in the carpet. Don't move here... trust me. There are wayyyy better places. I forgot to mention the shootings that happened multiple times while living here... waking up to gunshots at night is not my ideal living space. Once again don't move here!

name: Chelsey Jones
text: Parking is ATROCIOUS. Be prepared to park 4 buildings away from your building. However, they try. It is obvious they are understaffed. They have done a lot of renovations.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you have experienced some degree of difficulty finding parking. We wanted to reassure you the parking areas are maximized to benefit our residents and their guests. Additionally, we have a company actively monitoring these areas for any vehicles that may need to be removed due to parking violations. If you feel as though there are cars parked in area they should not be, we would be happy to assist you with this. We are ecstatic you are enjoying our Community Improvement Projects as much as we are. We love seeing the progress and seeing the enjoyment from our residents., We appreciate your feedback and if you know of any way we could improve your experience, please do not hesitate to stop by the office for a chat.

name: Christian Murry
text: I absolutely hate this apartment complex! It is the worst place I have ever lived. I live on the top level and there are always bugs coming from the ceiling. Also, I have not been able to turn on my shower without using a pair of scissors since March, and the office keeps hounding me about $45 that they can't even figure out why I owe them.... But you can't fix my shower though?! I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy to live here!! I'm trying to find a way to get out of my lease.

resp.text: Hi Christian – We apologize for your inconvenience with your outstanding issues. We will be sending someone immediately to make the needed repairs. We also offer pest control and will add you to the list for this week to correct the pest problem you seem to be having. We would love to sit with you to review your ledger and find out exactly why there is a $45 charge on your account. If there is something that is billed in error, we will happily remove it. The Park at Hoover values you as a resident and we hope you continue to call this your home. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: bookgeek9419
text: Don't move here. Neighborhood is nice enough and it's convenient to everything but maintenance sucks. I've been here for about a month and my air has yet to be fixed..I'm sure you can imagine the pain I feel with this Alabama heat with no air conditioning. It's miserable. I will not be living here after the lease ends. This is ridiculous.

name: Minda Means
text: There is a constant staff turnover at this apartment complex!  When my husband and I moved out of Landmark, the manager did a walk through with us and notated that the apartment was in good condition, and we thought we would have no problem getting our deposit refunded; however, we have been having the most difficult time getting a refund on our deposit because the current staff is mostly new and the financial records are all in disarray.  None of the staff return phone calls and it's been pass 35 days since we have moved and this is beyond the legal time limit for them to return a deposit.  I am still working on getting our refund and it seems I will have to take legal action real soon.  The managment staff is very inept and I suggest to anyone to beware of renting with Landmark at Magnolia Glen!!

name: Justin McClendon
text: I haven't even moved in yet and I'm giving this a one star. Too bad I've already signed the lease. We got a move in date when the apartment wasn't even finished, and they would not take off any of our rent. They told me to come in at 2 to check out the apartment, get there at two and there's a huge meeting with a sign saying "be back at 3:30." I had my family with me and a car full of stuff I had to unload and get to work. I walked around back of the office were all the employees were having a meeting. I knocked on the door and everybody just stared at me, and one girl even threw up her arms like I was in the wrong. Terrible way of doing business, and these were all the higher up people in this meeting! I was told to come in the next day to get my keys and now no response to emails or phone calls. I hope this year goes by fast....

name: Tasha S.
text: These people are unprofessional liars. I was approved to move in and given a date as well as all the welcome to the community information. However, due to circumstances beyond my control the move-in date needed to be pushed back from the originally date of August 4th. Despite numerous calls and emails no one bothered to let me know what was going on until yesterday I spoke to someone named Erica who told me my move-in date was scheduled for August 8th, which I knew was a lie (Who moves in on a Wednesday?) Today, however, Laura calls with another bogus lie saying I owed $1,000 to a sister property somewhere I never even lived before and after I corrected her with the correct property she goes “oh yea, that’s the one.” I actually went to the sister property I did live at and surprise, surprise I have a $0 balance. Furthermore, if this balance actually existed I’m sure it would have been caught before you guys sent a welcome letter giving me an apartment number, address, and paperwork to set up utilities. I’m glad I dodged a bullet because these reviews are terrible and I can believe every single one based on how the staff handles things. I knew this place was bogus when they told me I could only see the apartment and pick up the keys on August 3rd, the day before I was scheduled to move in. Even the leasing agent at The Park at Buckingham laughed when I mentioned this property by name, LOL. Do yourself a favor and take the money for your application fee elsewhere and avoid Laura, Anna (the assistant leasing manager), and whoever Erica is.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We do apologize if there was any confusion during the application process. The information provided by the apartment community where you resided previously did state that there is/was an unpaid balance on your account. If this is something that you feel is inaccurate we would be happy to ask the other community to review their records again; likewise, if you have a receipt documenting that you paid your balance, we would be happy to reconsider your application. I can assure you we handle current and incoming residents with the utmost care and customer service. We would be happy to review the details with you at your earliest convenience and look forward to speaking with you soon.

name: Kimberly Adams
text: I simply gave everything a one because they don't deserve anything higher. Sure maybe it's an okay area, but management and  maintenance sucks! I did a review on their site, but I guess it was so harsh they decided not to post it. It all started when we first moved from Nashville to move in here. When we got here, the apartment wasn't ready (the apartment was HORRIBLE). We only signed the contract because my boyfriend started work the next day and we didn't have time to apply else where. The manager (David) didn't even find fault with the fact that the apartment wasn't ready. They finally agreed to reimburse us for a hotel while they get the apartment ready (I suggested this great idea). We still agreed after they said the will fix everything after we moved in. Moved in Feb 16' and they didn't fix anything until June 16'. Some things still haven't been fixed. Dishwasher broke November 25th. Put in a work order 3 times. Here it Jan 17' and no one still have came to fix it even after it leaked all over the floor. I left serval of voicemails. They updated their website I had trouble paying online. I contacted them about it, do you think anyone tried to reach out to me (NO!). So my last complaint. I went in December to give my notice to move out. Received a letter January 25 saying the 60 day notice need to be signed. I explained to staff that I wasn't told that I had to sign anything. At that moment my word wasn't enough. I understand the rules and legals but I feel that I should have been told that in December. Please don't lease from them. Look elsewhere.

name: Becca Parsons
text:
This is truly the worst place I have ever lived. They showed me a beautiful apt. I was given a beat up , run down location. The amount I agreed to pay was increased without my consent. I was moving for work, all of my stuff in a UHAUL. What could I do?
Their maintenance staff is ridiculously slow. They've put VACANT signs in my mail box twice making it impossible to receive my mail. They have sent back my packages & never told me I had them.
