I have left multiple messages with the office in the past & it takes forever to get a response. I have multiple doctor bills for headaches & have just learned my gas is hooked up incorrectly & that could be the potential reason for such. I have lived here 6 months & still have a missing burner for my stove. The turnover in this office makes it difficult to follow up on anything & easy for them to Pass The Buck every time anyone complains. I moved here for work reasons. It was supposed to be an improvement in life. I can't wait until I can afford to  move again.

name: Bill Middleton
text: Just read about the 23 year old drug dealer that was shot and killed on Sunday at this apartment complex by a 14 year old. And the 23 year old was just getting his life back together after getting out of prison.

resp.text: This was a tragic isolated event which unfortunately occurred at our community. Though we are not able to guarantee safety as incidents can occur anywhere at any time, we always want to make sure our residents are informed. This is why we promptly sent out a message to the residents including tips for safety precautions and reminded them of our Courtesy Officer 24/7 phone line available for them. Our Courtesy Officers are a part of the Hoover Police Department and patrol our community actively. This event was devastating to our community and the families involved and we express our deepest sympathies.

name: Laura Lucas
text: In the TWO years I have lived here I have seen it go downhill.  I cannot even get in touch with the office OR maintenance.  My dishwasher has been broken for 2 months, leaking water and they don't even care, even after submitting 5 requests.  I am trying to move ASAP!!!!!  I am at work before they open, and they are closed before I get home at night.  Maybe they need to WORK harder to provide their residents with the things they are required in their lease to provide!!!!!!!!!!!!  But alas, they will never see this and it won't make a difference.  If you have a choice, DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: B L
text: If I could give less than one star, I would. The maintenance people  sit on their butts all day long and don't help until you call and complain 6 times. Oh and you know what's so fun about living here? You never know when your water will be turned off for no reason and without warning even though you have paid your water bill. There are multiple  pot holes that are big enough to swim in. Speaking of swimming, if you like to swim in the summer...don't move here. Out of the multiple  pools one gets opened each summer and it's nasty as can be. I wouldn't wish this place on my worst enemy

name: Chadwick Wilson
text:
This is a tale of sorrow, nonsense, and frustration. I'm convinced this place is a real life depiction of Dante's "Inferno."

To begin, the maintenance is horrible. My heater has been broken for a year. There are leaks in our ceiling. They said they'd come fix it all. They never did. Maybe they don't know how to repair anything because they spent too much time in training learning how imitate a game of Mario Kart by driving their little golf carts in circles around the complex all day. Maybe one day I'll see one slip on a turtle shell or banana peel. That would make me giggle.

Getting answers about concerns from the staff is like playing a game of 20 questions. Except, your questions are asked in vain because the staff have no solutions. They seem to only be trained on how to shrug their shoulders, give excuses, apologize profusely, give more excuses, and then go on their breaks.

Lastly, It's alarming that this place has been owned separately by three different companies within the past 6 months. It's like the companies buying this place got duped by the same brochure that all the residents did.

name: Thomas Atchley
text: Unfortunately, I agree with most of the negative comments.  Lots of bugs, poor maintenance, poor trash pickup,  multiple water service interruptions, even though they charge you plenty for those services.  staff doesn't answer the phone, sketchy bait and switch leasing policy, won't let you see your apartment before you lease, only the model, which of course is perfect, unlike your apartment.  Polite until they get you on the dotted line, then they don't want to hear from you, especially if you have an issue, but let your car sit in the same spot for two weeks, and you will come home to a towing sticker on it.  Just raised my rent, only reason I renewed is because I dislike moving even more than I dislike my apartment.  Only thing they had going for them was paying the rent online so I didn't have to deal with the office at the end of every month, but now they have changed management companies, again, so thats gone. The owner, really needs to cut the fat out of the staff and hire fewer, better employees.  They got just a couple of folks working their tail off doing all the work while the rest sit on their ass.  Same with maintenance, ride around on the golf cart all day screwing around instead of working.  Racing carts through the parking lot,  just craziness, very unprofessional.  After years in the Navy, I've lived in some shitholes, and had some seriously shady landlords and property managers,  and this isn't the worst dump I've lived in, but it's nowhere near as nice as the websites make it out to look, it's the epitome of bait and switch, and the management, well, there is no management. There is only rent collection.  I chose this complex strictly based on price, but now they have raised it.  Also, we get these notes on the door, water will be shut off, or whatever, and some of them are beyond rude, and in fact, some are over the line threatening.  They are painting, but it takes more than paint to make a complex work.  You can put lipstick on a pig, but  she ain't gonna make the chorus line, if you know what I mean. Basically the level of incompetence with the management is unbelievable, but there it is. I have to wonder if they ever question why their turnover rate is so high.

name: Christy Howell
text:
I had a great experience with The Park @ Hoover. Our leasing agent Steven was very helpful and kept us updated through the whole process. We came in on a Saturday and toured, signed and got the keys all in the same day. I love how my apartment has the wood plank look in the kitchen and the bathroom. All the staff was friendly and the property was clean. We were told they just got taken over by another company and they were local which I believe will make a difference in how the complex is maintained. We just left an apartment complex we were in for ten years and it was absolutely awful.
There is always going to be something people don't like about an apartment they are renting because some people are harder to please than others. People should try to resolve things before just posting bad reviews.

name: LISA MARDIS
text: Hi, did not know how to rate as I am new to all this. I would like to know if you accept Shelter plus care housing vouchers.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out to us. We are not currently aware of this community accepting shelter plus housing. You are welcome to reach out to the community directly at 205-985-7463.

name: Timesheets Timesheets
text: My family and I moved here almost a year ago, I have a 2 year old and was pregnant at the moment when we moved, almost 2 months after we moved there was a shooting between drug dealers pretty close to my daughter!!! Our drug dealer neighbor got shoot,  like 10 cops came to the scene and I'm not sure if they arrested anybody. Our drug dealer neighbor thank God left the apt. complex , but the news didn't even reported this incident.  VERY UNSAFE PLACE... not to mention the maintenance is obviously short staffed, our AC unit is still not fixed after my husband has requested like 30 times... and I'm not exaggerating. I have a new born besides my 2 year old and this place is horrible hot and its not summer yet!!! DO NOT MOVE HERE IF YOU APPRECIATE PEACE OF MIND.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. While we are unable to guarantee safety, we do have courtesy officers who are active policeman patrolling the property after hours. They are available for you by calling the office line and selecting  four if an issue ever arises after hours. During office hours we would love to take your call or email regarding any concerns you may have. We have a dedicated Resident Services Center available for you to assist in your maintenance requests or concerns. I am sorry to hear you are having a continues maintenance concerns and I would love to resolve this for you. I am unable to see your name attached, but would like to set up time to discuss your concerns. Please give the office a call at 205-985-7463 or the Resident Services Center at 205-721-8935.

name: JaCoria Smith
text: I DONT recommend ANYONE to live her not even an homeless person! My water is off without even notifying me, because of a pipe burst that wasn't my fault! The pests are out of control I just moved here 2 days ago and already want to leave! This place is horrible and on top of that they're big LIARS! If you're considering here DONT COME! This place really sucks I wish I could contact the manager because he really needs to shut this place completely DOWN!

name: Katrina Williams
text: Overpriced and underserviced apartment complex. Poorly maintained. Trash everywhere. Unprofessional office staff. Maintenance NEVER shows up; if you submit a request they mark it completed without ever having done anything. DO NOT RENT HERE!

name: Cherry Hutcherson
text: These apartments are horrible I wouldn't advise anyone to live here. Roach infested, bad customer service we have had the worse experience. I hate my daughter got stuck in this. They need more mature experience people working there.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback. Please do not hesitate to reach out to our office to share your concerns regarding pests and our manner of customer service. Our current on-site team is working to improve the experience here at The Park at Hoover and we would love to resolve these issues thoroughly.

name: kburdges
text: The apartment itself is not a bad apartment, however I do have some issues. I moved in on June 21st, and even after they had seven days to get the apartment ready, maintenance didn’t start putting down the vinyl flooring until the day of move in. Needless to say, the move in was delayed until 4:30 pm that day and it put us way behind in regards to moving. On top of that, the walls were dirty and needed touching up due to the flooring being put in that day and we were told that maintenance would come back the next day and touch up the walls. Four days have gone by and have not heard a word from management or maintenance in regards to the walls or anything that needs to be fixed in our apartment. The “walk through” has yet to be completed and now every time I cal I get their voicemail. For some reason I have to physically walk up there for them to call maintenance and see what the hold up is. The maintenance communication with management is complete and utter trash, not to mention the communication to the residents. You would think that since I am a new resident that I would be priority, but I feel completely ignored and don’t understand why I have to go out of my way to still get nothing accomplished.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that your time in the community is off to a rocky start. We understand your frustration. The flooring was complete prior to your arrival, however, we noticed areas the vendor needed to correct and asked them back to the property. Unfortunately, they were unable to keep their timeline as promised and we continued to work diligently on this as we understood your need to move-in that day.  We try to handle work orders and maintenance request in a timely fashion, especially when welcoming residents to the community, and it is unfortunate that you have somehow managed to fall through the cracks.  We look forward to resolving these concerns for you quickly and improving your experience to our desired 5-star performance. Please do not hesitate to contact the office with any further feedback or items you may need us to address for you. We are always happy to assist.

name: Move over Im A Dodge
text: Worst place to live ever!!!! Johnnie lee Early, will lie to about the whole 9yards  just to get your money. You will have roaches crawling all over you as you sleep, and black mold forming. Run far far away! Your nights will be filled with headaches and distant gunshots.

resp.text: Legacy Ali, we are dismayed to hear about your negative perception of our community. Our maintenance team works hard to complete all maintenance request forms in a timely manner. If you are having pest problems or any other maintenance concerns, please give us a call or visit us in the office immediately so we may work you with you on resolving it as soon as possible. We look forward to speaking with you soon. Thank you.

name: Ashley White
text: Worst place to live.  The leasing office people lie incredibly to much never do what they say they are going to do. My water is off with no warning and i have to go to work.  Just neglectful.  Word of advice dont live here

resp.text: Our team is working to follow up on past concerns so as to ensure our community remains a great place to live. Give us a call or visit our office if you wish to follow up with us on your May review. We’d love to hear how we can improve moving forward.

name: Jane Doe
text: I lived there from January 2015-January 2017. The unit was not ready on my move-in date (despite this date being on a signed document produced by the company) and I had to make last minute arrangements to stay with a friend for two days while they finished getting the unit ready. During the two years I lived there the complex changed hands twice and I had to deal with three different companies and their policies. For a while you could pay rent online, which was nice, but that would go away for several months at a time when the complex changed hands and you'd have to use money orders. During the Fall of 2016 the major water issues started and the complex would randomly do an "emergency shutoff" several times per month. I was charged a flat rate of around $120/month for water (I lived in a one bedroom apartment alone - my previous bill was $30) and I was never compensated for my days without water. Occasionally we'd get a paper flyer warning us of the impending water loss -like over Thanksgiving weekend - but it was usually a surprise that would make you show up dirty or late for work (after showering at the gym or at a friend's house). It was really embarrassing for your boss and coworkers to think you didn't pay your water bill. Other than that I had a solid year and a half of roaches as well as hardware and plumbing issues that submitting work orders did nothing for (it's a placebo system, I'm guessing, as no one ever came to fix anything). The roach cure was long term use of Boric acid around the baseboards and behind all the appliances as well as buying a seal for the front door. They are all over the walkways outside at night so they just come in through any small opening if they're not already inside. I also was told there were four pools there - I could only ever find two that ever had water in them. The front pool is 100% to lure in customers but was locked for all of 2015 and no one was allowed to use it. The back pool was green and also locked but was patrolled less so you could sort of use it. Upsides were that I felt like I got a lot of square footage for my money ($600 for a spacious one bed/one bath with balcony) and they repainted the whole complex in December 2016. (Not so funny sidestory-when they repainted there was no warning or schedule so one day I was late to work because there was a tarp over my car and the workers wouldn't let me remove it while they spray painted the side of the building. Another morning I awoke to a man on the inside of my balcony and I had to scramble to get dressed in front of him and it was terrible.) Moving out was a huge relief and I wouldn't want anyone to have to repeat my experience.

name: Kayla Vo
text: This place gets a one star, simply because I have had a rood over my head for 10 months and nothing more. The water is turned off at least twice a month and has ruined many plans and set me back on my work schedule multiple times. There is always an excuse and it's never their fault. When we moved in we literally had to repaint our tubs because whoever did prior, used the wrong paint and our shower curtains would stick to the tub. We haven't had a working ice machine the entire 10 months and have put in multiple requests to have it looked at. We pay monthly for pest control and have had them come out once in 10 months so we spray ourselves. The list goes on and on but I have to call a friend now to see if I can use their shower again so I'm not late to work. WORST LIVING EXPERIENCE EVER! DO NOT RENT HERE!

name: Lisa Dunbar
text: This is the WORST place I have ever lived! Slow maintenance, unprofessional office staff, Staff will tell you right out LIES! $90.00+ Water bill was total shock and surprise (think that should be communicated at lease signing!!) Garbage in the middle of the streets throughout complex. Trash compactor is ALWAYS full, even though we the tenants pay a monthly fee. I could go on and on. I WILL NOT be renewing my lease here. Fool me once, shame on you, Fool me twice, shame on ME!!!

name: Roderick Edwards
text: I have been living in the community since February and I am not impressed at all with my experience there. There is always trash in the parking lot. The trash compactor has more trash on the ground instead of in the actual bin. The leasing consultants are not professional and they will never return your calls even if you leave a thousand messages. Maintenance never completes any work orders, and their excuse is they never received any work order. I have submitted work orders online, on the phone, and in person in the rent office and no one has came to complete a work order to this date. I moved in on February 27th, and they said they had to fix a leak in one of the sinks in the bathroom. As of April 30th, I still have dirty pipes sitting on the floor that have yet to be connected to my sink. The breezeway is always trashy. When you talk to the people in the office about your many concerns, they say they don't have time to address the small problems. Overall horrible experience!!! When you request to speak to a manager, they say they will deliver the message to them. I have yet to talk to anyone about my many concerns. I will not be renewing my lease and I definitely would not recommend this property to anyone!!! Stay away!!!

name: DAISY MWANGI
text: I lived there for 8 years and it was not the worst I have seen.

name: Joseph Baker
text:
We had an appointment with Danielle Zinnerman today. We change our schedule and drive across town to see these apartments. We were greeted by a sign on the door that states the were in a staff meeting and would be free at 930.

This was at 10 am and they were still in that meeting. We have at 10:08 and left.

Pitiful business.

name: Marissa Kendrick
text: They have fantastic customer service

resp.text: Thank you so much for saying so, Marissa! At The Park at Hoover, we pride ourselves on dishing out service with a smile at every opportunity and we are so happy to know that this has been reflected in your experience. We hope we can continue to exceed your expectations and will be available if you are ever in need of some more quality service.

name: Alejandra Blankenship
text: Man if I could give this place a zero stars I totally would. My lease ended in Dec of this year so thank goodness I left . But if you are looking for a new place to live in hoover this isn't the place to choose. When I first  moved in the everything was fine but the staff was always so rude I can tell they were irritated anytime I would call to ask any questions. Which that should have thrown a red flag anyways but I had to move fast so I signed a lease quick before  even doing my research on this place. When I say these ppl are rude and they don't do what you ask them to do they literally are. The maintenance people take forever literally.. there is mold all under the sinks in bathrooms and in kitchen.. I brought that up and no one came but when I moved out the ppl they moved in after me told me that they spray painted on top of the mold. These people are a joke and someone needs to call the health department on them. On top of that they care nothing about the residents they approve to live in there apt complex.. bc its clear that they just approve anyone. People are nasty loud and my car got stolen at this apt complex .. But to top it off the last 3 months of me living here, I have no idea where all these roaches came from. Im OCD I clean constantly ... they came out of nowhere like a whole family of them. & I kid you not I am not even exaggerating a family of them knocked down one of my pics on my wall. It was so disgusting. I notified the office and all they said they were going to send someone to spray my apt. which literally made everything worse. I talked to neighbors and everyone around I noticed had roach bombs so they said they were having the same issue. No one has any clue where these things came from its just so disgusting.. long story short if I wasn't so broke I would have broke my lease and left . But I couldn't b/c I just didn't have that kind of money to break it. So glad im gone and the new apt im in is also in hoover and its a complete upgrade.. BEWARE OF THE PARK AT HOOVER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! horrible

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We care deeply about providing our residents with a rewarding experience and are happy you’ve taken the time to provide us with your feedback. Our maintenance team strives to fulfill work orders in a timely and thorough manner. We apologize this has not been your experience. We have made improvements and adjustments with the pest control services and are pleased with the positive feedback and results seen. We are always striving to make improvements to elevate our residents' experiences and appreciate your input. We wish you all the best with your future endeavors.

name: Shelly Drake-Slaughter
text: I've lived at The Park at Hoover since May 2016, we've had some good experiences and some very bad experiences. The good are the managing staff are friendly, and have never been rude in any encounter.  As far as the bad. They are understaffed as far as the maintenence team to accommodate the extremely large number of units. Also they have constant water maintenence that have your water cut off if not all day the majority of the day. I am currently writing this review with no water. This go around we didn't receive an email alerting us that there would be an interruption in the water system. We pay extremely to much to be inconvenienced this many times. HIGHLY DISSATISFIED with THE PARK AT HOOVER.

name: Daniel Lowery
text: This is the worst complex in history.  I could write a list of all the issues I've had here, but you'd be reading for an hour.  I don't want to waste your time asking you to read what all is wrong with this complex, and I don't want you to waste your time even considering moving here.  I would give it less than one star if I could.

Pitiful business.

text:
Horrible services ...Not renewing my lease.. The manager is not handling any services call and customers complaints. Since I moved in the apartment was dirty, carpet dirty, blinds broke and someone else silverware in the kitchen draw. Air conditioner unit leaking and causing issues with my water heater. This also increased my power bill..Bad experience
Don't recommend

resp.text: We value your residency and want to ensure your needs are handled in a timely and efficient manner.  Please stop by the office at your convenience to meet me and discuss any issues you are having in your new home.

name: Chris Davis
text:
Terrible, will be moving.  I am not paying this kind of money to be treated the way they treat residents.  They turn the water off, multiple times a month, then disconnect thier phones so you can't contact them or get information.  If you go to the office to try to get an answer, the office staff will just tell you to be quiet and there is nothing you can do.  Rude and incompetant are two words that come to mind, with regards to thier staff.

Lastly, notice the preponderance of 1 star reviews, and then understand that the very VERY few positive reviews are likely bought and paid for, or employees trying to improve the rating.  This place needs to be broken up into several properties so they can be managed properly.

Will repeat, DO.  NOT.  MOVE.  HERE.

name: Treyson Burder
text: The pictures don't do justice i have already been transfers once because of mold and now this is in the second apartment this place wants to raise my rent 50 dollars more are you kidding i have mold blowing out of the vents  and for the park of hoover don't reply with your fake lies  about how you care and your going to fix it because guess what you won't took yall 6 months to change a light bulb out side my door don't even deserve a star

name: Laura Morales
text: Worst place to live ever! Days with out a drop of water, days with no working AC. Apt full of mold, I was given a used carpet and got flooded twice. The carpet got more damage than what it was and they never did anything about it. I would post pictures of everything if I could. The staff is sooo mean. Except for Mr. Pride. Just don’t waist your money here.

resp.text: Hi Laura. Thank you for taking the time to send us your feedback regarding your carpets and home. We try to fulfill all maintenance requests in a timely and efficient manner, regardless of high volume. We’re sorry this was not your experience. We would appreciate the chance to resolve your concerns and improve your stay with us as soon as possible. Please visit us in the office at your earliest convenience so that we can work on your maintenance concerns. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: Tony G
text: Horrible apts, horrible staff, maintenance office is full of liars that misinform you, mislead you, and forget about you. maintenance response is a month delay when they do show up they will only come look say they are goin to.get tools and never come back. Ive had tht happen 5 times in the 2 months I've been and the stuff still isnt fixed. the manager whitney tells you whatever just to get you off the phone. Pest control are imbecils. apts and breezeways are infested with fleas and no matter how much you call they dnt care to fix it. Do not bring your kids here. Took a month for a mailbox key, still haven't received trash can since I moved in 2 months ago but you have to pay for trash pick up even tho they dnt pick up your trash. Water is off at least once a week with no warning.. DO NOT MOVE HERE!!!

resp.text: Hi Tony. We are working to better the experience here at The Park at Hoover and wanted to follow up on your review. Please give us a call or visit our office so we can address maintenance and pest issues alongside any lingering concerns here at The Park at Hoover. Our current team is committed to resolving prior issues here at our community and we appreciate your feedback.

name: Daniel Lowery
text: This is the worst complex in history.  I could write a list of all the issues I've had here, but you'd be reading for an hour.  I don't want to waste your time asking you to read what all is wrong with this complex, and I don't want you to waste your time even considering moving here.  I would give it less than one star if I could.

name: Desmond Givens
text: I stay here now and my experience is terrible. Maintenance is slow and the leasing office won't help. I had a water pipe bust above me and my floor was soaked. I told maintenence and called the office and they didn't send anyone to look at it until the next day. Then they said I would be able to have it all fixed by tuesday. I could have mold in my ceiling this is unhealthy. I have been here for over 2 years and wanted to upgrade to a bigger place but I will definetly not be resigning after this. Just not safe especially if you have kids.

name: Brittany an
text: My name is ania and this PLACE IS A RIP OFF !!FULL OF LIES !LAZY STAFF ! HORRIBLE LAZY WORKERS ! THIS IS THE 4TH TIME WITHIN MONTHS OF OUR WATER GETTING TURNED OFF! SAVE YOUR MONEY WHEN MY LEASE IS UP I'M RUNNING ! The app is big but not worth it ! I should have taken the other reviews seriously but i was looking for space so i tried them out and I'm so disappointed !

name: Ana Gutierrez
text:
If I could give NO stars I would in a heartbeat I'm posting my review everywhere, facebook, apartment finders, here, everywhere. I've tried calling the news to get the bad reviews on here, waiting on them.
Lets just say water is shared with the THOUSAND units.. so your water bill is garunteed over $100... I am a faimly of three, most of which we are not home.. and my water bill has been 150.. Now after the pipes burst in the middle of the night and no water for over a day my water bill is $226.... Guess who had to pay it or else I wouldve been evicted. Yep. Me. Trash is always over flowing at the dump sites, Ive always had people leaing food and cigarette butts on my floor outside I've called the office plenty of times to leave notes on all doors but it was still happening so I had to take matters in my own hands and leave notes for everybody. Some punk was slashing tires all within a month five cars with flats. My friends car was stolen in the middle of the night. They can't keep maintnence workers so there's about 4 workers for those thousand units. Moved in April 4th and told them my dishwasher is holding moldy water and smells of ass and death, it is December 5th and it is still not fixed. One guy came out and actually ran it, and said.. "Do this a couple times and it'll be good as new." ....... No. LOTS OF ROACHES EEEVVVVVEEERRRRYYYYWWWWHHHHEEEERRRRREEEEE. No joke. I spray once a month and have baits, there's still bugs everywhere and I am a neat freak. It drives me insane. If I could afford to cut my lease early, I would've done it the second da I moved in.. I hate it here..

name: Lana Mitchum
text: Horrible! Have lived in multiple.vuilding in this complex.for the last 5 yrs and always have to go through a run around to get anything fixed. My carpet is always soaked due to leaks they say they fixed but dont. I've had no lights in my bathroom for like a month bc they refuse to come.replace them. I've called the complex back to back 7 times at 230 in the afternoon on a Wednesday with no.reaponse. I have left messages for both the office and maintenance, left emails for the office and nothing. Contacting local news stations next. I do not recommend anyone living here.its not worth the headache or you better be ok with paying more everytime you renew your lease and expect to do all maintenance yourself

name: Meshia Jones
text: This has to be the worst place to live we've only been here two weeks and in the first night we saw a bed bug but none of our belonging were in the apt. Then a few days later I saw a few more one on the wall and one on my blanket I had laying on the floor. Told the office and now facing paying $700 or more for the treatment cause they said it's coming from our couch! (Which we had no problems with prior to moving in) no to mention the apt wasn't ready and we did not see it till the day of. And we asked for the carpets to be replaced because who ever lived there before us had a dog. So it smelled like wet dog and still had dog hair all over the carpets. This is just the worst experience I've ever had dealing with an apartment. If I'd could if give negative starts.!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Please follow up with our office so we learn more about what you experienced at the time of your August review. We hope to reach a resolution soon.

name: Patrick Porter
text: MAINTENANCE IS HORRIBLE AND THEY DON'T TELL YOU THE FULL DEAL ABOUT THE WATER BILL. YOU WILL PAY ALMOST IF NOT AN EXTRA $100. ON TOP OF YOUR RENT.

resp.text:
Hi James,

We do our best daily to stay on top of all maintenance request that may come in.  If you are having a specific problem please stop by the office to discuss with Community Manager Sheri Davis so she can get the attention you need on your issues.  In regards to the water we may be able to shed some light on this situation as well if you will come by and sit down with Sheri for a full breakdown of charges.  Many times the water usage is minimal however the sewer usage fees are approximately 3 times the amount of water.  We would love the opportunity to speak with you in person and look forward to doing so.

-The Park at Hoover team

name: Judy Le
text:
It is unfortunate that these nice apartments are so poorly maintained and managed.  I recently moved here in March---I was shown a beautiful apartment and after I submitted the application, they called to tell me that there was something wrong with the apartment, but the had another one available in the same location with the exact same floor plan.  I agreed (which was my mistake for not taking another tour, but lesson learned), and was placed in an apartment in the exact floor plan but not the same condition.  The associate who moved me in did not do a walk through with me, and when I informed the apartment manager of that, she told me that she would get back to me....still waiting.

I moved into an apartment that was not move-in ready.  There were dead roaches every where....one of the closet doors was off its hinge, the apartment was not painted (I know that because there are some children's scribbles all over the doors and walls), the carpets were not replaced or changed (and they are disgusting), the apartment itself is dingy and dirty.  If you step outside onto my patio, you will find discarded toys and stray cats.

The maintenance here is terrible.  They "fix" things in a timely manner, but they don't do it correctly.  My dryer wasn't working with the dryer connections, and after the maintenance man was certain that it was my dryer and not the outlet---I had someone else come look at it and replace the broken dryer outlet.  The dumpsters are always overflowing; I'm unsure if it's because they don't empty the dumpster often enough or because there is some shady business going on, but the dumpsters always have bags and bags and bags of trash overflowing from it with mattresses and furniture and the like (I hear from another tenant that this is because they're always evicting people).  Along with that, we have doggie stations located throughout the complex for you to discard your doggie bags when you clean up after your pet.  I moved in March, six months later, the disposals haven't been changed.  People are now just putting their bags on the ground since it can no longer fit in the station.  I wrote and called the office about it, thinking that this is a commonly missed area because we're in the back of the complex..they apologized, but have not emptied the container.

There were 3 apartments robbed about a month ago; one of them was in my building.  Directly across from her apartment was an empty apartment that didn't have a lock on in and squatters were living there.  Shady things like this occur all over the complex and attract a lot of crime.   The tenants who were robbed were allowed out of their lease...I wish I were so lucky to be allowed out of my lease, but that seems unlikely unless something equally terrible occurs.

My true concern is how unsympathetic and unconcerned the apartment manager (who is new) is when I brought up these issues to her.  They're only concerned with processing your rent...which isn't available until the 1st of the month, and is past due by the 4th.  If you try to pay your rent before the first, the system doesn't show you how much you owe in rent or water.  You have exactly 3 days to pay what you owe.

name: Rae is Here
text: Horrible horrible horrible this is not to chase others away however people have warned me about these apartment(staff) and I had to learn the hard way .... the people in the rent office initially starts off super sweet but a month in my furnace was broken and it didn't get fixed for moths ... I called literally every lunch break they do not communicate well either they are just rude and that's why I am leaving thank goodness 😅 Also I'd like to add we never have water !!!!!!!!!!! It's always getting cut off literallly 5 times in a month I would have to stay in a hotel since I don't have close relatives to my job

name: Adnan hussain
text:
I was the resident of Apt 4322 from 1st Sep 2013 till Nov 3rd 2014 and actually took over the lease from my friend in 2013 who also lived there for an year . I decided to move out by the end of my lease in August '14 but forgot to turn in My 60 days notice on 1st July so called in by the end of july and request that what if one of my friend and his wife wants to take over my lease by the end of lease agreement which is 30th August . He was willing to turn in Application and pay for background check and turn in all the required paperwork but the only problem was they want me to be there "physically" in the leasing office at the time of transfer which i can't be able to do as I was with my pregnant wife in Georgia and she wasn't be able to travel as per her Dr's recommendation I requested the Manager what if i signed the paper and get it "Notarized" from designated Notary public and send it to leasing office they denied as its against their "Policy" even offer to give my friend " Power of Attorney" so that he can sign on my Behalf they so "No"  even tho is Perfectly legal way and will not harm them in any way All the offers of Video chat ,Skype were denied too . I talked to several people in the office even some Manager in "Corporate Office" who wants me to send her Medical records and Letters from Dr so that she can "Think" about my request but never bothers to call me back or reply to my texts or calls again and one of the "Assistant Manager" at the leasing office threaten me with "Eviction Notice" and Immediately terminating my lease as i'm voilating the lease agreement by not living there ( Even tho I'm always paying rent on time and none of the neighbors have complains against me ) only because I'm arguing with them to consider my request .I end up submitting my 60 days notice and pay $150 Dollars more in rent after August and move out on 3rd November and Now Its been 18 days I'm trying to update my new address so that they can send me back my "Deposit Refund Check" several calls to leasing office only results in taking my no and promise that some one from corporate Accounts call me back .Uptill now there is No "Ackknowledgment" from Anywhere that they have my new Address and I dont even know When Am I going to get my Deposit Money back .

They should Consider their "Stuck up Rules" and "Red tape Techniques" as we are not living in 70's any more and It actually cost them more in paying cleaning/maintenance crew to get my Apt ready for New tenant instead of letting my friend get the lease transfered on his name and get the Apt as it is and they also lost the prospective future Tenant. I dont recommend any one ever to move to this Apt only because of management i never had any issues with maintenance/safety/Neighborhood.

Note: Some Maintenance Guy Entered into My Apt without any notice or Knocking at the Door on 5th October 2014 as he's been told By Management at leasing office that Apt 4322 is vacant . I filed complain for it and they do Apologize by putting your Guy's in a harms way is not a good Idea as any one can consider them as intruder and do harm them.

text: Normally I do not write any reviews but I'm so disappointed with this complex that I hope this would help future residents and hope it would get the attention of someone who actually cares about making residents happy. Every time I go to the out in a request it takes days or even me having to get an attitude with them before anything gets done. Now my refrigerator is not working and it's been three days and no one has come out uv been to the main office to voice my issue after the fact my husband and I have both called and been up to maintenance.  On top of that there is the biggest roach problem as well. Pest control has sprayed numberous times doesn't matter how much you clean or seal food or not have food they still keep coming.  It's absolutely sickens me to cook or try to eat knowing roaches crawl in my already fixed plate of food on the counter before I can even eat it.

name: Laura Evans
text:
I moved in here January of 2015 and I'm so thankful my lease is almost up because this place is literally awful. The management is terrible the people that work in the leasing office are nice until you sign your lease and then they're all extremely rude. The maintenance is horrible I had problems with my air conditioning all summer and almost had to take legal action because they never would fix it properly. There are roaches everywhere outside in the summer the place is disgusting. Living under a bridge would probably be cleaner than this place. The water gets shut off constantly in fact our water is off right now for some reason, not because I didn't pay they just shut it off all the time so now I have to go to someone else's house to even take a shower. This place is the biggest waste of money, they also tell you before you sign the lease that some utilities are included but once you move in you get all these extra fees including pest control which is ridiculous because there are pests everywhere. The water bill is split between everyone in your building which really isn't fair because I don't even have a washing machine so I have to pay extra just because some people use more water.
DO NOT MOVE HERE.

I called over and over and most of the time was put on hold for so long I just hung up. Definitely don't call when it's close to closing because they will definitely not cooperate. I was talking with one of the manager's, David, and even after talking to him, nothing was accomplished. Even when the sorry ass maintenance men came to the apartment, they didn't fix anything. I decided to dispute my rent but I don't know what that process is like and don't want to be evicted without having a backup plan! Anyone knows how that works?

The two ladys that work in the office are horrible and have the worst attitudes it’s always an inconvenience to them to fix and take care of what needs to be done. They are already so overpriced and junky the least they could do is treat there tenants better and fix the stuff that goes wrong. This property desperately needs new management and maybe this place will start to improve but with the 2 lady’s In the office it continues to get worse and worse. Then when you call corporate over a issue they will not resolve they confront you and tell you not to email or call corporate it make them look bad they are a complete joke!

name: Patricia Toups
text: Have been an resident for 5 years and have never had any problems that maintenance couldn't fix. The office staff is very friendly.

name: Craig Dickey
text: I give it one star apartment is small for what you pay for rent and trash on the ground and in the pond. My truck got stolen from there and they act like they didnt care didnt try to help out or nothing so it's not crime free.

name: Gabe P.
text: Way over priced, trashy, rude staff

name: Evan Alden
text: Its a cool place my brother lives here. Rec room pools and good clean apartments.

name: Paul Sams
text: The problem with trash has gotten much worse. It seems more residents have moved in who feel the breezeway is their own personal garbage dump. Sad. It was so nice when we move in here. It really is a shame.

name: robert2002bmw
text: I lived there for 6 years. At first it was nice and safe with a working gate. After management changed a few years later the gate would almost always be broken. The car thefts started. Someone tried to steal mine and my neighbors truck on the same night. I reported it to the property manager and she didn't even send out flyers warning the other tenants.  Rent started going up every year.  If you get in a building next to the wooden fence you can look over at the Barrington apartment complex and see people smoking weed and playing loud music. I hope this helps someone before you sign a lease.

name: L
text: This by far has been the BEST apartment complex I have ever lived in. We are sadly moving to Hoover but if we could take Bernadette, Van, Jay & the Oaks of St.Clair we would. They have been excellent the entire two years we have stayed at the Oaks. I love the community engagement they do year around--Christmas party, Waffle breakfast, Ice Cream days, Pool party, Halloween costume party & so much more!!! They do an excellent job maintaining the property at the Oaks and Jay & Van are the absolute BEST maintenance men!!! I could go on and on. If you are looking for a safe, quite & fun community with an outstanding staff--look no more the Oaks of St.Clair in Moody AL is the place for you and your family!!!!

name: Jonathan Pharr
text:
These aren't a bad place to stay but make sure you communicate with management.  We have requested help between 10 and 15 times with the ridiculously loud music coming from a neighboring apartment and some months later the individuals playing this music are finally being removed from the premises.
Maintenance has assisted us on several occasions and are generally slow and forgetful.  Any commitment made for repairs requires additional phone calls to get them to complete any repair that has been scheduled.  They do finish, eventually.
Our neighbors smoke and we often return home after a weekend to what smells like a smoker friendly hotel room.
Nothing was taped off for painting between rentals.  The same paint on the walls can be found on the trim, outlets, showers, and cabinets.  Our vinyl flooring was also coming off of the floor when we moved in and required replacement during our stay.  This was apparently an old rental manager's practice and will no longer occur.

name: Tracie Bean
text: I love living here. I live alone and feel very safe. As far as drug dealers I don't believe it. I just renewed my lease for another year! I have had 2 problems in a year and both was resolved in 24 hours. The office staff is the best you could ask for. Always very helpful! And my rent did go up but it is my understanding that is with all apartments.

name: Trevor Motes
text: Within the first month of living, my hot water heater itself exploded, my a/c unit broke and needed to be replaced, Clogged heat exhaust ducts from my dryer caused costly repairs to my personal dryer, and swarms of bees on my balcony are yet to be addressed. Sure people have had good experiences here, but my first month here is far from that. Nothing luxury about these “luxury “ apartments

name: John Higginbotham
text: The reason for me updating this review stems from the excellence that this complex displays on a daily basis. The office staff is courteous, helpful and will fix any needed repairs VERY quickly. However, the only complaint that I have is noise, I know many of the residents that live on the first and second floor. Many of them have complained of stomping, and loud sounds coming from their upstairs neighbors. This is due to the apartments being built long ago which has terrible sub-flooring and creates more noise than apartments that have proper sub-flooring. I would gladly continue to live here only because of the excellence and the office staff.

name: Jane Doe
text: We did not have the best experience.  You could hear any sort of noise - although we expected this in an apartment to a certain degree, it was much worse than anticipated.  We went the first 3 or 4 months there with a broken dishwasher, it made no difference how often we called the office or put in a maintenance request.  The last 5 months there we lived without a kitchen light.  Our front door was also broken and it didn't lock very well - it was very easy to break into our apartment, and yet this security hazard was NEVER fixed (we were there for a little over a year).  We evetually got the point where we would put in one maintenance request (or in some cases none), then just learn to live with whatever was wrong.  Just recently we bought our own house and have finally moved out.  Our rent was automatically drafted out of our account, and although we are no longer there for the month of November they took money out of our bank account.  It's been almost a week and we can't get anyone in the office to help us out.  Any other time in the past year when we've tried to call someone (or left messages to have someone call us back), no one has been very helpful and rarely would we get a call back.  The one lady who was somewhat helpful in the office is no longer there, so don't except any help.  Unfortunately there's not a lot to choose from in places to live in Moody, AL - so be prepared!

name: Andrea Arrington
text: Very pleased with the layout and presentation of the model apartment that the residents manager showed us and he was very nice and welcoming.

name: Madison Kelly
text: Our air went out multiple times during the hot summer and it took almost 2 months for it to finally get fixed. Management also would ignore our calls when trying to get the air fixed. $982 to live in a 1 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor. If you choose to live on the 2nd or 1st floor they charge you more. The gates have been broken multiple times and for a while the apartments smelt of sewage.

name: Janna Parris
text: We had went to speak with the property management company in October when out house was under contract. They are gracious enough to not charge us the admin fees a second time when we came back in January. However, we were told they would have an apartment available on the 14th on the ground level. We then went there and spoke with Bernadette last week who showed us the model. She promised the stainless steel appliance updates and updated cabinets and tile. She said to call back in a week for an update. So, I called a day early and was advised that they would not have an apartment available for us until next month. So, now we were 4 days from moving when when we were told to find somewhere else to go. This could have been handled better.

name: Davina Morris
text: The management is very nice. They cost of the apartments is rather High, though.

name: Tiffany Eunice
text: I lived here for 2 years and it was always quite and neighbors are respectful.

name: Darren Adams
text: Nice place, reasonably priced East of town so traffic isn't bad.

name: Joseph Huffstetler Jr.
text:
Before reading this know the staff is great and very friendly couldn't ask for more when it comes to the people that work here they are great people!

NOT LUXURY LIVING!!! Read on for details!! Don't be fooled!!

Live here now and have for a year.... don't really know why they told me the wrong rent price and let me pay for 3 months and now tell me I owe them $300. Even after they tell me they will have it taken care of I keep getting bills for it.
Next, one year and never changed the air filter even though they taped letters to everyone's doors saying they were coming through to do so every 3-4 months.
Next, bad water leak coming from Hvac room from pvc condensate lines backing up and not glued together so it drips everywhere carpet, door, and water heater.
Next, door lock was broken for almost a week before fixing.
Next, I have asked numerous times since before I moved in for them to clean the Hvac room, they never have and started saying a few months ago they were waiting on a shop vac that theirs was broken. Same with air filters every time I would ask I was told they were waiting on them to be delivered....

For $1200 a month just for rent for a two bedroom in MOODY AL this place is not recommended you can live a lot nicer and more comfortable closer to or in Birmingham. I will be moving as soon as I can save up enough money to do so! Just wanted to let people know this place is everything but luxury living!

name: Don McShane
text: great office staff. maintenance crew is amazing

name: Carl Toups
text: Very Nice gated community.

name: Cocoa Young
text: Very Nice Floor Plans!!!! Go by to see Bernadette

name: Vincent McCary
text: Awesome

name: mitchell troxell
text: My air went out 6 times in 3 months that's enough to be given one star.

name: Second2none
text: Great family place

name: Dm Payton
text: Clean place

name: 2K God
text: Nice apartments

name: Trent Baker
text: Terrible management

name: Steven Hughes
text: Nice apartments

name: Joel Hill
text: Rr

name: Mesha Lang
text: Very nice and clean environment!!

name: Amanda Mcclendon
text:
(Translated by Google) Launch

(Original)
Nise

name: Jasmine Williams
text: ME AND MY HUSBAND LOVE MOUNTAIN WOODS APARTMENTS. CORY IS AMAZING AND SO IS MRS. DIANE. GREAT PLACE , CLEAN NICE AND VERY PROFESSIONAL!!!

resp.text: Jasmine, thank you for this fantastic five-star review! We are thrilled you and your husband are enjoying life at Mountain Woods Apartments! Our team is dedicated to providing you with great customer service and a well-kept, comfortable home. If there is anything you need, please don't hesitate to reach out anytime. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Mariah Hunter
text: So far so good . This complex is so much better than the apartment complex that my boyfriend and I moved from . There is a drastic difference in the quality at this complex than the old. Diane really does know what she is doing . We are at peace and really do feel like we are home  here. There is also a courtesy officer here too. The only downside is one resident that blasts there music when they come home and leave it outside our particular building. We enjoy it so much that we are debating to stay another year if they have a 2 bed 2 bad with connections or 3 bed if not it will be so hard to leave . If you are really looking for a great place come here!

resp.text: Mariah, thank you for taking the time to leave this thoughtful five-star view for Mountain Woods Apartments! We couldn't be happier hearing you and your boyfriend are enjoying an upgraded lifestyle at our community. We will be sure to pass along your kind compliments to our manager. Please know we are always happy to listen to any concerns you have and will work to address them to your satisfaction. If there's anything we can do to assist you, don't hesitate to reach out to the office.

name: Violeta Sanchez
text: The apartment complex is a very small one so it's easy to manage which is why I really like it. It's affordable, close to everything, and the property manager is really nice. Maintenance comes in sporadically though, sometimes you have to pester them

resp.text: Thank you for this four-star review of Mountain Woods Apartments, Violeta! We truly appreciate you and are glad you've had a positive experience at our community. We appreciate the feedback and are always working to enhance the resident experience. If there is anything we can do for you, don't hesitate to call or visit the office. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Marcela Tapia
text:
A quiet and nice place to live. I lived here for 3 years and don't have any complains. Diane and her team did everything in their hands to make living there the best experience. Every time we had an issue that required maintenance Corey would come and fix it right away, I don't thin I ever had to wait more than a couple hours before something got fixed or taken care of.

The area is very close to everything, super markets, restaurants and entertainment. Neighbors were nice and everyone just kept to themselves and were pleasant. I really enjoyed my time living there.

resp.text: Marcela, thank you for taking the time to leave us this wonderful five-star review! We're thrilled you had such a good experience at our community, and we truly appreciate your kind feedback. Our goal is always the satisfaction of our residents, and we hope every residential experience is as good as yours! We're glad you found our staff helpful and prompt, our location convenient, and our community friendly and inviting. We would love to be of service to you again and invite you to visit the office or call (205) 942-6428 if we may be of assistance in any way.

name: Farrah Wright
text: This place is amazing! Super quiet neighborhood and wonderful neighbors who’ve lived here for a long time! Diane, property manager is so sweet and genuinely cares for the community here! Highly recommended

resp.text: Farrah, thank you for leaving us this wonderful five-star review! We're delighted you've enjoyed our peaceful, friendly community and helpful staff. We know you have many options when it comes to choosing your perfect home, and we're so glad you've chosen Mountain Woods! Please don't hesitate to visit the office or call (205) 942-6428 if we may be of any assistance. We are always happy to be of service!

name: Christopher Anglin
text: I love living here! The place really packs a lot of bang for your buck. The location is the best part. I love being able to walk to work and for almost anything I need. The building is dog friendly and pet rent is not very expensive. The management had my lease and apartment ready fast and it was very easy moving in. I highly recommend this place if your in the market for loft style apartment living downtown. This is definitely a place for dog lovers. The manager here is the best I’ve had yet.

name: Erin Duke
text: Home sweet home, management is amazing, especially Quinn, who has become more than just an acquaintance. She's a great friend as well.

name: Brandon Mann
text: Stayed here with a VRBO.  Building is masked with cheap repairs.  Always smelled like pot throughout the building.  Parking lot in back felt safe but absolutely no gates or security.  Great location to downtown and restaurants in the area.  Assuming all the units look the same, could always here the washer dryer combos going and lots of partying.  Nothing but yelling laughing sassy rude drunk girls from 6pm-9pm then 3am-4am.

name: Jamie Smith
text: Perpetual construction and debris in the parking lot and stairwells. Little attention to cleanliness or aesthetics. Unsecured in an area of high transient/ loitering activity. Small efficiency apartments touted and priced as "luxury." All the renovations have been counter-productive to improvement, most notably the uninsulated walls and metal ceilings that not only conduct sounds but amplify them. Smells like marijuana, sounds like a squeaky elevator and your neighbors' most passionate moments. The light fixture in the lobby and the mosaics are nice. Don't expect to establish a relationship with office staff because it changes about once a month.

name: Crystal Wilson
text: If it looks perfect for you it probably is. The only problem I have is with other tenants. They have pretty relaxed requirements for moving in. That’s why I was initially drawn to move in because I have a dog that surpasses weight requirements at other apartments. Unfortunately, that makes it easier for people who like to leave their beer cans in the parking lot and smoke cigarettes in the lobby to get it. Also, it would be great if we could get a working gate around the parking lot before Mardi Gras because it’s going to be hell to park here during that time. There’s a lot of homeless people that hang out in the park out front but that’s down town for you. I love living here. There’s ups and down to living anywhere.

name: Shane Duke
text: Before the management change, I wouldn't give this place a star, with the exception of the assistant manager Elise. She's amazing! Since Hammond Properties has taken over, a long with placing Quinn in the position of property manager, and keeping Elise on, this place has become home for sure!

name: joshua newbill
text: Absolutely love it here the best part was the office staff the apartment is fantastic highly recommended it you guys are great keep up the good work

name: Ayana Cunningham
text: Because zero stars isn't an option. This is one of the worst apartment building I have ever lived, it's worse than the dorms I stayed in at college. If you like privacy and a quiet place to live DO NOT STAY HERE!! You can literally hear everything from the conversations your neighbors have to the commotion going on in the hallways. Not to mention how the management changes monthly. During my entire 1 year lease here, there has been at least 12 different leasing managers who never know what they are talking about or anything about the building for that matter. I almost forgot...THE ELEVATORS. From the minute I moved in, they have been trying to fix the elevators and a year later they still aren't fixed. What a shame. Save your coins and stay somewhere that's actually a luxury apartment because I have been counting down the days until I can finally move out!

name: Jamelia Addison
text: The building from the outside is kind of sketchy but once you go in it’s really nice. The leasing manager  kaelyn was really nice. But when I came back with concerns for the property management she was very rude and basically told me to pull my application because I was concerned about the homeless people living in the front. Also while viewing I could hear the conversation of someone living next door the walls are thin. Overall nice building bad money hungry management and I’ve just been updated the lady that was handling my application was dealing in fraudulent activity

name: Nicole Cabrera
text: I am so happy with my choice to move here! I moved in about 2 months ago and could not be HAPPIER! They have/are renovating everything but don't let that deter you from here. This place has definitely progressed from where it was even 1 year ago when I had originally visited. Amazing apartment with high ceilings, awesome views from any apartment AND. A. WASHER. AND. DRYER. IN. THE. APARTMENT. I don't care what you say... finding that downtown is HARD! Oh... and management is the sweetest you'll find?? I mean, come on. Call them!!

name: Amber Killing
text: If I could do a half heart I would’ve but this is the worst place I’ve ever lived in an sad to say this was my first apartment mold was growing everywhere , loudmusic the manager always said or blamed us for things we didn’t do

name: Malikka N
text: I came and viewed this place and I loved it! Renovations are still going on but the work looks promising. I've seen several units that are already complete and I absolutely love them! It's gives me all the city vibes and a fresh look. I'm not a resident yet, but i'm strongly considering.

name: Morgan Brackin
text: The property manager is by far the nicest woman I’ve met throughout all the times I’ve leased. The newly renovated apartments are beautiful, so many cool things happening here. I’m extremely excited to be signing my lease with The Tower on Ryan Park. It’s unfortunate these apartments have a 3.3 stars currently, but I can attest that any previous negative  reviews are not a direct reflection of what Laura and her new staff are implementing at this property.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Spoke with a tenant outside who spoke of major renovation underway. "...more like a construction zone." Tenant was frustrated, met w/some initial reluctance when reported issues, but received more helpfulness later on. They've removed the awning from the front and hopefully one goes back up. The little spaces off the sidewalk in front should be returned to shops or offices. A small diner, salon and bodega would be ideal! Surely the gates will be restored. Mobile's first highrise apartment building. A self-contained dwelling w/apt., garbage chute, mail, laundry, theater room & community room all under one roof + two terraces. A real gem.

name: travis owens
text: Great place to live!! The staff are always very helpful and incredibly nice! 10/10 would recommend living here if you’re looking for a new apartment!

name: Preston Clark
text: The apartment itself is very nice. However, The construction crew is obnoxious and loud. No need to set an alarm clock, the sound of hammers, saws and drills will wake you up in the morning and greet you when you get back from work. I would hesitate to rent until after the construction is completely finished.

name: Rachel Parker
text: I moved into Tower June of 2015 and signed up for another year lease back in July.  I love the location of the Tower and the studio is a good fit for just myself. I would not recommend moving into a studio if you are going to be sharing the space with someone else. I've had some maintenance issues that look a little while to repair but there is two new guys working that seem to be doing things in a more timely manner. Other than maintenance everything else has been wonderful. Hope this helps!

name: Kaitlyn Sutherlin
text: Love living here. The best apartment manager I've ever had she seriously knows what she's doing!  Construction crews are working day in and day out to work on the renovations to turn this place upscale. The only negative thing I can even come up with is there is no no maintenance man. ;)

name: MACS James Gardner
text: We rented an apartment in The Tower while our home is under major renovations.  The one bedroom apartment we have is EXACTLY what we needed for our purposes. The staff is quick to address any issues.  On site laundry facilities, secure entry for residents, many units undergoing complete renovations.  The location is perfect and the views from the two rooftop terraces is great.  You will be a short walk from the many restaurants and attractions avaliable in downtown Mobile.   If there is an apartment avaliable I would recommend The Tower on Ryan Park.

name: Peter Kirk
text:
I like living here. The place is being remodeled.  I accept that and look forward to the work being completed.
I’ve had a couple of minor issues I’ve gone to the property managers and they’ve addressed it immediately.

name: Jim Bradley
text: I wouldn’t move here.

name: Alyce Woodruff
text: This place is a roach and bed bug motel. I have one more month to go on my lease and I'm out of here. This place used to be nice but now they just don't care. DON'T RENT HERE UNLESS YOU INJOY THE SMELL OF GARBAGE AND DOG PISS..

name: Jason Nicholson
text: Don't pay any attention to the bad reviews...they're way out of date. I absolutely love my apt and it's a great place to be in town. -- Update  Four months later and I still love this place. The view and amenities are amazing! They are small, so there may be some culture shock if you're used to a bigger place.

name: Deven Arnold
text:
The truth is, the only reason why you would want to live here is because it's cheap for it's location, the rooftop terraces are nice, and you can't beat the location. Besides that the cons out way the pros. Just to list the problems: roaches are everywhere but mangement will claim they spray every other week, they paint over rust and mold, it's very loud because your walls are so thin, managment doesn't answer phones, management will enter your room without notice, hallways on floors are never cleaned, parking gate didn't work for weeks at one point, toilet backs up with sewage at times I'm not in the apartment, sink and bathroom drains sometimes. This is not to bash tower on Ryan park but to point out the problems.

Update July 19,

It took over 2 1/2 months to get my security deposit back. Apparently the home leasing office decided it was a good idea to send the security deposit check to my apt that I had already moved out and returned both mail and room key. And yes, I did give them a typed letter signed and dated by both me and the leasing manager. The letter also included the forwarding address and instructions pertain to the move. Because of this I had to change my rating to a 1 star. If there was a zero I would go for it. FIND ANOTHER PLACE TO LIVE!

name: Miles Sanchez
text: Some apartments smell weird. But its old so there ya go. Pretty nice for what it is

name: BTG BlakeTheGreat
text: Where to start,hmm both elevators once agin don’t work and both side doors are close therefore occupants can’t get into apartments, to add  it’s late and sucks.. hardwood floors are warping , heat fan was never fixed , last but not least the maintenance here is a joke . My front door handle is still broke

name: D. Mc
text: I called and received the worst customer service!  The girl who answered was extremely rude and acting like a smart butt for absolutely no reason.  I was as polite as could be.  This staff needs to realize that a prospect's first impression is how they represent their property, and this representation leads me to believe that they do not care about their tenants at all.

name: Raf Cade
text: Well let’s see, If you are young or like to live downtown. This is probably the place for you. However, you will have to put up with some of the bad reviews. I personally think that this place is OVER priced for what you get. The higher up you are in the Towers the less likely you will see the roaches and pest (it's just the truth). Also, the elevator are just as old as the building 1950's. Sometimes you will have to wait for just one working. So, to cut it short...Great place to live if you like the downtown atmosphere and don't mind putting up with some "minor" issues.

name: Michael Burch
text: I just moved in and I love this place.  Awesome views,  awesome people,  awesome staff

name: Tony Helferich
text: Great experience so far, but waiting on some things to be fixed.  Will update.

name: Carlton Thornton
text: Ryan Towers looks like a really nice place online and in the apartment brochures, but it's only a deception. If I could give this place NO stars, I would. After several request for them to fix my caving bathroom ceiling, an entire month has gone by and STILL no work has been done. The office people are rude and lazy and the apartment as a whole is very dirty.

name: Logan Stroganoff
text: Location is the only positive for torp. Studios are overpriced for what you get,the only reason i settled on them is because i relocated to mobile on short notice and couldn't find anything else available in my price range. The building is infested with german cockroaches,this has been an ongoing problem they cant seem to solve. The smell of rotting garbage emanating from the trash chutes is overpowering at times,especially during summer months.(Thus the roach problem) The hallway carpets are rarely vacuumed,much less cleaned. The elevators and parking lot gate break down on a regular basis. Hedges growing along the parking lot fence are overgrown and drooping into the lot,making parking in the spots along it unusable. The place is a revolving door of management and maintenance people. If issues are addressed at all it usually takes multiple complaints. I could go on and on. That they charge $626 a month for dated, crackerbox studios with no ammenities beyond a crappy gym with busted equipment and a couple rooftop terraces is a joke. Needs a complete overhaul and lower rent. Stay away unless youre desperate and have no other option like me.

name: kristen bailey
text: When I moved in, the apartment had new carpeting. The AC is ice cold and I have never ran out of hot water. The people that work there have always been friendly and helpful. Some of the perks of downtown living are Mardi Gras, Bayfest, and the New Year's Moonpie Drop. Love the Terrace and library (you can walk to the library). I have had no problems/issues with my apartment.

name: Barbara Raney
text: Because 0stars isn't an option

name: Felicia Colette Goree
text: A lil small but real cute

name: Brian Buckelew
text: Lived there for 7 years it was okay for a place to stay but not where you would want to retire

name: Fred Butler
text: Ummm yeah ok

name: Linda Richards
text: Friendly place

name: LaJohntate Sumpter
text: It's very  clean

name: Slymjomitch
text: Convenient to everything

name: Jordyn Pierce
text: Building is extremely run down. All you're paying for is location and view.

name: tony long
text: TOWER SUCK A$$

name: Shane Caton
text: Friendly staff clean lobby

name: Elizabeth Paige
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE

name: Joslyn Abrams
text: HONEST REVIEW: As a Tuscaloosa native I’d heard about Woodlawn Manor and the reputation proceeded it. But when I came to view the unit I was pleasantly surprised and could not beat the price point. It is central to everything in Tuscaloosa. I moved into a one bed one bath with my dog the first of February and it has been fantastic. Being a single woman I was nervous about living alone out here but  The leasing office and agents are AMAZING and my neighbors are so friendly and welcoming! It’s ideal for college students or elderly who don’t want the responsibility of a home right now.  This was a gamble that paid off. Great price, great location and under Druid City Properties it’s really turning around. Don’t miss out on Tuscaloosa’s Hidden Gem!

name: Jeanetta Nixon
text: I love staying here. It's nice and quiet

name: Amanda Harper
text: I can not wait until my lease is up!!!! I've never lived anywhere like this before. The maintenance requests go unnoticed, I live downstairs and my upstairs neighbors obviously does not have a job. They fight, blast music and stomp all day/night. I've called several times and reported them, NOTHING has happened. I would sleep in my car at the park before moving here. Let's not talk about the bug problem. They do not care about their tenants but expect the rent each month. I have a toodler whos never even been outside over here because of the fast driving and gun shots. DO NOT MOVE HERE.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  As of June 1st, 2019 Woodlawn Manor is under new management.  Druid City Properties is now over this complex.  We are committed to improving Woodlawn Manor and making it a quieter, nicer, and safer place to live.  We hope the upgrades over the next few months will help improve your opinion of this property.  Please contact us with any and all additional feedback so that we can continue to improve.

name: Shakila Rashaad
text: I give this place 3 stars because of my upstairs neighbor and these ghetto ass rats around me! I work 8-9 hours a day & go to school when I get home I want piece & quite but these rats don't work I leave & come back there still in the same place when I left, & my upstairs neighbor smokes weed while her kids there she leave all 6 kids by themselves the oldest 1 is 8! She let's them run wild they bust my car window I got so sick of her ass I had to talk to her to many times so when my window got cracked I went to the manager she sent her a notice & it has got 10times better I rarely hear anything & I never see those kids anymore 😁😁 as for the apartment it's great really nice I have no bugs & whenever I had an issue maintenance was quick and resolved every issue but I rarely had problems with the apartment. I would recommend a upstairs unit for anyone wanting to move here though because most of these people are welfare rats with lots of bad ass kids!

name: James Gracie
text: It's quiet, peaceful, nice looking apartments and I would love to move in and live there and live as well. This is where I would like to move to, Woodlawn Manor Apartments. My new home.

name: Trudie Mckanstry
text: My Best Friend live there. She's a Senior Citizens.

name: Super Sunny
text: It looks like a great place to go buy crack at 3 am, with no contacts.

name: mrs. humbled Five
text: Very unsafe place to live. The water has a very strong chlorine smell and it's unsafe to drink. The toilets from other apartments come into the next apartments tub. The stoves catch on fire randomly. The crime is unbelievable.

name: drexyl twickenham
