name: Brad Brooks
text: Best apartment complex in Mobile AL by FAR! Staff always goes out of their way to be super helpful. Any issues I had were immediately resolved the same day.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5 star review! We really strive to create a great community for our residents, Brad. Let us know if we can ever do anything to help this experience.

name: Kathrynne Caldwell
text: Living here has had its sets backs and positives but now they have reached an all time low. I moved here and decided to pay their high priced rent because of all of the amenities. It was nice, clean, and yes, higher than most places but all of the bonuses made up for the difference. Now because of a select few, who didn’t follow the rules, all of our amenities have been striped and we’re not allowed to have guests??? It was one occurrence and the security in this place would allow for management to pinpoint the specific offenders. However, their management style is to put us all in a corner, on lock down, barring guests, instead of making the extra effort to address the situation directly. I moved into an apartment, not a dorm room. I pay significantly for a beautiful apartment and have yet to regret it until now. If this continues to be the management style, as it is shaping up to be with previous decisions they’ve made, I will not be renewing my lease. I hope this changes because I genuinely have loved living here so far but I do not appreciate be treated like a child, over an isolated incident, that I wasn’t involved in. Figure it out.

resp.text: Thank you for providing your feedback.  We understand and share your frustration.  We want nothing more than for our resident to utilize and enjoy the amenities we have.  We are in the process of working on and soon will be implementing a solution that will allow us to better monitor and manage the usage of our pool area to ensure our residents can enjoy the pool and all of the amenities.   Once implemented that will remove the current temporary restrictions we have in place.  Please feel free to reach out to the office for more details.

name: katherine schild
text:
management and building and property cleanliness leave much to be desired. pest control issues. dryer repair...the replacement dryer had the prior owners lint inside the filter and still won’t complete the cycle.

positives — amenities, when clean. Kandi is very kind and willing to do whatever she can to help her residents. Maintenance team is wonderful but very overworked.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  I am the regional manager We have not actually spoken but I am very sorry that you are experiencing issues in your new home. Please know that we genuinely care about your satisfaction.  Our team has been extremely responsive and have addressed all of your issues in a timely manner.  We also offered you multiple options to address your concerns, so please let us know what we  can do by contacting the office so the team can discuss and resolve these matters.  We sincerely want you to be happy in your apartment and will do what we can to try to achieve that result.

name: Nana Gyambibi
text: Ive been here for about 4 months now and it has been a great experience. The front desk staff is very kind. I honestly have nothing but great things to say about this place.

name: Alessia Patton
text: Great place to live! Kandi is also the best person in there if you would like to move in ask for her you will not be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you Alessia for the great review and for choosing Meridian at the Port as your home! We take great pride in providing wonderful service for our residents. Looking forward to continuing to serve you as a valuable resident!

name: Jory Martinez
text:
Being here for over a year and some months now, I have been greatly disappointed to watch this place slowly but surely decline. As I'm writing this, we are currently without power (not the first or last occasion) and using a mobile hotspot in order to get this warning across. Cars are stuck outside/inside of the parking garage due to the power outage, leaving people trapped within the garage (and unfortunately inside the elevators).
Moving on to the new, "rules & regulations". Back tracking to my tour of the property, I was shown the amazing amenities that I would soon come to be paying a significant amount of money for.. Only to be deceived into learning that there would be constant provisions and addendums added that steal all of our freedoms from each and every amenity once enjoyed. Such addendums are paraphrased below:
1: No personal furniture are allowed to be used around our pool areas.. Which would be understandable, if we were provided the proper amount of furniture from RAM in the first place.
2: At this point in time, no guests are allowed to enjoy the beautiful amenities we are paying for, alongside with us. With this being said, there should be a universal enforcement of this addendum and ALL residents, including employees living on site, should also respect this rule accordingly.
3: Proper swimwear must be worn while enjoying the pool.. Again, understandable UNTIL you read the fine print. Which goes on to explain that, "cutoffs" (T-shirts without sleeves) are prohibited from being worn. I would love to have a dialogue with management on this addendum alone.

That's just to name a few. It is extremely upsetting to see these amazing amenities be stripped away from us, again. With COVID-19 briefly stripping our amenities before, everyone that has now been properly vaccinated are looking forward to adjusting to the new norm and building what could be, and what was promised to be, "community".

Don't get me wrong, the residents that live here are nothing short of beautiful people. But we are paying way too much to have a company steal away our freedoms in the manner that they are. Especially in the day in age we are in at the moment.. In which people are needing social interaction to cope with the stresses of life the pandemic has put upon us. The amenities, "provided" have the potential to be the structure for amazing community events/safe gatherings. It is simply unfortunate that for the time being, they will remain as that alone.. "Potential".

I hope this review, at minimum, will provide the beginning of a dialogue for change.

-Jory Martinez.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with your experience here.  The recent power outage was due to a car accident that hit a transform near the state docks and power was restored relatively quickly and we did everything we could to address the issue as quickly as possible.  With regards to the amenities, we do understand and share your frustrations regarding the restrictions over the past year as COVID affected our nation in a most unfortunate way.  We want nothing more than for our residents to utilize and enjoy the amenities that were built for them and we are in the process of working on and will soon be implementing a solution to better manage and monitor the areas.  Please feel free to reach out to the office so we can provide you with more details.

name: Blaine Adams
text: Every apartment complex has negatives. But, the management at The Meridian goes out their way to be as close to perfect as possible. I don't know how anyone could give them less than 5 stars.

resp.text: Hi Blaine! Thank you so much for this awesome review. We really strive for perfection here and are so glad you have had a wonderful experience so far. Please let us know if we can do anything for you.

name: Andrea Chapman
text: I viewed several apartments in the Mobile area and none came close to Meridian At The Port! It’s safe, helpful staff, clean, and awesome views. Honestly, you’ve to come see the place!!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

resp.text: Thank you for this 5 star review! We appreciate you as a resident and are so glad you are enjoying it here at Meridian at The Port!

name: Jim Bradley
text: Kinda hate I moved here..it started off nice and they will sell their amenities to you by any means but once you’re in they will treat you like a prisoner and send emails all day about what you cannot do! Also we just got an email today saying you can’t be at the pool without an appointment I thought that’s what we were paying for? So don’t move here if you like to enjoy the amenities you pay for whenever you’re ready too! Please go else where!

resp.text: Hello! We are so sorry that you feel this way. Due to the current circumstances with COVID-19, Amenity Boss is able to better assist with allowing residents to still use the pool while practicing safe guidelines. It was also put in place on a trial basis to try and limit anyone who is not a resident from enjoying the amenities we have here for you! It is in no way to make you feel like a prisoner or controlled. We are hoping this helps with the situation and if it doesn't, then we do not plan on keeping it in place. We appreciate your feedback and thank you for being a valued resident.

We have done a soft opening of our amenities and have a game plan in place to start opening the remaining. Please let us know if we can do anything and hope to earn a 5 star review in the near future!

text: We absolutely love living here! There's nothing quite like moving into a brand new apartment complex with very luxurious amenities like a salt water pool and full gym and yoga room! Even the small details like soft-closing cabinets make it infinitely better.

text: Hands down the best community in Mobile!  The pool is my favorite!  There is so much to do here and it is so close to downtown!

name: Peter Schwier
text:
I love this place.
1. They advertise as luxury apartments and they deliver. The apartment I have is well planned so the space is well used, it has plenty of light, and the appliances are very nice quality. And when I say well planned, I mean that it is well planned from my perspective as a 35 year old male, and my mom's perspective where she is starting to need a cane to move around.
2. This is new construction and it shows. Key-fob entry to the building and the apartments.
3. I haven't actually used the facilities much, mostly been worried about COVID-19. But I plan to start using them once the major part of the pandemic is over.
4. The staff cares. You may hear that about a lot of places. But, here they put in the though of how to make things better. Just today they gave eveyone "Safety Keys". :) Basically little wands so you don't have to touch elevator buttons or touchscreens when you are out and about. And, yes, this does mean they will close the shared facilities with very little notice if there needs to be a cleaning instead of letting things sit until someone complains.

resp.text: Hello! Thank you so much for your awesome review. We are so happy to have you living here and glad to hear you are enjoying the community.

text: This place is amazing.  I’ve lived here for about 3 months now and I love everything about it. It feels like a 5 star hotel. There are even carts to carry things up to your apartment just like you see in a hotel.  The amenities are top notch. So far my favorite is the gym.  The staff is definitely top notch.  They are so nice and anytime I need anything they take care of it right away.  If you’re thinking of living downtown MeridianAtThePort is a must see.

I wake up after working late hours to find my car was towed. The cost being almost 400, we are still in financial crises and the park at wakefield and Wellington did not care nor take time to warn NEW residents of such things. On top of the fact that I've requested over three times for somebody to come look at my heating and air system. Causing my electric Bill to be very high. Still trying to figure out how the electric Bill was 400 in a empty apartment that I purposely cut off all lights and the air because I had not moved in yet and they kept the electric in their name until i changed it over. Just displeased overall and I expected better.

text: I really would like to give kudos to the maintenance tech, Jose Garcia. text: Not the best but not the worst. Firstly, It took us 2 months to move into our apt. We were given the wrong apt 3 times, causing me to be charged by Alabama power 3 times to transfer service. The complex wasn’t willing to compensate us for the extra stay nor the 2 extra transfer fees. I informed them that we had mice and pest control brought a stack of glue traps and sat them on my dining room table. Then the valet trash cans were taken away. Meaning we had to sit our trash bags outside the door. Well this just invited dogs and cats to tear up your trash before the trash man could pick it up. Consequently I’ve caught 12 mice in my apt. I also informed them that my bathroom ceiling was leaking. I now have a corner where the ceiling just hangs and there’s mildew around the ceiling above the shower

This apartment complex is horrible to even say the least. I have lived here for 7 years and I am ONLY here because of the good school that my daughter is attending now. Being here as long I have encounter all types of Management team and none of them are better than the other. But this team consists or liars and people who does not know how to communicate. I have sent emails to fox 6 on your side the Better Business Bureau of Birmingham, I have even sent emails to their property holder. They are just horrible and like one other reviewer said just spiraling out of control. I you are even CONSIDERING moving here please take my advice and so many other, DO NOT DO IT. It is so stressful trying to get someone to fix anything around here and the team doesn't really care about the residents. For what it's worth please go somewhere else but NOT the Park at Wakefield. It's not worth the headache. They make them look decent on the outside but they are falling apart on the inside. The plumbing is horrible. There are rats and roaches everywhere.

name: Joslyn Bilbo
text:
Upon move in on April 5, 2019 there were many issues with our apartment. The dish washer had dirty water in the bottom and is not draining. we were told that it would be replaced; which still hasn’t took place. The kitchen cabinets were scratched up and dirty. The ice maker isn’t working either. There are obvious plumbing issues..being that sink drains very slowly and the half bathroom sink faucet constantly leaks.
The patio has old trash and mold everywhere. Which we were told would be cleaned upon us moving in.
It took 5 days for the air conditioning to get fixed and the upstairs is still not getting a good air flow. The plug for the dryer isn’t working for after purchasing the correct prongs for the outlet.
We are also missing a bedroom door and a power outlet is not working.
All of these items were noted on the inventory check list as well as made known to office managers! & we still have not received our mailbox keys. & let’s not forget the water has been down all day making us unable to use the toilets or sinks. This is has been the worst apartment I have ever dealt with and isn’t worth the price! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

name: BradsBurgers “NotAHero”
text: Well within a week of us moving here my girlfriend's car was vandalized and told us we had a day to move despite that all four tires had been slashed. text: The worst possible apartment complex you could stay in. We’ve only been staying there for a month & half! We haven’t had any heat or hot water the whole time consistently! The wiring in those apartments are very hazardous. The maintenance men will come & try to fix the things but they don’t do a good job because it’s right back broke in the next hour. This facility is very unprofessional. They offered to move us to a unit that has rats like that’s any better.! We are  very disappointed & displeased with our stay here. I wouldn’t recommend these apartments to anyone! Everything in there is cheap, & not well maintained! To come home in the winter time to no heat or hot water, will piss anyone off! I feel like calling & reporting them!! Very distasteful place.

You get banned from being able to come to the office. You arent guaranteed parking even though you must have a parking pass. Drugs are sold in the breezeway constantly. Kids are out late at night breaking into cars etc. I've been here 2 years only because it's cheap and allowed me to save money for a house. I CANT WAIT TO MOVE OUT!!!

text: HORRIBLE PLACE TO LIVE!!!!Don't know how this place got three stars, when it doesn't even deserve one. Been living here for almost a year and CAN'T WAIT to leave. They don't guarentee parking in the lease but they'll give you a parking pass that does absolutely nothing because the guests park wherever they feel like and the apartment complex does nothing about this, they also have a towing company that does nothing as well even if you call them, they won't show. There's ALWAYS noise late at night, people yelling, dogs barking and blaring music at ALL hours of the day. We pay for valet trash pick up that seems to only be picked up whenever they feel like it. There's ALWAYS trash laying around in the parking lot. This place has a HORRIBLE bug problem, as well as a HORRIBLE sewage problem. You can call up to the office and complain but majority of the time you'll just be leaving a message for them to never get back to you cause they don't ever call you back. You'll either have to call multiple times or go up to the office and speak to someone, and even then you'll probably have to follow up with them after that cause they just don't care about anything at this place. Still can't fathom how this place is up and running.

name: Tyler Nutt
text: DO NOT MOVE HERE. Easily the worst apartment complex in the Birmingham Metro area. I was only there for a year and there was significant structural damage to the foundation underneath the water heater (they never fixed this). When I first moved in, the water heater was sparking when turned on. Thankfully this was caught this before the unit caught fire. Also, I had 4 leaks. One required a 2 square foot hole to be cut in my ceiling above the shower that was left for 6 months. The maintenance refused to come finish the job. Towards the end I was contacting them 3 times a week. The office staff are snide and unwilling to work with anyone and frequently put their pride above the problems of their tennants. At night the noise of cars outside your window is so loud, you'll never get any sleep. Also, people frequently parked in the fire lane the entire night, blocking access to my unit in case of a fire. Again I say DO NOT MOVE HERE. They will show you a completely different unit than you will get. Pay the extra 50 bucks a month and live somewhere decent. Avoid these awful people at all cost.

resp.text: Hi, Tyler. While we appreciate all feedback, we're very sorry to see yours expressed in this way. name: Kourtney Tillman
text: I moved in April 10 and it’s been a nightmare since I’ve moved in. My tub leaked into the walls and flooded my kitchen so much so that it was OUTSIDE on my front step from upstairs in my bathroom.. this happened FIVE times, and wasn’t taken seriously until I went live on my Facebook to show the damage publicly. The laundry list of things that have only been halfway fixed since I moved in is ridiculous. The door covering my utility closet fell ON my three year old son because they left the door completely unattached. I was never told that you have to request pest control- there’s been so many bugs and a MOUSE in my apartment. There’s exposed insulation in my kitchen due to no sheet rock being put on the wall. SO MANY ISSUES ON TOP OF THOSE. Finally, as they’ve been working on my apartment (which we are on night nine of being out of my apartment), everything is covered in sheet rock dust. My furniture, my food in my kitchen, etc. NINE DAYS. That doesn’t even include the days I had to pester the assistant property manager about having maintenance come out to my apartment. They put me in a hotel for ONE night and then wanted me to stay in a “guest suite” (MODEL APARTMENT) at another property instead of paying for the hotel any more. After being informed by the property manager that there’s no tv, no internet, etc- I was not willing to stay there as I work from home. Both of my kids are home all day being that it’s summer. It was unacceptable. Now they want to offer $500 off my rent, when they should have put us in a hotel for the nine nights (so far) that we have been out of the apartment- which would have totaled $1,044. I’ve been dealing with this since the first week I moved into this apartment in mid APRIL and I have tried to give them the opportunity to fix it and do right by people who spend money in their company and community but I cannot recommend spending money or living in ANY Arlington properties owned community. Stay away from this property- nothing but a headache. Do not ignore the NUMEROUS reviews here and elsewhere like I did!!!

name: Olivia Andrews
text: When we first moved in there were already problems with the apartment. The closet door was off the hinge, the bedroom door wouldn't close, the hot water heater was leaking, the sink wasn't draining properly, another closet door wouldn't open, and there were roaches. There were also gnats in the apartment .  And when we moved in  we noticed that our trash can was outside and it was completely disgusting inside .  So that had to be cleaned out  and put back in the apartment  but I'm guessing it was already in the apartment and that's why so many gnats were in there .  However After about a month all our maintenance problems got fixed. Yet the roaches had not been taken care of. We ended up getting some traps and we still see some also we got drainage for the sink and fix it ourselves. We pay for pest control but they have not came. They don't respond to emails how they should. And when we first moved in a lot of important information was not given, like the mailbox key the code to the laundry room and they didn't tell us that we needed a laundry card in order to do our laundry and that we had to pay for it initially. It says that the apartment is fully equipped however it did not come with a microwave. There are never any parking spots. So we may have to go to another building to park and walk to the apartment. People let their dogs just walk around. One day I was approached by a pitbull, it was nice though however that should not happen. There are no lights in the bedroom or the living room. It does help to save power but it's kind of inconvenient. The apartment smelled like smoke when we moved in when they are supposed to be no smoking. Also there was a huge roach outside of the complex trying to get in but like I said since Pest Control wasn't there they couldn't take care of that problem nor the one in our apartment. Also  the entrance to our apartment has so many spider webs and even like our doorway has spider webs and spiders. last few times I sent an email it said message blocked so I don't know if they blocked me or what but the emails in the past had sent. I really would not recommend this place to anyone. Because I shouldn't have to be scared to walk in my kitchen from a roach as soon as we move into the apartment. Or even to walk out my door afraid that a huge roach will come in. Hopefully the problem will be fixed soon though because this is the beginning of our lease.

name: Mary Welch
text:
If I could leave no stars, I would.  We lived in a unit for just over a year and our leasing officer has changed 4 times within that year.  The foundation below our hot water heater is cracked and it very well could fall through to the unit below us at any time.  When we first moved in, we didn't have hot water because the hot water heater had a broken wire that was sparking.
The unit would have caught on fire had we not called the emergency on call maintenance.  This unit is extremely cheap, and it shows.  When we moved in, there were 2 leaks , one of which took SIX MONTHS TOTAL to fix.  For 3 of those months, there was a 2 ft hole in the ceiling above our shower.  They like to turn off the water supply without sending an email warning you, so good luck making coffee or taking a shower when that happens.  The complex is extremely noisy and neighbors blast music while sitting in their cars parked RIGHT in front of your window at all hours of the night.  Trash can be picked up from your doorstep.  While this seems like a good idea, most people abuse it and leave their nasty trash sitting for way too long, attracting animals and bugs.  #EW.  I don't like walking into my apartment and having it smell like weed, which it does at least twice a week.  (I use a lot of candles to mask the smell.)  We were shown an ENTIRELY different apartment than what we were given and had to take the unit given to us because it was too late to change/we already moved out of the previous apartment complex.

DO NOT MOVE HERE. Find the money and pay a slightly higher rent somewhere else.

name: Sherhonda Butler
text: The absolute worst place to live. The staff dismiss your complaints like you are the problem. Moved in 10/17, power was disconnected 11/17 because I didn't receive any mail. Told the ofc I didn't have a mailbox door they told me to send my mail to the rent ofc. Needless to say I didn't get a mailbox door until the end of January 18. Maintenance is rude and I actually had a maintenance man come out the door and confront me. Can't wait until my lease is over

name: Barry R
text:
We have lived here for two years. Up until last November or December when they were purchased by Blue Rock Partners, it was great. Since that time, it has gone downhill despite all the signs and banners everywhere stating otherwise.

They replaced everyone in the office, and with the exception of the lady just under the head property manager, everyone else is disinterested in helping anyone. They smile and say they will help you and take care of it, yet they do not. The pool is hardly ever open, and they seem unable or unwilling to try to keep it open for all residents to enjoy throughout the week. The advertise a playground, but a quick drive through the complex will answer that question with small children running in harm's way in the road because there is no place for them to play. They have started redoing the interiors, but they are not addressing the bigger problems such as shoddy subfloors that need to be repaired/leveled, poor insulation, and underpowered A/C Units for their town homes. You can dress up the aesthetic, but unless you address the bigger safety/quality of living issues, you aren't fooling anyone once they step foot inside the home. And with the rent being overpriced already, this seems hardly like something that should be allowed to go on by the owners, who are based in Florida.

Speaking of which, Regina, the Regional Manager, will NOT call you back or speak to you when you can't get anywhere with the local staff. And if you keep calling the corporate number, eventually they won't answer your calls there either. In this day and age where every thing is graded on customer service and resident happiness, they fail miserably at both.

I am not afraid to post this review here because of my right to express my opinion. I am not alone in this thinking either. Most of my neighbors who have been here for some time are looking for other places to live and letting people know that they are not impressed with the management staff here at this complex. This was once a TERRIFIC place to live, but no longer. Word of mouth is already getting around as I overheard someone at work asking about our complex. Before I could even answer, two other people spoke up and said that they heard it was overpriced and they didn't have what they advertised as amenities. So unless they do a 180, they're going to find themselves losing tenants. And I bet that even after reading this review, they still will not try to make amends for anything. That's how they operate as a company. Which is a shame, because it has the potential due to location and natural beauty, to be so much more.

text: The Park wakefield/wellington is a horrible place to live. We was without air  for a couple of months, the apartment had rats and roaches and its bad with the mold. Every time you tell the manger, you make it seem like its no problem. we had water damage, the floor keeps coming up. they charge to much money for bas service. text: We haven't had no heat since October! Reported in December again, and on record...still no results. Gave us some heaters, which raised our light bill over 200$!!! Looking for solution and compensation now. It's March now, but I bet they still want that 755$ for rent though.

name: Ci B
text:
It has such potential to be a upscale place to live.  However, that would require management to really tighten up on the tenants that are allowed to move in.  Supposedly a background and criminal check is done, I find it hard to believe considering some of the tenants I have seen move in.
Quite a bit of drug activity going on!
Let's talk about the parking! Be prepared to park quite a few units away from where you live and walk to your apartment. (Management seriously needs to issue parking decals and designated parking spaces) and if they don't abide TOW THE CAR!
Another thing was they claimed you get monthly pest control service, the entire time I was there, never saw it once.
Again I will say, this place has such potential, management tighten up!

Good luck to future tenants!

name: Gee Phil
text:
Out of the year we've lived at this apartment complex nine out of twelve months have featured the water cutting out. All but three instances were unannounced. The shortest outage was for 4 hours and the longest outage lasted nearly 2 whole days. (The office tried to claim these outages were not related to a long-standing plumbing issues on the property but instead related to the cold weather bursting pipes, but 4 of the 9 outages happened during the warm months [in AL] between March-November.)

On average, maintenance requests get filled around 3 weeks after they're put in IF at all. Most of the time to get them taken care of I've had to make daily stops by the office to remind them we still had issues that were not resolved. For instance, it took them over six months to replace a missing window screen that I reported AT MOVE IN.

The "valet trash service" we're charged for monthly rarely collects the trash on all the nights per week they're scheduled, there's been on-going problems with mold in our apartment due to a few leaks taking far too long to be repaired, along with issues with poor construction such as the dishwasher not properly fitting into the allotted space in the kitchen and thus causing unavoidable damage to the wall next to it each time it's opened and closed. Furthermore, the kitchen counter top has been slowly collapsing to rest on the dishwasher because it wasn't properly supported. This has caused a large crack to run nearly all the way across the kitchen counter top where it meets the wall. All these issues were reported months ago with little or no action taken for weeks on end if at all.

I say all this because the maintenance guys are here. They're seeing about fixing the ceiling by the kitchen which was damaged during a leak in our upstairs bathroom a couple MONTHS ago. They're ripping out part of the ceiling and making a giant mess in the kitchen I've already deep-cleaned in preparation for our move-out Saturday. (Whenever the maintenance guys do show up, they never clean up their mess, either.) I suspect they're only fixing it now because they have to in order to trick the next victim, I mean tenant, to move into this apartment.

Someone send help so I don't totally lose it on the office manager today. I've lived in both cheaper/smaller, and more costly/spacious apartments than this one, but this property has been hands-down the most poorly managed place I've lived.

name: Amber Watkins
text:
UPDATE on my deposit & part of my last months rent...  FYI I had to move out early because there was mold in my air conditioning vents after having a major water leak in my ceiling when the condenser broke.  That took 3 days for them to come look at (during the week when maintenance is on the grounds).  They wouldn’t even come look at the mold let alone take care of it.  So I moved out early, Sept 7th & just got my deposit back today feb 22nd.  I got a lawyer & magically got my deposit back within 2 weeks.  I was only there for 1 year & waited 5 1/2 months for my deposit.  During this time they have been through 3 managers.  It is the worst management I have ever dealt with.  The price of the rent sounds good $650 but after they dollar you to death with water, gas, garbage (that they never pick up), bug service (that they never do), you are paying $700-$800 a month and could get a better apt.  This place wouldn’t be worth it at $400 a month.

I moved out 3 months ago & still have not got my deposit back.  I keep calling to check on it.  They told me they mailed it 2 months ago & they keep telling me “it’s in the mail”.  They refuse to reprint a new one & mail it out.  They are still blowing me off and acting like there is nothing they can do to fix it.  In the state of Alabama they have 30 days to get your deposit back to you.  I shouldn’t have to stay on them to get my deposit back.  This is very unprofessional and annoying.

resp.text: Amber, we appreciate you sharing this review with us. We're disappointed to read your deposit has taken longer than expected to reach you. We are happy to discuss this with you and provide any updates we can. Please stop by the office or give us a call at (205) 823-9778 so we can address this further. Thanks again, Amber. - The Park at Wakefield & Wellington Team

resp.text: Johanna, thank you for this fantastic review! We're thrilled to read you've had such a great experience with our team. We will pass your kind words on to Nancy. Let us know if you need anything! - The Park at Wakefield & Wellington Team

name: Tokio Blahblah
text:
HORRIBLE PLACE TO LIVE. ROACHES ARE A HUGE PROBLEM

The apartments will not help nor take responsibility for the bug problem. Management is a disgrace.  DON'T EVER MOVE HERE! IT WILL BE HELL ON EARTH!

resp.text:
Hi Tokio,

Pest control will begin spraying each building at The Park at Wellington beginning April 12. We have already started on buildings that residents have been experiencing an ongoing issue as of March 15th. We understand your frustration and appreciate your feedback. To further discuss this issue, or any other questions or concerns you may have, please contact our office at (844) 329-8814.

-The Park at Wellington team

name: TIM
text:
Giving it a one star since I can't give GPS zero stars and leave a review. Managers don't care about the residents, they cut the water off without warning most of the time. I understand that repairs are necessary. They destroy property and never come back to fix it when working on repairs.
The workers are too lazy to actually check the water and electricity usage of each resident, so they just take a wild guess and charge us for that amount, most of the time being way more. Our monthly bills are never delivered on time and they get mad at us for not paying the specific amount, and if they do deliver it they just throw it on the porch, SOMETIMES they'll tape it to our door. But if they do it'll be a few days late.
The repairs call for breaking the road, and the road repairs can take up to months to be fixed. I'll be adding pictures of the roads later.

Edit: 7 months later and surprise surprise!! They haven't fixed the roads! All management has been doing is refilling it in with gravel that goes everywhere and makes the place look worse!

name: Mary Boroughs
text: Great experience with the staff of this community, very professional and friendly. Would definitely recommend to a friend or family member.

resp.text: Mary, Thank you for your review, we appreciate your business and are happy to know you had a great experience with Green Park South.

name: Donna Holcombe
text: Going on my second year at Vestavia Reserve and I absolutely love it. Living alone here I feel safe and secure. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the walking trail is perfect for a quick round of exercise. Everyone who visits my apartment is impressed with the quality and upscale features. Definitely a 10 out of 10.

resp.text: We appreciate you rating our community, Donna. Your comfort is important to us so we're delighted to know that we're exceeding your expectations!

name: Moe Taha
text: Neat.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review

name: sahar
text: Beautiful fairly new apartments! Quiet and safe. Been here a month and love it! The maintenance team are  always working to keep everything up to par and clean. The office staff is always helpful. No problems!

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful rating and review! We're glad that you are enjoying your living experience at Vestavia Reserve. Our office staff works very hard to provide all of our residents with quality services, so we're glad that you have personally experienced this firsthand!

name: Trey Link
text: Absolutely amazing place to live! It is the small details like the landscape crew that comes EVERY week to keep the property looking great! Also, the management is so helpful and quickly responds to resolve any issue that you may have. The maintenance team is hard working and always get to the work orders as quick as possible! You pay for what you get at Vestavia Reserve!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Trey! We're delighted to hear that you had a positive experience with our team here at Vestavia Reserve. We're happy to be of service to you!

name: Joy Albano
text: Love my community!!!

resp.text: Joy Albano, we are so happy to read such a great review about Vestavia Reserve! Thanks again for taking the time to leave us this information about your recent visit. Take care!

name: Laura Thurmon
text: Just moved into this apartment complex recently from Tuscaloosa. I live with two other nurses and work at UAB and this could not be a better location. The commute to work is short with minimal traffic. My neighbors are kind and considerate. I work night shift, so I sleep during the day, and its quiet pretty much the entire work week. Maybe in the summer and without a pandemic it will be more lively on the weekends. There is a nice walking trail and the pond and pool are a great view from my balcony. Great apartment for singles and families. The staff is friendly and helpful. Maintenance responds in a timely manner. The apartment is clean, updated and well taken care of. Overall, only great things to say about Vestavia Reserve.

resp.text: Thank you for highlighting us, Laura. It's great to know that you're enjoying your time in our community, and we're excited to keep making that happen. Thank you!

name: Ashley Weaver
text: I have lived here for about 8 months and have been very impressed. They handle issues very quickly and send out emails regularly enforcing rules and sending out information. You can tell they care about the community as a whole. The apartments are very nice and have good layouts. The location is great and the community amenities are top notch.

resp.text: Thank you for highlighting us. We're happy to know that we've exceeded your expectations and look forward to continuing to do so!

name: Khushboo Golyan
text: This would be our third year here at the Vestavia Reserve and we love it. Calm neighborhood, beautiful property and a dedicated management who takes keen interest in the betterment of the community and its residents. The maintenance team here is top-notch, their diligence and promptness is worthy of a special mention. Would definitely recommend making this your new home.

resp.text: Khushboo, we do our best to provide you with professional service, so we’re happy that our team has contributed to your wonderful experience. Thank you for all this positive feedback about Vestavia Reserve!

name: Maya Madden
text: Cannot say enough great things about Vestavia Reserve! The property is beautiful and the entire staff goes above and beyond to take care of their residents. Special shout out to Casey, Megan, Jessica and JR for making this such a wonderful community to live in!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your recommendation, Maya! We’re pleased that you recognized our efforts in making Vestavia Reserve a place you can call home. We look forward to continuing to provide the same high-quality service for years to come.

name: Amy Cobble
text: This is the best quality apartment I’ve ever seen by far. Well worth the price! Amenities are fantastic and the office crew is on top everything. Also perfect location for those of us who go to Life Time fitness 😊

resp.text: Hi Amy, thanks for your review! Our team is committed to providing our residents with the best, so we’re happy to read that you’ve experienced our high-quality service firsthand. We appreciate your recommendation!

name: Mike Johnson
text: This is an absolutely top-notch apartment complex. You get what you pay for...and you get the best here. There's no smoking on the property. Parking rules are very clear and enforced. In fact, all the terms of your lease are strictly enforced...makes for a very nice place to live.

resp.text: Thank you for your 5-star review, Mike. We appreciate your recognition and will do our best to keep up the great work!

name: Eliza Waller
text: Vestavia Reserve is by far one of the most aesthetically pleasing properties I have ever seen. From the apartment interior to the apartment grounds and amenities (pool, fire pit, fitness center, clubhouse, etc.), Vestavia Reserve has it all. Vestavia Reserve has truly helped make Birmingham feel like home!

resp.text: We appreciate you rating our community, Eliza. We work hard to provide residents with a great experience and look forward to continuing to do the same for you!

name: Amanda Justice
text: Just moved here and it’s been great so far! The office staff were really helpful with the move in process and the apartments themselves are nice. The location is also very convenient to shops & restaurants.

resp.text: Amanda, welcome to Vestavia Reserve! We know it can be a journey to find the perfect apartment so we're delighted that our staff helped you find the perfect home. If there's anything we can do to help you get settled in, let us know. Until then, we look forward to providing you the best in apartment living!

name: Maddie Rutledge
text: I have had a lovely time living at Vestavia Reserve so far! The location and property are great!  The apartments are spacious & functional.

resp.text: Thank you for highlighting us, Maddie. We're happy to provide residents with great service, and we're glad that you’re enjoying your time with us!

name: Maggie Elliott
text: I have enjoyed living at Vestavia Reserve! Great location and amenities, especially the walking trail and pool! I am glad I am able to safely interact with the staff as well when needed! Thanks!

resp.text: We appreciate you rating us, Maggie. We're delighted by your positive rating and look forward to continuing to provide you with a wonderful living experience.

name: Bridget Daugherty
text: We love living here - our apartment is clean, new, and quiet. We also enjoy the walking trail to Publix, the apartment pool, and gym. Great place!

resp.text: We appreciate you giving us a 5-star review, Bridget. We’re happy to make you feel right at home and hope to continue exceeding your expectations!

name: Eryn Krehbiel
text: One of the best apartments in Birmingham! The staff is so responsive and helpful. The amenities are great too!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. We’re delighted to read that our staff has been able to provide you with excellent service. We appreciate your review and are confident that your experience will only continue to get better.

text: Such an amazing property to live at with amazing management whom are very responsive when needed. Great place to live at and very highly recommend for those looking for an apartment 😁

resp.text: Hi Homar, thank you for taking the time to share some kind thoughts about our staff! Our team makes it a priority to be professional, accommodating, and courteous when providing service, so we're very happy to see that your review aligns with our efforts!

name: Elizabeth Kohn
text: We love our apartment and management has done it’s best during the pandemic.

resp.text: We appreciate your review, Elizabeth. We value your insight and look forward to continuing to provide you with a 5-star experience!

name: Lawn Chasers
text: Vestavia Reserve is by far one of the best apartments around Birmingham.  From the curb appeal to the amazing staff , it is by far top notch.  A property can’t run without a good staff though and this property manager,  Casey,  And the rest of her team have done an excellent job at making this truly an amazing property to be at.  I highly recommend Vestavia Reserve for all your apartment living needs.

resp.text: Hello and thanks for this lovely review. It's great to hear you've enjoyed your time at our community and that our team has made such a positive impression. We will be sure to keep up the good work and look forward to continuing to make your experiences here fantastic!

name: Nicole Payne McClelland
text: Wonderful community and amenities!! Higher end appliances is a definite plus!! Location is perfect!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your rating, Nicole. It's great to know that you're enjoying your time at our community and we're excited to keep making that happen. Thank you!

name: Amy Myers
text: Great apartment complex, apartment are new and up to date. Repairs, when needed, are fast and painless. The office staff are always gracious, accommodating, and happy to help. Very quiet, I lived here for 18 months and only heard any neighbors a handful of times. Highly recommended. Great for pets too!

name: Ella Kuuskvere
text: We just moved out, and are honestly sad to have left this apartment complex! We LOVED the walking trails, the active community, the pool, and proximity to Lifetime. We made tons of friends through the community there, and Ashley in the office was always super incredible to work with! Our apartment had some one in a million issues and maintenance was on top of it - JR was incredible. Super dog friendly, too! We'll miss y'all!

name: Kadeem Hubbard
text: I have been living here for several months and I love it. The gym is amazing and I look forward to the swimming pool this summer. The office staff is super friendly and attentive to any and all the questions I had when I first moved in. Jessica, Casey, and Megan made my move in an incredible experience. The maintenance staff is always friendly and helpful as wel . I highly reccomend.

name: Sana Anwar
text: I never realized the importance of an outstanding team and management for a place of residence until after I moved out and signed with another complex in downtown Birmingham. This place is beyond accommodating, always ready or in the office if needed and that coffee machine is regularly maintained. I was always able to pop in if I ever needed anything and was always treated with the utmost customer service. The management does an excellent job creating a family feel for the residents. I would sign a lease with them in heartbeat if I ever return! Move somewhere where your needs are addressed and accommodated in a timely manner like at Vestavia Reserve. Also Jennifer and Joy are a dream!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review.  We loved having you here and would be so thrilled to have you back again if you come back our way.

name: Katherine Ann Mitchell
text: Absolutely love this staff and this community! My husband and I have lived here since the property first opened and we love our unit and the service we have received. The property has a great family feel. We have worked with Joy since the beginning and she has been SO amazing!

resp.text: Hi Katherine Ann Mitchell, we are very happy to have welcomed you guys home here!  Thank you so much for your positive comments about Vestavia Reserve!  We love having residents like you guys!

name: John B.
text: My nephew was in town visiting and we made plans to meet. I had him wait by the office until I could show him what unit was mine. A lady in the office asked him 21 questions. I picked him up and had a great time. A couple days later I had to work later than expected. My nephew waited outside my door until I got off but was harassed by staff and same lady. He was told he had to leave. They are stuck up, rude, Racist and against family/visitors. Problems with management since day one. Didn't want to fix any of the failing shoddy work with fans and ac. Over priced junk wanting to be Mountain Brooke. Notice the staff only addressed the good reviews.

resp.text: John B, we are disappointed to hear that you did not have a more positive experience with us at Vestavia Reserve. We would like the opportunity to turn your experience around. Please reach out to us at (205) 977-7767 so we may discuss this with you.  Here at Vestavia Reserve, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear that you received anything less. Regarding service to your fans and a/c, if you have submitted for service and the repair was not completed timely and properly, please contact us immediately. We hope to hear back from you so we can make sure this doesn’t happen again.

name: Joy Ogunsile
text:
BEWARE OF ROACHES!
Disappointing experience with this apartment complex. I should have heeded to the advice of a previous review that commented on the roach issue. Over the span of a month, I’ve encountered numerous roaches in my apartment. This is after having pest control twice and a “surveillance” of my apartment for modes of entry. Though the apartment manager is letting me out of my lease without penalty ( guess I should be grateful for that👀), it doesn’t subtract away for the moving expenses to move to a new building, disruption from work, and the overpriced rent I have paid so far for a subpar luxury apartment experience. Pictures are below.

name: Alisa Bretz
text: So rude. Just hanging the phone  and not picking up....and i wanted to rent apartment there.... no way i will do it...

name: Luke Thomas
text:
Very nice apartments, excellent amenities, and a friendly staff! It's also very dog friendly and walkable. I love being able to get to Lifetime Fitness via the connecting trail, or going over to the newly-constructed Altadena Park that connects to the other side of the apartment's trail system.
Overall, VR is a luxurious apartment community in a great part of town.

name: Yvonne Powderly
text: Loved my year here.  The staff are considerate and timely in answering questions or concerns.  The facilities are wonderful.

resp.text: We were so happy that you called us home while you were here.  We wish you all the best and know that you will always have a home here at Vestavia Reserve!

name: Diana Morlote
text: Lived here for a year. The apartment was nice and lots of storage space. Unfortunately, there was an issue with apartment break ins and stealing of packages from the front door of apartments. I did not have my apartment broken into but people on my floor did and I found Vaseline smeared on my peephole to prevent me from seeing outside and witnessing the break in. Scary. I did however, have a package stolen from my front door. I know because Amazon/USPS takes pictures of the package upon delivery and it had been left in the frontdoor. When I went to pick it up it was gone.

name: william phillips
text: New owners, ran great staff off. Raising rates, hiding fees in lease (tried to raise rent again, after lease was already renewed, through add on insurance fee, but reflecting in addendum as additional rent), reducing amenities (no more 50% discount at Lifetime Fitness). Onsite gym is poor substitute. Saving grace is perfect location. If you decide to lease or renew, review every fee in lease agreement. New owners are nickle, diming tenants. New lighting is excessive and lighting up the inside of units at night.

name: Jennifer Vu
text:
Would not recommend this place at all. This place has been under different managment several times over the last 2 years. Each time there is a change in managment, be ready to redo your login, update your bank account online, receive tons of emails regarding how you need to pay your bills differently for "just this month". This becomes an absolute annoyance after you have to do this several times.

Additionally, there have been several incidents of cars being broken into, tires stolen off of cars, and apartments being robbed. All of which has occurred multiple times in the two years I've been here.

In terms of staff,  other reviews raved how "great" the staff are... The only person that is great is Joy and she's no longer here. The ones that are here now are just plain rude.

Lastly, we pay for pest control monthly and there are ROACHES EVERYWHERE!!! A maintenance report was done about a month ago, and they "addressed" it; however, there are more now. IT IS ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING.

name: Megan Jones
text: not sure why I can't get a response on social media or from their website?     guess they have been booked up everytime I have inquired?

name: layla ghazali
text: Since I moved in I have never had a positive experience with this place. Patio was Brocken and it took them along time to fix it knowing I have kids in the house. A lot of stuff was Brocken. Today I came back from work and they send me an email about noise complaint. The neighbor below me is complaining that my kids are making noise. Kids are kids and it's normal for kids to play and run about the house. May be they should say in the lease no kids are allowed in the apartments!. I tried to explain that this is a Normal kid behavior and they would not listen. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

resp.text: Layla Ghazali, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Thank you for leaving feedback. Please reach out to us at (205) 977-7767 so we may identify ways to improve your experience.

text: Amazing property. The staff and leasing agents have the upmost courteous customer service. Thank you for all you do Vestavia Reserve!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review

text: Great location.  Great people. Overall nice place to live.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review. We are so pleased to team with such great people to serve together.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review, we love having you guys here!

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: Obviously ran out of funds while building. Have been locked out of my utility closet since i moved in this past March. Both my ceiling fans have come loose from the wall and look like trash. I have lost AC 2x in the short period of time and have received a threat of eviction for noise complaints on days I was not even at the location.  So many short cuts were taken amung their building process I FILANNY got someone to come replace my air filter since they "forgot" to reverse the locks the filter was so clogged I couldn't scrape it off with my fingernails. It had been there since construction.  Many of the residence file unnessesaey complaints about "noise" on not only MY behalf,  and 90% of those complaints were made while I was away at work or staying somewhere else.  They have a nice pool but the residence do not comprehend the fact that apartments carry some noise. I received 2 complaints in 2 weeks when I have been here since March and they have already threatened to evict me when I was not even ON the premisis when the complaints were made. They have made most residence angry and we are planning on taking them to court because of all the problems. I would not even give it 1* if I could have.  They look and sound amazing but I would NEVER spend the money they ask to live here and am moving out ASAP!!!

name: Rebekah Pittman
text: The staff is efficient. Everyone was helpful.

name: Tania
text: Very nice...

resp.text: Thanks so very much for your review

name: Dušan Dravinec
text: The best place for living in Birmingham

name: Amber williamson
text: Honestly the best apartment complex I have ever lived in. The staff is very friendly and maintenance takes care of request very quickly. The pond with the fountain in beautiful and the pool is so nice.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We're delighted to know that we've provided you with a great experience and hope to continue exceeding your expectations.

name: Leila Deep
text: When my husband and I got married, he was already living at Vestavia Reserve so we decided to just move in to a larger two bedroom.  This is by far the nicest apartment complex in all of Birmingham.  The pool and the grounds are beautiful, and our balcony over looks the lake and fountain.  You really feel like you live at a resort.  The open floor plan with huge kitchen island, plenty of cabinets and large closets also make it feel more like a true home than just an apartment. Aside from the beautiful and well maintained facility, the staff are what truly set this place apart.  Everyone in the office is so welcoming and truly helpful - even with the smallest requests.  The maintenance staff goes above and beyond and they are very quick to solve any type of problem.  We absolutely love our home at Vestavia Reserve - it's been the best place to start our married life!

resp.text: Leila, Thank you for the high praise! It is always rewarding to hear that you are experiencing great service thanks to our dedicated team here at Vestavia Reserve. We look forward to further providing excellence for the entirety of your stay.

name: Chad Craig
text: Vestavia Reserve is by FAR the best luxury apartment living in Birmingham! The landscaping, amenities & staff alone set the bar even higher. After living here for over 2 years now, I don’t think I could live anywhere else! Maintenance team is eager to fix whatever you may need & usually done within an hour of your work order being placed. I highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks for the stellar recommendation, Chad! We're so glad to hear that our maintenance team has been so helpful to you. It's our pleasure to provide the very best services at Vestavia, and give our residents the comfortable lifestyle they deserve.

name: Reid Millican
text: Great place to live. A little pricey, but you get what you pay for. Courteous staff, fast maintenance and great amenities!

resp.text: Hi Reid, thanks for your review! Our team is committed to providing our residents with the best, so we’re happy to read that you’ve experienced our high-quality service firsthand. We appreciate your recommendation!

name: Abigail Davis
text: I’ve lived here for just over a month and it is EXCEEDING my expectations. The staff is always responsive and friendly, and maintenance requests are taken care of typically within 24 hours. Love love love this place!!

resp.text: Abigail, thank you for your stellar review on our community and for highlighting our incredible team! If you have any further feedback, please let us know. We appreciate hearing from our residents.

name: Courtney Wright
text: The best place I’ve lived so far! Very clean, Great amenities, and location. Love living here!!

text: My house has been leaking for months when it rains and they have yet to come out and fix it properly. If there is any electrical issues they have absolutely no clue how to fix it either. Very sad but you can’t fix stupid

text: I land rent and have no complaint so far.
