I have renewed multiple times due to the proximity to my workplace and the relatively low rent but working with management has been a nightmare. I have called and visited the front desk FREQUENTLY to try to get a hold of the manager but she is always conveniently "in a meeting." I believe the front desk student assistants do their portion of the job taking down my name, unit & phone # to have her call me back but I have NEVER gotten a call back. It has taken my roommate and I 2.5 YEARS of harassing the front desk student workers only to get a flooring issue "semi" resolved by the management. OCCASIONAL email replies as a result of the harassment is the only form of communication we have been receiving. I am also expecting TWO concession payments: one of which clearly states that it would be given out within 30 days (it has been almost two months now) of the lease renewal date and another for referring a friend. This latter one does not even have a contract or a form of agreement, so the only argument I have in favor of my case, is a screenshot of the advertisement from two months ago. When inquired about this issue, the office only came back to me and said that I would hear from corporate soon and took no action whatsoever to accelerate this process. The only positive side of this complex is that the in-house maintenance is usually quick to respond (and the high water pressure is a bonus). There have been more than enough hiccups with our air conditioning which eventually got switched out to a new one (most of the A/C units are probably in need of an upgrade due to age). Gates have been installed as a "solution" for all the shootings that have happened recently, but have not been activated as they are still waiting to pass out parking passes/gate access as we approach the THIRD month of the lease term. There have been three changes in management companies in less than three years, which should explain the mess that this apartment is in, but I believe the actual on-site manager, Christina, who has stayed at the site despite the changes, is a main source of all these negative reviews from current residents. If "short-staffing" is the issue here, please hire someone else to help her address these matters - this apartment is not maintained well enough to justify the rent and the lack of response that the residents are receiving.

resp.text: Clara, thank you for sharing this experience with us. We're pleased to know that you've enjoyed speedy service from our maintenance team and value our high water pressure! However, we are concerned with the lack of responsiveness you've received from management and can understand how that would be a source of frustration. We will call you soon to touch base and assess how we can best assist you, but please also feel free to reach out to us anytime at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. Thanks so much for your review and bringing this matter to our attention.

name: Kevin Pham
text: A great place to live!

resp.text: Thank you, Kevin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Jessica Staggs
text: When signing the lease, there was an issue with the signatures and no one there knew how to fix it; we had to redo the entire lease three times. Apartments have water damage just covered up in paint, luckily there have been no further leaks. Upon move-in, I was given the wrong mailbox and front door key. Other than poor management, the complex is clean and feels safe. Looking forward to the new managers under the Magnolia, so far they've been way better.

resp.text: Jessica, thank you for reviewing and sharing what peace of mind you've felt in our community. We want your entire experience to be great, so we're sorry to hear you've had concerns with our service to your home and upon move-in. We'd like to check in to ensure any unresolved concerns are addressed promptly, so a member of our team will call you soon. We also welcome your input at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com anytime. We look forward to connecting with you.

name: Hunter Taylor
text: The social is a great place for incoming freshman. Not only is the rent super affordable, the apartments are spacious and nice. The management team is so helpful. Johnathan Mitchell helped me handle a lot of information that I wasn't understanding and was so nice. It really spoke a lot about the management office and their willingness and strive to help all of their tenants.

resp.text: Thank you,Hunter! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! We'll make sure to let Johnathan know of all the great things you have said about him!

name: Joshua Williams
text: Great place to stay

resp.text: Joshua, thank you for your review!

name: M H
text:
I have enjoyed my time living at The Social and plan to renew my lease for this upcoming year. I wouldn't say my experience has been perfect, but you get what you pay for. As The Social is one of the most affordable apartment complexes in Auburn, you shouldn't come here with overly high  expectations. For the price you pay, this is a great complex. They are not as renovated as I had hoped, but the appliances are in good working order, which is all that matters to me. Management has worked with my roommates and I each time we have had an issue. Recently, they credited our accounts after a broken AC unit ran up the power bill. Next week they will be replacing the unit. Maintenance can be slow to respond at times, but this typically coincides with times when many people are putting in requests, such as on move-in day. The staff at The Social are always helpful and have resolved each issue I have presented them with. I would say overall that The Social is a great place to live and I would recommend it to others.

Update: Since my original review, all of my kitchen appliances have been replaced. The kitchen was completely redone and I was told I should be getting new furniture in the near future. A new management team has taken over and made vast improvements to the property and to many, if not all, of the units. Currently they are resurfacing the front pool and soon they will be putting a dog park in the back of the complex. I am still very satisfied with my living experience at The Social and I still recommend it, especially now!

resp.text: Thank you, MK! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you ever have any issues during your stay, please reach out to us and let us know!

name: Samantha Adams
text: The Social is a pretty nice place to live. The office staff is super nice and try to help you however they can. They recently changed management companies and there have been a lot of improvements since. The apartments are already upgraded, but they've recently been remodeling all of the kitchens and they look amazing. The prices are good and relatively cheap, and you get what you pay for. I would definitely recommend living here.

resp.text: Thank you, Samantha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! Let us know if you need anything during your stay.

name: Tianna Surls
text: Good apartment for students

resp.text: Tianna, thank you for your review!

name: a A
text: This complex is a joke. I’ve lived here twice and had 2 leases and I regret it. The first time, they charged me for rent that I did not owe after I went to the office multiple times to clear this up. This second time, there was a shooting outside my building and the power hungry management team  responded by implementing very strict parking rules that are not needed. The complex never issued us guest parking passes in the first place. They complain about non residents parking in guest spaces when they never gave their residents guest parking passes which would have cleared that problem to begin with. Most apartment complexes issue their residents one parking pass and a guest pass but not the social! It doesn’t matter if your friends or family come to visit and they leave their car for 49 hours, they will tow it. They obviously had massive resident backlash from this policy otherwise they wouldn’t have sent out an email basically giving their own residents the finger. last time I checked, Adults live here not children so management should stop treating us like children. Trust me. There are better apartment complexes in Auburn.

resp.text: Andrew, we regret to hear of your disappointment as our resident. It is our mission to provide you with an excellent home, and we're sorry if you've been displeased with our management and parking policies. Thank you for allowing our Manager the chance to connect with you directly this week, as we appreciate the opportunity to better understand your experience and address your concerns. And don't hesitate to reach out directly in the future, at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, if we can be of assistance in any way. We appreciate your residency.

name: Woo Pettway

name: Radini Dissanayaka
text: I recently moved into Social and I really really love it. The staff is super nice. I first signed the lease in March but I had to cancel it bcz of some problems with my sublease of my previous apartment. Social management were super cool about it and canceled my lease without asking any questions which I really appreciate. Then I again signed my lease after a month. There are no deposit whatsoever when you move in. You only have to pay the monthly rent (when move in) which is great. It is one of the most affordable apartment complexes in Auburn and the apartment you get for your price is worth it. Plus if you sign your lease during their promotional time period you might get lucky and get a gift card :) The apartment was well cleaned when I moved in. They recently replaced all the Kitchen appliances and the Kitchen  was completely redone. Now my apartment looks even better. I have had bad experiences with some other property managements but my experience with Social so far is nothing but best. I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: Thank you, Radini! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you need anything in the near future, please stop by the office and we will be glad to help.

name: Devin Jiles
text: The Social is a great place to stay. Walmart is walking distance along with Burger King and Wendy’s. Beds are furnished and are as comfortable as It gets. Bathrooms are in the rooms and are decent sized. Very quiet and great views outside. Good places around the complex for reading or doing homework outdoors.

resp.text: Thank you, Devin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

text: If I could I would give this place 0 stars. I have lived in multiple apartment complexes and this is the worse place I ever stayed. I would recommend that no one move to this place. The staff and management is very disrespectful except Stephanie I would recommend that she be the new manager. I have been so disrespected that I almost felt the need to press charges. Anytime you try and speak to management it is always an excuse why they can’t speak and they always say they will get back with you and the never do. If you are considering this place do yourself justice by moving elsewhere. I hope that waypoint management step up and make changes if not I could see this places shutting down. They are giving away a $2000 to sign and have rent dirt cheap and that should say something because no one likes to live here.

resp.text: Willie, we are sorry to hear you so disappointed. While it's uplifting to know Stephanie has impressed you with her great service, we deeply regret if you experienced interactions that were anything other than professional and courteous. We'd like to better understand what has happened, so we will give you a call shortly to gather more insight. In the meantime, please feel free to connect with us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. Thanks so much, and we look forward to our conversation.

name: Ky Delane
text:
Worst place ever! Management is always changing. They are unorganized. When I first move in the apartment was a mess. Then my roommate kept taking what wasn't hers and when I confronted her about it she got scared and told the office something else and they made me move to a different building in the apartment complex.  It's a good location because Walmart is right across the street. When my lease was up I moved out and was suppose to get my security deposit back. They claimed they didn't have my forwarding address (which I wrote down on the move out paper and outside the envelope I turned in) so they sent it to THEIR address and told me to come pick it up. Once I got there they claim the move out check wasn't there and I drove 30 minutes from another location so I basically wasted my gas. Still waiting on my security deposit refund. I have called numerous times and even called the company that owns the social.

UPDATE:!!!
I moved back in about 2 years later since they had changed management thinking things were going to get better. They fined me for putting trash outside my door right before I took it out. They just want every little dime you have. Company and management sucks. Still didn’t get my $150 gift card they promised for resigning my lease. This year DEFINITELY WILL NOT be resigning for next year. It’s like living in a damn dorm or jail. What’s the point of having an apartment when they still micro manage everything you do

resp.text: Hi Ky, I am sorry for your bad experiences at our community. We are always looking to improve. Can you please email me, info@magnoliaatauburn.com and I will look into the $150 gift card that you did not receieve. Thanks, Levi (Community Manager)

text: The dedicated and friendly office staff are extremely helpful!

resp.text: Thank you, Shelly! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!! -Levi (Community Manager)

name: Tiauna T.
text:
I really enjoy the convenience of this location. There are two ways to enter and it’s very close to everything. If you do not have a car that is no problem. Walmart, Burger King, Wendy’s, etc are a quick walk up the street. What I love most about this location is the fact that there are no gate codes. You can get home ASAP.

I never worried about safety. I see security frequently patrolling at night to make sure we’re safe. Also, parking is not an issue. I’ve always found a spot for me and my guests when I have them. However, the Tow company does not play. If you are not in a visitors spot come night time your car will be gone. I’ve experienced this before I was a resident. Lol

I absolutely LOVE my apartment. It’s so cute and spacious. The closets are huge walk ins. The lighting is beautiful. I have no issues with my apartment if I did, maintenance was here the next day. I’ve never lived anywhere where maintenance showed up so fast. Speaking of maintenance they are also pleasant and clean. I’ve dealt with maintenance men who would get the job done and leave tracks of whatever they fixed, but not here.

The complex has many events for us. I haven’t partaken in taco Tuesday or waffle Wednesday yet but I did attend the ice cream social and I didn’t have high expectations for it. BUT I was surprised. They didn’t bring the cheap ice cream. They actually brought good options. They actually care!

In conclusion, yes, I recommend this place.

resp.text: Thank you, Tiauna! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you need anything just give us a call and we'd be happy to assist you.

name: Jonathan Moyer
text: This might be a cheap place to live but it’s the by far the worst. I live here now and the management could be better if 5 year olds were in charge everything they promise is a lie to get you signed and then they don’t care about your needs. They promised a workout room and basketball court and we managed to finally get into the basketball court no lie the first week of February and just today were told they will not open it until the summer. They never gave us a code for the workout room. This place honestly just needs to get rid of every single employee and start over. Also the hot tub that was promised only was filled in at the end of January. Unlike other apartment complexes that get everything ready before people live there they half a** everything and might get one thing done when you only have a few months left of living there.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, thank you for sharing your feedback. Our team strives to provide top-notch facilities and services for your enjoyment, and we regret if you've experienced anything less. We are working to renovate and improve those facilities as we speak and would love the chance to speak with you about what is to come and how we can serve you in the meantime.Our Manager will be reaching out to you shortly, but we wanted to give you her direct contact as well: SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. We appreciate your time and the chance to improve your satisfaction. Thanks in advance for the opportunity to restore your trust.

name: Tyarriah Smith
text: Not that bad of a place to live at. But when you need information and you try and call them, they NEVER answer the phone. Place could be managed way better.

resp.text: Tyarriah, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Please note, this is a very busy time for us and sometimes some calls do go missed. You're always welcome to stop by the office at anytime. We are open 7 days a week and we'd love to see you! Office hours are 10AM - 7PM Monday - Friday 10AM - 5PM Sat and 1PM - 5PM Sunday.

name: Ghost
text: this place is great just wish i didnt have roommates and wish i had the whole place to myself to feel free

resp.text:
Hello,
I completely understand that sometimes we just want our own place!  The Social does have a few studios but I quickly.  You might try stopping by the office to ask if they know of anyone needing to have someone take over their lease.
Try, contacting them at socialinfo@waypointstudentliving.com or call them at
(334-239-4233.

Enjoy your summer!

name: GemiDoll Galore
text: Do they accept people with past evictions?

resp.text: Hi! Thank you for inquiring! We comply with all fair housing laws and cannot determine an applicants eligibility until their screening is processed. We encourage you to complete the application on our website and we will alert you after the application and screening process is complete. Please let us know if you have any other questions. Thank you- Christina (Community Manager)

name: Maria Daly
text: Let me be honest, 1 star is too high of a rating for The Social. The staff is very disrespectful. If you sit in the office all you hear is them complaining and being rude to everyone that walks in. They don’t seem to care at all about their jobs and it shows. They don’t have any answers or have the slightest idea about what is going on. You ask them a simple question and they don’t have an answer. They ask for your number and say they will call back, not to my surprise they never call back. Go ahead call and ask them a question...I dare you. THEY WILL NEVER CALL BACK. Please if you are in incoming freshmen or looking to sign a lease RUN, The Social is absolutely horrible. The walls are paper thin, so if you want to hear your roommates tip toe in the middle of the night to go get a drink, this is the perfect place for you. You can hear a sneeze from two rooms away. But hey if you love parties at 3 in the morning every night of the week and people screaming outside your window, bingo you’d love it here. When I first moved in the air was broken, the place wasn’t cleaned and my toilet flooded the bathroom. It took maintenance a week to install a new toilet, that’s now loose. The air conditioning has broken 3 times in the summer and once in the winter. Everytime you do your laundry you have to restart the drier 4 times or you clothes will still be wet, maintenance came hit it with a wrench and called it fixed. Don’t sign a lease with them, you will regret your decision all year long. RUN!

resp.text: Maria, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact Elvin Philpot at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience.

name: Leah
text: Rent is way too high for all of the gunshots that occur each month. 12-20 shots just went off this morning at 9 am.That is the third shooting in a span of two months. To live in a place where you are scared to walk outside morning or night is terrifying. I will not be resigning my lease because this place in general is a terrible place to live.

resp.text: Hi, Leah. We understand the apprehension you may be feeling because of this incident, and are sorry that you feel this way about our community. We remain thankful that no one was hurt and those responsible (not residents of our community) have been apprehended by the Auburn Police. As always, we hold your peace of mind as our highest priority, and we will call you shortly to listen, answer questions, and support you. Please also know that you can email me anytime at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com to share any concerns. We appreciate you!

name: DeVontae Williams
text: Love the new look and upgrades in the apartments! They have a great staff that’s very helpful! Enjoyed my time here so far

resp.text: Thank you, DeVontae! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Daniel Jager
text: The rooms are okay. Maintenance is very kind and front office staff are nice. The actual property is unkempt and ownership doesn't seem to care. There are no security cameras and the gym is basically entirely broken. Out of 8 cardio machines, there is one that works. If you want a cheap place to live that has okay rooms and nice people....this is the place for you

resp.text: Daniel, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Social Auburn.

name: Keith Campbell
text: I am TOTALLY displeased with this complex!!! My son Aaron Campbell was going to move in this semester but due to a family emergency (my daughter having a heart attack) he was not able to attend. Our family has other financial obligations to fulfill at this time. We contacted the management company in well enough time so that someone else could lease the apartment but they refused to assist us in any way knowing we live in Chicago.  Also when he did find someone to take over his lease they gave him such a hassle that he refused to sign the lease. To make matters worse they signed a different lease with the person so that my son would still have to honor his lease “that is totally a scam”.  Why would you try & destroy a young persons credit for some unforeseen circumstances. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!! They are heartless, unprofessional, barley answer the phone, and please don’t have anything happen where you can’t honor your lease. They are going to stick it to you!!! All I can do now is get a lawyer involved so my son credit won’t be destroyed, I hope this helps someone so they won’t make a bad decision.

resp.text: Mr. Campbell, this issue has been resolved please contact the Community Manager, Elvin Philpot at 334-887-8740 for more information.

name: ChangetheCircumstances
text: Maintenance is punctual and has always done their job, the best part of the Social. There's a huge ant problem however in multiple complexes that rises up every time there's warm weather. The property is constantly changing owners though and currently the prices are going up so will likely not be affordable for the average college student soon.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback and compliments for our maintenance team. However, we're sorry to hear of your concerns with our pricing and seasonal pests. It's important to us to provide you with an exceptional living experience, so please come by the office or connect with me at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com so we can fully address these concerns and ensure your continued time here is truly enjoyable. Thank you.

text: I like it here but, sometimes my neighbors get in fights and I can hear everything! Also the stairs are very loud. Other than that it is an OK stay:)

name: Kennya Ross
text: Very POOR reviews on this place. I have stayed in University Village now for about 3 years. When I first moved over here it was under different management than it is now. The second year was not so great, my roommates and I was living in apartment where the cabinets door fell off the day we moved in. Which it was only hanging on by hope then.They NEVER came to fix it the entire TWO years we stayed there. Then, once we moved out they wanted to charge us that fee. Yes, we know kind of jacked up since we had put it a work order for it the day we moved in and it fell off. This year I stayed here by myself, my roommates had it with them but, due to the fact I use the Interstate to travel back and forth to Montgomery its closer so I stayed. BIG MISTAKE. I had to pay them $200.00 to transfer into a two bedroom apartment which they stated I could move in mid July. I did not move in until LATE AUGUST. The apartment I moved in was not cleaned properly especially the carpet. The reason I say that was b/c when I moved in here they carpet cleaners people says they were suppose to clean the carpet in the apartment, which was suppose to be VACANT I assume since they came. Well folks the carpet cleaning people NEVER showed back up. So now in this apartment, there are PEST  in the carpet and its literally attacking me. HOW SPOOKY is that. In the words of Dr. Cunningham there are fleas in the apartment. Yet, I have NO DOG NOR ANY OTHER TYPE OF ANIMAL. So that had to come from someone who lived here before me. They don't follow the roommate matching paper that you do. They stick you with anyone here. The people at the front office is VERY RUDE!!!!! I would not dare waste another year over here. Its so unprofessional, and they have no care about if the apartment burns down. If you have another options (which there is) please don't come here.... SINCERELY AN ANGRY RESIDENT!!!!

name: Leigha Bell
text: love it

resp.text: Leigha, we appreciate your feedback! Thank you!

name: Ting Du
text:
Totally a gross place!!!!!! People who live you around made big noise almost everyday!!!!! And the manager here did nothing!!!!

The people in the same apartment may throw their garbage outside your door!  Office was reluctant to deal with this problem after complaining for so many many times!!!!!!

Try to choose a place make you comfortable!
Never  ever choose this place! !!!!!!!!!

name: Dr Shwazz
text: I lived here the first two years I was here at Auburn. I moved out officially on July 31, 2018 and signed the move-out form. Come to notice a few weeks ago, I see a near $5,000 charge on collections for unpaid rent...which makes no sense because I clearly moved out of that apartment. There has to be some mistake. Credit took a hit for no obvious reason.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for any inconvenience, and assure you that the new management team here is working diligently to get to the bottom of what happened. Thank you for keeping in contact with me at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com as we work to resolve your concerns quickly and fully. Thanks, again, for reaching out.

name: dalton derr
text:
Inside of the apartment was the only good part of the complex, if you only care about where you sleep, it is an okay place.

Grounds were poorly cared for, including leaving trash and other debris (sticks, dog poo) in stairwells and sidewalks. Pools would close for maintenance without notification, packages would sit at office for days without notification. Maintenance was over worked and understaffed, no point in on-sight maintenance being advertised if you still have to wait 36 hours for A/C repair, and 3 weeks after move-in for the shower to be operational.

Would be a decent place to live if, complex was bought out by another company, and they upped the price to get bad tenants out. Using that extra revenue to employ more maintenance, and actual grounds keeping.

name: Elijah Hampton
text: Awesome experience at the social.  Staff is great and apartments are exactly what I need. NO complaints on my end.

resp.text: Thank you, Elijah! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Marisa Sitanggang
text:
Too bad google review does not allow us to give 0 star. I barely live here for 2 months and I already look for another apartment to live next year.
Update: maybe the management team doesn’t know how internet works these days. You can reject my comment on your portal. But google review is uncensored. Keep that in mind

resp.text: Hi Marisa, we welcome all feedback and appreciate honest reviews as they help us improve our community. Our Leasing Manager is trying to get in touch with you, as we would like to further understand & fully address your concerns, as well as let you know about some exciting enhancements coming to our community. Please feel free to reach out to me as well, at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, if there's anything I can do to improve your experience. Thank you in advance for the opportunity to connect and renew your faith in our community.

name: Abigail Wilkins
text: I have had many issues since moving into these apartments. Maintenance entering my apartment unannounced and leaving the door open when they left, shootings, lost packages, etc. When I attempted to reach out to the manager about these issues she either waited a month to respond or simply ignored me all together. It has been nothing but trouble since the day I moved in. I will be moving out as soon as my lease is over and discourage anyone from else living here.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your review, Abigail. We expect our staff to be helpful and courteous, and we sincerely regret if you've had delays in service and an unsatisfactory experience.  Should you ever have a similar experience, do not hesitate to stop by the office or email us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com if you have any further thoughts to share. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Chanel Blackwell
text: I regret moving my family here. The office staff are nice but they seem very unhelpful and never able to solve a question or request its always come back.  I had to stalk to accountant for over a month. Every time I come she's not there. Till a month later making a appointment and she doesn't have a clue to what I have been wanting to see her for.  Its very unprofessional, unorganized, no courtesy, and lack of time management. If you make a request for a work order you mine as well flag maintenance down because you will be waiting weeks close to months.  I have a one year old and the air condition was leaking I had been in the office three times. As always they wtite it down but never really document it and you keep having to repeat your request to each worker.  I just flag down the maintenance man and he fixed it. I walk to my car its dog pop every where. Its always a loose dog so be mindful coming out. Do not move here. Looks great on the outside but very unhelpful and unworthy of your coins.

name: Aleecia Jones
text: Living here is okay but I just hated the roommate matching. I always was roomed with people who smoke entirely too much weed and had other people living in the apartment. I’m so glad I didn’t renew, The social says they don’t allow any smoking on the property but that’s not true. Also it is unsafe on the property, it’s a new issue every week.

resp.text: Thanks for reviewing, Aleecia. We're sorry to hear that roommate issues left you dissatisfied as we always want our residents to enjoy their home with us. We'd like to connect with you to better understand the concerns you've shared and address any problems, so we will give you a call soon to chat. Please also reach out to us anytime at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. We wish you well!

name: Nicole Finley
text: I actually lived there and enjoyed my time being.. Maintenance requests answered quickly.

resp.text: Thank you, Nicole! We love hearing that you enjoyed living with us, here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Amber Lee
text: Awful place to live. Don't live here. Really...DO NOT LIVE HERE. It's terrible. No pest control. Snakes and bugs everywhere! Extremely thin walls, can hear everything your roommates are doing and also can hear everything the people above you do. I hate it.

name: Won Valerius
text: The social game under new management about a few months back and it’s been night and day from before. The management and staff are super helpful and timely with any requests you put in.

resp.text: Thank you,Won! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: YMB KELIAN
text: I've Visted The Complex A Couple Times, Wonderful Environment, Nice Office Staff, But Most Of All Very Nice Apartments Inside Out!! Highly Recommended!

resp.text: Thank you, Brittany! We love hearing that you enjoy our team here at The Social Auburn!! Next time you're in town, stop by and say hello!

name: tahseen munshi
text:
Obviously would give this zero stars if I could… this is beyond the WORST living experience I have ever had, and I’ve been at a lot of apartments.. seriously, stay away if you want to stay sane.

Let’s just start off with the staff/ management. The staff is extremely rude, no professionalism whatsoever. If you have a concern and try to explain it to them, they never let you speak and try to talk over you. I’ve left their place in tears because I was never reassured that my concern would be taken care of. They talk to you in a condescending attitude and act as if it’s your issue to deal with, and that they have "no responsibility" over it and shouldn’t have to deal with it. They act as if it’s an inconvenience on THEIR part, even though this is their job…

If you requested random roommates, congratulations, they pair you with the ones who don’t meet your compatibility/ preferences whatsoever. Mine was the complete opposite of me in regards to cleanliness, noise, having friends over, pets, etc. Then they expect YOU to figure it out when there’s conflict, even though the pairing was done on THEIR part. Don’t even bother indicating your preferences on that little “Roommate Matching” sheet because it makes zero difference.

The first time I got my keys, I was paired with a MALE. I’m a female… which apartment complex pairs males with females? That just goes to show they don’t even look at the preferences you provide in regards to floor level or roommates. So I had all my stuff ready to move in, but I had to be delayed because of the FIRST mispairing on their part.

I moved into another unit but realized soon enough that this female and I would not work as roommates. You can’t randomly put people together and "force them" to work things out. Some people are just NOT meant to live together… There are things such as pets, having guests over, and electricity use etc that people just aren’t willing to compromise for. After my roommate situation got out of hand, I again went to management demanding a new room assignment. He sat down with my roommate and I and we still couldn’t resolve our issues. He first told us to just "put up with it”  until our lease ends. Oh okay, so I’m paying $600 a month to “put up with” someone who’s making my place basically UNLIVABLE for me. Y’all, I’m not lying when I say I would have to look for excuses to be out. I felt as if the place wasn’t even mine… and hated being there because I felt uncomfortable. Anyway, so he FINALLY agreed to move me out into another unit. So that weekend, I packed up all my stuff, said sayonara to my roommate … and guess what? I NEVER heard anything back from them. I tried to get in contact with them multiple times and… nothing. They lied to my face, and when I came back to them AGAIN regarding roommate issues, they acted as if they did nothing wrong on their part.

resp.text: Tahseen, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.

name: Tosan O
text:
The service in the front office hasn't always been the most welcoming. I can count several instances where I was received with less than acceptable service. Management has changed so hopefully this will improve. Also I've been owed $1100.00 since I moved into the complex in August and am yet to receive this. I am met with story after story and the front office staff refuses to let me speak with a manager to get to the bottom of the issue.

UPDATE: 2.9.17 - THEY SENT ME A 1099 TAX FORM FOR $1200 !! THEY ARE TRYING TO WRITE IT OFF ON THEIR TAXES AND HAVE ME PAY FOR IT.

name: say M
text: Staff at social just sit, gossip on the phone and play and shop on the office computer all day long. Complained about utility bill $300/month plus $ 460 rent and $25 insurance. Management cannot resolve any roommate issues. They cannot show the utility bill for which I have to pay,. Complained about people doing bad stuff and management said its going on every where, its College town and its normal. I cannot risk my life and career here. Looking for some other place to live now and still have to pay this lease.WHAT NONSENSE!!!!  Don't stay here even if free!!!!!

name: alexandria c
text: I have been waiting a while to write a review hoping that my experience would get better but it has only gotten worse. When moving in they told me that the keys to my apartment had not been cut yet that I would need to wait in line for 45 minutes. it was actually closer to two hours. Then I get to my apartment to find that my bedroom door was kicked in and had no way to lock it, they where made aware of it immediately. (it took weeks for them to come and half way fix it). Also there was a roach infestation in every room and my roommates and I had filled a maintenance request on it multiple times. I then went to the office and the bug people came later that week. It took about four weeks for them to actually go away. The apartment was supposed to be newly renovated and mine was not. It has patched walls where someone had started to repair the walls and didn't sand them down or paint over them (this is in every room). the walls are covered in stains and sticky stuff and it does take a while for maintenance requests to get done. The towing people also love to screw you. If you do not have you tag hanging up even if it is on your dashboard they will tow you. I saw an older guy hooking my car up and went downstairs to explain to him that it was right there and he said that it would be $50 because he had already hooked it up or $100 if he towed it. of course I paid it. The security here sucks because it wasn't even 12 am yet and there was domestic dispute/violence and you could hear the female screaming but no one was around to do anything until the cops where called. Also if you choose random roommates they do not do a good job picking them out. They put my neighbors with a person who had a cat when they specifically said they where allergic to cats and then once they figured it out they put them with a another roommate and she also had a cat and they did nothing about it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND LIVING HERE... I believe that some of the staff does a good job at there task but the management is awful. I know about ten other people here who will not be living here next year because of the things I listed above and many more.

name: Catherine Marine
text: Super fun place to live. Office staff is awesome and really helpful!

resp.text: Thank you, Catherine! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Kristian Singleton
text:
The staff is super unhelpful and disrespectful. I’ve had problems with my neighbors, and they only wanted to listen to one side, and not help me at all. On top of not taking my complaints about my neighbors into consideration, they also expected me to pay double my rent in the time span of 2 days. Also the maintenance is unhelpful as well. My roommate asked for the dryer to be looked at because it wouldn’t start and they just looked at and never did anything else about it. I would definitely read all the other reviews before moving here and would not recommend moving here at all. No one is helpful. You get what you pay for there so that’s one good thing.
Edit: After putting in another mantinenqce request the guys did a great job of coming to replace our old dryer :) and the girls in the office are super friendly, but management is really no help at all

resp.text: Kristian, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having.

name: Matt Youngblood
text: This is the worst Apartment in the Auburn area. They did not give us a power bill until four month then gave us one big bill. They also put me with roommates that are not compatible with me. They do not answer the phone, and they are so disorganized. The Social also has trash all over the parking lots and outside of the dumpsters. I would highly advise not living here. I've been here five months and I wish I would have saw reviews like this before I moved to Auburn. The rent is cheap but the experience and environment is horrible. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

name: LaJessa Harris
text:
I Love It Here! I've been living here 2 yrs and it has really helped my independence. I was born with a disability called Cerebral Palsy. I drive around the property in my wheelchair all the time. Sometimes I even drive to Wendy's, Burger King etc. God place me here for a reason. The staff gets along with me very well. They're constantly asking if there is anything I need or can assist with.

I see low ratings on this page. No place you live is going to be "PEACHES N CREAM"! You have to communicate with the staff and managers. Let them know things in a respectful way and smile. I know your readting this and saying to yourself WHAT, but just think about it. If we approach people right and handled situations in a better way, then it could help open their eyes.

If anyone would like to meet or have me help a staff tour you around, just inform the office and ask for LaJessa Harris.

God Bless You!

name: 张竞攀
text:
It's hard to say..... Is the revenge from dishwasher? But It just been fixed last week. And this is the first time we use it😒. And if there is someone from the social office see this comment, please help us to think about the problem about the air conditioner, the maintenance people said they can't help with the problem. So maybe transfer us to another apartment which has a worked AC? After all we can't live without AC in summer.🙂
Our apartment number is 2005.

We got a good solution finally.
Thank you!

name: ZEA Meng
text: NEVER solve the problems. ALWAYS creating new troubles. Don't choose it even as your last choice.

name: Fazia Baker
text: WORST PLACE EVER!!!!! Do not live here. Management sucks!!! My dryer never worked from day one and I constantly put in requests for them to fix it. (Never did) My carpet looked a mess the before I moved in. A couple of friendly staff members. Dumpsters are super far from most buildings. I requested to live on the 1st floor and got stuck on the 3rd. Stupid visitors parking, the visitors parking is too far from most buildings. Horrible place to live. It is not worth the rent.

name: crazyjdkid
text:
Stayed with them for one year after spending my other 3 years at another complex and wished I had never left the other one. Move in had no organization at all, was given numerous incorrect keys and so were the roommates. Most of us gave up after a bit and just shared.
Once we get to the room, it was in horrible shape. Most apartment complexes inspect units and ensure everything is in functional shape before a tenant moves in. This is not the case for The Social. I had somewhere in the range of 8 work orders just from day one. Dryer wasn't hooked up, kitchen sink didn't work, ice maker didn't work, garbage disposal didn't work, half our lights didn't turn on and the list goes on. It was roughly 2 months before the Social actually addressed some of these issues, and it took a heated email to corporate and literally CC emails to everyone in the company. There excuse was they only had 2 maintenance men for 1000 units, as if other complexes around Auburn don't have that many.  When they were repaired they were not fixed correctly and I ended up having to go back and fix their mistakes.

The unit wasn't clean on move in. I bought a $20 vacuum at Walmart did 5 passes on the carpet and the bin was full.  Our countertop was charred and burned and so was the carpet, neither of which was replaced during the stay. The day of move in about 6 guys in "The Social" worker shirts , not sure if they were maintenance just spent the day seeing how long they could keep the maintenance golf cart doing a wheelie. Not professional, and definitely a waste on man hours for the company.

There was never a maintenance schedule to the units, I had to remind them each time that they needed to replace the air filter for the AC unit. The unit itself was an old R22 unit that costs more to run than that in my previous unit that was three times size. The light bulbs in the unit are a round fluorescent type that cost a small fortune to replace and barely produce enough light to see in the living room.

The majority of the office staff are rude, and love to place blame on others. They had blatantly lied to my face about packages arriving simply because they didn't want to go find it. Many times I had asked to see the property manager, and the simple response was that "he is on the property but not in the office." I said I'll wait for him to get back and they claimed he probably wouldn't be back and they could only contact him if it was some sort of emergency. I eventually got ahold of him by CC an email to his boss and his boss's boss. As a business this is extremely fishy way to operate and train your employees. They lost our check as well and then proceed to try and evict us, then blatantly ignoring us in the office when we went to confront them. Even with check receipts from them written in their handwriting and with their signature they did not believe us.

To continue their *optional* utility subcontractor made a clerical error,  and charged everyone for power even though we didn't sign up for the service.  Instead of the head office taking care of there contractor all at once the property manager instructed the office workers to tell the residence to handle it themselves. I had no affiliation with their contractor, and yet again they wanted me to do their job for them.

The general property is not taken care of. Many railings and posts along the steps are missing, along with the wood that is all splintered and heavily cracking. They have a poor locking system on the  basketball and exercise rooms where anyone with the code can get in. So when  people from other neighborhoods come in and trash it they blame and punish all their residence for there inability to provide a halfway decent secure locking system. Most of the equipment in the gym didn't work anyway, so no real loss there. There is 1 dumpster for about 3/4 of the apartments that is a very long walk away compared to most complexes.

The only pro I can think of is they did have a bowl of mints in the club house, most of which were stale but still edible.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.

name: Robert Hillman
text:
First, my neighbors all like to be loud all the time and the staff likes to blow non-existent leaves at 8:00 AM in front of your window. Maintenance likes to walk in to my room at about the same and when they see me sleeping, giggle and say "Whoops, sorry, maintenance." What really confuses me, is how they show up more at my house when I haven't requested maintenance, than when I actually do. It took over 2 weeks to actually see maintenance after submitting several work orders the first day. If you ask anyone at the front desk anything, prepare for at least 3 different answers and for none of them to be correct. As previously mentioned, the internet they provide is excruciatingly slow. Don't expect to be able to play any kinds of online games or watch Netflix without serious buffer times. Parking is TERRIBLE for visitors. There are only 105 guest parking spots for everyone in the apartment complex. So don't expect to be able to have more than one friend over without them getting towed. I recommend The Social for anyone who wants to legitimize ongoing anger issues.

UPDATE: Well they had forgotten to post electricity on our bill. So once they finally noticed, we got a notice on our door saying that they would charge us $40 a month per month they missed. This is insane. What's more insane is that once we logged in to check our bill, it had jumped to $50 per month because they felt like charging more. In all seriousness, this place is awful and I would honestly recommend that you live anywhere else in Auburn.

name: Brandice Marie
text:
I can't give a 0, so there's one star.

The maintenance is pathetic, never on time, and never gets the job done the first time.

Last owners were incompetent, but were at least apologetic over it. These owners are incometent, rude, and refuse to work with their tenants.

Neighborhood sucks and has nothing but rude, inconsiderate tenants- both in the Social and near by.

I would reccomend living under a bridge begore this place.

resp.text: We thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Unfortunately, we are not able to locate you using your alias. So if you could please contact Elvin Philpot at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience, we would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having.

name: Elaine Arnwine
text: Nice staff and apartments. Starting to get a little pricy though.

resp.text: Hi, Elaine! We're so glad you value our staff and your apartment. If we can address any concerns with our pricing, we'd be happy to listen and discuss options! Please visit us in the office anytime, and thanks for the great review!

name: Amboy Shop
text: I've been living at The Social for almost a year now and I even renewed my lease for them back in November..BIG MISTAKE. When I initially moved in my washer nor dryer worked, my toilet did not flush, only two of the things on the stove worked. All of this the first day of moving in, I had to report my issues a few times before someone was sent to fix them, I understood due to them having only one maintenance guy and he is super nice. Even with these issues I overlooked them because the apartment was nice and ok for the price. As time went on I had numerous issues with billing and them adding charges for electricity to my account multiple times for no reason resulting in large fees that I had to pay to them out of pocket when my electricity was hooked up with Alabama Power and has been. I still overlooked these things, but other things continued to break. My dryer still does not work properly I have to start the dryer over 3-4 times for it to dry clothing which makes doing laundry extremely long. The renovations to the apartment makes it look better and worth the amount I'm paying, however, WiFi is included in the rent and stated as such in my lease but I have been without WiFi in my apartment since the beginning of May and I have contacted them about this and they stated for me to call and send a technician out but a technician has not came out and I have been contacting Charter back and forth for over a month now. If you bring your own router you can connect to the WiFi and establish your own WiFi for your apartment. This was working perfectly fine with me until their workers came to redo the carpeting and flooring in the apartment. Now for me to have the personal WiFi that I had in the past I will have to PAY CHARTER MYSELF FOR WIFI MONTHLY WHICH IS RIDICULOUS. If I'm paying Charter for WiFi then there is no reason that it should be in my rent, the $49 I have to pay Charter should be deducted from my rent. The office staff is really nice but they don't understand a lot of things and aren't much help with things outside of paying rent and the front office. On numerous occasions I have went to them for packages that we delivered and that they signed for and they would tell me that they did not have my package and I would not get it for 2-3 days when they finally decided to do some work and sort through the packages. They don't do much work and rarely are doing anything when you enter the clubhouse. I initially love living at The Social due to it being in a great location, good parking, and located very close to campus. But now I am beginning to regret resigning to live yet again at this nightmare of a place. Whenever there is an issue the property manager of office staff will attempt to contact you to save face but ultimately won't try to fix anything. If you can move somewhere else that will look at you as a priority and not just a rent check. Don't LIVE HERE & I AM NOT CONTACTING THEM WHEN THEY COMMENT ON THIS REVIEW LIKE THEY CARE!

resp.text: Ebony, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact Elvin at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience.

name: DCM7734
text:
Ok place to live. they pick and choose what parts of their lease to enforce.
Living conditions aren't the best. Been complaining of mold and mildew for months with nothing being done about it.
Pets are not safe as residents have pit bulls who attack others off leash. Then when you threaten legal action, The Socials response is to move the problem neighbors and do nothing when your car was conveniently keyed days later.

resp.text: Caleb, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. As discussed, please get with our office to facilitate the time you would like to speak with a manager.

name: Anna Gates
text: I have lived here for two years and have yet to have a good experience with this place. During the summer there is crap in the pool and a sheen on the top of the pool from who knows what. The hot tub does not work the majority of the time and it's completely disgusting. Our washing machine broke, then they "replaced" it  with a brand new one and  the water hose broke; not to mention, it took them about a month to actually replace our washing machine! Their typical response when you have a complaint: "Thanks. I've put in your complaint and someone will be by this week." This is a completely false statement. I have trouble getting them to do ANYTHING! Our microwave and our sink broke down, both of these took longer than a week to get fixed (which is completely unacceptable because you need a sink to wash dishes/cook food!!). My roommate studied abroad for a semester and little did she/I know that the apartment complex was charging her for the furniture package (even though there was no furniture in her room) and for electricity every month! She had to go talk to them every week for a month before they agreed to reimburse her! Rent is due BY the 4th, but they charge you $75 if you pay ON the fourth. Their online payment system has been down before so it was impossible to pay on the first of the month and yet they did not extend the deadline to pay for rent...a problem that is completely their fault! I have never had to deal with such poor management before.

name: kay
text: It was difficult to adjust when I first moved off campus but the longer I lived here the more I started to like it. I do f have to go all the way to campus to swim or go to the gym and the apartments are pretty nice in general.

resp.text:
Thank you, Kayla! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you ever need anything, please let us know.

- The Social

name: R. Campbell
text: Definitely the worst apartment complex to live! Avoid at any cost!  The people at the front desk are rude. The management don't care at all. They appears super nice before you sign the lease, and after you signed the lease, their attitudes changed tremendously. Their staff are extremely mean! Honestly, worst apartment complex I've lived. Don't live there. Don't get trap into the renewal specials, which are all lie.

name: TAC
text: If you're thinking about staying here, don't. Run away, as fast as you can. I don't know how this place hasn't gotten a lawsuit yet

name: Macie Land
text: Poor management. I feel bad for the people that work in the front office. renovations that essentially require us to pack up all of our belongings.... normal apartments do serious renovations BETWEEN tenants. not to mention we were given less that 24 hrs notice that we would have to empty out all of our furniture... when i asked where i was supposed to put all of my stuff they told me the BATH TUB. I guess I wont be able to shower until renovations are done??

resp.text: Macie, notifications via email and flyers went out last week to all residents about the upcoming renovations. We have had multiple attempts to get in contact with you about your problems at The Social. Please stop by the office to meet with our management. We'd love to make your stay here better.

name: Chelsea Little
text:
DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!! It is terrible. It was originally the University Village when I moved in, but now they just changed the name to The Social to draw more people with new painting on OLD buildings.
After the new management (The Social), whoever didn't renew the contract is having pain in the a**. The office spokesman sounds like he's having problem with me when I am explaining my difficulties at here.
They are rude to you when you are moving out.

Three or more gunshot happened at the complex, explaining the unsafety part.

I don't even want to give a star for the rate.

name: Beibei Lin
text: If I can give the rate of zero, I’ll definitely give zero to the social apartment!!! Don’t ask me why, because it deserves it! It really sucks!!That was the worst experience that I had in the social apartment.

name: Drinking That Kool-Aid
text:
I usually don't leave reviews but the amount of negative reviews about apartment complexes in general is insane.

So, I'm going to break the norm of recent apartment reviews here as this one is overall positive.

I'll start with the BAD first:
- Common area isn't very clean (twigs, dust, spider webs around) - could use some occasional pressure washing
- Wooden stairs are quite loud when people are walking up and down
- The management/employee back-and-forth communication amongst themselves and us tenants could use some work - most of the staff is quite nice and willing to help but it was odd when I asked a certain staff member one question and someone else the same question, I got two different answers.
- Inside the apartment (initially) - cabinets had some hair in it (women who either didn't clean up well or maintenance overlooked it), door knobs are a bit clanky/loose, there was a roach (very small) in the bathroom but roach spray solved that, walls have some paint discoloration in certain areas, a small dent, windows have no blind shade adjuster stick, dryer lint wasn't clean and microwave door handle did come off once. Other than that, nothing major.
- Move-in day was cluster of craziness with double parking everywhere making it difficult to navigate, but that was only a one-day thing - management was a bit disorganized that day I must admit.
- Apartment lights weren't very bright

And now the GOOD:
- Brand new carpet - very nice
- Staff for the most part is quite nice
- Pretty area
- Close to campus
- Lots of restaurants, shopping areas, gas stations and the like nearby
- Open space to park your car
- Love the bus transit system that runs every 15min-20min
- Basic appliances work fine
- Excellent value for the $$$
- Lots of amenities include in such a low price

I don't understand the mass amount of negative reviews - maybe the old management/maintenance team really was bad, who knows. I feel as if these negative reviews are either competitors logging in and talking trash to each other or old tenants that had really extremely high standards for the money they were paying and were disappointed when one little thing went south. Or maybe just people only leave negative reviews.

$395/mo for a 3-bedroom with utilities included (minus electric) even with a few faults really should leave no room for anyone to complain. But I guess one little bad thing and people love to b*tch about it. I mean, come on, the equivalent apartment (quality, amenities, overall) in the North would be hundreds if $1k more per bedroom - if you wanna be realistic. Be grateful!

Remember - this is an off-campus student apartment complex, not a premium villa!

Keep up the good work!

name: Abbi-Storm McCann
text:
If there were anything lower than one star it would be awarded to the corporate management of this property. A few good people in the office cannot make up for the complete lack of organization that is happening. This is an apartment complex that is owned by an outside company (Trinity Properties) that I know has no idea what is happening at this site.

I hope you don't want to go to the office before or after work because they won't be open (10-6). I hope you don't want to have people actually come to visit your apartment because they will towed even though there is plenty of parking, just not enough visitor spaces. I hope you don't mind walking across a dark, threatening parking lot when you do actually find a visitor parking spot.

Long story short - don't live here. You won't be helped, by the office (who's hands are tied) or by the non-Auburn corporation that owns them.

name: 张蓝心
text: if you don't want to waste your money just far away from this apartment

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact Elvin at 334-887-8740 at your earliest convenience.

name: MEGAN E
text:
Why you should not move here !

1. They will change your rent price.

2. They will add on to your lease after you signed and now all of a sudden you have to pay for all these extra things.

3. Always under new management so new rules everyday.

4. When they do inspection they don't lock your doors back.

5. No application fee No deposit sounds great until they add it in your rent after you moved in and tell you ,you will be reimbursed later.

6. You will keep getting eviction notices although you paid.

7. The accountant is never there so don't bother wasting your time to talk to her them they whoever it is cause I never met this accountant cause I guess she lives in Texas or something.

8. You will never met with anyone they will tell you to make an appointment then be "busy" although there on there phone in the office laughing .

9. Wifi doesn't work !

10. Computer lab no printer ink , no batteries in mouses , no internet connection in the lab .

11. One parking pass for yourself and one for one friend ! Car will get towed if you don't park in visitors parking with a parking pass . 100.00 to get your car out ! 30$ a day after ! I'm pretty sure the social hired a towing company to tow there residents cars to make a profit !

12. Leaf blower ,painting , at 9am !

13. No communication they just leave notes on your door and then won't answer phone calls and emails !

14. Roommates move in and they don't tell you.

I'm sure there's more ......

#suethesocial

I never do reviews but when others should be warned I do ! Don't make the mistake I did !

name: Jaylynn James
text:
An absolute NIGHTMARE!!! Whatever you do, do not move there. TERRIBLE customer service, surprise charges, and maintenance could take up to a MONTH to respond. There's has been shootings and many other incidents and management doesn't even bother to apologize. ZERO STARS.

and in response to the owner's response: of all things to speak on? SMH. I address surprise charges and shootings and you reply about a maintenance request...

text: So I moved in on Aug 16 and I was under the impression that the apt was going to be ready when I moved, but I guess I was wrong there were a few  things wrong, the day I moved the lock of the FRONT DOOR was missing, had to call to get it install, no water  preassure on one shower, the shower head was change, and the bathroom lock was fix so problem fix, the hot plates on the stoves were not working, they were also fix but that was after I complain that things hadnt been fix and the firts maintenance guy that drop by my apt was rude, so they send a different one the second time he was really nice and got some  things fixed, BUT  not all of them, I was told that I was getting a new or they are replacing my microowave because it doesnt work, its still the same idk if they are building the freaking microowave or what is taking so long. And my biggest concern is my A/C so I've call like 10 times telling them it doesnt work, every 3 or 2 days I have to turn it off because it freezes and no air comes out, so I turn it off and you can hear the ice creaking and water dripping, What do I have to do to get things fix. I dont even want to call the office anymore because they only answere you with "we'll submitt a work order for you" and noone comes out to fix it.

text: The worst place I have ever lived. It's only cheap because it's terrible. The apartment was filthy, on move in day, appliances were broken, the a/c is extremely weak, and The carpets are very stained. The property manager is lazy,  incompetent, and really doesn't care about her job or the tenants. The response time between management (front desk) And tenants is awful and if you want a response or maintenance request  you pretty much have to beg. Overall this place is terrible and only gets business because iTs one of the cheapest apartments. Save yourself and GO ELSEWHERE!

Please feel free to come by the office, give us a call at 334.887.8740, or reply to our email (from  SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com). We look forward to connecting soon and appreciate your patience in this process.

text: This place sucks. My internet has been down for more than a week. They told my roommate it should be fixed on a Wednesday and it wasn't. Then I asked and they told me Saturday, and it wasn't. My dryer takes 5 hours to dry a small load of clothes and I asked them to replace it and they haven't and I honestly don't think they ever will. Our thermostat isn't working properly so our air is usually running all day and we can't do anything about it. They still haven't brought us furniture yet and the "State of the Art" workout area is god awful. Overall the management f****** sucks, the employees suck, and the complex as a whole, and as an individual apartment sucks.

Based on the name provided, we are unable to locate you in our system, so please com by the office or email me at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com to share any details from your experience. Thank you in advance for the opportunity to improve your opinion of our community.

text:
Terrible place to live. Management is awful. My internet doesnt work and they dont even follow their own lease. They are lucky I have not sued yet.

The 1 bedroom apartments do not even resemble the layout that they show on their website or the ones THAT ARE IN THEIR OFFICE. There is a total of 3 lights in the one bedroom apartment. One for the door, one for the bathroom, and one for the kitchen. I hope you do not need a light for your bedroom!! The place was filthy when i moved in and I was promised new furniture in September.. Still waiting on that. The gift card that I was supposed to receive in August on move in day, I finally received in November. This place is awful. I cannot stress enough how bad this place is. Please do not live here. ANY PLACE IS BETTER.

-VERY unhappy renter.

text: I moved in August 2015. Management changes very often but that just life but it seems like no one communicates. First i was told that we wouldn't have to back pay for the power bill that had added up for almost 5 months, then all of a sudden we get a bill that has to be paid in 2 or 3 months. Second i was supposed to get $400 for referring another resident, at first i was told that we didn't have to fill any paperwork out and that the checks were going to be delivered. After that i was told by another RESIDENT not a front office staff that we had to come to the office to fill out a paper that would take 30 to 90 days befor4i received the money. I called at least once a month only to be told that it would be coming late February early March. Early March came and I went to the office to ask about my check only to be told that they lost my paperwork, so i refilled another paper out waiting for the check once again. I've called multiple times to see about the check only to be given a run around by the office staff.

text: The gym is still not available, however, it’s advertised as an amenity!  It has not  been open since August of 2018. It is now  2019.   It’s currently used as a storage room.

resp.text: Hi Erica, we hate that it took awhile to get things up and running and apologize for the inconvenience it may have caused you. You'll be happy to know that our basketball court is open daily from 9am to 10pm and the fitness center is available to our residents 24/7. While we are working to renovate and upgrade those facilities for our residents, with new equipment set to arrive in the next couple of weeks, we are working to limit the amount of time those amenities will be unavailable for you. We'd like to connect with you to  share the exciting plans for our new amenity concept, as well as answer any questions you may have, so a member of our team will call you soon. As always, we welcome you to reach out via email at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, or in person, if there's anything further we can assist you with. Thank you for reaching out, and we look forward to improving your opinion of our community very soon!

We are sorry to hear that you are unhappy with our community.  We value your opinion and and hope that you will stop by and visit us in person or email us at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com.  We look forward to finding a resolution that would work for you.

Sincere thanks,

text:
Management is not helpful whatsoever. I've put in 3 maintenance requests over the past 2 months and none of them have been met, nor have I even been contacted that they would be fixed. They are looking for anyone and everyone to move into these places and then are not helpful when they match you up with someone that does not fit your standards of life. Student staff help is terrible. After filing multiple complaints about maintenance issues, I went into the office and had to wait 10 minutes before I was waited on because the student staff were too busy running around the office playing tag to assist me with the situation.

The apartments themselves are newer but what ones I have been in are already so run down it looks like they were built 15 years ago.

Overall, like the title says, DO NOT LIVE HERE! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

name: Leah Middlebrook
text: RentMonster, and Jessi in particular, was an incredible help for my remote search for a new apartment in Birmingham! She was very responsive and went out of her way to make sure I had all of the information I might need. She was very thoughtful and made the dreaded apartment search easy and fun. 10/10 would use RentMonster again and recommend them to anyone looking to rent in Birmingham!

resp.text: Thanks, Leah!

name: Meagan Belflower
text: I had a hard time finding an apartment after a bad landlord experience, and was tired of trying to sift through reviews, prices and locations. While searching I saw an ad for RentMonster and thought I'd give it a shot. After typing in my information, Jessi called me the same day and set up an appointment with me THAT afternoon. RentMonster did not charge any fees, and Jessi was super helpful and drove me around Birmingham looking at different places. RentMonster will NOT work with slumlord landlords and has even "fired" rental companies that do not match certain standards. Couldn't be happier with the location of my apartment and the company that runs the property. Thanks RentMonster!

name: Anh PT Do
text: Sherwin was very professional and helpful during the difficult process of moving to Alabama from far away. He made my move easier. definitely recommend their service to anyone

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words, Anh! We hope you enjoy your new home and love living in Birmingham!

name: Art Hill
text:
I recommend Rent Monster for anybody who’s getting their first apartment or anyone who wants another apartment quickly. I submitted my info online and then I got a text the next day.

Ashlyn was my leasing agent and she was AWESOME. She showed me around to places within my budget and gave me all the details about the application process with them. She was super accommodating for my schedule and she sent me pictures and videos of potential places to help me decide on what I want. She was super professional and very casual. I felt like one of my friends was helping me find my very first apartment. I hope she gets a promotion really quickly because she deserves it.

resp.text: Thanks, Art! We will make sure Ashlynn sees your kind words. :-)

name: lauren ray
text: I sought out assistance with finding an apartment last May and Caleb Clark was my lovely representative who helped me in every way possible. The process was smooth and I ended up finding a wonderful one bedroom apartment within my price range and location that I asked for. Caleb was extremely polite and informative with every question I had and with details of each location we looked at. I always recommend them to my friends when they begin looking for somewhere new to move. If you’re looking to move contact RentMonster and ask for Caleb, you won’t be disappointed!

resp.text: Thanks for this very thoughtful review, Lauren! We will be sure Caleb sees it!

name: Michael Lindsey
text: Caleb came through for us in a huge way. We had a few days really to get set up, so things were tight. We met at the office, went on a walk and got to know each other. He was kind, generous, and good humored. He asked good questions to get to know us and what we were interested in, and we were signing documents within hours, if I recall. It was clear he wanted us to find the best place for our needs. He stayed in the mix with us as we transitioned into the property owner system to make sure everything went well. This experience for us couldn't have gone better. A godsend.

resp.text: Thanks, Micheal! We're so glad you had such a wonderful experience. Please stay in touch!

name: Molly Sharit
text: This service should not be free!!! I had such a wonderful experience with Caleb, he helped me find a wonderful apartment in less than a week! He listened to all of my concerns about my wants and NEEDS in a place, as well as price range, before setting up multiple tours for me and I was able to sign my lease that same day! I could not recommend this service more!!!

resp.text: "Should not be free", you say... hmmm... maybe... Nah, just kidding! RentMonster will always offer our service for free! We couldn't be more grateful for your kind words. Thanks, Molly!

name: Kathleen Dexter
text: If you need a place to live and you need it fast, no hold-ups, no waiting periods, and zero fuss with multiple leasing offices, do yourself a HUGE favor and contact Caleb at RentMonster. He’ll get your parameters in a brief survey interview, run your qualifying numbers, and have a list of places ready in less than 14 days. My roommate and I were guided through SIX different apartments within the few downtown communities we loved most. We said Yes To The Glen Iris Apartment and we’re moved in within one more week! Thanks Caleb, for making us feel like we picked out our first home. We got everything we wanted!

resp.text: What a magnificent review! Thanks for your faith in us, Kathleen. We'll be sure Caleb sees your glowing words!

name: Odion Ovbiagele
text: I was assigned to Mary Alice and she responded to me less than 24 hours after I completed the form on their website. She asked me for all of my preferences, and sent me a list of apartments to consider on the following work day. My roommate and I were able to find a place and sign a lease in just three days! Mary Alice was a delight to work with and made sure to specify important details in the leasing process, something that many other agents/property managers have not done for me in the past. I highly recommend using Rentmonster, especially for people who need to find housing ASAP! Ask for Mary Alice!

resp.text: Thanks so much for these kind words, Odion!

text: I recently started grad school at UAB & I used rent monster to help me find the perfect apartment. Ashlynn Phelps made the process smooth and easy, and she got to the root of every issue I thought I had. All the places she showed me were super nice & I was able to pick my best choice among a handful of great choices. I love my new place. Ask for Ashlynn!

resp.text: Thanks so much for these kind words, Darrian!

text: After sifting through various online listings and touring several apartments, a friend suggested that I try rent monster. Robin was excellent! I would use rent monster again and will definitely encourage friends to use them/Robin as well!
