text: They didn’t have anything for me which is fine. I didn’t fall into their criteria but the communication was not good they reached out Monday. I responded and they ignored me and reached back out Wednesday and apologized, tried again and ghosted me when I had a follow up questions which sucks because I qualified for the final place they sent me. But the properties they work with would prob not be too happy with lack of communication, maybe they need more people on their staff.

resp.text: I think we may have different perspectives on your experience. Our text and phone records do not match up with what you describe. We would love to communicate with you and see if we can figure out where the confusion is. Please feel free to call the office.

name: Colton Windsor
text:
After struggling to find a place in Birmingham in my budget and in the area I was looking for, a family member suggested I try rentmonster. I filled out a short form on the site detailing specifics about my search, and I received a text message response from Ashlynn within a few hours - and this was on a Saturday no less.

Ashlynn was great - she found multiple places that fit all of my specifications before the coming Monday and set up remote tours that we conducted over FaceTime. No option felt like a waste of time and Ashlynn had answers to almost every question I had about every place. Anything that she didn’t have info for on hand she found the answers and got back to me almost immediately.

After I made my choice, Ashlynn assisted in the application process - which went more smoothly and quickly than any I have experienced. Instead of having to leave voicemails with property managers or trade emails back and forth I had a single point of contact that I could reach out to over text and got responses within minutes.

Even after moving in, Ashlynn has reached out to make sure everything was satisfactory and continues to answer any random question I may have about the apartment.

This is a great service, and Ashlynn was a great rep!

resp.text: Thanks a million for this fantastic and detailed review! We're super happy that Ashlynn was able to make your apartment search such a smooth experience. :-)

name: Kevin Wright
text: Had a great experience with Jessi. She was very helpful and got me in a place within 2 days! Highly recommend this service.

resp.text: Thanks so much for these kind words, Kevin!

name: Jordan Fincher
text: Sarah truly went above and beyond to make sure my daughter and I found the perfect apartment. She was so quick to respond to my questions (and believe me, I had A LOT!) and made the process go by smoothly. She was such a reassuring presence the whole time, I'm not sure what I would have done if I had tried to do this alone. I couldn't have asked for a better apartment finding experience. If/when I decide to move, I know who I'm calling!

She made the apartment search, application process, and lease signing so much easier by getting me directly in contact with the right people. I will be using Rent Monster again!

text: I am completely blown away by how easy and pleasant RentMonster made finding an apartment. I worked with Sarah and she made the whole process super simple and quick. text: Recently used RentMonster, specifically Jessi Nystrom, to find my new place and had such a positive experience that I've already recommended Jessi to friends! text: Rent Monster was awesome! I had to move to Birmingham all the way from Michigan and was not able to come visit beforehand so I was coming in very blind. She took videos for me and as many pictures as I wanted and did not try to hide the flaws of potential apartments. Was very honest and helpful and made my scary cross country move, much easier. Also, its free! There is no reason not to use Rent Monster to help you find a place.

text: I'm such a fan of this crew! I'm especially appreciative of Melissa's patience...but it paid off!!! I am so excited about my new apartment in Avondale :) THANK YOU!!!!

name: Geoffrey Harrington
text: So first thing first, finding the time to apt search is an extremely difficult and time consuming experience. my wife and i decided to utilize rent monster and had a great experience.Leah truly was a God send she went completely above and beyond to help find us something that we would be satisfied with. Life happens and certain situations arise that are out of a persons control. Leah not only understood that but made it her personal mission to help resolve an issue we had been having with one particular company here in Birmingham. Kudos to her and the amazing staff at Rent monster for truly earning our business. Definitely appreciate it!!

text: I love Rent Monster, I love my apartment, I love the price I pay for it, I love my neighborhood, I love the care package they sent me after I moved in, I love Melissa who helped me find this place. Can't recommend highly enough.

text: Outstanding service. They have access to apartments that are not listed anywhere on the internet.

name: Thomas Jones
text:
I had to make a spur of the moment move from Tuscaloosa to Birmingham after I got a job here and the commute was killing me. Rentmonster was an absolute life saver trying to find an apartment around town.

I was initially staying in an extended stay hotel trying to find a place, doing hours of research every night, and because of my work schedule I couldn't tour many places due to their limited office hours. I heard about Rentmonster and it just made sense. They have a ton of connections with apartments around town, a huge list of potential properties, and best of all: it was free. I had an all the benefits of an expensive broker without paying a dime.

My particular agent, Jessi, went ABOVE AND BEYOND to help me out. With my work schedule we couldn't do much during the week - she worked with my schedule and met me on a few Saturdays/Sundays when she normally wouldn't be working. Jessi was very easy going, professional, insanely knowledgeable about the properties and apartments in the area, and the whole staff made me feel at home from the moment I walked into their offices. Jessi worked with me over the course of a week or two, whittling down the places I did and didn't like, and eventually found  a place that I ABSOLUTELY love - which is surprising considering how picky I was. Throughout the whole process, Jessi was very patient working with me to find exactly what I wanted.

Kudos to Jessi, and the rest of the Rentmonster staff. Over the course of my apartment search I spent a fair amount of time in their offices, and they were all very welcoming and wonderful, one of the best customer service experiences I've ever had. I highly recommend Rentmonster if you're looking for an apartment and you're overwhelmed at the sheer number of other avenues and options offered from other apartment services.

name: stalexis glenn
text: I moved in Friday 8/9/19. Upon moving in my air wasn’t working, called and they said they would send some one out. 2 maintenance men came out but my air wasn’t fixed. When i called back they said they would not come out unless it was 85 degrees or more. They did not fix my air until 8/10/19 after i called that morning and told them i was hot and someone needed to fix my air that day. Second problem on my move in day, my tub was clogged. I put a work request in on 8/9/19 no one has yet to come out. I called 8/10/19 they said they will mark it urgent & someone would be out that day. 8/10/19 i took a shower & the water did not run out i had to scoop dirty water out & flush down the toilet. I called 8/11/19 & 8/12/19 about the tub being clogged and they said someone would fix it that day. I come home from work 8/12/19 and it is still a tub full of dirty water. I call the maintenance line and he said he would mark my request urgent and send the on call maintenance man to my apartment ASAP. As the air conditioning man was fixing the air in another apartment he knocks mine out somehow i called about that also. So the on call maintenance man calls me and says that he tried to come out but didn’t have a key to my apartment so i asked him what i was suppose to do about a shower and he said “the best i can do is be there in the morning”. AFTER i was told it would be fixed today. Cable line are ran from the upstairs apartments to the bottom. I asked if he fixed my cable he said the line was cut and spectrum was coming out tomorrow. I called spectrum and they had no record of this. Then he said the air conditioning man would be out & i am STILL without air. Moral of the story they will tell you anything to TRY to keep you happy. It has been problem after problem after problem and i have not been here a WEEK YET. My air is still out, my tub is still clogged, i still do not have my cable & WiFi hooked up. I WOULDN’T RECOMMEND TO MY WORST ENEMY!!!!

name: Stacy George
text: Great business to rent with.

name: Leandria Goodson
text: They are probably by far the worst people to rent from. Been a tenant with them for many years and it did not start off this way. What I love best about them is the maintenance department who first of all doesn't "fix" anything..they will "patch" things up and give you a bogus maintenance charge when you report the issue to them again. Oh and not to mention the person who handles the maintenance requests is a real joy to deal with over the phone, as this person is rude and very unprofessional.  Something else that I truly love about them is how they will send you bogus late fees  if you don't keep up with when you paid them and how much. My advice to any new tenant is to keep copies of your rent payments and if you pay online take screenshot of the paymment confirmation.

name: Only Truth
text: I rented 1836 Glendmere Dr Vestavia, AL. This house is a disaster to live in, especially when the property manager (Don) doesn't repair anything. The house basement floods when it rains, there was mold in ceilings, and the plumbing has issues. Do not rent from this company they only want your money and will not assist with their property.

name: Sarah B
text: This company IS BY FAR the BEST rental company I have rented from. From day ONE...Victoria, Amy, and Sarah have been EXCEPTIONAL. These ladies work hard and help in any way they can and we appreciate their constant support!! Our apartment had an issue with mixup in the beginning but these women worked expeditiously to resolve the issue!! My family and I will be here for the long haul because it's hard to come by a company that stands by their customers and their well-being!!! We love this place!!

name: Jackie Brown
text: This one of the worst property management companies in Birmingham. If you have no other choice, Red Rock Realty is just for you! They do not follow tenant leasing laws. They don’t do anything to solve problems, if anything they create more. You’ll make a complaint they will listen to you and sympathize but they will not be proactive in solving any situation dealing with disturbances of a neighbor. They also tried to say I didn’t pay my rent which was not true my bank statements said other wise. Instead of trying to help they will manipulate a situation trying to force you out from where you can afford to live. If you have 15 people that need a place to stay in a one bedroom rent from Red Rock Realty, they have no capacity limitations. You’ll have a Red Rock time. Remember Red Rock is just a stone covered in blood.

name: Alicia Sherman
text:
Brad Clay stated they do not accept out of state guarantors, even if they provide a year's rent upfront.  I am unsure how this is at all beneficial to them unless they are attempting to keep a certain kind of tenant from renting their properties.

Food for thought.

Edit to respond to owner's comment:

Thank you for your quick response!  If only your responses were this timely when reporting a problem in one of your units!  Let's be clear that I did not accuse you of anything, merely stated that this was the only logical reason I could conclude for not accepting a year's rent upfront.  While there are other issues I could address, I think your yelp and google reviews speak for themselves.

resp.text:
Ms. Sherman,
We have been advised by our attorney not to accept out-of-state guarantors because of the cost associated with holding those guarantors accountable.  We do allow tenants to pay rent in advance but this does not circumvent our standards to confirm a resident’s ability to provide income showing they have the ability to pay rent.  To make accusations online that we are discriminating is wrong and unfair.  We are an equal-housing opportunity provider and work with every applicant equally on qualifications.

Thank you,

name: Love Knox
text: I've been in one of the properties for a while now I have to say that it has been a fair stay as long as you don't need them for anything.. What I don't like is that you can never get anyone on the phone, maintenance takes their time to fix things and let not mention you can never get the person over the phone to return phone calls. The washers in the washroom work sometimes.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We honestly do our best to answer all calls and greet each person, however if you ever have an issue please feel free to email us at: Leasing@redrockrg.com or info@redrockrg.com.  You can also contact us through the Online Portal.  If you don't have access to it or have misplaced it, email us and we can send you a link to reset.  Thank you!

text: Jamie Kuntz and Mrs.Snow are the best !!! They were very patient and respectful with my moving process. I will recommend Red Rock Realty Group to anyone of all ages and all circumstances. Love love love this place !!

name: janice Williams
text: Red rock reality bought the apartments I live in on August 2019. I have never been late on rent but the manager doesn't post rental payments until the 8th to the 12th of the month and then post a late fee! Doesn't answer the phone either. I would love a call back. UPDATE: After this post I received a call back from corporate and everything was resolved in a very professional manner. Thank you so much for taking care of this problem!

name: Chris Burgett
text: I want to first say that I love how quiet our apartment is and the location. I enjoy that it is one level and no one is above or below us. The one thing, and it's a HUGE PROBLEM, something that I told them about right after moving into said apartment about is the carpet. I mentioned that it was filthy and the owner of Red Rock persisted to state that it had been professionally clean. And after talking to our neighbor I believe this to be true. But the previous owners were disgusting and I don't know what they did to it but even after us buying a high dollar, well made carpet cleaner ourselves and cleaning it TWICE we still cannot walk across the carpet without our feet being sticky and them nor or socks being BLACK. This makes me sick to my stomach. We should be able to walk on our carpet without this being an issue. We have a three year old and I feel disgusted knowing it will never been clean. We only moved in the last week of October and I hate knowing we have to deal with this problem indefinitely. It has torn places and places where it is coming apart in two areas in a line that will only get worse. You guys KNEW the last tenant was fifthly and knowing that should have just replaced the carpet so no one else had to deal with it. I believe it needs to be pulled up and something else put down ASAP. I know that if it is not that we will be moving out, instead of staying put (as we had hoped to do) as soon as our year is up. That is a shame because otherwise we love it.

name: Julie Wilson
text: My air conditioner went out last night (10/4). We have placed several calls through the maintenance line with promises of someone getting in touch with us ASAP. We haven’t heard a single thing. This is Alabama in the middle of summer. It’s HOT. I would never recommend these people to anyone.

name: Laura Puckett
text:
I applied for an apartment about three months ago. I paid the application fee ($90)  and waited for their call. When I finally received the call (after more than a week, rather than the 3-4 day waiting period they promised), I was told someone had applied before me, so they received the apartment. Things happen, and I was okay with this news. The woman I spoke to on the phone said they would have another apartment available at the same location in two weeks time. That's great! She said they would call me as soon as it was available, and I would be the first person on the waiting list.
Three weeks go by. I call to check on it after hearing nothing. This time I'm told they don't know what date the apartment will be available---not even a time estimate.
Fast forward three months. No updates. At first I called once a week, and they typically answered the phone, though they were NEVER able to offer a time estimate on the apartment. For the past month, I'm lucky to ever get a person on the phone--instead I have to leave voicemails that have only been answered once.
And now the voicemail box is full. They never answer. I was patient to begin with, but I specifically halted apartment hunting for the apartment they originally said would be ready two weeks after I applied.
I'm so disappointed with this experience. If you are in a time crunch and must have an apartment quickly, please don't use this company.
I am lucky to have found a much nicer place to live, with much more helpful staff. I'm leaving this review in the hopes that someone will completely avoid this realty company, rather than wasting three months on them with no results and down $90, like I did.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Puckett,
We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience with our team at Red Rock and apologize.  Please know that we have two new great leasing staff members that have just joined our team this last week and we would love to have the opportunity to try regain your business.  We can assure you that you will have a completely different experience.  Again, we sincerely apologize for not assisting as we should have.

Sincerely,
Brad Cleage
Red Rock Realty Group

name: CEO Scroggins
text: Jamie Kuntz is so awesome. She did whatever should could to get me approved. Also very courtius thank her so much. Amy also was great, very patient

name: Prasanna Kumar
text: Great Hospitality & good response time for maintenance issues. Have been living in Red Rock property for over an year and never had to call more than once for any maintenance issue.

name: Nathan Joly
text:
Worst realty company I have ever had to deal with. Was treated horribly because of my skin color. My girlfriend put in her application for an apartment which basically got approved but her boss wouldn't verify employment over the phone (that's okay and a safe thing to do). Instead of letting her know of the problem, she received no notification. She called to find out days later about the status of her application because she heard nothing from them at all and was told of the problem. For a company needing to fill spots, since empty spots cost money instead of make money, this is a very horrible way for employees to be. When she put in her deposit and we asked about a receipt, we were told the receipt from the money order was enough (the tear off tab). I guess receivership of money doesn't require a receipt for this company or Brittany doesn't understand how a receipt actually works. Every other company we've rented from gives a receipt as proof of receiving a deposit (Arizona, California, Florida, Virginia). Very sketchy. Not a company we want to deal with.
Update (20181106): The response to my review was horrible. Your core values don't mean a thing if there is no true follow-up to a problem so it can be corrected. I am in the U.S. Air Force and one of our core values are Integrity First. This company posted a advertisement as a 5 star review. There is no integrity there as they stated in their core values.

resp.text: We are very sorry you feel this way, however we take pride in serving our clients and customers with the highest degree of professionalism. Our Company Values are Accountability, Customer First, Enjoyment of Work, Family, Financial Responsibility, Integrity, and Teamwork. We try and live by these in everything we do.

text: Highly recommend Red Rock Realty for residential property rentals.  Excellent service by caring professionals.  Especially the front office staff and property manager.  I would definitely rent again with this company if the need arises.

David,
Thank you for the awesome review. We strive to provide excellent costumer service!

name: Venkatadri Raparla
text: Nice realty group to lease for residence near UAB. Hospitable and helpful staff, maintenance is reasonably good. They try to resolve issues instead of staying idle for complaints such as parking issues, pest control etc. But one of the things they need to concentrate more is on maintaining cleanliness around apartment complex

name: Miesha B
text: Red Rock realty was very accommodating when it came to issues I was having in my apartment, due to the previous tenant. The office went above & beyond to fix these issues. Even to the point of replacing my dryer with a new one (even though my particular complex no longer offered washers/dryers).

resp.text:
Miesha,
Thank you for the Google review. We strive to provide excellent costumer service always!

name: Tiara King
text:
If I could give this 0 starts I would. The atmospheres is very tensed & uninviting. The front desk/customer service reps that works in the Residential Department are very unprofessional & confrontational. The older Caucasian (heavy set) female doesn't acknowledge customers &  the younger Caucasian lady (slender with slight overbite) likes to raise her voice & talk to adults  as if they'er ignorant children. I always request receipts before submitting my payments in the drop & they always act as if it's a problem. No other customers are present & you're not doing anything but on your personal phone/social media.

If you activate the audio on your cameras you can clearly hear that words were exchanged between your cs rep and myself. Of course you can see a confrontation you can only hear it. Now you all are fake. Who ever I talked with when I filed my complaint stated that she shouldn’t have given me a hard time regarding a receipt request and now you want to call me a liar for the world to see. That’s slandering my character.

resp.text:
Ms. King,
After you spoke with one of our principals on the phone to file your complaint on 2/4/19, they reviewed the video of your visit to Red Rock on that day.  The account of your visit given to our principal and the one that you give in your review is not accurate.  We saw no confrontation between you and our leasing agent and our other agent was on the phone assisting a customer during your visit.  We welcome reviews of Red Rock, both positive and negative, as they help us grow as a company.  However, we do not appreciate when needless comments are directly personally towards our staff.  It is our goal to provide the best customer service possible, but sometimes we may fall short of some visitor’s expectations.  We apologize that your visit was not inviting and we do hope that it will be on your next visit.   After your visit and review, we have discussed with our leasing staff the importance of maintaining a welcoming and inviting environment for all who visit Red Rock.

name: Cindy Bentley
text: Red Rock Realty Group is a full service commercial Real Estate Company. Managing over 2,200 apartment homes and single family homes. Red Rock is led by senior management with 84 years experience. If your looking for a professional full service real estate company to manage your multifamily asset, commercial, single family home. Call Red Rock today. Our team is invested in your success.  Cindy

name: Snoe Fargeaux
text: Very prompt! You can’t beat being smack dab in the middle of the city in a reasonably priced complex and you get a overlook of the city. My complex doesn’t allow animals and I loovvveeee that! Police precinct right around the corner.

name: Kay W
text: AVOID AT ALL COST!!!! They rent out to literally anyone including scum drug dealers. They don’t even check on their properties. When calling the police on neighbors we were retaliated against. Red rock doesn’t properly address anything. They are extremely incompetent in the office. Luckily, the altercation gave me an opportunity to move. The only reason I moved in was because of the movein special but they could give our properties for free and I still wouldn’t rent with them. Continue to have your tenants have dice games in your parking lot. They are rude as well. I can go on and on about the company in general but all these bad reviews speak for themselves.

resp.text:
Kay W,
We are sorry you feel this way. We looked back in our records and we do not have any written complaints that have been submitted to our office regarding any of these issues from a Kay W (in your lease you will read we require all complaints be hand written and submitted into our office). You are more than welcome to email info@redrockrg.com with your name, old address, and phone number and someone from our office will reach out to you.

Thank you

name: john sisson
text: In my business dealings with Red Rock real estate I have found them to be very professional. In working with them year after year I have nothing but compliments for the level of customer service they provided me. Red Rock is a company continually pursuing excellence. They are problem solvers always pursuing a solution to problems instead of ignoring them. In the future I would be willing to work with him again without question.

text:
The worst customer service I've experienced. Our air conditioner broke and they passed our maintenance request to a "third party," who did absolutely nothing. They refused to give us any updates or help, blaming their "third party," while our apartment temperature climbed into the 80s. After a week we hired another maintenance company who showed up within hours.

Also, I spoke with three different customer service reps about this issue. The problem is not with any particular employee, it's with the company itself.

text: The people at Red Rock are top-notch, and I've had nothing but positive experiences with them. They're very honest and straightforward, and they know the Birmingham market well. Great company.

name: Timothy Astor
text:
Please do yourself a favor and rent with another company in Birmingham. This is one of the most disorganized and frustrating realty companies I have ever had the displeasure of having to work with. The shame is that the apartment itself is quite nice, even if it wasn't cleaned before I moved in.

Initially, after Red Rock tried to overcharge me, I was charged twice for my security deposit. Then, when moving in, I was told that the only way to pay my first month's rent was through security deposit and that I had to drop it off in person at their office. What a thoroughly archaic way to collect rent! On top of the fact that their office hours prevent you from actually getting to their office if you have a full time job. Regarding their hours, even if you call while they are supposedly open, never once have they actually answered the phone. And good luck receiving a timely callback if you leave a message, as it takes at least a week for them to respond.

Fast forward two months, and I receive a notice of 2 months back rent due plus a late fee and my security deposit. Not only have they lost the record of my security deposit, they failed to note that they already charged me TWICE for it. After spending 2 days on the phone and numerous assurances from multiple employees there that everything is settled, I hope it doesn't happen again. Next month comes along, and I am told I am being threatened with eviction due to $1300+ back rent missing from their records. I am still awaiting a call back regarding this new report of incompetence.

This company is absolutely horrible when it comes to organization. The only person who has been helpful at their office, Jordan, appears to be the only competent one there, but the issues still keep piling on. If looking to rent in Birmingham, DO NOT look here.

name: Monika Jackson
text:
Never had an issue with bed bugs until I moved into one of their units. It has been a total nightmare!! I’ve had to throw out most of my things and it seems they don’t even care. I’ve contacted maintenance TWICE with this very serious issue and still no response. My next step is calling the health department. BEWARE!!
Update: I still have bedbugs and I am still being bitten 3 weeks later. They have “treated” my unit twice & its not helped at all. Plus I found out the lady next door had bedbugs in November & the man above me has had them too but they claim he doesn’t have them anymore. I moved in towards the end of Feb & the bites popped up towards the end of March which means these bugs were still here well before I moved in & they didn’t treat it properly. I’ve decided to just move and they refuse to give my security deposit back but I don’t even care. I’ll rather live in a clean, safe environment. The name of these apartments are KINGS DREAM.

name: Tamara Lawrence
text: HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! I WISH I KNEW THEN WHAT I KNOW NOW. THEY DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR TENANTS AT ALL. YOUR BASICALLY ON YOUR OWN. I MOVED IN AND TWO DAYS LATER MY A/C WENT COMPLETELY OUT. THEY SENT A TECH OUT TO REPAIR IT AND THE NEXT DAY IT WAS OUT AGAIN. I THEN STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WITH ROACHES AND SPIDERS NOTHING WORKED. I WALKED INTO SPIDER WEBS ALL THE TIME. I HAVE A 10 MONTH OLD I CANT EVEN PUT ON THE FLOOR TO CRAWL AROUND. I THEN STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WITH MICE. I ASKED IF I COULD MOVE TO ANOTHER COMPLEX AND I WAS DENIED. THEY CAME OUT TO MY HOME TWICE TO SPRAY AND I HAD TO CALL THEM TO DO THAT. PLEASE TAKE YOUR MONEY SOMEWHERE ELSE THIS COMPANY IS HORRIBLE!

Ms. Lawrence,
Our records indicate that prompt service was provided to correct you’re A/C issues and we have no other records over the past three months showing that any other issues have occurred.  In regard to pest control services, the lessor has a monthly contract to spray the property and each unit.  We have no other reports from tenants of any pest issues, but have reported your issues to the vendor.  Please remember that you should contact our 24/7 maintenance hotline to report any maintenance problems.  We are sorry that you have had these issues and always want to take care of problems promptly.

name: Megan Walton
text: I have been a resident at the signal hill apartments for almost two years now and if I could give them a no star rating I would. I have been a great tenant, paying rent on time or early, no issues with other neighbors. The maintenance team seems to like to neglect their tenants. I have had water issues personally with water coming up thru my carpet to the vent in the bathroom leaking. To hearing about water it self leaking thru the walls in other apartments. To an upstairs neighbor being out of town with a leaking toilet that then started leaking in another apartment below them and maintenance taking days to show up and fix their issue. March of 2017 I called about water coming up thru my carpet and took me calling multiple times to “fix” said issue. In the past year I have had multiple sinus infection I now feel I can tie the missing link to mold that was never properly taken care of. Now I have tested positive for mold in both my living room and bedroom. I did an air test kit myself, so I now know and have proof of it. (Can’t see it but can smell it)  I assume they’re having issues believing me because I’m unable to see it. I have tried breaking my lease this past Friday on 25 May 2018 and asked them to honor my 30 day notice instead of a 60 day notice due to mold and it seems they have issues honoring that and want me to stay the full 60 days. I came in today may 29 with my mold test kits and am still waiting to hear back from the owner. I am not trying to cause issues, I just want to be able to leave and move on with my life to better my health. I am aware there are no laws in the state of Alabama that cover mold but the fact that they are so money hungry that they are willing to put their tenants health at risk for their rent money. I am very displeased with this company. I will never go thru them again.

name: Elizabeth Boyd
text: Terrible leasing company. We have put in numerous work orders that don't get answered. The health department had to be called to get trash picked up. No one returns phone calls.

text: I moved in 3 months ago at Gardendale terrace. I didn’t get a mailbox key when I moved in it is now September put in TWO requests and still have NOT received my mailbox key!!! I feel like they don’t care about their tenants at all!!!! Horrible experience!!!

text: "Superior service thats rock solid" is the slogan for this company and yet the maintence service is awful. I have been given the run around for 4 hours for someone to come out and fix my air unit. My apartment has flooded on several occasions and I know there is mold in the base boards.

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: Red Rock Rock managed Sherman Oaks in Eastlake for a private individual his name is Mark. Read the reviews online. I moved into an apt and 3 days later the worst odor I ever smelt in my life and I had to suffer it for 3 1/2 months before the owner would come out and he was so low down he came out when I wasn't there and removed a dead animal from a crawl space. I saw a dead possum at the end of my building. I made numerous calls & Mark the owner  never  do you need anything  for over 3 months He didn't care. the landlord reduced me to being crazy after the Health Inspector had been to my house twice and sent two letters. The owner said that the letter from the health inspector was not true. I spend a lot of money on Lysol and other products to camouflage the odor and kill the bacteria. the owner to this day still thinks that I don't deserve a dime. and he thinks that he should further punish me by holding my security deposit 5 wks. I have now learned that constructive eviction is not for the tenant it is it is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you out of your money. Unless you dead or half dead at least in Birmingham Alabama. I finally got the owner to release me from my lease to God be the glory. online reviews or  less than 2.9 now I know why. there was a strong musty odor in the apartment as well.My my eyes would burn a lot I felt my eyeballs were melting . I had headaches & I felt something or someone was dead in the walls to this day I regret not having call the police. Oh I forgot to mention about the so-called preacher Ernest Smith resident manager. Earnest a want to be preacher told as many lies as Mark and red rock. This was the most traumatizing and horrific  ordeal  I do not wish this on anyone. After removing the dead possum from the crawl space I finally got my letter from Mark to release me out of my lease. I moved out the end of June a new tenant moved in the beginning of September. I was told by one of the neighbors a Mexican family moved in at least they had at least two months to clear the air in that particular apartment. Lets name this story the hidden secret why because the apartment was newly renovated. Grandma always said looks are deceiving . I was about a1yr  cancer survivor  and  suffer with COPD with other disabilities. The federal government declared me 100% disabled in the year 2000. Mark the owner apparently thought I was just another hood rat. I lived at 7723 Apartment B 3rd Avenue South. They waited 2 months after I left then moved in a Mexican family. I almost died in there with a stinking possum. I wasn't compensated in anyway. Constructive eviction means nothing in Alabama. Unless you lost a limb or life or a have a class action lawsuit apparently. You call a lawyer and they tell you you should and when you move they tell you to file bankruptcy that's what Jonathan at Legal Aid Society call me with. All the wild suggested that there was no way that legal aid services could assist me. Every 3 months when he's got nothing else better to do he called me stalling till statue has run out. you move they tell you they are glad that you got out of that situation but they can't help you. Calling legal aid is a waste of your doggone time. Constructive eviction as far as I can see is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you anyway they want to. When you complain they do nothing can't wait till you move don't care about the money you lost. It cost me $1,500 to move in there and $1700 for me to find another place to live. I moved twice in the same year. Everytime Jonathan at Legal Services have nothing else better to do he gives me another call with another bright idea. Is Young still trying to learn his role but I do not appreciate him calling him wasting my time acquiring the same info he got the first time stalling. Whenever you get time Google constructive eviction. Hope you have better luck than I did.

name: Billy Sprague
text: This is a SCAM. I applied for an apartment for 575 a month and make almost 100k a year with good rental history. They still denied me to make the money off the application fee. They do not even return phone calls or answer the phone. I am not sure they are even a real company. I suggest if you find a place that they manage if they are real you run as they can collect more off a few application fees per day then any apartment would be worth. Very Poor business ethics.

resp.text:
Billy,

We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We do not make money off of application fees, the fee goes to cover the background check, rental history check, credit check and the time it takes to process all of these things. We have a process to review applications and mail a letter to all of our applicants letting them know if they were approved or denied. If denied the reason will be stated in the letter. It is the law that we cannot tell you over the phone why you were accepted or denied.

Our policy is to return calls and emails with in 24 hours, but with the holidays (and recent ice/snow storm) this has been off a little. For that we apoligize. If you believe there was any confusion or fault on your application please feel free to call us at 205-324-3383, email us leasing@redrockrg.com, or come by 1425 Richard Arrington Jr. Blvd South Birmingham, AL 35205.

Thank you,
Team Red Rock

text: This company is by far the worst company you could every rent from.... Summer of 2015 I lost my apartment due to neighbors being careless. The building was not up to fire code. They were very unhelpful with the entire situation. Granted I had just moved in Not even a month prior. 2016 I moved into a different complex owned by RedRock, (my fault). They rushed my thru the paper work I didn't have to do anything other than sign my name. The lady that had me filling out paper work was aware that I had a puppy.. 9months later I had 3 days to get rid of my dog. I turned in my 30day notice and last rent check. They "lost it". This company is lazy treats customers like crap. I have video footage of this company dumping raw sewage on to the driveway on several different occasions. They do not fix anything. I have had drainage issues out of everything in my apartment. The structure of the building and parking lot is literally sliding down hill. DON'T rent with REDROCK

Had a flood that ruined all of my belongings in the bedroom and bedroom closet and, 48 hours later, still cannot get anybody to come up with a plan or to even return my call.  Common courtesy and handling situations the way they should be handled is extremely easy - apparently RRRG had difficulty with this.  Do not ever rent from this company, nor should you ever consider leasing your property through this group.

text: Thank goodness I’m out of there! It was a little too late to try to “fix” the leak. Hilarious how it got “fixed” after I turn in my termination letter (which they LIED like they never got, thankfully I recorded). I was told my leak was going to get fixed sooo many times but yet every time it rained/stormed my kitchen and back constantly had water coming in after multiple times maintenance came to caulk it. Then I’m the mist of moving water was on my table so that’s even more damage. Hopefully one day they properly fix 2079A and not just re do the floors. Maybe this fix they just did will help. I moved in October water issues happened in December, this new management came like January and here it is may and the issue is now “fixed”. Wish it would’ve rained so I could’ve seen if it actually worked or not.

name: chante hunt
text: Great area! Close to EVERYTHING! They apartments are pretty decent. Reason I don’t recommend is because of maintenance. I’ve been her 2 whole years and my outlet for my dryer hasn’t worked! The first dryer I had went out and it wouldn’t dry my clothes. So I throw it out. Thinking it was the dryer. So I went and bought another one. Still wouldn’t dry my clothes. Then after a month it went out. So at this point I refuse to buy another dryer. So I called an appliance company and someone came out. Come to find out it’s the outlet. They guy said wasn’t enough power pulling through and needed to be replaced. My dryer worked just fine. So I tell the maintenance people about it. And only thing they was going to do was reset the breaker. Till this day, I am still not able to use my dryer. My oven went out about 2 months ago and it still hasn’t been replaced either. You don’t get any updates about your work orders or nothing. I hate it. There is nobody to talk to about the issue or nothing. That’s why when my lease is up I’m moving out. Other than that it’s pretty ok. Not 5 star though.

I really hated this apartment complex. I signed a least for 650 I never payed 650 I payed 900 every month. And they will call your phone about the rent . name: Kelly James
text: I was currently looking for an apartment in the hoover area and after going to all the surrounding apartment complexes I stumbled upon Alpine Village as I was driving by. Walking in I was greeted with open arms and the environment in the office was nothing but positive and inviting. The two girls in the office were extremely helpful and patient. I believe their names were Amber and Marisa. I left the leasing office feeling better than I did leaving any other apartments that day. As I was leaving I also ran into Johnathan (I think that is his name) the maintenance supervisor and was blown away with how nice and friendly he was. It is that kind of customer service that makes looking for apartments a breeze! Although I did not end up moving in because my job had stationed me somewhere else I now look forward to moving back to Birmingham and renting from Alpine Village. Thank you for make my apartment searching experience an easy one!

name: Jas C
text: Management is horrible and maintenance will try to enter your apartment without notifying you. I have video record of them entering my apartment but the notice left on the door says they left a mailbox key in the office. There is no reason you should have to enter my place of residence to give me a mailbox key! I was stung by a bee and had to go to urgent care for it. I called and put in a request online to have the nest removed from by my front door and was told I would have to wait for them to remove it. So I’m supposed to fear being stung AGAIN until the end of the week. They could care less because it’s not at their door! BS!!!! I’d live in my car of this was the only option for living! Will not be renewing my lease.

name: Justin Chamblin
text: Awesome Staff Marrisa and Amber make finding and living in your home easy and comfortable

name: Jeffrey Harris
text: Alpine is a great place to stay, management is caring, professional, and they are always doing nice thoughtful things for their residents.

name: Bryan Austin
text: This is a great apartment in a great location and the staff is supper nice.

name: Durran Turner
text: Amber and Marissa are very professional love the new place!

name: Kay Mitchell
text:
Take your business and money elsewhere if at all possible.

I’ve only lived here for a few months and I regret it. There are hidden fees that were not explained and I was unaware of until I got my last bill. I had made numerous attempts to reach the office and was unsuccessful until I sent an email stating that I wanted someone to address the complaint I had. Finally I made contact with the Property Manager. I asked for explanation and I got some crappy excuse about the cost of my bill and told “Sorry for the hidden fees.”

I’m fine with the rent, water, trash and sewer fee. My first sewer bill was 88 dollars and I think that is unfit and unfair. I understand that there may be an inflation cost with the County or BWW but this is ridiculous. Still it’s been paid on time like everything else. The kicker for me is the “Mandatory Cable Service.” I was told that it came with my unit. I’m being charged for 1 HD cable box and 10MB of internet speed that I never even had set up. Recently, I called to get it set up and the customer service rep had a horrible attitude and said that there is a 65 dollar service connection fee due upfront BEFORE they come out to set up service. I was told that this is mandatory although this unit came with cable and internet and I’m being charged 75 dollars monthly for it. Pathetic.

I constantly have problems with my toilet, there’s mildew in the hall and bathroom and my air constantly goes in and out. I’d rather turn a fan on. DO NOT BRING YOUR BUSINESS HERE.

The staff seemed nice and friendly and that’s what will draw you in. Response time to application was swift. Which is what impressed me. But stay away. Go somewhere else. I do not intend to renew my lease. I will be leaving the first chance I get. I am strongly considering just paying to end my lease just so I can go somewhere else. If I am going to pay 850-900+ a month for an older 2 bedroom 1 bathroom unit then I expect better service. For there not to be trash everywhere and for the necessities in my unit to work properly and to know exactly what I am going to be paying for upfront.

name: Andre Weathers
text: Floor very weak, plumbing backs up , air unit still not fixed.. Called the office and maintenance said their ordering parts since last year and the floor is bouncing because it's been worked on before.. I worked in construction before .. text: Amber Dansby was so helpful and nice:! Very professional!!! Great apartments!!!!

text: Office workers are friendly........., ceiling bulging from God knows what....  Been here 3 days and the environment is unfriendly for kids to play because teenagers hang out smoke dope and sell it in the open!!!  The appliances half work, HVAC unit is rigged and freezes up and it hasn't got hot yet!!  Closet doors are missing, it's an odor that no one can explain (mold)........ Etc.

name: Lindolfo Garza
text: They kept my deposit and the water bill is really high it was only my wife and me and we need to pay around 120$ per month I don't recommend you this place to live.

name: Paula Oliver
text: Amber McKinney is the BEST!!! She is helpful and informative!!!

name: Shannon Lamar
text: The leasing agent at the office Susan was extremely rude and on her cellphone the whole entire time.

name: Katrena Weathers
text: Can never get anything fix always people hanging around. The apartments. Poor management.

name: Latoya King
text: Mold and water leaks everywhere. Sewage backs up into the garage disposal. And the phone is always disconnected two months at a time

name: Naturally Heiress
text: I’ve lived here TWICE and I LOVE it here this time as much as I did the First... Lawren & Kelly are both sooo helpful and go above and beyond to make you feel valued and appreciated. Not to mention the amenities are equal to a 5 star hotel and it’s a peaceful place to live and great surrounding area.

name: Wanda Stallworth
text: Ms Larwren assisted me with my transition into my new apartment. She is very professional and knowledgeable within her position. She explained everything I needed to know in detail pertaining to the apartment and went over all documentation thoroughly. My first initial experience was delightful and attentive thanks to Ms Larwren. I look forward to residing here at Inverness Lakes Apts under the management of Ms Larwren.

name: Kimberly Goldsberry
text:
THE BEST PLACE TO LIVE IN MOBILE!!

I am a new resident here and I have four words, I LOVE IT HERE !!! The apartment is clean , updated , and the location is great ! But I am most impressed by the staff . Larwren is the ABSOLUTE BEST !!! She has been so helpful and polite to me since day one. She gave me all the information I needed and was not upset even when I called her 5x a day lol . She was patient and kind and eagerly got me approved and moved in in days!!! THANK YOU SOOO MUCH LARWREN !! If you’re reading this you’re the best at what you do and I pray you continue to be successful!! Thank you Inverness Apartments!!

name: John McDonough
text: This complex is outstanding Ashley, Lauren ,Kelly and Bonnie know the ropes what you need you can get. Maintenance is same day service

name: Wendy Tulo
text: Loft apartments are too cute.  Great location close to everything you need.

name: William Davis
text: Pleasant, pretty, relaxed atmosphere; cordial & service-oriented staff (& 2nd-to-none management); comfortable, secure, no-hassle living; prompt, quality-minded maintenance; quite central to practically everything in Mobile (& an easy walk for basics); we feel blessed to have found Inverness!

name: Danielle Stewart
text: Love the size of the apartment, very roomy and spacious, definitely worth the price you pay rent wise.

name: Tanya
text: Inverness Lakes and LakeView Cottage Hill have a great, relaxed quiet atmosphere!  Management always responds quickly to any questions or concerns.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: Clerk at front desk, friendly and cooperative. When searching for apartment more one bedroom available than additional bedrooms apartments.

name: Hoshi Yoshi
text: This review is for the leasing office, not for my apartment. My apartment and its on-site Property Management as well as maintenance is wonderful. I've had a lot of things get broken in my apartment due to normal use and all have been fixed promptly. However the website is not a good choice when trying to get something fixed quickly. I don't think they actually check their messages from the website. You have a much better chance of getting something fixed if you call-in your maintenance request. The leasing office itself also seems a bit scattered and the staff can be curt and unhelpful. However, the rules all seem fair. I have not had any issues with them keeping their side of our leasing contract. I also think some of the shortcomings of the leasing office have to do what the small size of the staff and the large number of properties that they have to communicate with. Which is to say, that I don't think they are able to stay up-to-date on what is happening with all of the properties, so they're not the best people to go to for property issues. I think your experience with JH Berry depends mostly on who your property manager is.

name: Lee Robinson
text: Rejected me because I'm self-employed. I've rented places my whole adult life, I have excellent credit and rental history. My parents were kind enough to offer co-sign. They were rejected too b/c they are retired and their income, which is no small sum, is largely from social security. None of us have ever been rejected for anything like this before. Two stars for nice place and the staff was kind but the office policies are rigid and unreasonable. JH Berry you just lost out on a superior tenant.

name: Michael Reed
text: By far the worst rental company I have ever dealt with in my 30$ years of apartment living and my 1 star rating because you can't choose less is a  overrated choice. My true rating would be -5 stars but I was not given that option .

name: Carlye Poljacik
text: If I could give JH Berry 0 stars I would. I love my apartment, but no apartment in the world is worth dealing with this terrible leasing company. I truly think they go out and look for the rudest most in- compassionate people they can find to work for them. I have heard form other apartments than mine that there is always issues (my heat and air have stopped working a total of 5 times in a 6 month period). I get that Birmingham buildings are old, but their maintenance is so slow, communication is poor and they are all around extremely rude people who will do absolutely nothing to help you. i saw the bad reviews and ignored them. TRUST ME DON'T IGNORE THIS REVIEW.

name: Scout Moonflower
text: JH Berry has been prompt in fixing any problem I've had, they call you back asap and are friendly, I've never had pests in my apartment, and they helped with a neighbor of mine that didn't follow smoking rules. They have been the best rental company I've had experience with and I've been renting around Birmingham for 17 years.

name: Leam Scullin
text: Terrible leasing company. Did not meet standards that were stated in the lease. Did not finish buildig the complex. Constantly had appliance issues because they would not add funds to fix old, broken equipment which they are supposed to provide. Threatened to take all my property 2 days before my lease expired.

name: Kelly Grimes
text: The maintenance people are onsite and friendly, but lately they've started charging for maintenance work. The type maintenance work that seems like it should be included. Every time you call the office staff, they treat you like it's your fault something broke and charge you (not a little, but a lot). Often times you have to keep calling b/c it wasn't fixed right the first time, but they consider that you breaking it b/c it was "Just fixed". Grrrrr

name: justin d
text: Well thanks for posting bad reviews so I want waste my time contacting them on renting

name: cole brock
text: terrible customer service. use a 3rd party answering service that doesnt help at all. suck.

name: Osama Elmhishi
text: Worst customer service ever. They charged me extra month just because I assumed we have one year agreement, which they knew, but pretended they didn't just to steal one extra month's rent from me in a lawful way. I will never ever forget this. Never ever rent from these people.

name: M A
text: Horrible staff , not updating their online site 😔

name: Sean Bryson
text: Refused to take responsibility for plumbing issues and sky high water bills. DO NOT LEASE FROM THEM.

name: Mehedi Hasan
text: Good service.

name: h Sims
text:
I moved to the Verandas after moving from another state. It is a beautiful property with wonderful amenities and an even better staff.
Amy was a joy to work with. She always answered every question, and I asked a lot of questions. She made the process very easy and I really enjoyed my time there.
I recommend living here.

name: JJo_ RI
text:
TERMITE!!!!
&SOAKED CARPET DUE TO DISHWASHER LEAK!!!!

I went to office to report these issues. The leasing lady (Morgan Mclene) simply said the manager will be back on Monday and that she cannot do anything.

She did not even relayed the message to the manager.

When I requested the manager’s contact information, she said she does not have the information. NONSENSE!!

The maintenance man came and left the fan on and said he will be back on Monday.

I am to live with these two issues till Monday. SPEECHLESS!

resp.text: Thank you for stopping by to explain. I understand that, via translator, we have explained that extermination services are scheduled for Monday and that you are satisfied with this resolution. Please let us know if you need further assistance. Thank you for choosing to make your home with us!

name: Ronald Young
text: Excellent Staff! Shelia Foster has been extremely professional and helpful as the apartment complex assistant manager. I definitely will recommend the Verandas to my colleagues and peers.

name: emily hultstrand
text: In the past when moving into other apartment complex’s I am disappointed by the condition of the apartment and how different it was from the showroom. At the Verandas at Mitylene it was way better than my expectations I had. It is a beautiful apartment complex and they did a great job of getting it clean before I moved in. Morgan helped me with my paperwork and was so easy to work with! It was the fastest and easiest move in process! I would recommend living here to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your stellar review, Emily! We’re pleased that you recognized our efforts in making Verandas at Mitylene a great place you can call home and appreciate you highlighting Morgan’s professional service. We look forward to continuing to provide the same high-quality service in all aspects of your stay with us!

name: Mark Oliver
text: Stacey and her staff are the best!!  For someone like myself who thought they could never live in an apartment, the Verandas at Mitylene made me feel right at home.  Spacious floor plans, garage for storage or parking, a pool, an exercise room and so much more.  And the maintenance crew were friendly and always getting the job done right.  This truly is a great place to live!  Thank you again to staff there.  Y'all really are the best!

resp.text: Hi Mark, Thank you so much for your glowing recommendation of The Verandas at Mitylene! We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your time with us. With our convenient location, great floor plans, and dedicated staff, we are always striving to provide the best for our residents. We hate to lose you as a longtime resident, but are excited for you in the purchase of your new home. Best of luck in your new adventures!

name: Sash hsaS
text:
Excellent option if you are seeking an apartment in the Montgomery area. I was very picky and skeptical of searching for an apartment online as what you see may not always be what you get. I got what was advertised and more!!!! My decision was based on the amenities, location as well as the leasing agent's attitude and response time. Karey was very patient, helpful and professional when I asked my numerous questions.
When I visited the property, I was a bit worried if everything was what I expected it to be but that was short lived...Apartment was spacious, clean new carpets, spacious bathroom (this was a winner for me), closets, appliances of excellent quality. I was and still am impressed...It looked even better than the pictures posted online. The outside was great too..Property was clean and well maintained.  I will definitely be recommending others.

UPDATE 3 years and 5 Months Later!

Maintenance requests always completed ASAP, grounds always clean and never had one episode of noise nuisance, missing packages or break ins.

Always felt safe and secure. Office staff always courteous and ready to help. Moving out process was just as easy as moving in.

Well kept apt community, only moved because of job change. I really enjoyed my living experience here. Not one Complaint from me!!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for your feedback. We value our residents and community and take pride in providing a great place to live. Your positive comments about our people, place and process mean a great deal to us because we truly strive to have loyal residents. We hope you are finding success with your new job and we miss you here at Verandas. Thanks again!

name: Keisha Aoi
text: The facility is absolutely amazing! Not only is it safe and very pretty but has amazing and very helpful staff. Shelia has helped me through a lot, including the applications and the moving out processes. I'd definitely stay here again if I ever come back to Montgomery!

resp.text: We love great reviews from current and former residents alike. Looking back is a great way to speak for the whole process. We wish you the best in your next stay. You are always welcome back to see us!

name: Janice Gibby
text: I have enjoyed living at the Verandas at Mitylene! The office staff is great and maintenance is always prompt to get any issues I have done quickly. I really enjoy the resident activities they have done so far. I am also thankful for Morgan in the office because she was so helpful when I moved in and answered all questions.

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent rating and for sharing such kind words about your experience at The Verandas at Mitylene, Janice. It's so nice to hear that you have been treated with exceptional customer service by Morgan and our maintenance team. Thank you for choosing to call Verandas at Mitylene your home.

name: Ok Ok
text: Since moving here in 2018 Shawn Robinson has always been quick to respond to all of my maintenance requests and all of them have been resolved the same day.   He has made my stay here pleasant by providing superior customer service and demonstrating  his technical ability.   Thanks Verandas at Mitylene for having Shawn as a member of your team, with him I and the rest of your tenants have peace of mind knowing our maintenance issues will be resolved quicker than expected.

resp.text: Thank you for taking a moment to review Verandas at Mitylene! We love "going the extra mile" for our residents, and we're delighted that we've succeeded at making you feel happy and at home here.

name: Jacob Daniels
text:
Verandas at Mitylene is a serene, safe place to live.  Stacy and her staff are top notch.  Repairs needed are responded to quickly.  Concerns are taken into consideration. And I want to thanks
Sheila Foster for all the extra help she did for me.

resp.text: Jacob, thank you for your excellent rating and for sharing such kind words about your experience at The Verandas at Mitylene. It's so nice to hear that you have been treated to exceptional customer service by our team. We appreciate your feedback and hope that you will continue to call Verandas at Mitylene your home.

name: Robert Walters
text: Great apartments with a great staff. I have had no issues since moving in, and Mona was always quick to answer any question I had during the moving process. Todd and Sean from maintenance team are always prompt in replying to service requests.

resp.text: We're so happy we were able to provide you with a comfortable and wonderful home for the last four years, Robert.  We are definitely going to miss you! Thank you so much for sharing this feedback with us! Please reach out to us if you ever need anything.

name: Brandi Roberts
text: Verandas at Mitylene is a serene, safe place to live.  Stacy and her staff are top notch.  Repairs needed are responded to quickly.  Concerns are taken into consideration.  Amenities are fabulous.  During Covid, they took great care and precaution for staff and residents.

resp.text: Brandi, Thank you very much for your feedback and excellent rating. We value our residents and community and take pride in providing great customer service for our residents. Your positive comments about our team and community means a great deal to us because we truly strive to have loyal residents at The Verandas at Mitylene. Thanks again for continuing to call Verandas at Mitylene home!

name: Willa Johnson
text: I love Ms. Shelia in the office very professional and hard working the others awful. For my first time in my own apartment I hated it got accused of false accusations and terrible noise from upstairs with a newborn. I would most definitely take all my money elsewhere. Car also got destroyed with some kind of paint and there’s nothing they can do oh wow and pay over $1,000. Would not recommend!!

resp.text: Willa, we're very sorry that you're not enjoying your time at our community. Please be assured that our on-site team is committed to ensuring our community members enjoy a positive resident experience. We always extend an open invitation to our residents to contact us directly with any feedback or to report unsatisfactory conditions around our community. Please give us a call or stop into the office and we'll do our best to help. Thank you.

name: Katrina Shead
text: I enjoyed speaking with Mrs. Shelia Foster in search for availabilities. She was very helpful and informative. Definitely reach out to her if you need help with anything.

resp.text: We really appreciate your kind words, Kneosha. Your feedback is very important to us, and it means so much that you enjoyed the efforts of our hard-working team during your visit to The Verandas at Mitylene. We hope that you will choose to live here with us!

name: Andrew Moncrief
text: This property is absolutely beautiful. The staff is fantastic. They are always willing to assist you. They make finding a home easy!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Andrew! We truly appreciate you taking a moment to brighten our day with this five-star rating of The Verandas at Mitylene. Thank you for your compliments about our friendly staff and community.

name: Gregory Lovett
text: Sean R. is an awesome employee. His attitude, demeanor, and professionalism has always been top notch. Whenever I have a question, he always has the answer or finds the person that does.

resp.text: We love hearing great things about our team! Thank you Gregory. We look forward to continuing to provide you with a great "home" experience.

name: Ja'Lisa Grissom
text: I’ve lived here for over 3 years and my rent has increased by $300 since I moved in. I’ve renewed my lease 3 times without having my carpet cleaned and the office staff will fine you for any and everything. It’s not worth the money. The maintenance crew is the best part about living here.

resp.text: Hi Ja’Lisa, We appreciate this feedback about Verandas at Mitylene. We want our residents to have nothing but positive things to say about our community, and we're disappointed that you're not enjoying your time with us. Will you please call us or stop by the office? We'll address each of your concerns in an effort to resolve them. We hope to hear from you soon!

name: Alejandro Rosales Fernandez
text: Love my apartment. Shelia was very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the excellent rating and compliment for Sheila. We work hard to provide great service and a little encouragement can go a long way. We are thrilled that you have chosen to make your home with us.

name: welton maynard
text: Shawn Robinson has always been available to resolve any maintenance issues we have and always in a very timely manner. We have lived at the Verandas for going on five years and Shawn has always been there when we needed him.  Verandas should be proud to have such a dedicated employee.

resp.text: Welton, thank you for the heartfelt review and the excellent rating! We value our residents and community and take pride in providing our residents a great place to live.  Thank you for continuing to call Verandas at Mitylene your home.

name: Elizabeth Swan
text: My cousin has lived Verandas for years and loves it. I enjoy visiting her. The setting is gorgeous, you get the feeling that you not in the middle of a busy city. It is quiet. The staff is so friendly and always makes you feel like family. If I ever moved to Montgomery, Verandas at Mitylene would be my first choice. Great job guys!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Elizabeth! We would love for you to join our community!

name: yoojin lee
text: Thank you for the help on pick up my package Shelia is very helpful even we visit her office on saturday

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent rating and positive review. We are excited that you have just moved into our community! We take pride in providing superior customer serviceto our residents. Welcome to the Verandas!

name: Amelia Matthews
text: Thank you 🙏 Sheila for providing me with the information about being apart of your beautiful community.

resp.text: Thank you, Amelia for your interest in our community Verandas at Mitylene and for the positive review.  We hope you will choose to call Verandas at Mitylene your next new home.

name: Christina Williams
text: Thank you Shawn for coming on a Sunday morning to help fix the water leak before it got worse. Anytime we’ve ever needed any help, you’re always right there. I appreciate you.

resp.text: We appreciate this five-star rating, Christina! We are pleased that you enjoy living at Verandas at Mitylene.

name: Wade Silas
text: I love my apartment and this and community. I thank god for Sheila always willing to help me.

resp.text: Wade, Thank you for the 5-star review and positive comments about Shelia and our community. Thank you for continuing to call Verandas Mitylene home!

name: Chelsea Hill
text: I absolutely love the Verandas at Mitylene! My cousin lived here previously for 3 years and I fell in love then, and knew I wanted to move out here myself. Morgan helped me from start to end, with every question I had an answer, and everything was done in a very timely matter. Morgan was very thorough with everything from the gate, to amenities, and also to rules and regulations of the community. She was extremely helpful and knowledgeable! I also met the manager and other staff members, and felt as I was extended family right away. It’s very homey and welcoming.. the staff and the community. Thank y’all again for an excellent experience, and I would recommend to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you Chelsea for your review! We are so glad that you have chosen the Verandas at Mitylene as your home!

text:
Excellent option if you are seeking an apartment in the Montgomery area. I was very picky and skeptical of searching for an apartment online as what you see may not always be what you get. I got what was advertised and more!!!! My decision was based on the amenities, location as well as the leasing agent's attitude and response time. name: Rashetta Smith
text: Thanks Ms. Shelia for your help it is greatly appreciated!

resp.text: Hello Rashetta. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We are glad to hear that Shelia was able to assist you and meet all of your needs during your apartment search. We hope that you will choose to call Verandas at Mitylene your home! We would love for you to join our community!

name: Corey Mckinney
text:
Living at Verandas was great! The complex is peaceful and quiet.

The reason for two stars comes from moving out. The great staff flips once you decide to leave. With insane fees like $300 for a required professional clean. They also charge over $1000  for damages to the carpet and replacing the carpet as well. It’s like they try to bring these fees in an attempt to force you to stay.

resp.text:
Corey,
Thank you for taking the time to rate and review our community. We have enjoyed having you as a resident of our community for the past year.  We understand your concerns and are here to answer any questions or concerns that you may have regarding our pet treatment and damages procedures. We hate to lose you and thank you for being a part of our community.

Verandas Mitylene Team

name: Damaris Pickett
text: Loved the property. Great amenities. Stacy and Morgan where very polite and great. The layout was also really good. Loved all the space. Thanks ladies.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review and comments Damaris!

name: Alysia Thompson
text: This property is beautiful. My friend lives here and I love it here. Also the maintenance men were very helpful when she had an issue. It didn't take them long to come and fix the issue.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Alysia!

name: UnbiasedReport
text: I should have read the comments. Old, rickety, discolored steps. Terrible parking. Rude and arrogant staff Mona and Stacy that talk to you like you are new to the Earth and new to Alabama Law in any discussion you have with them with no empathy or care about anything you talk to them about. Fake smiles in your face and interest in you until you sign the lease. Really it comes off as if you are on their time and not in reverse. Ants in the unit. No return calls for voicemail. Members of maintenance are always rude and unpleasant. It's an overall, outdated bad place. They cater to only a certain "kind" of people, give them no issues. I got yelled at by a tenant for being in the way on my first day moving in. I was merely parking. Also one of the tenants approached my car one night while I was at the gate accusing me of being the Uber driver for her and her friends. Another tenant approached my friend and I in the parking lot and asked us if we had our car door on hers? Too strict. This place is an antebellum in disguise, not worth it. Steer clear, pay a little more, and be at peace someplace else where you're always be respected. By the way, if you try to leave, they will make you regret it. You had better have at least $1,000 in a savings account. They will try to charge you all the way down to the lifeless air molecule left behind.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're sorry to see this review and receive this feedback.  We would welcome the opportunity to discuss your experience further to find out what prompted your review. Please don't hesitate to give us a call. We look forward to hearing from you!

name: John Kim
text: They do this really cute stuff every holidays where all staffs come out at the gate and pass out yummy breakfast even in cold weather. Which is very sweet and clearly shows they do actually care for their residents. Shout out to Ms.Mona who is nicest and sweetest management I ever dealt with. Maintenance team is also very efficient and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for your review John! We love our residents and enjoy having you as part of our community!

name: Ayan Bhattacharjee
text: My family and I have been staying here for an year now and I can surely say this is the best apartment complex in East Montgomery. All the staff and maintenance team are amazing, efficient, caring and friendly. On holidays they come out and serve breakfast even during cold weather which is great. We love staying here.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your wonderful feedback and excellent rating. We value our residents and community and take pride in providing great apartment home living in East Montgomery. Your positive comments about our people, place and process mean a great deal to us because we truly strive to have loyal residents at The Verandas at Mitylene. Thanks again!

name: Nyla Foster
text: The staff is very friendly and helpful! I love living at the Verandas.

resp.text: We are thrilled to hear this report! Compliments about our people are treasured. We seek to provide a great "home" experience and your wonderful encouragement helps us achieve this goal. Thank you so much for making your home at Verandas!

name: Kelli Golden
text: This is one of the best kept secrets in Montgomery! Nice and super quiet complex that sits back off the road but super convenient to the interstate too. The office staff is beyond friendly and helpful. They go out of their way with monthly events to engage the community - breakfast on the go, tailgating events, chili cook offs - in efforts to help you get to know your neighbors. During the day, you will always see maintenance staff out and about the property with a friendly wave as they pass. Sincerely, all around a safe, great community!!

resp.text: Shhhhhh!!! Don't tell everyone our secrets! Oh well, since we've opened the bag, I guess the cat is loose. We are happy to provide great service and then get glowing compliments; always encouraging. Our location? We can't take credit for that, but we know that sitting two minutes from the interstate in a location that feels like a farm is very appealing to anyone that can find us. We are happy that you did.

name: Drakoh
text: Our Air Condition went out and Supervisor Todd and his maintenance team was prompt to get it fix for us.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We sincerely love hearing from our residents, as we are dedicated to cultivating a top-notch living experience for all of our residents. We appreciate your kind words about our wonderful on-site team!

name: John Schexnayder
text: I spent 3.5 years at the Verandas.  You could not ask for a better staff to serve your needs. My apartment was clean & quiet. Maintenance was spot on; I seldom had to call for maintenance but when I did they were prompt in resolving my issues. If I return to Montgomery, the Verandas at Mitylene will be my first choice.

resp.text: John, thank you so much for this glowing recommendation. We'll miss you, but are happy that you are able to settle into this next stage of your live. We take great pride in The Verandas at Mitylene and in our service to our residents. We are gratified to find that our residents have felt this and value their time here. Your 3.5 years and recommendation above are excellent encouragement. We will continue to strive for this. -- You know that you are always welcome. Come see us any time!

name: Angie Head
text: Since moving to the Verandas at Mitylene, I have felt appreciated and informed as a resident. I love the breakfast on the go the office staff does periodically! The events at the leasing office host have allowed me to make friends with neighbors and the office staff. My leasing agent was helpful, kind and patient with my many questions. This is my first experience living at an apartment and it has been pleasant from the first phone call I made. This size is the one-bedroom deluxe is perfect — and the bathroom is amazing!!!!! Thanks for keeping a clean community that makes residents feel welcome!!!

resp.text: Fabulous review from a great lady! Thank you so much Angie.

name: John Schexnayder
text: I spent 3.5 years at the Verandas.  You could not ask for a better staff to serve your needs. My apartment was clean & quiet. Maintenance was spot on; I seldom had to call for maintenance but when I did they were prompt in resolving my issues. If I return to Montgomery, the Verandas at Mitylene will be my first choice.

resp.text: John, thank you so much for this glowing recommendation. We'll miss you, but are happy that you are able to settle into this next stage of your live.
