Your 3.5 years and recommendation above are excellent encouragement. We will continue to strive for this. -- You know that you are always welcome. Come see us any time!

name: J Olinger
text:
I am going to try and give a fully objective review of the Verandas. As you can see, my vote is three stars out of five. I encourage a full read of this review as it has both positives and some pretty serious considerations before you sign a lease.

To summarize:
-good place to live
-clean apartments with decent amenities
-friendly and helpful staff
-prompt maintenance response
-unnecessary posturing by management if you're a little late on rent
-expensive fees at move out that are not allowed in the lease and that you can't do much about unless you want to take them to court
-these fees are charged at a higher rate than the actual repairs

The Verandas is a pretty good place to live, all things considered. The apartments are nothing fancy. They've got several floor plans and decent amenities like a garden tub in the master bath, pool, gym, etc. Noise is generally low, but you'll still run into the normal foot noise if you live under someone. The front staff are pretty helpful and always nice. Maintenance is quick to respond and you'll get prompt service from their emergency line, if you ever have to call it. Mail delivery and package reception are painless. Again, this place isn't extravagant, but they do have some nice perks to make living here more attractive.

Now with that said, there were a couple of times that I was disappointed.

They give the standard grace period on rent (5 days in AL), and their lease indicates that if you're late, your lease is terminated. There was one time where I did not have rent to them by COB on the 5th, but I did have it paid electronically before the office opened on the 6th. Still, when I came home from work I had a note in my door telling me my lease had been terminated and that I owed the remainder of my rent promptly. I own that I should have had rent paid by COB on the 1st, but the notice of lease termination was a bit much in light of the fact that I had a zero balance in my account before they opened that day and before they printed the notice. The property manager indicated my lease had not actually been terminated which makes the situation even more unnecessary.

The Verandas will attempt to get you to replace the carpet when you move out. The pet addendum indicates that you are responsible for carpet replacement after attempts to remove pet stains through cleaning have been unsuccessful. Management made no attempt to clean my carpet before replacement, but still charged me. This is standard practice. When I pointed out that's not what the lease says, the asst. manager admitted there might need to be additional stipulations added to the lease. What does this mean? It means on top of rent, security deposits, pet fees, and any cleaning fees, you're going to be looking at a bill of somewhere between $1400 and $2000 at move-out. What makes it worse is that when I was told of the replacement fee, I was given an invoice from 2019 that turned out to be $400 more than the actual fee for the replacement. I won't say they weren't going to tell me, but I only found out when I started emailing them about the payment. I initiated; they did not.

I give 3 stars because my time at the Verandas was good overall. Although my view of the apt and staff was lessened significantly at move out, I can't let my overall experience at the complex be completely soured. Read the lease, and know what to expect at move out.

resp.text: M. Olinger, thank you for your feedback and the extensive detail. If we failed to meet your expectations, we sincerely apologize. This message has been shared with the management group. Aggregated reviews are a great way to spot trends which steer policy and investment. You share excellent advice about reading standard lease agreements. These are used nationwide as a manner of protecting both lessor and lessee. If you would like to share details of your experience with management, please fill out a comment form at www.bandm.org.

name: Amber Laws
text:
As someone who works in property management myself, I feel it is very necessary to write this review.

In November, my mother-in-law moved into a 3 bedroom apartment from out of state. This move was planned in advance and arrangements were made with ample time for the apartment to be prepared. When we arrived in Montgomery to pick up the keys and walk the apartment, we were disgusted with the smell in the unit. It smelled of pet urine in all of the closets, the laundry room and the HVAC closet. We immediately went to the office and notified Karey who called Todd, the maintenance supervisor, to come over. Upon checking, he determined he could not smell anything and that they would put an ozone machine inside the apartment before she moved her belongings in and also clean the carpets again. While the smell never totally went away, we put deodorizer in the closets and asked for it to be noted in the file.

While living in this apartment, my father-in-law passed away. My mother-in-law went to the office to speak to Mona Smith, the assistant property manager, in regards to her move out options and the costs. She was advised at this time that she could turn in her keys at any point and because of Alabama law, if she didn’t pay rent after the pay or quit letter, her balance would be written off and she wouldn’t owe it. What she failed to properly explain to my mother-in-law is that it would be considered an eviction on her rental history. As a property manager myself, I was concerned that someone would give such terrible advice to a resident that had all intentions of paying the balance. The buy-out fee is equal to 60 days rent with a notice. It was cheaper for her to stay through the end of her lease and pay the prorated rent which I don’t believe was ever explained to her prior to my involvement.

Fast forward to the day of move-out which was a complete disaster. Yesterday my mother-in-law went to the office to schedule a move out inspection with Mona for 12p on Tuesday. We had movers arrive at 9:30 to ensure all items would be out and we could clean the apartment. We were ready for the walk through but Mona did not show up. We called the office and asked to speak to Mona but apparently she left for lunch at 11:30 and didn’t bother to call and let us know OR send someone in her absence. After driving to the office to make alternative arrangements, the property manager Stacey was VERY rude and unprofessional in her apology. I do not think she was on a conference call but rather wanted to avoid the conversation. I say this because she walked by us very quickly without so much as an acknowledgement and hesitated to turn around when we asked if she was the property manager. As a manager myself, I expect a sincere apology and a solution to the problem when things do not go according to plan as that is part of the job.

The service manager completed the walk through for us and we settled the balance at the office as we turned in the keys. We have a 5 hour drive to our destination today so the lack of communication and disregard for our time is not appreciated. To anyone looking to move here, I very seriously suggest you look elsewhere. The property is okay but the experience you have with the staff will leave you feeling dissatisfied and angry. You will not get return phone calls, clear answers to questions or any type of communication. I will add that the maintenance staff was friendly and would always speak and wave to my family. We have reached out to Inland Residential in regards to this experience so that it can be properly addressed. I will update this review once we have resolution.

UPDATE: Bonnie the regional called on 10/22. We returned her call and left a message but have yet to hear back as of 11/7. This company is mismanaged and lacks communication. No, we will not stop by the office AS WE LIVE OUT OF STATE. We are waiting on a call from corporate and filing complaints with the Better Business Bureau. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND MANAGEMENT. Didn’t even have the decency to call. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear about these problems with our staff, Amber. We want all our residents to have easy move-in and move-out experiences, and we apologize to you and your mother-in-law for falling short. Please stop by the leasing office so we can help to put things right.

name: tnpir4002
text:
I've lived in several different apartment complexes in my day, and I was more or less forced into this one when I accepted a new job in Alabama, and had very little time to do research before I moved.  Though they come highly recommended, this complex has some serious flaws.  For one thing, they have a call center that they expect to handle most of their phone traffic, and the number for the leasing office is difficult to find.  And if you do call into the office, they'll let the phone ring and ring and ring if a visitor is in the office--troubling considering some issues can't be handled by a call center and HAVE to be addressed by a staff member, sometimes during my work day when I can't visit the office in person.  Every other complex I've seen tried to strike a good balance between phone service and walk-ins.

Then there's the leasing staff themselves, who seem much more interested in telling you what Alabama law says than they are with actually helping you, in an experience that strongly evokes the worst aspects of visiting a bank.  Now, granted this place has plenty of pros--I love the layout of my apartment, the carpet is soft, and the interior walls seem remarkably well insulated against sound--but what does all that matter, when kids run amok outside, yelling and screaming and bouncing a basketball on the edge of my building for hours at a time?

text: I have been looking for an apartment for a hile now and I thought this would be a great place because of the location. I had several issues with management even before I moved in. It took them a while week to get back to me about my application. I had to call and ask the status and of course they said my application must have fallen through the cracks somehow. A whole week wasted. But I continued with the process. I was suppose to be moving in this past Friday but decided not to sign the lease. So called orientation takes uo a lot of time and after the agent finished her spill she actually thought I would sign the lease without viewing the apt unit. Everyone knows that's a no no. The apartment was not up to par..at least for the amou5of rent they are charging. The front bedroom had a cracked that ran right under the crown molding of the ceiling...you cold see how they tried to just paint over it. THey could have easily filled the crack...sanded it...then painted it. But oh no the maintained man was too lazy to do the right thing. On to the kitchen where the bottom lip of the microwave wave has be broken into pieces and they just glued this pieces back on and the coenergy of the door was cracked ask if they were going to fix that if course they said no...only if it messes with the function of the microwave. Wrong answer! Then a placed my attention on to glass cook top the items they devoted two pages about how it's ti be cared for and if it is damanged in any way a teneant would have to replace it. Well the precious cook top had already been burned in places and scratched. Now if a tenant did these damages they would have been charged...so it only makes sense to believe they charged but refused to fix these issues. So if I would have done these damages they would charge me also. They really thought I would sign my name on the line and not have the issues fixed first only a dummy would do that. The exit clause is a beast alone...They have it sewed up tight. The lease even says they make no promises to fix and renovate anything after you are locked in to the lease. Good thing I know words mean nothing when it comes to buiness it's all about that black and white..

text: I had a great experience with the leasing manager Kim. She was efficient, professional and very helpful with my situation. I recommend Legacy at the Lake to anyone looking for a nice location and affordable living.

name: King Zxy
text: I think they are some very nice Lady's they answer all of  my questions they ask what the floor plan I would  and all not like some apartment just put you top and you want bottom  i will keep yall update on my father new move!!!

name: Tamisha Williams
text: Very nice apartment worker very helpful and respectful really would recommend any one to move here Kim is very nice and a happy person always smiling and can help with anything

name: JASMINE FULLER

Wonderful & nice serving
#lasheika w

text: Mrs . Kim was very helpful & nice & the apartments are very nice !!!

name: Teri Sumbry
text: Good luck getting a response from anyone. It's all a network of voicemails that never seem to get reviewed. I have been calling the leasing office and corporate for two days about my lease and no one has gotten back to me. Just found out no one has been in the leasing office for two days straight. It's like they have abandoned this property completely.

name: Alexia Williams
text: Ms. Kim was very professional and apartments are very nice

name: Carina B
text:
I should've known when we first moved in and our kitchen hadn't been clean this was a bad decision. We moved in last year when they had their 3,2,1 special going. Need less to say we terminated our lease early. The maintenance were messing up more than they patched up, they change management maybe four times from April-Dec. and we had to constantly go to the office to verify rent payments due to them loosing or not filing money orders.

We've moved out going on three months and they still can't give us our complete and correct total-out !!

name: MR. LÓPEZ PAINTER LLC
text: Good

name: Fifi Fields
text: Went by there the other day because of a reference & Ms Sonya was very polite & showed us around . We drove around & it was clean outside & there wasn’t anybody just hanging out .

name: cornell stewart
text: Wonderful and Outstanding services 😀

name: Juseda Parker
text: I have tried several times to get understanding of why nothing is done correctly....I have requested someone to call me from corporate but if course that haven't happened...Their is no concern for their tenants safety at all.

name: Brii Jones
text: The leasing consultant are great

name: Jacob Murray
text: Extremely mediocre, but after repeated management changes, continues to disappoint. I Referred someone over a year ago and never received the promised amount deducted from my rent after repeated times of me asking about it. I have been a resident for going on three years and Woodmere never sprays for bugs or changes air filters. There is a MOUNTAIN of dust on the old filter. I didn't mind some of these things because it was fairly inexpensive here, but they are raising my rent, and after witnessing no changes, with the exception of repeated management change I will NOT be renewing my lease. I have lived in similar quality apartments in Montgomery with much better maintenance for far cheaper.

name: Natalie Quebodeaux
text: I have been in the office asking about rates and to view apartments 3 times in the last year and every single time I am told that they would rather show me pictures. It is quite lazy. They don't even show the property around. Incredibly unfriendly staff. Will not be staying with them.

name: Ashley Cline
text: If I could give less than one star, I would. Absolutely mediocre. Our A/C has been broken constantly for a month straight. They do not want to replace any parts. They just charge it up for cool air to come out, then immediately goes down a couple of days later. We obviously need a new unit, but they do not care. I, once again, called at 10am to let them know that it is down. I come home from work at 05pm AND IT IS STILL HOT. I am four months pregnant and cannot live with these conditions. Hopefully contacting corporate will make a difference.

name: Random User
text: They employ abosolute creeps like Johnathon Rhodes. He’s a real piece of work.

name: Zion Beachem
text: good , quiet community

name: duru angel
text: Do not rent too bad bad

name: C DIXON
text: Daughter's apt broken into broad daylight lived right in front of rental office. No one seen anything. 50 inch tv stolen lived on 2nd floor. Her door was kicked in but after they left they locked her door.what thief would do that?   Her neighbor's apt broken into a week later only his clothes were stolen no electronics. He said 2nd time in less than a year.   Makes me wonder if management was involved. My daughter asked management (Nitu) if she could move to a different building. Nitu told her if that apt was broken into what do she think would happen if she moves to another building? That should tell you a lot! When my daughter went to turn in her keys Nitu was rude again.  When my daughter was leaving the other two ladies  that work there followed her outside and told her that Nitu is crazy . Im sure the home management is reading these reviews but nothing is being done so that shows they don't care about the tenant's or the crazy rude Nitu !

name: Anthony
text: Too many break-ins and robberies when I was there back in 08.  Thugs target the community often.

name: Tasha Laskey
text: Nice

name: Ivory Moore
text: It just amazes me how this complex can NEVER answer the phone but will send out text messages, emails with bills, or if you go to the front office, everyone is up there but not doing too much. I’ve had complaints & questions, and I’ve left messages but no reply. Until I can get a call or a response, I feel there is no reason to answer

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave this rating, Ivory. We appreciate hearing your perspective and we're happy that we had the chance to speak with you.  If you have additional questions or concerns, please give us a call at (334) 244-2091, or send me an email at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com.  Our goal is to always provide our residents with exceptional service.
Thank you.
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Tammy Evans
text:
My daughter lived at the Tapestry on Vaughn for a year!  When she was leaving the residence, we had Joyce Mann make sure that all was taken care of from the walk through to the end of the paperwork!!!!  She was AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Her personality was so helpful, kind, and genuine !!!! She was our calm against the storm we encountered with the manager.  Joyce also worked with our invoice and made the corrections. Her co-worker Sam was so kind and polite and helpful as well. TheTapestry apartment complex is very blessed to have these 2 people working for you. Joyce should be the one that is managing your apartment complex!!!!!!!!!
______________________________________________________________________
On the other hand you have a most UNPROFESSIONAL  manager working for your complex. Kristen shut her door the whole time we were there and had an employee ask us to make an appointment and come back at a later time.  We asked for her bosses name and she refused to give that to the employee (Sam)  I was on my lunch break and needed to make the closing happen!  She handed us a bill with an outrageous amount on the invoice (the day prior to us returning to make the payment) which came to double the amount actually owed !!!!!!!!!!!!!! She had asked her employees not to take my daughters calls, which she denied. Fortunately,  we have it recorded to prove if anyone is interested in hearing that!!!!! Kristen likes to work on intimidation.... which does not work on me !!!!!

resp.text: Tammy, we are sorry to see that you have not had the positive experience that we seek to provide all our residents and guests. We would like the opportunity to speak with you personally and ask that you come by our office, call us at (334) 244-2091, or email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com when you have time. Thank you. — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: EBHiro
text:
The apartments themselves are in decent shape; I have a unit with a nice renovated kitchen. I also had few issues with noise and had no trouble finding parking near my unit. The location is good too, being close to many shops and restaurants.

However, maintenance can be slow to fix things. Also, today I came home to find a carbon monoxide alarm installed in my unit. While it's nice to have, I wish I'd received advanced notice from management that they planned to have maintenance come into my apartment to install it.

resp.text:
It sounds as though your experience here has been overall positive and we wish we could have earned a higher star rating. We understand your concerns and appreciate your feedback. If you'd like to discuss further, please call us at (334) 244-2091 or email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com. Thank you.
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Kayla Woodruff
text: I recently graduated from college and have been looking for apartments to start my new journey post-grad. When I came to the property, I was greeted by the friendliest and sweetest individual, Sam. He was such a great help with looking at different apartments, explaining amenities and why I should choose this property. He seemed to be very passionate about his job and helping others find a new home. I have never experienced such customer service like I did with Sam. He is a great asset to your team and a wonderful face for the company. I will be telling others to come look at this property with Sam. I hope to move in soon and look forward to working further with this company. I hope to see Sam promoted soon, because his skill set, personality and passion is what every job needs and should look for!

resp.text: Kayla, thanks so much for your five-star rating and positive review of Tapestry. Nothing brightens our day like kind words about our team. Exceptional customer service is always among our highest priorities!  — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Amelia Lawson
text: What an awesome experience I had with helping someone with their move-in process. The office staff was so professional and got things done in a timely manner. I am just speechless about the outstanding communication skills and follow up time frame that Sam had. He has great communication skills. The move in process was perfect and right on time. I feel so proud and  good  about referring someone to this property. The apartment looked fabulous at move-in. Call and ask for Sam.

resp.text: Welcome to Tapestry, Amelia! It's wonderful that you received such excellent service from our team, as it's our goal to provide our community members with the very best care and attention! Please don't hesitate to let us know if we can be of further assistance to you as you get settled in. — Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Brendarius Thomas
text: Was looking for a one bedroom called the tapestry spoke with Joyce. She gave me info on the apartment she was very friendly and concern with my preference to assure I would be happy with my apartment. She told me about another property that’s with the company because she didn’t have anything available. What stood out to me the most is that although she couldn’t help me she didn’t just push me away. She provided me the name and number to the apartments she also called there and  explained what I was looking for to them and let them knew I was headed over. Joyce went the extra mile and I appreciated it I really wish they had what I was looking for at the tapestry. But she did state if a one bedroom became available she would contact me

resp.text:
Hi Brendarius, Thank you for your five-star rating. We always appreciate hearing when team members have been helpful and responsive to your needs. This is the kind of service you can expect from our communities. We are always happy to help!
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Mary Bates Tyson
text: I recently moved to Montgomery after a divorce and needed a place to live.  One of my girlfriends suggested The Tapestry.  She said to ask for Mr. Samuel Tyson.  Of course, because of the COVID-19, I wasn't able to enter the office but I appreciated the complex for following health and safety guidelines. I called and Mr. Tyson answered the phone with such professionalism.  All the questions that I asked, he was able to respond with no hesitation.  He was so patience but detailed and concise.  I did not have many questions to ask because he covered almost everything when speaking with me.  He offered a virtual tour and of course, I accepted.  I was so drawn in by his professionalism, courteous and kind voice, I would have signed a lease without even looking at the apartment.  I must give Mr. Tyson his kudos because he really represented The Tapestry on Vaughn.  I will come back and tell you all about my virtual tour.  I would recommend my friends to this property!

resp.text: Mary, thanks so much for taking a moment to review Tapestry! We're thrilled that your virtual tour experience was so positive and that you received exemplary care from our team. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any additional questions! — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Carie Frost
text:
Tapestry on Vaughn needs to seek out NEW Management. The office staff don't return phone calls, the maintenance staff do poor quality work.
Rent from the Arbors on Taylor.  Happy people live there👍👍👍

resp.text: We wish we could have earned a higher star rating, Carie. We are more than happy to address any concerns you may have. Please feel free to swing by the office, give us a call at (334) 244-2091, or email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com. Thank you. —Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Jasmine Smith
text: Just would like to say if you are searching for somewhere to stay to call Tapestry on Vaughn . I called and received info about a 2bed room spoke with Joyce who answered the phone. She asked questions and provided me all the info I needed I swear I was sold over the phone she was pleasant she didn’t over talk me (like somewhere else I called) she also offered to send me all the info we went over so I could share it with my parents. The world need more office staff like her. I will most definitely be moving there soon and I’m excited about it. Thank you Tapestry on Vaughn

resp.text:
Thank you for your five-star rating, Jasmine! It's always great to hear when our team members have been responsive and helpful, we appreciate your compliments and look forward to you joining our community. If you have any further questions, comments or concerns, please feel free to reach out! Thanks again.
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director, cdtapestry@liverangewater.com or (334) 244-2091

name: Infinite Layerz
text: Very amazing customer service. Exceeded my expectations by a long shot. This is an extremely nice environment and location to stay in, especially being that it’s isolated. The apartments are very nice. I’ve referred several to consider moving to the area.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write this review of Tapestry! The comfort of our residents is of the highest importance to us. We are happy to know the quality of your apartment and the service of our staff have met your expectations.  — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Kelsey Evans
text:
This place is HORRIBLE. The manager tried to rip me off over 3 thousand dollars!! She is very unprofessional and when I tried to talk to her about why she was charging me so much she would avoid me, ignore my phone calls and emails. Then I went to the office so Kristen could explain this to me and she closed her door and would not come out.  She is a liar and needs to be put out.  DO NOT LIVE HERE. I had nothing but problems since the day I moved in.
Kristen Taplin is a thief.

resp.text: We’re sorry you feel this way, Kelsey. Our goal is to stay true to the highest ethical standards and principles and be honest, trustworthy and humble in all of our words and actions. We follow the lease contract when assessing fees and/or charges. If we have made a mistake or have not explained the charges thoroughly, we sincerely apologize. We are happy to discuss this with you and invite you to stop by our office, give us a call at (334) 244-2091, or email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com. Thank you. — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: James (Landon) Johnson
text: I would say this place is just livable. The maintenance guys are nice. The place wasn’t really prepared for us to move in (there was dirt on the floors, the tubs were not clean with hair still in them, dryer and washer weren’t hooked up along with dust and lint all in the laundry room, etc.). My car was hit by another residents vehicle on the property in one instance. Shortly after, my car was then broken into and had items stolen from inside. They have cameras, HOWEVER, be aware they do not cover the entire property (leaving at least the large corner of parking spots near my building blind) as I have witnessed first hand in the office from seeing footage. Upstairs neighbors did a lot of stomping and smoking. My unit constantly smelled of marijuana.

resp.text: I am sorry about your experience with your vehicle. We would like to speak with you about your concerns in hope of restoring your opinion. Please feel free to call us at (334) 244-2091 or email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com when you have a moment. I look forward to speaking with you. Thank you. - Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Mary Brown
text:
Super friendly staff Sam and Joyce are very professional and that’s what I loved the most.Joyce I think is the asst manager was very helpful. We did everything virtual she even FaceTime me from her phone just to make sure I was able to feel like i was there In person during the whole tour.

I did decide to move in thanks to Joyce she made the process smooth and easy during this pandemic and I can’t thank her enough. Property is alway clean and I also love my neighbors. If you are looking to move call Joyce or Sam you will not be disappointed! Thanks again Joyce

resp.text: Welcome to Tapestry, Mary! Thank you for your five-star rating and positive review! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your tour experience, as we strive to provide exceptional customer service. We look forward to your continued comfort and happiness as a member of our community. — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Jaboris Thomas
text: Ms. Joyce & Sam at the front are awesome! I would move back there if I’m stationed back in Montgomery

resp.text: Thank you for this spectacular review, Jaboris! —Kristen Taplin Community Director

name: S Moorer
text: My experience was nothing short of amazing. I am familiar with the property so I called for pricing info spoke with Joyce after our conversation I had all I needed she was friendly/professional we was talking like we have known each other for years lol . My lease isn’t up til November where I live now but I will most definitely be reaching back out to Joyce when I’m ready to move

resp.text: Thank you so much for your five-star rating and positive review of Tapestry! We're delighted that you received such great care from our team. Your compliments are appreciated. — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: M Brown
text: My daughter stayed there for a year, this place seemed to be good but it was awful the neighbors were rude and the maintenance was not that great. Overall the staff are somewhat nice but these people are truly out to get your money! My daughter paid almost $300 and they never bothered to say anything.

resp.text: Mike, we're sorry that your daughter departed our community with unpleasant feelings. We would like the opportunity to speak with her personally to learn more about her concerns and what we could have done to improve. We can be reached at (334) 244-2091, or she may email me at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com. Thank you. — Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Patrick Brasell
text:
Terrible place to live. Staff are not on the same page, we were told due to covid-19 that a 30 day notice would be sufficient before non-renewal. A month later, the manager tells me that I have to pay an extra month even though I’m not living there. Our cars were broken into on their property. Huge lack of security. Obvious drug deals in the parking lots. Awful environment. Live anywhere else but here.

Edit since response: The “Community Director” sarcastically thanked me for my review on google and then stated that I would now not be receiving a $300 referral fee that I was owed for referring a friend 4 months ago. Greed and corruption at its finest. I have never been spoken to or treated with such disrespect. I have received support from the Department of Housing and Urban Development and have moved forward with the Better Business Bureau and the Attorney General’s Office. I encourage anyone else that is being mistreated by this manager to do the same. As you can see from the other recent reviews, there is a definite problem with management.

resp.text: Patrick, we are sorry to see that you have not had the positive experience that we seek to provide all our residents and guests. We would like the opportunity to speak with you personally and ask that you call us at (334) 244-2091 or send me an email at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com when you have time. Thank you. - Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: LaQuanna Turner
text: I moved to this property in March of 2019.  Assistant Manager /Accountant Joyce is so Professional.  Joyce has the same personality ( positive and friendly) every time you call the office or go into the office.

resp.text:
Thank you for your five-star rating,  LaQuanna! We always appreciate hearing when team members have been helpful and responsive to your needs.  Thank you for choosing to make your home in our community!
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Katelyn Woodruff
text: One of the best complex in the city of Montgomery, Sam, Joyce, and Kristen been so helpful through my process looking at apartments.I highly recommend the team and the complex 😊😊

resp.text:
Thank you for your five-star rating, Katelyn! We always appreciate hearing when team members have been helpful and reliable. We are honored to receive your high recommendation!
-Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Ly Nguyen
text: Management is constantly changing and the staff at front office is decent. We’ve contacted them numerous time regarding our deposit but get the same response of “it’s on the way” each time. We’ve moved out at the end of September 2019 and paid all the appropriate fees. It’s been over 3 months and we still haven’t received our deposit back and that’s unacceptable!

resp.text: Please accept our apologies for your inconvenience, Ly. Our records indicate that the deposit was sent. Please give us a call at (334) 244-2091 or email us at cdtapestry@liverangewater.com so that we can look into this for you. Thank you. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Shalonda J
text: I love this complex my apartment feels so much like home , being as though this is my first apartment/ rental experience the assistant manager Joyce.H has been nothing short of AMAZING with her warm , friendly and professional personality. This complex is also very clean and there is not a lot of noise or disturbances . Conveniently located near several gas stations , CVS , Starbucks , Publix and Walmart . This is the Montgomery’s best kept secret!  Thank you Tapestry for having me and welcoming my baby boy and me 💕🥰😊

resp.text: Welcome to Tapestry, Shalonda! We're thrilled that you and your son are enjoying your living experience. We look forward to continuing to provide you with excellent care and attention. Thank you for your positive review and your residency! — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Verbal Assassin
text: I have not had the pleasure of living with the Tapestry yet but my experience with getting the process started has been the best! I went to apartments.com to search for a new place to call home and I have been away from apartments for some years but this price gouge on rent and the application fee for some apartments compared to years back is crazy. I just so happen to click on The Tapestry and just from the photos and other details about the complex I was interested. Last week I called inquiring about their available units, I had the pleasure of speaking with Sam who informed me to call the following week for updates on units. After being told there were no available units by other complexes, I received a breath of fresh air with The Tapesty today. I must say Sam left a great impression on me, he was very poliet and patient with each question I asked and answered each question with detail and not just a basic yes/no. I was able to view one of the units and it was not bad. A nice size one bedroom for just me and in a good price range. I was sold and did the paperwork same day with updates on the process. They did not make me feel as if they were just telling me anything to get me to move in an then hit me with the B.S later . Which ever way this process goes with being accepted or denied having the pleasure of meeting Sam and experiencing his great customer service will not only have me recommend The Tapesy to others but give The Tapestry on Vaughn..5 Stars🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟!

resp.text: Thank you for telling us about your application experience! We're thrilled that you had such a good experience and that our team demonstrated exceptional customer care. After all, we pride ourselves on providing our residents with exemplary service! We look forward to welcoming you as a new member of Tapestry community. — Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: T Jackson
text: Office staff helpful and friendly nice side of town quiet apartments

resp.text: Thanks for your five-star rating of Tapestry! We love receiving such positive feedback from happy residents. — Kristen Taplin, Community Director

name: Tanisha Dan'Yielle
text: This is a very honest review ! I worked at this property...Firstly, they can’t keep good management in the office, and they have different managers every couple of months. The current manager is horrible ! She’s rude, disrespectful, and very nasty ! I would not advise ANYONE to stay at this property. The property has gates which don’t work & the price you’re paying for rent isn’t worth what the property looks like! Maintenance is horrible also, it appears some of them don’t really know how to do their job correctly. The gym sucks ! Most of the equipment isn’t operable. So save yourself the hassle & find something else.. & that’s not even the majority of the issues you will deal with renting here.

name: McKenzie Ferrell
text: This place is a big ol’ scam. I’m a college student that was trying to get an apartment for my last year of school and this complex seemed like a decent place. Wrong. I knew i was going to need a co-signer because i didn’t make enough money. I filled out an application for me and my mother and paid the administration fee. $200 and i get denied because her credit wasn’t very good. Okay no problem, i just ask my brother to do it cause he has excellent credit and makes the 3x the rent that they required. Another $50 for the application just to get denied. They said that he didn’t make enough which is a flat out lie. Not only did they just take $250 from me, they almost made it to where i couldn’t come back for school because it was two weeks before school started and i didn’t have housing on campus. Luckily the very helpful ladies down at Peppertree worked to find an open unit for me at the last minute. Stay very far away from this complex.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns, McKenzie. Would you mind emailing or calling us at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com or (334) 244-2091 so that we can look into this further? Our goal is to provide  exceptional service in a timely manner. Thank you. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Emily
text: Hello to all newcomers: my name is Ms.Dee I have lived at the tapestry for two and a half years. I have really been enjoying my stay here it’s  a wonderful community to live in. The new community manager Ms. Brenda is a very professional lady, she  is doing a wonderful job making sure this community is together. The ladies that assist in the office is Tori and Faith and they  are very professional as well and stay on top of things to assist Ms. Brenda. The maintenance guys ..Speedy, Cedric and Charles. Are professional and they get the jobs done that are requested. They do a wonderful job keeping the community clean the crew that does the land scape are really good at making it beautiful around here. I have read a lot of bad reviews about the tapestry and with  my experience here I have not experienced what I'm reading. Sometimes when people get upset they want to give bad reviews to make a company look bad. So to anyone looking for a place to stay  come on home to The Tapestry on Vaughn. I hope to see you all soon.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write this incredible review! We are delighted that you feel comfortable and safe in your apartment. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Wes Mills
text: I've lived at The tapestry on Vaughn for a little over a year. It's a vast improvement, $400 less for moving less than a mile, over where we were staying. I don't have many complaints about the community, there are some...... instigators, and none about the office. My one and only issue is the gates as they've been broken since we moved in but with the amount of people I've seen hit them, it makes sense. Maintenance is usually quick, courteous and kind. They've handled every issue we've had very quickly, the same day in a few instances. Update: The dryer has been fixed. It was a fault in the heating elements.

resp.text: Hi, Wes! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave this 5-star review. We are glad that you are pleased with the time you’ve spent with us so far. However, we’d love to speak with you in hopes of resolving these few concerns you’ve mentioned. Please feel free to reach out to us if you’d like to discuss it with us directly. We’d love to know how we can enhance your living experience. Thanks again! - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: v lee
text: Next month will make it my 3rd year at this apartment complex and I have nothing good to say about it.  My 3 year living  experience here has been awful from the office personnel on down to my neighbors (not all my neighbors were bad). When I first moved in they lost my deposit and almost caused me to pay a late fee for the next month's rent plus another deposit if I had not a copy of my cashier's check. They left the burden of proof on me to provide the copy of my deposit.  The did not care what that they were the ones who made the mistake.  I've had awful neighbors my whole 3 years at the here at this apartment complex. Tori has not always been nice. When Lisa was the manager, she had a nasty attitude; however since management has changed several times, I have seen an improvement in her attitude.  The new manager and Faith, I haven't had a problem with them, I can say they are better than the old manger and do try to resolve issues; however, I'm sick of this place and have decided to move on now.  It served the purpose until I could get on my feet but I had to suffer with noisy neighbors in the process and bad management.

resp.text: Thank you for your time. We are sorry you feel this way, for our number one priority is to always provide the best possible living experience for our residents. Given the nature of your concerns, we would like to speak with you directly. Please stop by our office, give us a call at 334-244-2091, or send me an email at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com. Thank you. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Joi Boone
text: I moved Montgomery from California.  I paid the necessary fees to live here. I then get a phone call stating that I was told the wrong amount, thus I owe them more money.  I was emailed a copy of my contract with a line going through the hold amount and a new amount written in. I decided not to move in because of this and wanted my money back. Though this apartment complex changed the lease agreement, thus the contract was voided, they have refused to give my money back.  I contacted the BBB. The BBB had to contact this apartment complex twice for them to respond to my complaint. Finally, this apartment complex stated they would refund my money. Still haven’t seen it. These people were unprofessional.  I would not recommend living here.

resp.text: Hi, Joi. Thank you for your time. We apologize for any inconvenience regarding your refund. We can confirm that your check was mailed to the address we have on file. Please stop by our office, give us a call at 334-244-2091, or an email at acdtapestry@matrixresidential.com if you’d like to discuss this with us further. Thank you. - Torey Hudson, Associate Community Director

name: candice burke
text: I love Tori and Faith, however they keep getting new managers. Who are alley, ratchet hood liars who are either rude and unprofessional or will tell you anything to get you to leave the office.  I re-signed my lease worth the understanding that I was to get my carpet and padding replaced after multiple "floods" in my hall,  dining and living area.  They were also supped to fix my "power problem" in which the lights keep blowing and breakers keep tripping.  My lamp caught fire one day and a separate outlet caught fire one night.  Also, my apartment was supposed to be repainted.  They came and "fixed" my stove, all the eyes work now but one doesn't get as hot as it should and the other gets way too hot, putting it on 6 is like putting it on high.  These are only SOME of the problems that that I have endured for the last 3 years.  Then they offered for me to stay in a letter with a RENTAL RATE INCREASE!!!  Laughable, thanks but no thanks.  I'm tempted to take photos of my apartment so you can see what you are REALLY getting if you move in here.  Furthermore the gate NEVER works and the fitness center has ONE Treadmill and ONE Elliptical and one weirdo that is always in there.  I don't even go in there anymore because it is scary.

resp.text: Thank you for your time, Candice. We do appreciate all feedback, but we are disappointed that you feel this way about our community and team. We assure you that one of our main priorities is to provide quick and efficient fixes to maintenance issues that are brought to our attention, and we apologize if you feel this hasn’t been the case. We’d like to discuss this with you directly and invite you to reach out to us at the office, over the phone at 334-244-2091, or via email at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com when you have the time. Thank you. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Crystal Dee
text: I have nothing good to say about this property since I've moved in. The apartment that I chose wasn't ready so I was given a different apartment. Then I put in a service request on 5/22/19 and here it is 09/23/19 and the service request is still open. The service request was in regards to the tubs because they are not stable and unsafe! Was told that a lot of other tenants are having the same issue but no resolution. So I called the office last week and one of the staff told me that the issue is no longer their priority and was told that I would be called back regarding the issue and as always never received a returned call. I have even reached out to the corporate office via email and still no one responds. At this point, I'm just angry and appalled!

resp.text: Crystal, thank you for your feedback. Our desire is to always provide our residents with the service they expect and deserve, and we sincerely apologize if you feel we've ever fallen short of this goal. I would like to address your concerns in a timely manner and ask that you email me directly with your apartment number at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com at your earliest convenience. Thank you. - Randi Farmer, Community Director

name: Markell Cobbs
text: I just recently ended a two year residency here, my first luxury apartment lease, and I have to say that torey and faith made it the smoothest experience I've had in this type of situation. Any of the few issues we had while living here were often handled by torey in the same day and they always made sure to follow through to ensure our continued satisfaction as residents. Although they were the property managers, they easily felt more like friends and made the apartment renting experience here far less stressful than is usually experienced. I would readily recommend this community under the guidance of these ladies to anyone seeking affordable living in a home environment.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave this review! We care deeply about our residents and aim to provide the best in customer service and quality. We are pleased that you enjoy the community and have had an overall positive experience! - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: JOSHUA JAMES
text: I would give them a two thumbs up because every time I have a problem they fix it. I been live here going on 4 years and they have one of the best customer service that I ever had at a apartment complex. The people who works in the office are like family and I don't have any family in Montgomery at all. So if I just need to talk to someone they always there to listen. They are awesome to me and this is a great place to live. So if you ever in the neighborhood I think you should go check it out and see what I see.

name: Caitlin Campbell
text: One of the worst managed apartment complexes in Montgomery. Nothing is ever fixed correctly or in a timely manner, the front gate doesn't close but you're paying for a "gated community" and the pool stayed a horrible green color during the entire summer last year. Not to mention they overprice these rundown apartments. I wouldn't recommend this property to anyone.

resp.text: Hello Caitlin and thank you very much for reaching out and bringing this to our attention. We take all allegations like these VERY seriously and would love to procure additional information. I am a corporate representative for JMG and will investigate immediately. Please send additional details to FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com. Thank you very much & have a great day

name: Billy Dee
text: I would have like to rate it, but I guess they don't want military service members living here.  I've went by to apply during normal business hours. I went by on 01/06 twice, once at 10 and second at 3. I've been by several time this week when off base and the office is closed, guess they just open the office at their convenience. I've  emailed and called the information below in the response, and nothing. I've left information on the automated service..nothing.I'll pass on this place the reviews look accurate with my experience, glad I checked out the paddock club, so I can get off base housing .

resp.text: Billy, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. Our manager would like to help turn your lackluster experience around. If you're willing, please contact our manager at (334) 440-7928 or at FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com to discuss what we can do to help.

name: Rosalind HH
text: I recently had an issue with my air conditioning unit.  Mr. Matthews left me several notes regarding the status of the attempted repair and the replacement unit.  He was even kind enough to replace a light bulb that he noticed was blown.

resp.text:
We appreciate your five-star rating, Rosalind. The comfort of our residents is of the highest importance to us. We are happy to know the quality of your apartment and the service of our staff have met your expectations and we thank you for your residency!
-Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Farris Y. Nawas
text: Great apartment complex to live in. Tory and Faith are awesome!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write this incredible review! We are delighted that you feel comfortable in your apartment. - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: prinshay robinson
text: Tapestry is a great place to move in!!! Ladies in the office is awesome very friendly great staff good😘😘😘😘❤️❤️

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Prinshay! We’re so glad you feel this way. Please let us know if there is ever anything we can do for you. Thanks again! - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Sheryl Spencer
text: This complex has potential.  Unfortunately, there are issues. Our apartment wasn't ready when we got there; cleaning lady was "working". We moved into a roach infested dishwasher and kitchen, dirty carpet, and an A/C that kept breaking down (took over 2 months to repair). We definitely did not move into an apartment as nice as what we were shown in the model.  The former maintenance supervisor was horrible. The gates worked maybe two months of the 12 month lease. It isn't really a gated community. The pool was okay. Dumpster areas were gross.  However, the trees and plants were pretty, and we had some nice neighbors. Sadly they moved out too. They changed management/owners again, so maybe it will get better.  My husband and I just decided it was not a place for us.

resp.text: Sheryl, thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We’re sorry that you had issues with previous management, but we're glad that you can see the potential in this community. We strive to offer the best in customer service and maintenance, and we are looking forward to working hard to provide a comfortable home for our residents. If you'd like to speak with a member of our team about the changes we're planning to make, or about how you think we can improve, we'd like to chat. We'd also like the chance to speak with you about the work orders you submitted and the problems you experienced with the gate. Please stop by the office, give us a call at (334) 244-2091 or send us an email at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com. Thank you - Lisa Jemison, Community Director

name: Kimberly Pendarvis
text: Not friendly. When you come into the rent office they don't speak to you like you are a paying resident with a smile on their face. The one girl that would speak kindly is no longer present. But that is not my biggest concern. This apartment complex is going to be in trouble for the simple fact that I have lived out here for two years now. My apartment has near it a Lamppost in the grass that has been out for several months now. Basically when I come home it's dark. I have submitted a service request two times, 1 via the web and the other in person to the unfriendly staff. I explained to them that me being a young lady living here by myself it's not good for me to continue to come home at night sometimes and walk back there with no light on. Last month I made a third request. Each time I am met with an excuse that they don't handle the lamp post, that it is Alabama Power who does it and that they will get them out there to change the light. It has been four months now and that light is still not working! I don't think the representatives had a sense of urgency to contact the proper people to get this fixed and I'm upset. Not only that, I'm concerned for my safety. Aside from this one major issue, the apartment complex is a great place to live. There is no pest issue. It has beautiful landscaping. It is super quiet. The neighbors are super respectful. This issue right here and the unfriendliness of the staff is the one thing that kept them getting five stars. I cannot ignore the fact that I am being ignored. They are not the ones coming home in the dark each day. I have done my part and notify them of the issue. Somebody can get on a ladder and fix the light! What gets me is how they found a way to charge me $25 for garbage bag sitting at my door in which I was intending to take out but they will not change the lightbulb. It's an utter insult to a good resident.

resp.text: Hello Kimberly and thank you very much for reaching out and bringing this to our attention. We take all allegations like these VERY seriously and would love to procure additional information. I am a corporate representative for JMG and will investigate immediately. Please send additional details to FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com. Thank you very much & have a great day

name: K_Chavonne MUA
text: Not worth the money at all!!!! The gate never works! So this isn’t a “gated community “ . When you walk into the rental office NO ONE SPEAKS! They look at you like you’re crazy! Maintenance is slow as ever! My apartment looked nothing like the model they showed me. I just cannot wait to move !

resp.text: We're sorry you feel this way, Keynesha. While we appreciate all feedback, we are disappointed to read that you feel negatively towards our community at this time. It is a priority for our maintenance team to ensure that they respond to work orders quickly and efficiently and we apologize if you feel we've ever fallen short of this goal. We are glad that we were able to discuss this with you and get a work order submitted to fix your oven. If you would like to discuss this matter with us further, please feel free to stop by our office, give us a call at (334) 244-2091, or an email at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com whenever you have the time. Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your time. Thank you. - Lisa Jemison, Community Director

name: The Life of Lani
text: Tonight was our last night. I cried leaving. We stayed here a year and I enjoyed every bit of it. I was pregnant when we first moved in and I can’t believe we left with a whole baby 😂. Faith and Torrey were amazing! Maintenance came on time. We only had a few problems but they were fixed right away. The only thing I didn’t like was the fact that the gates didn’t work the whole year we stayed but if you didn’t care to be in a gated community like that then they didn’t matter. Our apartment came with an alarm system so we were okay. Our neighbors were amazing as well. Everyone respected one another and it was very quiet. If you don’t get a renovated spot, you can use contact paper and make it feel like home which is exactly what it was for us. I put the contact paper on all of the cabinets and countertops so the cabinets looked like they were all completely wood and the countertops looked like they were granite. I got the wood contact paper from the Dollar Tree and the countertop contact paper from Walmart. When it was time to leave, it took seconds to take everything up. I hate that we left because we made so many memories, but due to family circumstances we had to move. I will definitely remember the Tapestry and thank you so much for everything Torrey and Faith!

resp.text: We are happy to hear that you have had an overall great experience here; our residents' comfort is of the utmost importance to us. Thank you for leaving this review! - Brenda Ellis, Community Director

name: Jasmin Valentine
text: There are FAR better apartment complexes to live in the Montgomery area! The office staff is HORRIBLE. Faith was the only sweetheart in the office. Gates never worked. There is a bar hanging off the exit gate that can be easily ran over & damage someone’s car. The place needs to be renovated, don’t be fooled by the kitchen! The walls had cracks & were peeling. You couldn’t even wipe the walls down, if something spilled, bcuz the paint was coming off with it. Maintenance is SLOW to move/repair. You pay for pest control, & I don’t even know if they come out on a consistent basis. The apartment we were in had a mouse, & it was no concern to anyone in the office. In fact, they tried to bring a mouse trap over one week prior to us moving out, even after complaining for weeks about the mouse. The parking area has huge potholes near the speed bumps. The water has a black substance coming out every now and then. All in all, this place is not worth what it costs to live here. Run!!

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing this review with us, Jaz. All feedback is important to us, whether positive or negative, as it helps us work to improve our community and the experience of our residents. However, it is disappointing to read such a poor assessment of our community. Our team wants nothing more than to provide a 5-star experience for all of our residents and we apologize if you feel we've fallen short of this goal. We urge any resident that is experiencing maintenance or pest issues to notify our team immediately so that we can work to address them. We would love to speak with you regarding your concerns so that we may improve your opinion of our community. Please stop by the office, give us a call at 334-244-2091, or send an email to cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com.  - Markita Yates, Community Director

name: Francis B
text: I scheduled to tour here at 11:00AM and there's no one in the office. The office should have opened almost two hours ago at 10:00AM. They didn't call to let me know that they would be late, and I doubt they're going to show up. I'm glad this is my first experience so I can be sure to escape the problems that would surely have followed. I had plenty of time to read poor reviews that were posted in only the past few months.

resp.text: Francis, we sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. We’d like to speak with you in hopes of restoring your opinion. Please stop by our office, give us a call at 334-244-2091, or an email at acdtapestry@matrixresidential.com whenever you have the time. Thank you. - Torey Hudson, Associate Community Director

name: DeadOf NightRecords
text:
The up stairs tennants really put on a show early this morning. I was awaken around 1am to the sound of what can only be described as objects being thrown & the slamming of doors. A little after 2am, they were fussing & hollering. I started hearing noise from outside. I looked out, & they through a garbage bag of trash off their patio. A few minutes later, a second bag came down.

My wife is a teacher & they are waking her up at night & it is making it hard for her to get up in the morning.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to reach out. We know you've been in touch with our team directly, and have been updated on the situation at hand. If you have any other concerns, or if there is anything else keeping you from the five star experience we want every resident to have, we hope you won't hesitate to stop by the office, give us a call at 334-244-2091 or send an email to cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com. Thank you. - Markita Yates, Community Director

name: Haleigh Dennison
text: Been living here for 3 months, almost 4. Hate it. Office staff are nice, but maintenance is slow. They didnt give me a number to reach maintenance when I moved in which I thought was sketchy. Power went out for no reason, after paying nearly 200$ on the bill. The walls are paper thin, anything you might knock into the wall on even an accident will put holes in it, paint comes off when spilled things get on the wall, floor carpet comes up easily. Not somewhere I'd choose to live, I hate I picked here to spend the money I had and still have, I cant wait to move. Its gonna be a long ride. But, they fooled me with a picture that looked so good, dont get me wrong when I went to look at it, it was nice smelt nice too, but there were some things already tore up, LOTS of things, that I will and should not be held against when I move out at the end of my lease, cause they weren't me. And wall paper will peel, corner of walls will peel also, tapestry on Vaughn please do better. This isnt pleasant, and I just need help quicker when things go wrong, and better paint needs to be put on these walls. They also shouldnt be paper thin, I mean come on.

resp.text: Haleigh, thanks for taking the time to share your opinion of our community. While I'm glad that our front office team has been helpful, I'm sorry to read that you're unhappy with your home in our community. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further about your concerns with your home so that I can see what our team can do to improve your experience. When you can, please stop by the office to chat with me in person, or give me a call at 334-244-2091. You're also welcome to send me an email directly at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com. Thank you, and I look forward to speaking with you. - Markita Yates, Community Director

name: Kute Kaos
text:
Worst apartment complex ever!!!! Only gave them a star because google would not allow a post. My commode has not worked for a month ( backed up ... made several requests), when running my AC unit my apartment smells of mold ( I removed the vent...inside covered with mold as I thought) the awful leasing staff asked how I knew this... I have a nose plus check and asked you to resolve this issue several times for the amount I pay to live here.
Nasty attitude when you enter the leasing office is not a plus!!

resp.text: Hi, we regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. We do our best to ensure that appliances and fixtures are repaired in a timely manner, and regret that your requests have not been fulfilled. When you have an opportunity, please reach out to us at (334) 440-7928 or at FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com so we can try to restore your confidence in us. Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: T'Ana Mitchell
text: Not worth the price! My apartment was overall nice but maintenance was horribly slow. When I first moved in, my washing machine wasn't working properly.. took almost 3 months to fix. Then something broke in July and wasn't fixed until late November. And I understand that maintenance can't always get to things right away but that was inexcusable. My rent was not cheap so I definetly had higher expectations. The office staff wasn't the best I've encountered... Torey is nice though lol. But for 3 people to be working there I definetly think service could be better.

resp.text: Hello T'Ana and thank you very much for reaching out and bringing this to our attention. We take all allegations like these VERY seriously and would love to procure additional information. I am a corporate representative for JMG and will investigate immediately. Please send additional details to FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com. Thank you very much & have a great day

name: Jonathan Dearman
text: This is literally one of the worst places I have ever lived. At the time I was supposed to move in my apartment wasn't ready and I ended up with one of the run-down 3 bedrooms. Maintenance is slow or NEVER fixes things. The gate worked maybe 1 month total for my 12 month lease. The manager is ok but the other 2 employees are incompetent.

resp.text: Hi, Jonathan: Thank you for reviewing our community. We pride ourselves on maintaining clean units and properly working amenities for all of our residents. As our buildings age over time, we strive to quickly address and resolve any issues that might crop up so its disappointing to hear that you feel we let you down. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Aaron Watts
text: Gates are always broken for it to be a gated community. The apartment we toured verses the apartments we ended up with are vastly different.

resp.text: Aaron, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We apologize for any miscommunication regarding the gates, as we are no longer a gated community. According to our records, we understand that you saw your apartment once before you signed your lease and again on move-in day. However, we apologize if you feel it was not what you were expecting. We'd like to speak with you so that we can discuss this with you directly. Please feel free to stop by our office, give us a call at 334-244-2091, or an email at cdtapestry@matrixresidential.com. Thank you. - Lisa Jemison, Community Director

name: Chelsea Taylor
text:
This apartment complex is not worth the money. They fix stuff on their time and my apartment is still having a bug problem, which they told me this is something I have to live with. Pest control has been to my apartment about four times and I am still having this issue. My air has went out twice since I been here. I have only been here for 7 months. When I first moved to this apartment complex,  I had put in ton of maintenance request that just got fixed in Sept. I had a leak in my bathroom ceiling which when it first happen I called maintenance three
times and put two online request for them to come out

resp.text: Hi, Chelsea. Thank you for taking the time to bring this matter to our attention. Please give us a call at (334) 440-7928 at your earliest convenience, so we can further discuss the details in person. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: Henry Washington III
text:
The maintenance is beyond awful. Ive been here 9 months and still havent gotten things that need replacing/fixing done yet.
I hope that i can find somewhere asap before the lease up so i dont have to renew. The ac unit went out and they are taking their time about it when this is suppose to be an emergency situation,especially when outside temperature is above 90°. For the price of rent tenants shouldnt be treated so poorly!!!

resp.text: Hi there Saints Tigers, I'm a corporate representative of JMG and this review particularly concerns me. Would you have any problem emailing FeedbackSolutions@JMGrealty.com with your contact information so that we can follow up? We are so sorry for the inconvenience and look forward to solving any outstanding issues as quickly as possible. Thank you!

name: Madison Jones
text: Did not like the way a rent discrepancy was handled to begin with.

resp.text: Hello Madison and thank you for your feedback.  A member of the management staff will reach out to you shortly to discuss.   We aim to earn a five star review from you!

name: Kellen “pcwiz84” S
text: Prompt service

name: Jacob Mcnair
text: Nice up scale apts

name: Taneisha Williams
text: I live here currently, and it’s awesome. Maintenance is super nice and helpful. The office staff is very informative of my questions, and they are ready to help right away. I will live here until I Graduate!! The amenities are cool to use, and convenient. I like kayaking at the lake! I highly recommend living here as a Junior.

resp.text: Thank you, Taneisha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We're looking forward to another year of adventures with you!

name: Christopher (Gavin) Brazelton
text: Warning to potential renters. The 4.2 the cottages have is a lie. They get the residents to leave good reviews in exchange for free items through out the year. I work in housing and this is typically found as a bad practice by a bad company and typically looked down upon. I don’t typically do this but since I saw the good reviews I thought it was great. Let’s start from the beginning. I moved in and had already completed all move in paper work before getting there including my dog information and paid the pet deposit. I get there the day of move in and they say my dog cannot move in because they “lost the paper work” after a few hours of arguing I finally was able to move in in order to find my copy of all the paper work. We move in and the place is a mess nothing had been cleaned the carpets had stains everywhere. It was horrible I had never seen anything like it. They said they cleaned it which is weird since I could find tons of syrup or something spilt in the cabinets. I also found tons of dirty spots on the carpet through out the house. When I get to my room there was stains that looked like bleach stains which were easy to see since My bed was completely missing... my door was broke to the bathroom. Then come to find out the toilet was leaking. They never fixed the toilet i put in at least three work orders but it never got fixed so I just had to leave a cup under there and dump it every day so it would ruin my stuff... it wasn’t fixed until they changed out toilets for the entire community. Save yourself the trouble don’t live here was the worse experience of my college career would rather or lived in the dorm again.... I will add pics if I can..

resp.text: Christopher, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. We know that if anything would have been brought to our attention that we would have addressed the situation to the best of our ability. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at 205-409-2052 at your earliest convenience.

name: Kellianne Dodge
text: I highly recommend this for off campus housing! I spoke on the phone with a lovely lady who was very patient and eager to answer ALL of my questions (and there were a lot!). Thanks Mackenzie! Very excited to start my new journey here!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kellianne! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We're excited to welcome you home this fall!

name: Josh Arruda
text: The cottages was a great place to live. I had the time of my life there and I have memories I will forever cherish. Both Mackenzies were very helpful in the office. My time was so amazing at the cottages, I’m even going to be getting the logo tattooed across the entirety of my back so a memory of the cottages will live with me for the rest of my days. Absolutely great experience, 10/10 recommend.

resp.text: Josh, thank you for your honest review! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, as well as our sense of community. We're happy to hear that you have enjoyed communicating with all of the Mackenzie's that our office has to offer, haha!

name: Suzanne Coleman
text: This will be my daughters third year living with the cottages and we love it! She always talks about how fun their events are and I have always had a great experience when i come visit. Our favorite thing to do while I am in town is rent the Kayaks and spend the day on the lake! It is within walking distance and we do this every time I come (if the weather allows us) LOL

resp.text: Suzanne, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Ben Curtis
text: Beautiful place to live. The maintenance team is fantastic. And the management really cares about you. Rachel Curtis is a wonderful person to work with on getting your perfect place to live.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ben! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Mackenzie Cole
text: I have loved living at The Cottages this year! The staff is INCREDIBLE and always there when you need them! They are so fun during events and really like to provide residents with the best experience possible. I will miss them all & living here so much!

resp.text: Thank you, Mackenzie! We love hearing that you have enjoyed living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We're going to miss you but are wishing you the best of luck on your new adventure!!

name: Elizabeth Brigham
text: As a college student it can be hard to find off campus housing. After calling The Cottages looking for more info, Mackenzie C did an excellent job helping me with the apartment searching process! She was very knowledgeable and I look forward to living there for the upcoming semester!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Elizabeth! We are so happy to hear that you have had such a positive experience with our team! We're looking forward to welcoming you into your new home this fall!

name: Nannette Thompson
text:
My daughter has lived here for two years and loves it.
The houses are fantastic, large living and bedroom space. The staff is friendly and accommodating.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Nannette! We are happy to hear that you have had such a positive experience working with our team and that your daughter has enjoyed her time here!

name: glynn claridy
text: I love it here it’s not that far from campus and has so many things to do here. It’s not like any other normal apartment it’s a actual house and that’s what I love so much about it. Super safe here and have a lot of friendly neighbors at the cottages. Definitely worth my time and money living here 👍.

resp.text: Hi Glynn, Thank you for your awesome review! We are glad that your are embracing #CottageLife to the fullest!!

name: Emily Mack
text:
I lived in 3 places throughout my undergrad at UA. The Cottages was the best of those experiences without a doubt. Large bedrooms, quality amenities, and great staff. Maintenance requests were always fulfilled, common areas were always clean and well kept, not to mention how affordable this place is. Also, I lived much closer to campus before and had a longer drive time. 25th, Jack Warner, and that side of University don't get backed up so it's a relatively quick commute.

Having lived other places, I couldn't recommend this one enough.

resp.text: Thank you, Emily! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We appreciate you taking the time to write such a kind review!

name: Gayle Parris
text: Called to get info on the Cottages for my son. Tori did a great job explaining all the details and made it sound like a great place for him to live.  Looking forward to getting a tour from her.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Gayle! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Tori is a rockstar!

name: Breonna Alexander
text: I’ve lived here since august 2020 and I love it! So many amenities that are greatly maintained as well as staff who are always there to help. It’s a very nice community and everyone is very friendly. Also a great place to live if you have pets! Lots of greenspace for them to play in. Highly recommend living here.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Breonna! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Hannah Bishop
text: Love the cottages! Biggest pool, so many students, buses straight to campus, late night buses to take you to the strip! 🚍 Very pet friendly! Scenic walks on the lakes! Bonfires, movie nights, free food trucks & so much more!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Hannah! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them along with our resident events!! We look forward to seeing you at more in the future!

name: Brian Thompson
text: Great place to live, very safe.  Management personnel are the best - very friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend the Cottages.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Brian! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Eric Friello
text: The cottages is great and has great views along with many things to do. Tori was very helpful in the office and was great at answering all of my questions.
