resp.text: Thank you for your review, Eric! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Trey Dickey
text: I love living at the cottages. I get my own room and bathroom and lots of space for my puppy to play. Very pet friendly and a great place for student living. There is also a bus that takes you to and from campus if you are worried about transportation.

resp.text: Thank you, Trey!! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you and your pup are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Sarah M Coleman
text: Called today and spoke with Tori and what an amazing experience she is so knowledgeable and genuine. She was great and I cant wait for a tour!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Sarah! It is great to hear that you had such a positive experience with, Tori!

name: Victoria Oldham
text: I’ve lived at the Cottages for 5 months now and I am so happy that I found it. I love that I can live in my own little cozy house even at college :) The amenities seem endless with my favorite being the fact that I have a lake in my backyard! The staff has always been very helpful and friendly, with fun events and giveaways all the time. I’ve made so many memories here already and I can’t wait to make more.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your awesome review, Victoria! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We greatly appreciate your honest and detailed feedback, we're looking forward to the years to come!!

name: Jacob Feibusch
text: The cottages are very nice.  Very friendly staff with plenty of fun activities.  Yeah hI housing units are nice as well.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jacob! It is great to hear that you appreciate our hardworking staff and have enjoyed our events here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Sara Beth Loggins
text: 10/10 best place I have stayed! The cottages is a warm and welcoming place where everyone fits in and gets along. The amenities are great, getting to know your neighbors is amazing, and lastly the location is so convenient for students!

resp.text: Thank you, Sara! We're so happy to hear that you have had such a wonderful experience while living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Reid Bryan
text: Great place to live for such a low price The amenities are AMAZING and the staff are very nice!

resp.text: Thank you, Reid! It is so great to hear that you are enjoying your time with us here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Addison Wirt
text: The cottages has an amazing atmosphere with a pool and great places to take your dogs for a walk by the lake or enjoy an afternoon stroll. Leading with them has been by far the best choice!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Addison! We pride ourselves in our amenities and we love that you and your pup have enjoyed them!!

name: Caitlin McCann
text: Very nice place. I like walking by the lake. It is sometimes difficult to get questions answered by management, and sometimes work orders take a while to go through, but overall a good place to live and I enjoy it.

resp.text: Thank you Caitlin for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at (205) 409-2052 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with a member of our leasing team!

name: Shelby Johnson
text: Been living here since august, and I currently live in a 5 bedroom unit. Very spacious, love the pool and tennis courts, safe environment! Would totally recommended this over living in an apartment , it’s very nice to drive up to your house and not have to worry about elevators and parking decks!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Shelby! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Hanna Jernigan
text: Such a wonderful team in the office and on maintenance. They are so helpful when signing your lease. The apartments are great as well.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Hanna! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Julia Lener
text: My favorite part about the cottages is the student environment in the complex. I have made so many friends and I love running down by the lake. Overall has been a great college experience here at the cottages.

resp.text: Julia, thank you for your honest review! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, as well as our sense of community.

name: Mel Alberico
text: I just moved into the cottages as a junior and can honestly say I wish I lived here in my previous years. It feels like such a safe and comfortable community. The houses are absolutely great and I love having a house instead of a crammed apartment. I run the lake every morning and it’s a beautiful view! Highly recommend The Cottages!

resp.text: That is so sweet of you to say! Thank you, we are glad to have you here.

name: Rachel Curtis
text: I have honestly had the greatest experience with the cottages! The events are always so much fun and the fact that I have my own house has been my favorite part. The lake is really peaceful and overall been the best experience ive had anywhere in town

resp.text: Thank you so much, Rachel! We're so happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here and look forward to seeing you at many more resident events in the future!

name: Heidi Risher
text: I lived here during college, and I absolutely loved the experience. There is literally nothing like it in Tuscaloosa. Trust me, I lived in another apartment one year, and that place didn’t come close to the cottages. I miss it!! 10/10 recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Heidi! We love hearing that you enjoyed living with us, and we miss having you at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! Best of Luck!

name: Lauren Niemi
text: The Cottages is an awesome place to live and very safe. It has brought me awesome roommates as well as neighbors! The amenities are awesome! The lake is a great place to watch the sunsets or even fish. I’ve only been here for a month and it already feels like home. The houses are very spacious & a convenient location for students as the drive to campus is only about 3 minutes. The staff is very friendly! I highly recommend living at the cottages!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Lauren! We are so glad that your have had such positive experiences interacting with our team and that you are enjoying everything The Cottages has to offer!

name: Blake Swafford
text: Terrible service heat was out for five days. Peoples water gets arbitrarily shut off do not sign here. Management will not work with you at all. Staff was very unapologetic about the situation. We just resigned and are already having regrets. Only rated highly due to monetary incentive for positive reviews.

resp.text: Hey Blake, we are terribly sorry that you have had a bad experience. We did have to shut water off to 3 units that did not drip their pipes during the hard freeze warning to ensure that their houses did not flood when the pipes unfroze. Also, It looks like you put in your work order on February 19, 2021 and we contacted JC's Refrigeration to come take a look at your unit. From our understanding, your unit was taken care of and is working properly. You have also already spoken with our property manager as well to ensure that your complaint is taken care of. Thank you for taking time to give us a review. Please let us know if there is anything that we can do for you in the future. We hope that you have a great weekend!

name: Alex Hutto
text: The Cottages is like home away from home! I love how they were cottages instead of the traditional wall to wall apartments which meant that I didn’t have to worry about noisy neighbors. Also, the staff has always been super helpful with anything I ever needed. They listened and were patient with me even when I wasn’t as patient as I should have been at sometimes lol. Overall, I’m glad I chose the cottages when I lived in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your awesome review, Alex! We love that you enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We greatly appreciate your honest and detailed feedback!

name: Hallie abel
text: I’ve had a great experience living at the cottages the past couple years, I’d recommend it to anyone looking for student housing in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you, Hallie! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Helen Rose
text: The cottages is a great place to live! It’s pet friendly and has great amenities-I would recommend for any student to live here and the houses are so cute.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your recommendation Helen! We love that you are having a great experience with us!

name: Sabina Jancikova
text: This is my second year living at The Cottages! This place felt like home the day I moved in! This community is so fun and enjoyable. Also the people living here can always help with whatever you need! Any problems that me and my roommates had, has always been taken care of in a timely manner! The people that work in the office are also very helpful, nice, and understanding!! I would recommend this place to live to everyone that’s looking for great community!

resp.text: Thank you, Sabina! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kendall Frisbee
text: It’s great! You get all of the perks of an apartment with the comfort of a home. It’s also super pet friendly, and seeing my neighbors walking their dogs is a highlight of my mornings. Would definitely recommend for students looking for something cozy with the convenience of being close to campus.

resp.text: Hi Kendall, Thank you for sharing your experience with us! :)

name: Skylar Lien
text: I highly recommend living at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha! It has everything I need + more for a fantastic rate. The property is extremely well kept & their team has responded quickly to all of our work orders. Plus my roommate’s and I LOVE waking up to our lake view backyard every day.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Skylar! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking team and we're so happy to hear you are enjoying your cottage on the lake!

name: Chase Layton
text: This is a great place for me and my two roommates to live! They have great amenities here including full Tennis courts, large green spaces, a huge pool, and several workout rooms. I would highly recommend living here if you are really interested in these things!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Chase! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Justin Porter
text: I’ve been in the cottages for about a month but so far it’s an excellent community to live. The houses and lawns are well kept so it’s a pretty walk around the lake or the community. The house I’m in is much bigger than I expected and there were no issues when I moved in so I am very pleased with that. My only complaints are that the gates are very slow, but that’s a minor inconvenience, and that there are a few hidden fees you can get but it’s all in the lease and the signing bonus more than covers it. It’s also a very safe community the only street that isn’t gated has security on it all night. Overall the cottages is a very nice and safe place to live if you’re willing to pay a little more, also if you’re a student at ua it seems like it’s further from campus than it is, it never takes me more then 10 minutes to get to campus and that’s with traffic.

resp.text: Thank you, Justin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha! :)

name: Kayla Bryant
text: I just moved to the cottages like 2 months ago and I absolutely love it! There’s always different events going on for the residents and the staff is so nice! I’m definitely happy to call it home.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kayla! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff and that you are enjoying your home here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We look forward to seeing you at more resident events!

name: Ashlee Sanders
text: This is my first year at The Cottages and it's been amazing! The houses are spacious and well-taken care of, and there's easy access to the lake and all of the amenities! I've had a great experience with management every time I've had a question, and the gates make the community feel very safe.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ashlee! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Tyler Keenum
text: This property is one of the best in town! Great staff and beautiful cottages. Amenities are better than all the competition!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Tyler! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Lindsey Finn
text: This is my third year living at the Cottages and I absolutely love it! I love the spacious housing options and how it is dog friendly!! The lake is beautiful and it’s an all around great place to live!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Lindsey! We are so happy that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and are glad that you have decided to renew with us for another year!

name: Jennifer Rakes
text: Just want to give a shout out to all of the on site students and others that work at The Cottages leasing office! We had to reassign our sons lease and Mckenzie Logan and the multiple people  I spoke to there made this a less stressful process. Could not have done this without all of their help and PATIENCE! Thank you and all the best!

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you for your review! We are so happy to hear that you had such a wonderful experience with our onsite team, wishing you & your son the best!

name: Max Harouche
text: Very nice aesthetic. That’s all pretty much. If you like hidden fees and an unsafe place then you hit the jackpot. The likelihood that you’ll wake up one morning to either your car keyed or something stole from your car is very high. The security is a joke. Only quality is the pool.

resp.text: Thank you, Max, for your feedback. We take what you are saying very seriously. Although we cannot guarantee your safety, we do not want you to feel threatened in your home so we appreciate you bringing your concerns to our attention. We have made note of concern with our onsite security. Moving forward we will keep our eye on this and make fixes where necessary. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you by stopping by the leasing office or giving us a call at 205-409-2052.

name: Sean Hill
text:
TAKE PICTURES ON MOVE IN OR ELSE!! Any scratch, stain, dent or rip in anything in the apartment should be pictured and recorded in the move in sheet! Otherwise, they’ll turn around at move out and expect you to pay to get the apartment back into shape (whether they actually do that work or just bill you for it is another discussion).

Also, REVIEW YOUR FINAL STATEMENT! They tried to charge me $75 for DRIP PANS, only reversing that after numerous attempts to contact them and calling it “a billing error”. The factThe property is fairly nice, but their business is apparently based on exploiting college students and foreign workers who don’t have the knowledge to protect themselves.

Finally, I can confirm they do provide compensation for reviews on google from current residents, so keep that in mind for every review from someone who hasn’t done move-out.

resp.text: Sean, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues if they haven't been already. Please contact disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com at your earliest convenience.

name: Alex Hill
text: Loved living here for the past 2 years. On to the 3rd. Many great amenities and it feels a lot more like home than a regular apartment. It is also a gated community which is nice.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Alex! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Bryanna Mains
text: I'm so glad I moved here, and I can't wait to spend another year or two here! My roommates three roommates are amazing and our house is spacious and cozy, definitely a place I am glad to call home in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Bryanna! We're so glad that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and are looking forward to the years to come!

name: David Hart
text: Very nice place and community. The layout is beautiful and the location is ideal. Customer service was very good and the workers explained everything very well and thoroughly.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, David! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: Samuel (Sam) Gunn
text: Have loved living here so far! Truly feels like a community here and everyone is very friendly. Management is quick to respond to questions and concerns and is almost always doing giveaways for residents which is really nice!

resp.text: Thank you, Samuel! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Elissa Nation
text: This is my first year living in The Cottages, and I can go early say I love it here. I live in a 3 bedroom, and I have only had a few minor issues that were addressed as needed. Looking forward to renewing my lease.

resp.text: Thank you, Elissa! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! We're looking forward to the years to come!

name: Izzy Crumpton
text: Prefer living here way more than the dorms or an apartment building. Living in your own house is so much quieter than the latter. There is also way more space in the units here than in other complexes in town!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Izzy! We're so glad that you love our property just as much as we love having you here!

name: Cameryn Robertson
text: So happy I moved here. I love my luxurious home so much. Thank you to the cottages for making me feel like i’m at home. Everything is perfect!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Cameryn! We're so happy that you are enjoying your The Cottages and hope to continue to make you and your roommates feel at home!

name: Rae Hamilton
text: The management here is the worst! They do not care about their residents at all. They ignore the needs of residents and are slow and resistant to help their residents in any way. I do not recommend living here. My sister had a better experience back when is was called "The Retreat" and supposedly the new management is supposed to be better. I really don't think so. You overpay for bad management and a frustrating experience. They do not take care of the apartments, it is hard to get maintenance to fix problems, and they force people to live with pet owners even when their contract says they are not in a pet friendly apartment. They largely disregard the needs and preferences of the resident. Stay away!

resp.text: Rae, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact 205-409-2052 at your earliest convenience.

name: Jacob Vargas
text: Absolutely enjoy living here. The pool and lake make it the best place to live in Tuscaloosa. Never ran into a problem with the cottages and would definitely recommend living here to anyone!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Jacob! We're so glad that you are enjoying your time here with us and we are looking forward to the years to come!

name: Hailey Mrozek
text: A great community for college students! They have a great selection of amenities that are sure to satisfy everyone! I have lived here for 2 years now and couldn't imagine living any where else! My favorite parts are the private lake which is perfect for walking your dog because there are trails around the whole thing! The only issue we ever had was with some bugs getting in our house but we live against the tree line so its kind of to be expected. The good thing is they have an exterminator that comes to the property and you can put your house on a list to be treated! I'm going into my senior year so its sad to think this could be my last year here but if you're looking for great housing in T-town this is the place to be!

resp.text: Hailey, we are so glad that you decided to make The Cottages your home and that you will be spending another year with us. We're happy to have been able to fix the issue you had with the bugs in your cottage, please be sure to let us know if you need anything else, looking forward to another year with you and your pup!

name: John Hutto
text: Let me start of by saying that this place has been amazing! The atmosphere of the Cottages has always been like a home away from home and the community makes it feel like one even more. All the events that the Cottages host make it that much more fun. I highly recommend living here!!

resp.text: That is amazing, John! We are so happy that you have had such a positive experience with us. We cannot wait until we are able to host more events!

name: Emily Campbell
text: Such a great place to live! Very safe and many amenities offered. The beautiful lake is only a short walk away from your cottage :)

resp.text: Thanks, Emily! We are happy that you enjoy it here!

name: Bill Wilkens
text: My son loves this place. The cottages were nothing but nice to us and gave him a stable place to stay during the horrible situation and a fantastic property the past year. He sent me these pictures he took at the lake yesterday.

resp.text: We love our Lake Tamaha, glad to see that your son does as well. Please reach out if you guys need anything! #CottageLife

name: Brock Burks
text: Excellent service. Great community. Many facilities. It’s an overall package that is hard to put down.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Brock! We're happy to hear that you have been enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Darion Hawkes
text: I absolutely ADORE this place! The homes are so spacious and homey - it really takes student living to another level. The amenities are top notch but the pool is definitely my favorite. If that isn't enough, as the name suggests, they are right by the lake! Location, quality cottages, amenities and above-and-beyond customer service make choosing The Cottages @ Lake Tamaha  is a no-brainer.

resp.text: Awe, you have us blushing, Darion! Thank you for your honest review and thank you for choosing The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. #CottageLife

name: Austin Chisolm
text: Absolute experience living here! Staff is great and helpful. Beautiful atmosphere as well

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Austin! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: RW Keeney
text: Absolutely love the neighborhood! Great prices for a high quality of living. All the neighbors are very welcoming and easy to make friends!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Ryan! We are so glad that you are making so many friends and loving the community!

name: David (Alex) Weaver
text: The cottages have a great environment to live in from the multiple green spaces to play sports to the pool and basketball courts there is always something to do here!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Alex! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Will Collins
text: I moved in 3 weeks ago. So far I have enjoyed it, the staff has been very quick and polite to help with any issues I needed. Very satisfied

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Will! It is great that you appreciate our hardworking staff at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha.

name: James Hall
text: My daughter rented here for three years ... the last year cut short by COVID. Throughout her stay, the management here seemed only interested in money, not the safety or service of the students. My daughter's car was broken into because the managers refused to fix the gates. When her senior year was cut short, the management would not work with us on rent assistance. And once her lease expired, they sent us a bill for more than $450 for "damages" to the unit, including a $25 charge for not removing a shower curtain rod. DO NOT let your child live here. They care only about the dollar and will cut corners, cheat and lie to make more of it.

resp.text: Thank you for loyalty to The Cottages for 3 years, we are sorry that you had a few issues here and I hope that you contacted the office for all of the above. This has no doubt been a tough year for everyone. Please email disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com to discuss your move-out charges as we are willing to work with you there. Thanks again.

name: B
text: Staff is nice and love the amenities!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We're so happy to hear that you have enjoyed our amenities and have had a nice experience with our team!

name: Kamryn Gilbert
text: Living at the cottages is an adventure!! Meeting new people and pups. A perfect college experience living at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kamryn! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and that you are really enjoying the sense of community that we take pride in!

name: John Stumpff
text: Be ware and ask questions about Simple Bills.  It is a rigged system to bring in a lot of money.  The thermostats are not adjustable ( you can’t turn off or down the ac when away for the summer for example) and you will be charged for utility overage when you are away.  During the Covid/summer break I have been billed every month ranging from $6 to $37.  We have not been in the apartment in three months.  This will be our last contract with this company.  Be ware of what you are agreeing to and shop around.  Read carefully.

resp.text: Hi John, these statements that you have made are untrue, be we understand that you may be frustrated. We would be happy to talk this over with you and discuss your overages. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.

name: Emily Vallario
text: I’ve lived here for 3 years and I love it! The amenities are great and the staff is always so friendly and accommodating. Love love love it!

resp.text: Thank you, Emily! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!! :)

name: Kelsey Finn
text: Been living here for 4 years. Dog friendly and a great place to live if you love hiking, swimming, fishing, and being out on a lake.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelsey! We love hearing that you & your pup enjoy living with us, and we love that the both of you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Emily DeLorenzo
text: I’m so happy to call this place home! It has so many great amenities and I love how everyone here is so friendly!!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Emily! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: David Patterson
text: The Cottages is a pretty nice place to live. The amenities are great and the staff is very helpful when you have an issue.

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, David! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you  you appreciate our hardworking staff!

name: Jadah Nichols
text: The cottages is a very spacious place to live! I love the events they host for the residents!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jadah! We are happy to hear that you are enjoying your time here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha and we look forward to seeing you at more of our upcoming events!

name: Nathanael (Nate) Jones
text: Great builds and a great location. It’s far enough away that you feel like you can get away from Tuscaloosa but still have everything close.

resp.text: Thank you, Nathanael! We're so glad you are enjoying your adventure here at The Cottages!

name: Megan Dravet
text: I love living at the cottages! It’s so beautiful here and the amenities are great!

resp.text: Thank you for your great feedback, Megan! We pride ourselves in our amenities at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha, and we love that you have enjoyed them.

name: Elena Zink
text: Such a fun place to live!!!! Awesome staff, great amenities, and affordable prices. I definitely recommend living here for any students searching for housing!!

resp.text: Thank you, Elena! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Brenna Snow
text: I’ve lived at the Cottages for two and a half years now. The houses are very spacious compared to apartments with the same amount of bedrooms. Our house had brand new appliances and furniture when we moved in, and so everything is very nice. I also love being able to park right in front of my house (much better than lugging groceries through the halls of an apartment complex!). If I ever had a maintenance issue, it was resolved quickly. Some people say it’s far from campus, but it’s only a five minute drive to the Northeast Commuter Lot taking University. They also offer short term leases, which is nice because I’m graduating this fall and won’t be trapped in a lease trying to find someone to sublet for the spring semester. Recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your awesome review, Brenna! We love that you have enjoyed your time at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We greatly appreciate your honest and detailed feedback!

name: Daniel Hampton
text: I have spent one full semester living at the Cottages and have been pleased the whole time. I had a couple of maintenance issues at the beginning of the year but I was able to submit my own work orders without calling and maintenance was out there to fix it the next day. Also, I love the community and the residents that live here. Everyone is so friendly around here and I've actually even made tons more friends since living here. I look forward to spending the rest of my time living at the Cottages while I finish up school!

resp.text: Thank you, Daniel! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kevin Miller
text:
I've had a ton of problems with the cottages,  they've been pretty good at fixing stuff when called, but have COVID safety for maintenence, which is understandable but makes you wish they gave you a functioning apartment in the first place.

I'll keep it simple, this place is cheap because they will make up the difference with some other fees, you cant swim in the lake, and there is no hot tub.

only thought to give this review an update after our internet started going in an out over the past hour. now I need to go to campus and work on classes. with no notice.

also make note of the distance,  the cottages are one of the furthest apartments.so factor in a years worth of extra mileage in gas as well.

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your expectations have not been met during your time here. We are not sure who informed you that you are not allowed to swim in Lake Tamaha as this is false information, you are allowed to swim in the lake however it is at your own risk as this information is stated on our signs near lake Tamaha since we do not have lifeguards on duty in the area. As for our Jacuzzi, we apologize if there was any miscommunication that lead you to believe that it is a heated hot tub rather than a Jacuzzi tub. We are not sure if you are aware of this, but there are 3 bus stops on our property for the Crimson Ride that you are more than welcome to take to campus Mon-Fri from 7am-9pm! We hope that you will find some of this information helpful and hope to make your experience at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha a better one!

name: Adam Wolfsheimer
text:
I wrote a review a couple months back and I’m not sure if it got deleted or what but I didn’t see it, so here’s an updated review

I’ll start by saying for what it’s worth I’m resigning here for next year. The cottages themselves are nice, we only had a couple issues and haven’t had problems getting them fixed. The pool is great and living by the lake is definitely a plus, but there are some cons. First off the utilities went up considerably, everyone that I talked to said that their utility bills were considerably higher since they switched to simple bills. I’m not sure if our meter is messed up but after the first bill we went the rest of the year with the AC turned completely off, only 1 tv in the house, and normal light usage and had overages every month.... probably the most annoying thing, and what may be a much bigger issue with COVID pushing classes online, is that the internet will cut out across the cottages. Some of these incidences lasted a couple days, which with online classes is worrisome...... Also, I wouldn’t sign for the sign on bonuses, I’ve yet to get either of mine or hear anything about them.....

All in all, I’m living here next year and I’m decently  happy with my current situation, there are some problems, but there are problems almost everywhere.

resp.text: Hi Adam, thank you for sharing such an honest review and for renewing your lease. The overages can be looked into further if you give our 3rd party SimpleBills a call, that way if there are any discrepancies they can follow up with us to look into it further. As for your signing bonus, please see that someone has reached out to you on this matter. If you have any more questions or concerns please do not hesitate to give us a call at 205.409.2052. Thank you!

name: David Hill
text:
Background info: I’ve lived here for one semester so far in a 4 bed, 4.5 bath cottage with two roommates. It is the elite package and I live upstairs.

My experience at the cottages has been no less than excellent. While it isn’t the cheapest place in Tuscaloosa to live, it easily provides the most value, and I’ve been so happy with my stay so far.

Here’s what you need to know if you are considering the cottages:
-You live right on the lake which is hands down the best place in the world to relieve stress or to pray if you’re the type.
-The staff is very friendly, but sometimes don’t really know what they are talking about (I asked about hours last month and got 3 different answers from two people at the front desk). I will say I am sympathetic to them because they are students like me and have not been working there for a number of years like you would get in a non-college town.
-There are multiple events a semester which, depending on where your cottage is located and when the event is relative to your exams can be either a blessing or a curse. There was a concert that was pointed right at my cottage not too long ago that really disrupted my ability to focus on my studying.
-I have to pay $15 a month extra because my closet is huge. At first I thought this was outrageous, but having utilized my closet as an office space/storage area and set up a gaming space in my actual bedroom, the $15 a month is justified for the luxury of having so much extra space.
-You may hear other people complaining about the upstairs being hot and the downstairs being cold. If you have ever lived in a two story building, that is just how temperatures work. Could the buildings have been planned better? As an engineer, the answer I’ll give you is always yes. Would it drastically improve the state of the temperature in your cottage? No, but it would drive your rent price higher.
-If I had one extra roommate, our parking situation would be awful, but I’m fortunate to have exactly the correct number of spaces around us. The workaround for this is to buy a reserved space for $10/month. They will set up a sign in your front yard and you will always have a spot. That’s 100% worth it in my eyes so I never have to deal with searching for a parking spot coming home from the library at 1 am.
-You will be late to class if you don’t leave at least 20-25 minutes early, sometimes 35 if your class is on the far side of campus.

All in all, your experience at this complex is what you make of it. You only share walls with people you can control. The pool is okay, but the lake is incredible. Nucor Steel ruins any chance at seeing the stars in all their glory because of how bright the steel mill is at night, but laying out on the bank of the lake at night under the sky is still a blissful experience that I seek out regularly regardless of temperature. There are plenty of events and giveaways if that’s what you are looking for. Find good, CLEAN roommates, and you’ll have a wonderful experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your thorough review, David!! We are so happy you have had a great experience a The Cottages, and we appreciate all of your feedback. We apologize for some of the inconsistencies you mentioned. In regards to our hours, we did just change them at the start of the year, and we can give you a solid answer now. We try to host fun events for residents, and Country Fest was no exception. We did advertise the date of the event beforehand, and we hope you're able to enjoy other events we host. Again, we truly appreciate your feedback! Thank you for your thorough review!

name: Jeff Robbins
text:
Renter beware!  My son and 2 roommates rented from there for 2 years.  The second year their carpet was in bad shape and some woodwork was chewed up by a prior tenant's pet.  We actually did a good job on the move-out cleaning.  The other two roommates did not.  The roommates got assessed about $200 on move-out, even though one of their bathrooms had mold.  We got assessed over $600.

We emailed and called repeatedly to explain and try to negotiate.  They wouldn't take our calls and we got nowhere with the emails.  We sent over $200 and then sent another $260, which we thought was more than fair, considering the bad condition on move-in.  They sent us to a collection agency that’s now calling and bothering us constantly.  If you move in, make sure to take lots of photos of any damage that was pre-existing!  Anyway, now my son, who is a straight A STEM MBA student is in collection.  It's just a big corporation trying to rip us off!

resp.text: Thank you for your honest review, Jeff. We assess damages based on the move in condition form that is turned in at the beginning of the lease term and compare it to the condition of the unit upon move out. We only communicate about disputes via email for liability and documentation purposes. We did offer a settlement to you, however you paid the amount that you saw fit and unfortunately we could not accept that. If you have any other questions regarding the disputes/collections process, please reach out to us at 205-409-2052. Again, thank you for your feedback and have a great day!

name: Benjamin David
text: The cottages is a great place to experience lots of new friends and fun activities. It had given me lots of friendships that will last a lifetime. I highly recommend living here!

resp.text: Thank you, Benjamin! We are so happy that you have enjoyed your time at Camp Tamaha. We pride ourselves in our sense of community, so it is great to know that you see that as well!

name: Taylor Ramer
text: This was one of the nicest places especially for university living. Different options for housing styles to choose from as well as the staff being extremely nice and pleasant. Especially the girl that helped us named Hailey, she was the bomb at helping us with whatever we needed. 10/10 recommended.

resp.text: Thank you, Taylor! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Kenyon Rejczyk
text: The Cottages is truly one of the best, if not the best off campus housing option for UA students. The amenities rival any other place with a large pool, putting green, volleyball and basketball courts, as well as a top of the line clubhouse. The biggest perk of the cottages is the amount of space compared to other housing options. Additionally, the management has been very friendly and helpful in my time here so far, and they offer many promotions/giveaways! On top of all of this one of the better attributes the cottages has is the location in relation to campus. It is an fast and easy trip down Jack Warner by car or bus with minimal traffic compared to being on the other side of Tuscaloosa! Overall, this is a great place to live with a ton of value for the price, and I would recommend checking it out!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review, Kenyon! We are definitely packed with awesome amenities at The Cottages, and we are so glad you have enjoyed them as a resident. Our location makes it seem like it is far away from UA's campus, but, like you said, it is a short drive!

name: Alex Hall
text:
Upon move out, charges to our account were placed that were totally fabricated, and photos of the “charges” sent to us. The photos were not of our house, the charges were a complete lie.

Save yourself the hassle (and the money), it’s not worth it. The rent is absurd for what you’re getting. Live somewhere downtown. The houses suck anyway. Don’t get distracted by  the pool.

resp.text: Hi Alec, I hate that you had this experience with us, however I can assure you that we do not "fabricate" charges/damages, we have no reason to. However, if you feel your charges were not justified you are welcome to send any disputes to the following email: disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com

name: Isabella Howell
text: I've lived here for a year and a half and have absolutely loved it! The staff is fantastic and super helpful! Best place for college students in Tuscaloosa

resp.text: Isabella, thank you so much for your kind review! We love it that you have appreciated The Cottages and our hardworking staff. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated!

name: Jatty Jones
text: I have really enjoyed living at The Cottages for the past 4 years. I am sadly graduating this May and will be moving out.  I feel like you get a lot for your money here and management is awesome.  I have been able to talk with the same person for the last four years if I ever had an issue.  She is extremely understanding and always helpful.  The pool and lake are my favorite things about The Cottages.  If school ever stressed me out, a walk along the lake always helped.  I would recommend anyone to live here.  You get so much more space over living in an apartment.  Plus, you wont find a better shuttle driver, Susan! She makes sure you make it home every night you go out and ride with her.

resp.text: Jatty, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We love hearing about our residents feedback and we are super happy you are a resident with us!

name: Lani Hodge
text: Love this place! Staff is so accommodating and friendly

resp.text: WE love hearing that you love The Cottages. Thank you, Lani, for your review!

name: Amelia Hooper
text:
This is my good deed for the year - if I can convince any potential resident to AVOID LIVING HERE, I will be happy. The Cottages is a horrible apartment complex. If you choose to live here, you will pay overpriced rent for rotting/infested houses, poorly-maintained amenities, rude and unhelpful office staff, and an unsafe location. One of my friends had their car broken into, another was robbed at gunpoint, and this still wasn't enough to convince the office to get the gates fixed! Yet you will be charged the rate of a gated community.

Also, the fees!!! The Cottages has an airtight contract that will bend you right over. Any utility overage or move out fee they decided to slap on you is impossible to negotiate. I had a roommate ruin the paint in the living room - even after proactively approaching management to resolve the issue, I was charged for 1/4 of the damage. The apartment complex neglected to move out old chairs when they updated furniture - I was charged for that too! The list goes on.

Bottom line, don't live here. Tuscaloosa isn't full of amazing options as far as apartments go. However, The Cottages is really the bottom of the barrel.

name: Robert Bruce
text: I have lived here a semester and while I’ve had some roommate issues, we are determined to stay in our cottage because of how great it is here. Great amenities, beautiful lake, and a great community

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Robert! Despite having some issues, we are so happy you have enjoyed all that The Cottages provides.

name: Brittany Sloan-Barbour
text: Shout out to The Cottages and the most amazing people in the office for being the greatest! They really go above and beyond to make sure your needs are met leaving a smile on everyone’s face! Thank you all!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Brittany! We love our office staff, too!

name: Samantha Myers
text: The cottages is a great place to live I am so happy I moved here! I have met so many amazing friends here. I have great roommates the cottages did a great job with the roommate match up. Our house is very spacious and was super clean when we moved in! The pool is amazing and they have a lot of great amenities to choose from!

resp.text: Thank you, Samantha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and that you are getting along with your roommates so well!

name: Samuel Kastel
text: I shouldn’t have resigned my lease. My roommates and I have been having problems with our AC for a week now. We have submitted so many work orders and each time it gets “fixed” it still doesn’t work. During the day, the air in our unit is running constantly, causing out utilities bill to the through the roof, but the air in the house is still upwards of 80 degrees. This is unlivable, let alone when we go to sleep, it is so hot that we can’t sleep. After being “fixed” and still not working, we are extremely annoyed, because clearly the problem is with the AC unit, not the air filter. On top of all of this, amenities are still closed, while numerous other complexes have theirs open and they won’t tell us why. I am not paying so much money to live here when i feel like i am barely living. Don’t sign here if you want to live somewhere that appreciates their residents.

resp.text: Samuel, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments. I believe we have resolved these issues, please let us know if you are still experiencing problems.

name: Kendra Zebroski
text: So excited to live here next year! The staff is super helpful with all my question

resp.text: We are SUPER excited too!

name: Madeline Hogan
text: I lived here for a year and loved it! A great atmosphere, very safe, and I think very worth the cost. As with every place you rent from, as long as you stay on top of projects that need done, they get done when you need them. I never felt unwelcome or unsafe. I would highly recommend this location for any new house renter! A great move for our first renting property to learn the ropes!

resp.text: Madeline, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Daivd Thompson
text: Awesome place to live! I think I couldn't have asked for a better move in experience. I just moved in a month ago and everything is soooo nice here.  The property is nice, the people are nice and my roommates are awesome.

resp.text: Thank you, David! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Vicki
text: Decent place to visit, horrible place to live. So many hidden fees and management is terrible. Recently moved out and left the place spotless, they still managed to fine me $160+ for “carpet cleaning fees” and sent grainy black and white photos as “evidence”. Would always get charged for overages every month even though my roommates and I were barely there and used little electricity when we were. This place will SCAM you for a few extra bucks.

resp.text: Vicki, thank you for your detailed feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to discuss and clarify any charges with you. Please send any disputes to the following email: disputes@cottagesatlaketamaha.com

name: Tyler Lubin
text: If I were you, I would totally live at the cottages. Not only do they have a dope staff, but they also have a great pool, a useful coffee machine, an awesome tennis court, a huge basketball court, etc. The houses are also a great vibe for a college student. Overall, The Cottages at Lake Tamaha is the place for you !!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you for your awesome review! We pride ourselves in our amenities and camp-like lifestyle, so it is great to know that you see that, too. Your feedback and recommendation is very appreciated!

name: Adelle Gilbert
text:
This place is amazing.  I have a daughter that currently lives there and my son will be coming to live there in August.  The Community is well kept and maintained.  The large pool and lake are a plus along with all the other great amenities that are offered.

The management and staff does a lot of fun activities with a lot of free food, entertainment and prizes.  I think the staff and management are well in tune to the wants and needs of the tenants when it comes to college living.

The management and staff have been very receptive when we have reported issues or needed something done around our house.  They have always responded and completed any necessary maintenance issues with in a timely  manner considering the number of tenants in the community.

As a parent, this is the ideal living environment and gives me peace of mind to know my children are in a safe environment.  Incidents are likely to happen anywhere you live but to know the management and staff along with the tenants are focused on making this the best experience as possible

Job well done to the management and staff!!!!!

resp.text: Adelle, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We are so glad that your daughter loves living with us and we look forward to having your son as a resident in the Fall! Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Tori Riley
text: I absolutely love living here!! The neighbors are quiet and the staff is helpful with anything you may need.

resp.text: Thank you, Tori! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Jack Townsend
text: Living at the cottages had made me feel a lot more at home. You get a sense of that neighborhood community type feeling with the layout of this student living area. While the cottages may seem far from campus it’s really only about a 6-8 minute drive and the bus that drives back and forth between the bus hub is always on time with the schedule. Haven’t had but only one problem and the people at the office helped me out to get it figured out and fixed quickly.

resp.text: Thank you, Jack! We pride ourselves in our sense of community! We love that you appreciate our proximity to campus, as well as our hardworking staff. Thank you again for your great review!

name: Kira Gomes
text: I've loved living here the last 2 years.  I read reviews before I moved in and I was really scared about overages, but our house doesn't really go over and if we do, its in the summer months.  The property is really nice and well kept up.  I would tell people to live here over most properties in town.  The price is good and you really do get what you pay for here.

resp.text: Thank you, Kira! We appreciate your kind words about The Cottages! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Adam Wolfsheimer
text:
My experience: the houses are fine, I’ve had occasional maintenance issues, but they’re usually fixed in a decent time. The pool is a great feature. The internet every couple of weeks will just stop working for a couple days which is annoying and for students isn’t great. They started using simplebills for utilities and pretty much everyone in a 500+ person GroupMe has agreed that its gone up a bunch after this move. Personally we only have 1 tv in the house and have kept the AC and heat completely off after our first bill and still had overages somehow. Overall it’s fine, there are a few annoying issue (internet being the biggest), but I’m living here next year if that says anything.
Also don’t sign up just because of the bonuses they offer. I still have yet to get mine from last year or this year that I signed for and I’ve stopped holding out hope I’ll ever receive it.

name: Dana Mustafa
text: This is by far the best student housing in Tuscaloosa. It has everything you could ask for. To start with you essentially have your own house which is so much better than having an apartment. I have dog and it simply doesn't get better for dog owners. I have a chocolate lab and she loves it. She has so much grass area to run around. The lake is amazing and it completely sets The Cottages apart. The most underrated feature is the 24/7 clubhouse that also has the computer lounge that you can use anytime. Turns out I procrastinate quite a bit, so it comes in handy. I have lived in numerous properties in Tuscaloosa and the part where The Cottages sets itself apart is simply the management. Every time you go through the clubhouse, the entire staff treats with such pleasure and respect.

resp.text: Hi Dana, Thanks for the 5 stars. We're glad your chocolate lab enjoys it here as well!

name: John Biar
text: I moved in this month and I really love it.  I really love to be able to use the lake and kayak anytime I want to.  I was randomly matched with roommates and I don't think the staff could have done a better job.  The property is always clean and I feel safe living here.  When I moved in my place was really clean and I loved all the free food.  So far, I couldn't have asked for a better move in experience or a better place to live for my senior year.  I just wished I would have moved in sooner.

resp.text: Thank you, John! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Morgan Smith
text: I’ve lived here for 3 years now, and I absolutely love it. The Cottages are a dream for college students. I think everyone takes advantage of how convenient it is to have on site maintenance and on site management. All of the houses and amenities have had awesome renovations that really take The Cottages to the next level. They have a lake, kayaks, tennis, basketball, volleyball, a huge pool, grills, ping pong, private study rooms, free printing, 24/7 coffee machine, and a gym. They’re also ALWAYS having events with free food. I honestly don’t think I would be able to live in an apartment building after living in my own cottage for so long. I dread having to graduate and move away from this place that’s become my home. I highly, highly recommend The Cottages.

resp.text: Morgan, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. We love hearing that you love living with us! Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Daniel Seehase
text: Talk to anyone that lives here and you will get an idea of how management treats maintenance requests and its residents. You will see a few reviews about how fast they are to respond, but this is only when small things break. Most houses have at least one major issue throughout the year since they are so cheaply built (we had a burst pipe and a shattered glass door) and these issues take forever to resolve. I attached pictures from my bathroom where I had a hole leading outside for 2 weeks. The contractors arrived when no one was home with no warning from the Retreat. They tore out drywall near the leak and didn't cover anything in the bedroom or bathroom so everything was covered in dust (computer, bed, toothbrush, tv, etc). At one point they didn't show up for 2 days and when I went to the main office I was told that the contractors reported that the work was done. They didn't believe me so I had to have someone from the office come look and see for themselves. "Oh wow that's crazy," was their reaction. We have been waiting for our glass door to be fixed for almost 3 weeks now as well. The landscapers cracked the pane and we reported it the same day. Four days later glass was falling out each time the door was opened so we removed the broken pieces and duct taped the edges. The next day the duct tape was removed and more broken glass was on the porch. The main office told us they had tried to fix it but had the wrong sized pane. I don't expect it to be fixed until after we move out. Additionally, you will receive an overage for utilities every month. I don't know a single person living here who doesn't. Dealing with management is also hard because they hide behind the college students at the front desk who really aren't given enough responsibility to help you with any of your problems. There's lots of better housing closer to campus, don't bother with this place.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Danny. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at (205) 553-6453 or stop by the office at your earliest convenience so we can discuss a solution.

name: Pace Shelton
text:
Lived here for 4 years that I have been at school down here. I have had all good experiences and do not have anything bad to say.  Definitely recommend checking it out. A few small complaints would be theres not enough room for trash on main section, and then also the pool table could be kept up better. But other than that I really enjoyed living here.
Megan

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Pace! We are actually in the process of getting our Billiard Cloth replaced! Join us this Friday for our Dead Week Darty!

name: Olivia Myers

name: Jess
text: New management is awesome! The office staff are professional and helpful, the maintenance crew are always on top on any issues we have, and its just a short ways from campus. Definitely one of the cleanest and safest complexes in Tuscaloosa, without costing you an arm and a leg

text: The amenities are great and the staff are amazing. Very safe and great place to live

resp.text: Madison, thank you so much for your kind review! We love that you have enjoyed your time at Camp Tamaha.

name: Dana Mustafa
text: This is by far the best student housing in Tuscaloosa. It has everything you could ask for. To start with you essentially have your own house which is so much better than having an apartment. I have dog and it simply doesn't get better for dog owners. I have a chocolate lab and she loves it. She has so much grass area to run around. The lake is amazing and it completely sets The Cottages apart. The most underrated feature is the 24/7 clubhouse that also has the computer lounge that you can use anytime. Turns out I procrastinate quite a bit, so it comes in handy. I have lived in numerous properties in Tuscaloosa and the part where The Cottages sets itself apart is simply the management. Every time you go through the clubhouse, the entire staff treats with such pleasure and respect.

resp.text: Hi Dana, Thanks for the 5 stars. We're glad your chocolate lab enjoys it here as well!

name: Madison Friley
text: I love this location!! The property is so nice and the staff is AMAZING!! would recommend to anyone!! :)

resp.text: Thank you, Madison!! We appreciate your honest and kind review of our property!

name: everything outdoors
text: The Cottages are awesome! The staff, and leasing team are so nice and helpful, ask for Jackie. The pool is beautiful, and the clubhouse is a great place to work out, hang out, or work on homework! I highly recommend this place if you are a student! The atmosphere is awesome as well!

name: Taylor Pope
text: Very nice pool, great fitness rooms, and helpful staff.

resp.text: Thank you, Taylor! I know our team will be pleased to hear your kind words!

name: Trot Yanuty
text: The cottages has been comfortable and great value for the price! Would and have recommended to friends! Tons of amenities and even a lake!

resp.text: Thank you, Trot! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Aamir Rahman
text: Really love the neighborhood and the people in the leasing office are super helpful. Work orders take a little bit longer to get finished but that’s probably due to the amount of people living here. Definitely thinking about renewing our lease even though it’s so early in the year

resp.text: Aamir, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Brian Taylor
text: Used to live over at house #87. We really enjoyed our time here for the most part. Amenities are nice and the complex itself is really nice too. The area outside of the community is rough though. When I lived here, the staff was pretty meh. I think our biggest complaint about actually living there was their ever increasing restrictions on house parties. There really weren't any rules at first, but then they switched security staff and said all parties had to be ended by 2:00 am. Then it was 1:00 am. Then it was midnight. No idea what this policy is nowadays but that was pretty damn lame, considering its a college town and house parties are fairly common everywhere. When we moved out they hit us with some major fines. Some of it made sense, but some of it was stuff that needed to be done by that point anyway (like replacing carpeting and repainting walls. Yes, they use that awful flat paint that marks up when you look at it). They actually charged me to repaint my room and replace the carpet. I had expected these shenanigans so I provided photo proof that my room did not need to be repainted and I also provided proof that the carpet had never been replaced. I've heard that they do this to a lot of people, charging them for things they don't actually replace or repair. It must be really profitable to charge 2 or 3 people for the same carpet before they actually replace it. Overall, we really enjoyed our time in the Retreat. Had a lot of great memories there. But yeah, they will nickel and dime you FOR SURE.

resp.text: Brian, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Joshua Bucher
text: Cottages is a great place to live. The office staff is very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Joshua! We love our hardworking staff, too.

name: Ashley Mcdonald
text: Love living here!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ashley! We are happy to hear that you love your home here with us!

name: Daniel Seehase
text: Talk to anyone that lives here and you will get an idea of how management treats maintenance requests and its residents. You will see a few reviews about how fast they are to respond, but this is only when small things break. Most houses have at least one major issue throughout the year since they are so cheaply built (we had a burst pipe and a shattered glass door) and these issues take forever to resolve. I attached pictures from my bathroom where I had a hole leading outside for 2 weeks. The contractors arrived when no one was home with no warning from the Retreat. They tore out drywall near the leak and didn't cover anything in the bedroom or bathroom so everything was covered in dust (computer, bed, toothbrush, tv, etc). At one point they didn't show up for 2 days and when I went to the main office I was told that the contractors reported that the work was done. They didn't believe me so I had to have someone from the office come look and see for themselves. "Oh wow that's crazy," was their reaction. We have been waiting for our glass door to be fixed for almost 3 weeks now as well. The landscapers cracked the pane and we reported it the same day. Four days later glass was falling out each time the door was opened so we removed the broken pieces and duct taped the edges. The next day the duct tape was removed and more broken glass was on the porch. The main office told us they had tried to fix it but had the wrong sized pane. I don't expect it to be fixed until after we move out. Additionally, you will receive an overage for utilities every month. I don't know a single person living here who doesn't. Dealing with management is also hard because they hide behind the college students at the front desk who really aren't given enough responsibility to help you with any of your problems. There's lots of better housing closer to campus, don't bother with this place.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback, Danny. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact us at (205) 553-6453 or stop by the office at your earliest convenience so we can discuss a solution.

name: Vivian Tant
text: I've loved every thing about the Retreat at Lake  Tamaha! They keep the property extremely clean and I've loved how much they care about the residents. The pool is always clean and they have so many events going on during the fall/summer. I suggest if you haven't checked this place out, I would go a give it a tour! 😍

name: Lara Seavey
text: This is the worst place ever to live.  They say they will let you sublease and they will not.  My daughter was stuck there and found someone to take it and they would not let her sublease after telling her she could.  I have reported this to the Alabama student off campus housing.  If you think you may have to sublease for any reason, coming home over the summer, etc., DO NOT SIGN ANYTHING THEY ARE AWFUL.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ms. Seavey. We are truly sorry that you feel this way and we wish that your daughter wasn't giving up her bedspace in the Fall. We definitely allow leaseholders to find reassignments, but our reassignment policy does not allow a current resident to take over your lease because they are an active leaseholder. Our Leasing and Marketing Manager would love to go over the reassignment policy in depth with you. Please call us at 205-409-5092 at your earliest convenience.

name: John Fitzgerald
text: The cottages has been a great place to live. The staff is very welcoming and they really strive to bring the community together with fun events. It’s been a home away from home.

resp.text: Thank you, John! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Jessica Jones
text: I moved into The Cottages in August and I couldn't be more pleased with my housing experience! The staff throws events every month for their residents and always gives out free food! I didn't come with a roommate and I was roommate matched and I have the best roommate ever! We get along very well and have became friends thanks to The Cottages! I love living in a house rather than an apartment and having a lake in my backyard! I love living at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

resp.text: Jessica, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with The Cottages at Lake Tamaha. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

name: Victoria Ward
text: love living here!!! 10/10 def recommend

resp.text: Thank you for your great recommendation, Victoria!

name: Taylor Nemick
text: The cottages had a beautiful southern feel, along with a gorgeous pool and many different things to do!! Love it!

resp.text: Thank you, Taylor! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!!

name: Alex Murray
text:
Currently live here and I can’t imagine anyway management could be worse.

Cockroaches all over the apartment along with lots of other bugs that only ever go away for a few days after spraying and then come right back.

Just last night, my car was broken in to because the complex gates have been broken since the summer (it’s october!) and management refuses to do anything.

There was cat litter and pet dander all over the apartment upon move in, and it took weeks to get someone to clean it up.

Lots of damage inside the unit. Little dings all over the wooden floor, and even a small hole straight through the front door that almost resembles a bullet hole.

The trash compactors are shut down half the time, but then management will fine you if trash is left anywhere. And when it is left, the complex rarely cleans anything up.

Beware before leading!! No one seems to have any regard for tenants, even when things go very wrong.

resp.text: Thank you Alex for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205-409-2052 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with Taylor.

name: Brian Teas
text: Friendly and professional staff!!! The property stays in great condition and the grounds are cleaned up daily. The adjoining lake is a great place to relax and the view is wonderful.  Lots of common space / grass to walk your dog and plenty of allocated bins w/ bags to dispose of their "presents". The Gym is great!

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback, Brian. We love hearing how we are doing and are so glad you are enjoying your stay with us! Bring your puppy to Yappy Hour this Wednesday from 2pm-4pm in the clubhouse!

name: Canyon Gerbracht
text: Offer a shuttle service but offer no way of contacting the driver. Offer an app to track the bus, but doesn’t accurately show the drivers location, and the driver doesn’t do routine routes. Instead, just sits at the cottages waiting to drop people off.

resp.text: Canyon, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.

text: They will never do or fix anything. All they ask is extra money and they came to keep lying to get more and more money. When I receive my room it was extremely nasty and when I left I give it to them as they give it to me, and back there with me he paid for the cleaning. Never go there

resp.text: Thank you, Hamany, for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 205.409.2052 or stop by the leasing office and ask to speak with one of our team members.

name: Ethan Diven
text: The Retreat is overall a pretty good place to live. It's got the highest quality housing and best amenities of anywhere around campus, and it offers competitive pricing and enticing promotions throughout the year, such as wing eating contests and sending free pizzas for doing online reviews. My only complaints about this living community are small and rather specific, and they are only that it has speed bumps at the entrance, strict security guards that will hassle, but ultimately let pass, your friends or guests when they try to drive into your neighborhood on weeknights, and how it's not within walking distance from campus. None of these, however, are anywhere near significant enough to negatively affect the esteem to which I hold this place in my memory moving forward. I've enjoyed my time at The Retreat very much, and would consider it the clear choice for your off campus living arrangements after your freshman year.

resp.text: Thank you, Ethan. Your kind words have made our day. We love having you here at The Retreat at Lake Tamaha!

name: Joshua Bucher
text: Cottages is a great place to live. The office staff is very helpful.

Once they replaced it though, it was with a brand new, top of the line version. Having a lake in your neighborhood is great too. The Retreat's a little pricey, but you get lots of space for your dollar. Plus, big living-rooms make for throwing great parties.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Retreat at Lake Tamaha!!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Hayden! We are glad you and your dogs love living here

name: Danielle Pickett
text: I do not recommend The Retreat for college kids. It is too far from campus for students.  My daughter felt like it was a big mistake being that far away. You tend to not go out as much and have to drive everywhere and everyone. Not good. And secondly the management office is very hard to work with. They had a recent change to their portal and refused to even discuss with me over the phone the best way to access the new portal. After 4 messages, I was told the manager, Courtney, does not communicate via phone. After trying to get the bill paid and 10 months of paying every bill on time and electronically, they than charged a $57 late fee which they claim can not be reversed event though they had a problem with their portal.  Not nice. I have another child attending Alabama and will make to never recommend this place.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your feedback. Our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact the Community Manager at 205-553-6453 at your earliest convenience.

text: My son moved into The Retreat a few weeks ago.  On move in day we walked into the unit to notice a small coming from the carpet.  We notified the front office and within a few hours they had new carpet installed in the main areas of the house and his bedroom.  I was very impressed with how quickly they solved the problem.  This would not have happened in my older daughter's apartment complex, so we were very happy.

name: Amy Lode
text: Very kind and helpful! Looking forward to a great year of housing😊

resp.text: Hi Amy, thank you for your kind words. We look forward to  a great year with you here at The Cottages at Lake Tamaha!

name: Sharnelle Anthony
text: I am a former resident of The Cottages, although I just moved out this past July. I lived at The Cottages my sophomore through senior years of college and my experience was nothing short of exceptional. I would recommend this place 100% to anyone looking to move off campus in Tuscaloosa. The staff was always friendly, maintenance was consistently prompt and getting fed by The Retreat was no a rare occasion (Can I get an AMEN). In addition the amenities are extremely convenient and useful from the perspective of a busy college student.  I followed all my move out instructions and received a final account statement that I deemed as appropriate. There is no place in Tuscaloosa like the cottages. Living here will enhance your college experience in ways you can't image.

text: I live in a five-bedroom cottage at The Retreat and my roommates and I have had a great experience here overall. And being right by a lake with a nice little walking trail is a wonderful perk! My roommates and I decided to re-sign with The Retreat for next year, as we have been very satisfied with our experience.

text: I absolutely love living here. The various colors of the cottages give this place a retro vibe, but they are very nice on the inside. name: Riley Lawson
text: The Retreat is a great community with nice amenities, lots of space, clean cottages, and a tremendously short back-route to campus. While the new management company definitely has improved the standards, there is room for more. Overall, I do recommend living at The Retreat, but be aware that it may cause you a few headaches here and there.

name: James (Jimmy) Henry
text: This has been my first year living in The Retreat, and in that time I lived in both a 4 bedroom and 5 bedroom unit. The homes are spacious & the cottage style living adds for a neighborhood feel, which is very nice as opposed to apartment-style living, and it is a plus not having adjoining walls with neighbors (At least for the 4 & 5 bedroom units anyhow). I found myself using the clubhouse, pool area and other amenities more often than I thought I would, which was a plus. I was a little disappointed when we first moved in and had a lot of broken utilities in the house - fridge missing pieces, Cable not functioning, bent stove handle; but these issues were fixed by staff within the first few days of move in. Other than a few mishaps I had with incorrect payments - which were also quickly corrected by staff - I had no other problems, and it is overall a fantastic area to live. I resigned my lease and look forward to living at The Retreat again the following year!
