text: I've been a resident since Fall of last year and have very much enjoyed every aspect of my experience since moving in. The facilities are beautiful and well kept.

name: Sheila Wiggins
text: Update the reason why I rated this apartment complex a 1 is because since the new property manager took over things has gotten out of hand, the staff is very unprofessional, they do not have a good form of communication, I've given a 30 day notice 6/7/19  because they increased the rent on my 2 bedroom apartment after a yr of staying, I wrote a review previously and was asked to take it down which i did and made a mutual agreement to vacay the property on 7/7/2019, I was called about a week later and was told that my 30 day notice was cancelled, I told the young lady i did not cancel my 30 day notice and that i would be leaving the property on 7/7/19 Im not comfortable paying what they are asking for a 2 bedroom, not to mention my lease is up and i will not be renewing it, I spoke with someone today to get my renters insurance info and was told that i still have to pay July's full rent even if Im moving on the 7th, because my notice was updated to a 60 day notice,I explained that I talked to the leasing manger and that's not the agreement that we made the young lady began to get flustered and started to be very rude and agitated(over talking me), so i asked her to have her manager contact me I'm just not comfortable at this point I have been a great tenant since I've moved in this complex, things just are not the same since Lynn and Sabrina are no longer over this property Kim tries her best to be civil when speaking with me but she just has IDC (i dont care) attitude. I feel like they are trying to force me to stay against my will. I could understand if i was charged for 1-7 but not for the whole month and how can you force someone to stay somewhere they just don't want to not because of the property but because of management and the office staff.,CONTINUED on 7/17 So i got a 7 day notice and finally got a returned call back, I believe her name is Shannon, this was the same lady that I spoke with when i gave my 30 day notice the same lady that asked me to remove my last review, she really just tried to handle me!!!  she said they are starting the eviction process LADY I wanted to move 7/7/19 you kept me here (against my will just didn't want a negative mark on my credit so i complied) and said i would pay this month rent when I turn in my key because of lies and miscommunication she told me before I just cant trust anything she says at this point, so I agreed that I would pay July's rent in full when I'm moving out you know make one payment and be done, she told me "that would not acceptable very RUDELY and because they are filing for an eviction I would have to pay the legal fees!!!! I'm sorry but if my memory serves me correctly I didn't want to stay here either!!! I've already paid my 1st month and security at my new house because I thought I would be out of this apartment on 7/7,  however that was not the case, I have no problem with paying my rent, again I've never had a late fee, never had a 7 day notice good tenant no complaints no nothing!!!I just do not trust the office staff so i would pay everything when i turned in the key I have the money to pay i just dont want them to say i owe anything else, Ive asked on several occasion to speak with someone higher then Shannon she says they are going to tell you the same thing, at this point I wouldn't personally  recommend this place to a fleas on a dogs balls, the apartments needs updates and lets not talk about how high your power bill is going to be because the heating and air conditions are older the Christ him self. BEWARE of this rental company im over it and almost out this place.Actually thinking about calling FOX 6 news on them for this harassment

name: AM MR
text:
UPDATE NOVEMBER 3.  THEY HAVE COME ABOUT MY THERMOSTAT SOOOOOOOO MANY TIMES AND TODAY IT IS BLOWING.  FAN WILL NOT STOP BLOWING.  IT'S BEEN IN OFF POSITION FOR HOURS.  THEY HAVE COME FIVE TIMES TO FIX IT.

UPDATED NOV 1, 2018 The leak is back.  I have had a few weeks of dry floors.  I wake up to moisture and rot again.  Do not move here.  I lived in Unit 2735 A, a 3 bedroom, for one year.  The master bedroom was the worst bathroom with water periodically oozing out of floor coming from the pipes in the wall behind the toilet and sometimes from the toilet tank (which joins the kitchen on the other side, where the washing machine has to be located.  Black mold or rot of moulding  behind the wall where the water is.  NEVER FIXED.  THEY COME.  THEY DISTURB.  THEY MOP UP WATER.  THEY SAY FIXED.  IT'S NOT FIXED.  THEY CAME FIVE TIMES BEFORE IT STOPPED.  I DO BELIEVE THAT THE MAINTENANCE INCOMPETENT OR INTENTIONALLY PROVOKING EARLY RENT PAYING TENANTS BY NOT FIXING ISSUES.  THE THERMOSTAT FAN RUNS AND WILL NOT TURN OFF.  FOR THIS ISSUE I HAVE CALLED THREE TIMES.  BARRY HAS COME OUT THREE TIMES.  FINALLY, IT STILL BLOWS AND I HAVE TURNED OFF THE CIRCUIT BREAKER TO TURN FAN OFF.  THERE IS NO POOL.  BASICALLY, IF YOU MUST LIVE IN A 3 BEDROOM, YOU WILL BE MOVING TO THE GHETTO AND PAYING 1049 FOR RENT, 80 FOR TRASH AND SEWER AND 30 FOR WATER.  I HAVE NEVER SEEN A MORE INCOMPETENT MANAGEMENT TEAM.  I'M SORRY TO HAVE TO SAY THAT IF YOU CAN DO BETTER, YOU SHOULD.  UNFORTUNATELY, THESE APARTMENTS KNOW THAT TO ATTEND THE SCHOOLS IN VESTAVIA,  A LOT OF US MUST LIVE IN THESE APARTMENTS.  IT IS DISPICABLE!!!!  WATER EVEN COMES INTO ONE OF THE BEDROOMS FROM OUTSIDE AND WETS THE CARPET ALONG THE MOULDING IN DAUGHTER'S ROOM.  THEY COME.  THEY LOOK.  THEY DO NOTHING.  WHY?  BECAUSE WITHOUT A FULL RENOVATION, SOME OF THESE THINGS AREN'T A CHEAP FIX. I TRIED TO UPLOAD VIDEO OF THE ROTTING MOULDING EVERYWHERE BUT FOR SOME INTERESTING REASON, I CANNOT GET THE VIDEO LOADED.  I WILL UPLOAD PHOTOS SOON!  BY THE WAY, THEY CAME BY TODAY AND I STILL SEE FRESH WATER BEHIND THE TOILET!!!!! IT IS NEVER FIXED, YET YOU GET TO TAKE TIME OUT OF YOUR PRECIOUS TIME TO TALK ABOUT MAINTENANCE DAY AFTER DAY AFTER DAY AFTER DAY, YET THEY COME OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER.  IT SEEMS LIKE A COURT OF LAW WOULD MAKE THEM ACTUALLY FIX THE PROBLEM AS OPPOSED TO COMING TO ADD GLUE TO A PIPE.  THEY ARE LAUGHABLE.  YET I PAY 1049 PLUS 100 IN CORRUPT WATER AND SEWER CHARGES.

name: Celeste Rodgers
text: I have had nothing but headaches since moving into this apartment complex a little over a year ago. On the outside the apartments look nice and are in a good location (hence the two stars), but on the inside they are a complete disaster. To begin with, when I first moved in all the stainless steel appliances they boasted about were not yet fully assembled. When I first opened up the oven and dishwasher I was shocked to find pvc pipes, tubes, and screws just sitting inside them. Also half the light fixtures were without bulbs. I thought maybe they didn’t have the place fully set up yet and called and they fixed it after a few days. Without a working oven at first and having just moved to a new town, I went out and got some microwave dinners... that’s when I found shock number two. If the TV and living room lights are on and you use the microwave for longer than 60 seconds the power shorts out. They had an electrician come look at it and he told me the wiring was all done wrong and there was nothing he could do. Still to this day I only microwave in thirty second increments to avoid having to use the flashlight on my phone to find the breaker box and reset the power. The next issue I found was that the apartment is on a slant and the floors are uneven. So I had to completely rearrange the furniture in my room to keep the drawers in my chest from sliding out or my TV from being dangerously close to tipping over. The next issue was the plumbing... still to this day from time to time after having had it “fixed” three times all the sinks and tub in my apartment will randomly start filling from the bottom up with dirty water. My neighbor tells me it’s done the same for him too. It’s disgusting and I refuse to take baths and only shower because of it. Also when the Neighboor uses his food disposal the gunk starts pouring in from the bottom up on my side... a nasty surprise to have when cooking diner in the kitchen. And another major issue I had was there was no functioning cable connection when I arrived. The cable wire had been cut out of the wall by the construction crew. Charter made me get written permission from the complex to instal a new one, which took ages to get. My installation fee and labor fee came to  $83, and the complex refused to pay more than $30 because that was their “policy”, despite having promised functioning cable connections in the rent agreement. I could go on about issues in my apartment forever, but I’ll stick to those main issues. The next problem I want to warn any future residents about is that the complex is misleading when saying they have a gym and self laundry service. The laundry room is under construction and has been since summer so is completely closed, and the gym was turned into a storage room “temporarily” for several months now as well so is closed too. The pool didn’t open until mid summer and would only be open a few hours on certain days, which apparently the office didn’t know because several times I called to see if it was open before going only to pack everything and get down there to find it chained up with a big closed sign on it. Also the trash valet service is a mandatory $15/month fee, and they only pick up your trash after it’s been sitting out for days. Oh and  the “cafe” is a kerig set up in the main office lol. Which gets me to the main office... good luck dealing with them. Management has turned over hands three times in the year I have lived here. Nobody ever knows what is going on and you get different answers from different people. Not to mention their hours are constantly changing, they will take one and two hour lunch breaks, and they close frequently for the most random of holidays I’ve ever heard of. So good luck if you work a full time job trying to find a time when you are off and they are open to pick your packages up. I would not recommend this apartment complex.

name: Nina Mayberry Ali
text:
I moved here from up North and before my family relocated we did lots of different reviews being Birmingham was such a bad reputation, Vestaiva Hills was the second best City area outside of Mountain brook, The first Apts which we moved to directly across the street from Vesta, Place was nasty infested with water bugs ad the Town- homes were infested with large Rats, so we gave notice, and they allowed us to break our lease. We then moved to Vestavia Place, The water bugs was awful the grounds was not kept and I had to make a police report agent the downstairs neighbor for Threatened me and my grandchildren several times, Although I was not afraid I decided to let the Law handle it, and she was evicted.

The  staff including the management team as changed more then five times in 15 months there is always new staff. The pool and workout room and Laundry room was closed all summer, and never once have they offered the residence any kind of prorated rent for our inconvenience, Our Apartment has several  internal and external problems  . When it rain it rains inside our kitchen and Mater Bathroom we have to put buckets in both rooms to catch the rain I have videos of the rain coming in. All the floors are cracked underneath the carpet , they have sent several floor guys in and each of them stated the floors need to be redone throughout the entire Property being they are over fifty years old, so when walking through the Apartment I can feel and hear the cracked floor. The leaves are never removed they just blow them onto the grass so we never have beautiful green grass its leaves and dirt everywhere, I had to request for them to repair the Hallway Bathroom the flooring was lifting up molding around the tub was coming off all the vents throughout the unit was full of dust it was nasty my husband and I had to do most of the deep cleaning to even move in, They had promised new appliances at move in instead they had old discoloring Mitch matched stove and refrigerator there, after a couple of weeks they finally replaced them.

When we moved in we had ATT after the second week they told us we couldn't use ATT every resident must have Spectrum, so we were penalized  for breaking our ATT contract. Spectrum service are so awful everyday between 6pm and 9pm the internet works like a dial up service because so many people are logged on at once in this area. Just when we thought it couldn't get any worse  Vestaia Place/ Mountain Lodge Apt had Spectrum come in and rewire every united, Throughout December their has been strange men six or more walking through my home. Once I woke up to them in my Living room saying they was Spectrum yes the Apartment Manager had gave out everybody Apartment keys for these strangers to enter each united. On Wednesday Dec 19th they returned several of them they were in the attic which is connected to the bathroom in my bedroom. I asked them were was the Maintenance or Management because  I was uncomfortable leaving them in my home with my key. Spectrum employee re-insured me they would not be in the Apart alone he lied! When I returned I noticed things out of place  my husband sliver chain that was on the sink was gone, so I started to check around and notice my 35mm cameras was gone and two  Zizio remotes to both our band new Tvs. I had just deep cleaned my home and laid two remotes under ever Tv I know they were there. The chain I had just cleaned and my camera was on the table next to my bed because I sell online I was just using it the night before.
They didn't re hook the cable I had to move everything back and re hook all the cable cords a neighbor said the office never came spectrum locked the door with my key. I am headed today December 21st to make a Police report because the  Property Manager refuse to handle the problem or give my husband the Corporate office number. Before Spectrum she sent five Spanish guys in my Apartment saying they were the floor guys they to had my Apartment key, now uniform business cards nothing yet once again Vestavia Place gave Strangers my Apartment Key.

name: Markedia Stafford
text:
There must be some incentive for leaving 5 star reviews... Because I have not been so fortunate to experience any of the great things they are referencing.

I'm sure Josh is a kind and hard worker (never met him), but that does not make actually living in this apartment complex a pleasant experience.

I have lived here for just over a year and this has by far been my worst residential experience.

The rennovations within these units were very poorly done. I look around in my apartment and feel as though this place could fall apart at any moment.

The plumbing within these units is also terrible. I have completed countless maintenance requests for no resolve. I have also been asked to no longer use the shower in my bedroom, because it causes a leak in the apartment below me.

Maintenance has even come to cut a portion of a wall out to resolve plumbing issues. I never got a completion notice and the wall was never repaired.

You should also be prepared for the water within the complex to be turned off without notice, for repairs that could take hours.

The HVAC System also works poorly and the age of this unit causes it to be quite drafty so expect high utilities expense.

The keys to my apartment somehow were "misplaced" by the leasing office. I was not informed by the leasing office, but by maintenance men when they came and knocked on my door asking for a copy of my key.
It was very difficult to take this up with anyone in the leasing office, because the turn over here is crazy. Very rare that I've walked into this office and seen the same face twice. (HUGE RED FLAG IN TERMS OF SAFETY FOR RESIDENTS)

The walls are very thin... You'll hear EVERYTHING your neighbors are doing and the outdoors areas are not kept clean.

Please also be prepared for whatever goes down your neighbors kitchen sink/garbage disposal because it will come up through yours and the smell is deathly.

And the list goes on and on...

My suggestion: Before you stop into the leasing office, I suggest you drive through this complex and take a good hard look before they glaze you over with things that sound awesome and show you model apartments that would not actually stand up to everyday living.

Also, read EVERY review!

Hi Juanita,

Thank you for your review.  I'm sorry that you're having a hard time getting along with your neighbors.  If there are any outstanding items in your apartment, please let us know.  I checked our system and do not see any recently opened work orders.  We are here, please give us a call.

name: Adam Pope
text:
Good neighbors, horrible service. Lived here for two years. Had A/C and heat go out at least 6 or 7 times. A/C is VERY OLD with no replacement in sight. A/C has leaked in washroom multiple times.

Dishwasher and garbage disposal issues leave deathly smell in apartment.

If you live on the first floor, beware of water leaking through bathroom vents at any given time.

Walls and ceiling are VERY thin. You can hear everything. EVERYTHING.

Ownership has changed 3 or 4 times in the two years I lived here (2015-17).

Do not expect emergency service after hours because company hasn't even bothered to update their old voicemail to reflect ownership change.

Go live in Woodmere Creek Apartments. Just a few minutes away. Maybe a little more money, but less hassle and fewer problems.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  I’m sorry to hear that you have had anything less than a 5-star experience.  Please call us at your earliest convenience so we may learn more about what happened, in effort to reach an amicable resolution.  Thank you!

name: Qui Haygood
text:
Apartments change owership as they sometimes due, but I would have to say that I have been here since August of 2016 and we have experienced at least, three or four.

The blessing in all of that mess was that once it was officially changed over to Vestavia Place, the last two managers including Ms. Chistie and, now, Ms. Sabrina have made this place a joy to call home. We have maintence staff who are friendly and professional while in your home. Issues are usually handled in a reasonable time with some exceptions.

The seclusion and peace that my little peace of heaven offers is worth giving this place a look if you are in the market for a good stepping stone. I would not suggest this place for long-term living. The high turn over of office staff will make your head spin and there are more than a few foundational issues in the buildings themselves. There was a remodeling project started last summer that has yet to be completed.

I do feel the pool is safe enough during the summer to allow my little ones to splash around and have been graced with a few great neighbors in my particular building. I don't really venture out beyond that. I also appreciate that this is a dog friendly complex. The complex is kind of cut out of and into a wooded area so the dogs get the run of the few grass areas available, but are kept completely clear ofhe toddler-friendly play area. t

The gym is figureprint monitored which makes me feel safe when I'm in there early mornings or late nights alone. I never feel afraid to walk the complex at night because of the on-site officer and the pleasant people your run in to sometimes.

This place does certainly have its pros and cons. And there have been some extremely horrible office staff and management. Also, beware of the water bill. That is the only utility issue that has yet to be addressed since I moved in (2016- present) and the bill climbs higher every two months with no explaination.

I've been able to raise a family here and I don't regret my choice, but I would not suggest spending more than 3 years here AS-IS.

text: We just moved to Kenley and I absolutely love it. The whole area is beautiful and the staff is incredible. Dave (manager) has been so helpful and kind to us. name: Sydney Zimmerman
text:
I would give this ZERO stars if I could! I usually am not one to leave bad reviews but quite frankly I’m surprised this place is still in business. I am currently a student at Auburn University; my mom and I moved into Kenley apartment complex back in January of 2020. Before we moved in there were many problems, the air conditioner was leaking, the towel bar fell out of the wall, the bathroom door would not lock, the shower faucet was broken, paint dripping down the cabinets, paint specs all over the floor, hot water was not attainable, very little water pressure, and a few other minor things. The lady at the front desk was very nice and told us she would have maintenance come fix everything before we moved in. She bold-face lied! A few weeks go by and maintenance never showed up so my mom logged a service request... maintenance comes in and fixed the problems temporarily, but the problems weren’t permanently fixed. The air conditioner still continues to leak and it will go out atleast 3 times a week. We have called the office many times and no one seems to ever answer. We have continued to log service requests and maintenance will show up, half way do the job, promise to have the maintenance supervisor come back and inspect, but he never shows back up. This is a recurring problem since January and it is now June? It has now been over 5 months and my mom and I have just learned to get on our hands and knees with buckets and empty the water pan out ourselves every time the air goes out. One problem seems to lead to another and management ignores it. There is now mold in my closet from water leaking from the air conditioner into the wall and my bathroom faucet still is not fixed. Taking a shower has been miserable for the past 5 months and this is supposed to be a “luxury” apartment. The gates to the apartment are broken and it’s been that way for a while so anyone can get in and it’s no longer safe.  This whole complex is a fire hazard with broken smoke detectors. Maintenance went to the apartment above me and soaked everything on my back porch and not to mention the whole complex smells like weed and cigarettes; so if you don’t like the smell of weed and cigarette smoke coming through your air vents,
that sucks because you just have to deal with it. Parking here is RIDICULOUS. Sometimes I work late and there is no where to park, so I have parked on the curb because guest parking was also full. I received a tow warning, so I called the office, no answer as usual.  I went to the office myself and talked to management about it, asking where I should park. The lady says “There are spots all over this complex”, I asked where and she points to the complete opposite side of the complex about 1/2 of a mile from where I live. I walk by myself at 11pm sometimes to get back to my apartment in complete darkness, because community exterior lighting doesn’t exist. Oh, and getting back to parking; don’t even try to have a guest over because there basically is no guest parking; so if you give someone a guest parking pass “that is no longer active” they will get a $375 towing charge like my friend did. There must be an illegal racquet going on because what kind of apartment complex would squeeze out and purposefully short parking spaces, then have your cars towed in the middle of the night? Kenley must be receiving a kick-back! SHAME! Also, the employees in the office are extremely rude and don’t care about anything!! Everyone around me has started to move out because management is so terrible.  Living here has been absolute HELL and my mom is paying $1125/month which is supposed to include valet trash service. To no avail, the trash compactor doesn’t work either & valet trash service gets “cancelled several times a week. They are charging $25 a month for something that doesn’t exist 1/2 the time!! How is this legal? This is NOT right and many tenants are moving out of this hell-hole! We won’t be too far behind.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing your concerns to management. It was a pleasure speaking with you. Parking can be an issue at any apartment community, however we are taking the necessary steps to help manage the parking process in or around your building via email, notices to door, additional lighting for visibility  and even adding additional signage. We additionally want to thank you for letting us know about your maintenance request and thank you for submitting it on the resident portal yesterday. By using this tool you can submit your service requests 24 hours a day/ 7 days a week.  Please do make us aware of any further issues you may be having. I can be reached at kenleymanager@gwrmanagementco.com.

name: karen Edwards
text: We moved here for more space and the amenities but have only been able to enjoy one of the amenities listed, the fishing lake.... This property is advertised as luxury but the luxury is missing. We love our apartment and enjoy the staff and maintenance team but the amenities advertised are not functional and is a disappointment. The fire pits do not work, the hot tub jets do not work, the golf course no longer exists, the dog park is over run with feces, the dog clean up stations do not have bags in them and haven't had any since we moved in 3 months ago, (dog feces is everywhere on this property), the fitness cardio equipment in the gym is in need of serious maintenance and repair and do not work properly, initially we had to use the laundry room when we first got here and the dryers took three cycles to dry and need maintenanced,  the tv in the tv sitting/meeting room doesnt work, the lights on the tennis courts do not work, the gate was broken for the first fews months we were here but its fixed now however there is a nice guard shack for extra security but its not used or staffed, most of the gas grills in the pic nic areas do not work, spectrum internet was supposed to be in the buildings in October but its January and there's been no communication updates...apparently you cant run hot water and your heat at the same time, you have to pick one, so either a hot shower and cold apartment or a warm apartment and a cold shower because of the systems in these apartments, we spent alot of time in the fall cleaning litter from the lake, streams, and trails because trash piles up and blows out of cans into the lakes and surrounding grounds....we are hoping its just because 2020 was a pandemic year and things had to be overlooked and maybe in 2021 things will be repaired and made functional again but if you're looking for the luxury thats advertised I would check on these things before sigining your lease, gwr property management company doesn't seem very professional or interested in maintaining a luxury property as they advertise at the moment... we hope it gets better in the spring/summer..we love the staff and our physical unit but hope gwr management does plan to eventtually maintain and up keep what they advertise as reasons why people should move here and live here...I know this sometimes mean upper management has to equip the on site staff better so we are hoping and optimistic to see better care in the spring/summer since we've only been here 3 months

text:
Absolutely terrible. First off maintenance will not even come out to look at a service request for at least 2 weeks so don’t expect anything to get fixed and when they do come they half way fix the problem. Parking is the next problem. There has been many nights that I have had to park on the other side of the complex at 10 at night and walk to my apartment when you should just be able to park infront of your building. There was a week that a dumpster took up 5 spots infront of my building without being given a notice.
The gate is not ever closed but yet i paid a fee for the gate service.

The trash valet is also a fee that is included in the rent but most of the time they have to suspend the service because problems with the compactor.

I have only been here since May and I am ready for my lease to be over so I can move out.

Hello Megan. We’re sorry to hear that you're displeased with our service. We truly value our residents, and want to take whatever action possible to address and rectify your concerns. Please contact the office at kenleymanager@gwrmanagementco.com or 205-453-1400
so that we have an opportunity to discuss this further. Thank you.

text:
THE KENLEY IS THE BEST PLACE ON 280 TO LIVE . AWESOME LAKE VIEW , BEAUTIFUL PROPERTY , THE STAFF IS KIND AND COURTEOUS. SPACIOUS FLOOR PLANS.

name: Jack Helean
text:
UPDATE: Soon after I posted this the gate was repaired. However problems still remain. — ORIGINAL: I moved here more than a year ago. Overall I’m happy but there are some major downsides in my opinion: the internet service here is TRASH. The ISP they use is overpriced, the connection is unreliable and drops out all the time so forget uninterrupted streaming or gaming, and the ISP’s customer service is the worst I’ve ever experienced for ANY company. The management at Kenley has been promising to get a new ISP for about 6 months but no results yet. If it actually happens my rating will change.

Another downside: the front gate has been broken for about 4 months and vehicle break ins have increased as a result. Yet I’m still paying the same rent for a complex that’s less safe. How does that work?

Also maintenance has been an issue for me. I think this is more of an understaffing issue than anything else: When the maintenance guys do show up they do a professional job but It requires multiple phone calls, even to the “emergency” maintenance line to get anyone to respond.

My A/C stops working once every 4-5 weeks during the summer months and every time it’s required multiple phone calls to get anyone to show up. Even in the middle of August. The longest I waited was over 48 hours in a 90 degree apartment on the weekend I moved in.

Another small complaint, the front office hours are inconvenient. They are open 9-6, M-F so if you work a normal 9-6 M-F job you have to take your lunch break to come and pick up any delivery packages that were left in the office for you.

Also, the fee they charge for making online rent payments is over $30 EACH time. So if you plan on paying your rent online make sure you have the budget to spend nearly $400 every year to cover that.

On the PLUS side, the property is beautiful, they have great amenities , the management is usually responsive and communicative about issues and events happening around the complex, there’s “Food Truck Friday”, it’s generally a nice and quiet place to live.

However they do need to improve some things or I will definitely not be renewing my lease or recommending them.

resp.text: Hello Jack. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. While we're glad to hear that you are enjoying many aspects of our property, we see that our community has some room for improvement. We invite you to reach out to our office at kenleymanager@gwrmanagementco.com or 205-453-1400 to discuss your concerns. We want you to love your home at Kenley, and would be happy to hear from you.

name: Jamie Ostroff
text:
I've lived at Kenley for 3 years and counting, and I've loved it from day 1. Unlike my experience in other apartment complexes, I'm friends with my neighors here-- some of whom have lived here longer than I have! The staff in the leasing office, despite changing hands over time, have always been friendly and helpful. The current team goes out of its way to accommodate residents' needs, create a community atmosphere and get to know everyone personally. The maintenance crew is prompt and effective. I was in disbelief when my air conditioner broke on a Friday night in the heat of summer, and someone was here to fix it in less than an hour. Kenley isn't owned by the same company that was in charge when I moved in, but the new company is renovating the clubhouse and pool, adding a dock by the lake and setting up a dog park. I can't wait to see the finished product.

My one and only complaint is the aging appliances in my apartment. I consider this a small price to pay for a safe, comfortable and happy place to call home.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, Thanks for your 5 star rating of the Kenley. We appreciate your positive feedback! We are thrilled to hear that you love living in our community. We are lucky to have residents like you!

text:

text: Do Not move here. I can't wait until my lease is up. My husband and I have complained numerous times about the person on top of us is constantly stumping. He walks from sun up to sun down. We went to the front office and filed a complaint they told us there was nothing they could do. Before that someone broke the driver side mirror off my husband's truck and nothing  was done about that. Every time you come out of your house someone is constantly watching you. I'm in nursing school and I can't study at home because of the noise. If anything goes wrong in the neighborhood the only thing they can do is send out letters. I repeat do not move here.

name: Drew Johnson
text: Four-month-long resident here. I have had a great experience thus far with little to no issues. Noise is minimal, neighbors are welcoming, landscape is beautiful. My only complaint would be parking. In my building each resident has an assigned parking space and sometimes I'll come home to my space being taken. This does not happen as often as it used to and that leads me to believe that management is working to fix it. Other than that, living here has been an wonderful experience and I am likely to renew my lease! 4/5

name: KBZ
text: I have a beautiful two bedroom apartment and I walk outside to my balcony every day to see the beautiful lake that sits right outside my window. Sometimes there are no parking spots available, but i lived in cali so compared to there...parking is exceptional. I make my own parking spaces despite the office putting stickers on my window once a year telling me i cant do so. Oh well. Kiara is a great lease agent here and she is very professional. My wife is white and we have faced no discrimination. When I wake up, i can see the ducks in the lake, and there are TONS of fish to catch..... i love it here...

resp.text: Hi KBZ, We are thrilled to hear that you are enjoying your stay in our beautiful community! We look forward to living and working with you for many years!

text: To make a long story short, don't be expected to get your deposit back. Be prepared to pay hundreds if they find anything messed up, even if it was that way when you first got there. Please don't waste your money or your time on this place. These apartments are very old and everything in it is old.

name: Karl Ludwig
text:
Thin Walls, Thin ceilings. Very little support from the office when problems occurred with other tenants. The WORST parking situation I have ever experienced. Do not plan on being able to park near your apartment when you come home from work.

They will send you to collections without even contacting you to say that you owe them 75$ dollars despite having addresses and phone numbers.

Stay Away.

text: After living here, I feel like I made the right decision choosing Kenley. The biggest drawback is the complex only allowing DirecPath cable/internet service, which is somewhat annoying (almost 4 star rating instead of 5). Also, parking for residents is limited afterhours. If I arrived after 8pm, I usually would have to park at another building. The best thing about the apartment is the community and the service I received. Kaylyn is amazing! and she continued to show great service during my stay, which made me feel like it was genuine and not just a tactic to get a lease signed. Another reason for the high rating is the maintenance, I've had bad experiences with maintenance in large complexes, but Kenley's maintenance team is very quick without any additional problems.The community is nice and I didn't have a problem with noisy neighbors. I would suggest this apartment to someone else.

name: Bailey Stephens
text:
The Grove is the perfect place to live if you’re in you 2nd or 3rd year of undergrad. It is close to campus, and a great price. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the maintenance men are relatively quick with response. They have great amenities like a pool, a tanning bed, a basketball court, a volleyball court, and a dog park.

Because it is associated with campus housing, dorm rules still apply. I live in low grade two bed room. Though it’s not “upgraded” we just had a new air conditioning unit installed inside and out. They also updated the shower head and sink spout! There is a big variation in room size between my roommates and my room, but we made it work! There is not a ton of provided storage, but additive storage has been beneficial, and I HIGHLY suggest it if you move here and have a lot of stuff. Downside is that the walls are VERY thin and other students tend to talk until late into the night. Other than that, it hasn’t been a bad experience!

The Grove is a fine place to live and worth the money, it can just be noisy. I would suggest this place to anyone not in a graduate program!

resp.text: Thank you, Bailey! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

When I put in a request for maintenance, the maintenance people mark it complete when nothing has even been fixed on two totally different occasions with the same issue.

text: Maintenance and management can’t do anything right, takes them days to respond to emails, they don’t follow up with maintenance or questions you may have, put you on hold during phone calls and hang up. Apartments are spacious, but run down. And they lie about what they actually have the apartment furnished with. They try to charge you for damages that were already there when you moved in..renter beware

resp.text: Thank you for your honest feedback. Grove at Mobile is now recently under new management. We strive for the best customer service and apologize the expectation was not met in the past. text: I really regret ever signing this lease . When I signed my lease animals were not allowed! 2 months before I moved in they now allow animals ! I would definitely explore other facilities such as The district at South. Not to mention the internet goes out every other second ! I am very displeased with this selection!

name: Madison Frost
text: The front desk staff has always been nice and helpful. The actual apartments are not bad, good for the price. But maintenance is the absolute worst. There has not been a single time since I have lived here (almost 2 years) that I have been able to put in a maintenance request and it be addressed the first time. If you want something fixed then it takes at least two work orders. They mark it as “complete” but nothing has changed. Maintenance once claimed that they came in and fixed my bed and I was home all day... they never even came into my room. It’s frustrating when you’re paying $500 a month for an apartment with issue that are either never fixed or take a solid two weeks to get seen about. Management seriously needs to do something about this issue considering that I know I am not the only resident who has these problems. This is why I did not and will not renew my lease.

resp.text: We encourage all of our residents to communicate with us directly so problems can be solved quickly and efficiently. Our office is open M-F 10-8pm. Our phone number is 251-341-9412 or you can contact our management team directly at community email grovemobile@achliving.com. We want to make your home a sweet home.

name: Rachel Wyers
text: These apartments are poorly managed to say the least. The apartment complex itself is not that old but it has already gone downhill. I only sub-leased for two months and had to call maintenance three times to spray for cockroaches in the kitchen. Management was only getting the bug exterminators to spray my kitchen which wasn't solving the problem since the whole apartment complex had a terrible cockroach infestation problem. The rent is cheap for what you get but you can expect to pay more every summer because your power bill will be higher. They only allot $100 limit on your utility costs and it is easy to go over that in an Alabama summer. The Grove will try to convince you that it is cheaper to live at the Grove than on campus but this is not true. It all ends up being the same in the end.The crime is abnormally bad for such a place! The management does nothing to deter the crime. They have a gate that has been broken for at least a year. Vehicle break-ins are routine and every now and then you will get someone who gets a gun in their face. If you want to stay somewhere close to campus I suggest staying at Campus Quarters. The security is top notch (gates, security cameras everywhere), and no roaches!!!!!!!

name: James Martin
text: The grove has the WORST customer service possible. They do not return any email or phone calls my son (student) places to the management. He is no longer eligible for attendance at USA and his lease doesn't start until July (it is June) and they will not release him from the lease saying "he signed it when he 'was' eligible for USA." The grove is only allowed for eligible students and once ineligible, the lease is supposed to be terminated, with proof from the school (which was provided). The Grove doesn't want to terminate the contract and hold the parents (guarantor) liable for the payments until next July because my son was eligible. Common sense is not welcome at this apartment complex either. They can find a tenant (new student to fill this lease) faster than their recommend, "have the student find someone to assume the lease." I can't say this with enough emphasis, DO NOT apply to or allow you student to ever live in these apartments. If I were to rate this place on a scale of 1-10, I would give it a negative 5. When things are broken in the apartment, it takes weeks to months to get them fix. If you are looking for a place for your student to live and happen to hear the name "GROVE," see or drive by the "GROVE," RUN, fast, very fast. This mismanaged scam-shack is not the place for you or your student.

name: Kaleb Nailer
text: I'm entering my second year as a resident at the Grove Apartments, and I've seen my fair share of pros and cons. The cons are why my rating isn't a five star rating, but the staff at the office are the reason why my rating isn't a one star rating. One big con is that groundskeeping has been an issue as of late, and maintenance requests are very slow to be fulfilled. However, a massive pro is that the front office staff try to be as helpful as possible, especially Heather Burgess. Heather Burgess is one of if not the most dedicated members of the staff when it comes to serving the residents. She genuinely cares, and from my own personal experience, Heather has consistently gone above and beyond in order to address any grievance or solve any problem I may have had. Staffmembers like Heather Burgess are a huge reason for why I can't rate the Grove at a one star rating because they work incredibly hard to make living at the Grove a wonderful experience.

resp.text: Thanks Kaleb for your feedback!  We are glad to hear that you've had a great experience with our office staff and that Heather has been a big help to you!

name: A. Mendenhall
text:
If i could give a -150 rating i would! Will move you into an already raggedy apartment, tell you they will give you new furniture, then wait until you move out to do it and charge you for every cent it cost them!!! I would recommend anybody who move in to take pictures, record conversations, and request all of your info in writing with a signature because this is ridiculous! Never Again!

No thanks because when i called regarding the issue i was told u could do nothing about it. I wasn't even contacted before the issue went to debt collection. And was told by debt collection in a nasty way that i basically might as well pay because nothing will get done. So i will pay yal the money that I shouldn't owe in the first place just to get yal out of my life for good!!!! It makes no sense to charge people hundreds to thousands of dollars for already messed up furniture that was supposed to be replaced when they lived there but waited until we move out to add the charges on our accounts. Idc if it was new or old management this has gone on for too many years just look at your reviews. We all can't be lieing about the same issue of being charged hundreds of dollars! And all because the company dnt want to pay to replace it yourself. This company has a huge issue and i'm not gonna waste my time calling in again just so nothing can be done.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear your experience was less than satisfactory. I am not able to find you in our records, please reach out to me at cm@groveatmobile.com. We do require all disputes be put in writing. If you send me an email, I will be more than happy to review your account and answer any questions you may have.

name: Emma B
text: Overall the Grove is decent. I lived there a year (2016-17) and liked it well enough. My main complaints were that the couch smelled weird and that neighbors would always leave their trash under the stairs so the breezeways smelled terrible. Maybe with greater punishment they wouldn't do that. Rent was expected for what you get. The internet was very fast but very occasionally would go out, however management would email us every time and let us know they were diligently working to fix the problem, which usually didn't last long anyway. I would most likely live there again IF ONLY THEY ALLOWED PETS D:

resp.text: We really appreciate you taking the time to leave this positive review! Your time is valuable and you spent some of that time to compliment us – THANK YOU SO MUCH! Thank you for having called The Grove your Home.

name: Sunny & Dylan
text: Grove is gr8! They gave me free tacos 🥑

resp.text: Thanks Sunny! Glad you enjoyed them!

name: monica robinson
text: Parents and students, please heed the warnings of the reviews! Do not sign a lease and ensure your student does not sign a lease if they get told they have to sign an early lease because apartments may not be available. If a students situation change and no long plans to reside there or even attend school...the Grove will threaten to ruin your credit and send your account to collections. You will either have to pay or find another tenant...Not worth it.

name: Adasia Tinson
text: I just love it here! ❤️

resp.text: Thank you, Adasia! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Aaron Etheredge
text:
I lived at the Grove for 3 years. Upon move out they charged me 500 in "damages" for things that were stupid. When I disputed these charges they never returned my phone calls. Corporate was no help either. Management switches every year or two because they're too crappy to hire professionals. Stay far away from the Grove. I can remember overhearing a conversation with managers shortly before move out on ways to hide negative reviews online, which is my main motivation for writing this.

I'm seriously considering hiring an attorney and launching a smear campaign by paying college kids to stand right off the property with signs about past experiences and how terrible they are. Perhaps when they start losing business they'll straighten up.

EDIT:

Since posting this, the management of The Grove has contacted me about my experience. I was informed that the Grove was bought out from the owners that I had such a bad experience with and that it is now under new management. I was in contact with a phenomenal woman who has worked at the property for several years and is now in a position of management. It is always such a pleasure to work with genuine people who can empathize with others.

Because of the fact that she has gone far above and beyond anything than I ever expected, I'm giving the new organization a much better review and rating.

The way that my problem was resolved was both quick, courteous, and professional. Because of this sincere desire from the new management to repair the reputation of The Grove with the community, I would now consider the Grove to be a legitimate choice for my future housing needs.

resp.text:
Aaron,

Thank you for giving us the opportunity to cure the situation you were in. We have thoroughly enjoyed being able to make things right for you, and really appreciate you being patient with us as we were trying to get everything resolved for you! Thank you again!

-Grove Management

name: Rachel Collins
text: Absolutely the worst student housing. Up front they lied to me about how much rent I would be paying, over charged myself and the roomates for electricity consistently (we had a $30 overage each when literally nothing except the fridge in the apartment was on while we were all away, A/C off). They charged me $200 to repaint ONE room when I reported that the walls were very damaged upon move in, and are terrible to deal with. Not to mention the property is poorly maintained and the residents are really loud. Also, it is supposed to be smoke free and everyone smokes, cigarette butts and smoke smells everywhere. Seriously, live ANYWHERE but there.

name: Raj Dhillon
text: Great staff and loved the area

resp.text: Thank you, Raj! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Angela Newsome
text: Great value and the staff is always helpful.

resp.text: Thank you, Angela! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Cameron Wilson (WILDJETZ45)
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE! All these 5 star reviews are either people who don’t actually live here or employees because anyone who has lives here knows that this place is a nightmare. Just ask anyone who goes to South, The Grove has a well deserved reputation as the worst apartment in this area. Just in the 2 years I lived here my apartment was broken in to, there was a shooting in the apartment next to mine, my bike was stolen and my water was out for almost 3 weeks. Thats only the tip of the iceburg too! The Grove is plagued with problems all the time like their internet, the internet here will go out from time to time for DAYS AT A TIME. So they charge you way too much for what you get, there is always trash everywhere (there was an old condom on my staircase for almost 4 months), and I wouldn’t consider is a safe apartment by any means. So there is my review of the worst decision I have ever made in living here and hopefully I have saved someone else from making the same mistake I have.

resp.text: Cameron, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact me at cm@groveatmobile.com at your earliest convenience.

text: Great value, friendly staff, easy access to the university

resp.text: Thank you, Brandon! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

text: very friendly staff! and always fun events !

resp.text: Thank you, Payton! We are so excited you decided to stay with us and cant wait to have you as a resident!

name: bree collier
text: Best place to stay near campus !

resp.text: Thank you, Bree! We love hearing that you love the Grove at Mobile!!

name: Kyle Regas
text: ***STAY AWAYYYY!!!*** Spacious yes, upscale no. This place was one of the dirtiest places I’ve ever lived. Not to mention they will charge you thousands of dollars when you move out claiming the (dirty carpets, walls, etc. to be caused by you). $1,600 later I learned my lesson to never ever rent from a place this unorganized/unethical. Stay away! Consider yourself warned. They will try to blame it on me having a dog, I assure you this is not the case.

resp.text: Our staff strives to provide all of our residents a clean and sanitary place to call home. This requires us to restore the apartments back to the original conditions once someone vacates. We disclose the requirement to leave the apartment in a clean and damage free condition upon move in to avoid costly damage charges at move out. Our move out inspections are done with move in inspections in hand so if there are deficiencies we are able to compare them to the condition of the apartment at move out and charges are not made on pre existing damages. Charges for damages are always based on the cost to restore to an acceptable living condition.

name: Kenneth Cotton
text: Terrible and trashy living environment. The front desk are rude and inconsiderate. Plus they will overcharge you for the smallest violations, but not fix your major problems in a timely manner. I encourage no one to stay here!

name: Dianna Archer
text: Do NOT live here. I'm writing this review because I wish someone had told me how horrible this place was before I moved in. This is honestly the most ghetto place I've ever lived. As a woman, I don't feel safe walking outside of my apartment at night. Take a drive around here at night and you'll see what I mean. There are loud parties almost every night, people smoking weed outside, and there seems to be an event that involves the police every other week. Yes, the price is inciting, but you can get just as good of a deal at The Edge or even some non-campus apartments. And after all the random overages and fees The Grove charges you for, you might have been better off living at Campus Quarters for $600 a month. Don't be fooled, the model apartment they show you when you go for a tour is nothing like the actual room you'll get. The first month that I lived here I had a downpour of water from my bathroom ceiling and the hot water in my apartment stopped working. It took maintenance over a week to fix it. I took freezing showers for over a week. I also had someone (who was believed to be on LSD) try to kick my apartment door down. If you want to keep your sanity and your safety, please don't live here. If I had a daughter, this would be the last place I would put her.

name: B C
text: Really awesome staff, super sweet super helpful

resp.text: Thank you,  BC!! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

text: The Grove is an amazing place with great a staff. All Jags should stay here!!!

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Grove!

text: The people are nice and the environment is friendly. 😁

resp.text: Thank you, Sarah! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: Tonya Jones
text: Room is nothing like the model. They are not upfront about everything. The Grove in Troy is where my oldest daughter lived and I assumed everything was going to be the same. Poor management of the Grove in Mobile never again in life -5.

name: Katherine Pope
text: The apartment itself was OK.  Management is awful!   Please, Please, Please keep a detailed record of your payments for they do not.  We had no electricity overages, so the total amount should have Never changed, (IT DID)  Due to them not knowing how to post payments to the correct account Multiple Times.  And now we are trying to sort all of this out.  But the icing on the cake, they have our contact information wrong as well. How can a large complex such as this operate this way!!!  Sooo glad we have moved out.   PS.  Took 3 weeks and several phone calls to get the ac repaired so the window unit could be removed!!

name: haylee raye
text:
PLEASE do not invest your time or money into this place. Front desk always has an attitude and regularly gives out the wrong information, maintenance just barges in and doesn't repair things to completion, the management (Patricia) is rude and condescending, the sales lady ( her name is Avery I think)  is equally rude.
I initially decided to stay here because it was the cheapest option, if only I had known that I would regularly be fined/ up-charged without reason. The wi-fi is slow, the air in my apartment regularly goes out ( i'm not the only one with these complaints) there are often overage fees that don't match actual usage and no one can ever explain why.
Parents, trust me, you're better off sending your kids to a nicer, slightly more expensive complex. At least then there would be a chance that they could live comfortably under bad management.

resp.text: Haylee, we take complaints seriously and when we attempted to locate you in our database your name does not appear. We believe this to be a questionable post and request that you contact us directly at grovemobile@achliving.com We would like to discuss your  review,as we do not show you as a current or former resident of The Grove.

name: Blair Smith
text: Do. Not. Live. Here. I could go on for at least 15 minutes on reasons to not live here. Especially if you are a transfer student and brand new to the Mobile area, DO NOT live here. They will take advantage of you and lie to make it sound like the apartment fits the needs you are looking for just like they did to me.

resp.text: Blair, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory. Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. Please contact  me at cm@groveatmobile.com.

name: Kandise M
text: This establishment disclosed that animals were not allowed in an attempt to draw in guests. The maintenance team does not complete tasks in a timely fashion. When I went to visit my family in April, I returned to an eviction notice saying I was moved out of the system. I also lost my last two months of free rent. This establishment is a major downgrade and management is insufficient as well. I am very displeased with my business transaction, and I have advised my friends against using your establishment due to the pest control as well. You all should do better and treat your guests with more respect. I am disgusted and disgraced by the way in which my business was handled unprofessionally. Very displeased. And the maintenance man watch you when you’re working out. Management changed, but the communication problem is still there. You also threw away all of my things without my knowledge. Im never sending anyone to your complex as a referral. And there is a BAD roach a and mold problem.

text: the worst living i ever saw. these people suck if you sign your lease and once you sign your lease thats it you are doomed. you cant leave till they complete sucking all your money. the worst decession of my life ever made is signing a lease with them

text: The Grove by far is the most unprofessional apartment I know of. The apartments are ok but management is absolutely horrible. All they care about is taking your money, they care nothing about the satisfaction of customers. I've stayed here for three years and it just gets worse and worse. Please don't make the same mistake I did.

resp.text: Thank you, Tanecia! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at Grove at Mobile!!

name: LA Fishing
text: I can not begin to explain how terrible this apartment complex is. They fail to notify when lock's are changed so you get to find out yourself and are locked out of your apartment with nowhere to go, and have no number to call to get you help after hours. In all if you are reading this looking into this place... Pay a little more and go somewhere else. You will regret your decision in living here.

name: Cheree Green
text: I would not recommend my worst enemy to stay at this place. They treat their tenants as if they’re not students and they don’t work with you when you’re having problems with paying rent. When you’re late they threaten you with eviction notices, legal fees, and late fees all within a few days of being late mind you( after the 5th of each month). Parents do not let the Grove fool you into thinking that your child is in good hands because they’re not. This apartment complex is about making money plain and simple. The management is purely ridiculous, you can only speak to the assistant general manager via email, which is frustrating when you’re trying to handle business accordingly, other than that you’re handling business with students who tell you to email the assistant GM. The conservice bill is a joke they give you a $25 allowance every month which you’re bound to go over and it can get to be pretty high and if you don’t pay this with your rent by the 5th of every month they will threaten you with eviction notices as well. I am not one to leave reviews on anything but this place needed one so please HEAD MY WARNING AND DO NOT LEASE AT THE GROVE!!!

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to rectify your concerns and change your opinion. 251-341-9412

name: Susan C
text: Filth, LOUD parties, and nothiing is ever done. Rooms are full of bed bugs. Do your research, there is a reason the rent here is cheap. You get what you pay for.

resp.text: Susan, thank you for your feedback. It is our goal is to provide the best possible service and we are truly sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.  Our team would be happy to speak with you and resolve the issues you are having. We do not see you in our system so we are unable to reach out to you. Please contact our Community Manager, Avery at 251-341-9412 at your earliest convenience.

name: Will Harkins
text: I was stuck living at this hole in the ground for 4 years.  They take the cake when it comes to lying and cheating their tenants.  They claim to be safe and secure gated community.  That gate out front is never closed, anyone who wants to can walk right in.  Swim in our pool, play on our basketball courts, and rob anyone they please.  I was robbed 3 times, my car vandalized, and the grove themselves took money that i gave no authorization for them to take.  Management likes to play dumb when you confront them about problems, and when you start pressing them hard about it, they become a bunch of smart mouths towards you.  Nothing about the grove is appealing, you're better off living in your vehicle than living at the grove.  Its horribly unsafe.  I watched someone stabbed outside my window 2 weeks into living there, cops showed up 20min after i called them.  My neighbor was robbed at knife point and her car stolen.  One of my roommates had his car stolen the other was in our apartment when someone kicked the door in and robbed him at knife point and stole everything he had and anything i had in the living room.  They hit you with fake charges and force you to pay them.  The place is dirty, and loud at night and cops wont do a darn thing if you call them.  I've been moved out for a while now, and im still having to deal with the idiots of grove management.  Spare yourself what I went through and still going through. And maintenance...my AC was broken for most of the 4 years i lived there...after the first 2 years i just gave up on them fixing it correctly all together...but even with my ac dead i still managed to go over on my utilities, to spite the fact that me and my room mates were never home to use power and kept the lights off all the time.

name: Gabrielle Green
text: it's so beautiful, stop sleeping on the grove

resp.text: Thank you Gabrielle!

name: Shawn Balk
text: The Grove is a great place to live because the rent is cheap and the commute to classes is minimal driving-wise.  In fact, for new incoming residents wanting a 3 BR 1200 sq. ft unit, the rent, which always includes all but like $10 of utilities, is only going to be $485/month.  In my case, it is only $455/month, because it is my second year here since a $30 cheaper rent was an incentive to sign for another year, six months early.  Often times, in my experience, the occupancy level is below capacity; My unit only has two of us, and my roommate is moving out at the end of this month, while I happen to be looking for someone to take my lease because I am doing a leave of absence from school.  The free internet and basic cable have been nice.  I don’t know if phone service is free or not because I just use my 688,9377 non-Mobile mobile (480) number.  There are volleyball and basketball courts and a soccer field for the athletic, and there is a fire pit and grills for outdoor hangouts.  I definitely recommend the Grove to incoming students, whether I was leaving or not.

name: Destanee Harris
text: I'm so glad this is my last month living in the grove. I have stayed here for two years and it's time for a change. The management is horrible they can't even keep a manger for 6 months. The people that work in the office will tell you anything to get you off the phone. My dryer was broke for atleast a month before, I kept calling and calling and they stated they were waiting on new dryers to come in. I found out they actually had a dryer in the  maintenance closet the whole time. The maintenance team is good they respond to the work orders when giving by the office but sometimes it never makes it to their hands so I can't blame them for poor management. The air conditioner in my apt goes out every summer two times already this summer. The air conditioner units are old and when water gets in them they stop working. This complex gets about 500 dollars from each resident each month but yet are too cheap to get new air units. The gate situation at night is terrible, people who have a gate card have to wait up to 15 mins some nights in long lines of cars just get home. This is a college campus most of the visitors are college students so just leave the gate open!!!! Closing it is absolutely crazy. They are trying to be like other complexes but don't have the  amenities  to try to follow in the footsteps of the others like Campus Quaters and the Edge. Don't stay here I recommend saving  money and living in a off campus complex.

name: Destiny Sealie
text: I will never live here again.They are horrible they do not work with their students period!!!!!!
