name: Google Account
text:
Unfortunately, I lost a lot of respect for this apartment when they kept $100 from my security deposit even though the apartment was clean when they took it back, I was told that "we have to clean the apartment after we go through and get it ready." It's not in the lease. Sad!
While this is not a terrible or unsafe place to live, it's that borderline between upper lower class and lower working class. As a consequence, there is a wide array of persons
that end up living here. Though you have some
very respectful neighbors, unfortunately you
also run the risk of having absolute jerks as
neighbors. While one can make the argument
that any apartment complex is going to have that
issue, it does seem to be a bigger issue here since
there is that wide discrepancy in socio-economic
income here. I will break this review down into
three categories: Price, amenities, and overall
experience.
Price: Not everybody pays the same amount. I'm
not talking about the different levels of pay for
whichever floor. For instance, you're going to pay
a higher price on the bottom floor while paying a
lesser price on the third floor. What I am referring
to is the cost of an apartment vs. What's your
neighbor might be paying. In one case, a neighbor
was paying around $60 less per month than I was.
This was based off the fact that when they signed
their lease the rent was lower. Unfortunately, what
that means is that when your lease runs out, you
automatically get moved to month to month. But
unless you ask, you're not going to know whether
or not the rent has fluctuated up or down. It's nice
to go month-to-month after a year lease is up but it
would also be nice to know what the current going
rate for the rent is so if I wanted to re-sign a lease
for a lower rate I could. The reason I won't mention
rent amount though is that I don't know what
the current going rate is and I don't want to give
incorrect information.
Amenities: they don't have much. There is no other
way to put. The workout room is nearly unusable
because it's so small, it does have a fairly nice pool
unfortunately it is not as clean as it should be. I have
found everything from cigarette butts to pieces of
broken glass in and around the pool. I can't blame
the apartment complex property manager for this,
since they are not the ones who did it, but I feel like
it should be cleaned on a more regular basis. There
is a playground on the property but it's basically
falling apart and the feral cats that live in the area
use the sand as their litter box so it's pretty gross.
On the plus side, you do have free internet and
cable and you don't have to pay for water. While
the Internet isn't super fast, it's pretty darn good
for something you're not paying for. Not always
super reliable but you can stream on it without too
much of an issue as long as you're not trying to
watch HD video. There are three dumpsters on site
but unfortunately a lot of trash blows around the
apartment complex because people have trouble
throwing their trash into the dumpsters. I want saw
an old man on his scooter picking up trash because
he couldn't take it anymore. It's a problem that got
worse the longer I lived there. Maintenance is also
a small problem. This apartment complex is well
over 10 years old now and is starting to show the
signs and problems that an older complex going to
have. Unfortunately, the owners of this apartment
complex won't hire more maintenance workers so
the one guy they have on staff is WAY overworked!
Great guy and very helpful, but I wouldn't want his
job because he has way too much on his plate
Overall experience: Would I recommend this
apartment complex to someone? That's a hard
question to answer. If you can afford to spend
closer to the $1,000 mark, I would suggest
finding a different apartment complex. They are
understaffed (don't get me started about whether
or not they'll be someone in the office on any given
day) and it's not the cleanest

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Although I searched for your name and email address on our property ware I could not locate when you lived here. Neverless, my favorite part was when you mentioned your neighbors socio-economic income.  I know some tenants just cannot get along, but we never discriminate here.  I will get to work on your recommendations immediately! Thanks again for the post

name: Vanessa Flonnory
text: Stayed in this complex for a short lease. They are amazing. No issues for us. Great area and close to military base. Train runs past the apartments but wasn’t bothersome for us. Ms. Erica is phenomenal and so friendly. The officer that lives in the complex is AMAZING as well. He was super helpful and very kind. I would definitely stay here again if we move back to the area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. It was an absolute pleasure having you and your family stay with us!

name: erica jones
text: I reached out inquiring about a rental application. The respondent seemed genuinely interested once I communicated my profession. I submitted my application and I was told I had discrepancies on my credit report, that was NOT TRUE. After a two days and multiple calls I finally received the discrepancy which did not state that I had a previous balance but that the payments were late. I reached out to have the verification completed and I received an email not even a couple hours later stating the apartment had been filled. Completely unprofessional. I will NEVER recommend nor consider living here EVER.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Let me start by saying that you were never declined to become a tenant at our complex. As a rule, we do not rent to people with housing debts. There are clearly two housing debts on the report that was provided to us. After your request, we sent you a copy of that report. You were told that if you could obtain a letter from the Gardens on Stadium Apartments clearing the debt, we would gladly accept you. We are sorry that your experience was a negative one. Hopefully you can use the report we provided you to clear up the misunderstanding with the other complex.

name: Omran Awad
text:
Best management !!!
Safe place to live...

name: Amanda Woodruff
text: My husband and I would not recommend this complex. There is a lack of professionalism shown by everyone who works here and the communication from the landlords/owners is far from acceptable.

name: Denise Vanclife
text: I've lived at Windsweep Luxury Apartments for almost 7 years and absolutely love it here! Erica, the property manager is a great person that helps everyone in our community. She's always there when we need something and truly cares for her tenants. I wouldn't want to live anywhere else!

name: Alyssa KM
text:
Let me start by saying that I am very picky about the places I live. When we found out we were moving to this area, my husband and I spent at least 5-6 months searching and over-analyzing every apartment complex between Phenix City, AL and Columbus, GA. During that time I found myself constantly disappointed with the results I was getting. Apartments were either grossly overpriced, extremely particular about the potential ferociousness of our lovable Boxer puppy, or too good to be true. The apartments we thought were perfect ended up being full of problems (which we discovered through reviews like this), so I had no other option but to try and accept the fact that we were going to have to settle for two years of car break-ins, obnoxious neighbors, and bugs infestations.

That was until I stumbled upon Windsweep Luxury Apartments. You WILL NOT find this level of quality for such an affordable price. We have lived here for several months now, and for once in my life I have ZERO complaints (can't you tell I'm quite the ray of sunshine?). The manager, Erica, is phenomenal at what she does. I have worked in customer service for years (including management) and I can tell you from a professional standpoint that she is someone that any business would be lucky to have. Nowhere else will you find a property manager that remembers each of their tenants' names, and genuinely cares for the people around them.

The apartments are beautiful, the maintenance workers are great, incredibly prompt, and polite, the neighborhood is quiet, and the overall atmosphere is just great. I could go on and on about Windsweep.

Do yourself a favor and check this place out. We've made it a point to try and refer all our military friends here!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Murray for your kind words! It is such a pleasure to have you here!

name: Darlea Udugampola
text:
Definitely will not be recommending this apartment place simply for their lack of communication and customer service.

Erica, the front desk lady seemed super great and helpful at first. My family and I had just moved here and we’re struggling to find a home so she said she was going to try and squeeze us in an apartment. Well not even 24 hours later my husband and I ended up finding a home that would fit us better (2 kids, 2 adults and one on the way) so we went back out to windsweep that day and when we got there the door was closed and locked. So we came back the next day and Erica was leaving again and completely ignored us. So We had finally gotten ahold of her on the phone and told her we were no longer needing an apartment because we found a much better fit to which she informed us we would no longer be getting our deposit back. She said we only had 72 hours (which she never informed us of) but regardless we went out there twice and called dozen of times within those 72 hours and never got ahold of anybody. So now we’re out $250 dollars because they don’t want to be honest and give us our money back. I will never tell anyone to come live here. Absolutely disgusting!!!!!
So

resp.text:
Good Morning,
I am so sorry that I've upset you in this way. When you came to our office, I understood that you were in a bad situation and needed to get out of your current housing situation immediately. After speaking with your family, I made some calls so that I could squeeze you in. I understood the issue that you were having and was more than happy to help. Because you were military, I gave you a free application (which is normally $90). I also only charged a $250 security deposit.
The security deposit was paid that day. I received a phone call on Sept 16th when you informed me that you found a house. At this time, the 72 hours had lapsed and the security deposit of $250 was no longer refundable (as indicated on the application on 09/09/19). A pet deposit for a cat ($100) was made and has been put in the mail back to you.
When we spoke, you told me that you made several calls to me. I explained to you, that if I had a voicemail from you indicating that you were not moving to Windsweep, that I would refund your security deposit. When I looked back at my calls and voicemails, there were none from you indicating a refund.
Again, I am so sorry that I've upset you. Should you decide to come back to Windsweep, I will be more than happy to honor your security deposit.

name: Stanley Phillips
text: Windsweep Apt was one of the best living experiences ever. It is a very military friendly community making it easy to become a home away from home. The staff is very welcoming and treat you like one of the family.

name: Mindi Royal
text: Awesome staff, awesome location

name: Jeannette Marshall
text: IT   IS   VERY   PEACEFUL   AN   COMTABLE   HERE   I   WOULD   LIVE   ANYWHERE  ELSE.   AN   I   LOVE   MY   MANAGER.

name: D Brown
text: I love it here....I love everything about it. The greatest find ever. The staff is amazing.

name: Catou
text: I love it

resp.text: We are thrilled to have you with us! Thank you for your review!

name: Neal Stainbrook
text: Ok

name: mariama jalloh
text:
So far my experience at this apartment complex has been great, apartments are nice
property is well maintained and the office staff are friendly and Professional. The only problem I have encountered is maintenance it takes weeks to months for maintenance requests to be completed! when I wasn’t getting any help or response from the maintenance staff I reached out to the property manager Kevin, and he went above and beyond and made sure all my work orders were completed and handle right away. He exemplifies professionalism and great management!

name: Sepeshia Baker
text: I was about to submit my application, but before I did I called to make sure the unit I wanted was available. The particular apartment is listed at $675 and that’s what I expected because that’s what it says on the website. However she explained that it is $800 and something. I’m a little furious because if I would have submitted the application my fee would of been taken with no refund. She explained that prices change. There was no range with the price. Example: $675-$800 It was an exact price of $675. Not to forget to mention I even asked if there is an apartment that is in that price range she stated, no. I don’t understand why it says that at all then. I feel as if it’s false advertisement to get people to do an application. I also ask if she could honor what I see I’m applying for. She stated no because it’s subject to change. Rewind I was in the middle of the application two days ago. Today online price remains the same. It’s already bad enough I don’t have money to just give away. I just want to save someone else time and their money. Please call before doing your application.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Your review has been forwarded to our onsite staff.

name: Bree Perry
text: The old owners when it was listed as “Parks at Summerhill” were nothing but problem after problem. They had one guy who was good and now the ladies who took over and that are in the office are wonderful!!! They try to resolve everything they can! Maintenance gets sent out almost immediately especially for major problems! My fridge went out the previous owners never sent anyone. I reported it the first day of the new owners (Lurin) and they had a new fridge to me that day!!! Our hose for the dishwasher busted called the office within 20 minutes they had a guy out to fix it ^.^ SO INCREDIBLY HELPFUL AND ACTUALLY FIND SOLUTIONS!!! I am looking forward to the next year with the new owners ^.^

name: Krisi Johnson
text: RUN -don't walk away from this place!  I can not express how terrible this complex is and how poorly it's run. Don't be fooled, they have a good "yes man" in the front office; however you will regret moving in here with every fiber of your being.  No AC the ENTIRE SUMMER,  Water constantly cut off, bugs, break ins, and on and on.  Action was promised time and time again but was never taken.  Also, never had a late payment,  left apartment with 60 days notice, cleaned thoroughly and had to fight tooth and nail with threat of attorney to receive our deposit back.  Still shorted $35 dollars for unknown reason.  Don't be fooled by "new management", it's the only way they can trick people into thinking it's gotten better.   BEWARE!!

name: Zelnita Williams
text: I am absolutely disgusted in the lack of urgency when it comes to maintenance emergencies. I have been out of A/C for a couple of days. I have put in work orders and have even gone so far as to flag down the maintenance man. But there seems to be no importance to the office that a tenant is stuck in a 90 degree apartment in the dead heat of summer!! They will not make any accommodations for the inconvenience. I wish I could leave zero stars. It is absolutely crazy that I have to live in this state of an apartment and endure laziness of staff. It’s upsetting to see that I am not the only tenant dealing with this problem.  It only speaks volumes about the way this complex is ran.

resp.text: Hello Zelnita, It saddens us to hear of your experience. We can assure you our maintenance team is working to resolve the matter.

name: Mack Bishop
text: I love it here, I have been here for 8 years! There's no place like home, the staff is wonderful! So would recommend it to anyone!!

resp.text: Hello Mack, Thank you for taking the time to leave us your positive feedback.

name: Kaitlyn Borden
text: The lack of communication and urgency of the management staff is concerning. We have not had air in our apartment for over five days despite reporting it several times. This is the hottest part of the year, reaching 100 degree index during parts of the day. After being given the run around for several days, I spoke directly to the office staff who did very little to communicate or even apologize for the inconvenience, couldn't even be bothered to take his headphone out. He said someone would be out by the end of the day, which is what we have heard all week. The excuse of only having one guy to work on AC for two complexes is a direct result of poor planning and execution from management. We have had to spend extra money on top of rent to purchase fans, which will also increase our utility bill. Not only this, but my roommate working outside all day and not being able to cool off at home could lead to dehydration and heat stroke. The utter lack of concern and care for the tenants is why I will not be staying once the lease is up.

resp.text: Hello Kaitlyn, We regret to hear of your recent experience. We thank you for your patience thus far and hope to regain your support as a resident.

name: EverythingErin
text: I had been apartment searching for several months and when I applied for Summerhill the Assistant Manager, Jae'ah, was completely on top of it. She made sure I knew exactly what I needed for my move-in and even checked in with me post move-in. She exemplifies professionalism and great management!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us your positive feedback.

text: If I could give zero stars I would. We are here for work and chose these apartments to short term rent. If I would have known the drug traffic and stealing was so bad I would have chosen different. I’ve had 3 packages stolen from my front door. My neighbor is constantly dealing drugs. The air never works, and when you put in a work order, it never happens. The staff could care less. Roaches are horrible. So if drugs, stealing and nasty is your cup of tea then here is your places! I’m counting down the days till we get to move out!

We would love for you to stop by to see some of the great changes we have made and possibly we can convince you to change your review.

name: Shannon aka Naenae
text:
**I moved here in Sept of 2016**

Positives:
-New apartment complex building colors
-New roofing on all/most of the buildings in the complex
-Most office staff are professional and polite
-Several much needed renovated apartments
-Maintenance does amazing quality work
-Ability to make online rent payments/maintenance request

Negatives:
-Paid months ahead on rent and payments were lost after getting new management I had to pull out my receipts as proof or I would have been stuck
-Staff is never at the office they always have a sign up that says they are out on the property no matter what time of day you go up there.
-The phone rarely gets answered
-It takes weeks to months for maintenance requests to be completed if they are not closed out first w/o being completed
-Most of the staff that I've had to deal with were professional and business minded aside from one to which I will keep anonymous but she was extremely rude and seemed annoyed the more I spoke

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. We are sorry to hear you have not been satisfied with our service. Please contact the leasing office for assistance.

Kevin and staff were courtesy.
I put a deposit down. On the day to viewed the apartment, there was still much need repairs. I chose not to take the apartment.

text:
I am a soon-to-be-former resident here. This was an ok place to live in the beginning. Then they got acquired by a different company. Now, I am being harassed to leave. I have gone the whole summer with no A/C and other unresolved maintenance issues although they have been reported. I tried to resolve back rent and they refused to accept it stating that they had already started eviction proceedings (which was a lie). I would only recommend this place if you are desperate and do not have children!
03/16/2018: I left this place 09/2017 and they are still ruining my life! I left a forwarding address and they never sent anything only for me to find out that they added a balance to my rental history. I have tried to contact their corporate office (Hammond Residential Group) to obtain information...no one answers the phone. Will probably have to end up in court. Do better people!

name: Lorin Cooke
text: Hillside Village is now under new management AND new ownership! The issues from the past- to include maintenance and safety concerns are being addressed and actively worked on by the new company. We are very well aware of the reputation of the community and the condition that it is in- there is a multi million dollar renovation that will begin very soon! Contractors are already onsite preparing some of the vacant apartments to show the quality of their workmanship before moving forward on the rest of the community. Management is brand new, and new office staff will be joining our team in the upcoming weeks. We apologize for any and all of the prior neglect and oversights, and will do our very best to right the wrongs made by previous management or staff. Hillside Village Apartments is becoming  a great place to live and somewhere you will be proud to call "home". Our new management believes in customer service and knows that there is nothing more personal than your home. That attitude is coupled with the new owners who are determined to turn the community around and renovate Hillside Village to recreate a community as wonderful as it was originally and are investing everything it takes to make that happen. The community has a reputation and a past that needs to be overcome- they have the right team in place and are making all the necessary moves to make it happen!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. We are happy to hear you have been satisfied with our service. Please contact the leasing office for assistance.

name: robin reynolds
text: DO NOT MOVE HERE, SAVE YOUR MONEY! Unless you want your car broken into, AC unit steady going out(imagine 95 degrees in you're apt in the summer time, yeah not fun), MANAGEMENT SUCKS!! I promise you they lost two months of my payments and actually told me I was under eviction. It took me having to bring in money order receipts from my bank to prove I paid them. They're under new management every time you turn around. Not a very safe place to live. Carpets and walls get filthy so fast, appliances are from stone ages, somethings ALWAYS breaking down. I was planning on staying another couple of months to save money but bump thay...were leaving ASAP! they honestly don't deserve that one star

name: Kaila Palmer
text:
I absolutely HATE living here . when i first moved in was july 2015 and it was great . Spacious living, new appliances,  efficient parking and you can't beat the price but after about a month all the problems started. My air conditioning went out and it took maintenance weeks to fix it. not a week or two but more lile 5-6 weeks. Imagine summer in alabama with NO AIR. they kept coming out to fix it instead of ordering a new unit because of costs. The complex is not well lit and is very creepy. i had to argue with management for weeks to put a light outside my building because it was pitch black. They do not have a gated community or patrol on site. Management told me they would have the front gate working by October 2015, now its April 2016 and the gate still doesnt work. people get shot and robbed in this complex. they smash windows and break in cars every other day. They've switched management three times in 9 months and still no changes have been made. I could go bck I would take every review into consideration and never would have moved here. no amount of money is worth your safety. i HAD to rate this apartment one star for the review, but its not worth that much .

SAVE YOUR MONEY & TIME ..

name: Cherillee Lewis
text: It's sad, just so so sad. From the roaches flooding outside, to deplorable conditions inside; rotten doors (all of them), old worn doorknobs, kitchen appliance not working like never! No pest control or general upkeep, bathroom :'( just horrible, leaking ac unit - mold build up, and neighbors that SMOKE LIKE A FACTORY i can't stop coughing. this is no way for people to live. No wonder they didn't want us seeing the apartment before signing the lease. We took it for granted that they were fair enough to rent what they showed in the model apartment. Or at last chance out old, rotten and broken items. So so so sad :'(
